<div><div>Leading New York City Event Organizer Invites Industry Players to Annual Media&nbsp;Conference</div><br><br>New York, NY | April 9th, 2015&nbsp;-- CoInvent (<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.coinvent.co/">www.coinvent.co</a>), the innovation-minded media company widely known for its fun and exciting events where small business owners exhibit the newest ideas in their industries to entrepreneurs and investors, is launching this year's iteration of its annual CoInvent Media Summit in New York City. <div><br></div><div>The event, which will be held from 8 am to 5 pm&nbsp;on April 22nd&nbsp;EDT at Anchin Block &amp; Anchin, LLP (at 1375 Broadway, #23), will showcase the latest in technology that startups have to offer in shaping the ever-changing and fast-paced business of media. Event attendees will have excellent opportunities to network and speak with influencers, thought leaders, technology experts, entrepreneurs, and investors.</div><div><div><br></div><div>CoInvent brings together the best minds in the media industry to brainstorm the ideas that will transform technology and business as we know it and disrupt the traditional way these industries operate," said CoInvent Founder and CEO Andrew Wong. "This year's CoInvent Media Summit promises to be the most talent-packed and unique event in New York City."<br></div><div><br>CoInvent Media Summit 2015 will feature more than forty forward-thinking speakers from AOL, Ad Age, TechCrunch, Buzzfeed, Microsoft, Group M, Edelman, Angel Investments and other top leaders in the fields of media, tech, and venture capital. Industry pioneers will share insights and advice on embracing and incorporating change in news, streaming, music, social media, and other evolving areas. Speakers and event-goers will discuss topics surrounding content strategy, mobile, viral movements creation, and fundraising for media startups, among others.<br><br>The summit is one of many events that CoInvent features in New York throughout the year. The media company also holds cocktail parties, showcases, entrepreneur "speed-dating" nights, and other opportunities for startups and small business owners to present their ideas to investors and venture capitalists and talk about their companies' growth.<br><br>If you'd like to learn more about the event and attend, visit <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://coinvent.co/events/cmsny">coinvent.co/events/cmsny</a>. To meet with CoInvent CEO Andrew Wong, please contact him through&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow">andrew@nyebn.com</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow">347-598-0678</a>.</div></div></div><div></div>
<p>Impact Radius (<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.impactradius.com/" title="Link: http://www.impactradius.com/">www.impactradius.com</a>), the leading global marketing technology platform that enable brands to maximize their return on ad spend across digital and offline channels, welcomes Mark Wrighton to its team as Commercial Director EMEA in the United Kingdom. Mr. Wrighton brings over twelve years of experience and a passion for improving digital marketing strategy using Big Data insights to the rapidly-growing global capabilities Impact Radius provides.</p><p>A thought leader in digital marketing, Mr. Wrighton has developed an acute understanding of technology and the marketing ecosystem. Before Impact Radius, he served as EMEA Director of Sales at BrightEdge, where he oversaw the foundation and development of EMEA sales and established the company as the leading enterprise solution in SEO and content marketing.</p><p>Mr. Wrighton looks to do the same at Impact Radius as Commercial Director EMEA, extending the companys global reach and spearheading the European organization from the London office. With Impact Radius at the forefront of Big Data-driven analytics and insights and experiencing record growth in the region, Mr. Wrighton will bring advertisers more control and transparency into their affiliate and cross-channel marketing programs.</p><p>I'm excited to join Impact Radius because I've already witnessed market-leading innovation and capabilities within the technology said Wrighton. With its state-of-the-art digital marketing suite, Impact Radius benefits from a huge marketplace of potential partners and provides a customer-centric team that's motivated to drive success for advertisers and agencies alike.</p><p>Mr. Wrighton sees Impact Radius as the top global affiliate marketing platform, and joins the company to accelerate growth and meet the growing demands of agencies and brands.</p><p>We saw 96% year over year revenue growth in EMEA. Were extremely excited to welcome Mark to our fast growing global organization as we continue our investment in expanding our European footprint, stated Vice President of Revenue Tijs van Santen.</p><p>To learn more about Impact Radius or schedule a demo of Impact Radius media attribution, performance marketing, and tag management products, visit&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.impactradius.com/">www.impactradius.com</a>.</p>
<div>Leading New York City Event Organizer Invites Industry Players to Annual Conference</div><br><br>New York, NY |&nbsp;April 9th, 2015&nbsp;-- CoInvent (<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.coinvent.co/">www.coinvent.co</a>), the innovation-minded media company widely known for its fun and exciting events where small business owners exhibit the newest ideas in their industries to entrepreneurs and investors, is launching this year's iteration of its annual CoInvent Media Summit in New York City. <div><br></div><div>The event, which will be held from&nbsp;8 am to 5 pm&nbsp;on&nbsp;April 22nd&nbsp;EDT at Anchin Block &amp; Anchin, LLP (at 1375 Broadway, #23), will showcase the latest in technology that startups have to offer in shaping the ever-changing and fast-paced business of media. Event attendees will have excellent opportunities to network and speak with influencers, thought leaders, technology experts, entrepreneurs, and investors.</div><div><div><br></div><div>CoInvent brings together the best minds in the media industry to brainstorm the ideas that will transform technology and business as we know it and disrupt the traditional way these industries operate," said CoInvent Founder and CEO Andrew Wong. "This year's CoInvent Media Summit promises to be the most talent-packed and unique event in New York City."<br></div><div><br>CoInvent Media Summit 2015 will feature more than forty forward-thinking speakers from AOL, Ad Age, TechCrunch, Buzzfeed, Microsoft, Group M, Edelman, Angel Investments and other top leaders in the fields of media, tech, and venture capital. Industry pioneers will share insights and advice on embracing and incorporating change in news, streaming, music, social media, and other evolving areas. Speakers and event-goers will discuss topics surrounding content strategy, mobile, viral movements creation, and fundraising for media startups, among others.<br><br>The summit is one of many events that CoInvent features in New York throughout the year. The media company also holds cocktail parties, showcases, entrepreneur "speed-dating" nights, and other opportunities for startups and small business owners to present their ideas to investors and venture capitalists and talk about their companies' growth.<br><br>If you'd like to learn more about the event and attend, visit&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://coinvent.co/events/cmsny">coinvent.co/events/cmsny</a>. To meet with CoInvent CEO Andrew Wong, please get in touch with Miranda Tan (<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow">mtan@myprgenie.com</a>,&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow">917-678-6041</a>).</div></div>
electric vehicle?
electric vehicle?
        <p><b>Is Vice Media the Members Only Jacket of the Media Industry?</b></p> <p><br></p> <p>Those of us of a certain age vividly remember Members Only. One day no one had heard</p> <p>&nbsp;of it, and the next day everyone - and I mean everyone - was wearing the jacket. &nbsp;However, Members Only did not actually come out of nowhere. &nbsp;The company (founded in 1975) was around for nearly a decade before an unpredictable chain of events caused it to</p> <p>&nbsp;become hot in the mid 80s. Then, just as quickly as it exploded, it died down. &nbsp;In no time, wearing Members Only was a sure way to tell the world you were out of touch and behind the times.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Vice Media runs the very real risk of following the exact same trajectory.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Like Members Only, Vice has been around for a while  since 1994 to be exact. &nbsp;For many</p> <p>&nbsp;years it languished in obscurity. &nbsp;An occasional article or series would give it a little visibility beyond the clubby world of the media industry. &nbsp;But in the last 2-3 years Vice has exploded. It seems like there is hardly a corner of the world or a sensational</p> <p>&nbsp;story that has not been touched by a Vice reporter. &nbsp;One would struggle to find a Twitter feed or a Facebook wall that is</p> <p><b>not</b> littered with shared</p> <p>&nbsp;Vice articles and videos.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Most telling is how much Vice has become the main topic of discussion inside Old Media</p> <p>&nbsp;executive offices and boardrooms. &nbsp;As someone who works with print, TV, and online media executives, I hear the word Vice used on a daily basis. &nbsp;Common uses of the word Vice include:</p> <p>·</p> <p>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Why cant our editors exhibit more of an edgy Vice-style voice?</p> <p>·</p> <p>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;I wish our Sales team could master native advertising the way Vice has.</p> <p>·</p> <p>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;If we opened an office in Williamsburg, Brooklyn would we be able to recruit fresh young Vice-like talent?</p> <p>·</p> <p>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;We cant reach the Vice audience because nobody on our management team has the magnetism and charisma of Shane Smith.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Vice is serious. &nbsp;They are hungry, fierce, and on the attack. &nbsp;However, the question</p> <p>&nbsp;nobody seems to be asking is whether Vices position is sustainable. &nbsp;Will they continue to grow and threaten Big Media or will they implode and fade away like Members Only?</p> <p><br></p> <p>Vice has a few things working against it. &nbsp;First, its core demographic is getting older.</p> <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;Much of Vices rise is attributable to an uncanny ability to capture the attention of Millennials. &nbsp;There is probably no company on earth better than Vice at reaching this seemingly unreachable demographic. &nbsp;However, Millennials are getting older. &nbsp;Will they</p> <p>&nbsp;still want to munch on the Twinkie and Fritos diet of Vice content when they acquire a taste for Fois Gras? &nbsp;Millennials wont wake up one day and simply decide they would rather read the commodities report in the Financial Times rather than watch a video</p> <p>&nbsp;of a rock band made up of heroin-addicted skateboard punks from Somalia. &nbsp;This transition will take place as they get jobs, get married and get on with their lives.</p> <p><br></p> <p>It is believed that Winston Churchill once said, If you are not a liberal at 25, you</p> <p>&nbsp;have no heart. &nbsp;If you are not a conservative at 35, you have no brain. &nbsp;Vice is a business model that is all about nourishing the young heart. &nbsp;It is not equipped to satisfy a critical, well-informed, mature brain. &nbsp;Its content, however heartwarming, does</p> <p>&nbsp;not meet the needs of someone who wants to truly understand the implications and nuances of a serious news story.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Furthermore, the Vice business model is not very defensible. &nbsp;Sure, they have built a</p> <p>&nbsp;loyal and highly engaged audience. &nbsp;However, they do not have a secret formula that cannot be replicated (or at the very least simulated). &nbsp;They are competing against media companies that have deep pockets, massive scale, huge infrastructure, and expansive</p> <p>&nbsp;reach and distribution. &nbsp;While these media companies are largely on their heals, Vice cannot expect them to stay quiet. &nbsp;Nor can Vice maintain the hubris that they are insulated from Old Media attacks. &nbsp;No matter how loudly Shane Smith calls the competition</p> <p>&nbsp;a bunch of bitches, he must accept that these bitches fight hard.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Millennials are not an alien race understood only by the young Aquavit-sipping employees</p> <p>&nbsp;who occupy Vices funky Williamsburg offices. &nbsp;While it has taken a while, most companies in media (and other industries) have started to become very effective at reaching and connecting with this audience. &nbsp;Vice does not have a monopoly on talent, resources</p> <p>&nbsp;or even ideas. &nbsp;While Vice is much more than a one trick pony  Old Media has figured out most of the tricks.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Vice will learn that there are just two types of companies in the world - Attackers and</p> <p>&nbsp;Defenders. &nbsp;Attackers are the scrappy, hungry new entrants seeking to disrupt the industry, take market share, and battle the establishment. &nbsp;Twenty years ago MTV was an attacker. &nbsp;Ten years ago Google was an attacker. &nbsp;Today, they are defenders, fending off</p> <p>&nbsp;new entrants and small startups trying to nibble away at their business. &nbsp;The goal of nearly every attacker is to one day become the defender. &nbsp;Some companies thrive as defenders (Apple), while others struggle (Microsoft). &nbsp; </p> <p><br></p> <p>Vice has unquestionably been the attacker and has inflicted some serious damage onto</p> <p>&nbsp;established media companies. &nbsp;However, due to its scale, audience size and deep pockets, Vice is transitioning into becoming a defender. &nbsp;As that transition happens the new attack will not only come from young media startups but also from well-funded and extremely</p> <p>&nbsp;powerful established media conglomerates. &nbsp;Does Vice have the resources, skills and experience to thrive as a defender?</p> <p><br></p> <p>Some industry analysts have pointed at Fusion (a joint venture between ABC/Disney and</p> <p>&nbsp;Univision) as a first shot in what is sure to be a war for the millennial eye balls. &nbsp;While Fusion is a great product and will have some success, it will not win the war. &nbsp;Other media companies are currently running Manhattan Projects to build more formidable</p> <p>&nbsp;weapons. &nbsp;The war is still young and the outcome is not decided. &nbsp;However, Vice should prepare itself to take casualties.</p> <p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p> <p>Its not yet clear how Vice will respond to the attacks. &nbsp;The successful formula that</p> <p>&nbsp;got it to where it is today will need to be tweaked or possibly changed entirely. &nbsp;Vices investors have placed a lot of faith in its management team - a management team that curiously lacks anyone with business experience. &nbsp;The teams lack of business experience</p> <p>&nbsp;and knowledge has served them well as attackers. &nbsp;It freed them of constraints and allowed them to make bold decisions. &nbsp;As Vice becomes a defender, it will need to expand its leadership team to include some experienced leaders who understand more than just</p> <p>&nbsp;the creative side of building a media company.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Ultimately, the future of Vice will likely rest less on the strength of its editorial</p> <p>&nbsp;content and more on its ability to expand into new business models. &nbsp; What are the ways Vice can convert this unique relationship with millennials into new businesses? &nbsp;A very positive sign was their launch of Carrot Creative  a digital ad agency focused</p> <p>&nbsp;on millennials. &nbsp;However, launching an agency is not a radical idea. In fact, Old Media has been in the agency business for years. &nbsp;What are other business models Vice may want to explore? &nbsp;Should Vice launch a travel business to target millennials who want</p> <p>&nbsp;to visit the exotic locations of Vice reports? &nbsp;Should Vice launch a food delivery business to feed the kids who regularly enjoy the Munchies channel? &nbsp;Can Vices Motherboard create a tech event that puts Disrupt or SXSW to shame? &nbsp;There are countless ideas</p> <p>&nbsp;worth exploring, but doing so productively requires a blend of fresh creativity and business rigor.</p> <p><br></p> <p>To be clear  what Shane Smith has accomplished is very impressive. &nbsp;Beneath all the</p> <p>&nbsp;tattoos is a ruthless and brilliant leader who has done a masterful job of getting Vice to where it is today. &nbsp;Frankly, I would love to see Shane be the CEO of a few Old Media companies I know  he would certainly make a positive impact. &nbsp;However, the sustainability</p> <p>&nbsp;of Vice cannot rest on Shanes shoulders alone. &nbsp;He needs to diversify his organization and its business models. &nbsp;For Vice to avoid becoming a one-trick pony, Shane has to get into the media equivalent of the race horse breeding business.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Twenty years ago, many of the companies that we now call Old Media were in the same</p> <p>&nbsp;position as Vice. &nbsp;They were flying high and could do no wrong. &nbsp;MTV was the voice of its generation, Fox was a fourth network in a three network world, Wired was the future of the magazine industry, AOL was the forebearer of media convergence, and Sirius</p> <p>&nbsp;re-imagined the radio industry. While these companies all exist today, some reasonably successfully, they failed to maintain their meteoric trajectories. Most disappointing is that they failed to fully capitalize on the countless opportunities that were available</p> <p>&nbsp;to them. &nbsp;Ultimately, they did not evolve quickly enough, they stopped being sufficiently aggressive, and eventually became content with operating their businesses in survival mode.</p> <p><br></p> <p>Rather than ignoring Old Media, Vice should learn from it. &nbsp;Vice should adapt, evolve,</p> <p>&nbsp;and continually transform or one day it too will be referred to as Old Media.</p> <p><br></p> <p>The decline of Members Only was rapid and brutal. &nbsp;The company literally fell off the</p> <p>&nbsp;face of the earth. &nbsp;Vice is currently looking down from the very top of the mountain. &nbsp;Its a long way down and the drop can be painful and possibly deadly. &nbsp;Rather than building a fort at the top of the mountain, Vice needs to aggressively look for new peaks</p> <p>&nbsp;to conquer.</p> <p>?<br></p>
<p>DUBLIN, February 17, 2014- AYLIEN, Inc., a Dublin-based technology firm backed by SOS Ventures, this week announced the availability of its Text Analysis API, a suite of eight Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval and Machine Learning APIs that enable developers and news organizations to extract meaningful insights from nearly any document.</p><p></p><p>The concept of the Semantic Web is crucial to the evolution of the web in general, but existing technology hasnt kept up with that vision, founder Parsa Ghaffari said. In order to build the platform of the future, we need to build the technology to support that platform. It starts with giving developers and news organizations the tools they need to build platforms that adapt to the needs of their users. The Text Analysis API is the first step in building a web in which machines communicate with each other in meaningful ways.</p><p></p><p>AYLIENs Text Analysis API offers distinct advantages over existing solutions, most notably with automatic hashtag suggestions for social media platforms. The package consists of eight APIs, each with unique capabilities:</p><p></p><p>The Text Analysis API delivers highly relevant information at record speed, surfacing new information almost immediately after it appears on, for example, Wikipedia. Classification adheres to a universal standard, eliminating miscommunication between platforms. Using the API consists merely of creating a Mashape account and subscribing to the API through its homepage. Pricing is aggressive, and does not require long-term contracts. A plan is available to students, educators, and researchers free of charge for the first six months.</p><p></p><p>A demo of the Text Analysis API is available here, and an overview and FAQ section is available on our page. A press kit is available for download here.</p>
<p>Impact Radius (<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.impactradius.com/">www.impactradius.com</a>), the leading global marketing technology platform that enable brands to maximize their return on ad spend across digital and offline channels, welcomes Mark Wrighton to its team as Commercial Director EMEA in the United Kingdom. Mr. Wrighton brings over twelve years of experience and a passion for improving digital marketing strategy using Big Data insights to the rapidly-growing global capabilities Impact Radius provides.</p><p>A thought leader in digital marketing, Mr. Wrighton has developed an acute understanding of technology and the marketing ecosystem. Before Impact Radius, he served as EMEA Director of Sales at BrightEdge, where he oversaw the foundation and development of EMEA sales and established the company as the leading enterprise solution in SEO and content marketing. </p><p>Mr. Wrighton looks to do the same at Impact Radius as Commercial Director EMEA, extending the companys global reach and spearheading the European organization from the London office. With Impact Radius at the forefront of Big Data-driven analytics and insights and experiencing record growth in the region, Mr. Wrighton will bring advertisers more control and transparency into their affiliate and cross-channel marketing programs.</p><p>I'm excited to join Impact Radius because I've already witnessed market-leading innovation and capabilities within the technology said Wrighton. With its state-of-the-art digital marketing suite, Impact Radius benefits from a huge marketplace of potential partners and provides a customer-centric team that's motivated to drive success for advertisers and agencies alike. </p><p>Mr. Wrighton sees Impact Radius as the top global affiliate marketing platform, and joins the company to accelerate growth and meet the growing demands of agencies and brands.</p><p>We saw 96% year over year revenue growth in EMEA. Were extremely excited to welcome Mark to our fast growing global organization as we continue our investment in expanding our European footprint, stated Vice President of Revenue Tijs van Santen.</p><p>To learn more about Impact Radius or schedule a demo of Impact Radius media attribution, performance marketing, and tag management products, visit <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.impactradius.com/">www.impactradius.com</a>. </p><p>About Impact Radius</p><p>Impact Radius' digital marketing platform enables significant improvement in the return on global advertising spend for brands and agencies. The company provides a fully-integrated suite of products for media attribution, performance marketing, tag management and mobile analytics. Impact Radius provides a singular view into the consumer journey, tracks cross-channel marketing efforts, and delivers Big Data insights that drive revenue growth. Impact Radius serves companies around the globe including American Airlines, Cabelas, Deckers, Shutterstock, Tommy Hilfiger and Wayfair. Learn more at <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.impactradius.com/">www.ImpactRadius.com</a>.?</p>
                 <p>Leading New York City Event Organizer Invites Industry Players to Annual Media Conference</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>New York, NY | April 9th, 2015 -- CoInvent (<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.coinvent.co/">www.coinvent.co</a>), the innovation-minded media company widely known for its fun and exciting events where small business owners exhibit the newest ideas in their industries to entrepreneurs and investors, is launching this year's iteration of its annual CoInvent Media Summit in New York City. </p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>The event, which will be held from 8 am to 5 pm on April 22nd EDT at Anchin Block &amp; Anchin, LLP (at 1375 Broadway, #23), will showcase the latest in technology that startups have to offer in shaping the ever-changing and fast-paced business of media. Event attendees will have excellent opportunities to network and speak with influencers, thought leaders, technology experts, entrepreneurs, and investors.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>CoInvent brings together the best minds in the media industry to brainstorm the ideas that will transform technology and business as we know it and disrupt the traditional way these industries operate," said CoInvent Founder and CEO Andrew Wong. "This year's CoInvent Media Summit promises to be the most talent-packed and unique event in New York City."</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>CoInvent Media Summit 2015 will feature more than forty forward-thinking speakers from AOL, Ad Age, TechCrunch, Buzzfeed, Microsoft, Group M, Edelman, Angel Investments and other top leaders in the fields of media, tech, and venture capital. Industry pioneers will share insights and advice on embracing and incorporating change in news, streaming, music, social media, and other evolving areas. Speakers and event-goers will discuss topics surrounding content strategy, mobile, viral movements creation, and fundraising for media startups, among others.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>The summit is one of many events that CoInvent features in New York throughout the year. The media company also holds cocktail parties, showcases, entrepreneur "speed-dating" nights, and other opportunities for startups and small business owners to present their ideas to investors and venture capitalists and talk about their companies' growth.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>If you'd like to learn more about the event and attend, visit <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://coinvent.co/events/cmsny">coinvent.co/events/cmsny</a>. To meet with CoInvent CEO Andrew Wong, please contact him through <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow">andrew@nyebn.com</a> or <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow">347-598-0678</a>.?</p>

                 <p><br></p><p>Today, Tonara, a music education technology company, announced a $5 million investment round led by Baidu, Chinas leading search engine, and Carmel Ventures. Baidus investment and partnership will accelerate Tonaras growth, particularly in China, the worlds largest music education market. Existing investors also participated in the round. Baidus Senior Director of Corporate Development, Peter Fang, will be joining Tonaras board. </p><p>Tonara's mission is to redefine the way music is taught, learned and practiced around the world by bringing music education into the digital age. We are excited by Baidu's endorsement of Tonara's vision and potential said Guy Bauman, CEO of Tonara. The new funding will enable us to scale and reach music students and teachers globally. Were thrilled to cooperate with Baidu in reaching out to the Chinese audience"</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Tonara has consistently pushed the envelope when it comes to developing innovative and revolutionary technology, said Peter Fang of Baidu. Not only is there a huge global market for Tonara's music education platform, a large piece of which is China, but we see many other possible applications for Tonara's technology.  We are certain that Tonaras future will be extraordinary, and were proud to be a part of it.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Music education hasn't changed for hundreds of years. We are delighted to support Tonara in its mission to redefine the huge global market of music education by creating a user-friendly music practicing experience on tablets for students and teachers," added Rina Shainski, General Partner of Carmel Ventures.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>The company currently offers two apps: Tonara, a fully digitized sheet music platform for professional and amateur musicians which, follows played music, flips the pages during rehearsal and performance, and offers an extensive catalog of scores. Following professional artists onstage success with Tonara, the Wolfie app for teachers and students was launched in 2014. Based on the same proprietary technology, Wolfie is transforming music education by using an iPad to create an interactive and engaging music learning experience. Wolfie supports teacher-student communication and features an extensive catalogue of music lessons organized by levels.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Tonara and Wolfies music catalog is constantly expanding thanks to partnerships with music publishers. The company will be announcing new partnerships with major music publishers in the coming months, further developing the catalogue, and cementing Tonaras leadership as the provider of the best apps for musicians  whether they are students, teachers, or world-class performers. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Tonara:</b></p><p>                                             </p><p>?Tonara launched in 2011 with an industry-first interactive digital music sheet app for the iPad that has been embraced by performers on stage as well as by amateur players. Tonara is a music technology company developed by musicians for all those who love music. With a mission to broaden access and be a catalyst for lifelong learning at all levels, Tonara is leading the transition of sheet music into the digital age by making it accessible and interactive. Tonara's technology is also paving the way for a wide range of new applications for digitized music, including its premier music education platform Wolfie. For more information about Tonara, visit <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.tonara.com">www.tonara.com</a>; for Wolfie, visit <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow" href="http://www.wolfiepiano.com">www.wolfiepiano.com</a>. </p>
                 <p><u>FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE</u></p><p><small>Contact: Heather Marlowe, thehazeplaypress@gmail.com</small></p>  <p><b>400,000 Ignored Rapes Nationwide.</b></p>  <p><b>One woman wrote a casual play to get her rape kit processed</b></p>  <p><b>THE HAZE</b></p>  <p><b>A SOLO PLAY BY HEATHER MARLOWE</b></p>  <p><b>TWO NIGHT EXCLUSIVE ENGAGEMENT</b></p>  <p><b>Presented by Take Back The Night and </b><b>Emily Kollaritsch</b></p>  <p><b>AT MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY</b></p>  <p><b>APRIL 17-18, 2015</b></p>  <p><b>April 15, 2015, LANSING, MI: <i>THE HAZE, </i></b>a provocative solo show by writer and performer <b>Heather Marlowe</b> will tour to Michigan State University to perform a one night theatrical engagement as part of the Universitys annual Take Back the Night event.</p>  <p>A dark-humored, sharp-witted, and autobiographical story about the aftermath of being drugged and raped while attending San Franciscos annual Bay to Breakers event, Marlowes play has already generated local and national attention for the issues and questions it raises about how rape cases are chronically mishandled and ignored at Police Departments even in enlightened cities like San Francisco, CA. Marlowes performances along with pressure from local media resulted in the San Francisco Police Department auditing and releasing the numbers of their 1,877 rape kit backlog.<b><i> THE HAZE </i></b>is further is credited with the San Francisco Police Department expediting and processing 753 of its ignored rape kits and creating reform protocol to prevent a rape kit "backlog" in the future.</p>  <p><b><i>THE HAZE</i></b> comes to Michigan at a moment when Wayne County District Attorney's office -- &nbsp;in processing its 12,000 rape kit backlog  has partnered with The Michigan Womens Foundation in holding private fundraisers to investigate, prosecute, and lock up indicted rapists identified from their "backlog" testing. Says Marlowe of this approach, This may be a worthy effort but in my opinion it sends the wrong message to our government, law enforcement, and criminal justice system about taking the violent crime of rape seriously. U.S. Police Departments and city officials spend millions of dollars on growing police misconduct, to fight the war on drugs through mass incarceration, and to militarize their units. Furthermore, private fundraisers to investigate and prosecute the crime of rape shows the 400,000&nbsp;<i>criminals on the loose</i> that our government is just fine to maintain this status quo rather than taking all fiscal and legal action necessary to reform its broken system and prioritize rape victims' safety and justice.</p>  <p>Marlowe has partnered with MSU activist and survivor Emily Kollaritsch who led a protest last December against the Universitys decision to feature George Will as their commencement speaker. In April 2014, Kollaritsch also spoke out about how MSU administration ignored her rape complaint and investigation for 285 days.  Emily is now a student leader and organizer around sexual violence that happens to students at Michigan State University. She has filed a Title IX Compliant against the University for the failure to provide an adequate and impartial investigation for both the sexual abuse and the retaliation by her assailant. </p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b>ABOUT <i>THE HAZE:</i></b></p>  <p><b><i>THE HAZE</i></b><i> </i>began its development in 2012 and has been workshopped in San Francisco and New York. <b><i>THE HAZE</i></b> was a 2013-14 recipient of The Yerba Buena Center for the Arts grant in San Francisco. <b><i>THE HAZE</i></b> received 12 presentations at the Costume Shop at American Conservatory Theater in September, 2014. </p>  <p><b>ABOUT THE WRITER AND PERFORMER:</b></p>  <p><b>Heather Marlowe (Performer/Playwright)</b> has been on stage as an actress/performer, dancer, and musician since 2007. She has studied theater and performance with Kristin Linklater, Gabrielle Roth, and at Berkeley Repertory and American Conservatory Theater. Her work has been most recently seen at American Conservatory Theater, Bawdy Storytelling, Porchlight Storytelling Series, and W. Kamau Bells Solo Performance Workshop. As a violinist and vocalist she has performed with San Francisco based bands <i>Thee Landlords</i> and <i>Winchester Revival</i>. Heather is currently working on a<i> </i>mockumentary and a music video. </p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>###</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><b>April 15, 2015, LANSING, MI: <i>THE HAZE,&nbsp;</i></b>a provocative solo show by writer and performer&nbsp;<b>Heather Marlowe</b>&nbsp;will tour to Michigan State University to perform a one night theatrical engagement as part of the Universitys annual Take Back the Night event.</p><p>A dark-humored, sharp-witted, and autobiographical story about the aftermath of being drugged and raped while attending San Franciscos annual Bay to Breakers event, Marlowes play has already generated local and national attention for the issues and questions it raises about how rape cases are chronically mishandled and ignored at Police Departments even in enlightened cities like San Francisco, CA. Marlowes performances along with pressure from local media resulted in the San Francisco Police Department auditing and releasing the numbers of their 1,877 rape kit backlog.<b><i>&nbsp;THE HAZE&nbsp;</i></b>is further is credited with the San Francisco Police Department expediting and processing 753 of its ignored rape kits and creating reform protocol to prevent a rape kit "backlog" in the future.</p><p><b><i>THE HAZE</i></b>&nbsp;comes to Michigan at a moment when Wayne County District Attorney's office -- &nbsp;in processing its 12,000 rape kit backlog  has partnered with The Michigan Womens Foundation in holding private fundraisers to investigate, prosecute, and lock up indicted rapists identified from their "backlog" testing. Says Marlowe of this approach, This may be a worthy effort but in my opinion it sends the wrong message to our government, law enforcement, and criminal justice system about taking the violent crime of rape seriously. U.S. Police Departments and city officials spend millions of dollars on growing police misconduct, to fight the war on drugs through mass incarceration, and to militarize their units. Furthermore, private fundraisers to investigate and prosecute the crime of rape shows the 400,000 <i>criminals on the loose</i>&nbsp;that our government is just fine to maintain this status quo rather than taking all fiscal and legal action necessary to reform its broken system and prioritize rape victims' safety and justice.</p><p>Marlowe has partnered with MSU activist and survivor Emily Kollaritsch who led a protest last December against the Universitys decision to feature George Will as their commencement speaker. In April 2014, Kollaritsch also spoke out about how MSU administration ignored her rape complaint and investigation for 285 days. Emily is now a student leader and organizer around sexual violence that happens to students at Michigan State University. She has filed a Title IX Compliant against the University for the failure to provide an adequate and impartial investigation for both the sexual abuse and the retaliation by her assailant.?</p>
<h2>Companies are struggling to fend off cyber attacks as hackers get faster, sneakier and more creative.?</h2>
<div><p>How long will the data last in your hard-drive or USB stick? Five years? 10 years? Longer?</p></div><p>Already a storage company called Backblaze is running 25,000 hard drives simultaneously to get to the bottom of the question. As each hard drive coughs its last, the company replaces it and logs its lifespan.</p><p>While this census has only been running five years, the statistics show a 22% attrition rate over four years.</p><p>Some may last longer than a decade, the company says, others may last little more than a year; but the short answer is that storage devices don't last forever.</p><p></p><h3>A permanent solution</h3><p></p><ul></ul><p>Science is now looking to nature, however, to find the best way to store data in a way that will make it last for millions of years.</p><p>Researchers at ETH Zurich, in Switzerland, believe the answer may lie in the data storage system that exists in every living cell: DNA.</p><p>So compact and complex are its strands that just 1 gram of DNA is theoretically capable of containing all the data of internet giants such as Google and Facebook, with room to spare.</p><p>In data storage terms, that gram would be capable of holding 455 exabytes, where one exabyte is equivalent to a billion gigabytes.</p><p></p><h3>Fossilized data</h3><p></p><p>Fossilization has been known to preserve DNA in strands long enough to gain an animal's entire genome -- the complete set of genes present in a cell or organism.</p><p>So far, scientists have extracted and sequenced the genome of a 110,000-year-old polar bear and more recently a 700,000-year-old horse.</p><p>Robert Grass, lecturer at the Department of Chemistry and Applied Biosciences, said the problem with DNA is that it degrades quickly. The project, he said, wanted to find ways of combining the possibility of the large storage density in DNA with the stability of the DNA found in fossils.</p><p>"We have found elegant ways of making DNA very stable," he told CNN. "So we wanted to combine these two stories -- to get the high storage density of DNA and combine it with the archaeological aspects of DNA."?</p>
<p>DUBLIN, September 15, 2014- AYLIEN, Inc., a Dublin-based firm backed by SOS Ventures, has announced the availability of a Google Sheets add-on which extracts meaningful data from documents.</p><p></p><p>The add-on was built using AYLIENS own Text Analysis API, released in February of this year, and features the full capabilities of the original product. The Text Analysis API, as the original press release states, enables developers and news organizations to extract meaningful insights from a given text. The Google Sheets add-on extends that capability beyond developers and news organizations.</p><p></p><p>AYLIEN founder Parsa Ghaffari spoke about the motivation behind building the add-on: The Text Analysis API is a huge step in making web documents more meaningful from a data perspective, but it was built for developers. We wanted to bring that same capability to everyone. Building an add-on for the most popular web-based office editing software in the world was a logical step. Its baked into a product that everyone already uses and requires no technical expertise. Anyone can use this to gain insights into a given text without installing anything locally. Just open your web browser.</p><p></p><p>Like the original Text Analysis API, the Google Sheets add-on can perform sentiment analysis, extract mentions of entities and concepts, summarize lengthy texts, detect language, create hashtags for optimum sharability, classify documents into categories, and extract full text and embedded media. Its the first such tool available for Googles web-based productivity suite.</p><p></p><p>Using the Text Analysis add-on users can:</p><p></p><p>To use the add-on, users simply install the add-on from Googles Chrome Web Store. Once installed, the add-on integrates with Googles built-in Sheets Function, adding new capabilities which correspond with the Text Analysis API functions. To see how the addon works, visit the official tutorial page.</p><p></p><p>Pricing is structured to provide maximum value for single users and large organizations alike. A pay-as-you-go model allows users to buy the credits they need when they need them, eliminating the possibility of overpaying.</p><p></p><p>The Text Analysis Google Sheets add-on is available now. For more information, or to install the add-on and get started, simply visit this page.</p><p></p><p>A press kit is available for download here.</p>
<p>Portland, OR &nbsp;Locally owned CrabTech Hermit Crab Shells announced today that it will be merging with Miami-based crab shell superstore HermitHomes effective December 21, 2012. Company officials are expected to meet with Crab Construction Union officials later this month to discuss employee benefits and retirement packages.</p><p></p><p>CrabTech officials expect this merger to improve investor confidence and widen its customer base. In addition to shells, CrabTech stores will now stock aquariums, heating stones, and crab socialization areas.</p><p></p><p>The merger will permit HermitHomes factories in Virginia and Colorado to construct CrabTech's patented BioShells and Shellac-Attack hermit crab shells. In exchange, CrabTech stores will be opened in Maine and Michigan, with construction and product selection completed by HermitHomes contractors.</p><p></p><p>More information is expected to be released following a shareholders meeting on August 20, 2012.</p><p></p><p>About CrabTech Hermit Crab Shells</p><p></p><p>CrabTech opened its first store in Portland in 1996 and is owned by Jesse and Jean Callahan. It has enjoyed 16 years as an independent company and hassix&nbsp;stores in Oregon and Washington.</p><p></p><p>CrabTech will uphold its promise to stimulate the local economy. Known for its biodegradable temporary shells and sustainably harvested shellac, the company also intends to maintain its commitment to environmentally friendly business practices. For more information, please visit <a href="http://www.CrabTechHermits.com/">http://www.CrabTechHermits.com/</a>.</p><p></p><p>About HermitHomes</p><p></p><p>HermitHomes is a Miami-based crab shell dealer. It specializes in wholesome, crab-healthy living and is committed to using only American labor to create and market its products. It has 68 stores nationwide, as well as&nbsp;four&nbsp;overseas in France and Chile. For more information, please visit<a href="http://www.HermitHomes.com/">http://www.HermitHomes.com/</a>.</p><p></p><p>Contact</p><p></p><p>To learn more about this merger, please contact</p><p></p><p>Bill Stickers, Media Relations</p><p>1246 NE Sandy Blvd. Ste. 210A</p><p>Office: (503) 867-5309</p><p>Fax: (503) 867-5408</p><p>billstickers@crabtechhermits.com?</p>
<p>DUBLIN, February 17, 2014- AYLIEN, Inc., a Dublin-based technology firm backed by SOS Ventures, this week announced the availability of its Text Analysis API, a suite of eight Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval and Machine Learning APIs that enable developers and news organizations to extract meaningful insights from nearly any document.</p><p></p><p>The concept of the Semantic Web is crucial to the evolution of the web in general, but existing technology hasnt kept up with that vision, founder Parsa Ghaffari said. In order to build the platform of the future, we need to build the technology to support that platform. It starts with giving developers and news organizations the tools they need to build platforms that adapt to the needs of their users. The Text Analysis API is the first step in building a web in which machines communicate with each other in meaningful ways.</p><p></p><p>AYLIENs Text Analysis API offers distinct advantages over existing solutions, most notably with automatic hashtag suggestions for social media platforms. The package consists of eight APIs, each with unique capabilities:</p><p></p><p>The Text Analysis API delivers highly relevant information at record speed, surfacing new information almost immediately after it appears on, for example, Wikipedia. Classification adheres to a universal standard, eliminating miscommunication between platforms. Using the API consists merely of creating a Mashape account and subscribing to the API through its homepage. Pricing is aggressive, and does not require long-term contracts. A plan is available to students, educators, and researchers free of charge for the first six months.</p><p></p><p>A demo of the Text Analysis API is available here, and an overview and FAQ section is available on our page. A press kit is available for download here.</p>

 		 	 	 		<div> 			<div> 				<div> 					<div> 			<div> 				<div> 					<p>Singapore, 30 October, 2014  </p> 					<p>From April to November 2015, a travelling showcase celebrating Singapores contemporary creative talents will travel to Beijing, London and New York before returning to Singapore. As part of the SG50 celebrations, Singapore: Inside Out will shine the spotlight on our creative talents who have gained recognition and acclaim for their works. </p> 					<p>Singapore: Inside Out is an initiative led by the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) and is supported by agencies such as the National Arts Council and DesignSingapore Council. It will be a showcase that presents cross-disciplinary works of local talents across a spectrum of the creative industries and disciplines. Some of the featured sectors include architecture, design, fashion, film, food &amp; beverage, music, and literary, performing and visual arts. Set in a specially designed modular structure (refer to Annex B), the showcase will debut in Beijing (April 2015), before heading to London (June 2015) and New York (September 2015). Each international presentation will last for five days, while the homecoming finale in Singapore (November 2015) will be an extended 10-day presentation. </p> 					<p>As Singapore turns 50, it is timely for us to celebrate the achievements of our talents and developments in our creative ecosystem. While Singapore is renowned for its business-city credentials, less is known about our creative sector. Through Singapore: Inside Out, we hope to spark conversations in 2015 and beyond about the creative talent and work emerging from our city, said Ms Melissa Ow, Assistant Chief Executive, Singapore Tourism Board. </p> 				</div> 			</div> 			<div> 				<div> 					<p>1 </p> 				</div> 			</div> 		</div><p> 		 	 	 		 		</p><div> 			<img width="65700000" alt="page2image416" height="51000000"> 			<img width="54934000" alt="page2image584" height="51000000"> 			<div> 				<div> 					<p>Mr Randy Chan, who helms one of Singapores leading local architectural studios Zarch Collaboratives as Principal Architect, has been appointed as the projects creative director, and will lead the development of the creative concept and programming of Singapore: Inside Out.
