<br><br><br><br>Mother's Day&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br><br>Thanksgiving Day <br><br><br><br>Hurricane Season Begins (June 1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br><br>The Holiday Season (December)<br><br><br><br>Father's Day &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br><br><br><br>The Fourth of July (July 4) <br><br><br><br><br>Anniversary of Americans with Disabilities Act (July 26) <br><br><br><br><br>Back to School (August)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br><br><br><br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Editor's note: The preceding data were collected from a variety of sources and may be subject to sampling variability and other sources of error. Facts for Features are customarily released about two months before an observance in order to accommodate magazine production timelines. Questions or comments should be directed to the Census Bureau's Public Information Office.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Public Information Office&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;301-763-3030 / pio@census.gov&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;census.gov&nbsp;Connect with us on Social media<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Logo - <a href="http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20110428/DC91889LOGO">http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20110428/DC91889LOGO</a> <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  &nbsp;<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									 			   		  	 		  			   										<br>										 										SOURCE  U.S. Census Bureau 			   		  	 	 RELATED LINKS<br>	 		  		  		  <a href="http://www.census.gov">http://www.census.gov</a>
WARWICK, R.I., June 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- According to a new survey by travel insurance comparison site InsureMyTrip, more than half of travelers (55 percent) polled will not return to the same destination as last summer. The results were part of the 2015 Summer Travel Guide, a compilation of data-driven insights to help consumers travel smarter in 2015. <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  This research also highlighted travel planning behaviors and preferences. For example, most will choose to stay in a hotel while on a summer trip and plan to go sightseeing, visit the beach, and spend quality time with family and friends. Top travel concerns include overspending and disruptions of vacation plans due to weather or health issues.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  For this particular study, InsureMyTrip conducted a highly targeted survey and restricted the respondent pool to only a group of US travelers who either researched or purchased travel insurance within the past 18 months. Here are the results:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TRAVELERS PREFER TO VISIT NEW DESTINATIONS<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  55% will visit a new destination this summer24% will sometimes visit the same destination22% do tend to visit the same destination<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MOST WILL GO ON A SUMMER VACATION THIS YEAR<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  An overwhelming eighty-two percent said they were planning a summer vacation. Twelve percent said they had no plans yet. Six percent had no plans.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Out of those polled, 67 percent will get to their destination by air.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  PREFER STAYING IN HOTELS<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  42% will stay in a hotel25% will go on a cruise18% will stay in a vacation rental10% prefer to stay with family or friends4% &nbsp;&nbsp;will use a timeshare<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  SIGHTSEEING TOPS THE LIST OF SUMMER TRAVEL ACTIVITIES<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  50% enjoy sightseeing the most during a summer vacation23% like going to the beach or relaxing13% enjoy spending time with family and friends the most10% other3% &nbsp;&nbsp;eating at restaurants<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TRAVELERS BOOKING WELL IN ADVANCE<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Most travelers prefer to book vacations in advance with 82 percent booking a trip more than 30 days in advance, 15 percent booking a few weeks prior to departure and three percent preferring spur of the moment trips.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TOP TRAVEL CONCERNS: MONEY, HEALTH, WEATHER<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The poll reveals that most summer travelers are concerned about overspending, health issues and&nbsp;bad weather affecting travel. Here is the list of concerns in order of popularity:<br><br><br>Overspending <br>Health issues before or during a trip <br>Hurricane or bad weather affecting travel plans <br>Missing a flight <br>Bad experience with food or accommodations<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The survey also asked how much travelers planned to spend on a vacation. Nearly half polled (47 percent) will spend over $1500 on a vacation budget. Thirty-one percent will spend over $5000.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MOST POPULAR INTERNATIONAL DESTINATIONS: UK, FRANCE, ITALY<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  This list shows the most popular summer destinations for travel outside the US (June 2015  August 2015). This information was pulled from internal customer data.<br><br><br>United Kingdom <br>France <br>Italy <br>Caribbean <br>Netherlands<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MORE INTEREST IN TRAVEL TO EUROPE<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip teamed up with&nbsp;pricing app Hopper&nbsp;to research travel trends this summer. With the strong US dollar, it is not surprising to find more Americans booking trips to Europe this summer and taking advantage of a bargain.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  According to Hopper, the cheapest times to fly to Europe this summer are in the beginning of May and the end of August.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																																		<br>June is the most popular month for European travel <br>Prices peak at the end of July <br> 											 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TOP TRAVEL INSURANCE NEEDS FOR SUMMER TRAVEL<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  To gain insight on the travel insurance needs of summer travelers, the research team polled licensed travel insurance agents from InsureMyTrip.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Here are the top reasons why travelers purchase travel insurance for summer travel, listed in order of importance:<br><br><br>Hurricanes or bad weather affecting travel plans <br>Concerns over&nbsp;coverage for a vacation rental <br>Health issues affecting travel plans&nbsp;<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip estimates 80 percent of travel insurance consumers purchase a comprehensive policy.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Comprehensive travel insurance provides a variety of benefits including medical coverage, emergency travel services, baggage protection, and trip cancellation and interruption coverage.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Tip: Travelers concerned about&nbsp;hurricanes should purchase travel insurance early. Once a storm starts forming, insurance is no longer available.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  ABOUT INSUREMYTRIP:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip compares travel insurance products from the most trusted providers in the industry.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip's powerful unbiased comparison engine and thousands of reviews enable travelers to quote and buy the right travel insurance plan. The site is supported by award winning customer service and travel insurance agents licensed in all 50 states.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Featured by&nbsp;Consumer Reports, and listed as a helpful website by the&nbsp;US Federal Consumer Information Center.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip travel insurance experts are featured in national publications including Los Angeles Times, New York Times, Washington Post, and Travel + Leisure.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									 			   		  	 		  			   										<br>										 										SOURCE  InsureMyTrip 			   		  	 	 RELATED LINKS<br>	 		  		  		  <a href="http://www.insuremytrip.com">http://www.insuremytrip.com</a>
WARWICK, R.I., June 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- According to a new survey by travel insurance comparison site InsureMyTrip, more than half of travelers (55 percent) polled will not return to the same destination as last summer. The results were part of the 2015 Summer Travel Guide, a compilation of data-driven insights to help consumers travel smarter in 2015. <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  This research also highlighted travel planning behaviors and preferences. For example, most will choose to stay in a hotel while on a summer trip and plan to go sightseeing, visit the beach, and spend quality time with family and friends. Top travel concerns include overspending and disruptions of vacation plans due to weather or health issues.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  For this particular study, InsureMyTrip conducted a highly targeted survey and restricted the respondent pool to only a group of US travelers who either researched or purchased travel insurance within the past 18 months. Here are the results:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TRAVELERS PREFER TO VISIT NEW DESTINATIONS<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  55% will visit a new destination this summer24% will sometimes visit the same destination22% do tend to visit the same destination<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MOST WILL GO ON A SUMMER VACATION THIS YEAR<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  An overwhelming eighty-two percent said they were planning a summer vacation. Twelve percent said they had no plans yet. Six percent had no plans.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Out of those polled, 67 percent will get to their destination by air.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  PREFER STAYING IN HOTELS<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  42% will stay in a hotel25% will go on a cruise18% will stay in a vacation rental10% prefer to stay with family or friends4% &nbsp;&nbsp;will use a timeshare<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  SIGHTSEEING TOPS THE LIST OF SUMMER TRAVEL ACTIVITIES<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  50% enjoy sightseeing the most during a summer vacation23% like going to the beach or relaxing13% enjoy spending time with family and friends the most10% other3% &nbsp;&nbsp;eating at restaurants<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TRAVELERS BOOKING WELL IN ADVANCE<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Most travelers prefer to book vacations in advance with 82 percent booking a trip more than 30 days in advance, 15 percent booking a few weeks prior to departure and three percent preferring spur of the moment trips.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TOP TRAVEL CONCERNS: MONEY, HEALTH, WEATHER<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The poll reveals that most summer travelers are concerned about overspending, health issues and&nbsp;bad weather affecting travel. Here is the list of concerns in order of popularity:<br><br><br>Overspending <br>Health issues before or during a trip <br>Hurricane or bad weather affecting travel plans <br>Missing a flight <br>Bad experience with food or accommodations<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The survey also asked how much travelers planned to spend on a vacation. Nearly half polled (47 percent) will spend over $1500 on a vacation budget. Thirty-one percent will spend over $5000.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MOST POPULAR INTERNATIONAL DESTINATIONS: UK, FRANCE, ITALY<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  This list shows the most popular summer destinations for travel outside the US (June 2015  August 2015). This information was pulled from internal customer data.<br><br><br>United Kingdom <br>France <br>Italy <br>Caribbean <br>Netherlands<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MORE INTEREST IN TRAVEL TO EUROPE<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip teamed up with&nbsp;pricing app Hopper&nbsp;to research travel trends this summer. With the strong US dollar, it is not surprising to find more Americans booking trips to Europe this summer and taking advantage of a bargain.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  According to Hopper, the cheapest times to fly to Europe this summer are in the beginning of May and the end of August.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																																		<br>June is the most popular month for European travel <br>Prices peak at the end of July <br> 											 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TOP TRAVEL INSURANCE NEEDS FOR SUMMER TRAVEL<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  To gain insight on the travel insurance needs of summer travelers, the research team polled licensed travel insurance agents from InsureMyTrip.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Here are the top reasons why travelers purchase travel insurance for summer travel, listed in order of importance:<br><br><br>Hurricanes or bad weather affecting travel plans <br>Concerns over&nbsp;coverage for a vacation rental <br>Health issues affecting travel plans&nbsp;<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip estimates 80 percent of travel insurance consumers purchase a comprehensive policy.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Comprehensive travel insurance provides a variety of benefits including medical coverage, emergency travel services, baggage protection, and trip cancellation and interruption coverage.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Tip: Travelers concerned about&nbsp;hurricanes should purchase travel insurance early. Once a storm starts forming, insurance is no longer available.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  ABOUT INSUREMYTRIP:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip compares travel insurance products from the most trusted providers in the industry.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip's powerful unbiased comparison engine and thousands of reviews enable travelers to quote and buy the right travel insurance plan. WARWICK, R.I., June 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- According to a new survey by travel insurance comparison site InsureMyTrip, more than half of travelers (55 percent) polled will not return to the same destination as last summer. The results were part of the 2015 Summer Travel Guide, a compilation of data-driven insights to help consumers travel smarter in 2015. <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  This research also highlighted travel planning behaviors and preferences. For example, most will choose to stay in a hotel while on a summer trip and plan to go sightseeing, visit the beach, and spend quality time with family and friends. Top travel concerns include overspending and disruptions of vacation plans due to weather or health issues.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  For this particular study, InsureMyTrip conducted a highly targeted survey and restricted the respondent pool to only a group of US travelers who either researched or purchased travel insurance within the past 18 months. Here are the results:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TRAVELERS PREFER TO VISIT NEW DESTINATIONS<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  55% will visit a new destination this summer24% will sometimes visit the same destination22% do tend to visit the same destination<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MOST WILL GO ON A SUMMER VACATION THIS YEAR<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  An overwhelming eighty-two percent said they were planning a summer vacation. Twelve percent said they had no plans yet. Six percent had no plans.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Out of those polled, 67 percent will get to their destination by air.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  PREFER STAYING IN HOTELS<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  42% will stay in a hotel25% will go on a cruise18% will stay in a vacation rental10% prefer to stay with family or friends4% &nbsp;&nbsp;will use a timeshare<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  SIGHTSEEING TOPS THE LIST OF SUMMER TRAVEL ACTIVITIES<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  50% enjoy sightseeing the most during a summer vacation23% like going to the beach or relaxing13% enjoy spending time with family and friends the most10% other3% &nbsp;&nbsp;eating at restaurants<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TRAVELERS BOOKING WELL IN ADVANCE<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Most travelers prefer to book vacations in advance with 82 percent booking a trip more than 30 days in advance, 15 percent booking a few weeks prior to departure and three percent preferring spur of the moment trips.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TOP TRAVEL CONCERNS: MONEY, HEALTH, WEATHER<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The poll reveals that most summer travelers are concerned about overspending, health issues and&nbsp;bad weather affecting travel. Here is the list of concerns in order of popularity:<br><br><br>Overspending <br>Health issues before or during a trip <br>Hurricane or bad weather affecting travel plans <br>Missing a flight <br>Bad experience with food or accommodations<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The survey also asked how much travelers planned to spend on a vacation. Nearly half polled (47 percent) will spend over $1500 on a vacation budget. Thirty-one percent will spend over $5000.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MOST POPULAR INTERNATIONAL DESTINATIONS: UK, FRANCE, ITALY<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  This list shows the most popular summer destinations for travel outside the US (June 2015  August 2015). This information was pulled from internal customer data.<br><br><br>United Kingdom <br>France <br>Italy <br>Caribbean <br>Netherlands<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  MORE INTEREST IN TRAVEL TO EUROPE<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip teamed up with&nbsp;pricing app Hopper&nbsp;to research travel trends this summer. With the strong US dollar, it is not surprising to find more Americans booking trips to Europe this summer and taking advantage of a bargain.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  According to Hopper, the cheapest times to fly to Europe this summer are in the beginning of May and the end of August.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																																		<br>June is the most popular month for European travel <br>Prices peak at the end of July <br> 											 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TOP TRAVEL INSURANCE NEEDS FOR SUMMER TRAVEL<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  To gain insight on the travel insurance needs of summer travelers, the research team polled licensed travel insurance agents from InsureMyTrip.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Here are the top reasons why travelers purchase travel insurance for summer travel, listed in order of importance:<br><br><br>Hurricanes or bad weather affecting travel plans <br>Concerns over&nbsp;coverage for a vacation rental <br>Health issues affecting travel plans&nbsp;<br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip estimates 80 percent of travel insurance consumers purchase a comprehensive policy.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Comprehensive travel insurance provides a variety of benefits including medical coverage, emergency travel services, baggage protection, and trip cancellation and interruption coverage.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Tip: Travelers concerned about&nbsp;hurricanes should purchase travel insurance early. Once a storm starts forming, insurance is no longer available.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  ABOUT INSUREMYTRIP:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip compares travel insurance products from the most trusted providers in the industry.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip's powerful unbiased comparison engine and thousands of reviews enable travelers to quote and buy the right travel insurance plan. The site is supported by award winning customer service and travel insurance agents licensed in all 50 states.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Featured by&nbsp;Consumer Reports, and listed as a helpful website by the&nbsp;US Federal Consumer Information Center.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  InsureMyTrip travel insurance experts are featured in national publications including Los Angeles Times, New York Times, Washington Post, and Travel + Leisure.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									 			   		  	 		  			   										<br>										 										SOURCE  InsureMyTrip 			   		  	 	 RELATED LINKS<br>	 		  		  		  <a href="http://www.insuremytrip.com">http://www.insuremytrip.com</a>
<p>In 2002, a struggling artist took a leap of faith and started his own company with only a few hundred dollars. Today, that artist is not only celebrating the tenth anniversary of his award-winning product, but he is giving artists around the globe the chance to do what he did. Terrence Kelleman is realizing his dream through his mighty wallet product line and Artist Collective program.</p><p>Terrence Kelleman founded Dynomighty Design with the idea to create jewelry using magnets. His first design took off after a YouTube video went viral, and sales began to soar. During a flight to LA, Terrence folded a napkin into what would later become the pattern for the Original Tyvek wallet. The only thing missing was a material as creative as the wallet. Enter Tyvek.</p><p>Dynomighty has been creating products from Tyvek since 2005 and has used them to spread positivity and creativity. Besides being eco-friendly, Tyvek products created a canvas for hundreds of designs. In the Spring of 2013, an early iteration of the Artist Collective was launched, and Terrences dream of being able to give back to other artists started to take shape.</p><p>Now, two years later, the Artist Collective hosts over 700 artists, and has given over $50,000 to independent artists through the program. On top of being a platform for artists to share their mighty wallet designs, the Artist Collective serves as a channel for worldwide exposure for the artists.</p><p>Starting in 2015, Dynomighty has set forth a goal to move ten designs into full production twice a year. This commitment to the Artist Collective allows for an artist to become part of the full mighty wallet line that is distributed around the globe in 66 countries, and within over 1600 stores in the US. Independent artists see the value in being part of Artist Collective and Terrence sees the value in giving back to help spread creativity globally.</p><p>While other platforms host artists work and pay commissions, there is no other company opening up their distribution network to help individual artists grow. This endeavor is what Dynomightys motto, Be Mighty!, represents. Often said at trade show booths, and given out on buttons, the motto resounds through everything Terrence has created.</p><p></p><p>The company has already seen growth within Artist Collective this year, and can attribute that directly to the dedication and support of the artists. With more artists joining daily, Artist Collective is set to break the 1000 artists mark this year. The first 10 designs that have been brought into the full mighty wallet line launch this week, and will be available worldwide starting mid-June.</p>
LOS ANGELES, June 15, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Father's Day is Sunday, June 21st, and global faith-and-family television leader TBN will devote the weekend to honoring the men who lead and provide for their families, and who help mold the destinies of future generations.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Logo - <a href="http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150615/222971LOGO">http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150615/222971LOGO</a><br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  "I know first-hand the challenges fathers today face in leading their families," said TBN Vice President Matthew Crouch. "I also know from personal experience that our heavenly Father stands ready to help dads succeed in their divinely commissioned responsibility. And at TBN we're here to encourage and stand with fathers."<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  TBN's Father's Day weekend lineup includes some great movies and programs specially selected for dads to share with their families:<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Pendragon: Sword of His Father. In 411 A.D., Artos, the son of a British chieftain, is captured and enslaved by Saxon marauders who destroy his village and kill his people. Beaten down under the oppression of his heartless masters, Artos somehow finds the strength to flee and make his way to a British stronghold in the Welsh mountains. Along the way God strengthens Artos' faith and gives him an understanding of his duty as a man to join in God's sovereign plan. Instilled with God's confidence, the young man joins the warriors that British ruler Ambrosius is preparing for the daunting task of halting the Saxon invasion. This powerful story re-enforces the important values of faith, responsibility, and courage in a man's life. Airs June 20th (click here for broadcast time).<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Hero. A father's broken relationship with his family fills him with determination to win back the son he left behind. Reaching out through baseball, he forms a team designed to reconnect fathers with their sons, transforming his community in the process. Airs June 20th (click here for broadcast time).<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  -- Abraham. From the pages of the Old Testament comes an unforgettable story of the man God called the "father of many nations," and from whose lineage would come Jesus Christ. This cinematic re-telling of the inspiring Bible account stars a pair of legendary actors, Oscar nominee Richard Harris and Academy Award winner Maximilian Schell. Airs June 21st (click here for broadcast time).<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  -- A Letter to Dad. This impacting film tells the story of a young man preparing to marry and start his own family, but who must first face the anger he has held toward the father who abandoned him as a young child. The moving conclusion reinforces the truth that faith in God and a choice to love can overcome a lifetime of pain and disappointments. Airs June 21st (check here for broadcast time).<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  -- A Father's Heart. Hosted by popular sportscaster James Brown, this inspirational special features celebrities from the world of sports as they reflect on their fathers and the experience of fatherhood. Includes appearances by Hall of Fame NFL quarterback Bob Griese, former NBA great A.C. Green, NASCAR's Buckshot Jones, and PGA golfer Doug Tewell. Airs June 21st (click here for broadcast time).<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Matthew Crouch said that with the family unit under attack as never before, strong, committed fathers are more crucial than ever. MUMBAI, June 16, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  The concept of self-driving vehicles has been gaining traction from the past few years. Self-driving vehicles are expected to radically change the driving experience. With sophisticated sensors, radar, lasers and advanced mapping technology, these self-driving cars have eyes and ears on the roads, theoretically allowing the driver to sit back and relax. Automakers are hopeful that the next generations of driverless cars will carry even more autonomous features.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Self Driving Car Opportunity Market Segments: In terms of Self Driving Car Segments, the software will be the competitive differentiator in the automated vehicles market as it is expected to capture the largest slice of the autonomous car opportunity market. Computer hardware is predicted to be second largest segment followed by Optical Camera and Radar.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  Self Driving Car Opportunity Region Wise: North America is anticipated to be the leader in terms of self driving car sales being followed by China. The Western Europe is anticipated to stand at the third spot.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			   																																									  "Global - Automatic/Self Driving Car Opportunity Market Analysis" provides a comprehensive assessment of the fast-evolving, opportunistic Global Automatic vehicle Industry. <p><b>Local PR Firm to Represent Retail Technology Venture Accelerator</b><br></p><p>REVTECH, the Dallas-based venture accelerator and seed fund dedicated to restaurant and retail industry, has named Dallas-based<b> </b><a href="http://www.trizcom.com/">TrizCom Public Relations</a> as its PR agency of record. REVTECH aims to accelerate the best retail, restaurant and hospitality tech companies to ultimately promote Dallas to the center of the universe for retail tech innovation.</p><p>Founded in 2012, REVTECH (previously VentureSpur) attracts, mentors and connects experienced entrepreneurs with viable products to talent, customers and investors specifically related to the technical evolution of the restaurant and retail industry. They activate this through the REVTECH Accelerator program  a unique 14-week, mentor-driven program that provides up to $40 thousand in seed capital for each start-up, business development workshops hosted by successful entrepreneurs and industry leaders, free office space at&nbsp;the Dallas Entrepreneur Center and an opportunity to pitch at Demo Day in September 2015.</p><p>Since 2012, REVTECH has invested over $500 thousand in 17 portfolio companies through its first three funds. Their graduating portfolio companies have raised over $2.5 million.</p><p>Positioning their startups for success, REVTECH operates out of Dallas, Texas. Dallas has the largest concentration of national restaurant and retail chains headquartered in the U.S., with over 100 national chains in the DFW area and 100 more within a 250-mile radius.</p><p>REVTECH Managing Director David Matthews says, In concert with our mission to make Dallas the hub of retail teach innovation, we recognize the importance of working alongside the media to leverage the growth that we are seeing in the entrepreneurial sector. Our partnership with TrizCom Public Relations puts us in that arena. We are thrilled to work with the team.</p><p>Jo Trizila, founder and CEO of TrizCom, says, REVTECH has a hyper-focus on the technological evolution of an industry that is firmly rooted in Dallas. Our goal is to stay lock-step with their efforts. REVTECHs commitment to their startups is extraordinary, and we look forward to expanding awareness of their mission as a company.</p><p>For more information, please visit REVTECH at <a href="http://www.revtechaccelerator.com/" title="Link: http://www.revtechaccelerator.com/">http://www.revtechaccelerator.com/</a>. For more information on TrizCom PR, please visit <a href="http://www.trizcom.com/">www.trizcom.com</a>.</p><p><b>About REVTECH</b></p><p>REVTECH is a venture accelerator seed fund dedicated to identifying and developing the best early-stage, high-growth ventures focused on tech for restaurant, retail and hospitality.&nbsp; REVTECH aims to facilitate the technological evolution of the restaurant and retail industry by attracting, mentoring and connecting experienced entrepreneurs with viable products to talent, customers and investors. Established in 2012, REVTECH and its unique 14-week accelerator program have fostered success through engagement at inception and continued growth for an ever-present industry in Dallas, home to over 100 national restaurant and retail headquarters, the largest concentration in the U.S.</p><p>For more information, go to <a href="http://www.revtechaccelerator.com/">www.revtechaccelerator.com</a>, Facebook: <a href="http://www.facebook.com/revtechaccelerator">www.facebook.com/revtechaccelerator</a>, Twitter: <a href="https://twitter.com/REVTECHVentures" title="Link: https://twitter.com/REVTECHVentures">https://twitter.com/REVTECHVentures</a>, LinkedIn: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/venturespur">https://www.linkedin.com/company/venturespur</a>.</p><p>                              </p><p>###</p>
<p> </p><ul> 	<li><p>Never 	leave home without moisturizer, eyeliner inside the lower lash line 	and lip gloss</p> 	</li><li><p>Pump 	up your eye color by coordinating a complimentary smokey eye</p> 	</li><li><p>For 	an angelic look, try golden bronzer on places that the sun kiss like 	your forehead, the bridge of your nose, and portions of your cheeks. 	 	</p> 	</li><li><p>Use 	a light sweet pink blush and apply before you apply concealer to 	make it look very natural. And then line you inner lower lids with 	white eye liner and use a black eyeliner only to complement your 	upper lash line and go light with the mascara.  	</p> 	</li><li><p>Going 	match-y/match-y with your eye shadow and outfits isn't always a bad 	thing. If you are going for a casual warm weekend look in certain 	cases going with a very light dusting of eye shadow that matches 	your outfit can give you a put together look without a lot of 	effort.</p> </li></ul><p> </p><p><br><u><b>About Broken</b></u><b>:</b></p><p> </p><p>Recently famed as a Bestselling Romance by iBooks, Broken by New York Author Tanille Edwards is a young adult novel that stars Milan, the girl everyone wants to be but no one really knows. Milan finds herself in a burgeoning supermodel career right at the start of her senior year in high school. Nothing like expected, Milan is struggling to identify with her friends and family. Milan, like every teenage girl, is fighting insecurities. Milan goes to great lengths not to be known as hearing impaired. To top it all, Milan finds herself longing for a lost love.</p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p><i>Broken</i> is a novel conceived in the new media era where books and music can be consumed on a single platform. Every copy of <i>Broken</i>&nbsp;includes a link to download the Broken Soundtrack that includes free music from author &amp; singer/songwriter Tanille. Tanille makes the heart-throbbing longing for a lost love come alive in her single "Baby Comeback to Me" as part of the Broken Soundtrack. <i>Broken</i> invites readers to enjoy a new spin on Young Adult Romance.</p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p>Tanilles Book Expo America Performance held at the Jacob Javits Center. <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZFlgeAE4wVc">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZFlgeAE4wVc</a><br><br> </p><p> </p><p><u><b>About Tanille</b></u>:  </p><p> </p><p>Tanille was recently on Voices of America, On Air with Sir and Just Wake Up Morning Show. <p> </p><p>Summer Sizzles in the Hamptons: Tanille, Author of Young Adult Romance Book <i>Broken</i> Offers Top Five Summer Romance Tips</p><p> </p><p>	</p><p> </p><p>New York, New York  June 23, 2015  Summer romance is in the air and as well all plan our summer beach vacations, the novel <i>Broken</i> is a must for all summer beach bags. Packed with summer fun, romance and drama, <i>Broken </i>shares a story that we can all relate to  our first summer love.</p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p>New media Young Adult Romance Author, Tanille shares the Top Five Summer Romance Tips in lead character Milans voice, taken straight from the steamy pages of <i>Broken</i>.</p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><ul> 	<li><p>Never 	ask a guy out on a date. If you truly want to gauge a guys 	interest, let him make the first move. <i>Milan 	waits for the new foreign exchange student to make his move it sets 	a precedent for their entire relationship.</i></p> 	</li><li><p>Only 	kiss him when you truly feel ready. Dont feel pressured into 	doing something you feel uncomfortable doing. <i>Milan 	is shy about kissing on the first date. She only does what she is 	comfortable with and expresses her healthy self-esteem by doing so. </i> 	</p> 	</li><li><p>Dedication 	does not make him the one. Just because he is hopelessly 	dedicated to you, it does not necessarily mean he is the one for 	you<i>. If chemistry and 	feelings fall short, it is completely okay to make a tough 	relationship call. </i> 	</p> 	</li><li><p>Dont 	kiss and tell. You dont have to share every move you make with 	your friends. If you spill to your girlfriends every relationship 	move you make will it help or hurt your relationship. <i>There 	are definitely things that should stay between you and your guy. </i> 	</p> 	</li><li><p>Dont 	lose yourself in a relationship. Place no one before thyself. It is 	important to love yourself more than you love anyone else. <i>Stay 	true to who you are and what you stand for. If you lose yourself, 	then you risk becoming someone that is not in harmony with who you 	truly are.</i>  	</p> </li></ul><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p>Broken (<a href="http://www.brokenthenovel.com">www.brokenthenovel.com</a>) by New York Author Tanille Edwards is a young adult novel that stars Milan, the girl everyone wants to be but no one really knows.  Milan is a young emerging teen supermodel struggling to hide her hearing disability to others. She is caught up in the sweet memories of her first love and struggling to figure out just how much she would risk for that love.  </p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p>Broken is a novel conceived in the new media era where books and music can be consumed on a single platform. Every copy of Broken includes a link to download the Broken Soundtrack that includes free music from author &amp; singer/songwriter Tanille. Tanille makes the heart-throbbing longing for a lost love come alive in her single "Baby Comeback to Me" as part of the Broken Soundtrack. Broken invites readers to enjoy a new spin on Young Adult Romance.</p><p> </p><p><br> </p><p> </p><p><b>About Tanille:</b></p><p> </p><p>Tanille has authored two young adult novels featuring her music, romance novel <i>Broken</i> and teen thriller <i>Cameo</i>. She is a New York City native with a strong pulse on young love. (<a href="http://www.tanille.com/">www.Tanille.com</a>). Tanille was recently featured on Voices of America, On Air with Sir and Just Wake Up Morning Show. Tanille's music was recently featured in Weekend Notes, ONYX, and Hype Magazine. Shes also been featured as the monthly Celebrity Beauty in Salon Today. Tanille is in Amazing Kids Magazine this month as an Amazing Mentor.  </p><p> </p>
<p>Its common for babies to be colicky, meaning your otherwise healthy baby goes through bouts of uncontrollable crying. Colic may not harm your baby, but it can definitely be stressful for a parent who doesnt know what to do to calm baby. Luckily, the majority of infants are over colic by the age of four months. If you have a colicky baby, there are a couple of things you can do to comfort your baby. Alicia Overby, mom of four and inventor of Baby Elephant Ears, shares her five tips to help.</p><p><br></p><p>1. &nbsp; &nbsp;Soothe baby with warmth</p><p><br></p><p>Babies usually like the feeling of warmth, which is why a nice warm bath can sometimes be enough to comfort baby to sleep. If that doesnt work, try taking a hot water bottle filled with lukewarm (not hot) water and wrap it in a towel. Next you will place the bottle on your stomach and have baby lie down on top of you.</p><p><br></p><p>2. &nbsp; &nbsp;Try a baby support pillow</p><p><br></p><p>Babies are born with weak neck muscles, which is why they need mom and dads help to support their heads. The next time baby is in a stroller, swing, or on a changing table, you can use an&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babyelephantears.com/" target="_blank">infant support pillow</a>&nbsp;to provide baby with some extra comfort. Baby Elephant Ears is a&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babyelephantears.com/" target="_blank">baby headrest</a>&nbsp;that can be used wherever baby goes to provide spinal/neck alignment and comfort.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="400" alt="beepng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/bee-png" height="267" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/bee-png"></p><p><br></p><p>3. &nbsp; &nbsp;Use a white noise machine</p><p><br></p><p>Infants are used to hearing lots of sounds from inside moms womb, so trying to recreate those sounds in the nursery can be helpful. A white noise machine, running the vacuum, or turning a fan on can all provide gentle whooshing sounds that baby enjoys.</p><p><br></p><p>4. &nbsp; &nbsp;Use rocking motions</p><p><br></p><p>Some babies like to be rocked to sleep and are soothed by gentle, rhythmic motions. Baby swings and rockers are ideal for this but you can also place baby in a sling and walk around the house and bounce baby gently to calm her. Even taking her for a drive in the car around the block just might do the trick.</p><p><br></p><p>5. &nbsp; &nbsp;Swaddle baby</p><p><br></p><p>When all else fails, swaddling is sure to get baby to fall asleep and stay asleep for a longer period of time. Swaddling helps recreate the womb environment so baby feels snug and secure. Just make sure the swaddle is not too tight and that baby doesnt get overheated. </p><p><br></p><p>Note: This release is intended for informational purposes only and not to give professional medical advice. Please consult your doctor about any questions you may have regarding your child's health and before following any of the suggestions in this release.&nbsp; </p><p><br></p><p>To browse and shop the Baby Elephant Ears collection, visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babyelephantears.com/" target="_blank">www.babyelephantears.com</a>. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>To schedule an interview with Alicia Overby or request a sample for a media feature, please contact Giselle Diaz at giselle@socialmedia22.com or call Tasha Mayberry at 207.317.6099.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>###</p>
<div><p>When thinking about child safety, clothes arent typically the first things that come to a parents mind. However, when you learn more about what goes into the manufacturing of your childs clothes, you may realize that they could be harming your childs health. Childrens clothes often come in contact with pesticides, phthalates, and other toxic chemicals that can be damaging to sensitive skin. For National Child Safety Awareness Month, Cutie Bees founder Pooja Songar wants parents to know why they should be more mindful of the clothes they purchase for kids and why Cutie Bees offers the <a href="http://www.cutiebees.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.cutiebees.com/">healthiest clothes for kids</a>.</p><br><p>The Cutie Bees&nbsp;<a href="http://www.cutiebees.com/" target="_blank">clothing line for baby and toddler</a>&nbsp;was founded by mom of two, Pooja Songar, after she noticed that her daughters skin rashes and eczema were exacerbated by the clothes she was wearing. Some of these clothes were labeled as organic or eco-friendly, but the tags never specified what ingredients went into making them or that no toxic chemicals were used during production. Thats when Pooja did her own research and decided to create a healthy line of her own. Now the Cutie Bees mission is to make kids look good and feel good without compromise.</p><br><p><img width="300" alt="1mvLgbAuzRFJCKWaIX86oz1yGsj4qZTTDRzXMt8fpGQjpeg" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/1mvlgbauzrfjckwaix86oz1ygsj4qzttdrzxmt8fpgq-jpeg" height="300" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/1mvlgbauzrfjckwaix86oz1ygsj4qzttdrzxmt8fpgq-jpeg">&nbsp;<img width="300" alt="MFC2y_MQ5ABBUEvlMMY1KkwOCl0Bxlkkkvwn4Zxvy5gjpeg" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/mfc2y_mq5abbuevlmmy1kkwocl0bxlkkkvwn4zxvy5g-jpeg" height="300"></p><br><p><img width="300" alt="zQ7hMeeSWpsg2H5OlvJKcm6TKxNowK7rzNu1IvRqHAIx9eWyTzOWdx1tuf8Mp__LvQ_lr0NcZPGU2xnCPactQcjpeg" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/zq7hmeeswpsg2h5olvjkcm6tkxnowk7rznu1ivrqhai-x9ewytzowdx1tuf8mp__lvq_lr0nczpgu2xncpactqc-jpeg" height="361" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/zq7hmeeswpsg2h5olvjkcm6tkxnowk7rznu1ivrqhai-x9ewytzowdx1tuf8mp__lvq_lr0nczpgu2xncpactqc-jpeg">&nbsp;<img width="310" alt="cutiebeesjpg" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/cutiebees-jpg" height="360">&nbsp;</p><br><p>Here are five main reasons to choose Cutie Bees clothing:</p><br><p>1. <p>When summertime finally comes, kids cant wait to get outside and play all day long. However, boredom can sometimes develop when kids dont have a set schedule or activities to keep them occupied. Sitting them in front of the television all day is no way to banish boredom and it doesnt stimulate their brains. The learning does not have to end when summertime comes around and school lets out! Surprise Ride is a great way to <a href="http://www.surpriseride.com/" target="_blank">keep kids brains active during the summer</a>, and year round. The monthly subscription box supplies kids with all they need for fun, new activities each month so parents can take it easy this summer. </p><p><br></p><p>Each and every month, Surprise Ride is delivered straight to your door to bring a smile to your childs face. Theres a different theme each month with related activities and the box comes with supplies, instructions, a snack, fun facts, and more. Perfect for children ages 6-11, the Surprise Ride box will allow them to explore, broaden their horizons, and learn about the world around them. With every box comes a new adventure and memories to be made.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="300" alt="surprisepng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/surprise-png" height="300" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/surprise-png"></p><p><br></p><p>The curated&nbsp;<a href="http://www.surpriseride.com/" target="_blank">subscription box for kids</a>&nbsp;was invented by sisters Donna and Rosy Khalife. While Donna is a Harvard Business School alumna, Rosy is a graduate of Providence College with experience in marketing and advertising overseas. Both women are deeply involved in the creative process behind Surprise Ride and believe in nurturing the minds of children so they can be tomorrows innovators.</p><p><br></p><p>Benefits of Surprise Ride:<br></p><p><br></p><ul><br><li>Fosters curiosity and creativity in kids</li><br><li>Quality time for the whole family</li><br><li>Gets kids off the electronics</li><br><li>A way for families to stay connected</li><br><li>Makes the perfect gift </li><br></ul><p><br></p><p><img width="350" alt="birdhousepng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/birdhouse-png" height="350" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/birdhouse-png">&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Signing up is easy and every subscription includes free shipping each month. Choose from three subscription options including: a monthly subscription for $29.99/month, a 6-month subscription for $24.99/month, and a 12-month subscription for $24.99/month. </p><p><br></p><p>You can also purchase individual past boxes and sign-up for a subscription online at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.surpriseride.com/" target="_blank">www.surpriseride.com</a>. </p><p><br></p><p>To schedule an interview with Surprise Ride founders Rosy and Donna Khalife, contact Giselle Diaz at&nbsp;<a target="_blank">Giselle@socialmedia22.com</a>or call Tasha Mayberry at 207.317.6099.&nbsp; </p><p><br></p><p>### </p>
<p>When bringing a new baby home from the hospital, its important that the nursery is well prepared and safe from any hazards. Many times parents are not aware of common room items that can potentially cause harm to infants. In honor of Child Safety Awareness Month, mom of three, Jennifer Cicci, wants to share these seven hidden hazards so parents can prepare the nursery and keep baby safe at home.</p><p><br></p><p>1. &nbsp; &nbsp;Curtains and blind cords</p><p><br></p><p>When decorating the nursery, beautiful and bright curtains may be on your mind, but parents need to realize that they can be dangerous if they are in babys reach. Cordless blinds should be purchased and the crib should be placed away from the windows.</p><p><br></p><p>2. &nbsp; &nbsp;Crib rail</p><p><br></p><p>Most babies will go through a teething period where they will put their mouths on anything to soothe their sore gums. Unfortunately, many&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babeetalk.com/" target="_blank">crib rail covers</a>&nbsp;are made from synthetic materials that have toxic chemicals. Thats why Babee Talk designed their Eco-Teether® Crib Rail Cover with organic cotton that is free of chemical and toxins so its safe for baby to chew on.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="450" alt="babee1png" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/babee1-png" height="238"></p><p><br></p><p>3. &nbsp; &nbsp;Crib mattresses</p><p><br></p><p>Several mattresses are made with foam, which is required to be treated with fire-retardant chemicals. These chemicals are toxic so its best to invest in a natural crib mattress.</p><p><br></p><p>4. &nbsp; &nbsp;Paint</p><p><br></p><p>Choosing a color scheme for your nursery is one of the most exciting design choices because it lays the foundation for what the rest of your nursery will look like. What parents often dont think about is that some paints and lacquers create toxic emissions when they emit volatile organic compounds (or VOCs). Parents should try to use VOC-free paints or paints with low levels of VOC.</p><p><br></p><p>5. &nbsp; &nbsp;Baby toys&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Youll probably be gifted a bunch of adorable baby toys during your baby shower, but parents need to know that toys should not be kept in the crib while baby is asleep. Furthermore, plastic toys tend to contain phthalates, which are harmful to children. Stick with high-quality,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babeetalk.com/" target="_blank">eco-friendly baby toys</a>&nbsp;like Babee Talks Eco-Buds® Take-Along Pals.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="250" alt="babee2png" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/babee2-png" height="250"></p><p><br></p><p>6. &nbsp; &nbsp;Furniture&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>A lot of wooden furniture (even cribs) are made of pressed/composite wood that formaldehyde is often used in. Formaldehyde is a carcinogen and asthmagen, so choose solid wood furniture for your nursery.</p><p><br></p><p>7. &nbsp; &nbsp;Baby bedding</p><p><br></p><p>Baby bedding can be exposed to flame-retardant chemicals or pesticides, or even toxic dyes. Babee Talk designs stylish and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babeetalk.com/" target="_blank">organic baby bedding</a>, from crib sheets to rail covers, to crib skirts.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="300" alt="babee3png" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/babee3-png" height="244"></p><p><br></p><p>To view the full line of Babee Talk products and to purchase visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babeetalk.com/" target="_blank">www.babeetalk.com</a>. </p><p><br></p><p>Note to the media:&nbsp;Jennifer Cicci is extremely mediagenic and available for TV, radio, newspaper, magazine and other interviews. To schedule an interview with Jennifer, contact Tasha Mayberry, Director Public Relations at media@babeetalk.com or call 207.317.6099.</p><p><br></p><p>###</p>
<p>Second generation <a href="http://www.sigikid-usa.com/" target="_blank">sigikid</a>&nbsp;owners, Lucian and Eva, have decided to expand their beloved family toy brand to the United States. Beginning where they live in San Francisco, the mom and dad business duo are travelling from coast to coast living in a custom designed teardrop trailer. This will be their home for the next three months while they make stops to see current sigikid retailers, potential new retailers, and best of all, the people they meet along the way in different cities/towns/campgrounds and more! The family-owned brand with roots dating back 150 years ago officially started in 1968 in Germany with the Gottstein family. They saw an opportunity to change the look of children toys from stiff, to cute and cuddly with lifelike facial expressions  a brand trait that makes sigikid so popular. </p><p><br></p><p>The name came from company&nbsp;founder, Sigrid (her nickname is sigi), and her first child Axel (kid). Now, as a true family business, Axel continues to run the business in Germany while his sister, Eva, handles business development in the US with her husband, Lucian, and their son, Sebastian.</p><p><br></p><p>In today's world, many of our daily interactions are quick-paced and short-lived. We often tend to forget one of the most important human attributes: the ability to play. Our mission at sigikid is to bring back quality toys and the importance of playtime for all." shares Eva Frecea, 2nd generation owner of sigikid. </p><p><br></p><p>From June through August, the tour will not only introduce people to sigikid toys and the incredible family behind the brand, it will raise money for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.everymothercounts.org/" target="_blank">Every Mother Counts</a>, an organization dedicated to making pregnancy and childbirth safe for every mother. A percentage of revenues from all toy sales will be donated to this special charity.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="400" alt="sigikid - 10 donatedpng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/sigikid-10-donated-png" height="400" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/sigikid-10-donated-png">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>We are so excited to be on the road in our custom sigikid trailer and to be raising money for an important cause. What better way to share our family-owned sigikid brand by grassroots marketing face-to-face with people we meet? All we know for sure is we are starting in San Francisco and ending in New York. The rest will be inspired by suggestions from our fans which will add a whole other element of fun and adventure! shares Lucian Frecea. </p><p><br></p><p>sigikid will capture their tour by sharing photos on social media and on their website. Those who spot the sigikid trailer can snap a photo and upload it to social media with #sigikidTourUSA for a chance to win a $100 sigikid gift card every month during the tour, and those who dont see the trailer in person but still want to enter, can do so by sharing the provided image on the tour web page. This way every fan can be part of the tour no matter where they are, adds Eva.</p><p><br></p><p>From June through August 2015, keep your eyes peeled. The sigikid husband and wife duo will be on tour across America in one little, bright red trailer with a big purpose, to remind people of the power of play and how powerful playing is for kids and adults!</p><p><br></p><p>sigikid offers a range of toy lines: </p><p><br></p><p>Baby World<br>Cuddly World<br>Activity Toys<br>Sweety Collection<br>Organic* Toys<br>BEASTS  desiger plush toys**</p><p><br></p><p>*10% of online sales are donated to Every Mother Counts</p><p><br></p><p>**Collectibles for tweens, teens and adults!</p><p><br></p><p>All of the toys are made of high quality materials and are machine washable and durable to be handed down in the family.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="400" alt="sigikid - collectionspng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/sigikid-collections-png" height="318" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/sigikid-collections-png">&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>sigikid toys are: </p><p><br></p><ul><br><li>Innovative&nbsp;without being flashy</li><br><li>Classic&nbsp;without being conservative</li><br><li>Prestigious&nbsp;without being exclusive</li><br><li>Durable&nbsp;without being hard-to-clean</li><br><li>Soothing&nbsp;without being boring</li><br><li>Affordable&nbsp;without sacrificing quality</li><br></ul><p><br></p><p>Follow the tour online and suggest where sigikid goes next at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.sigikid-usa.com/pages/tour" target="_blank">http://www.sigikid-usa.com/pages/tour</a>&nbsp;and follow on Facebook and Instagram with hashtag #sigikidTourUSA. </p><p><br></p><p>To set an interview with Eva and Lucian Frecea, please contact Giselle Diaz at&nbsp;<a target="_blank">giselle@socialmedia22.com</a>&nbsp;or call Tasha Mayberry at 207.317.6099. SAN FRANCISCO  Plug In America announced today that Nissan will serve as the exclusive automotive sponsor for National Drive Electric Week through 2017. National Drive Electric Week, the largest annual organized gathering of plug-in vehicle drivers, celebrates its fifth anniversary this September with test drives and other activities planned in cities throughout the U.S. and beyond.<br><br>"Nissan is a driving force in the plug-in vehicle industry, with the top-selling electric vehicle, Nissan LEAF, and with investments in charging infrastructure and consumer education," said Tom Saxton, Plug In America's Program Manager for National Drive Electric Week. "Nissan's support of National Drive Electric Week helps Plug In America with our efforts to rapidly increase adoption of EVs of all kinds in cities across the U.S."<br><br>National Drive Electric Week is based on the idea that nothing beats ride-and-drives in clean, quiet and powerful plug-in vehicles for converting gasoline-car drivers to EV owners. The event, designed to showcase the fun, cost-savings and clean-air benefits of plug-in vehicles, was launched in 2011 in 29 cities, growing to more than 150 cities in the U.S. and abroad in 2014. Plug In America, the Sierra Club and the Electric Auto Association team up with local groups to organize events, which typically feature all-electric and plug-in hybrid electric cars from every automaker on the market.<br><br>Nissan and the all-electric LEAF have served as the event's exclusive automotive sponsor since 2013.<br><br>"From the moment we launched Nissan LEAF, we quickly found that LEAF owners are our best salespeople," said Andrew Speaker, Director, Nissan Electric Vehicle Sales and Marketing. "We are continuing to support National Drive Electric Week because this event helps bring owners of LEAF and other EVs together to share their experience and educate consumers on the benefits of driving electric cars."<br><br>With more than 178,000 global sales and more than 80,000 in the U.S., Nissan LEAF is the world's best-selling electric car. LEAF features seating for up to five passengers and boasts an EPA-estimated* driving range of 84 miles on a fully-charged battery and MPGe ratings of 126 city, 101 highway and 114 combined.<br><br>The starting price of a Nissan LEAF is about $22,000** in the United States after the maximum available federal tax credit, and can be lower in states and localities that offer additional credits or rebates. LEAF offers the benefits of lower running costs and less scheduled maintenance. Nissan manufactures LEAF and its battery pack at its plant in Smyrna, Tennessee.<br><br>National Drive Electric Week will take place Sept. 12 through 20. To organize or attend an event, visit <a href="https://driveelectricweek.org/events.php">https://driveelectricweek.org/events.php</a>.<br><br>About Plug In America<br><br> Plug In America, a San Francisco-based national nonprofit organization, works to accelerate the shift to plug-in vehicles powered by clean, affordable, domestic electricity to reduce our nation's dependence on petroleum and improve the global environment. The organization conceived National Drive Electric Week and has advanced workplace charging by pioneering regular ride-and-drive events at such leading corporations as Google, Mattel and Paramount Pictures. It developed the world's largest, most dedicated network of plug-in vehicle owners and drivers, many of whom have driven EVs for well over a decade. We drive electric. You can, too. <a href="http://www.pluginamerica.org">www.pluginamerica.org</a>.<br><br>About the Sierra Club<br><br> The Sierra Club is the nation's oldest and largest grassroots environmental organization with more than 2.4 million members and supporters and chapters in all 50 states. The Sierra Club's national electric vehicles initiative advocates for a switch to EVs as one important way to reduce emissions and cut oil consumption. Sierra Club is proud to have been one of the three national groups organizing National Drive Electric Week since its inception in 2011. <a href="http://www.sierraclub.org/EVGuide">www.sierraclub.org/EVGuide</a>.<br><br>About the Electric Auto Association<br><br> The Electric Auto Association, formed in 1967, is a nonprofit educational organization with 75 chapters worldwide that promotes the advancement and widespread adoption of electric vehicles. <a href="http://www.electricauto.org">www.electricauto.org</a>.<br><br>About Nissan North America<br><br> In North America, Nissan's operations include automotive styling, engineering, consumer and corporate financing, sales and marketing, distribution and manufacturing. Nissan is dedicated to improving the environment under the Nissan Green Program and has been recognized annually by the U.S Environmental Protection Agency as an ENERGY STAR® Partner of the Year since 2010. More information on Nissan in North America and the complete line of Nissan and Infiniti vehicles can be found online at <a href="http://www.NissanUSA.com">www.NissanUSA.com</a> and <a href="http://www.InfinitiUSA.com">www.InfinitiUSA.com</a>, or visit the U.S. media sites NissanNews.com and InfinitiNews.com.<br><br>About Nissan Motor Co.<br><br> Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., Japan's second-largest automotive company, is headquartered in Yokohama, Japan, and is part of the Renault-Nissan Alliance. Operating with more than 247,500 employees globally, Nissan sold 5.32 million vehicles and generated revenue of 11.38 trillion yen (USD 103.6 billion) in fiscal year 2014. Nissan delivers a comprehensive range of more than 60 models under the Nissan, Infiniti and Datsun brands. Nissan leads the world in zero-emission mobility, dominated by sales of the LEAF, the first mass-market, pure-electric vehicle. It is the best-selling EV in history with almost 50% share of the zero-emission vehicle segment.<br><br>For more information on our products, services and commitment to sustainable mobility, visit our website at <a href="http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/">http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/</a>.<br><br>*2015 EPA Fuel Economy Estimate 126 city, 101 highway. Based on EPA formula of 33.7 kW/hour equal to one gallon of gasoline energy, EPA rated the LEAF® equivalent to 126 MPG measured as gasoline fuel efficiency in city driving, and 101 MPG in highway driving. Actual mileage may vary with driving conditions  use for comparison only. 2015 EPA range of 84 miles.<br><br>** 2015 Nissan LEAF as low as $21,510 net value after maximum federal tax credit of $7,500. NASHVILLE, Tenn.  The all-new 2015 Nissan Murano, which was introduced to near universal acclaim in December 2014, has added another prestigious award to its trophy case  a "Best Crossover" in the Parents magazine and Edmunds.com annual listing of the "10 Best Family Cars."<br><br>As in previous years, the top vehicles for 2015 were selected by the Parents and Edmunds.com editors based on safety, convenience and high-tech performance features at all price levels. In choosing the Murano, they stated:<br><br>"The all-new Murano pulls off a neat trick, mimicking the creamy ride and luxe features of models costing $10,000 more. It provides stretch-your-legs space for five, easy car-seat access, and storage for a weekend getaway (portacrib and stroller included). The fatigue-fighting 'Zero Gravity' front seats are a blessing for long drives. The monitor beams 360-degree camera views, detecting and alerting you to moving objects in the parking lot, from bicycles to shopping carts to little kids."<br><br> Parents, June 2015 issue<br><br>Murano was also recently awarded an IIHS "Top Safety Pick Plus" ranking as one of the latest Nissan vehicles to offer the innovative Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB) systems specifically designed to alert drivers of potential risks ahead  along with available Driver's Attention Alert* (DAA) system. The DAA system analyzes driver steering behavior to provide an alert if signs of drowsiness or inattention are detected.<br><br>Sales of the all-new 2015 Murano increased 58.3 percent in May and 33.4 percent through May 2015 (compared to the same periods in calendar year 2014).<br><br>"The 2015 Murano has found a sweet spot in the competitive crossover SUV segment, offering standout styling, a highly versatile premium interior, advanced safety and driver aid technologies and, of course, Nissan's legendary driving excitement," said Fred Diaz, senior vice president, Sales &amp; Marketing, Parts &amp; Service, U.S.A, Nissan North America, Inc. "Now, on top of record sales in May, we're honored to add the highly sought-after Parents / Edmunds.com 'Best Family Car' acknowledgment to a great first year of the new Murano design."<br><br>As the halo vehicle for Nissan's expanding range of bold crossovers, the all-new Murano carries forward the new Nissan design direction with its V-Motion front end, boomerang lights, floating roof treatment and efficient aerodynamics. Inside, the new Murano offers an engaging "social lounge" feel through features such as the refined lower-height instrument panel, wide center console, advanced Zero Gravity seating, and the airy atmosphere created by the large windows and oversized Power Panoramic Moonroof.<br><br>Murano's long list of available features include NissanConnectSM with Navigation and Mobile Apps, 8-inch color display with multi-touch control, 8-way power driver's seat with power lumbar support, SiriusXM® Satellite Radio and Travel Link® (SiriusXM subscription required, sold separately), Nissan Intelligent Key® with Push Button Ignition, Remote Engine Start system, iPod® and other compatible devices interface, 11-speaker Bose® (including dual subwoofers) premium audio system and Bluetooth® Hands-free Phone System.<br><br>Responsive driving is provided by a standard 3.5-liter DOHC V6 connected to an advanced Xtronic transmission. Murano is available in front-wheel drive or Intuitive All-Wheel Drive. Fuel economy is rated at 28 mpg highway for both front-wheel and all-wheel drive models.<br><br>Available technologies include Around View® Monitor (AVM) with Moving Object Detection (MOD), Blind Spot Warning (BSW), Intelligent Cruise Control (ICC), Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB). The Rear Cross Traffic Alert (RCTA) system utilizes radar to detect a moving vehicle behind the Murano approaching from either side of a parking space.<br><br>The 2015 Murano is offered in four trim levels  S, SV, SL and Platinum  and in a choice of front-wheel or all-wheel drive. The starting MSRP** for the Murano S FWD is $29,560 USD, while the top-of-the-line Murano Platinum AWD is priced at $40,600 USD (full pricing is available at NissanNews.com). The new Murano is assembled in Canton, Mississippi.<br><br>For photography and additional information about the 2015 Nissan Murano along with the complete lineup of Nissan vehicles, please visit <a href="http://www.NissanNews.com">www.NissanNews.com</a>.<br><br>The complete 2015 Parents and Edmunds.com "10 Best Family Cars" list will be published in the July 2015 issue of Parents magazine and is available online at Parents.com/best-family-cars.<br><br>About Nissan North America <br><br>In North America, Nissan's operations include automotive styling, engineering, consumer and corporate financing, sales and marketing, distribution and manufacturing.
