<p>Sep 2, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- These days, more and more people are scheduling massage therapy sessions during their lunch breaks, returning to work refreshed and rejuvenated. The lotions used by massage therapists play a major role in the way people feel following a massage session. <br><br>There are two distinctive types of massage lotions â those for home use and those for professional use. Of the professional massage lotions, there are hundreds of products and products lines, each with their own unique ingredients and scents.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy therapists use only Massage Envy approved lotions - Bon Vital, Soothing Touch, and Biotone brand lotions. Each brand has been producing lotions specifically for professional massage therapists for years.&nbsp;<br><br>Since the first Massage Envy clinic opened its doors, they have instilled a âno-aromaâ policy to accommodate clients with allergies.&nbsp;<br><br>âFor sensitive skin it is best to stay away from heavily scented products and ones containing a high amount of oil. The best bet is to request products that are hypo-allergenic, which all Massage Envy clinics use,â says C.G. Funk, vice president of industry relations and product development for Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S.&nbsp;<br><br>In addition, the âno-aromaâ policy lends itself to people on-the-go, who might be returning to workplace and want to avoid coating themselves in a disruptive aroma.&nbsp;<br><br>All of the products used at Massage Envy clinics can be purchased at individual Massage Envy clinics.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>September 5, 2009/ (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com)/">http://www.myprgenie.com)/</a> -- "A recent study found that fibromyalgia patients who received massages regularly reported less pain and better sleep," said CG Funk, vice president of industry relations and product development for Massage Envy Limited, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S. <br><br>At Massage Envy clinics, professional therapists can discuss the level of pressure you're comfortable with and then customize your massage to relieve tight muscles and help reduce stiffness and fatigue.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy clinics' ongoing massage wellness program is convenient, with weeknight and weekend hours.&nbsp;<br><br>In addition to fibromyalgia, scientific research also proves that massage therapy increases immune function, decreases stress levels, and reduces recovery time in many medical conditions including:&nbsp;<br><ul><li>Allergies&nbsp;</li><li>Depression and Anxiety&nbsp;</li><li>Arthritis&nbsp;</li><li>Carpal Tunnel Syndrome&nbsp;</li><li>Asthma and Bronchitis&nbsp;</li><li>Circulatory Problems&nbsp;</li><li>Insomnia&nbsp;</li><li>Sports Injuries&nbsp;</li><li>Temporomandibular Joint Dysfunction (TMJ)&nbsp;</li><li>Chronic Fatigue Syndrome&nbsp;</li><li>Musculo-Skeletal Disorders&nbsp;</li></ul>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>September 10th, 2009/ (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com)/">http://www.myprgenie.com)/</a> -- Doctors have linked chronic stress to a number of serious health problems, including heart disease, high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes, osteoporosis, inflammatory arthritis and certain cancers. Stress can contribute to headaches, digestive problems, back pain, and difficulty sleeping. <br><br>"One of the most important benefits of massage therapy is the stress relief," says C.G. Funk, vice president of industry relations and product development for Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S. "Massage activates the nervous system and sends the body into rest and recovery mode."<br><br>Reducing stress through massage therapy will have long-lasting health benefits, but what many don't realize is that massage therapy will also relieve respiratory issues, aid in post-surgery rehabilitation, and aid in prenatal care. Relieving stress has a domino-effect in regards to other health benefits that people tend to overlook when considering a massage session.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p><i>SourceOne Partners comments on HR outsourcing trend, but warns that satisfaction depends on choosing the right PEO for the business</i></p><p><i>Fort Lauderdale, FL </i>- Business owners and managers throughout the United States are grappling with an increasingly complex regulatory environment with respect to their employees. Concurrently, human resources (HR) departments are coping with more regulations, baby boomers retiring, a new generation of young adults with new expectations, and intense competition when it comes to recruiting top talent. HR must grapple with legal issues, collective bargaining, and federal regulations like the <a href="http://sourceonepartners.com/obamacare-health-care-reform/affordable-care-act-employers-update/" target="_blank">Affordable Care Act (ACA)</a>, while helping the company make the most of its human capital. Partly because of all these HR demands, <a href="http://www.forbes.com/sites/meghanbiro/2013/12/01/top-5-reasons-hr-is-on-the-move/" target="_blank">approximately half</a>&nbsp;of today's businesses outsource some or all of their HR functions.<i><br></i></p><p>The phenomenon of more companies <a href="http://sourceonepartners.comhttp://sourceonepartners.com/peo-services/outsourcing-human-resources-to-a-peo/?utm_source=PRWeb&amp;utm_medium=Press Release&amp;utm_campaign=Outsourcing HR PRpeo-services/outsourcing-human-resources-to-a-peo/" target="_blank">outsourcing more HR functions</a> indicates that businesses understand the intricacy of navigating today's regulatory environment and the risks of mistakes. Outsourcing helps cut costs of back office operations, reduces risks like payroll tax errors leading to problems with the IRS, allows companies to offer better benefit packages, and helps ensure companies remain in compliance with regulations that change frequently. Professional Employer Organizations (PEOs) handle HR functions from payroll to recruiting to workers' compensation for companies of all sizes. But not every PEO is right for every company.<br></p><p><a href="http://sourceonepartners.com/peo-services/selecting-a-peo/?utm_source=PRWeb&amp;utm_medium=Press Release&amp;utm_campaign=Outsourcing HR PR" target="_blank">Selecting the best PEO partner</a> requires that businesses first identify and define their most critical needs. Smaller companies, for example, may outsource all HR functions rather than cope with the overhead of hiring internal staff. Larger companies with in-house HR departments may choose to only outsource selected HR functions. "PEOs are not one-size-fits-all, says Jeff Hecht, President of SourceOne Partners. The perfect PEO for a large corporation may not be right for a small start-up. It's critical that companies evaluate their options and know exactly what they're paying for before signing on with a PEO."<br><br></p><p>With a PEO taking care of <a href="http://sourceonepartners.com/peo-services/hr-solutions/?utm_source=PRWeb&amp;utm_medium=Press Release&amp;utm_campaign=Outsourcing HR PR" target="_blank" title="Link: http://sourceonepartners.com/peo-services/hr-solutions/?utm_source=PRWeb&amp;utm_medium=Press Release&amp;utm_campaign=Outsourcing HR PR">HR functions</a> and ensuring regulatory, tax, and other requirements are met, companies are able to devote more time to critical business functions. Moreover, says Hecht, "With a PEO partner, businesses can often create better benefits packages for employees, making it easier to hire top talent." Other benefits of outsourcing HR functions to a PEO include:<br> <br>  Cost savings - due to economies of scale from PEOs that provide HR services exclusively <br>  Lower risk - because of regulations that change frequently and the effort required to stay abreast of all applicable changes, which is a core function of a PEO<br>  Easier recruiting - for the company that does not have the time or resources to devote to finding, attracting, and hiring top talent<br>  Access to better technology - for recruiting, providing training, and ensuring that payroll and other functions are carried out with maximum accuracy and efficiency<br><br></p><p>About SourceOne Partners</p><p>SourceOne Partners represents PEO brokers and offers customized solutions that fit each individual company's needs. By presenting complete and accurate proposals to PEO brokers, they are able to help companies identify the best PEO partner for their specific requirements. Shopping both the PEO and traditional market and offering cost-benefit analyses, SourceOne Partners empowers clients to make the best, most informed decision about outsourcing HR functions and choose the right PEO for the job.<br> <br> SourceOne Partners is a leading provider of PEO and <a href="http://sourceonepartners.com/payroll-services/?utm_source=PRWeb&amp;utm_medium=Press Release&amp;utm_campaign=Outsourcing HR PR" target="_blank">payroll services</a> in South Florida, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania. The services SourceOne Partners provides help companies reduce HR costs, minimize employer risk and liability, and relieve the administrative burdens of HR and payroll.<br> <br> <b>SourceOne Partners</b><br> <b><i><br></i></b></p><p><b><i>Florida Location</i></b><br> <i>2255 Glades Road</i><br> <i>Suite 324</i><br> <i>Boca Raton, FL 33431</i><br> <i>T: 561.674.0748</i><br> <i>F: 561.381.9143</i><br> <br> <b><i>New Jersey Location</i></b><br> <i>990 Cedarbridge Ave #7</i><br> <i>Brick, NJ 08723?</i><br> <i>T: 561-381-9306</i><br> <i><u>info(at)sourconepartners(dot)com</u></i><br> <a href="http://sourceonepartners.com/" target="_blank">http://www.sourceonepartners.com/</a><br> <img width="3" alt="Description httpsmediashowercomcontentActiontpcid17506" src="file://localhost/Users/jherman/Library/Caches/TemporaryItems/msoclip/0/clip_image002.png" height="3"></p><p> &nbsp;</p><p>                          </p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>September 16, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Therapists at Massage Envy have taken notice that clients are always asking about how often they should receive massages. <br><br>"The truth is," says C.G. Funk, vice president of industry relations and product development for Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S., "it depends on a number of things."<br><br>Massage therapy not only decreases pain and tension in muscles, it's also great for improving posture, promoting a healthy circulatory system, improving flexibility, relieving stress and strengthening the immune system.&nbsp;<br><br>The type of massage being received, the recommendations of the massage therapist, the physical condition of the client and time and finances, are all factors that determine the number of massages a person should have.&nbsp;<br><br>"For a general recommendation of massage frequency," says Massage Envy's Funk, "I would suggest receiving a massage at least twice a month in order to maintain the effects and results from each session." While Funk gives a general recommendation of two massage sessions per month, receiving massage once a month will still produce great results when scheduled on a regular basis.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p>September 18, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Thanks to the people at Massage Envy, another benefit can be added to the list of many that already exist for massage therapy. Massage Envy is teaming up with the Burlington Northern Railroad to sponsor a United Way fundraising campaign. <br><br>Employees of the Burlington National Railroad will be offered 10 minute chair massage sessions from Massage Envy at the price of $1.00 per minute. Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S., will send 100 percent of all money raised to benefit the United Way.&nbsp;<br><br>"We know that massage therapy has its health benefits," says Larry Stout, Flower Mound Massage Envy owner. "But, at Massage Envy we love to take things a bit further and help out as much as we can. The United Way is an outstanding organization and we're more than happy to help them reach their goals."<br><br>This event will take place over the course of two days. The first event will take place September 18th, and the second event is scheduled for September 24th. The events will last from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. each day. The chair massage sessions will be conducted one at a time in private conference rooms by licensed, professional massage therapists from Massage Envy.&nbsp;<br><br>Burlington Northern Railroad is sponsoring the United Way campaign this month and asked that Massage Envy play a role in supporting the charity. Massage Envy will also become a wellness partner with Burlington Northern Railroad and their more than 3,000 employees.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p>September 28, 2009/ (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --Back pain can be debilitating, but it can be effectively treated through proper massage techniques and the right plan of attack. Massage therapy reduces the need for painkillers by 36 percent according to a study from the Annals of Internal Medicine. <br><br>Massage therapy alleviates back pain by increasing blood flow, relaxing muscles, releasing endorphins, and restoring flexibility to tense muscles.&nbsp;<br><br>"Massage therapy may make the back quit aching right away, but don't expect one session to cure all the pain," says C.G. Funk, vice president of industry relations and product development for Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S. "Your back pain didn't start overnight, so don't expect an overnight cure. However, a solid massage therapy wellness plan can help tremendously."&nbsp;<br><br>Achieving long-term back pain relief depends on a varying number of factors; lifestyle, posture, and the severity of the pain. Sufferers of chronic back pain should develop a plan that includes a massage therapy session every three, to four weeks.&nbsp;<br><br>"It's important to listen to your therapist," says Massage Envy's Funk. "A good therapist will give you homework that you need to stay on top of to get rid of the back pain."<br><br>At Massage Envy clinics, this âhomeworkâ might consist of correcting posture, adjusting living and working spaces, and changing work habits. Exercise should also play a role with massage therapy to achieve maximum relief. Just be sure to consult a physician before embarking on a new exercise program.&nbsp;<br><br>According to a study that appeared in the Feb. 13 issue of The Journal of the American Medical Association, total estimated medical costs associated with back and neck pain increased by 65 percent between 1997 and 2005, to about $86 billion a year.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage therapy is an effective and conservative approach when compared to the other options â plus, it feels good.&nbsp;<br><br>Not every Massage Therapist is a back pain expert. When seeking out back pain relief itâs important that the therapist be notified of the condition. <p>October 6, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- For years, Dave Wilensky has known about the health benefits of therapeutic massage, but what he didn't know was that his weekly Massage Envy appointments would play a role in saving his life.&nbsp;</p>Dave Wilensky frequently schedules appointments with Massage Envy. Kari Robles, massage therapist for Massage Envy has been treating Mr. Wilensky for quite some time.&nbsp;<br><br>After treating Mr. Wilensky week after week at Massage Envy, Ms. Robles noticed the appearance of a suspicious-looking mole on his back and recommended that Mr. Wilensky consult a dermatologist. After a few weeks of diligent urging by Ms. Robles about the seriousness of the issue, Mr. Wilensky left the Massage Envy clinic and made an appointment with a dermatologist.&nbsp;<br><br>Mr. Wilensky was diagnosed with Stage 1 Melanoma. Surgery was performed to remove the tissue and Mr. Wilensky received a clean bill of health.&nbsp;<br><br>The professionalism, knowledge, and care of Ms. Robles, along with her persistence at the Massage Envy clinic, resulted in a potentially life-saving procedure for Dave Wilensky.&nbsp;<br><br>Skin cancer ranks as the most common form of cancer in the United States. It's vital to know the warning signs. For years, dermatologists have used an alphabet list to remind us what to watch for:&nbsp;<br><br>A = Asymmetry. One half doesn't match the other.&nbsp;<br>B = Border. Ragged or ill-defined edges.&nbsp;<br>C = Color. Irregular pigmentation.&nbsp;<br>D = Diameter. Melanomas are usually about the size of a pencil eraser or larger.&nbsp;<br>E = Evolving. The mole changes, including texture or sensation.&nbsp;<br><br>Dermatologists also encourage watching for moles that look or feel different from neighboring moles - darker/lighter, larger/smaller or located in an otherwise clear area.&nbsp;<br><br>âThis was a good story for Mr. Wilensky,â says C.G. Funk, vice president of industry relations and product development for Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S. âWe urge our therapists at Massage Envy to inform clients about anything out of the ordinary, but clients shouldnât depend on massage sessions for a diagnosis of other conditions. Weâre glad Mr. Wilensky took Ms. Robles advice.â&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>October 9, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- While most people realize that massage therapy has many health benefits, many do not realize massage therapy can be a beneficial complementary aspect of a woman's prenatal care regimen. Therapists at Massage Envy locations in DFW have noticed an increase in the number of pregnant women setting appointments for massage therapy sessions. <br><br>As the numbers increase, it has become clear that pregnant women are recognizing massage therapy can reduce stress while promoting general well-being. Pregnancy can be physically grueling and proper massage therapy can relieve many of the natural discomforts that come with carrying a child.&nbsp;<br><br>Therapists at Massage Envy have noted that prenatal patients have found relief from back aches, stiff neck, leg cramps, headaches, and swelling from massage therapy sessions.&nbsp;<br><br>"We get a lot of calls and emails from pregnant women asking about how safe massage therapy is during pregnancy," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy. "The truth is, not only is massage therapy safe, but it can be extremely beneficial. It helps to alleviate a lot of the physical stress of pregnancy."&nbsp;<br><br>In addition to the benefits already mentioned, prenatal massage therapy sessions, like the sessions conducted at Massage Envy clinics, can reduce the stress on weight-bearing joints, increase lymph and blood circulation, help to relax nervous tension, and relieve depression and anxiety caused by changes in hormone levels. Alleviating any or all of these symptoms can result in better sleep patterns and an increase in energy.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy's licensed therapists place all prenatal patients in side-lying positions. A side-lying position eliminates extra strain to the lower back and pelvic area that would be incurred during a massage session in the typical position when pressure is applied. The position of the patient is very important because any extra strain can cause back pain and discomfort. However, for prenatal massage therapy during the first trimester patients may lay on their backs with a slight elevation beneath one hip.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members may also enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.&nbsp;<br><br>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com">www.massageenvy.com</a> to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. There are 26 Massage Envy locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 590 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.&nbsp;<br><br>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a> and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.&nbsp;<br><br>###&nbsp;<br>Massage Envy Limited, LLC is a national franchise of massage therapy clinics dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage services to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations. Founded in 2002, Massage Envy is open in 40 states, has awarded 810 clinics nationwide and has 26 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. <p>Offering Free Massages to Frisco ISD Teachers<br></p><p>October 1, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy clinics at Stonebriar and Craig Ranch have donated 2,700 half-hour massages  a total of 1,350 hours of free massage therapy to the Frisco Independent School District (Texas). <br><br>"The Stonebriar and Craig Ranch Massage Envy clinics have donated a free half-hour session to every single teacher in the Frisco ISD," said Brendan McBratney, owner of both clinics. "This is our way of saying thank you to the teachers for their commitment and accomplishments."&nbsp;<br><br>Also, in special recognition of Frisco ISD teachers, the clinics are offering the District's teachers a discounted monthly group rate.&nbsp;<br><br>"There are a bundle of full-body benefits from massage that we wanted teachers to experience through our free massage program," Mr. McBratney said.&nbsp;<br><br>The Stonebriar clinic is located at 3685 Preston Rd., Suite 159, Frisco, 75034, phone (972) 370-ENVY (3689). The Craig Ranch clinic is located at 8950 State Highway 121, Suite 340, McKinney, TX 75070, phone (972) 370-ENVY (3689).&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy is the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S. Massage Envy therapists are trained in techniques such as trigger point, deep tissue, reflexology and cranial sacral therapy.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage with time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. NASHVILLE, Tenn.  The all-new 2015 Nissan Murano, which was introduced to near universal acclaim in December 2014, has added another prestigious award to its trophy case  a "Best Crossover" in the Parents magazine and Edmunds.com annual listing of the "10 Best Family Cars."<br><br>As in previous years, the top vehicles for 2015 were selected by the Parents and Edmunds.com editors based on safety, convenience and high-tech performance features at all price levels. In choosing the Murano, they stated:<br><br>"The all-new Murano pulls off a neat trick, mimicking the creamy ride and luxe features of models costing $10,000 more. It provides stretch-your-legs space for five, easy car-seat access, and storage for a weekend getaway (portacrib and stroller included). The fatigue-fighting 'Zero Gravity' front seats are a blessing for long drives. The monitor beams 360-degree camera views, detecting and alerting you to moving objects in the parking lot, from bicycles to shopping carts to little kids."<br><br> Parents, June 2015 issue<br><br>Murano was also recently awarded an IIHS "Top Safety Pick Plus" ranking as one of the latest Nissan vehicles to offer the innovative Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB) systems specifically designed to alert drivers of potential risks ahead  along with available Driver's Attention Alert* (DAA) system. The DAA system analyzes driver steering behavior to provide an alert if signs of drowsiness or inattention are detected.<br><br>Sales of the all-new 2015 Murano increased 58.3 percent in May and 33.4 percent through May 2015 (compared to the same periods in calendar year 2014).<br><br>"The 2015 Murano has found a sweet spot in the competitive crossover SUV segment, offering standout styling, a highly versatile premium interior, advanced safety and driver aid technologies and, of course, Nissan's legendary driving excitement," said Fred Diaz, senior vice president, Sales &amp; Marketing, Parts &amp; Service, U.S.A, Nissan North America, Inc. "Now, on top of record sales in May, we're honored to add the highly sought-after Parents / Edmunds.com 'Best Family Car' acknowledgment to a great first year of the new Murano design."<br><br>As the halo vehicle for Nissan's expanding range of bold crossovers, the all-new Murano carries forward the new Nissan design direction with its V-Motion front end, boomerang lights, floating roof treatment and efficient aerodynamics. Inside, the new Murano offers an engaging "social lounge" feel through features such as the refined lower-height instrument panel, wide center console, advanced Zero Gravity seating, and the airy atmosphere created by the large windows and oversized Power Panoramic Moonroof.<br><br>Murano's long list of available features include NissanConnectSM with Navigation and Mobile Apps, 8-inch color display with multi-touch control, 8-way power driver's seat with power lumbar support, SiriusXM® Satellite Radio and Travel Link® (SiriusXM subscription required, sold separately), Nissan Intelligent Key® with Push Button Ignition, Remote Engine Start system, iPod® and other compatible devices interface, 11-speaker Bose® (including dual subwoofers) premium audio system and Bluetooth® Hands-free Phone System.<br><br>Responsive driving is provided by a standard 3.5-liter DOHC V6 connected to an advanced Xtronic transmission. Murano is available in front-wheel drive or Intuitive All-Wheel Drive. Fuel economy is rated at 28 mpg highway for both front-wheel and all-wheel drive models.<br><br>Available technologies include Around View® Monitor (AVM) with Moving Object Detection (MOD), Blind Spot Warning (BSW), Intelligent Cruise Control (ICC), Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB). The Rear Cross Traffic Alert (RCTA) system utilizes radar to detect a moving vehicle behind the Murano approaching from either side of a parking space.<br><br>The 2015 Murano is offered in four trim levels  S, SV, SL and Platinum  and in a choice of front-wheel or all-wheel drive. The starting MSRP** for the Murano S FWD is $29,560 USD, while the top-of-the-line Murano Platinum AWD is priced at $40,600 USD (full pricing is available at NissanNews.com). The new Murano is assembled in Canton, Mississippi.<br><br>For photography and additional information about the 2015 Nissan Murano along with the complete lineup of Nissan vehicles, please visit <a href="http://www.NissanNews.com">www.NissanNews.com</a>.<br><br>The complete 2015 Parents and Edmunds.com "10 Best Family Cars" list will be published in the July 2015 issue of Parents magazine and is available online at Parents.com/best-family-cars.<br><br>About Nissan North America <br><br>In North America, Nissan's operations include automotive styling, engineering, consumer and corporate financing, sales and marketing, distribution and manufacturing. Nissan is dedicated to improving the environment under the Nissan Green Program and has been recognized annually by the U.S Environmental Protection Agency as an ENERGY STAR® Partner of the Year since 2010. More information on Nissan in North America and the complete line of Nissan and Infiniti vehicles can be found online at <a href="http://www.NissanUSA.com">www.NissanUSA.com</a> and <a href="http://www.InfinitiUSA.com">www.InfinitiUSA.com</a>, or visit the U.S. media sites NissanNews.com and InfinitiNews.com.<br><br>About Nissan Motor Co.<br><br>Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., Japan's second-largest automotive company, is headquartered in Yokohama, Japan, and is part of the Renault-Nissan Alliance. Operating with more than 247,500 employees globally, Nissan sold 5.32 million vehicles and generated revenue of 11.38 trillion yen (USD 103.6 billion) in fiscal year 2014. Nissan delivers a comprehensive range of more than 60 models under the Nissan, Infiniti and Datsun brands. Nissan leads the world in zero-emission mobility, dominated by sales of the LEAF, the first mass-market, pure-electric vehicle. It is the best-selling EV in history with almost 50% share of the zero-emission vehicle segment.<br><br>For more information on our products, services and commitment to sustainable mobility, visit our website at <a href="http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/">http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/</a>.<br><br>About Parents<br><br>Parents was founded in 1926 and, along with American Baby, FamilyFun, and Ser Padres, makes up the Meredith Parents Network portfolio of parenthood brands. Parents is the leading voice for a community of more than 15 million moms who are engaged and inspired by the brand's trusted content. In turn, these moms enlighten and inspire others by joining ongoing conversations about parenthood via Parents.com as well through Parents' robust presence on Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, Instagram and Tumblr. Parents is dedicated to engaging and inspiring moms with the information they need, wherever they go.<br><br>About Edmunds.com<br><br>Edmunds.com is a car-shopping Web site driven to make car buying easy. Almost 18 million visitors use our shopping tools every month to connect with over 9,500 dealer franchises across the U.S. Shoppers can browse our inventory listings for available cars and trucks, and with Edmunds.com's Price Promise?, they can get an instant, upfront price on those same vehicles. Recently named by Maritz Research as one of the most trusted online consumer review sites - and the only automotive site listed in the top ten - Edmunds.com is also home to comprehensive car reviews, shopping tips, photos, videos and feature stories. Even when you're at the dealership, we're always by your side. Just call our free Live Advice Line at 1-855-782-4711 or use our acclaimed Edmunds.com iPhone and iPad apps or Edmunds.com Android App. We're based in Santa Monica, Calif., but you can connect with us from anywhere by following @Edmunds on Twitter or by becoming a fan of Edmunds.com on Facebook.<br><br>*It is the driver's responsibility to remain alert at all times. <h2>Enhanced Security, Composer integration and Front End Editing Joomla 3.4.3 Out-of-the-Box Experience More Efficient for Developers and Users</h2><p>NEW YORK, NY -- (7/9/2015) one of the world's most popular open source content management systems (CMS) used for everything from websites to blogs to custom apps to Intranets, announced the availability of Joomla 3.4.3 of its content management system on July 2, 2015. This is a maintenance release that has come quickly on the heels of version 3.4.2 which was released June 30, 2015. The 3.4.3 release fixes some issues with the 3.4.2 version that may affect some installed systems depending upon the features used.<br></p><p>"Open Source is growing at a rapid pace, -- &nbsp;a broader audience means it's more important than ever that maintenance releases be as simple, secure, stable and straightforward as possible," said Robert Deutz, Production Leadership Team member -- Production Leadership Team (PLT): responsible for coordinating the production of the Joomla CMS and Framework, including code, documentation, localization and releases.<br></p><p>Details of release include:<br></p><ul><li><p>Case sensitive renaming of an important file.</p></li><li><p>System warnings from Smart Search feature</p></li><li><p>Issue affecting extensions on multilingual sites</p></li><li><p>Issue affecting default access level on new item creation</p></li><li><p>Display issue of a drop down menu when using batch feature</p></li></ul><p>Nine issues were rapidly fixed through the dedication of seven members of the Joomla.org Production Leadership Team.<br></p><p><b>The next major version of Joomla, version 3.5 is expected to be released in September 2015</b>. Roland Dalmulder with help from George Wilson will lead the version 3.5 release. Roland is leader of the Joomla Bug Squad, and both are members of the Production Leadership Team (PLT).<br></p><p>To demo Joomla 3.4 go to <a href="http://ctt.marketwire.com/?release=1110929&amp;id=4158925&amp;type=1&amp;url=http%3a%2f%2fdemo.joomla.org%2f">demo.joomla.org</a>, to download it go to <a href="http://ctt.marketwire.com/?release=1110929&amp;id=4158928&amp;type=1&amp;url=http%3a%2f%2fwww.joomla.org%2fdownload">joomla.org/download</a>.</p><h2>About Joomla! </h2><p>Joomla is one of the world's most popular software packages used to build, organize, manage and publish content for websites, blogs, Intranets and mobile applications. With more than 3 percent of the Web running on Joomla and a CMS market share of more than 9 percent, the free open source software powers the web presence of hundreds of thousands of small businesses, governments, non-profits and large organizations worldwide like Citibank, eBay, General Electric, Harvard University, Ikea, McDonald's and Sony. The award-winning CMS is led by an international community of more than a half million active contributors, helping the most inexperienced user to seasoned web developer make their digital visions a reality. Joomla's power and extensibility has resulted in its software being downloaded more than 60 million times.</p><h2>CONTACT INFORMATION</h2><p>Editorial Contact:<br>Mark Simko<br>PR for Joomla<br>Email Contact: Mark.Simko@community.joomla.org</p>

<p>October 20, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- When most people think of massage therapy the image they conjure up is typically of the Swedish massage technique. This technique is centuries old and originated in Stockholm, Sweden. According to massage therapists at Massage Envy, most people also mistakenly consider Swedish massage therapy identical to deep tissue massage. <br><br>"We offer many different types of massages including Swedish and deep tissue massage at Massage Envy," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy. "Most people don't realize that there's a difference between Swedish and deep tissue massages. In fact, most people are surprised when our therapists introduce them to all the styles of massage therapy that exist just to address specific symptoms."&nbsp;<br><br>Swedish massage therapy at Massage Envy clinics involves the rubbing of muscles in long, gliding strokes in the direction of the blood returning to the heart. Circular pressure is applied by the hands and palms, along with firm kneading, percussion-like tapping, bending, and stretching&nbsp;<br><br>Deep tissue massage therapy sessions at Massage Envy are similar to Swedish massage sessions, except that the techniques are applied to deeper layers of the muscles. To access these deeper layers, the therapist will oftentimes use other tools besides their hands like forearms or elbows.&nbsp;<br><br>"Massage therapy has been shown to help with many conditions and disorders," says Funk, of Massage Envy. "Deep tissue massage focuses on the deepest layers of muscle tissue hence the name. Clients requesting deep tissue should be aware that the techniques can leave the muscles sore for a few days while they heal and release."&nbsp;<br><br>One of the great benefits of many the many styles of therapeutic massage is that it can increase the level of oxygen in the blood, expel toxins by encouraging circulation, increase flexibility and decrease tension and stress.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>October 26, 2009/ (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --Massage therapy is becoming a very important aspect in the healthcare regimen of millions of chronic pain sufferers. While pain and discomfort may be alleviated with one massage session, regular, recurring sessions will have the greatest benefit. <br><br>Some experts even estimate that up to 90 percent of disease is stress related. Eliminating anxiety and stress completely is not a realistic goal, but regular massage therapy can decrease their effects which is what the massage therapists at Massage Envy have set out to do.&nbsp;<br><br>Regular massage sessions from licensed therapists at Massage Envy have been known to generate profound effects among clients suffering from a variety of chronic conditions â both young and old.&nbsp;<br><br>Some examples are:</p><p><p><ul><li>Arthritis sufferers note fewer aches and less stiffness and pain&nbsp;</li><li>Asthmatic children show better pulmonary function and increased peak airflow&nbsp;</li><li>Burn injury patients report reduced pain, itching, and anxiety&nbsp;</li><li>High blood pressure patients demonstrate lower diastolic blood pressure, anxiety, and stress hormones&nbsp;</li><li>Premenstrual Syndrome sufferers have decreased water retention and cramping&nbsp;</li></ul></p><p>As the medical community actively embraces massage therapy, it is becoming an integral aspect of neonatal care as well as hospice programs. Researchers are continually discovering benefits not just related to chronic diseases. Massage therapy and touch have shown to reduce symptoms from neurological disorders and injuries.&nbsp;</p>"The beauty of massage," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy, "is that while a massage session feels great, there are also many therapeutic benefits. To a point, the more often you schedule massage sessions, the better you will feel."&nbsp;<br><br>Consider scheduling regular appointments with a massage provider like Massage Envy when suffering from any chronic condition. <p>October 29, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- As health professionals continually learn more about the human body they are discovering that combining massage therapy with an exercise program will increase the benefits of any exercise. <br><br>Massage therapists at Massage Envy note that proper massage therapy will increase blood flow and create improved circulation throughout the body. Improved circulation causes an increase in oxygen being delivered to the muscles, which then results in increased endurance. The increase in oxygen also causes the muscles and body to expel toxins at a quicker rate and therefore reduces the time it takes the body to recover, also eliminating residual pain.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage therapists at the Massage Envy clinics in Dallas/Forth Worth have noticed a steady increase of athletes making appointments for massage therapy sessions. More and more athletes are including massage therapy as an integral aspect of their exercise regimens.&nbsp;<br><br>"It heightens the results of an athlete's exercise routine," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy. "Anything that gets your blood flowing throughout the body is going to really add to an exercise routine."&nbsp;<br><br>Massage therapy also greatly improves one's range of motion and overall muscle and joint strength, which prevents injuries to the muscles, joints, and tendons.&nbsp;<br><br>"You don't have to be a professional football player," says C.G. Funk of Massage Envy. "Massage therapy is going to enhance any level of exercise routine whether you're getting paid to play or you're just a casual walker."&nbsp;<br><br>Any time new movements are introduced to the body, whether from exercise or natural action, stress and strain are introduced to muscles and joints which can cause stiffness and soreness. The integration of massage therapy sessions into a regular schedule will enhance the benefits of any exercise routine. <p>November 3, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Trigger-point massage, uses cycles of isolated pressure and release to alleviate pain sources. During trigger-point massage therapy sessions at Massage Envy, the client plays an active role through deep-breathing. Clients also play a crucial role in the success of trigger-point massage therapy by identifying the exact location of discomfort. <br><br>The actual "trigger-point" is considered a tight area within muscle tissue that causes pain in other parts of the body. As an example, a "trigger-point" in the back may cause, or trigger, pain in the neck. The neck might then act as a satellite trigger-point, causing pain in the head. The pain could vary from a dull ache to a sharp, intense pain.&nbsp;<br><br>"Basically, a trigger-point pain is caused from muscle overuse, or even injury," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy.&nbsp;<br><br>Trigger-point massage therapy is just one of the many forms of massage therapy offered at Massage Envy that has its own specific function. It is important for anyone considering massage therapy as a solution to any pain, discomfort or illness, that they discuss their symptoms with their massage therapist in order to achieve the most relief possible.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p>November 17, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Here's a way to enjoy the health benefits of massage therapy before the end of the year: Tap the money in your Flexible Savings Account (FSA). <br><br>Flex accounts are used for healthcare expenses that aren't covered by insurance plans. They help cover the costs of anything from deductibles to eyewear. Many people are unaware that money from a FSA can be used for massage therapy.&nbsp;<br><br>"Our therapists at Massage Envy(R) are finding that more and more clients are using their flex accounts for massage therapy sessions," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S. "People with flex accounts in their health care plans are trying to use up any excess dollars that otherwise would not carry over into the next year."&nbsp;<br><br>As long as a physician recommends massage therapy with a written prescription, it can be considered a medical expense. An IRS ruling states that medical care expenses must be primarily to alleviate or prevent a physical or mental ailment. Examples of illnesses that qualify include carpal tunnel syndrome, stress, back pain, arthritis, diabetes, hypertension, fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue, anxiety, depression and chronic pain.&nbsp;<br><br>If you suffer from one of these conditions, tell your medical practitioner you have a Flex Spending Account (FSA) or Health Savings Account (HSA) and that you need a prescription for massage therapy to treat your condition.&nbsp;<br><br>Your physician must provide three pieces of information on the prescription:&nbsp;<br>--Medical necessity: why you need massage therapy (example: to relieve back pain)&nbsp;<br>--Frequency: number of sessions per month (example: minimum of two sessions monthly)&nbsp;<br>--Duration: length of treatment (example: 12 months)&nbsp;<br><br>Once you have obtained the prescription, file it away in case you are ever asked to back up the expense. It isnât necessary to bring the prescription to your Massage Envy.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>December 9, 2009/ (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- With the holidays just around the corner, DFW Massage Envy® clinics are getting into the spirit of the holidays through their promotion "Share the Joy". <br><br>Throughout the month of December, the DFW-based Massage Envy clinics will be accepting nominations for "Share the Joy". Nominees should be people who deserve a special treat this holiday season - a complimentary one-hour massage session. Nominations are accepted on Massage Envy's fan page at <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>.&nbsp;<br><br>"Any Massage Envy DFW fan on Facebook can nominate someone special who deserves a relaxing massage during the holidays," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "During the holiday season it's important to tell those around us that we think they are important and deserving."&nbsp;<br><br>To nominate someone special, go to <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>. Be sure your friend who you are nominating is also a fan, and post a message on the wall telling Massage Envy DFW why your nominee deserves a relaxing massage. If your entry is selected, Massage Envy DFW will notify you of how to receive the one-hour complimentary massage gift card.&nbsp;<br><br>If your nominee is not currently a Massage Envy DFW fan, just encourage them to become one before you nominate them for "Share the Joy". <p>Everyone's A Winner - Celebrating Local Walkers and Runners<br></p><p>December 10, 2009 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) <br><br>Who:&nbsp;<br>Massage Envy(R) - Dallas/Fort Worth (27 locations) only&nbsp;<br><br>What:&nbsp;<br>Massage Envy DFW is pleased to announce its "Everyone's A Winner" holiday promotion. DFW Massage Envy clinics are excited to give an extra pat on the back - and a rejuvenating post-exercise massage - to all runners and walkers who participate in any of the DFW races from November 26 - December 31, 2009. Runners and walkers will receive a free 30-minute upgrade on their massage when they present their race bib to any DFW Massage Envy clinic. This means that race participants can extend their one-hour or 90 minute massage sessions by an additional 30 minutes. Participants must book a minimum 60 minute session to receive 30 minute upgrade.&nbsp;<br><br>How:&nbsp;<br>Individuals need to mention they participated in a Dallas/Fort Worth area holiday race (between November 26 - December 31, 2009) when they call their DFW Massage Envy clinic to schedule a massage. Fans can post their own topics and questions to the site or browse postings by other fans to gain additional insight into the benefits of therapeutic massage and the services offered by Massage Envy.&nbsp;<br><br>To energize community conversations, Massage Envy DFW regularly posts informative articles on various health and lifestyle topics, including: managing workplace stress, overcoming insomnia, improving posture and alleviating depression. Massage Envy DFW even provides advice on using flexible spending account (FSA) dollars for massage therapy - an option that few recognize as an option.&nbsp;<br><br>Additionally, Massage Envy DFW offers discounts, deals and promotions exclusively to its Facebook fans. <p>Plus Special DFW Valentine's Day Offer<br></p><p>January 28, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy offers the perfect gift for individuals and couples this Valentine's Day. The gift of massage is a great alternative to traditional Valentine's Day gifts and one that can actually help individuals be more attentive to their significant others. <br><br>Massage therapy offers an escape from the pressures of modern life by providing a relaxing, rejuvenating experience that suits any schedule. Massage therapy has been proven to relieve stress levels and promote ongoing stress management to make individuals better equipped to handle daily issues - like the little things that can make us less available for our significant others. Additionally, massage therapy boosts immune system functions and can help relieve depression to enable a happy, healthy approach to daily life.&nbsp;<br><br>As the leading massage provider in the U.S., Massage Envy believes that everybody deserves access to customized massage therapy. That's why they offer affordable massage sessions with flexible appointment times seven days per week to fit even the busiest schedules. And, with 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth area, massage has never been more convenient.&nbsp;<br><br>"A Massage Envy gift card is the perfect way to say "I love you" to those most special to you - including yourself," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth regional developer for Massage Envy. "And with the proven, ongoing benefits of massage, it is the Valentine's gift that's actually good for your relationship."&nbsp;<br><br>The Dallas/Fort Worth area Massage Envy clinics are offering a special Valentine's day offer- buy a gift card valued at $60 or more and get a free box of Godiva Chocolate for your sweetheart. This offer is only valid at the 27 DFW area Massage Envy clinics and while supplies last. Two of the DFW Massage Envy clinics now offer Murad(R) healthy skin facials. Massage Envy gift cards may be used for any combination of products and services offered in any Massage Envy clinic nation-wide.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits throughout the month at reduced prices. Or, for only $10 more, individuals can enjoy a one-hour healthy skin facial utilizing Murad skincare products at participating locations. <p>February 9, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- National Sleep Awareness Week (R) (March 7-13, 2010), the 27 Massage Envy clinics in the DFW Metroplex remind those with sleep problems that regular massage therapy promotes sufficient sleep to allow the body to restore, relax and heal. <br><br>While many understand the benefits of adequate sleep, few realize the major health concerns associated with the lack of quality sleep. More and more studies are showing the relationship between the quantity and quality of sleep and health problems such as obesity, diabetes, hypertension and depression.&nbsp;<br><br>Ongoing massage therapy has been shown to promote high quality, restful sleep by managing two common causes for insomnia: stress and pain. Physically, massage relieves stress by easing muscle tightness and increasing circulation throughout the body. Massage also works on a biochemical level by lowering levels of the stress hormone cortisol and by promoting the release of endorphins. These benefits combine to induce a calm, relaxed state conducive to achieving quality, restorative sleep.&nbsp;<br><br>Additionally, daily stressor's often resurface during night-time hours and interrupt or prevent sleep. Customers receiving ongoing massage therapy from Massage Envy report a sense of mental clarity and an increased ability to turn-off these stressor's and achieve optimal rest and relaxation.&nbsp;<br><br>"Massage therapy benefits sleep on many levels," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy. "Not only does massage feel great physically, but it also helps to reset the mind and establish a state of mental relaxation."&nbsp;<br><br>As the leading massage provider in the U.S., Massage Envy believes that everybody deserves a good night's sleep. That's why they offer affordable massage therapy sessions with flexible appointment times seven days per week to fit even the busiest schedules. <p>February 16, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- In an effort to increase employee productivity, job satisfaction and retention, North Texas companies are looking for cost-effective ways to increase the benefits they offer existing and prospective personnel. Dallas/Fort Worth area Massage Envy locations have noticed that many of these companies are beginning to include massage therapy in their wellness programs. <br><br>According to a recent survey by The Conference Board, job satisfaction in the U.S. is at a 22-year low with almost a quarter of those surveyed indicating that they do not expect to be at their current position within a year. Additionally, with more companies slated to move to the Dallas/Fort Worth area and Texas jobs expected to increase by 100,000 in 2010, increasing employee satisfaction and retention is quickly becoming the focus of North Texas companies - particularly smaller companies that are not always financially able to offer the perks of larger firms.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy recommends therapeutic massage as a low-cost benefit that promotes wellbeing in the workplace. Studies show that therapeutic massage not only increases productivity, but promotes employee morale and job satisfaction by:&nbsp;<br><br>* Reducing and relieving stress - both personal and work-related - allowing employees to clearly focus on their professional responsibilities and take more pride in their work.&nbsp;<br><br>* Promoting relaxation to improve mental outlook, ongoing stress management and better handling of high-pressure situations.&nbsp;<br><br>* Providing a rejuvenating experience to foster aptitude for problem solving and enhance calm and creative thinking.&nbsp;<br><br>* Strengthening the immune system to more efficiently fight illnesses, resulting in healthier employees and decreased sick days.&nbsp;<br><br>"Companies are realizing what massage can do for their employees' productivity and overall satisfaction," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "When you add a low-cost benefit like massage therapy to your wellness program, it helps create good will among your employees. They're happy - even excited - to work for you."&nbsp;<br><br>Employees of Dallas/Fort Worth companies that offer therapeutic massage programs through Massage Envy report that it creates a much happier and healthier working environment. <p>February 24, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Two of the Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy clinics located in Frisco and Alliance Town Center now offer Spa services that include relaxing, healthy facials. Like massage, facials can help to combat the stressors of everyday life. These stressors can damage the appearance and health of the skin. Regular facials increase circulation, reverse visible signs of aging, improve skin tone and texture and help to eliminate blemishes and breakouts - particularly those attributable to stress. <br><br>Massage Envy Spa's new Murad Healthy Skin Facials feature specially formulated products from world-renowned Murad, Inc. Founded in 1989, the Murad skincare line is based on science-driven The Cellular Water Principle(R), which concludes that skin cells lose the ability to retain water as they age. Murad products are designed to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. This unmatched approach makes Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials the most effective way to achieve balanced, more youthful-looking skin.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy Spas offer a variety of skin care treatments that benefit every skin type, including:&nbsp;<br><br>* AHA Rapid Exfoliator Anti-Aging Facial - helps to reveal smoother, vibrant, younger-looking skin.&nbsp;<br><br>* Clarifying Enzyme Acne Facial - improves skin clarity, reduce blemishes and soothes inflammation.&nbsp;<br><br>* Environmental Shield Vitamin C Infusion Facial - reverses the signs of aging that result from everyday environmental factors such as sunlight, smog, pollution and stress.&nbsp;<br><br>* Sensitive Skin Facial - repairs and balances the skin with a gentle, yet effective treatment designed specifically to address skin that is easily irritated or sensitive.&nbsp;<br><br>"Massage Envy takes the same dedicated approach to skin care as it does to massage, so our customers know they are in the hands of professionals who understand their needs," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "And, we are happy to offer yet another service that helps our customers look and feel their best."&nbsp;<br><br>Clients of Massage Envy appreciate the ability to receive affordable massage therapy and facials at one convenient location. And, many report that taking the time to be pampered by Massage Envy professionals leaves them feeling revitalized and refreshed.&nbsp;<br><br>Facials are available at two of the Massage Envy DFW locations: Frisco North at 5105 Eldorado Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX, 75034 (972) 370-3689 and Alliance Town Center, 9630 North Freeway, Fort Worth, TX 76177, (817) 337-7300.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy Clinics Treat Chronic Pain<br></p><p>March 3, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Chronic pain affects over 86 million Americans right now. Yet, while it is the top reason cited for doctor visits, it is one of the least effectively treated symptoms in today's healthcare industry. According to Massage Envy, there is a good reason why pain is so hard to measure and treat. <br><br>"The problem is that pain is subjective," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy. "The perception of pain is not a scientifically measurable occurrence like fever, heart rate or blood pressure. Each person experiences pain individually, and even comparable pain is reported differently. For example, when selecting the severity of pain on a scale of 1-10 (10 being the most intense), one patient will rate a broken finger as pain level 10, and another will rate a broken leg as pain level seven."&nbsp;<br><br>Scientific research has proven the enormous benefits of massage therapy - from treating injuries, chronic diseases and neurological disorders to alleviating the tensions of modern lifestyles. Consequently, even the traditional medical community is actively embracing ongoing therapeutic massage as an effective treatment for pain.&nbsp;<br><br>Clients of Massage Envy report that regular massage therapy not only reduces their pain but also alleviates the stress associated with chronic pain, making it easier to manage. Many clients report that massage therapy even helped where painkillers could not.&nbsp;<br><br>"After over nine months of painkillers, MRIs, injections and even surgery - with no relief at all - a friend suggested I try massage," says Michelle Wehrwein, Massage Envy client and Frisco, Texas school teacher. "After the one session, I had next to no pain...for the first time since onset, and I finally feel like I am on the path to recovery. [My therapist at Massage Envy] did what 10 months and 10 specialized doctors could not do."&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>March 10, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- For the fourth straight year, Massage Envy was named in Entrepreneur Magazine's 2010 Franchise 500(R) list. Based on objective analysis of various aspects of U.S. franchise businesses - including financial strength, size, business stability and growth - Massage Envy ranked 23rd in the fastest-growing franchises category and 88th in the overall list of 500 companies. <br><br>Not surprisingly, the strength of the Massage Envy franchise is actually a direct result of the current economic downturn. With factors such as increased stress due to employment instability, rising healthcare costs and the general anxiety people feel over the ability to make ends meet, many people are making low-cost therapeutic massage an essential part of their wellness routines.&nbsp;<br><br>Scientific research shows that therapeutic massage relieves stress, boosts the immune system, promotes physical wellbeing and even improves mental outlook. These benefits further promote ongoing stress management, increased aptitude for problem solving and enhanced creative thinking - vital assets in today's economic and social climate. Additionally, more and more companies are including therapeutic massage in their wellness programs as a cost-effect method of increasing employee health, productivity and satisfaction.&nbsp;<br><br>This upswing in interest in therapeutic massage has particularly benefited the Dallas/Fort Worth area locations. In addition to adding two new Massage Envy locations to the Dallas/Fort Worth area, Bruce McGovern, owner of four DFW Massage Envy clinics was awarded Massage Envy Franchisee of the Year for 2009. And, Frank Stockton, owner of the Arlington Highlands Massage Envy location says he saw more first-time prospects than any other Massage Envy clinic in the U.S. last year.&nbsp;<br><br>"We are very excited about the growth of the Massage Envy franchise," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. <p>March 24, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- March 30 is recognized as I am in Control Day - a day for individuals to assess their lives and regain control. People traditionally mark the day by spring cleaning, organizing their office or starting a new exercise program. Massage Envy suggests massage therapy as an easy and affordable way to regain control through reducing stress. <br><br>I am in Control Day was born from the chaos surrounding the events of March 30, 1981 when President Ronald Reagan was wounded in an assassination attempt. Secretary of State Alexander Haig stepped up to the plate amidst the confusion, stating "I am in control here". The quote was taken out of context and many believed that Haig incorrectly interpreted the U.S. Constitution regarding the presidential line of succession. While uproar surrounding the quote eventually led to Haig's resignation, the quote is seen in a much different light today. People now interpret it as a call to action to get their lives under control despite seemingly uncontrollable circumstances.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage therapy helps provide a sense of control by reducing stress levels and promoting ongoing stress management to make individuals better equipped to handle life issues. Additionally, massage therapy promotes relaxation to improve mental outlook, ongoing stress management and better handling of high-pressure situations.&nbsp;<br><br>"Massage therapy offers a reset button for the mind and body that clears the clutter caused by stress," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth regional developer for Massage Envy. "After a massage therapy session, people find they are better equipped to handle any problem or task at hand."&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. <p>March 30, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- 27 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy clinics <br><br>What:&nbsp;<br>One walk team in the 2010 Tarrant County Komen Race for the Cure will be selected by DFW Massage Envy to receive a $1000 donation and co-branded team shirts for the entire team. <p>April 7, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Mother-daughter relationships are some of the most fascinating and complex interactions. For co-owners of the Texas Massage Envy clinic in the Lake Prairie Towne Crossing shopping center in Grand Prairie, mother Sharon Wright and daughter Wendy Wright, the relationship has taken on a whole new dynamic. <br><br>While working as a lawyer in Houston, daughter Wendy Wright had always dreamed of owning her own business. After visiting a local Massage Envy clinic, Wendy had such a positive experience that she began researching franchise opportunities with the company. She found that what appealed to her as a client also made ownership an inviting business prospect -- Massage Envy's dedication to providing affordable, licensed massage therapy to the masses.&nbsp;<br><br>Rather than embark on this new path alone, Wendy approached her mother Sharon and asked her to participate. As a school teacher approaching retirement, Sharon welcomed the idea of partnering with her daughter both to show support and to secure her own financial future.&nbsp;<br><br>Because Sharon is still employed full-time, Wendy primarily runs the business with input from her mother. Upon retirement, Sharon will take on a more prominent role. One of their first decisions was to make the business a true family affair by hiring Misty Clark, Wendy's older sister, as clinic administrator to manage the day-to-day business operations. This decision allows Wendy to handle the bigger picture issues of owning a business, including behind-the-scenes decisions and public promotion.&nbsp;<br><br>"Mom and I both are so proud to be women who are first-time business owners," says daughter Wendy. "It is so exciting to hear clients tell us how great their Massage Envy experience is and to know that we made it possible for them."&nbsp;<br><br>As with any business relationship, conflicts do arise. However, all three agree that family is the most important relationship they share and that it is essential to not let their business disagreements interfere with the quality of their bond outside of the clinic. When differences of opinion arise, they try to take a step back and handle the situation as if they were not related. Wendy believes this approach helps each to avoid over-personalizing the disagreement and enables them all to see the situation objectively.&nbsp;<br><br>"It also helps to spend some personal time together outside of work doing something you all enjoy and not discussing the business," says mother Sharon.&nbsp;<br><br>And speaking of Mother's Day, Massage Envy gift cards make wonderful Mother's Day gifts. Gift cards are available in all denominations. Including the Grand Prairie location, Massage Envy has 27 DFW area clinics.&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits throughout the month at reduced prices. Or, for only $10 more, individuals can enjoy a one-hour healthy skin facial utilizing Murad skincare products at participating locations. <p>April 16, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- With over 46 million Americans suffering from arthritis, it is one of the leading causes of disability and high health care costs in the U.S. Massage Envy clinics in the DFW Metroplex offer massage therapy programs that can help individuals cope with the chronic pain of arthritis. <br><br>Arthritis is categorized as a joint disease, mostly affecting the cartilage around the joint. Symptoms of arthritis include pain, swelling and loss of motion in the joint. Most sufferers report that arthritis limits normal activities and significantly decreases quality of life. Unfortunately, there is no cure for arthritis. Sufferers face high healthcare costs and often come to rely on drugs that have little effect on the pain or, worse, cause other health issues.&nbsp;<br><br>The good news is that massage therapy has been shown to be an effective method for combating arthritis symptoms. While many massage therapists have long cited the benefits their clients describe after receiving massage therapy, science is beginning to back these anecdotal reports with clinical evidence.&nbsp;<br><br>In 2006, researchers from Yale Prevention Research Center held a 16-week clinical trial involving 64 individuals with arthritis. The results showed that massage therapy improved flexibility, lessened pain and improved range of motion in the participants. Another study conducted by the Touch Research Institute at the University of Miami - School of Medicine showed that ongoing massage can lower anxiety, reduce pain, and improve grip strength for those with arthritis.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy offers affordable, drug-free relief from arthritis pain. Its Massage Wellness Program for arthritis sufferers is designed to improve joint movement, relax tense muscles, and stimulate the flow of blood and nutrients to the skin and underlying tissues. Additionally, the relaxation achieved through therapeutic massage helps break the cycle of pain and stress that often accompanies and complicates arthritis.&nbsp;<br><br>"Not only does each session feel great, but the therapeutic benefits are compounded when massage is utilized as a frequent therapy," says C.G. Funk, Licensed Massage Therapist and Vice President of Industry Relations and Product Development for Massage Envy. "The more you go, the healthier you feel."&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits throughout the month at reduced prices. Or, for only $10 more, individuals can enjoy a one-hour healthy skin facial utilizing Murad skincare products at participating locations. Massage Envy gift cards can be purchased at all Massage Envy locations and can be redeemed at any clinic in the U.S.&nbsp;<br><br>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com">www.massageenvy.com</a> to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. There are now 27 Massage Envy locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. <p>April 21, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy has selected Stewart Title Southlake Sole Sisters as the winner of its Susan G. Komen Tarrant County Race for the Cure Sponsorship Sweepstakes. The 15-member team will receive a $1000 donation, co-branded team shirts and a free chair massage on race day from licensed therapists in the Massage Envy tent. Additionally, Massage Envy will provide gift cards as prizes for the team members who raise the most money. <br><br>The Tarrant County Affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure is dedicated to combating breast cancer by raising money to fund grants to local hospitals and community organizations that provide breast health education and breast cancer screening and treatment programs for medically underserved women. The first Tarrant County Race for the Cure was held in 1993 and raised $100,000. Today, the race is the largest charitable 5K race in Tarrant County, and the 2009 Race for the Cure had more than 14,000 participants and raised more than $1.5 million.&nbsp;<br><br>The Massage Envy Sponsorship Sweepstakes was created to benefit the 2010 Tarrant County Komen Race for the Cure on April 24 at Sundance Square in downtown Fort Worth. The contest took place from March 16 to April 2 and individuals throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth area nominated teams by posting a 300-word essay on Massage Envy DFW's Facebook page.&nbsp;<br><br>The winning entry was submitted by Jenae Hibbard, a member of the Stewart Title Southlake Sole Sisters from Southlake, Texas. After joining together for team-building exercises for other charity events, the co-ed team members were surprised to learn that many of them have been directly affected by breast cancer -- whether through helping family members and friends battle the disease or even by personally surviving breast cancer. Discovering this information led them to band together again to support a cause that has touched so many lives.&nbsp;<br><br>"Not one more baby should have to give up their mother to this disease and not one more man should lose the love of his life," says Jenae Hibbard. "No one deserves this, so on April 24 we will join together to find away to stop breast cancer from affecting anyone ever again. We will walk for a mother, a wife, an acquaintance, a stranger -- for anyone who has been devastated by this disease."&nbsp;<br><br>To read Jenae's winning essay, visit the Massage Envy DFW Facebook page at <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>.&nbsp;<br><br>Massage Envy supports Susan G. Komen for the Cure on many of their events, including a unique annual event called Massage for the Cure. Held each year in the fall, Massage for the Cure is a one-day event that raises money for the organization by offering discounted massages and donating a portion of each massage to Susan G. Komen for the Cure. Many Massage Envy clinics and therapists have donated 100% of all revenue and fees for the day to support the charity.&nbsp;<br><br>"Breast cancer affects the lives of many people in our community," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "We are proud to support the Tarrant County Race for the Cure and help raise awareness and funds that provide programs and research to help us see the end of this disease."&nbsp;<br><br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits throughout the month at reduced prices. Or, for only $10 more, individuals can enjoy a one-hour healthy skin facial utilizing Murad skincare products at participating locations. <p>Mother's Day is Massage Day at Massage Envy<br></p><p>April 30, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy --Dallas/Fort Worth (27 locations) only <br><br>What:&nbsp;<br><br>Dallas/Fort Worth area Massage Envy clinics are offering a special Mother's Day promotion. The offer is valid only at the 27 DFW area Massage Envy clinics.&nbsp;<br><br>Aromatherapy at Massage Envy uses massage with aromatic plant extracts and essential oils to address a number of different health concerns, including pain and stiffness, stress and anxiety and depression.&nbsp;<br><br>Aromatherapy at Massage Envy uses massage with aromatic plant extracts and essential oils to improve a person's mood and relieve stress and anxiety.&nbsp;<br><br>A Massage Envy gift card is the gift that keeps on giving. <p>In Komen Race for the Cure North Texas on June 12<br></p><p>Dallas, Texas -- May 25, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Dallas/Fort Worth&nbsp;will select a walk team to receive a $1000 donation as well as other prizes in the&nbsp;Komen Race for the Cure&nbsp;North Texas, scheduled for June 12 in Plano.</p><p>To nominate your walk team, submit a 300-word essay on why&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;should sponsor your team at<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>. Look for the&nbsp;Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure&nbsp;tab.<br></p><p>Entries may be submitted beginning Saturday, May 22 through Sunday, June 6. The winning team will be announced Monday, June 7 on<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy DFW</a>.<br></p><p>"As a long-time supporter of the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;wants a record number of teams and Facebook entries, to highlight the Colin County race," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, the nation's leading provider of massage therapy. "Every team and dollar brings a cure closer."<br></p><p>In addition to a $1000 donation,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;will also supply co-branded shirts to the team it sponsors. The three team members who raise the most money will receive a&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;gift card for a free massage.<br></p><p>On race day, a special area at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>'s tent will be reserved for team members to receive a free chair massage from&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;therapists.<br></p><p>The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.komennorthtexas.org/affiliate_raceInfo.html" target="_blank">Komen Collin County Race</a>&nbsp;for the Cure on Saturday, June 12 will be held at the Plano campuses of HP and the Campus at Legacy (Legacy at Parkwood Drive, east of the North DallasTollway).
