<p>Local Business Night at Pizza Hut Park, June 5<br></p><p>Dallas, Texas -- May 26, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;in Frisco (5105 Eldorado Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034) will offer free chair massages by its licensed therapists at the FC Dallas game on June 5. The service is part of FC Dallas Local Business Night during the professional soccer match between FC Dallas and the San Jose Earthquakes.</p><p>WHERE: &nbsp;Pizza Hut Park, Frisco, TX</p><p>WHEN: &nbsp;7:30 p.m., Saturday, June 5</p><p>HIGHLIGHTS:<br></p><p>Attendees can score free chair massages from&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massagedfw.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;at the FC Dallas Local Business Night on June 5. Three&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;therapists from the Stonebriar location will be available for chair massages before, during, and after the FC Dallas-San Joe Earthquakes soccer match. There will also be a drawing for a free one-hour massage session.&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/types-of-facials.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;associates will be available to answer questions.<br></p><p>An estimated 100 Dallas-area businesses are expected to feature their products and services at Pizza Hut Park's Vendor Village along the park's concourse.<br></p><p>A one-hour introductory&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/your-first-visit.aspx" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/your-first-visit.aspx">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;massage for non-members is only $39, a one-hour introductory Murad signature spa facial is only $49. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits or facials throughout the month at reduced prices.<br></p>
<p>Breast Friends Forever and Third Base or Bust will walk in the Susan G. Komen for the Cure on June 12<br></p><p>DALLAS, Texas -- June 10, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Two walk teams in the upcoming&nbsp;<a href="http://www.komennorthtexas.org/" target="_blank">2010 Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure North Texas</a>&nbsp;have won $1000 sponsorships each for&nbsp;Susan G. Komen for the Cure.&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, a long-time race supporter, sponsored the essay contest and the prizes.</p><p>Frisco resident Laurie Brosius of&nbsp;Breast Friends Forever, one of the winning teams, wrote in her essay that the team "is walking for the past, present, and future. My husband and I walk in memory of his mother who lost her battle to breast cancer in 1997. My best friend Nikki and her husband walk in memory of her grandmother. We are also celebrating our friend Cathy Rosen's second year as a survivor. Nikki and I met (survivor) Ana Moss in the Susan G. Komen 3-Day for the Cure 2008."<br></p><p>Ms. Brosius said the 10-member team is also walking "so our daughters, nieces, and other family members do not have to go through this in their lifetime. We have a common goal -- to end breast cancer. Together as&nbsp;Breast Friends Forever, we can do it." Follow the team at<a href="http://our3day.com/" target="_blank">http://our3day.com</a>&nbsp; and at&nbsp;<a href="http://laviedelaurie.com/" target="_blank">http://laviedelaurie.com</a>.<br></p><p>Team&nbsp;Breast Friends Forever&nbsp;has 10 participants; two are survivors of breast cancer.<br></p><p>Plano resident, Erica Brown of team&nbsp;Third Base or Bust&nbsp;said she started volunteering for Susan G. Komen for the Cure North Texas 10 years ago. She said her grandmother Avis, age 96, is a 26-year survivor, "and I can only dream of being as strong as she."<br></p><p>Five other remarkable women that she loves are also survivors, Ms. Brown wrote. "These women are my heroes," she said. "I raise money especially for them but also for every woman and man that has fought or is fighting (breast cancer). My efforts fail in comparison with their battles, but I will continue to raise awareness until we find a cure."<br></p><p>Team&nbsp;Third Base or Bust&nbsp;has 30 participants; two are direct survivors of breast cancer.<br></p><p>The winning essays are posted at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>. Look for the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure tab.<br></p><p>"We had such an overwhelming response that we could not pick just one team for the Susan G. The three members on each team who raise the most money will also receive a&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;gift card for a free massage.<br></p><p>On race day, a special area at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>'s tent will be reserved for team members to receive a free chair massage from&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;therapists.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.komennorthtexas.org/" target="_blank">The Susan G. <p>DALLAS, TX -- June 17, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- When he opened a Massage Envy clinic here in 2005, Bruce McGovern thought the location might produce several hundred thousand dollars in annual revenue.</p><p>&nbsp;It did -- and then some.<br></p><p>The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic, in the Old Town Shopping Center on Greenville Avenue in Dallas, now generates more than $2 million in annual revenue. The Old Town franchise and River Oaks in Houston are the top two revenue producers for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, the leading provider of massage therapy in the United States.<br></p><p>McGovern attributes the clinic's growth and success to old-fashioned service. "First and foremost, we want to give the customer the absolute best massage experience they can imagine," he says. "Everything we do is aimed at making the experience better for the client. A wonderful experience for one client attracts others, many of whom are experiencing massage therapy for the first time."<br></p><p>"The attention to customer service is the defining factor in the Old Town clinic's growth, making it one of the top two&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>franchises in the United States," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>. He said&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;is open in 42 states, has 622 clinics nationwide, and 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex.<br></p><p>At&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>"When you make it comfortable, affordable, and convenient for a client, they keep coming back," says Bruce McGovern.<br></p><p>The market for massage therapy continues to grow, even in a slow economy. An estimated $5-7 billion a year is spent on massage therapy; consumers visit clinics approximately 140 million times a year.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>'s&nbsp;franchising of clinics has produced wide name recognition, making the company the brand name for massage therapy throughout the country.<br></p><p>The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997. Doctors are increasingly recommending massage for their patients.<br></p><p>Massage therapy customers also tend to get massages frequently. Those who seek therapeutic massage from trained professionals average 7 visits per year. The growing population of elderly and aging baby boomers continues to fuel strong demand for massage therapy.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic. <p>Dallas, Texas -- June 22, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Breast Friends Forever, a team that walked in the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure last weekend, also won a $1000 contribution for its essay on the team.</p><p>Massage Envy, a long-time race supporter, sponsored two $1000 donations for the best essays on walk teams.<br></p><p>Laurie Brosius of Frisco, a Breast Friends Forever member who wrote the winning essay about her team, saw the race as an opportunity to "walk for the past, present and future."<br></p><p>Ms. Brosius says she and her husband walked in memory of his mother, who lost her battle to breast cancer in 1996. "My best friend Nikki and her husband walked in memory of her grandmother," she said.<br></p><p>The team also celebrated team member Cathy Rosen's second year as a survivor. Teammate Ana Moss is also a survivor. "Nikki and I met Ana in 2008 when we walked 60 miles in the Komen 3-Day, and she has been through breast cancer more than once herself," Ms. Brosius said.<br></p><p>She added that "We are also walking for the future, so that our daughters, nieces and other family members do not have to go through this in their lifetimes. We all have different reasons, but have come together to fight and have a common goal -- to end breast cancer. Together, as Breast Friends, we can do it!"<br></p><p>"We had such an overwhelming response that we could not pick just one team for the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure sponsorship," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy, the nation's leading provider of massage therapy. "As a long-time supporter of the Susan G. Komen for the Cure, the DFW Massage Envy clinics were thrilled to sponsor these two deserving teams."<br></p><p>Besides its two $1000 donations,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;also supplied co-branded shirts to the two teams it sponsored. The three members on each team who raised the most money received a&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;gift card for a free massage.<br></p><p>At the race, a special area at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>'s tent was reserved for team members to receive a free chair massage from&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>therapists.<br></p><p>At&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Memberships are available for $49 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members may also enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic. There are 27&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.<br></p><p>Follow&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>Massage Envy<br></p><p>Massage Envy Limited, LLC is a national franchise of massage therapy clinics dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage services to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations. Founded in 2002,&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;is open in 40 states, has awarded 810 clinics nationwide and has 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. For more information aboutMassage Envy, visit the website at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.MassageEnvy.com</a>. Follow&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW on Facebook -<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>For more information contact Jo Trizila at&nbsp;<a target="_blank">jo@trizcom.com</a>&nbsp;or 214-232-0078.<br></p>
<p>This press release corrects the version released on 06 July, 2010. The one-hour therapeutic massage rate of Massage Envy on its "Massage for the Cure" event on September 14 is at $49 and not $45, as earlier issued. A complete, corrected release follows:<br></p><p>Dallas, Texas -- July 06, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- On Tuesday, September 14, 2010,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;will host a one-day fundraiser event,&nbsp;Massage for the Cure, which will offer one-hour therapeutic massages for $49, to raise funds for the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure. $15 from each massage will be donated to the DFW affiliate to be used for breast cancer education, screening, and treatment programs in the DFW area.&nbsp;Massage for the Cure&nbsp;is a national event, with an expected 620&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;centers across 42 states participating. 27 DFW locations will participate.</p><p>WHEN: &nbsp;Tuesday, September 14, 2010<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;8:00 am -- 10:00 pm</p><p>*Reservations for appointments will be accepted by phone or in person beginning&nbsp;Saturday, August 14, 2010. You do not have to be a<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;member to make an appointment. Walk-ins are welcome.<br></p><p>COST: &nbsp;<br>$49&nbsp;for a one-hour therapeutic massage, $15 will be donated directly to the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure. Additional donations greatly appreciated.</p><p>A gratuity for the therapist is also suggested.<br></p><p>HISTORY:<br>Since&nbsp;Massage for the Cure's&nbsp;inception in 2005, <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;has raised more than $1.4 million to support breast cancer research for regional Affiliates of Susan G. Komen for the Cure, funding breast cancer education, screening, and treatment initiatives.</p><p>WHO:<br>Massage Envy&nbsp;Franchising, LLC, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage and spa services in the United States. The national franchise of massage centers is dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage and healthy skin facials to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations.</p><p>Susan G. Komen for the Cure is the global leader in the movement to end breast cancer having invested more than $1.5 billion since its inception in 1982. As the world's largest grassroots network of breast cancer survivors and activists, Komen works to save lives, empower people, ensure quality care for all, and energize science to find the cures.<br></p><p>WHERE: &nbsp;Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations</p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250,&nbsp;Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Test Drive the Chevy Malibu and Receive a Free Massage<br></p><p>Dallas, Texas -- July 20, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com/</a>) --&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;clinics and Chevy dealers in the Dallas/Fort Worth area.</p><p>What:<br>Follow three different mommy bloggers on Chevy's new social media page,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.gottalovechevydfw.com/" target="_blank">www.gottalovechevydfw.com</a>, and enter to win a Mom's Time Out at the Four Seasons.</p><p>Test drive a new Chevy Malibu at any North Texas Chevy dealer and receive a free one-hour massage session from the Dallas/Fort WorthMassage Envy&nbsp;clinics. A test driver must be a legal Texas resident, at least 21 years old and have a valid driver's license.<br></p><p>Where:<br>Details at any North Texas Chevy dealer,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.gottalovechevydfw.com/" target="_blank">www.gottalovechevydfw.com</a>&nbsp; or&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/gottalovechevydfw" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/gottalovechevydfw</a>. &nbsp;</p><p>When:<br>Through July 31</p>
<p>Dallas, Texas -- July 23, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;clinics throughout Dallas-Fort Worth</p><p>WHAT:<br>Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy first time clients can relax and enjoy a free aromatherapy upgrade with each $39 introductory massage.</p><p>WHEN :<br>Now through Monday, August 6</p><p>WHY:<br>Relax, recharge and reduce stress. Using the scents of essential oils, aromatherapy can help increase mental clarity, promote relaxation and rejuvenate, depending on the type of essential oils used. Combining aromatherapy with therapeutic massage is more beneficial than either is separately.</p><p>Scientific research has shown that inhaling certain scents sends messages directly to key areas of the brain. These messages can reduce stress, blood pressure and heart rate, and help memory, digestion and even the immune system.<br></p><p>WHERE:<br>Any of the 27&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;clinics in the D-FW area. Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest clinic. All are open seven days a week.</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250,&nbsp;Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Frisco, Texas -- Aug 10, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;The Frisco North Massage Envy Spa and IKEA in Frisco</p><p>WHAT<br>IKEA just released their Fall Catalog, and in anticipation of the throngs of customers descending on the popular retailer, IKEA has enlisted the Frisco North&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;to give complimentary chair massages in August at IKEA in Frisco.</p><p>WHEN: &nbsp;2-4 p.m. on August 13,14,15,21,22, and 28</p><p>WHERE: &nbsp;IKEA<br>7171 IKEA Dr.<br>Frisco TX 75034<br>Phone: (972) 712-4532</p><p>WHY<br></p><p>IKEA and&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;are teaming up to relieve tension and stress. "In the dog days of August, when the heat is at its worst, and shopping at its best, a chair massage is a great way to relax and unwind while you're shopping," said Brendan McBratney, owner of the Frisco North&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;Spa. "IKEA enlisted two of our licensed massage therapists to be at IKEA on weekends in August to provide free massages for their shoppers."<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic. There are 27&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.<br></p><p>Follow&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p>
<p>Employees donate salaries for the day - Massage for the Cure -- September 14, 2010<br></p><p>Rowlett, Texas -- Aug 16, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Employees at the Massage Envy clinic in Rowlett, Texas &nbsp;will give their all -- literally -- to benefit Susan G. Komen for the Cure on September 14, 2010. <br><br>"All our Rowlett Massage Envy employees have volunteered to donate salaries for the day and work for free on September 14, so all revenue from massages that day goes directly to Susan G. Komen for the Cure in the DFW area," said Dr. Rick Klics, owner of the Rowlett clinic.<br><br>The clinic's efforts are part of Massage for the Cure, the Massage Envy one-day, nationwide event on September 14. Approximately 620 Massage Envy centers across the country will offer specially priced one-hour therapeutic massage sessions for $49 to benefit Susan G. Komen for the Cure.<br><br>On September 14, all 27 Massage Envy clinics in the DFW area will donate $15 of each $49 massage (donation may be more depending upon clinic). The donation will benefit the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure. &nbsp;Funds raised support breast cancer education, screening and treatment initiatives in the D/FW community.<br><br>The Rowlett clinic isn't waiting until September 14 to get started. Clinic Manager Morgan Tucker plans to donate her hair for use in making wigs for cancer patients in the Dallas/Fort Worth area.<br><br>On September 14, an instructor from Lakepointe Hospital in Rowlett will be on hand at the clinic to provide information and answer questions on breast health and breast cancer.<br><br>On Sept 13, a mobile blood donor unit will operate outside the clinic. Blood donors can enter a raffle for prizes from Massage Envy and also sign up for a massage during Massage for the Cure September 14. Four Rowlett restaurants will donate food during Massage for the Cure Confirmed sponsors include: Chick-Fil-A, McAllisters Deli, Valentino's, Mission Linen and Front Door Advertising.<br><br>"The people of Rowlett have really embraced Massage for the Cure as a great way to benefit the Susan G. Komen for the Cure and advance breast cancer education. So many of us have experienced the horrific disease and this is our way of saying, you are not alone -- we care," said Dr. Klics of Massage Envy. The Rowlett Massage Envy clinic is located at Rowlett Crossing, 4301 Lakeview Parkway, Suite 600, Rowlett, TX 75089, phone (972) 463-0101.<br>Reservations for the Massage for the Cure began August 14, 2010.<br>This year, Massage Envy's goal is to raise $500,000 for the cause. To date, Massage Envy has raised more than $1.4 million for Susan G. Komen for the Cure.<br><br>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. There are 27 Massage Envy locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.<br>Follow Massage EnvyDFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br>###<br>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br>Massage Envy Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br>Massage Envy Allen - 816 W. <p>McKinney, TX -- Aug 26, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy's annual Massage for the Cure has special significance for Massage Envy's Craig Ranch clinic.</p><p>"It's really close to our heart -- two of our team members are fighting cancer, including one with breast cancer," said Brendan McBratney, owner of the Craig Ranch clinic in McKinney. "As we prepare to raise funds during Massage for the Cure next month, we're also supporting our two team members and rooting for their full, speedy recovery."<br></p><p>Massage for the Cure is scheduled for Tuesday, September 14. In the DFW area, $15 from each massage will be donated to the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure to support breast cancer education, screening and treatment initiatives.<br></p><p>The Craig Ranch clinic is an especially generous supporter of Massage for the Cure. Last year during the program, McBratney and his staff donated all of their salaries, and will donate all salaries again this year.<br></p><p>"<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;nationally and our 27 clinics in the DFW area are long-time avid supporters of Susan G. Komen for the Cure," Mr. McBratney says. "Every year, we see how enthusiastic and committed our employees and the community are to making Massage for the Cure a huge success."<br></p><p>Clinic administrator Michelle Butler says the Craig Ranch location is ramping up for the September fund-raiser. Booths at the clinic will include vendors from the Susan G. Komen local affiliate; Lady of America in McKinney, Aflac, Mary Kay, Wells Fargo, Life Time Fitness, Durkins Pizza, Mattress Firm, and CK Sports. There will also be book signings at the clinic.<br></p><p>Lady of America in McKinney has pledged a $30 contribution to Massage for the Cure for each new Lady of America sign-up on site September 14. In addition, more than 20 people have signed up to donate blood to the American Red Cross, which will be at the clinic noon to 4 p.m.<br></p><p>Visitors to the clinic September 14 will receive gift bags with t-shirts, coupons, bracelets, self-exam shower cards and candy. Ms. Butler and her husband are donating homemade barbecue, drinks and desserts to feed the clinic's team members. Other donations have come from Durkins Pizza, movie theaters, salons and gyms.<br></p><p>During Massage for the Cure nationwide, some 620&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinics will offer specially priced one-hour therapeutic massage sessions for $49. All proceeds benefit Susan G. Komen for the Cure.<br></p><p>This year, Massage Envy's goal is to raise $500,000 nationally. To date,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;has raised more than $1.4 million for Susan G. Komen for the Cure.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic. There are 27&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. <p>Massage for the Cure -- September 14, 2010<br></p><p>Rowlett, TX -- Sep 01, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Morgan Tucker, manager of the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic in Rowlett.</p><p>What<br>Ms. Tucker will cut her hair 10 inches and donate it for use in making wigs for cancer patients in the Dallas/Fort Worth area.</p><p>When<br>Morgan Tucker's donation on&nbsp;September 7,  11 AM, is tied to Massage Envy's nationwide Massage for the Cure on Tuesday, September 14, benefiting Susan G. Komen for the Cure.</p><p>Where: &nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Rowlett Crossing, 4301 Lakeview Parkway, Suite 600, Rowlett, TX 75089, (972) 463-0101.</p><p>Why<br>"I love that my employer participates in Massage for the Cure. When thinking what I could do to make a difference in the life of a cancer patient I discovered that I could donate my hair," Ms. Tucker said. "My hair grows really fast, and I could not imagine having to lose all my hair and not being able grow it back. I know my donation will make a difference in someone's life."</p><p>She has never donated hair before and admits to being "a little nervous." "I feel for all the cancer patients that have to go through that, but especially the little girls, because I know that has to be really hard for them."<br></p><p>Clinic owner, Dr. Rick Klics, says, "Two years ago I lost my oldest sister to a very aggressive and fast-moving breast cancer, so this is not just a great and worthy cause, it is something that has touched my life and the lives of my family very directly as well. I am so proud of our employees and their generous response to Massage for the Cure."<br></p><p>Details<br>During Massage for the Cure, the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;nationwide event on Tuesday, September 14, some 620&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;centers will offer specially priced one-hour therapeutic massage sessions for $49. In the DFW region, $15 from each massage will be donated to the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure. However, the staff at the Massage Envy Rowlett clinic has volunteered to donate all of their salaries that day, meaning that at this location, 100 percent of the money raised will be donated to the cause. Funds raised go to support breast cancer education, screening, and treatment initiatives throughout D-FW. This year, Massage Envy's goal is to raise $500,000 for the cause. To date,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;has raised more than $1.4 million for Susan G. Komen for the Cure.</p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic. There are 27&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.<br></p><p>Follow&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250,&nbsp;Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Dallas, Texas -- Sep 10, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- This Tuesday, September 14, 2010 <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;will host a one-day fundraiser event,Massage for the Cure, which will offer one-hour therapeutic massages for $49, to raise funds for the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure. $15 from each massage will be donated to the DFW affiliate to be used for breast cancer education, screening and treatment programs in the DFW area.&nbsp;Massage for the Cure&nbsp;is a national event, with an expected 620 <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;centers across 42 states participating. 27 DFW locations will participate.</p><p>WHEN: Tuesday, September 14, 2010<br>8:00 am -- 10:00 pm</p><p>*Reservations for appointments will be accepted by phone or in person. You do not have to be a <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;member to make an appointment. Walk-ins are welcome.<br></p><p>COST:<br>$49&nbsp;for a one--hour therapeutic massage, $15 will be donated directly to the Dallas/Fort Worth affiliate of Susan G. Komen for the Cure. Additional donations greatly appreciated.</p><p>A gratuity for the therapist is also suggested.<br></p><p>HISTORY:<br>Since&nbsp;Massage for the Cure's&nbsp;inception in 2005, <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;has raised more than $1.4 million to support breast cancer research for regional Affiliates of Susan G. Komen for the Cure, funding breast cancer education, screening and treatment initiatives.</p><p>WHO:<br>Massage Envy&nbsp;Franchising, LLC, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage and spa services in the United States. The national franchise of massage centers is dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage and healthy skin facials to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations.</p><p>Susan G. Komen for the Cure is the global leader in the movement to end breast cancer having invested more than $1.5 billion since its inception in 1982. As the world's largest grassroots network of breast cancer survivors and activists, Komen works to save lives, empower people, ensure quality care for all and energize science to find the cures.<br></p><p>WHERE:<br>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Dallas, TX -- Sep 17, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- DFW&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;will select a walk team in the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure-Dallas to receive a $1000 donation as well as other prizes.</p><p>To nominate your Dallas walk team, submit a 300-word essay on why&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;should sponsor your team at<a href="http://www.facebook.com/massagedfw" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.facebook.com/massagedfw">http://www.facebook.com/massagedfw</a>. Look for the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure tab.<br></p><p>Entries may be submitted through September 26, 2010. The winning team will be announced September 28, 2010 on<a href="http://www.facebook.com/massagedfw" target="_blank">http://www.facebook.com/massagedfw</a>.<br></p><p>"As a long-time supporter of the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure,&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;wants to encourage a record number of teams and Facebook entries, to highlight the Dallas race," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;Massage Envy, the nation's leading provider of massage therapy. "Every team and dollar raised brings us closer to a cure."<br></p><p>In addition to a $1000 donation,&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;will also provide the team it sponsors with co-branded team shirts and gift cards as prizes for the team members who raise the most money.<br></p><p>On race day, a special area in the&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;tent will be reserved for team members to receive a free chair massage from Dallas/Fort Worth&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;therapists.<br></p><p>The Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure-Dallas is on Saturday, October 16 at NorthPark Center in Dallas. All funds from the Komen Race for the Cure go to research, education, screening and treatment programs for breast cancer.<br></p><p>This year, the goal is $2 million and 18,000 race participants. For more information, go to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.komendallas.org/" target="_blank">www.komendallas.org</a>&nbsp;<br></p><p>At&nbsp;Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits throughout the month at reduced prices. <p>FLOWER MOUND, TX -- Oct 05, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic in Flower Mound has been named Best of Denton County for Massage in 2010.</p><p>The clinic, located at 950 Parker Square in Flower Mound, was selected in the massage category by readers of The News Connection, a bi-weekly newspaper devoted to happenings in the most flourishing part of Southern Denton County. Only one business was selected in each of 158 categories.<br></p><p>"It is always gratifying to win the approval of one of our communities," said Peter Nguyen, owner of the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Flower Moundclinic. <p>Dallas, TX -- Oct 08, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The&nbsp;DFW Massage Envy&nbsp;clinics have selected Jenna's Bosom Buddies, a walk team in the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure-Dallas, to receive a $1000 donation as well as other prizes.</p><p>Team members who raise the most money will also donate three Massage Envy gift card prizes to Jenna, in whose honor the team is named. She has stage 2 breast cancer and is pregnant with her first child.<br></p><p>In its winning entry, Jenna's Bosom Buddies wrote, "Our race has suddenly become more important. Breast cancer (has) hit too close to home.  Our dear friend Jenna was diagnosed with metastatic stage 2 breast cancer.  To complicate treatment, Jenna is three months pregnant with her first baby. In support of her fight, we are renaming our team Jenna's Bosom Buddies and are recruiting members around the country to support Jenna's fight. Our team is dedicated to raising funds and awareness, and helping Jenna fight and win the ultimate race -- surviving breast cancer and raising her child."<br></p><p>In addition to the $1000 donation,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;will also provide the team with co-branded team shirts and three gift cards as prizes for the team members who raise the most money. The team will donate the three gift cards to Jenna "so she may enjoy Massage Envy in the midst of this stressful time."<br></p><p>"<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;congratulates Jenna's Bosom Buddies for its winning entry," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer forMassage Envy, the nation's leading provider of massage therapy. "Every team and dollar raised brings us closer to a cure. As a long-time supporter of the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure,&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;wants to honor the hundreds of teams entering the race and posting on Facebook, and the tremendous commitment of teams to the Dallas race."<br></p><p>On race day, a special area in the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;tent will be reserved for team members to receive a free chair massage from Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy therapists.<br></p><p>Two others teams, Baylor Aggie's Angels and The Thessalonians, will each receive a $500&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;donation.<br></p><p>The Susan G. Komen Komen Race for the Cure-Dallas is on Saturday, October 16 at NorthPark Center in Dallas. All funds from the Komen Race for the Cure go to research, education, screening and treatment programs for breast cancer. This year's goal is $2 million and 18,000 race participants. For more information, go to <a href="http://www.komen-dallas.org">www.komen-dallas.org</a><br></p><p>Additionally,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;supports Susan G. Komen For the Cure with Massage for the Cure. A nationwide program held each year in the Fall, Massage for the Cure raises money for the organization by offering discounted massages and donating a portion of massage revenues to Susan G. Komen For the Cure.  In some clinics, franchisees and therapists donate all revenue and fees for the day to support the charity.<br></p><p>At&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $39. Members can enjoy a one-hour massage session every month for just $49 plus additional visits throughout the month at reduced prices. Or, for only $10 more, individuals can enjoy a one-hour healthy skin facial utilizing Murad skincare products at participating locations. Massage Envy gift cards can be purchased at all&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;locations and can be redeemed at any clinic in the U.S.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;clinic. There are 27&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.<br></p><p>Follow&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250,&nbsp;Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>This Saturday, October 16, 2010<br></p><p>DALLAS&nbsp;-- Oct 11, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;Massage Envy DFW, with 27 massage centers throughout the Metroplex.</p><p>What<br>Massage Envy&nbsp;will reimburse the entry fee of the first 500 participants (clients/employees and families of Massage Envy) that join the Massage Envy DFW race team for the Komen Dallas Race for the Cure.</p><p>When/Where<br>The deadline to sign up for the&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW race team is Saturday, October 9. Register at:<a href="http://www.komen-dallas.org/site/TR/Race/General/932250130?pg=team&amp;fr_id=1050&amp;team_id=42902" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.komen-dallas.org/site/TR/Race/General/932250130?pg=team&amp;fr_id=1050&amp;team_id=42902">http://www.komen-dallas.org/site/TR/Race/General/932250130?pg=team&amp;fr_id=1050&amp;team_id=42902</a></p><p>The Komen Dallas Race for the Cure is on Saturday, October 16, at NorthPark Center in Dallas.<br></p><p>Details<br>Participants must bring their entry fee receipt to the Massage Envy tent on race day to receive reimbursement. When checking in, team members will also receive a free&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;Team T-Shirt to wear during the race. The&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;Team will all walk together.</p><p>"We participate in this amazing event because we believe in the Susan G. Komen for the Cure vision," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;Massage Envy. "Join our&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW Race for the Cure team now and support the fight against breast cancer."<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;center. <p>Dallas, TX -- Oct 15, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- A team of therapists from Massage Envy&nbsp;will offer free five-minute chair massages&nbsp;at the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure-Dallas. Donations for Susan G. Komen will be accepted.<br><br>When:&nbsp;<br>6-10:30 a.m. Saturday, October 16, 2010</p><p>Where<br>The Massage Envy&nbsp;tent will be in the east parking lot of NorthPark Mall at the corner of Park &amp; U.S. 75 (Central Expressway).</p><p>Details<br>Massage Envy&nbsp;will present the Jenna's Bosom Buddies walk team its $1000 Susan G. Komen check for the best walk team essay. Walk teams Baylor Aggie's Angels and The Thessalonians will each receive a $500 Susan G. Komen check. The check presentations will be at 9:15 a.m. in the Massage Envy tent.</p><p>In the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure-Dallas, the Massage Envy&nbsp;team will include 100 walkers. Massage Envy&nbsp;is the nation's largest provider of massage services.</p><p>Contact<br></p><p>Jo Trizila<br>TrizCom, Inc.<br><a target="_blank">jotrizila@trizilacommunications.com<br></a><a href="http://www.trizilacommunications.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.trizilacommunications.com/">www.trizilacommunications.com</a><br>office: 972-247-1369<br>cell: 214-232-0078</p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy&nbsp;clinic. <p>ROWLETT, TX&nbsp;-- Nov 03, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Rowlett-Crossing.aspx" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Rowlett-Crossing.aspx">Massage Envy in Rowlett, Texas</a>&nbsp;has won a Readers' Choice Award as the city's best massage therapy for 2010.</p><p>The Rowlett Lakeshore Times&nbsp;presents the awards annually to local businesses chosen as best by the newspaper's readers.&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Rowlett-Crossing.aspx" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Rowlett-Crossing.aspx">Rowlett'sMassage Envy</a>&nbsp;is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway.<br></p><p>"A big thank you to all who voted us as the best massage center in Rowlett," said Dr. Richard Klics, owner of the Massage Envy center. "It is always gratifying to win the approval of our community."<br></p><p>Dr. Klics said, "Our goal is to give our clients the best experience possible -- a relaxing, affordable, and convenient massage. Our clients constantly tell us how much they enjoy visiting&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>. Our mission is to exceed their expectations and fully satisfy their needs." To schedule an appointment, call 972-463-0101.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. The nation's largest provider of massage therapy,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;is the best-known name in the massage category.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>At&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?zip=75229&amp;radius=50&amp;city=Dallas&amp;state=&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p>November 26, 27 and 28<br></p><p>FRISCO, TX&nbsp;-- Nov 15, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- &nbsp;</p><p>WHO<br>Massage Envy -- Frisco North and IKEA</p><p>WHAT<br>IKEA has enlisted the Frisco North&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;to give complimentary chair massages at IKEA in Frisco.</p><p>WHEN<br>4-6 p.m. Friday, Saturday and Sunday, November 26-28</p><p>WHERE:<br>IKEA<br>7171 IKEA Dr.<br>Frisco TX 75034<br>Phone: (972) 712-4532</p><p>WHY<br>IKEA and&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;are teaming up to relieve shopping stress. "During Black Friday weekend after Thanksgiving, when stress is high and shopping is at its best, a chair massage is a great way to relax and unwind while you're shopping," said Brendan McBratney, owner of the Frisco North&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;Spa. "IKEA has enlisted two of our licensed massage therapists to provide free massages for IKEA shoppers."</p><p>Massage Envy&nbsp;is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. The nation's largest provider of massage therapy,&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;is the best-known name in the massage category.<br></p><p>Massage Envy&nbsp;in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>At&nbsp;Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;center. <p>DALLAS&nbsp;-- Nov 18, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The joy of the holidays -- parties, gift-giving, family get-togethers -- can also be stressful. And stress can weaken your immune system, cause headaches, sleep loss, irritability and indigestion.</p><p>To celebrate, not just survive, the holidays, here are some stress-relieving tips from&nbsp;Massage Envy, the nation's leading provider of massage therapy:<br></p><p>Be realistic.&nbsp;One way to lower stress is to lower your expectations. Plan your activities-including shopping, baking and partying-on a master calendar. Stick to your schedule and feel free to say no to things that aren't on it.<br></p><p>Take "me" time.&nbsp;Build in a healthy slice of time to do something just for yourself, whether it's reading a great novel or getting a massage. The DFW&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;centers are offering a free one-hour massage with the purchase of three $60 gift cards beginning Black Friday, November 26, 2010. Gift cards must be purchased at any of the 27 DFW&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;locations. &nbsp;<br></p><p>"Massage Envy&nbsp;gift cards are a great idea for friends, family, co-workers and the hostess -- and you can create special time for yourself with our free massage offer," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>.<br></p><p>Make good choices.&nbsp;Remember, you don't have to do it all. Learn to make good choices, and keep those choices to a minimum, and you will enjoy your holidays.<br></p><p>Go with the flow.&nbsp;You're not perfect the rest of the year, so learn to go with the flow, whether it's because you burned dinner or because your youngest said something inappropriate during dinner. The holiday season is for celebration, not competition.<br></p><p>Practice moderation.&nbsp;Don't overdo. Eating too much, drinking too much and spending too much money will only make you feel worse later. But don't deprive yourself either. Moderation is what's key.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex.</a><br></p><p>At&nbsp;Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;">Massage Envy in Texas</a>&nbsp;and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;center. <p>DALLAS&nbsp;-- Nov 24, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- 'Twas the month before Christmas, and all through the town, holiday wishes were granted, good cheer did abound</p><p>For the second year in a row, radio station 94.9 KLTY's Christmas Wish program, with the help of DFW&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, centers and Chick-fil-A locations in the DFW area, will make hundreds of Christmas wishes come true this holiday season.<br></p><p>Massage Envy&nbsp;therapists will give free chair massages at 21 selected Chick-fil-A locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth area Nov. 29 - Dec. 24. All donations will benefit radio station 94.9 KLTY's annual Christmas Wish program. All dates and locations will be posted on DFW Massage Envy's Facebook page,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/massagedfw" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/massagedfw</a>.<br></p><p>"Massage Envy is proud to join with KLTY and Chick-fil-A in the Christmas Wish project," "said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>. "This holiday partnership captures the spirit of the holidays and shows how much the people of Dallas/Fort Worth really care. It's a community project that everyone can get behind and feel good about."<br></p><p>During the Christmas Wish program, KLTY listeners can register to win a year's&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;membership, and gift certificates for massages will be given away during live KLTY broadcasts at participating Chick-fil-A locations.<br></p><p>In addition, Massage Envy's "Three for You, Free for Me" campaign offers a free massage with the purchase of three $60&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>gift cards during the holiday season. Gift cards must be purchased at one of the 27 DFW Massage Envy centers.<br></p><p>Each year, 94.9 KLTY listeners email their Christmas wishes to the station or nominate a Christmas Wish recipient. Listeners can donate to the Christmas Wish Fund for needy D/FW residents and families; and can also personally select and grant a Christmas Wish that touches their heart.<br></p><p>In the month before Christmas, the station selects one letter per day and makes that wish a reality. Now in its ninth year, the Christmas Wish project has raised an estimated $3.1 million through the generosity of listeners and advertisers. The DFW&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;centers and Chick-fil-A are core partners for the program.<br></p><p>Massage Envy&nbsp;is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex</a>.<br></p><p>At&nbsp;Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;">Massage Envy in Texas</a>&nbsp;and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>###<br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250,&nbsp;Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Donations help 94.9 KLTY's Christmas Wish program<br></p><p>DALLAS -- Dec 02, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Feeling stressed as the holidays draw near? Now's the time to kick back and enjoy a free chair massage from the <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;DFW centers.</p><p>For the second year in a row, Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy therapists will give free chair massages at selected Chick-fil-A locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth area through December 23, 2010. All donations will benefit radio station <a href="http://www.klty.com/christmaswish.php" target="_blank">94.9 KLTY's annual Christmas Wish program</a>.<br></p><p>Free massages are available during live KLTY broadcasts at participating Chick-fil-A locations. KLTY listeners can also register to win a one-year Massage Envy membership. Gift certificates for massages will also be given away during the broadcasts.<br></p><p>In addition, Massage Envy's "Three for You, Free for Me" program offers a free massage with the purchase of three $60 Massage Envy gift cards during the holiday season.<br></p><p>"Massage Envy is a proud partner in the Christmas Wish project," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "This holiday partnership captures the spirit of Christmas and shows that the people of Dallas/Fort Worth really care." Massage Envyand Chick-fil-A are core partners in the program.<br></p><p>DFW Massage Envy's free chair massage schedule is listed below. All KLTY remote broadcasts at Chick-fil-A restaurants are 6-10 a.m. except as noted.<br></p><p>2-December -- Thursday - Chick-fil-A - 117 East FM 544, Murphy 75094<br></p><p>8-December -- Wednesday - Chick-fil-A - 8700 State Hwy 121, McKinney 75070<br></p><p>9-December -- Thursday - Chick-fil-A - 996 W Highway 287 Bypass, Waxahachie75165<br></p><p>13-December -- Monday - Chick-fil-A - 6408 W Plano Pkwy, Plano 75093<br></p><p>14-December -- Wednesday - Chick-fil-A - 749 Main Street, FM 1171, Lewisville 75067<br></p><p>16-December -- Thursday - Chick-fil-A - 5211 Eldorado Pkwy, Frisco 75034<br></p><p>17-December -- Friday - Chick-fil-A - 2617 Lakeview Pkwy, Rowlett 75088<br></p><p>18-December -- (10am-2pm) - Saturday -- Chick-fil-A - 1711 S Loop 288, Denton 76205<br></p><p>21-December -- Tuesday - Chick-fil-A - 3041 W Camp Wisdom Rd, Grand Prairie 75052<br></p><p>23-December -- Thursday - Chick-fil-A - 12120 Inwood Road, Dallas 75244<br></p><p>Now in its ninth year, the Christmas Wish project has raised an estimated $3.1 million through the generosity of listeners and advertisers. <p>Dallas, Texas -- Dec 16, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- </p><p>WHO: <br>Massage Envy centers in the Dallas/Fort Worth area</p><p>WHAT<br>Will be offering massage therapy services and gift card sales on both Christmas Eve and New Years Eve.</p><p>WHEN<br>Until 3 p.m. on both Friday, December 24, and Friday, December 31</p><p>WHERE<br>At the 27 Massage Envy centers throughout D/FW (addresses and phone numbers below)</p><p>WHY<br>"Stress and strain don't take the holidays off," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "Our licensed therapists will be providing massage therapy at all of our Dallas/Fort Worth centers on the day before Christmas and New Years Eve too. You'll enjoy both holidays more after a therapeutic massage that leaves you relaxed and stress-free. However, appointments fill up quickly -- be sure to call today and reserve your session."</p><p>Also for the holidays, Massage Envy's "Three for You, Free for Me" program offers a free massage with the purchase of three $60Massage Envy gift cards.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p>Dallas, TX -- Dec 30, 2010 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Along with saving money and losing weight, developing a healthy habit is one of the top three New Year's resolutions that Americans make.</p><p>Unfortunately, 77 percent of resolution makers are resolution breakers, according to a FranklinCovey study. Get back on track by following these baby-step resolutions:<br></p><p>Get Movin'<br></p><p>You needn't be an athlete to reach your goal of staying active. Performing daily, low-intensity activities such as brisk walking or housework can lower your risk of heart disease. Any type of exercise helps reduce body fat, lower blood pressure, decrease total cholesterol and improve your mood.<br></p><p>'Trans'-cend Fats<br></p><p>A healthy eating plan starts with knowing which fats to restrict. Saturated fat and trans-fatty acids are "bad" fats, while monounsaturated fat and polyunsaturated fat are better for you. Trans fats raise LDL cholesterol levels and the risk for heart disease. Try to avoid these fats - found in fast and frozen foods as well as baked goods - and eat more whole grains, fruits and vegetables.<br></p><p>Screen the Sun<br></p><p>One in five Americans will develop skin cancer, according to the American Academy of Dermatology. This spring, make a healthy skin resolution to avoid sun damage. Use sunscreen with an SPF of at least 15 and both UVA and UVB protection.<br></p><p>De-Stress<br></p><p>Take a deep breath. Stress can lead to high blood pressure, elevated cholesterol levels and even rapid aging. One very effective method to relieve stress is massage therapy. Research shows regular massage therapy boosts your immune system, which can become weak after extended periods of stress.<br></p><p>Plan 'Me Time'<br></p><p>Plan one day a month for 'ME time'. There's nothing is better than having a massage appointment in your calendar weeks ahead of chedule. Massage Envy centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Plus, regular massage therapy can contribute to healthy living. Besides relieving stress and encouraging relaxation, regular massage can improve circulation, lower blood pressure, improve flexibility and even strengthen the immune system.<br></p><p>Massage Envy is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>Dallas, TX -- Jan 20, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage has been around for thousands of years, but myths about the practice still run rampant. Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, sets the record straight about five common massage misconceptions.</p><p>Myth 1: A good massage leaves you sore the next day.<br></p><p>Soreness is no indication of the quality of a massage. "Some people will be sore after their first massage if they've been sedentary," O'Pry says. "Another reason for soreness is if a massage therapist works very deeply to break up lactic acid or trigger points in your body, or if the client fails to drink enough water. But if you get regular massages, chances are you won't be sore the next day."<br></p><p>Myth 2: If I feel fine, I don't need to drink water after a massage.<br></p><p>Drinking water immediately after a massage helps reduce soreness. So does increasing your water intake after your appointment. "Water helps move out waste products that the therapist worked out of your muscles into circulation," O'Pry says. And don't drink alcohol or smoke afterward. Massage increases circulation, so alcohol and nicotine will have a stronger effect after a session.<br></p><p>Myth 3: If you are pregnant, you shouldn't get a massage.<br></p><p>Massage is safe in all trimesters of normal pregnancies and actually can be beneficial. "For normal pregnancies, it's perfectly safe," O'Pry says. "And it feels wonderful-relaxing for mother and baby."<br></p><p>Myth 4: It has got to hurt to really be effective.<br></p><p>"Nothing can be further from the truth," O'Pry says about the no pain, no gain philosophy. "You may experience discomfort, but you should never be in pain." If your therapist is causing pain, say so immediately. "A lot of clients assume a therapist knows when it hurts, but you need to say something," O'Pry says.<br></p><p>Myth 5: Unless my therapist asks, I do not need to bring it up.<br></p><p>It is important to tell your therapist about your health history, including medical conditions, surgeries and medications. "If you have heart disease, are taking antidepressants, have metal in your body, or took a pain reliever an hour before your appointment, we need to know," O'Pry says. "That helps us tailor your massage, determine the depth to use or decide if you should have a massage at all."<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy in Texas</a>&nbsp;and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>## <br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Dallas/Fort Worth, TX -- Jan 28, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- With National Sleep Awareness Week coming up March 7-13, 2011, now is the perfect time to really examine personal sleeping habits. While most people do not give sleep much thought, it is very important that one get enough quality, restorative sleep. Besides affecting things like mood and productivity, a lack of quality sleep is associated with major health concerns. More and more studies have shown the relationship between the quantity and quality of sleep and health problems such as obesity, diabetes, hypertension and depression.</p><p>Getting enough good sleep should be a priority in everyone's life. Fortunately, there is something easy and enjoyable that can help improve sleep: massage. Ongoing massage therapy has been shown to promote quality, restful sleep by managing two common causes of sleep issues: stress and pain.<br></p><p>Physically, massage relieves stress by easing muscle tightness and increasing circulation throughout the body. Massage also works on a biochemical level by lowering levels of the stress hormone cortisol and by promoting the release of endorphins.<br></p><p>Additionally, daily stressors often resurface during nighttime hours and interrupt or prevent sleep. Clients receiving ongoing massage therapy from Massage Envy report a sense of mental clarity and an increased ability to turn off these stressors and achieve optimal rest and relaxation.<br></p><p>Massage gets to the root of pain by relaxing tight muscles and addressing trigger points to put a stop to the pain cycle. Massage also increases blood flow to the affected muscles, which brings in healing oxygen and nutrients, and helps remove the waste products of cellular metabolism. All of this activity reduces swelling and stiffness and increases flexibility to help eliminate pain.<br></p><p>These results of massage combine to induce a calm, relaxed state that is more conducive to achieving quality, restorative sleep. Experience all of these benefits and more at Massage Envy.<br></p><p>As the leading massage provider in the U.S., Massage Envy believes that everybody deserves a good night's sleep. That's why they offer affordable massage therapy sessions with flexible appointment times seven days per week to fit even the busiest schedules. And, with 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth area, massage has never been more convenient.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. NASHVILLE, Tenn.  The all-new 2015 Nissan Murano, which was introduced to near universal acclaim in December 2014, has added another prestigious award to its trophy case  a "Best Crossover" in the Parents magazine and Edmunds.com annual listing of the "10 Best Family Cars."<br><br>As in previous years, the top vehicles for 2015 were selected by the Parents and Edmunds.com editors based on safety, convenience and high-tech performance features at all price levels. In choosing the Murano, they stated:<br><br>"The all-new Murano pulls off a neat trick, mimicking the creamy ride and luxe features of models costing $10,000 more. It provides stretch-your-legs space for five, easy car-seat access, and storage for a weekend getaway (portacrib and stroller included). The fatigue-fighting 'Zero Gravity' front seats are a blessing for long drives. The monitor beams 360-degree camera views, detecting and alerting you to moving objects in the parking lot, from bicycles to shopping carts to little kids."<br><br> Parents, June 2015 issue<br><br>Murano was also recently awarded an IIHS "Top Safety Pick Plus" ranking as one of the latest Nissan vehicles to offer the innovative Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB) systems specifically designed to alert drivers of potential risks ahead  along with available Driver's Attention Alert* (DAA) system. The DAA system analyzes driver steering behavior to provide an alert if signs of drowsiness or inattention are detected.<br><br>Sales of the all-new 2015 Murano increased 58.3 percent in May and 33.4 percent through May 2015 (compared to the same periods in calendar year 2014).<br><br>"The 2015 Murano has found a sweet spot in the competitive crossover SUV segment, offering standout styling, a highly versatile premium interior, advanced safety and driver aid technologies and, of course, Nissan's legendary driving excitement," said Fred Diaz, senior vice president, Sales &amp; Marketing, Parts &amp; Service, U.S.A, Nissan North America, Inc. "Now, on top of record sales in May, we're honored to add the highly sought-after Parents / Edmunds.com 'Best Family Car' acknowledgment to a great first year of the new Murano design."<br><br>As the halo vehicle for Nissan's expanding range of bold crossovers, the all-new Murano carries forward the new Nissan design direction with its V-Motion front end, boomerang lights, floating roof treatment and efficient aerodynamics. Inside, the new Murano offers an engaging "social lounge" feel through features such as the refined lower-height instrument panel, wide center console, advanced Zero Gravity seating, and the airy atmosphere created by the large windows and oversized Power Panoramic Moonroof.<br><br>Murano's long list of available features include NissanConnectSM with Navigation and Mobile Apps, 8-inch color display with multi-touch control, 8-way power driver's seat with power lumbar support, SiriusXM® Satellite Radio and Travel Link® (SiriusXM subscription required, sold separately), Nissan Intelligent Key® with Push Button Ignition, Remote Engine Start system, iPod® and other compatible devices interface, 11-speaker Bose® (including dual subwoofers) premium audio system and Bluetooth® Hands-free Phone System.<br><br>Responsive driving is provided by a standard 3.5-liter DOHC V6 connected to an advanced Xtronic transmission. Murano is available in front-wheel drive or Intuitive All-Wheel Drive. Fuel economy is rated at 28 mpg highway for both front-wheel and all-wheel drive models.<br><br>Available technologies include Around View® Monitor (AVM) with Moving Object Detection (MOD), Blind Spot Warning (BSW), Intelligent Cruise Control (ICC), Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB). The Rear Cross Traffic Alert (RCTA) system utilizes radar to detect a moving vehicle behind the Murano approaching from either side of a parking space.<br><br>The 2015 Murano is offered in four trim levels  S, SV, SL and Platinum  and in a choice of front-wheel or all-wheel drive. The starting MSRP** for the Murano S FWD is $29,560 USD, while the top-of-the-line Murano Platinum AWD is priced at $40,600 USD (full pricing is available at NissanNews.com). The new Murano is assembled in Canton, Mississippi.<br><br>For photography and additional information about the 2015 Nissan Murano along with the complete lineup of Nissan vehicles, please visit <a href="http://www.NissanNews.com">www.NissanNews.com</a>.<br><br>The complete 2015 Parents and Edmunds.com "10 Best Family Cars" list will be published in the July 2015 issue of Parents magazine and is available online at Parents.com/best-family-cars.<br><br>About Nissan North America <br><br>In North America, Nissan's operations include automotive styling, engineering, consumer and corporate financing, sales and marketing, distribution and manufacturing. Nissan is dedicated to improving the environment under the Nissan Green Program and has been recognized annually by the U.S Environmental Protection Agency as an ENERGY STAR® Partner of the Year since 2010. More information on Nissan in North America and the complete line of Nissan and Infiniti vehicles can be found online at <a href="http://www.NissanUSA.com">www.NissanUSA.com</a> and <a href="http://www.InfinitiUSA.com">www.InfinitiUSA.com</a>, or visit the U.S. media sites NissanNews.com and InfinitiNews.com.<br><br>About Nissan Motor Co.<br><br>Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., Japan's second-largest automotive company, is headquartered in Yokohama, Japan, and is part of the Renault-Nissan Alliance. Operating with more than 247,500 employees globally, Nissan sold 5.32 million vehicles and generated revenue of 11.38 trillion yen (USD 103.6 billion) in fiscal year 2014. Nissan delivers a comprehensive range of more than 60 models under the Nissan, Infiniti and Datsun brands. Nissan leads the world in zero-emission mobility, dominated by sales of the LEAF, the first mass-market, pure-electric vehicle. It is the best-selling EV in history with almost 50% share of the zero-emission vehicle segment.<br><br>For more information on our products, services and commitment to sustainable mobility, visit our website at <a href="http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/">http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/</a>.<br><br>About Parents<br><br>Parents was founded in 1926 and, along with American Baby, FamilyFun, and Ser Padres, makes up the Meredith Parents Network portfolio of parenthood brands.
