In turn, these moms enlighten and inspire others by joining ongoing conversations about parenthood via Parents.com as well through Parents' robust presence on Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, Instagram and Tumblr. Parents is dedicated to engaging and inspiring moms with the information they need, wherever they go.<br><br>About Edmunds.com<br><br>Edmunds.com is a car-shopping Web site driven to make car buying easy. <p>DALLAS -- Feb 02, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --</p><p>Who<br>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth (27 locations) only</p><p>What<br>The Dallas/Fort Worth area Massage Envy centers are offering a special Valentine's Day offer -- buy a gift card valued at $75 or more and get a free half-hour massage promotional gift card. This offer is only valid at the 27 DFW area Massage Envy centers and while supplies last.</p><p>A Massage Envy gift card is the perfect way to say 'I love you' to those most special to you, including yourself. <p>Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes, Knees and ToesEntire Body Benefits<br></p><p>Dallas/Fort Worth, TX -- Feb 14, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- "We live in such a fast-paced society, it is very rare we have a moment to focus on our own bodies," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>. "That's one of the healing benefits of massage; it's a meditative time to focus inward and relax."</p><p>Regardless of the area of the body, therapeutic massage can reduce tightness and pain and promote healing. Different parts of the body benefit from massage in different ways:<br></p><p>HEAD: Scalp massage can be extremely relaxing. Muscles on the scalp are responsible for making facial expressions, and there can be a lot of tension there, especially when staring at a computer all day or when under stress. Many people feel that tension melt away when their head is massaged.<br></p><p>NECK: You can blame your office job for the stiffness in your neck. Sitting at a desk, staring at a computer, your shoulder blades start rising up, shortening and tightening the neck muscles. Regular massage can help loosen the muscles and prevent stiffening.<br></p><p>HANDS: We use our hands for everything -- typing, clutching the steering wheel, holding the phone, changing a light bulb. Massage feels good because there are so many places to focus on. The thumb pad alone has nine muscles, and the hand is full of trigger points.<br></p><p>BACK: The back is greatly affected by the front. When you sit slumped and don't exercise much, your abs become weak and don't help hold up the spine. Your back has to do extra work to compensate.<br></p><p>ABDOMEN: Closely connected to the back, the muscles in your abdomen need love too. One group in particular, the iliopsoas, pulls on the front of your spine. It's a typical culprit of low-back pain. Another muscle group that can contribute to pain is the deepest back muscle, the quadratus lumborum.<br></p><p>LEGS: Our lower limbs are complex, with several interdependent joints. Knees are easily affected by what's going on in the hips or ankles. Legs also are often prone to injury. Massage therapists at DFW Massage Envy centers are trained to know the range of motion of joints and can help with healing of muscles.<br></p><p>FEET: Foot pain can be life-changing. You might not want to stand, which often prohibits exercise, which can lead to weight gain, perpetuating the cycle. But massage can help bring circulation to the area and even help with mobilization of the foot bones.<br></p><p>Massage Envy is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###<br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Dallas, TX -- Mar 07, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;Who: Massage Envy&nbsp;-- Dallas/Fort Worth locations (27 locations)</p><p>What<br>Getting enough good sleep should be a priority in everyone's life. Fortunately, there is something easy and enjoyable that can help improve sleep: massage. Ongoing massage therapy has been shown to promote quality, restful sleep by managing two common causes of sleep issues: stress and pain.</p><p>Daily stressors often resurface during nighttime hours and interrupt or prevent sleep. Clients receiving ongoing massage therapy from<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;report a sense of mental clarity and an increased ability to turn off these stressors and achieve optimal rest and relaxation.<br></p><p>Massage gets to the root of pain by relaxing tight muscles and addressing trigger points to put a stop to the pain cycle. Massage also increases blood flow to the affected muscles, which brings in healing oxygen and nutrients. All of this activity reduces swelling and stiffness and increases flexibility to help eliminate pain.<br></p><p>These results of massage combine to induce a calm, relaxed state that is more conducive to achieving quality, restorative sleep. Experience all of these benefits and more at&nbsp;Massage Envy.<br></p><p>When<br>March 7-13, 2011</p><p>Where<br>The 27 DFW Massage Envy locations.</p><p>Massage Envy&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br>Massage Envy&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Frisco, TX -- Mar 10, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Frisco North Massage Envy Spa &amp; IKEA </p><p>WHAT<br>Spring break is a great time to head to IKEA, so in anticipation of the throngs of customers descending upon the popular retailer, the Frisco North <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">Massage Envy Spa</a>&nbsp;is teaming up with IKEA to give complimentary chair massages at IKEA in Frisco.</p><p>WHEN<br>4-6 p.m. March 12-20, 2011</p><p>WHERE<br>IKEA<br>7171 IKEA Dr.<br>Frisco, TX 75034<br>Phone: (972) 712-4532</p><p>WHY<br>IKEA and Massage Envy are teaming up to relieve tension and stress. There is no better time to shop than the beautiful spring days of March and no better place to shop than IKEA. "Now for nine days in March, the shopping experience will be even better. While at IKEA, you can get a free chair massage to relax and unwind while shopping," said Brendan McBratney, owner of the Frisco North Massage EnvySpa. Two licensed massage therapists will be at IKEA during the specified days and times to provide free massages to shoppers.</p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy in Texas</a>&nbsp;and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com">www.massageenvy.com</a> to find the nearest Massage Envy center. <p>Plus DFW Massage Envy Centers Offer Great Mother's Day -- Buy 2 Get 1 Free Deal<br></p><p>Fort Worth, TX -- Mar 15, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- There is something unique about the Alliance Town Center Massage Envyin Fort Worth; it is managed and run by a mother-daughter team.</p><p>Sandi Romero is general manager and her daughter, Candyce Romero, is assistant clinic administrator of the Alliance Town CenterMassage Envy. Sandi began working for Massage Envy in 2010. After hearing her mother's excitement about the company and industry, Candyce jumped at the chance to join her mother when a position opened later that same year.<br></p><p>Both admit that working with family can be challenging. Candyce says, "With my mom and me, our personalities are very similar so sometimes we butt heads." Sandi agrees, saying, "Trust me, we do have the occasional conflict." Both also agree that, difficult as it may be, it is best to put their personal lives aside when it comes to business. Working together requires a different kind of relationship, because there they are not mother and daughter but boss and employee. It is especially difficult for Candyce to think of her mother as boss first and her mother second at work, stating, "She puts me in check really fast when I cross the line handling business conflicts."<br></p><p>Sandi also worries that other employees might think Candyce "gets a break" because of their relationship, but notes, in actuality, "I am the toughest on her because I expect her to be the best and demand it of her." Candyce knows it: "I think my mom is probably harder on me than any other employee."<br></p><p>Despite the challenges, both immensely enjoy working together at Massage Envy. Mother and daughter agree that working together has strengthened their already close relationship and created a mutual professional respect between them. Mother Sandi says she enjoys watching her daughter grow professionally, and Candyce says she feels lucky to be able to work with her mother and learn so much from her.<br></p><p>Sandi and Candyce both greatly appreciate the work they do at Massage Envy. They get great satisfaction knowing they help clients feel better. "Understanding that massage therapy has true health benefits and knowing that we have helped our clients is really rewarding," Sandi acknowledges. She and Candyce are thankful to Massage Envy for bringing them even closer together and allowing them to learn so much from each other. Candyce says she is very excited about the future at Massage Envy.<br></p><p>Remember Mother's Day is May 8. DFW Massage Envy centers are offering a special promotion just for Mother's Day; when you buy two $60 gift cards, you will get a one-hour massage gift card free! A Massage Envy gift card is the perfect gift for the mothers in one's life. Some say that being a mother is the toughest job in existence, so reward them for all their hard work with an enjoyable, relaxing massage at any of the Massage Envy DFW centers.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy in Texas</a>&nbsp;and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. <p>Dallas/Fort Worth, TX -- Mar 22, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy continues to climb the rankings on Entrepreneurmagazine's 2011 Franchise 500 list. The company ranked 64th overall (up from 88th last year) and 49th in the fastest growing franchise category.</p><p>There are 27 Dallas/Ft. Worth area locations, including four centers owned by Massage Envy's Franchisee of the Year. In the last year, DFW area centers,</p><p><ul><li>Performed 565,135 massages</li><li>Serviced 48,451 members</li><li>Saw a 20 percent increase in sales</li></ul></p><p>"Our DFW sales were huge -- a record last year," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "Due to the success of our core services, we have added additional services, for example aromatherapy massage and deep heat muscle therapy. And we continue to hire across the region - managers, front desk, and licensed massage therapists." </p><p>While the strength of the Massage Envy franchise appears to contrast sharply with the lingering economic malaise in the U.S., some economy-related stressors have actually boosted Massage Envy's appeal.<br></p><p>For example, stress-inducing job uncertainty and anxiety over making ends meet have caused many Americans to include low-cost therapeutic massage as an essential routine for staying well.<br></p><p>Additionally, more companies are including therapeutic massage in their wellness programs as a cost-effective way to increase employee health, productivity, problem solving, creative thinking and job satisfaction.<br></p><p>Scientific research shows that therapeutic massage relieves stress, boosts the immune system, promotes physical well-being and even improves mental outlook -- all of which can lower health care costs for companies.<br></p><p>"The strength of the enterprise nationwide and especially here in the Dallas/Fort Worth area illustrates the importance of therapeutic massage and the Massage Envy franchise model in today's economy," says Mr. O'Pry.. "We are very excited about the continued growth of the franchise -- including plans for a new center in Corinth, Texas this Spring. Accompanying our business growth is a strong demand for therapists. Massage therapy is a growing profession that offers flexibility, good pay and an opportunity to help others that many young people should consider as they think about their futures."</p><p>Entrepreneur magazine's annual rankings are based on analysis of the financial strength, size, business stability and growth of franchise companies.<br></p><p>Massage Envy is open in 42 states, with 638 centers nationwide and 27 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. The company was recently named a top AllBusiness (a D&amp;B company) AllStar Franchise, and is a member of the International Franchise Association (IFA).</p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">Massage Envy in Texas</a>&nbsp;and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/locations.aspx?radius=250&amp;city=dallas&amp;" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>###<br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Get a free one-hour massage session with gift card purchase<br></p><p>Dallas/Fort Worth, TX -- Apr 11, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy -- Dallas/Fort Worth (27 locations) only. This offer is only valid at the 27 DFW area Massage Envy centers and while supplies last.</p><p>Mother's Day is May 8. <p>Frisco, TX -- Apr 21, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- For the fourth year in a row, the Craig Ranch, Stonebriar and Frisco North SPAMassage Envy centers are proud to sponsor Riders Against MS of Frisco, Texas in the Bike MS Sam's Club Ride on April 30 and May 1, 2011. Organized by the National MS Society Lone Star chapter, the event is a two-day fundraising bike ride from Frisco to Fort Worth. In 2010, the event raised more than $2 million to help fight multiple sclerosis. This year marks the event's 24th year in North Texas.</p><p>Multiple sclerosis (or MS) is a chronic, often disabling disease that attacks the central nervous system. The National MS Society raises money through events across the country to fund research and provide support for those affected by MS. Bike MS has come to be known as the premier cycling series in the U.S.<br></p><p>The Bike MS Sam's Club Ride kicks-off on Saturday, April 30, when more than 3,500 cyclists will depart Frisco from the Dr. Pepper Ballpark. Cyclists will ride to Texas Motor Speedway where they will stay overnight. The following morning, the cyclists will take a victory lap for MS around Texas Motor Speedway, then head to the finish line at Sundance Square in historic downtown Fort Worth to complete the 153-mile journey.<br></p><p>To show support for the Riders Against MS team, Massage Envy is providing purple cycling jerseys and on-site licensed massage therapists will be available at Texas Motor Speedway between 1:30 and 3:30 p.m. on Saturday to help riders sooth aching muscles. Each team rider will receive a certificate to redeem for a free 30-minute massage session. The massage therapists will be available for a time after 3:30 for riders who want additional massage time at $1 per minute. Massage Envy employees will also be present at the event to help cheer on the team who are easily recognizable in their purple cycling jerseys featuring the Massage Envy logo. &nbsp;<br></p><p>"Our individual riders are dedicated to raising funds and awareness to help bring an end to this disorder once and for all," says Rod Moffitt, team captain of Riders Against MS. "Massage Envy is also dedicated to helping out the cause by being a major sponsor of our cycling team. We could not do it without them."<br></p><p>The Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy centers not only provide beneficial services to individuals, but also support events to ensure the well-being of the community as a whole.<br></p><p>"We are proud to support the Riders Against MS in this important event and to help raise awareness of and funding for MS in our community," says Brendan McBratney, owner of Massage Envy centers in Frisco and one in McKinney. "By providing on-site therapeutic massage, we hope to enable all riders to not only complete the ride, but to feel great while doing it. Massage helps reduce fatigue and speeds up the recovery time of athletes."<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Rowlett, TX -- May 03, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Having the right touch is important to a massage therapist. The same could also be said of the Rowlett Crossing Massage Envy Center in Rowlett, Texas. &nbsp;Certified massage therapist Nina Almandarez has been named Regional Therapist of the Year for 2010. She is the second consecutive staff member to be so honored -- Lead Therapist Jason Michaels was Regional Therapist of the Year for 2009.</p><p>What many of Nina's clients don't immediately realize is that she is legally blind. Nina has been with Massage Envy Rowlett for over a year, is married and has two young children. Co-owner Dr. Richard Klics notes that Nina is one of the centers "highest producing and most successful therapists."<br></p><p>"She has a great attitude, and most people do not even realize she is sight impaired unless she tells them or they get to know her a little. She is looking forward to going to Phoenix with us in May to get her award," says Dr. Klics.<br></p><p>This is the fourth year for the Regional Therapist of the Year award. Dallas/Fort Worth, with 27 centers, makes up one region. Each center employs between 25 and 45 therapists. Massage Envy Corporate selects a winner from each region. Regional winners are flown to Phoenix to receive their awards at the Gala and Awards Banquet in early May.<br></p><p>"Winning this award last year was a terrific surprise and we were so proud of Jason and our entire staff. But to win it again this year was just unbelievable! We are so happy and so proud of Nina," say co-owners Dr. Rick and April Klics.<br></p><p>Clinic Manager Morgan Tucker states that "Nobody deserves this award more than Nina. She is so sweet and compassionate to all of her clients, and such a pleasure to be around," while 2009 award recipient Jason Michaels adds, "When I asked the other therapists for suggestions on who we should nominate, it was almost unanimous, NINA!"<br></p><p>"This is such a great honor," Nina shares. "We have so many great and hard working therapists at our clinic, and I think a part of this award goes to each one of them."<br></p><p>Almandarez became a massage therapist in 2002. "I wanted to find a good career where my loss of sight would not hold me back, and where I could feel like I was making a difference.  I love doing massage and helping people, and I am glad that I work for Massage Envy.  The people here have been great and are always so positive and so helpful.  And the clients are great too.  I enjoy coming to work, and I think Massage Envy is a great career choice.  I also hope that maybe others with a disability might see me and think that maybe they can do it too!  You can't be scared or let things stop you.  You just have to reach for your dreams and believe in yourself."<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com">www.massageenvy.com</a> to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>Dallas/Fort Worth, TX -- May 19, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Stress management is essential for anyone striving to achieve a healthy lifestyle. While stress may be an accepted part of normal life, unmanaged stress can lead to health problems. Stress can weaken the immune system, cause tension headaches and increase the risk of heart disease, among other things. Stress awareness is vital to healthy living and Massage Envy Dallas/Fort Worth is here to offer some helpful tips on how to take time out from a hectic life to refresh body and mind and keep stress in check.</p><p>It is possible to reduce stress and learn to relax by using the five senses. Many holistic health practitioners agree that what people smell, taste, touch, hear and see can influence how they feel -- and maybe even bring them serenity. Try listening to soothing music during a massage or lighting a candle and taking a bath.<br></p><p>Another good way to reduce stress is to participate in an enjoyable, relaxing activity such as drawing, painting or dancing. Whether you want to draw in a sketchbook or just doodle in the margins of a newspaper, let the mind go and the imagination take over. Take a dance class in a local studio or crank up the music in your house and just dance. Studies have also suggested that viewing art, as well as creating it, can reduce stress and anxiety. Enjoy the works of art by others by visiting a museum exhibit, or just take some time to appreciate the earth's natural beauty.<br></p><p>For thousands of years, people have been meditating as a way to improve well-being. The simplest form is called concentrative meditation, which centers on slow, rhythmic breathing while the mind is cleared of all thoughts. Mindfulness meditation, on the other hand, involves focusing the mind on the thoughts and actions one is experiencing. Just be in the moment.<br></p><p>Don't worry; getting started with meditation is very simple. Just choose a quiet spot, pick a comfortable posture, focus on breathing or the repetition of a word or phrase, and be positive.<br></p><p>Last but not least, massage therapy has been proven to be one of the most effective methods for achieving stress relief. Research studies show massage therapy boosts the body's immune system, helps lower blood pressure and heart rate and relaxes muscles.<br></p><p>All types of massages help decrease stress, but the Swedish massage, reflexology and hot stone therapy are particularly good stress busters. The Swedish massage relaxes the whole body by rubbing the muscles with long, gliding strokes in the direction of the blood returning to the heart. This technique increases the level of oxygen in the blood, decreases muscle toxins and improves circulation and flexibility while easing tension in the body and decreasing one's overall stress. Reflexology massage focuses solely on the hands and feet; specific points on the extremities are targeted to send signals to the brain and balance the nervous system. Endorphins are released throughout the body, which reduces stress and returns the body to equilibrium. Hot stone therapy melts away tension and stress by placing smooth, water-heated stones at key points on the body to allow for deeper relaxation of the muscles. Hot stone therapy is becoming very popular, because it provides deeper muscle and tissue relaxation, which releases more toxins and improves circulation.<br></p><p>With the fast pace of today's world and the hectic schedules people are forced to keep, everyone can benefit from these simple and easy stress-management techniques and tools. Visit one of the 27 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy locations to learn more about how massage therapy helps people relax and de-stress.<br></p><p>At <a target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to <a target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. <p>Grand Prairie , TX -- May 26, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The Massage Envy South 360 center located in Grand Prairie now offers relaxing, healthy facials. Like massage, facials help to combat the stressors of everyday life. These stressors can damage the appearance and health of the skin. Regular facials increase circulation, reverse visible signs of aging, improve skin tone and texture, and help to eliminate blemishes and breakouts-particularly those attributable to stress.</p><p>Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials feature specially formulated products from world-renowned Murad, Inc. The Murad skincare line is based on the fact that skin cells lose the ability to retain water as they age, so Murad products are designed to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. This unmatched approach makes Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials the most effective way to achieve balanced and more youthful-looking skin.<br></p><p>A variety of skincare treatments are offered that benefit every skin type, including:</p><ul><li>AHA Rapid Exfoliator Anti-Aging Facial that helps to reveal smoother, vibrant, younger-looking skin.</li><li>Clarifying Enzyme Acne Facial that improves skin clarity, reduces blemishes and soothes inflammation.</li><li>Environmental Shield Vitamin C Infusion Facial that reverses the signs of aging that result from everyday environmental factors such as sunlight, smog, pollution and stress.</li><li>Sensitive Skin Facial that repairs and balances the skin with a gentle, yet effective treatment designed specifically to address skin that is easily irritated or sensitive.</li></ul><p>"Massage Envy takes the same dedicated approach to skin care as it does to massage, so our customers know they are in the hands of professionals who understand their needs," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "And, we are happy to offer yet another service that helps our customers look and feel their best."<br></p><p>Massage Envy has very high standards for the employees performing facials. Only estheticians licensed by the state of Texas were hired and, prior to launching this new service, the center held three days of extensive training led by both a Massage Envy trainer and two Murad representatives.<br></p><p>Like massages, facials at Massage Envy are reasonably priced. The introductory price for any of the four signature facials is just $59. <p>In Honor of Father's Day, Massage Envy Salutes a Father Son Duo<br></p><p>Arlington, TX -- Jun 07, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- If happy customers are a business's best advertising, then father and son duo Frank and Jordan Stockton are doing Massage Envy proud. A customer himself, Frank now owns three Massage Envy centers -- Fort Worth Hulen, Arlington Highlands and Uptown at West Village in Dallas. Son Jordan manages the Arlington Highlands center.</p><p>Frank, a former 23-year employee with Southwest Airlines, first discovered Massage Envy while doing his last-minute shopping in Coppell on Christmas Eve in 2005. Having enjoyed massages on a regular basis over the years for $90 and more, Massage Envy caught his attention with an introductory massage for $39. Although it sounded too good to be true, he bought gift cards for three friends, all of whom were "thrilled" with their experience at Massage Envy, so Frank went back to get a massage for himself.<br></p><p>The rest, as the story goes, is history. "I was shocked that my massage at Massage Envy was just as good if not better for half the price of what I usually paid! While checking out, I noticed Massage Envy was a franchise. Within seconds I knew the concept of convenient hours, affordable pricing and quality service was a terrific business model and decided to start investigating what it took to become an owner," Frank says.<br></p><p>Now that he's opened three centers where people can receive a wonderful massage experience, he most  enjoys interacting with his employees and customers. Frank tries to develop personal relationships and values input from others. After he opened the Fort Worth center, he would sit down with members to discuss their massage experience, which built great relationships with the customers, provided valuable customer service lessons and helped fine tune how he ran the business. He still holds focus groups with members to this day, which he deems "priceless."<br></p><p>Frank is most proud of his 23-year-old son Jordan, "a fine young man" who joined him in the business as a Sales Associate at the Fort Worth location in January 2007 when he was 18. Since then Jordan has worked at all three locations with his father gaining valuable leadership and customer service experience. "Jordan had to work his way up over the years" Frank says but after proving himself by handling more responsibility and being effective operationally, Jordan was promoted to supervisor, Assistant Center Manager and now Manager of the Arlington location.<br></p><p>Frank enjoys working with his son knowing they both value and model good customer service. "The customer is the reason we're here, so it's important to me, my son and my staff that each customer feels welcomed and appreciated. I treasure one-on-one time with employees and customers alike," he notes, adding, "They are what makes our Centers successful."<br></p><p>Another lesson Frank is passing along to his son to help him succeed at Massage Envy is rooted in advice he was given by his grandmother when he was first hired at Southwest Airlines. "I was eager to climb the corporate ladder so my grandmother told me that if I wanted to be successful, I should always be on time, maintain a positive attitude, don't make excuses, work hard even when the work wasn't fun, and do more than what was required of me so that I would stand out among the rest of my co-workers. I applied her advice then and still do to this day."<br></p><p>In addition to being the owner, Frank is still a Massage Envy customer. Massage therapy helps him relax, de-stress and rejuvenate, while promoting a healthy balance in his busy schedule. He also surrounds himself with enthusiastic and friendly employees including his son.<br></p><p>Father's Day is June 19. A Massage Envy gift card is the perfect gift for the special man in one's life. He deserves time to unwind from life's daily stresses with a relaxing massage at any of the Massage Envy DFW centers.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage EnvyDFW on Facebook - <a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter - <a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###<br></p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Prestonwood.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Allen.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy</a>&nbsp;Allen - 816 W. <p>McKinney, TX&nbsp;-- Jun 23, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Licensed Massage Therapist Joe Borchardt believes in providing celebrity treatment for each client, so it's no surprise that he has been named the new Clinic Administrator for Massage Envy Craig Ranch. The announcement was made by Brendan McBratney, owner of Massage Envy Craig Ranch, Massage Envy Stonebriar and Massage Envy Frisco North Spa, on June 20.</p><p>"Combined with his excellent skill set and expertise in customer service, dedicated service and therapeutic touch through his LMT background, his service before self specialty, and overwhelming desire to help his fellow human beings in their pursuit of health and wellness through therapeutic massage, Joe will make an excellent addition to our management team," stated McBratney.<br></p><p>Borchardt has been with Massage Envy almost five years, with more than half of that at Craig Ranch. As Clinic Administrator, he is responsible for overseeing all aspects of customer service, hiring and training. He is also attending Texas Women's University in Denton, where he expects to earn a degree in Sociology in 2012.<br></p><p>"My goal is for each person to have the $125 experience for the $59 membership, to help them improve their overall wellness and reduce stress, and to work with their wellness program," Borchardt said. He wants everyone to have the best experience possible, not just at Craig Ranch but at Massage Envy, because a person's experience reflects on Massage Envy as a whole.<br></p><p>A cancer survivor, Borchardt became a licensed massage therapist in 2006 because of his cancer experience. He wants other cancer survivors to know the benefits of massage therapy and came up with this quote.<br></p><p>"Words save us, because they empower us to feel...they empower us to think...words can hurt, or heal. Words can give hope, courage and inspire us all...But if you don't use your words...They will never be heard or known."<br></p><p>At Massage Envy Craig Ranch, Joe Borchardt will make you feel like a celebrity -- "creating a $125 experience for a $59 price every month." Pretty powerful words.<br></p><p>A one-hour introductory Massage Envy massage for non-members is only $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. There are now 27 Massage Envy locations throughout the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex and 620 nationwide. All are open seven days per week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>Cutline: Joe Borchardt in front of Harlaxton College, where he studied abroad in England last semester. <p>Third Year in a Row by Addison Magazine Readers<br></p><p>Addison, TX&nbsp;-- Jul 01, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The Massage Envy Center in Prestonwood has been voted "Favorite Massage" by readers of Addison Magazine. The magazine's 2011 Reader's Choice Award is the third in a row for the Prestonwood Massage Envy location.</p><p>"We are very proud, excited and honored to receive this award again," said Stephanie and Bruce McGovern, owners of the Prestonwood franchise of Massage Envy. "We thank everyone for helping us achieve this distinction. Recognition and praise from our customers is the highest possible accolade for our team at Massage Envy."<br></p><p>The Reader's Choice Award will be presented July 12. The Massage Envy Prestonwood center is located at 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250 in Addison. The McGoverns also own other Massage Envy franchises in Dallas and Plano.<br></p><p>With the fast pace of today's world and the hectic schedules people are forced to keep, everyone can benefit from simple and easy stress-management techniques and tools. <p>New site now hiring licensed massage therapists, estheticians, customer service reps<br></p><p>Corinth, Texas -- Jul 07, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S., will open a new spa at the Kensington Square Shopping Center in Corinth in mid July. Hiring of experienced massage therapists, licensed estheticians and customer service representatives is already under way.</p><p>Massage Envy Spa Corinth is located at 4451 FM 2181 (Swisher Road), suite 130. This will be the first Massage Envy in Denton County north of Lake Lewisville and is the 28th Massage Envy clinic in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.<br></p><p>&nbsp;"We are extremely pleased that Massage Envy has selected Corinth for this new location.  Our commercial and retail demographics are very strong for this type of business development in the Corinth community, and we welcome new retail venues to take advantage of our affluent market opportunity," commented Paul Ruggiere, Mayor, City of Corinth<br></p><p>&nbsp;"We're excited about bringing the Massage Envy Spa experience to the people in the Corinth area," said Peter Belcher, who with his wife LeeAnn, owns the new Corinth franchise. "First and foremost, we give our clients the absolute best massage experience they can imagine. We know that a wonderful experience for one client attracts others."<br></p><p>The Massage Envy Spa Corinth is hiring therapists and estheticians who want each client to leave in a happier frame of mind. "Our staff must be committed to helping clients really relax and relieve stress," said LeeAnn Belcher.<br></p><p>Applicants must hold the appropriate Texas license, be covered by a professional liability insurance policy and complete a practical and written interview. Massage therapists, estheticians and customer service representatives may send resumes to<a target="_blank">jobs@massageenvycorinth.com</a>&nbsp;or submit a job application online as follows:<br></p><p>1. &nbsp; &nbsp;  Go to massageenvycareers.com<br>2. &nbsp; &nbsp;  Click on Find Job link on left navigation bar<br>3. &nbsp; &nbsp;  Enter zip code 76210 <br>4. &nbsp; &nbsp;  Click Enter<br>5. &nbsp; &nbsp;  Select Corinth opportunities<br>6. &nbsp; &nbsp;  Click Apply Now and follow directions on the application</p><p>Like massages, facials at Massage Envy are reasonably priced. The introductory price for any of the four signature facials is just $59. Clients wishing to obtain a facial service will pay only $10 more than our regular massage therapy prices.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session or facial treatment. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. <p>Wins Consumers' Choice Award for Best Massage<br></p><p>Dallas, TX -- Jul 18, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com/</a>) -- Massage Envy's 27 clinics in the DFW area have won a Consumers' Choice Award for best massage.</p><p>"North Texans have spoken -- they voted Massage Envy the best massage in DFW," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "It's extremely gratifying to win the approval of our community. All our Dallas/Fort Worth locations share the same goal: give our clients the wonderful experience of a relaxing, affordable, convenient massage. Our clients constantly tell us how much they enjoy visiting Massage Envy. They know we pay close attention to meeting their needs. It's all about excellence and service."<br></p><p>Consumers' Choice Awards, an initiative of Consumers' Choice Institute, identify businesses that consumers voted as their choice for excellence. CCA is in its sixth year in DFW, identifying companies with outstanding customer service.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>Massage a Good Way to De-stress, Says Massage Envy<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX -- Jul 25, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- National Relaxation Day is Monday, August 15. Plan to celebrate any time during August by treating yourself to a break. Here are a few suggestions from Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S., to dial down the stress:</p><p><ul><li>Take a whole day or part of a day off. Sleep late. Lounge around the house. Enjoy a lazy day.</li><li>Do something you enjoy. Listen to music, read a good book, watch a movie.</li><li>Visit a tranquil, relaxing place like a lake, the beach, the mountains or a quiet restaurant.</li><li>Spend time relaxing in the tub or on your deck or patio.</li><li>Take a technology break -- no emails, texting or tweets; let calls go to voice mail. Soak up the silence.</li><li>Pamper yourself. Visit a spa. Enjoy a massage. (At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session is just $49.)</li><li>Don't cook. Dine out or order in. Put housework, yard work and errands on hold. This is your day to relax.</li></ul></p><p>When you take a break from your fast-paced and hectic schedule, you're saying no to stress. Visit one of the 27 Dallas/FortWorth Massage Envy locations to learn more about how massage therapy can help you relax and de-stress.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>Massage Envy DFW recommends stretching muscles<br></p><p>DALLAS FORT WORTH, TX&nbsp;-- Aug 18, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Even if you concentrate on conditioning, sports injuries happen. Apply ice to any strain or sprain during the first 72 hours, then switch to a moist heating pad. Nonprescription medicine can help control pain and a good sports massage can help as well.</p><p>Massage therapy is also a great help for sports injuries. Request a therapist experienced in sports massage, and ask that special attention be paid to any injured areas, says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "A massage therapist can stretch the muscles in trouble areas, promoting increased flexibility when the body is warm and more elastic."<br></p><p>Massage therapy helps bring blood and nutrients to the affected area to repair the soft tissue. Ideally, get a massage as soon as you can tolerate it. Massage also can help break up scar tissue and keep the muscles supple so less scar tissue develops.<br></p><p>Even when there's no injury, massage also helps athletes of all levels improve their flexibility and muscle suppleness. The kneading action of a massage disperses the accumulation of lactic acid, which causes fatigued, sore muscles.<br></p><p>With today's fast-paced and hectic schedules, you can benefit from stress-management techniques and tools. Visit one of the 28 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy locations to learn more about how massage therapy helps people relax and de-stress.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy center. All centers are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>###</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br>Massage Envy Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254  972-388-5500<br>Massage Envy Allen - 816 W. <p>GRAND PRAIRIE, TX&nbsp;-- Aug 31, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Wendy Wright is training to run a half marathon. "My son, Cohen, is the best reason for me to run and raise money for a cure for Crohn's disease," says the owner of Massage Envy Spa South 360 in Grand Prairie.</p><p>Wendy was diagnosed with Crohn's in 2002. The chronic disorder inflames the small intestine or colon. The inflammation leads to ulcerations and bowel injury. Symptoms include fatigue, abdominal pain, fever and weight loss.<br></p><p>As many as one in four Crohn's patients have a close relative with the disease, so Wendy knows there's a chance that her son Cohen will be affected. Crohn's most often strikes adolescents and young adults but can also affect young children. Some 10 percent of Crohn's patients are under age 18.<br></p><p>"So far I have been lucky and have only had mild symptoms from this very debilitating disease," Wendy said. "When I heard about the Team Challenge run, I jumped at the chance to join this cause." She will run her half-marathon December 4 in Las Vegas.<br></p><p>Several of Wendy's coworkers have contributed to her Team Challenge efforts. The center is located at 5232 South State Highway 360, Suite 610, Grand Prairie, TX 75052, phone 817-303-ENVY (3689).<br></p><p>"By supporting Team Challenge, you are also supporting me and the 1.4 million people who suffer from Crohn's disease and inflammatory colitis," Wendy said. "I want to thank my many friends and family members who are contributing to this cause which is so personal to me. Your support is really appreciated."<br></p><p>Wendy is already more than halfway to her $3,300 goal. To support Wendy's efforts, go to<a href="http://www.active.com/donate/NTX11TCVEGAS/ntxWWright" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.active.com/donate/NTX11TCVEGAS/ntxWWright">http://www.active.com/donate/NTX11TCVEGAS/ntxWWright</a>.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>ROCKWALL, TX&nbsp;-- Sep 02, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The time seems right to Kenneth Lyons, co-owner with wife Celeste of Massage Envy Rockwall Clinic. On September 1, the clinic became Massage Envy Spa Rockwall and is now offering customized facials using Murad(R) Skincare Products.</p><p>Just as massage can help deal with life's everyday stresses, so can facials. The appearance and health of our skin are affected by products applied to the face, poor diet, illness and pollution. Regular facials increase circulation, reverse visible signs of aging, improve skin tone and texture, and help to eliminate blemishes and breakouts -- particularly those attributable to stress.<br></p><p>At the yearly Massage Envy conference held this past spring, Lyons saw how well the spas worked and wanted to offer the service to his clients. "We are really excited about our new spa services and think the training will fuel the fire," he stated, adding "our clients are really excited about adding facials to their visits, too."<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials feature specially formulated products from world-renowned Murad, Inc. The Murad skincare line is based on the fact that that skin cells lose the ability to retain water as they age, so Murad products are designed to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. This unmatched approach makes Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials the most effective way to achieve balanced and more youthful-looking skin.<br></p><p>A variety of skincare treatments are offered that benefit every skin type, including:</p><ul><li>AHA Rapid Exfoliator Anti-Aging Facial that helps to reveal smoother, vibrant, younger-looking skin.</li><li>Clarifying Enzyme Acne Facial that improves skin clarity, reduces blemishes and soothes inflammation.</li><li>Environmental Shield Vitamin C Infusion Facial that reverses the signs of aging that result from everyday environmental factors such as sunlight, smog, pollution and stress.</li><li>Sensitive Skin Facial that repairs and balances the skin with a gentle, yet effective treatment designed specifically to address skin that is easily irritated or sensitive.</li></ul><p>"Massage Envy takes the same dedicated approach to skin care as it does to massage, so our guests know they are in the hands of professionals who understand their needs," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "And, we are happy to offer yet another service that helps our customers' look and feel their best."<br></p><p>Massage Envy has very high standards for the employees performing facials. Only estheticians licensed by the state of Texas have been hired and will undergo extensive training led by both a Massage Envy trainer and two Murad representatives prior to September 1.<br></p><p>Like massages, facials at Massage Envy are reasonably priced. The introductory price for any of the four signature facials is just $59. Clients wishing to obtain a facial service will pay only $10 more than the regular Massage Envy massage therapy prices.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa Rockwall is located at 2931 Ridge Road, Suite 111, Rockwall, TX 75032 and is the seventh Massage Envy Spa in Dallas/Fort Worth.<br></p><p>With today's fast pace and hectic schedules, everyone can benefit from therapeutic massage. <p>On October 12, $10 from every massage and facial will benefit The Arthritis Foundation<br></p><p>Dallas/Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- Sep 07, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy Dallas/Fort Worth (28 locations)</p><p>What:<br>Massage Envy has joined forces with the Arthritis Foundation to host Healing Hands for Arthritis, a one day national event to build awareness and raise funds to fight arthritis. On World Arthritis Day, October 12, 2011, Massage Envy Dallas/Fort Worth will donate $10 from every one hour massage session and facial to the Arthritis Foundation.</p><p>Additionally, Murad(R), Massage Envy Spa's strategic skin care partner, will donate 10 percent of all sales from their products sold at Massage Envy Spa locations during the event to the Arthritis Foundation.<br></p><p>When:<br>Wednesday, October 12, 2011</p><p>Where:<br>To make an appointment for the Healing Hands for Arthritis event, contact one of the 28 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy locations. Reservations will be accepted beginning August 18, 2011 on a first come, first serve basis.</p><p>Why:<br>Over the past two years, Massage Envy has donated nearly $100,000 to fund clinical research related to the benefits of massage therapy. Recent scientific studies have found that massage therapy increases immune function, decreases stress levels and reduces recovery time in many medical conditions including arthritis.</p><p>Details:<br>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>Massage Envy's Healing Hands Day -- October 12<br></p><p>MCKINNEY, TX&nbsp;-- Sep 16, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The word is out about Massage Envy Eldorado Parkway in McKinney. Among the clinic's members are several who receive massage therapy to cope with arthritis pain. Two share how regular massage allows them to go about their lives and are happy to have a location so close to them.</p><p>For Denise Laman, arthritis is a family affair. Both of her parents have arthritis, as did all of her grandparents. She was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis over 30 years ago, which affects most of her body, and now her son has arthritis. In recent years, Denise was also found to have psoriatic arthritis in her feet. "My elbows are about the only part of me that isn't affected," she laughs.<br></p><p>Arthritis leaves Denise with a burning sensation. She goes to Massage Envy about twice a month for what she calls pain management. After a session, the burning has eased to more of a tingle, "as if something is being released," Denise says. While she has to take arthritis and anti-inflammatory medication, massage therapy allows her to stay off pain medicine.<br></p><p>Massage therapy "is a godsend," states Denise, adding that her massage therapist at Massage Envy, Jane, is "awesome." Denise has used massage for a long time to deal with the affects of arthritis and credits her brother, a massage therapist and acupuncturist, for recommending massage therapy. Without massage, "I couldn't function without more medication -- I only take two now. I probably wouldn't even by walking."<br></p><p>"It's a lifestyle issue," states Pam Knies, referring to managing her arthritis. Simple, everyday activities aggravate and cause pain. "Driving is the worst, but even pulling weeds is a problem," she says.<br></p><p>Pam was diagnosed with arthritis about 1½ years ago but has had pain for about 10 years. She has been going to Massage Envy for massage therapy 1 to 2 times a week for the last year. "I have a really bad back, and massage keeps me from taking medication." Eventually she will need to have surgery, but massage allows her to manage the pain until then.<br></p><p>She understands that not everyone likes to be touched. But, "I tell everyone I know how good massage makes me feel," says Pam. "It's affordable, and anyone who has known me awhile can see the difference."<br></p><p>On World Arthritis Day, October 12, 2011, Massage Envy is partnering with the Arthritis Foundation to host Healing Hands for Arthritis, a one-day national Massage Envy event to build awareness and raise funds to fight arthritis. Massage Envy will donate $10 from every one-hour massage and facial on October 12 to the Arthritis Foundation. To make an appointment for the Healing Hands for Arthritis event, contact Massage Envy. To book your appointment for Healing Hands Day at one of the 28 Dallas/Fort Worth locations call 214-556-2475.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Eldorado Parkway is located at 2890 Craig Drive, Suite 120, in McKinney. Call 214-544-ENVY (3689) for an appointment.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. Americans visit massage therapists approximately 140 million times a year. The percentage of Americans using massage therapists has more than doubled since 1997.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. All clinics are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br>Massage Envy Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254  972-388-5500<br>Massage Envy Allen - 816 W. <p>On October 12, $10 from every massage and facial benefits the Arthritis Foundation.<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, Texas -- Sep 21, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy, the pioneer and national leader of affordable and convenient massage and spa services, has joined forces with the Arthritis Foundation to host Healing Hands for Arthritis, a one?day national event to build awareness and raise funds to fight arthritis. On World Arthritis Day, October 12, 2011, Massage Envy DFW will donate $10 from every one?hour massage and facial session to the Arthritis Foundation.</p><p>"Our massage therapists see firsthand the crippling effects of arthritis, the nation's leading cause of disability," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "Arthritis affects one in five adults and 300,000 children. That gives a special urgency to building awareness and funding research."<br></p><p>To make an appointment for the Healing Hands for Arthritis event, contact one of the 28 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy locations at 214-556-2475. Reservations are being accepted on a first?come, first?serve basis. All proceeds donated during Healing Hands for Arthritis will support the Arthritis Foundation's nationwide efforts to prevent, control and cure arthritis and related diseases. Additionally, Murad(R), Massage Envy Spa's strategic skin care partner, will donate 10 percent of all sales from its products sold at Massage Envy Spa locations during the event to the Arthritis Foundation.<br></p><p>"We're confident that, with support from thousands of our clients and the efforts of Massage Envy employees at more than 690&nbsp;clinics nationwide, Healing Hands for Arthritis will be a major milestone in the fight against arthritis," Mr. O'Pry said.<br></p><p>Over the past two years, Massage Envy has donated nearly $100,000 to fund clinical research related to the benefits of massage therapy. Recent scientific studies have found that massage therapy increases immune function, decreases stress levels and reduces recovery time in many medical conditions including arthritis.<br></p><p>With consumers visiting massage therapists at least 140 million times a year, it is evident that more Americans are turning to therapeutic massage to relieve the painful symptoms of arthritis and fibromyalgia, while improving circulation, joint flexibility, sleep patterns and an overall sense of well?being. The experienced, professional therapists at Massage Envy clinics can design effective and customized massage treatments to address the individual needs of any member or guest.<br></p><p>In addition to hosting Healing Hands for Arthritis, Massage Envy is a national sponsor of the Arthritis Foundation's 200 Arthritis Walk(R)events. Massage Envy owners from across the country have been and continue to have a presence at their local Arthritis Walks to share information about the benefits of massage therapy, provide chair massages and support the Arthritis Foundation's mission.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. All clinics are open seven days a week.<br><br>Follow Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.&nbsp;<br></p><p>About The Arthritis Foundation<br></p><p>Striking one in every five adults and 300,000 children, arthritis is the nation's leading cause of disability. The Arthritis Foundation (arthritis.org) is committed to raising awareness and reducing the impact of this serious disease, which can severely damage joints and rob people of living life to its fullest. The Foundation funds life?changing research that has restored mobility in patients for more than six decades; fights for health care policies that improve the lives of the millions who live with arthritis; and partners with families to provide empowering programs and information.<br></p><p>About Massage Envy<br></p><p>Massage Envy, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage in the United States. The national franchise is dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage and spa services to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations. Founded in 2002, Massage Envy has more than 690 locations in 44 states and has experienced 25 percent year-over-year growth. In addition, the average unit volume for a Massage Envy is $1 million.&nbsp;The company was recently named a top AllBusiness (a D&amp;B company) AllStar Franchise, and is a member of the International Franchise Association (IFA).&nbsp;For more information, visit<a href="http://massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">MassageEnvy.com</a>.<br></p><p>###</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br>Massage Envy Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br>Massage Envy Allen - 816 W. <p>Rowlett, TX&nbsp;-- Oct 04, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The Massage Envy clinic in Rowlett joined forces with its clients to collect food for the Rowlett food bank. The result: more than 240 food items were donated last month for local residents in need. </p><p>"I can't tell you how proud I am of our employees who headed the drive and the dozens of Rowlett residents who contributed," said Dr. Richard Klics, owner of Massage Envy Rowlett. "The food donations almost filled my pickup truck. It was a great response from our community."<br></p><p>In return for their donations, the clinic offered its clients such prizes as a free Aroma Therapy upgrade, a Deep Heat Relief Muscle Therapy, or a 30-minute massage upgrade.<br></p><p>Clinic employees Alisyn Schreiber and Vivian Ortiz headed the drive. "They did an excellent job getting the word out to our clients," said Dr. Klics. "More and more people are turning to food banks because of rising prices and high unemployment. We were glad to be able to help out."<br></p><p>Massage Envy Rowlett is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway, Suite 600. Call 972-463-0101 for an appointment.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>Local Community Showed Widespread Support of Event Benefiting the Arthritis Foundation<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, Texas -- Nov 04, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy, the pioneer and national leader of professional, affordable and convenient massage and spa services, and the Dallas/Fort Worth community came together on World Arthritis Day, October 12, to raise $16,725 during their Healing Hands for Arthritis event benefiting the Arthritis Foundation's mission to prevent, control and cure arthritis. Massage Envy DFW, and more than 700 other Massage Envy clinics around the country, donated $10 from every one-hour massage and facial to the Arthritis Foundation and collectively raised nearly $500,000 across the nation.</p><p>"We were overwhelmed by the community's strong support for Healing Hands for Arthritis," said Lance O'Pry, DFW Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "The event was truly a team effort, and we are very thankful for our wonderful members and guests, as well as our therapists, estheticians and clinic staff, who helped make it a huge success."<br></p><p>During Healing Hands for Arthritis, Murad(R), Massage Envy Spa's exclusive skin care partner, also donated 10 percent of sales from their products sold at Massage Envy Spa locations to the Arthritis Foundation.<br></p><p>Today, arthritis strikes 50 million adults and 300,000 children and is the leading cause of disability in the nation. Massage Envy partnered with the Arthritis Foundation to help conquer this painful and debilitating disease. In addition to hosting Healing Hands for Arthritis, Massage Envy is a national sponsor of the Arthritis Foundation's 200 Arthritis Walk(R) events, where local Massage Envy owners from across the country have shared information about the benefits of massage therapy, provided chair massages and supported the Arthritis Foundation's mission at their respective local walks.<br></p><p>With consumers visiting massage therapists at least 150 million times a year, it is evident that more Americans are turning to therapeutic massage to relieve the painful symptoms of arthritis and fibromyalgia, while improving circulation, joint flexibility, sleep patterns and an overall sense of well-being.<br></p><p>Over the past two years, Massage Envy has donated nearly $100,000 to fund clinical research related to the benefits of massage therapy. Recent scientific studies have found that massage therapy increases immune function, decreases stress levels and reduces recovery time in many medical conditions including arthritis.<br></p><p>The experienced, professional therapists at Massage Envy DFW clinics can design effective and customized massage treatments to address the individual needs of any member or guest. For more information, contact one of the 28 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy locations.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. All clinics are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>About Massage Envy<br></p><p>Massage Envy, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage in the United States. The company was recently named a top AllBusiness (a D&amp;B company) AllStar Franchise, and is a member of the International Franchise Association (IFA). For more information, visit MassageEnvy.com.</p><p>About The Arthritis Foundation<br></p><p>Striking one in every five adults and 300,000 children, arthritis is the nation's leading cause of disability. The Arthritis Foundation (<a href="http://www.arthritis.org/" target="_blank">www.arthritis.org</a>) is committed to raising awareness and reducing the unacceptable impact of this serious disease, which can severely damage joints and rob people of living life to its fullest. The Foundation funds life-changing research that has restored mobility in patients for more than six decades; fights for health care policies that improve the lives of the millions who live with arthritis; and partners with families to provide empowering programs and information.</p><p>#  #  #</p><p>Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br>Massage Envy Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br>Massage Envy Allen - 816 W. <p>Drop off a toy and get your holiday shopping done all at the same time<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- Nov 28, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- This season, bring your donations for Toys for Tots -- the annual Marine Corps campaign for needy children -- to &nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Firewheel-Market.aspx" target="_blank">Massage Envy's Firewheel Market</a>&nbsp;clinic in North Garland.</p><p>"We will be collecting new toys for needy children through Saturday, December 17," said Michael Khammash, director of operations of the Firewheel Market Massage Envy clinic. "We are honored to join with the U.S. Marine Corps and its Toys for Tots program in making Christmas brighter for children in our area."<br></p><p>The <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/clinics/TX/Firewheel-Market.aspx" target="_blank">Garland&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;clinic</a>&nbsp;has moved to 4430 Lavon Drive, Suite 310, in Firewheel Market, 75040, phone (972) 675-ENVY (3689).<br></p><p>During the holiday season, local Marine Reserve units nationwide collect new toys and donations to provide toys to millions of children.<br></p><p>"The Tots for Tots campaign brings holiday joy to children," Mr. Khammash said. "Many times one or more parents are out of work. Other children have experienced a death of a parent, some are in orphanages and foster homes, and others live in very poor communities." &nbsp;<br></p><p>From Monday, November 21, through Saturday, December 24, 2011, Dallas/Fort Worth area Massage Envy clinics are offering a special holiday promotion - buy three gift cards valued at $60 or more (or one at $180) and get a one-hour massage session free. <p>Partnership with 94.9 KLTY now in its third year<br></p><p>DALLAS/FORT WORTH, TX&nbsp;-- Dec 02, 2011 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- 'Twas the month of December, and all through the town, Christmas wishes are granted, good cheer does abound</p><p>For the third straight year, Massage Envy clinics in the DFW Metroplex are partnering with radio station 94.9 KLTY for its Christmas Wish program.<br></p><p>Christmas Wish supports deserving families and individuals by publishing their letters (often sent by a friend or relative) and encouraging local businesses, groups and individuals to choose a wish to grant.<br></p><p>Massage Envy will make a donation of $5,000 to a family in need and publicize the Christmas Wish program on Massage Envy's Facebook page.<br></p><p>"After reading many Christmas Wish letters this year, the DFW Massage Envy team realized how much need there is right here in our own community," said Lance O'Pry, Massage Envy Regional Developer. "Through this special program we will support a family that is truly in need. It is a very humbling blessing for all of us to take part in Christmas Wish, and we encourage other businesses to join us."<br></p><p>In addition to supporting a family, Massage Envy is giving away two Massage Envy gift cards every day until Christmas Eve day to lucky listeners of KLTY. Each gift card is valid for a one-hour massage session at any of the 28 DFW-area Massage Envy clinics.<br></p><p>Mr. O'Pry added that "Christmas Wish captures the spirit of Christmas and highlights the wonderful generosity of the people of Dallas/Fort Worth. It's a community project that all of us can support and feel good about."<br></p><p>Now in its tenth year, the Christmas Wish project has raised an estimated $3.5 million through the generosity of listeners and advertisers. In addition to Massage Envy, other major sponsors are Chick-Fil-A and Capital One.<br></p><p>Also, through Saturday, December 24, 2011, Dallas/Fort Worth area Massage Envy clinics are offering a special holiday promotion -- buy three gift cards valued at $60 or more (or one at $180) and get a one-hour massage session free. This offer is only valid at the 28 DFW-area Massage Envy clinics. Seven of the DFW Massage Envy clinics are spas that offer Murad(R) healthy skin facials. Massage Envy gift cards may be used for any combination of products and services offered in any Massage Envy clinic nation-wide.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session.
