Bottom line: Alibaba-affiliated Ant Financial is experiencing breakneck growth through its roll-out of a wide array of new products and services, and could be valued at up to $150 billion by the time it makes its IPO as soon as next year.<br><br>A new report is spotlighting the rapid rise of Ant Financial, the financial services affiliate of e-commerce giant Alibaba that looks set to challenge not only domestic rival UnionPay but also upcoming drives into China by global giants Visa and MasterCard. Much of Ants incredibly rapid rise is tied to its core Alipay asset, which began life as an electronic payments service but is rapidly moving into other areas like credit card-style offline payments and savings account services.<br><br>The latest reports also contain a new figure on Ants valuation following its first major capital raising. That figure of $45 billion is substantially larger than an earlier figure of $30 billion that was contained in initial reports on the funding just a week ago. (previous post) But those earlier reports also pointed out the low valuation was based on shares that were probably sold at a discount to a big domestic institutional investor, perhaps for strategic reasons, and that the real value could be as high as $50 billion.<br><br>The latest reports show just why Ant is getting such rich valuations, as it tries to become Chinas first privately owned giant specializing in a wide array of financial services. The reports say that Ant has been quietly mounting a campaign to get Alipay accepted in traditional brick-and-mortar stores that now mostly accept only UnionPay, Chinas homegrown transaction settlement network operator that is a joint venture of the nations major banks.<br><br>According to the reports, more than 130,000 Chinese offline stores now accept payment by Alipay, and another 900,000 taxi cabs can also accept payment via the service.&nbsp;One of Alipays biggest new clients is Yum Brands&nbsp; KFC chain, which recently began accepting Alipay and is planning to quickly expand the program into all of its 4,500 stores in China. (previous post) Since then Ive seen similar reports saying Alipay is also moving into KFCs fast-food rival McDonalds.<br><br>The taxi initiative looks different from anything Ive seen to date, and shows why Ant is quickly gaining ground on the stodgier and more conservative UnionPay. Most taxis in China dont accept any payment besides cash, though my adopted hometown of Shanghai has for years allowed payment using city-backed subway cards. UnionPay could have easily tried to tap this market at any time, but instead has focused on building up a retail-based network similar to those operated by MasterCard and Visa.<br><br>Meantime, the real MasterCard and Visa are probably looking increasingly at Alipay and Ant as their top competitor for the day when they can finally enter the China market for domestic yuan-denominated transactions. The pair recently won permission to enter China after filing a complaint at the WTO. But even so, they will have to wait until 2018 to offer such yuan-denominated services due to a Chinese law that prohibits companies from offering such services for the first 3 years after they enter the market. By that time, Alipay could easily overtake UnionPay and become the main rival for the 2 western giants.<br><br>As to Ants valuation, the latest $45-$50 billion figure is roughly in line with reports from earlier this year when word of the funding first splashed into the headlines. Ant has said its not in any hurry to make an IPO, even though reports last week indicated the company was being pressured to list on a new strategic industries board that could launch in Shanghai as soon as next year. (previous post)<br><br>I was always a bit skeptical about valuations for Alibaba during the companys meteoric rise, even though I was often wrong. I still question the big figures, but clearly others think the company is quite valuable due to its vision and aggressive practices. Investors are now applying similar thinking to Ant, and I wouldnt be surprised to see the companys value easily double and possibly triple by the time it makes its highly anticipated domestic IPO as early as next year or in 2017.<br><br>Doug Young is a former China company news chief for Reuters who teaches financial journalism at Fudan University in Shanghai. To read more of his commentaries on China tech news, click on <a href="http://www.youngchinabiz.com">www.youngchinabiz.com</a>.
<p><a href="http://www.italki.com/article/414/the-language-toolbox-for-any-language-learner" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.italki.com/article/414/the-language-toolbox-for-any-language-learner">http://www.italki.com/article/414/the-language-toolbox-for-any-language-learner</a> <br></p>
<p>Today Im ready to share one of my favourite discoveries of this year for learning a language; <a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki" target="_blank">italki.</a></p><p>Ive reviewed several websites in the past, such as&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/lingq-review/" target="_blank">LingQ</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/busuu-livemocha-review/" target="_blank">Livemocha &amp; Busuu</a>,<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/duolingo/" target="_blank">DuoLingo</a>, and paid courses such as&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/rosetta-stone-review/" target="_blank">Rosetta Stone</a>. They each have advantages and disadvantages, but my conclusion is generally the same, that you cant beat the best language learning system in the world;&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/hb/" target="_blank">HB 2.0</a>. (Spoiler alert, HB stands for&nbsp;Human Beings)</p><p>And thats the reason why I like italki so much. There are no courses or gimmicks to distract you, it focuses&nbsp;entirely&nbsp;on connecting you to Human Beings.</p><p>If you live in an international city, there are&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/social-search" target="_blank">some social networks</a>&nbsp;like Couchsurfing and meetup.com can be great sites to check out to try and meet up with people in person, but if you&nbsp;cant&nbsp;find those people, then of course thanks to the wonders of the Internet, you can simply&nbsp;Skype&nbsp;a native speaker and speak to them to practice your language from the comfort of your home.</p><p>As Im trying to demonstrate with&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/arabic-mission/" target="_blank">my current project</a>, you can actually learn to speak a language very well by doing it&nbsp;entirely&nbsp;via Skype. Once you find those people to practise with and learn from via Skype, then you have no excuse to not make progress as quickly as possible, which your speed depending on how many spoken sessions you get and how intensively you are learning.</p><p></p><h2>WIDE RANGE OF LANGUAGES AVAILABLE</h2><p>I started using this site back in February with&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/chinese/" target="_blank">Chinese</a>, and I found it worked out cheaper than getting in-person lessons, even though I was in the country with plenty of teachers available around me. The selection was actually&nbsp;better&nbsp;on this site for Mandarin teachers than what I could find on online advertisement boards or in newspapers in Taipei itself!</p><p>As well as this, it was way more convenient to do it from home, than travel across town for the more affordable lessons, so I actually moved&nbsp;all&nbsp;my lessons to be entirely Skype based.</p><p>And over the summer, I wanted to work on improving&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/polyglot-summer/" target="_blank">every single one of my languages</a>. So I actually got Skype lessons to help me improve my Spanish, French, German and Italian (analyzing cultural subtleties, such as complex lines in a movie, or improving my accent, as these are my best languages  as well as fixing a few annoying mistakes that were slipping into my dialogues). (I used another resource for Dutch, and didnt bother working on my Portuguese since I knew Id be spending three months in Brazil)</p><p>I continued to use it to help me maintain my Chinese, and&nbsp;even&nbsp;get back into my American Sign Language to prepare for my visit to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/gallaudet" target="_blank">Gallaudet university</a>. Yes  you can learn sign language via Skype of course. It was great to be getting back into ASL despite being in Hong Kong of all places! I found my ASL teacher on this site.</p><p>And finally, now Im learning Arabic, and once again the vast majority of my lessons are with teachers Ive found via&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki" target="_blank">italki</a>. There were a large enough pool of teachers to choose from that I could even focus specifically just on teachers from Egypt, as that dialect is my priority.</p><p>Youll find that all the major languages are covered with a lot of teachers and exchange partners to choose between, and some minor ones have a couple of teachers  this is only going to improve with time as the site is growing very quickly.</p><h2>THREE OPTIONS: LESSONS FROM PROFESSIONAL TEACHERS, PRACTICE WITH ENTHUSIASTS AND FREE LANGUAGE EXCHANGE</h2><p>I have personally used the site exclusively for&nbsp;paid&nbsp;lessons, although I havent even paid that much (see below). Having said that, it can also work for those looking not to spend any money at all.</p><p>You have three options to choose from when searching for someone to help you with your target language:</p><p><a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki"><img width="440" alt="" src="http://www.fluentin3months.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/lessons.jpg" height="39" title="lessons"></a></p><ul><li>Language Lessons</li></ul><p>The language lessons option is given only by&nbsp;professional teachers. So this would be those who have experience teaching offline/in the real world, with certification as language professionals (uploaded to the site for verification).</p><p>This option tends to be more expensive, but you can be more confident that youd get a high quality lesson, as the teacher is expected to guide the lesson more and adapt to your needs better, based on their experience. This obviously varies with the person you have the lesson with.</p><ul><li>Speaking Practice</li></ul><p>This option is given by a native speaker (if you select it) who is eager to help others by teaching the language. They may not have any experience teaching off Skype, and would have a day-job unrelated to teaching.</p><p>It can be tricky to get a lesson with a less experienced teacher when you are starting off yourself. These lessons are more appropriate when you are truly interested in practising, with someone who will patiently listen and correct your mistakes. This option is usually more affordable than the language lessons option, specifically because its less likely to follow a lesson format.</p><p>In my case, this option is quite fine. Ive got teaching experience so I can decide to take the role of deciding where the lesson goes. This is a LOT of work when Im also a beginner in the language however, and its difficult when the teacher keeps asking So, what do you want to talk about now? with my current very limited vocabulary.</p><p>The thing is, sometimes even when someone doesnt have a certificate, or experience in a classroom, they can be an&nbsp;excellent&nbsp;teacher. Ive found people at this level that are honestly way better teachers than those with diplomas, who can also take the lesson in a direction that works well for the student, while some professional teachers have a fixed programme that they stick very rigidly too, which may not work well for a particular student.</p><p>The ideal thing is to try out several teachers (see Trial explanation below) from both categories and go with the one(s) you feel is helping you the most.</p><ul><li>Language Exchange</li></ul><p>This option is great if you cant afford to be getting private lessons, but still want time with a native who is motivated to patiently listen to you and correct your mistakes. All you have to do in exchange is to teach them&nbsp;your&nbsp;native language!</p><p>And yes, the demand for English teachers is&nbsp;huge&nbsp; especially if you speak a dialect they happen to be interested in.</p><p>In this sense, the large pool of people and the ability to search means youll find quite a lot of people here! Since the conversation is ultimately over Skype, and the site just acts as a way to find these people, you could also search in other sites like<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/busuu-livemocha-review/" target="_blank">Livemocha/Busuu</a>&nbsp;and message them to connect to Skype. The forum on this blog also has an active&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/forum/find-a-conversation-exchange/" target="_blank">language exchange board</a>&nbsp;where people announce the language combination.</p><p>Since its free, Id recommend trying italki out with the other options until you find the person or people you find is/are definitely helping YOU out. If you end up speaking just in English (presuming thats your native language), then you should consider finding someone else. The search facility makes italki that extra bit easier to use.</p><h2>MANY TRIAL LESSONS FOR $1-5? IDEAL FOR FINDING THE BEST TEACHER FOR YOU</h2><p>There are loads of other sites that let you search for paid teachers. Ive tried a bunch out (Ill actually share all of the ones I used for Chinese in a separate post, since I didnt exclusively use italki; although if you have Arabic alternatives for me, let me know so I can perhaps review that later too), and generally I just find italkis interface so much cleaner and easier to navigate.</p><p>But one thing that makes it stand out is that (if the teacher has enabled that option) you can get a&nbsp;trial lesson&nbsp;with&nbsp;each&nbsp;teacher for a much better rate than their normal class rate.</p><p>This allows you to actually go through a&nbsp;bunch&nbsp;of trial lessons at first and find which teacher works in a way that is going to help your needs best. Whenever I started to use teachers for any of the languages of this year, I went through trials of as many as I could find, and had full-price lessons only with the&nbsp;good&nbsp;ones.</p><p>For me for example, if the teacher is doing most of the talking and teaching at me, with a pre-made course that I just have to basically keep grunting to show them Im still online, then I consider it wasting my time, as I can get this information from a book or Youtube just as easily without paying by the hour. Then again you might prefer the traditional course approach and dislike teachers that Id enjoy classes with.</p><p>It was great to be able to try out dozens of teachers, but not actually end up spending so much money. (Of course, you only get one trial maximum per teacher) A few people have been asking me to recommend specific teachers, and I really think trying several of them out for yourself is by far the best option, as the cheaper trial option really wont break the bank.</p><p><a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki"><img width="346" alt="" src="http://www.fluentin3months.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/trial.jpg" height="120" title="trial"></a></p><p>The actual price of the trial and the main lesson depends on a lot of factors, including:</p><ul><li>Does the teacher have enough reviews to be able to raise their rates yet (he/she may be a new teacher, but still really good, and as such has cheap trial rates to encourage more people to try out a lesson),</li><li>What country are they from (my teachers in China were cheap for&nbsp;both&nbsp;trialsand main lessons; the main lessons with some of my teachers were as low as US$5!! And these are good teachers! They just happen to live deep inside China where living expenses are much lower. But currency differences means that teachers in Europe, North America, Japan etc. tend to be more expensive)</li><li>The teachers experience overall and possible lesson quality</li></ul><h2>INTERESTING REFERRAL SYSTEM FOR SAVING MONEY</h2><p>Now, Ive been getting two spoken lessons/practice sessions in Arabic&nbsp;a day&nbsp;since my project started almost a month ago.&nbsp;<a href="http://speakfromday1.com/" rel="external nofollow">Speaking from day 1</a>&nbsp;is my mantra, and its the only way a&nbsp;fluent in 3 months&nbsp;goal is feasible, so you can bet I encourage you to also speak as much as often, as early as possible.</p><p>Those in Egypt are charging about US$8-15 per hour long lesson. So with a bit of mathematics, you may guess that Im spending about US$600 a month on private lessons (which would already be better than most generic courses where you are sitting in a class being talked at, especially considering you are getting one-on-one attention).</p><p>In fact, Ive spent much less. You see, italki have an interesting referral system  so if you click&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki" target="_blank">this link</a>&nbsp;to their site, youll connect to&nbsp;my profile&nbsp;on the site and see some details of how my learning is going (although Ive enabled privacy settings in some cases). By signing up on this referral link, if you decided to go for paid lessons then Id earn credit for this, and ultimately it costs the exact same for you.</p><p>At the moment, the referral gives you US$20 credit to be used on the site, for every $40 spent by those you have personally referred.</p><p>Ive dropped the italki link to my profile inside of a blog post or two this year, and promoted it actively in the Language Hacking League email once. The resulting sign-ups have given me free credit, which Ive been using for my lessons. So by writing this blog post and sharing a resource I genuinely find useful, Im also ultimately getting more free lessons  cool huh?</p><p>This means that after you get into it, if you decide to tell others about it, use&nbsp;yourreferral link (on Facebook, or on your blogs sidebar if you have one etc., or even in an email) and youll get enough for&nbsp;several&nbsp;lessons if that person decides to pay for some lessons. [If you dont want to sign up&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki" target="_blank">on my referral link</a>&nbsp;(since Im using it in this blog post), just type italki.com into your browser, although the result is the same, whether you buy lessons or go just for the free exchanges]</p><p>I have also spent my own money though. Another advantage of this system is that it lets you pay by&nbsp;credit card, paypal, Moneybookers bank transfer, Skrill, China Union pay, Allpay, cashu,&nbsp;and&nbsp;webmoney. In my case, paypal is really convenient as I prefer to avoid paying a lot on credit, as doing so had me in debt&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/hitting-a-brick-wall-in-your-language-progress/" target="_blank">a few years ago</a>.</p><h2>EARN MONEY AS A TEACHER</h2><p>As well as using the system to learn a language, you can also earn money through it by applying to be a teacher. You should consider this both if you are a qualified professional&nbsp;and&nbsp;if you are simply enthusiastic to teach your native (or high level fluent) language to others, while earning from it.</p><p>The system takes a 15% commission from your classes (which is way less than what a school like Berlitz used to take from student payments to teacher earnings when I used to work for them&nbsp;<img alt="" src="http://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/72x72/1f61b.png">&nbsp;), and since its a large network you are much more likely to find students than you would by trying to advertise independently in many cases.</p><h2>EASY TO USE INTERNATIONAL TIME MANAGER</h2><p><a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki"><img width="498" alt="" src="http://www.fluentin3months.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/calendar.jpg" height="233" title="calendar"></a></p><p>While testing out a&nbsp;LOT&nbsp;of alternative sites for finding private language lessons (especially for Chinese), one major headache was trying to synchronise times with the teachers. When we were in the same country, it was a non-issue, but otherwise I had to use online time conversions to figure things out.</p><p>One site I found sticks to only using GMT, which drove me crazy because during the summer (because of daylight savings), this time only applies to Iceland!! Since I was checking London time (even though I wasnt even in that time zone), I wasted an hour waiting for my teachers on that other site.</p><p>italki simply shows you a calendar for whatever you have set your time-zone to. Its all you have to concern yourself with  but it shows you availabilities that your teachers have that&nbsp;they&nbsp;have selected, based on their own timezone. This synchs up nicely and there is no confusion about it, and you see all times from your perspective.</p><p>As well as this, the system will email you two hours before your class starts, to remind you, which is great if you arent super organized.</p><h2>PROBLEMS WITH THE SYSTEM?</h2><p>italki is a recent start up that is growing very quickly. As such they are very receptive to feedback. In fact, I had the chance to meet up with Kevin Chang, the CEO, briefly when I was passing through Shanghai (where the company is based).</p><p>I held out on writing this review because I did indeed have several frustrating issues with the system, and wasnt shy to vent these to Kevin throughout the year. He was very receptive in fixing problems with the referral system and annoying issues I had with privacy on the site, as well as a few other minor issues.</p><p>Luckily these problems have been removed, so I have much less negative things to say about the system, and its why Im so eager to recommend it!</p><p>One recent feedback I gave Kevin though, which Id like to see is&nbsp;a personal note&nbsp;to leave on teacher pages. After a lesson, you can write a review of a teacher for everyone to see, and this will help others decide if they should have a lesson with the teacher. But sometimes Id like to write my own note that other people dont need to see.</p><p>Maybe the teacher was excellent, but doesnt work with my own approach or personality. In one of the systems I used for Chinese there was a non-published note only you could see, and this helped me keep track of what I personally saw as teachers strengths and who I probably shouldnt have lessons with again, without punishing them with a public bad review. Having said that, seeing public reviews of teachers is a great way to vent out the bad ones, and make sure you dont waste time to begin with.</p><p>Another thing is that Id like to have an option to synch my italki calendar with my Google Calendar automatically, since Id generally manually add lessons into my calendar each time.</p><p>Other than these two minor points that dont affect the overall experience much, all other frustrations Ive had with the system this year have actually been removed, so I cant quite nitpick much further!</p><h2>OVERALL, DEFINITELY WORTH CHECKING OUT!</h2><p>There are other features of the site, such as the ability to add public notes in your target language, that are like status updates, but that natives can comment on to correct you. Its great to be able to ask a question about a grammatical feature, or quick translation question, of the language and have the community answer it for you for free.</p><p>There is also a chat feature that you can use with someone before youd leave the site to call via Skype. Im sure the site will continue to improve and expand with time.</p><p>Of course, the quality you get out of it, depends on how much work you put into it. At the end of the day, it will be you and another person on Skype and youll have to work hard to make sure you progress in your target language, and work well with them. In many cases, its as much the students fault as it is the teachers if progress is slow.</p><p>Ill write another post later about how Id recommend working with teachers efficiently to learn as well as possible, and get as much value out of that time as possible.</p><p>The system follows my own philosophy, by focusing on human connections andspeaking&nbsp;languages as the focus, and as such I do recommend&nbsp;<a href="http://www.fluentin3months.com/italki" target="_blank">you give it a try</a>.</p><div><br></div>
<p>italki is preparing to host its biggest <a href="http://www.italki.com/languagechallenge">Language Challenge</a> ever, with over a thousand language learners expected to intensively study for the month of June. To complete the challenge a learner will have to complete 12 hours of lessons with a <a href="http://www.italki.com/teacher/professional/">professional teacher or community tutor</a> on italki between June 1st and June 30th. Participants who complete the challenge will be rewarded with italki credits and gifts. Registration for the June 2015 challenge is now open at <a href="http://www.italki.com/languagechallenge">www.italki.com/languagechallenge</a>. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>"The Language Challenge is a great way to get motivated and to make real progress on learning a foreign language. I have friends that want to improve their Chinese, but they often make excuses saying, 'Why now?' The Language Challenge is a reason to start now." said Kevin Chen, co-founder at italki.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>A well-known polyglot at <a href="http://www.lindsaydoeslanguages.com/">Lindsay Does Languages</a>, Lindsay Dow, found that the Language Challenge helped her reach her personal learning goals:</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Having a variety of lessons motivated me to keep going and even on the days when I didnt feel up to it, or didnt feel that I had the time, knowing that the lesson was booked and I was going to be paying if I liked it or not meant I couldnt slack off! No procrastination on Facebook, no 5 more minutes YouTube and no excuses. And every time I felt a sense of achievement. said Dow.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>How it works: </p><p>Participants pay an entry fee of $10 to join the Language Challenge. &nbsp;If the challenger completes 12 hours of lessons with an italki teacher within the month of June, they will receive a reward of $40 in italki credits. italki credits are used for 1-on-1 online classes with professional native-speaker teachers. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Challenge History: </p><p>The original concept behind the Language Challenge was based on two key ideas: a city marathon, and a smart incentivization scheme. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Similar to a city marathon, the Language Challenge brings language learners to socially "train" together to achieve a defined goal. The social element turns the challenge into a public event, and helps the participants encourage each other to complete the challenge.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>"Having a defined goal, such as taking 12 lessons, is crucial for focus. In language learning, it's not easy to set a goal because progress is not easy to quantify, and there is always more room to improve." said Kevin Chen, co-founder of italki</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>The other idea was to offer a reward to people who achieve their goals, and to have the reward funded by the people who fail to achieve them. This concept was inspired by experimental gyms that were testing new payment models, such as charging higher membership fees for people who failed to go to the gym regularly.¹</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>The first Language Challenge was held in 2012, and the June 2015 challenge is the 10th in the series. The number of challengers has increased in almost every challenge, and over a thousand challengers are expected to participate in June. The Language Challenge attracts learners from all around the world, and many celebrity polyglots and language enthusiasts have participated in previous challenges. </p><p><b><br><br></b></p><p>For more information about the June 2015 Language Challenge, please follow this link:</p><p><a href="http://www.italki.com/languagechallenge">www.italki.com/languagechallenge</a></p><p><b><br></b></p><p>For stories from previous Language Challenge participants, please follow this link:</p><p><a href="http://stories.italki.com/story/category/language-challenge">http://stories.italki.com/story/category/language-challenge</a></p><p><b><br><br></b></p><p>italki Company Introduction</p><p>italki.com is a community marketplace that connects language learners with teachers around the world. Learners can find a native teacher to improve their fluency through 1-on-1 lessons on Skype. There are over 3000 teachers on italki teaching over 50 languages, and thousands of language lessons take place every day. italki hopes to bring effective and affordable language learning to every place on Earth.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>For more information, please visit: <a href="http://www.italki.com">www.italki.com</a>.</p><p></p><p>For press inquiries please contact: <a>ivan@italki.com</a></p><div><br></div>

<p>Almost 200 toys collected in Toys for Tots campaign<br></p><p>DALLAS/FORT WORTH, TX&nbsp;-- Jan 13, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Alisyn Schreiber and her co-workers at Massage Envy Rowlett know that Christmas is all about gifts given, not gifts received. The resultalmost 200 toys for area children.</p><p>Partnering with Toys for Tots, the annual Marine Corps campaign for needy children, the staff at the Rowlett Massage Envy clinic collected toys for more than four weeks before Christmas.<br></p><p>"We believe that every child should be able to open a present on Christmas morning," Ms. Schreiber said. "And every family should be able to celebrate the holiday season without stress or worry."<br></p><p>Spearheaded by Ms. Schreiber, the clinic offered incentives to both clients and the staff to donate toys. Toys for Tots signs and a donation box were prominently displayed at the clinic during November and December.<br></p><p>"We chose to work with Toys for Tots this Christmas because we care about bringing joy and happiness to those who aren't as fortunate as others," Ms. Schreiber said. "Many of us are parents, grandparents, aunts and uncles, and we wanted to be able to reach out to families in the DFW area. Next year, we want to shoot for 300 toys."<br></p><p>"We're so happy and proud of our staff," said Dr. Rick Klics and his wife, April, owners of Massage Envy Rowlett. "This was their idea, and they did all of the work to make this so successful. It really feels good to give back to our community." &nbsp;<br></p><p>Several Massage Envy clinics in the D/FW area joined with the U.S. Marine Corps and its Toys for Tots program.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>For more information, log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. All clinics are open seven days per week.<br></p><p>More information may also be found on Facebook at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>. Massage Envy fans and followers receive the latest news about massage therapy as well as any current and upcoming specials.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. <p>Customized Facials Will Use Murad Skincare Products<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, Texas -- Feb 01, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- As of January 23, Massage Envy Rowlett clinic will be Massage Envy Spa Rowlett. The Spa now offers customized facials using Murad(R) Skincare Products, says Dr. Richard Klics, owner of Massage Envy Spa Rowlett.</p><p>Just as massage can help deal with everyday stresses, so can facials. Your skin's appearance and health can suffer from products applied to the face, poor diet, illness and pollution. Regular facials increase circulation, reverse visible signs of aging, improve skin tone and texture, and help eliminate blemishes and breakouts -- particularly those caused by stress.<br></p><p>At last year's Massage Envy conference, Dr. Klics saw how well other spas worked and wanted to offer the service to his clients. "Our new spa services offer a new relaxing dimension for our clients," said Dr. Klics. "Our guests are really excited about adding facials to their visits."<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials feature specially formulated products from world-renowned Murad, Inc. Because skin cells lose the ability to retain water as they age, Murad products are specially formulated to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. This unmatched approach makes Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials the most effective way to achieve balanced and more youthful-looking skin.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa Rowlett offers a variety of skincare treatments that benefit every skin type, including:<br></p><p> AHA Rapid Exfoliator Anti-Aging Facial helps reveal smoother, vibrant, younger-looking skin.<br> Clarifying Enzyme Acne Facial improves skin clarity, reduces blemishes and soothes inflammation.<br> Environmental Shield Vitamin C Infusion Facial reverses signs of aging caused by environmental factors such as sunlight, smog, pollution and stress.<br> Sensitive Skin Facial repairs and balances the skin with a gentle, yet effective treatment designed specifically to address skin that is easily irritated or sensitive.</p><p>"Massage Envy takes the same dedicated approach to skin care as it does to massage, so our guests know they are in the hands of professionals who understand their needs," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "And, we are happy to offer yet another service that helps our customers' look and feel their best."<br></p><p>Because of Massage Envy's high standards for employees performing facials, only estheticians licensed by the state of Texas were hired for the Rowlett spa. They underwent extensive training, led by both a Massage Envy trainer and two Murad representatives, before January 23.<br></p><p>Like massages, facials at Massage Envy are reasonably priced. Clients can have a facial for only $10 more than the regular Massage Envy massage therapy price.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa Rowlett is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway, Suite 600, Rowlett, and is the eighth Massage Envy Spa in Dallas/Fort Worth.<br></p><p>With today's fast pace and hectic schedules, everyone can benefit from facials and therapeutic massage. <p>National Sleep Awareness Week is March 7-13, 2012<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- Feb 15, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- If you've ever had a thorough massage, you know how relaxing it can be. So it's no surprise that massage can help when you're having trouble sleeping, notes Massage Envy.</p><p>The benefits of massage are many -- loosen or soothe sore, aching muscles; reduce stress; improve circulation; release tension; lower heart rate and blood pressure; and help strengthen the immune system. These relaxing effects make massage a big help in restoring restful sleep.<br></p><p>Massage can also help treat sleeping problems due to stress, migraine headache, pain, and muscle and joint stiffness. National Sleep Awareness Week, March 7-13, is the perfect time to improve your sleep.<br></p><p>The leading massage provider in the U.S., Massage Envy "believes that everybody deserves a good night's sleep," said Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth regional developer for Massage Envy. "That's why we offer affordable massage therapy sessions with flexible appointment times seven days a week to fit even the busiest schedules. And, with 28 locations in the Dallas/Fort Worth area, massage has never been more convenient."<br></p><p>Therapeutic massage relieves stress by easing muscle tightness and increasing circulation throughout the body. Massage also lowers levels of the stress hormone cortisol and promotes the release of pain-killing endorphins in the brain.<br></p><p>Clients receiving ongoing massage therapy from Massage Envy report a sense of mental clarity and an increased ability to turn off stressors and achieve optimal rest and relaxation.<br></p><p>Massage also increases blood flow to sore, painful muscles, bringing in healing oxygen and nutrients and helping remove waste products in muscles. The result: less swelling and stiffness and increased flexibility to help eliminate pain.<br></p><p>Because massage helps ease stress, strain and pain, you're more calm and relaxed and better prepared for quality, restorative sleep.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. <p>ROWLETT, TX&nbsp;-- Feb 23, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Within the Massage Envy universe, the Rowlett Massage Envy Spa latest achievement may be a first -- for the third consecutive year, the Regional Therapist of the Year has been chosen from the Rowlett clinic. Alisyn Schreiber is the 2011 honoree. And the clinic, owned by Dr. Richard and April Klics, won't even celebrate its fifth anniversary until March 16, 2012.</p><p>Alisyn currently is Lead Therapist at Massage Envy Spa Rowlett and has been full time with the clinic for two years. She is a very busy woman. In 2011, she performed almost 1500 hours of massage in addition to scheduling, hiring and training massage therapists. A popular therapist, requested therapist bookings make up 65 percent of her schedule.<br></p><p>Schreiber said, "I am so excited and honored. I love my job and helping people, and I am so lucky to be able to make a living doing something I love. Then to win an award like this -- I could hardly sleep for days after I found out. I am so happy I came to work for Massage Envy Spa in Rowlett."<br></p><p>Dr. Klics commented, "Alisyn has grown a lot in the last year as a person and a therapist. Though she is still quite young, she impresses everyone she meets with her knowledge and experience. She regularly initiates and works on community projects in order to help those in need. But best of all, Alisyn always has a big smile and words of encouragement for everyone she sees. Staff and clients alike love her for her knowledge and appreciate her patience and kindness."<br></p><p>She joins 2009 Regional Therapist of the Year Jason Michaels and 2010 Regional Therapist of the Year Nina Almandarez. Both are still with Massage Envy Spa Rowlett. Having three Therapists of the Year on staff is both a special accomplishment and source of pride for the clinic.<br></p><p>"The first time was a shock, we really didn't expect it since there are so many large and successful clinics in the DFW region," says Dr. Klics. "The second year we knew that we had all worked hard and felt so honored and humbled to have won the award in back to back years. But to win it for a third straight year is just beyond words. I am so proud of my people and all their hard work and dedication to the profession. It is nice to be recognized, but we accept this award with great humility and thanks to our friends and the Massage Envy brand for their support."<br></p><p>Alisyn is looking forward to attending the annual conference Massage Envy Corporate holds in Phoenix, Arizona, each year. The Regional Therapists of the Year from all around the country are honored at an awards ceremony.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa Rowlett is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway, Suite 600, Rowlett.<br></p><p>With today's fast pace and hectic schedules, everyone can benefit from facials and therapeutic massage. <p>Massage Envy Spa Preston Park Village Reaping Benefits of Popularity<br></p><p>Plano, TX&nbsp;-- Feb 28, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Thousands of North Texans are turning to massage therapy and facials to relax and de-stress. Exhibit A in this surge of popularity is Massage Envy SPA -- Preston Park Village.</p><p>"Our revenues are up 20 percent year over year," says Bruce McGovern, who, with his wife, Stephanie, owns four Massage Envy clinics including the Spa in Plano. "Along with growing demand for therapeutic massage, we will be adding facials and spa services in the next 30 days, so our growth curve should continue upward."<br></p><p>There's more to the spa's growth than revenues. Massage Envy SPA -- Preston Park Village has moved to a new 3,500-square foot location at 1900 Preston Road, Suite 201, Plano TX 75093 (972) 964-0600, adding two rooms and separate waiting areas for spa and massage clients.<br></p><p>The Plano Preston Park Village site is the first in the DFW area to incorporate new Massage Envy specifications for color schemes. "It's a relaxed and welcoming environment where our clients will feel right at home," Mr. McGovern said. "We've evolved from a neighborhood location to a regional resource for spa and massage services."<br></p><p>The Massage Envy Spa -- Preston Park Village therapists offer specialized massage expertise, including pre-natal, hot stone, reflexology and trigger points. To attract experienced therapists, the McGoverns offer employment packages that include major medical and paid vacations for full-time employees. All four of the McGovern's clinics are actively hiring certified massage therapists, certified estheticians and sales associates.<br></p><p>Winners of numerous Massage Envy awards for excellence in franchising, the McGoverns were the first Massage Envy franchisees in the DFW area, opening their Old Town site on Greenville Avenue in Dallas in 2005. Over the past five years, Old Town has been the second busiest Massage Envy in the United States.<br></p><p>With today's fast pace and hectic schedules, North Texans are benefiting from facials and therapeutic massage. Clients can have a facial for only $10 more than the regular Massage Envy massage therapy price.<br></p><p>Massage Envy in Texas and throughout the country has helped popularize massage. <p>Second Readers' Choice Award as city's best massage therapy<br></p><p>Rowlett, TX&nbsp;-- Mar 13, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy in Rowlett, Texas, has won a Readers' Choice Award as the city's best massage therapy for the second straight year.</p><p>The Rowlett Lakeshore Times presents the awards annually to local businesses chosen as best by the newspaper's readers.<br></p><p>"We always try to provide our clients with excellent service. When we were told that we had won this award for the second year in a row, we just couldn't believe it," said Dr. Rick Klics, who with his wife, April, owns the Massage Envy franchise. "A big thank you to our members and clients who voted."<br></p><p>"I was shocked and so excited to hear that we had won a second year," said Morgan Tucker, the clinic's administrator. "This award is definitely a team accomplishment, and I'm thankful for such a great staff." Rowlett's Massage Envy is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>DFW has 28 Massage Envy Clinics and Spas and continues to grow<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- Mar 19, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Forbes Magazine has ranked Massage Envy as one of its "Top 20 Franchises for the Buck." The recognition by Forbes is a significant achievement as it highlights the need for affordable services and illustrates that massage therapy has gone mainstream as more people seek the benefits of therapeutic massage from licensed therapists.</p><p>The national leader in massage therapy, Massage Envy was cited by Forbes for offering reasonable monthly memberships -- in the DFW area, monthly memberships are available for $59 and include a 60-minute massage session -- plus "a host of discounted services. Franchises averaged over $1 million in annual sales in 2010."<br></p><p>Based in Scottsdale, Arizona, Massage Envy began franchising in 2002. According to Forbes, the average initial investment for a franchise was about $455,500. Massage Envy had 656 locations in the U.S. as of the end of 2010. Only seven Massage Envy locations closed in the three-year period 2008-2010.<br></p><p>"Forbes reported what our franchisees already know: Massage Envy is a great value that delivers 'bang for the buck,'" said Lance O'Pry, Dallas-Fort Worth regional developer for Massage Envy. "Here in the DFW area we are seeing solid growth as more and more North Texans are experiencing the therapeutic benefits of both massage and facials. North Texans are incorporating our services into their lifestyle."<br></p><p>Many of the 28 DFW Massage Envy locations are experiencing double digit year over year growth. "In Dallas-Fort Worth, positive same store sales performance is leading current franchise owners to grow their holdings by adding additional locations," notes O'Pry. "<br></p><p>Contributing to this growth are clinics that have become spas. As Bruce McGovern, who with his wife, Stephanie, owns Massage Envy Spa Preston Park Village in Plano, notes, "We've recently added facials and spa services, so our growth curve should continue upward." The spa just moved to a new 3,500-square-foot location, adding two rooms and separate waiting areas for spa and massage clients.<br></p><p>Massage Envy therapists offer specialized expertise -- pre-natal, hot stone, reflexology, trigger points and sports massages. To attract experienced therapists, many local franchises offer employment packages that include major medical and paid vacations.<br></p><p>With today's fast pace and hectic schedules, North Texans are benefiting from facials and therapeutic massage. <p>Customized Facials Will Use Murad(R) Skincare Products<br></p><p>Allen, Texas -- Apr 12, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage Envy's Allen clinic is now Massage Envy Spa Allen. In addition to regular massage services, the spa now offers customized facials using Murad(R) Skincare Products, says Jim Kennedy, owner of Massage Envy Spa Allen.</p><p>Just as massage can help deal with everyday stresses, so can facials. Your skin's appearance and health can suffer due to products applied to the face, poor diet, illness and pollution. Regular facials increase circulation, reverse visible signs of aging, improve skin tone and texture, and help eliminate blemishes and breakouts, particularly those caused by stress.<br></p><p>"Our new spa services offer a new relaxing dimension for our clients," Kennedy said. "Our guests are really excited about adding facials to their visits. We have just added four new dual-purpose treatment rooms to handle facials." Massage Envy Spa Allen is located at 816 W. McDermott Dr., Suite 340 in Allen, and is the tenth Massage Envy Spa in Dallas/Fort Worth.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa's Murad(R) Healthy Skin Facials feature specially formulated products from world-renowned Murad, Inc. Because skin cells lose the ability to retain water as they age, Murad products are specially formulated to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. This unmatched approach makes Massage Envy Spa's Murad Healthy Skin Facials the most effective way to achieve balanced and more youthful-looking skin.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spa Allen offers a variety of skincare treatments that benefit every skin type, including:<br></p><p> AHA Rapid Exfoliator Anti-Aging Facial helps reveal smoother, vibrant, younger-looking skin.<br> Clarifying Enzyme Acne Facial improves skin clarity, reduces blemishes and soothes inflammation.<br> Environmental Shield Vitamin C Infusion Facial reverses signs of aging caused by environmental factors such as sunlight, smog, pollution and stress.<br> Sensitive Skin Facial repairs and balances the skin with a gentle, yet effective treatment designed specifically to address skin that is easily irritated or sensitive.</p><p>"Massage Envy takes the same dedicated approach to skin care as it does to massage, so our guests know they are in the hands of professionals who understand their needs," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "We are happy to offer yet another service that helps our customers look and feel their best."<br></p><p>Because of Massage Envy's high standards for employees performing facials, only estheticians licensed by the state of Texas were hired for the Allen spa. They underwent extensive training, led by both a Massage Envy trainer and two Murad representatives.<br></p><p>Like massages, facials at Massage Envy are reasonably priced. The introductory price for any of the four signature facials is just $59. Clients can have a facial for only $10 more than the regular Massage Envy massage therapy price.<br></p><p>With today's fast pace and hectic schedules, everyone can benefit from facials and therapeutic massage. Visit one of the 28 Dallas/Fort Worth Massage Envy clinics to learn more about how massage therapy helps people relax and de-stress.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. <p>Recognizes Coppell Employee for Good Citizenship<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- Apr 16, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- In honor of National Volunteer Week -- April 15-21 -- Massage Envy is encouraging its employees to give back to the community. As part of that initiative, Massage Envy is saluting Carrollton resident Stephanie Bush, a massage therapist at Massage Envy Coppell, for her outstanding and continued service to the community.</p><p>"Stephanie has a heart for giving. She volunteers for several charities, most notably, her work with HomelessPartners.com and its Christmas Wish program, where she is in charge of arranging donations for homeless folks around the Metroplex. She also is involved with Massage Envy's Arthritis Foundation initiatives, and for several months, she donated all of her tips to help a co-worker who was out injured," said Ashley Martin, clinic manager at Massage Envy Coppell.<br></p><p>Bush has been a massage therapist for five years. She says she chose this career for the same reason that she does charity work -- she enjoys helping people.<br></p><p>"As a massage therapist, I really enjoy seeing the benefits the clients have when they receive a massage. They may come in with a migraine and leave without one or they may have a lower-back problem that we're able to help solve. I love helping people. I just want to do everything I can to help those around me," said Bush.<br></p><p>Bush got her start in charity work about eight years ago, while living in Las Vegas and working for a bagel shop. Store policy was to throw away uneaten bagels at the end of the day, but Bush had other ideas.<br></p><p>"I just couldn't stand throwing away a huge, five gallon bag of bagels while there were so many people who didn't have enough to eat, so I started taking the bags downtown and giving them to the homeless. It really opened up my eyes and my heart to homelessness. That's why I'm involved with HomelessPartners.com. People often have a negative perspective on homelessness, but this program allows them to see homeless people for who they really are," said Bush.<br></p><p>HomelessPartners.com allows homeless men, women and children to tell their stories, and at Christmas time, make a "wish list" of what they need most. People can log onto the site and donate items on the wish lists -- coats, hats, gloves, socks and shoes are some of the most common wished-for items.<br></p><p>In addition to her work with HomelessPartners.com, Bush is actively involved with HOPE worldwide, an organization that's dedicated to assisting economically disadvantaged people around the world. Bush participates in a number of HOPE worldwide programs locally, including a fire safety campaign and an educational program for inner-city children. She's also involved with Massage Envy's charitable work with the Arthritis Foundation.<br></p><p>"Massage Envy does several programs to help support the Arthritis Foundation. Right now we're helping with the 'Let's Move Together' program, which encourages people to move every day to prevent or treat arthritis. We also host the 'Healing Hands for Arthritis' fundraiser in October. Last year Massage Envy raised nearly $500,000 for the cause," " said Lance O'Pry, Dallas-Fort Worth regional developer for Massage Envy.<br></p><p>National Volunteer Week was established in 1974 inspire, recognize and encourage people to engage in their communities. According to the National Service Resources website, "National Volunteer Week is about taking action, encouraging individuals and their respective communities to be at the center of social change-discovering and actively demonstrating their collective power to foster positive transformation." For more information, visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.nationalserviceresources.org/calendar/national-volunteer-week-2012" target="_blank">http://www.nationalserviceresources.org/calendar/national-volunteer-week-2012</a>.<br></p><p>Massage Envy, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage in the United States. The national franchise is dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage and spa services to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations. Founded in 2002, Massage Envy has more than 690 locations in 44 states and has experienced 25 percent year-over-year growth. In addition, the average unit volume for a Massage Envy is $1 million. The company was recently named a top AllBusiness (a D&amp;B company) AllStar Franchise, and is a member of the International Franchise Association (IFA). To find a local clinic, visit<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.massageenvy.com/">www.massageenvy.com</a>. All clinics are open seven days a week. Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook -<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.</p><p>28 Massage Envy - Dallas/Fort Worth Locations<br>Massage Envy Prestonwood - 5225 Belt Line Rd., Suite 250, Addison, TX 75254 (972) 388-5500<br>Massage Envy SPA Allen - 816 W. <p>On May 9, with just a cheek swab, find out if you're a match<br></p><p>Rowlett, Texas -- Apr 23, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- The staff at Massage Envy Spa-Rowlett Crossing will host a drive for bone marrow donors on May 9, 2012.</p><p>Fundraising in support of bone marrow donations began April 1 at the spa, with all proceeds going to the Be the Match Foundation. On May 9, Massage Envy staff and clients can take a simple cheek swab to see if they are a bone marrow match. The spa is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway, Suite 600, in Rowlett.<br></p><p>"Our publicist, Jo Trizila, a bone marrow recipient herself, inspired us to conduct the drive," said Dr. Richard Klics, owner of the Massage Envy Spa - Rowlett Crossing. "The profound and amazing truth is that a single bone marrow donor can save a life. A cheek swab makes it easy to determine if you're a bone marrow match. Take a moment and save a life."<br></p><p>You do not have to be a member of Massage Envy to participate. Walk-in volunteers for the swab test are welcome. The clinic is located at 4301 Lakeview Parkway Suite 600, Rowlett, TX 75089.&nbsp;<br></p><p>Bone marrow donors have the power to heal, Dr. Klics said. For some 10,000 patients a year with leukemia and other life-threatening diseases, their only hope for a second chance at life is a marrow transplant from someone outside their family.</p><p>Patients and their families count on the National Marrow Donor Program and the Be the Match Foundation. Over the past 25 years the donor program has made 50,000 transplants possible, bringing hope to thousands more each year.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.</p><p>Facials at the spa feature Murad products specially formulated to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. The result: skin that's clearer, firmer and younger-looking.<br></p><p>Log on to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/" target="_blank">www.massageenvy.com</a>&nbsp;to find the nearest Massage Envy clinic. All clinics are open seven days a week.<br></p><p>Follow Massage Envy DFW on Facebook -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/MassageDFW</a>&nbsp;and Twitter -&nbsp;<a href="http://www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/MassageEnvyDFW</a>.<br></p><p>Massage Envy, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage in the United States. The national franchise is dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage and spa services to consumers with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations. Founded in 2002, Massage Envy has more than 690 locations in 44 states and has experienced 25 percent year-over-year growth. In addition, the average unit volume for a Massage Envy is $1 million. The company was recently named a top AllBusiness (a D&amp;B company) AllStar Franchise and is a member of the International Franchise Association (IFA). <p>Focus and courage of Frisco cyclist energizes Massage Envy owner<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- Apr 26, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW will sponsor a cycling team for the&nbsp;Bike MS: Sam's Club 2012 Ride.</p><p>Brendan McBratney, owner of&nbsp;Massage Envy's&nbsp;Craig Ranch &amp; Stonebriar clinics and the Frisco North Spa, has sponsored Riders Against MS as the&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;team for the past four years.<br></p><p>Rodney Moffitt, a resident of Frisco, was diagnosed with MS seven years ago and is the founder of Riders Against MS. Moffitt sums up his attitude: "Don't let MS control your life, but take control of your MS through your exercise or things you want to do, and do it as long as you can. I know someday I might be in a wheelchair, but until that day comes, I'm going to ride."<br></p><p>"Rodney's focus and courage energizes me, the riders and everyone at&nbsp;Massage Envy," McBratney said. The&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;team is aiming to raise more than $15,000 this year. &nbsp;<br></p><p>Scheduled for Saturday and Sunday, May 5-6, 2012, the 150+-mile fundraiser benefits the National Multiple Sclerosis Society, Lone Star Chapter.<br></p><p>The ride begins at 7 a.m. Saturday at Frisco's Dr. Pepper Ballpark. After an overnight pit stop at Texas Motor Speedway, cyclists will loop back on Sunday for a new raceway finish. An estimated 3,000 riders are expected to take part. The ride is celebrating its 25th anniversary this year.<br></p><p>The&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;tent at Texas Motor Speedway will be a gathering place for riders after they bike 85 miles Saturday.&nbsp;Massage Envytherapists will provide massages to&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;team members and other cyclists in preparation for Sunday's ride. The riders are extremely grateful for the massage to help recover from the first day's ride as it helps tremendously preparing for day two.&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;is the leading provider of massage therapy in the U.S.<br></p><p>Massage Envy's sports massage therapy is geared toward athletes of every kind, from world-class professionals to weekend joggers to cyclists. Licensed massage therapists focus on areas of the body that are overused and stressed from repetitive and often aggressive movements.<br></p><p>Aspects of sports massage therapy are gaining popularity as useful components in a balanced training regimen. Sports massage therapy can be used as a means to enhance pre-event preparation and reduce recovery time for maximum performance during training or after an event. Athletes have discovered that specially designed sports massage promotes flexibility, reduces fatigue, improves endurance, helps prevent injuries and prepares their body and mind for optimal performance.<br></p><p>One of the key benefits of&nbsp;Massage Envy's&nbsp;sports massage therapy compared to other modalities is its ability to target muscle-tendon junctions. A 2010 study in&nbsp;The Journal of&nbsp;Strength and Conditioning Research&nbsp;found that even a 30-second massage improved hip-flexor range of motion. Another study conducted by Margaret Jones, Ph.D. of the American College of Sports Medicine, demonstrated a notable trend toward decreased muscle soreness in the athletes who received massage either before or after exercise.<br></p><p>Signup continues until the day of the race. Some 2,856 riders took part last year. Connect on&nbsp;<a href="https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1448755707#!/bikemsdfw" target="_blank">Facebook</a>&nbsp;(Bike MS: Sam's Club Ride) and<a href="https://twitter.com/#!/BikeMS_DFW" target="_blank">https://twitter.com/#!/BikeMS_DFW</a>&nbsp;(BikeMS_DFW).<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>About Massage Envy<br></p><p>Massage Envy, based in Scottsdale, Arizona, is the leading provider of therapeutic massage in the United States. Founded in 2002,&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;has more than 690 locations in 44 states and has experienced 25 percent year-over-year growth. <p>Murad(R) Healthy Skin Facials Available at 10 DFW Massage Envy Spas<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- May 02, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.myprgenie.com/">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- For Mother's Day, there's no better way to pamper Mom than to give her the gift of a spa facial. Mom will look as good as she feels after a Murad(R) Healthy Skin Facial, available at any of the 10&nbsp;Massage Envy Spas&nbsp;in the Dallas/Fort Worth area.</p><p>Massage Envy&nbsp;gift cards can be used for facials as well as massages and Murad products. All 28 Dallas/Fort Worth area&nbsp;Massage Envyclinics are offering a Mother's Day special -- &nbsp;buy three gift cards valued at $75 each and get a free one-hour massage gift card.<br></p><p>Facials at&nbsp;Massage Envy Spa&nbsp;feature Murad products specially formulated to repair cell membranes while attracting water and nutrients to the cells. The result: skin that's clearer, firmer and younger-looking.<br></p><p>Massage Envy Spas&nbsp;offer a variety of skincare treatments that benefit every skin type, including:</p><ul><li>Environmental Shield Vitamin C Infusion Facial&nbsp;reverses signs of aging caused by sunlight, smog, pollution and stress. Rich antioxidants, including Vitamin C, are delivered directly to the skin to fight wrinkles, boost collagen production and protect against free radicals. &nbsp;</li><li>Clarifying Enzyme Acne Facial&nbsp;improves skin clarity, reduces blemishes and soothes inflammation. A precise combination of exfoliating natural fruit enzymes, antiseptics, antioxidants and hydrating agents opens pores for deep cleansing without irritation. </li><li>Anti-Aging Facial&nbsp;helps reveal smoother, vibrant, younger-looking skin. To minimize fine lines and wrinkles, concentrated glycolic acid maximizes exfoliation and dramatically improves skin texture, tone and appearance.</li><li>Sensitive Skin Facial&nbsp;repairs and balances the skin with a gentle, effective treatment designed specifically for easily irritated, sensitive skin. Mild exfoliation and a soothing mask help reduce redness and inflammation while restoring hydration and suppleness and minimizing fine lines and wrinkles.</li></ul><p>"Massage Envy&nbsp;takes the same dedicated approach to skin care as it does to massage," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;Massage Envy. <p>Don't just talk the talk -- walk the walk<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX -- May 16, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) --&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW is proud to sponsor the 2012 Dallas Arthritis Walk(R) on Saturday, May 19, 2012. Not only will&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW have a 40-person team of walkers representing&nbsp;Massage Envy, but event participants should look for the&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;tent, where five licensed massage therapists will be performing chair massages and giving away 1,000 sun block sticks.</p><p>"All of our employees are excited to be sponsoring this event and participating in the Arthritis Walk(R). Many of our clients live with arthritis, including rheumatoid arthritis, and come to&nbsp;Massage Envy&nbsp;for therapeutic massages to help them deal with the pain," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for&nbsp;Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the United States.<br></p><p>The Arthritis Walk(R), part of the&nbsp;Let's Move Together(R) movement, is the Arthritis Foundation's nationwide signature event that supports public awareness and raises funds to fight arthritis, the nation's most common cause of disability. Joining the 2012 walk is a way to help improve the lives of the 50 million men, women and children with arthritis.<br></p><p>Locally, the goal for the 2012 Dallas walk is to raise $200,000.<br></p><p>Get your company involved or recruit friends and family members to form a team. The funds raised will support critical Arthritis Foundation research and discoveries, public health initiatives and public policy efforts to improve the lives of people with arthritis.<br></p><p>The walk will be held at Park Central, located at 12700 Park Central in Dallas, from 8:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.</p><ul><li>8:30 a.m.: Registration</li><li>9:40 a.m.: Announcements</li><li>10:00 a.m.: Walk begins</li><li>*Food/Games throughout event*</li><li>11:30 a.m.: Closing comments</li></ul><p>To donate and for more information on the Dallas walk, go to:&nbsp;<a href="http://www.kintera.org/FAF/home/default.asp?ievent=995532" target="_blank">http://www.kintera.org/FAF/home/default.asp?ievent=995532</a></p><p>Arthritis is the leading cause of disability, reduced quality of life, and high health care costs in the U.S. Of the 46 million Americans who suffer from arthritis, nearly half say that arthritis limits their normal activities. The good news is that recent studies suggest that massage can help reduce pain and increase mobility in those who suffer from arthritis. At Massage Envy, we offer a Massage Wellness Program to help cope with chronic arthritis pain.<br></p><p>Following the walk, check out&nbsp;<a href="http://www.facebook.com/MassageDFW" target="_blank">Massage Envy&nbsp;DFW's Facebook page</a>&nbsp;for photos of the event.<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. <p>Massage Envy is a Weekend Warrior's best friend<br></p><p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- May 24, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- Massage isn't just for women -- it is for real men too. Massage Envy DFW will be profiling men who know the power of massage and what it brings to their lives.</p><p>With the weather warming up, Weekend Warriors will be out in force -- running, golfing, hiking, biking, team sports, etc. -- not to mention all of those "Honey-Do" projects at home. Massage Envy is the Weekend Warrior's best friend.<br></p><p>"Massage Envy DFW currently has a membership base that is 60-40 in favor of women," says Lance O'Pry, Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Developer for Massage Envy. "We would like to see that ratio become closer to 50-50, so we have asked DFW male leaders with busy lives to talk to us about why they get massages and the benefits that massage therapy brings to their overall well-being."<br></p><p>The featured men, listed below, will share why they believe it is important to include massage therapy in their schedules.<br></p><p> Geoff Wright -- superintendant with Richardson Convention &amp; Visitors Bureau <br> Corby Davidson -- co-host of The Ticket Sports Radio show "Hardline" <br> Rick Groesch -- chief commercial officer of Heelys, Inc. <br> William Huffman -- future Olympic athlete<br> Randy Gregg -- partner with BDO USA LLP<br> Craig Rosengarden -- publisher of "Avidgolfer" Magazine<br> Todd Storch -- founder of Taylor's Gift Foundation <br> Sherwin Daryani -- executive director of Operation Kindness</p><p>Men's reasons for getting massages differ from women. Men primarily want to relieve pain, increase sports performance and to relax.<br></p><p>Massage Envy, the leading provider of massage therapy in the United States, offers several types of massages that are custom tailored to men's needs.<br></p><p><ul><li>Trigger Point Therapy</li><li>Relieves a tight area within muscle tissue causing pain in other areas of body</li><li>Uses cycles of isolated pressure and release</li><li>Helps naturally manage pain and stress from chronic injuries</li><li>Deep Tissue Massage</li><li>Releases muscle tension</li><li>Provides deep pain relief</li><li>Loosens scar tissue and lengthens muscles</li><li>Good for chronic and overuse injuries</li><li>Sports Massage</li><li>Promotes flexibility to decrease risk of injury</li><li>Improves endurance</li><li>Reduces post-workout recovery time</li><li>Offers balance to training regimen</li></ul></p><p>Listen to The Ticket for more information on Massage Envy. <p>Dallas Fort Worth, TX&nbsp;-- May 29, 2012 / (<a href="http://www.myprgenie.com/" target="_blank">http://www.myprgenie.com</a>) -- It started in the middle of the night -- a blinding pain that woke Corby Davidson up from a sound sleep. His first thought: "I'm dying."</p><p>The pain in the marathon runner's back was excruciating but, luckily for Davidson, not actually life-threatening.<br></p><p>"I started running marathons about 10 years ago. Three years ago I woke up in the middle of the night, and the pain was so bad I thought, 'This is it. I'm dying.' The next day, I went to a chiropractor who suggested several things to improve my core strength and alleviate that pain, such as sit-ups, working with the big exercise ball and massage therapy," explained Davidson.<br></p><p>While training for a marathon, Davidson says he runs at least 10 miles a day. But even when he isn't training, he runs between 30 and 45 miles per week and continues with his massage therapy.<br></p><p>"Whatever sport you're doing, you need to do massage therapy in addition to your cardio and strength training. It's an integral part of your exercise program," said Davidson. "It helps heal injuries, improves athletic performance and increases your range of motion. It's maintenance -- like going to the gym. If you stick with it, it will pay off."<br></p><p>Davidson has met his personal competition goals and has participated in a number of marathons. He ran the New York City Marathon twice, the Chicago Marathon once and the Dallas White Rock Marathon four times. But, although running is something he's passionate about, it's not his day job. Davidson is co-host of the popular Cumulus radio show "Hardline," which airs from 3 to 7 p.m. weekdays on The Ticket Sports Radio, 1310 AM and 104.1 FM in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.<br></p><p>"We spend four hours a day sitting in a chair, chatting about sports. It's great!" said Davidson.<br></p><p>When he isn't running marathons or hosting a radio show, Davidson spends most of his free time with his family hitting golf balls at the driving range and giving his youngest piggy-back rides.<br></p><p>"I used to play a ton of golf before I had kids, and now I'm slowly getting back into it. My son is getting interested in it now and so is our 2-year-old, so that helps. We go to the driving range as a family and hit balls together," explained Davidson.<br></p><p>Davidson, also is a former football player, doesn't have complete range of motion in his shoulder due to an old injury. He has roughly 95% range of motion now and says his massage therapist is working with him to get to 100%.<br></p><p>"Hopefully, I'll have full range back in a few months," said Davidson. "If you're an active guy like me -- doing sports, exercising or have kids running around, I highly recommend a massage at least every other week."<br></p><p>Davidson added, "If you go to Massage Envy, you'll be in good company. When I go there, it's usually 60-40, girls to guys."<br></p><p>At Massage Envy, an introductory one-hour massage session (a 50-minute massage and time for consultation and dressing) is just $49. Memberships are available for $59 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39 member rate.<br></p><p>All clinics are open seven days a week.
