NASHVILLE, Tenn.  The all-new 2015 Nissan Murano, which was introduced to near universal acclaim in December 2014, has added another prestigious award to its trophy case  a "Best Crossover" in the Parents magazine and Edmunds.com annual listing of the "10 Best Family Cars."<br><br>As in previous years, the top vehicles for 2015 were selected by the Parents and Edmunds.com editors based on safety, convenience and high-tech performance features at all price levels. In choosing the Murano, they stated:<br><br>"The all-new Murano pulls off a neat trick, mimicking the creamy ride and luxe features of models costing $10,000 more. It provides stretch-your-legs space for five, easy car-seat access, and storage for a weekend getaway (portacrib and stroller included). The fatigue-fighting 'Zero Gravity' front seats are a blessing for long drives. The monitor beams 360-degree camera views, detecting and alerting you to moving objects in the parking lot, from bicycles to shopping carts to little kids."<br><br> Parents, June 2015 issue<br><br>Murano was also recently awarded an IIHS "Top Safety Pick Plus" ranking as one of the latest Nissan vehicles to offer the innovative Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB) systems specifically designed to alert drivers of potential risks ahead  along with available Driver's Attention Alert* (DAA) system. The DAA system analyzes driver steering behavior to provide an alert if signs of drowsiness or inattention are detected.<br><br>Sales of the all-new 2015 Murano increased 58.3 percent in May and 33.4 percent through May 2015 (compared to the same periods in calendar year 2014).<br><br>"The 2015 Murano has found a sweet spot in the competitive crossover SUV segment, offering standout styling, a highly versatile premium interior, advanced safety and driver aid technologies and, of course, Nissan's legendary driving excitement," said Fred Diaz, senior vice president, Sales &amp; Marketing, Parts &amp; Service, U.S.A, Nissan North America, Inc. "Now, on top of record sales in May, we're honored to add the highly sought-after Parents / Edmunds.com 'Best Family Car' acknowledgment to a great first year of the new Murano design."<br><br>As the halo vehicle for Nissan's expanding range of bold crossovers, the all-new Murano carries forward the new Nissan design direction with its V-Motion front end, boomerang lights, floating roof treatment and efficient aerodynamics. Inside, the new Murano offers an engaging "social lounge" feel through features such as the refined lower-height instrument panel, wide center console, advanced Zero Gravity seating, and the airy atmosphere created by the large windows and oversized Power Panoramic Moonroof.<br><br>Murano's long list of available features include NissanConnectSM with Navigation and Mobile Apps, 8-inch color display with multi-touch control, 8-way power driver's seat with power lumbar support, SiriusXM® Satellite Radio and Travel Link® (SiriusXM subscription required, sold separately), Nissan Intelligent Key® with Push Button Ignition, Remote Engine Start system, iPod® and other compatible devices interface, 11-speaker Bose® (including dual subwoofers) premium audio system and Bluetooth® Hands-free Phone System.<br><br>Responsive driving is provided by a standard 3.5-liter DOHC V6 connected to an advanced Xtronic transmission. Murano is available in front-wheel drive or Intuitive All-Wheel Drive. Fuel economy is rated at 28 mpg highway for both front-wheel and all-wheel drive models.<br><br>Available technologies include Around View® Monitor (AVM) with Moving Object Detection (MOD), Blind Spot Warning (BSW), Intelligent Cruise Control (ICC), Predictive Forward Collision Warning (PFCW) and Forward Emergency Braking (FEB). The Rear Cross Traffic Alert (RCTA) system utilizes radar to detect a moving vehicle behind the Murano approaching from either side of a parking space.<br><br>The 2015 Murano is offered in four trim levels  S, SV, SL and Platinum  and in a choice of front-wheel or all-wheel drive. The starting MSRP** for the Murano S FWD is $29,560 USD, while the top-of-the-line Murano Platinum AWD is priced at $40,600 USD (full pricing is available at NissanNews.com). The new Murano is assembled in Canton, Mississippi.<br><br>For photography and additional information about the 2015 Nissan Murano along with the complete lineup of Nissan vehicles, please visit <a href="http://www.NissanNews.com">www.NissanNews.com</a>.<br><br>The complete 2015 Parents and Edmunds.com "10 Best Family Cars" list will be published in the July 2015 issue of Parents magazine and is available online at Parents.com/best-family-cars.<br><br>About Nissan North America <br><br>In North America, Nissan's operations include automotive styling, engineering, consumer and corporate financing, sales and marketing, distribution and manufacturing. Nissan is dedicated to improving the environment under the Nissan Green Program and has been recognized annually by the U.S Environmental Protection Agency as an ENERGY STAR® Partner of the Year since 2010. More information on Nissan in North America and the complete line of Nissan and Infiniti vehicles can be found online at <a href="http://www.NissanUSA.com">www.NissanUSA.com</a> and <a href="http://www.InfinitiUSA.com">www.InfinitiUSA.com</a>, or visit the U.S. media sites NissanNews.com and InfinitiNews.com.<br><br>About Nissan Motor Co.<br><br>Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., Japan's second-largest automotive company, is headquartered in Yokohama, Japan, and is part of the Renault-Nissan Alliance. Operating with more than 247,500 employees globally, Nissan sold 5.32 million vehicles and generated revenue of 11.38 trillion yen (USD 103.6 billion) in fiscal year 2014. Nissan delivers a comprehensive range of more than 60 models under the Nissan, Infiniti and Datsun brands. Nissan leads the world in zero-emission mobility, dominated by sales of the LEAF, the first mass-market, pure-electric vehicle. It is the best-selling EV in history with almost 50% share of the zero-emission vehicle segment.<br><br>For more information on our products, services and commitment to sustainable mobility, visit our website at <a href="http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/">http://www.nissan-global.com/EN/</a>.<br><br>About Parents<br><br>Parents was founded in 1926 and, along with American Baby, FamilyFun, and Ser Padres, makes up the Meredith Parents Network portfolio of parenthood brands. In turn, these moms enlighten and inspire others by joining ongoing conversations about parenthood via Parents.com as well through Parents' robust presence on Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, Instagram and Tumblr. Parents is dedicated to engaging and inspiring moms with the information they need, wherever they go.<br><br>About Edmunds.com<br><br>Edmunds.com is a car-shopping Web site driven to make car buying easy. <h2>New Multicolor Template Added To Free Hosting Service</h2><p>On June 24th, 2015, Joomla.com,added JSN Shine Multicolor, a flexible template to the collection of 15 templates currently offered through the free service. JSN Shine Multicolor from Joomlashine &nbsp;(joomlashine.com), is a responsive template using Twitter's Bootstrap system. It features 6 color variations, 25 module positions and 7 CSS style variations for its modules, a rich tapestry of CSS typography, and a clean style with a responsive layout.<br><br>Joomla.com is the free web site hosting service provided by Siteground in affiliation with joomla.org. The free service has been available since January, 2015. Joomla.com allows its subscribers to host their web sites indefinitely on joomla.com servers without charge. &nbsp;There are currently over 35,000 web sites hosted on the Joomla.com service.. Siteground has specialized in hosting Joomla &nbsp;web sites has been sponsoring Joomla events for several years.</p><h2>First Contributed Template Is Exclusive To Free Service</h2><p>The new template is exclusively available through joomlal.com for its hosting subscribers only. JoomlaShine, the template designer, offered the new template design to joomla.com. The template is modified to work with the Joomla.com service, and opens the way for other template designers to contribute designs. &nbsp;JoomlaShine offers 35 templates separately from the joomla.com service. &nbsp;JoomlaShine offers several types of extensions for Joomla! including 6 components such as JSN Page Builder. Most JoomlaShine extensions are offered as a free version with an extended version with additional features available for purchase.</p><h2>Free Service Is Easy To Use</h2><p>Joomla.com was conceived with the intention of making it easy for people to get started with Joomla. It is a great place to set up a web site and get started learning Joomla. There are many tutorials on the joomla.com web site detailing the basics of using Joomla. There are 5 popular Joomla extensions included with the service. The Joomla.com hosting service boasts freedom from the sponsorship advertising that many other popular free web hosting services have.</p><p>The ease of use of Joomla.com web sites was demostrated in a recent Youtube video at: <a href="http://t.co/2nTkzMQjtZ">http://t.co/2nTkzMQjtZ</a> in which an 11 year old Portuguese boy demonstrates in a few minutes how to set up a Joomla! web site, make some configuration changes, and create a page with an embedded video.<br></p><p>Siteground also has an upgrade option available for users of joomla.com wishing to graduate to a full site with all of the privileges and freedoms of site administration. Users may also use an export feature to move the content of their joomla.com site to another joomla hosting provider of their own choosing. The joomla.com service provides users with a sub domain name of the joomla.com domain (ex. mysite.joomla.com).</p><p><b><br></b></p><h2>CONTACT INFORMATION</h2><p>Editorial Contact:</p><p>Mark Simko</p><p>PR for Joomla</p><p>Email Contact: <a>Mark.Simko@community.joomla.org</a> <br></p>
<p><b>Roel de Vries</b></p><p><b>Corporate Vice President, Global Head of Marketing and Brand Strategy, Nissan Motor Co., Ltd.</b></p><p>As Corporate Vice President, Global Head of Marketing and Brand Strategy, Roel is focused on further strengthening Nissan's brand value. This entails two key elements: firstly, ensuring internally Nissan is doing everything needed to develop leading brands; and secondly, making sure this is then communicated effectively and consistently in today's increasingly complex world of marketing.</p><p>Roel joined Nissan in 1994 at the European head-office in Amsterdam.  In 1998, Roel joined Nissans South Africa marketing team where he eventually became Director of Marketing and Sales.  Roel then held a number of global roles before being appointed to his current position in November 2010. </p><p>Roel holds a Bachelors Degree in Industrial Engineering from Hogeschool Eindhoven, and a Masters Degree in Business Administration from the University of Groningen, both in the Netherlands. </p><p><b>Financial Times Future of Marketing Summit</b></p><p><b>September 16, 2015</b></p><p><b>New York City</b></p><p><b>Panel Title:&nbsp;</b>Shifting brand strategy in the age of the empowered consumer<b></b></p><p>The digital age and phenomenons such as the shared economy, mean that consumers are more empowered than ever before. Within this self-regulating environment they are better protected, have more choices and access to better prices. Due to technological advancement and new marketing strategies, what consumers expect from brands has also changed dramatically. To reach this powerful tech-savvy group brands must be transparent, consistent across channels and must truly engage. So in such an arguably de-centralized environment, how do you ensure you are speaking the same language and connecting with the all-powerful customer?</p>

<p>On August 2nd, over 300 hundred young people from all corners of the world will assemble in Wiesbaden, Germany for cultural exchange, learning, and most importantly: a celebration. What they will be celebrating is a constructed language, Esperanto, at the 71st Esperanto Youth Congress. italki, the largest Peer-to-Peer 1-on-1 online language education platform is proud to be the only language education company to be sponsoring this event.</p><p><b>The Event:</b> </p><p>The World Esperanto Youth Organization (Tutmonda Esperantista Junulara Organizo) TEJO, has created the Esperanto Youth Congress (Internacia Junulara Kongreso, or just IJK) to encourage the youth involved in the Esperanto movement to share their experience. </p><p>Most importantly, this event allows Esperanto speakers to practice speaking the language within a community, reinforcing the international applicability of the language. Many of the participants may still be starting out in the language, and being able to reinforce the acquisition socially, through one-on-one communication in a friendly atmosphere helps preserve and encourage the community around this language.</p><p>The IJK started in 1938, in the The Netherlands, and is seeing its 71st iteration. The event has been held in multiple countries, and is the largest such event oriented specifically at encouraging younger speakers to improve and perfect their communicative Esperanto ability, and encourage a new generation of practitioners of the language.</p><p>The Youth congress generally sees several hundred Esperantists between 18 - 35, who share a passion for "the language of hope" and the ideals of open cross-cultural communication.</p><p><b>italki involvement:</b></p><p>italki has sponsored previous events like the Polyglot Gathering in Berlin (<a href="http://polyglotberlin.com/">http://polyglotberlin.com/</a>) and sees its role in the new language learning environment as that of supporting linguistic diversity, inter-personal learning, and effective, learn-by-doing approaches to education by connecting language learners with fluent or native-speaking teachers of any language, no matter where in the world those students or teachers may be.</p><p>Considering that Esperanto is a language without a country, going home after an event can mean leaving the Esperanto community except for online connections. Working together with the event organizers, italki is providing an online community and online teachers, and hopes to encourage enthusiastic new Esperanto speakers to keep practicing what they learned during the event.</p><p>More importantly, the spirit of the Esperanto culture (by nature multi-national, inclusive, and communication-oriented) aligns with the way that italki celebrates language learning and the important human connections that inevitably come with it.</p><p>It is italki's mission to make learning a language an interpersonal, accessible, and affordable experience. Celebrating and supporting the Esperanto community and IJK simply falls within the company's core beliefs. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Follow the conference on Twitter: @IJK2015</p><p>Follow italki on Twitter: @italki</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>About Italki: </p><p>Starting as a language exchange social network in 2007, italki has become a multi-million user platform for language learners and educators to find one another, hold individual language classes, and participate in a collaborative learning and community-building experience. The italki platform has become a hub of the language-learning online ecosystem, that is able to bring effective and affordable language-learning to every place on Earth. As of 2015, italki has helped or is helping over 1.8 million users approach fluency in a foreign language.</p><p>In 2015, in the midst of the trend away from traditional education and towards self-directed, truly personal knowledge discovery, italki provides the platform to find affordable authentic language-learning solutions created by a truly global community of language-learning enthusiasts, including polyglots, translators, and professional language teachers.</p><p>For any further questions please contact: ivan@italki.com</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="redwerk.com">https://robin8.com/redwerk.com</a> <br></p>
<p>Introducing the newest member of the Cogo Labs family of companies, Tenizen! </p><p>Launched on January 1, 2015 and already profitable and growing, Tenizen is poised to radically alter and improve the apartment rental experience.</p><p>Our goal is to take what is currently an unpleasant process for both tenants and landlords and improve the entire experience, from the listing of the apartment to the signing of the lease, says CEO Jacob Silber.&nbsp; The products were building will not only modernize the experience in ways that are long overdue, but transform and elevate it, not just for renters, but for rental agents and landlords as well.</p><p>Being part of the Cogo Labs incubator has been an invaluable experience for Silber and his team. The startup world can be very lonely. At Cogo Labs youre both cooperating with and learning from other companies who are rushing to solve similar problems in different industries. It provides a motivation and comradery thats often missing when youre operating as a solo startup in a shared work space.</p><p>Tenizen currently consists of 8 full-time and 2 part-time employees, and theyre looking to grow in a number of areas in the coming months, including analytics, software development, and business development.</p><p>If youve ever rented an apartment than you know all too well what a frustrating process it can be, Silber says. If youre excited about the potential for the apartment rentals market to be drastically improved, and want to be part of the team thats going to make it happen, wed love to hear from you.</p><p>For more information about Tenizen, visit <a href="http://www.tenizen.com/" target="_blank">their website</a>.</p>

<p>July 23rd, 2015, Winterhaven, Florida - <a href="http://nomore.org" target="_blank" title="Link: http://nomore.org">NOMORE</a>, a public awareness campaign that purports: "Together We Can End Domestic Violence and Sexual Assault" has continued to be the subject of investigation by retired Domestic Violence Court Judge, Robert Doyel.&nbsp;</p><p><a href="http://www.judgedoyel.com/domestic-violence/no-more-and-the-nfl-strange-bedfellows/" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.judgedoyel.com/domestic-violence/no-more-and-the-nfl-strange-bedfellows/">In his latest examination of NOMORE</a>, Doyel questions the motives of NOMORE's&nbsp;DV "Expert Advisors" hired to consult NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell in the wake of the Ray Rice, Ray McDonald, and Greg Hardy Domestic Violence crises and the resulting public scrutiny that the organization has suffered over the past year.&nbsp;</p><p>Doyel continues to elucidate that NOMORE is not an actual authentic DV or rape advocacy group but rather: "instruments of propaganda for organizations which have a public relations problem."&nbsp;</p>

<p>A womans jewelry changes with her mood, her style and the seasons. The massive Jinja Jewelry collection incorporates an endless array of style for any occasion. Inspired by the warm Bali beaches, Jinja has several designs that are perfect for the summer and range from bracelets to earrings to pendants. All of these <a href="http://www.jinjajewelry.net/" target="_blank">handcrafted jewelry pieces</a>&nbsp;use top quality materials from the earth to tell a different story, unique to the woman wearing the jewelry.</p><p><br></p><p>Summer Cuffs</p><p><br></p><p><img width="275" alt="banglepng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/122428/bangle-png" height="194"></p><p><br></p><p>This stainless steel cuff from the Jinja Jewelry collection intertwines shades of marsala and aqua. Their gypsy flare and flirtatious nature pairs perfectly with maxi dresses, kimonos and all the summer staples in between. Its uniquely progressive color story mirrors a clear summer night sky.</p><p><br></p><p>Marsala Rings&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><img width="250" alt="ringpng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/122428/ring-png" height="247"></p><p><br></p><p>Marsala and shades of red have trumped the runways this year. <div><div><h2>Newest data partner provides participating startups with free access to digital currency &amp; block chain data</h2></div></div><div><div><div><div></div><p>BOSTON, MA &amp; NEW YORK, NY (PRWEB)&nbsp;JULY 13, 2015</p><p>FinTech Sandbox and TradeBlock announced today that TradeBlock will provide free access to digital currency and block chain data to startups participating in the innovative Sandbox program. FinTech Sandbox residents may use this data up to six months for development, testing and customer demonstrations purposes. The free data TradeBlock is making available includes:&nbsp;<br>Trading &amp; index data&nbsp;<br>Economy / block chain data&nbsp;<br>Computational / mining network data</p><p>For each category, TradeBlock offers live and historical raw data, as well as proprietary indices. For example, the TradeBlock XBX index represents a reliable, real-time, USD-equivalent spot rate for bitcoin. TradeBlock joins other leading data partners in the program, including Benzinga, FactSet, Plaid, S&amp;P Capital IQ, SIX Financial Information, Thomson Reuters, Tradier, Xignite, and Yodlee. TradeBlock is itself a startup backed by Andreessen Horowitz, FinTech Collective, Devonshire Investors, Bitcoin Opportunity Corp., and Data Collective.</p><p>FinTech Sandbox is a nonprofit whose mission is to promote entrepreneurship and innovation globally in the financial technology sector. Unique among organizations supporting startups in the burgeoning global FinTech ecosystem, FinTech Sandbox facilitates free access to financial data and infrastructure to up-and-coming startups. The six-month program includes:&nbsp;<br>A robust set of data feeds and APIs from a wide array of data partners&nbsp;<br>Cloud hosting from industry-leading infrastructure partners&nbsp;<br>Membership in a vibrant, global FinTech community</p><p>We are committed to providing our clients with the most reliable data feeds for all aspects of the digital currency economy, said TradeBlock CEO Greg Schvey. There are still tremendous opportunities for innovators working with digital currency trading and block chain technologies. Were excited to see how FinTech Sandbox participants will leverage our data.</p><p>We see increased interest from incumbent Financial Institutions in digital ledger technology," commented Jean Donnelly, FinTech Sandbox executive director. "They are looking for partnerships with startups with this expertise. That's one of the reasons we are excited to partner with TradeBlock."</p><p>About TradeBlock&nbsp;<br>TradeBlock provides live and historical data for all aspects of the digital currency economy. It is the world's leading provider of institutional execution and analysis tools for digital currency markets, capitalizing on block chain technologies to optimize trading operations. More information can be found at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.prweb.net/Redirect.aspx?id=aHR0cHM6Ly90cmFkZWJsb2NrLmNvbS8=" rel="nofollow">https://tradeblock.com/</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://www.prweb.net/Redirect.aspx?id=aHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS90cmFkZWJsb2Nr" rel="nofollow">https://twitter.com/tradeblock</a>.</p><p>About FinTech Sandbox&nbsp;<br>FinTech Sandbox is a Boston-based nonprofit founded to promote financial technology innovation globally by providing access to critical data and resources to FinTech entrepreneurs and startups. Sponsors include Fidelity Investments, Devonshire Investors, Thomson Reuters, Silicon Valley Bank, Amazon Web Services, Intel, SIX Financial Information, Goodwin Procter and .406 Ventures. For more information, please visit<a href="http://www.prweb.net/Redirect.aspx?id=aHR0cDovL3d3dy5maW50ZWNoc2FuZGJveC5vcmc=" rel="nofollow">http://www.fintechsandbox.org</a>.</p></div></div></div>
<p>In the last few years, whenever the topic of Bitcoin arose among financial services industry professionals, it provoked either negative connotations associated with reputed criminal uses such as money laundering or outright dismissal as something only Silicon Valley tech-libertarians would be interested in. In the last year or so, the tone of conversation on the topic has shifted as respected names in the industry like NYSE and Goldman Sachs have revealed not just interest in Bitcoin but plans to invest in the technology.</p><p>Bitcoin is innovative because it allows individuals to exchange value across the Internet without the involvement of trusted third parties that may impose costs or delays. The most obvious application of such a technology would be in the payments space, particularly in enabling cross-border remittances. However, Mercator Advisory Groups most recent research report,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.prweb.net/Redirect.aspx?id=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubWVyY2F0b3JhZHZpc29yeWdyb3VwLmNvbS9SZXBvcnRzL1VuZGVyc3RhbmRpbmctQml0Y29pbl8tQmxvY2tjaGFpbi1BcHBsaWNhdGlvbnMtQmV5b25kLVBheW1lbnRzLw==" rel="nofollow">Understanding Bitcoin: Blockchain Applications Beyond Payments</a>&nbsp;argues that this is just one of the many applications possible with this technology and by no means the most interesting one. The blockchain could fundamentally alter a whole range of services that today require middlemen to maintain centralized databases. These applications range from using bitcoins to trade real-world assets like securities or land titles to structuring smart contracts that could pave the way for on-demand services like Airbnb without the need for an Airbnb to act as the middleman.</p><p>The shared ledger known as the blockchain represents a global consensus of events that have happened up until the latest block, all in the form of Bitcoin transactions. These two aspectsimmutability and decentralizationgive Bitcoin technology immense promise, far beyond simply enabling person-to-person transactions, comments Nikhil Joseph, Emerging Technologies Analyst at the Mercator Advisory Group and author of the report.</p><p>Highlights of this report include:&nbsp;<br></p><ul><li>An easy-to-understand explanation of the cryptography behind Bitcoin and why the technology represents a fundamental innovation</li><p></p><p></p><li>Breakdown of the key elements in a Bitcoin transaction and the role that miners play in the Bitcoin ecosystem</li><p></p><p></p><li>Analysis of how Bitcoin compares to card networks in facilitating retail payments and where it falls short</li><p></p><p></p><li>Explanation of ways in which the blockchain could be used to build digital asset exchanges to trade anything from securities to land titles</li><p></p><p></p><li>Examples of next-generation applications with smart contract use cases and the ways records could be secured on the blockchain</li></ul><p></p><p>This report contains 21 pages and 11 exhibits.</p><p>Companies mentioned in this report include: Circle Financial, Coinbase, Coinprism, Ethereum, Factom, MasterCard, Ripple Labs, and Visa.</p><p>Members of Mercator Advisory Groups Emerging Technologies Advisory Service have access to this report as well as the upcoming research for the year ahead, presentations, analyst access, and other membership benefits.</p><p>For more information and media inquiries, please call Mercator Advisory Group's main line: (781) 419-1700</p><p>For free industry news, opinions, research, company information and more visit us at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.prweb.net/Redirect.aspx?id=aHR0cDovL3d3dy5QYXltZW50c0pvdXJuYWwuY29t" rel="nofollow">http://www.PaymentsJournal.com</a>.</p><p>Follow us on Twitter @&nbsp;<a href="http://www.prweb.net/Redirect.aspx?id=aHR0cDovL3R3aXR0ZXIuY29tL01lcmNhdG9yQWR2aXNvcg==" rel="nofollow">http://twitter.com/MercatorAdvisor</a>.</p><p>About Mercator Advisory Group&nbsp;<br>Mercator Advisory Group is the leading independent research and advisory services firm exclusively focused on the payments and banking industries. We deliver pragmatic and timely research and advice designed to help our clients uncover the most lucrative opportunities to maximize revenue growth and contain costs. Our clients range from the world's largest payment issuers, acquirers, processors, merchants and associations to leading technology providers and investors. Mercator Advisory Group is also the publisher of the online payments and banking news and information portal PaymentsJournal.com.</p>
<h3>US Based HashingSpace Corporation Announced it has been uplifted to a higher reporting status on the OTC Market. HashingSpace will now be listed as OTCQB: HSHS. HashingSpace provides scalable datacenter and technology infrastructure for the global adoption of Bitcoin including Bitcoin ATMs and hosted ASIC mining.<br></h3><p>WENATCHEE, Wash.,&nbsp;July 29, 2015&nbsp;/PRNewswire/ -- HashingSpace Corporation (OTCQB: HSHS), a company focused on the global adoption of Bitcoin, announced today that it has officially been uplifted to a higher reporting status. HashingSpace will no longer be listed on the Pink Sheets and has been moved to OTCQB status.</p><p>HashingSpace Corporation submitted all the mandatory documents and has successfully met all of the initial requirements to receive this upgrade. The upgrade became official on&nbsp;July 23, 2015.</p><p>"We are pleased to learn that we have been upgraded to a higher status," stated&nbsp;Terry Taylor, Chief Financial Officer of HashingSpace. "This upgrade reflects on our plan to bring better value to our shareholders.  This shows that we are current in our SEC compliance reporting and will undergo an annual verification and certification process. Providing accurate information to our investors is a top priority."</p><p>Included in our new OTCQB designation will be real-time level 2 quote display. Quotes can be found at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.otcmarkets.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">www.otcmarkets.com</a></p><p>Weekly OTC Market Reports summarizing the activity in our security will be available.</p><p>All company information, including stock trading, filings, and market data related to the company, is reported under the new upgrade, OTCQB: HSHS.</p><p><b>HashingSpace Corporation's business will provide a wide range of services to include:</b></p><div><div><div><table><tbody><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHHOSTING</b></li></ul></td><td><p>Servers fully managed and specifically set-up for ASIC MINING</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>CLOUDHASH</b></li></ul></td><td><p>Cloud mining servers that can be rented with full hashing power</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHMINING</b></li></ul></td><td><p>Our own Mining Farm</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHATM</b>&nbsp;</li></ul></td><td><p>Owner and operator of Bitcoin ATM machines</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHWALLET</b></li></ul></td><td><p>Bitcoin consumer wallet for bitcoin banking and transactions</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHPOOL</b></li></ul></td><td><p>Public Stratum and P2Pool (Web/IOS/Droid)</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHTICKER</b>&nbsp;</li></ul></td><td><p>Free Ticker for tracking Bitcoin Value (Screen Saver/Web/IOS/Droid)</p></td></tr><tr><td><ul><li><b>HASHVAR</b></li></ul></td><td><p>A wholesaler of Bitcoin servers and Bitcoin ATM machines</p></td></tr></tbody></table></div></div></div><p><b>About HashingSpace Corporation</b></p><p>HashingSpace Corporation is a Bitcoin ASIC mining company, hosting provider, and service provider of blockchain transactional services. HashingSpace's high density datacenters are designed to meet the demanding power and cooling needs of client hosted Bitcoin mining gear with unparalleled pricing, cooling and green energy. The Corporation is continuing to expand its datacenters to satisfy the shortage of low cost hosting facilities catering to the Bitcoin and blockchain mining and transactional verification services industry specifically.</p><p>HashingSpace Corporation manages HashWallet, a Bitcoin wallet; HashPool, a Bitcoin mining pool; and HashATM, the owner and operator of Bitcoin ATM machines. The company is a wholesaler of Bitcoin mining servers and Bitcoin ATM machines. Bitcoin businesses interested in reselling HashingSpace products and services are invited to reach out to HashingSpace Corporation for more information.</p><p>HashingSpace Corporation is headquartered in&nbsp;Wenatchee, Washington. For more information, visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.hashingspace.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">www.hashingspace.com</a>.</p><p>Any unreleased services or features referenced in this or other press releases or public statements may not be currently available and may not be delivered on time or at all. Customers who purchase HashingSpace services should make their purchase decisions based upon features currently available. For more information please visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.hashingspace.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.hashingspace.com</a>&nbsp;or call 1-855-HASHING (427-4464).</p><p><b>Safe Harbor Statement</b></p><p>This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933 and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. These forward-looking statements are based on the current plans and expectations of management and are subject to a number of uncertainties and risks that could significantly affect the Company's current plans and expectations, as well as future results of operations and financial condition. The Company undertakes no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p></p><p>SOURCE HashingSpace Corporation</p><div><br></div>
<p></p><p><b>FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE</b></p><p><b>Würzburg,</b><b> Germany, </b><b>July 30</b><b>, 2015</b> Priolite GmbH is proud to announce the worlds first solution for high speed flash photography with high-powered Li-Ion battery operated studio and location strobes, compatible with Pentax digital medium format cameras.  </p><p>Similar to the Priolite Remote Control for Nikon and Canon, Pentax users are now able to synchronize their cameras with the help of the Priolite Hot Sync System, and use Priolites high-powered Li-Ion battery operated strobes at up to 1/4000th of a second on the <b>Pentax 645D and 645Z</b>. Utilizing the entire range of possible shutter speeds with the Priolite Hot Sync System allows photographers to shoot with wide-open apertures in sunlit environments, freezing motion of fast moving objects, and enables them to create images difficult or impossible to capture before. The ability to remotely control high-powered battery operated studio strobes anywhere between 17 w/s and up to 1000 w/s per light3 with the Priolite Remote Control opens up endless possibilities for creatives all around the world.   </p><p>High-powered strobe photography at shutter speeds of up to 1/4000th of a second, combined with the ability to operate any of the Priolite Hot Sync strobes at any power setting and without the need for an outlet, truly represents a quantum leap forward for all owners of Pentax medium format cameras, says Joachim Renschke, the CEO and founder of Priolite GmbH. By using the 2.4 GHz spectrum, the Priolite Remote Control supports 4 groups, 9 different IDs in each group, 1/10th of a stop power adjustments, and remote control of modeling lights wherever your next assignment might take you. Photographers now no longer have to rely on generators while on location, searching for outlets, or running wires when setting up their lights.  </p><p>As a Pentax 645Z user I am excited about Priolites development of their Hot Sync System. It enables Medium Format flash photography in a way impossible before, and with no need for leaf-shutter lenses. The 645Z can now reliably sync at up to 1/4000th of a second, making it the ultimate and most sophisticated tool amongst professionals looking for high resolution, high image quality, and high speed flash photography. Unlike other systems that can sync with flash lights at no more than 1/1600th of a second, Priolites solution is a clear game changer in the world of photography, says Alex Munoz, professional still and motion photographer from Los Angeles, California. <br></p><p><br></p><p><b><u>Main Features</u></b>  </p><p>Support Flash Sync speed on HSS enabled Pentax cameras up to 1/8000th of a second<br></p><p>Hot Sync works over the entire power range of the strobe from 17 w/s up to 1000 w/s (MBX/M-Pack 1000 HS)  </p><p>Wirelessly trigger and control Priolite strobes with the Priolite Remote Control (2.4 GHz)</p>  <p>Control Priolite strobes in 4 groups with 9 device IDs individually; control modeling lights</p>  <p>Provide up to 1000 w/s per light/head with a maximum of 220 full-power flashes per charge (MBX 500 HS)</p>  <p>Li-Ion powered (MBX and M-Pack series), no memory effect</p>  <p>Made in Germany with a 2 year warranty</p>  <p><b>&nbsp;</b></p>  <p><b><u>Content</u></b></p>  <p>Product introduction and first look video <b><a href="http://priolite.us/pentax_hss/">http://priolite.us/pentax_hss/</a></b></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b><u>Contact</u></b></p>  <p>PRIOLITE</p>  <p>888.818.7335 (Ext. 800)</p>  <p>hss@priolite.us</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b><u>Sales</u></b></p>  <p><a href="http://www.priolite.us">www.priolite.us</a></p>  <p></p><br>
<p>Edited by Stuart Hoegner and featuring a foreword by Jerry Brito of Coin Center, and articles from Bitcoin, law and cryptocurrency experts worldwide, newly-released book The Law of Bitcoin is an invaluable tool for anyone needing to understand how Bitcoin and cryptocurrency intersect with legal frameworks in the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada and Germany.<br></p><p>TORONTO,&nbsp;July 13, 2015&nbsp;/PRNewswire/ -- Published in&nbsp;July 2015&nbsp;and available now,&nbsp;<a href="http://thelawofbitcoin.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">The Law of Bitcoin</a>&nbsp;is a response to the great interest and need for a text focused on the law of cryptocurrencies, especially Bitcoin. This book is the first of its kind delving into cryptocurrency law in four jurisdictions:&nbsp;the United States, the&nbsp;United Kingdom,&nbsp;Canada&nbsp;and&nbsp;Germany. Written by knowledge leaders in the fields of law and cryptocurrency,&nbsp;<i>The Law of&nbsp;</i><i>Bitcoin</i>&nbsp;addresses such topics as the intersection of cryptocurrencies and criminal law, taxation, anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing regulations, securities law, consumer protection, negotiable instruments, currency law and financial regulation.&nbsp;<i>The Law of&nbsp;</i><i>Bitcoin</i>&nbsp;is a leading resource and go-to text both for those wishing to understand the basics of how the law affects cryptocurrency and Bitcoin businesses, and also for those in the legal community searching for sophisticated answers to more advanced questions.</p><p>Photo -&nbsp;<a href="http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150713/235634" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150713/235634</a></p><p><i><b>The Law of&nbsp;</b></i><b><i>Bitcoin&nbsp;</i></b><b>team is currently available for interviews with media&nbsp;</b><b>outletsworldwide</b><b>. To arrange an interview please email media(at)</b><b>thelawofbitcoin</b><b>.com or call +1 416 545 1386.</b></p><p><i>The Law of&nbsp;</i><i>Bitcoin</i>&nbsp;features contributors and legal experts from 4 different countries:</p><p>Stuart Hoegner&nbsp;(editor) is a lawyer and accountant in the cryptocurrency and Internet gaming spaces. He represents bitcoin and other cryptocurrency exchanges, leading cryptocurrency entrepreneurs and investors and blockchain 2.0 initiatives. He is General Counsel to the Bitcoin Alliance of&nbsp;Canada.</p><p>Paul Anning&nbsp;is a specialist financial services lawyer and partner at Osborne Clarke in&nbsp;London. He has a broad range of experience, including experience in M&amp;A and capital markets transactions, establishing private equity and property funds, and advising institutional investors on alternative investments.</p><p>Mark Brailsford&nbsp;is a Consultant in the corporate tax group at Osborne Clarke in&nbsp;London. Mark has over 25 years of experience in corporate tax and wide expertise in the UK and international tax arena. His primary focus lies with corporate tax and VAT structuring for corporate and financial transactions.</p><p>Lorna Brazell&nbsp;is a partner in the intellectual property litigation department at Osborne Clarke in&nbsp;London. She acts for a wide range of clients, advising technology-centric businesses in life sciences, digital business, energy, and financial services, and has been recognized for several years as a leading individual in both national and international directories.</p><p>Jerry Brito&nbsp;is executive director of Coin Center and adjunct professor of law at&nbsp;George Mason University. Jerry is the coauthor of Bitcoin: A Primer for Policymakers, as well as other scholarly works on the regulation of cryptocurrencies. Jerry has over ten years' experience in technology policy and he has testified twice before Congress on cryptocurrencies.</p><p>Matthew Cleary&nbsp;obtained his J.D. from the&nbsp;University of Colorado Boulder. He has developed a specialty in bitcoin regulation through a seminar paper on the subject and work on future publications. Matthew is an Associate Editor of the Colorado Natural Resources, Energy, and Environmental Law Review.</p><p>Jillian Friedman&nbsp;is a lawyer and academic with expertise in commercial law and financial services in the e-commerce sector. Jillian is Chief Legal Officer and member of the Board of Directors of the Bitcoin Foundation Canada, counsel to the Bitcoin Embassy (Montreal), and a board member of the&nbsp;Montreal&nbsp;chapter of the Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (ACAMS).</p><p>Ryan Straus&nbsp;is an attorney and co-chair of the Payments Practice Group at Riddell Williams in&nbsp;Seattle. Ryan has extensive experience in payments matters, including electronic payments, mobile payments, prepaid cards, alternative currencies, and federal and state licensing. Ryan is counsel for industry leaders in the banking, payment processing and cryptocurrency sectors.</p><p>Michael Taylor&nbsp;is Legal Counsel at Travelex in&nbsp;London, specializing in the legal and regulatory aspects of payment services, e-money, and consumer credit. Michael has worked with a broad range of clients, particularly digital and FinTech businesses.</p><p>Christoph-Nikolaus von Unruh&nbsp;is a lawyer in&nbsp;Germany&nbsp;and the CEO and co-founder of Dogecoin-based app DogeRain. Nikolaus obtained his law degree from&nbsp;Humboldt University in Berlin&nbsp;and has a Masters degree in company and taxation law. His Masters thesis was on VAT on bitcoin transactions.</p><p><b>To learn more please go to:</b>&nbsp;<a href="http://thelawofbitcoin.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://thelawofbitcoin.com</a></p><p><i><b>The Law of&nbsp;</b></i><b><i>Bitcoin</i></b><b>team is currently available for interviews with media outlets worldwide.</b></p><p><b>Media Contact:</b></p><p><b>Name:</b>&nbsp;Lisa Guylee,&nbsp;Toronto, Canada</p><p><b>Email:&nbsp;</b>media(at)thelawofbitcoin.com</p><p><b>Phone:</b>&nbsp;+1 416 545 1386</p><p></p><p>SOURCE&nbsp;Jerry Brito</p>
<p>When personal trainer Jennifer Johnson gave birth to her son Cole, she had to find a way to stay active while giving her baby the attention he needed. Cole was a high needs baby, so he would never let Jennifer put him down. Jennifer began taking walks carrying Cole and soon incorporated stair workouts and hills using him as her weight for resistance exercises. They both loved the daily workouts and time together and Jennifer got in great post-pregnancy shape. Her experience inspired her to create <a href="http://www.babystrongworkout.com/" target="_blank">Baby Strong Workout</a>, a set of cards featuring innovative, fun and effective mommy &amp; me exercises and customizable workouts. Jennifer has just launched Baby Strong on Kickstarter to help more moms get active and feel good post-pregnancy!</p><p><br></p><p>Moms may have every intention to work out after having a baby but, more often than not, find it near impossible to find the time or money to do so. Moms end up giving up on essential mommy care and as a result, dont feel good about themselves. Its not just about fitting into your pre-pregnancy jeans or losing the baby weight  its about feeling healthy, confident and strong. When I had my son and literally couldnt ever put him down, I knew I had to figure something out to be able to take care of myself without neglecting his needs. I experienced firsthand how great the Baby Strong exercises worked to get me in shape, tried them out on clients and test groups, and then I knew I had to find a way to help other moms, shares Jennifer Johnson, perinatal exercise specialist and inventor of Baby Strong.</p><p><br></p><p>The&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babystrongworkout.com/" target="_blank">Baby Strong exercise cards</a>&nbsp;all feature real moms and their babies to show how customizable the program is for moms of all shapes, sizes, and fitness levels. The exercises help moms build functional strength to do all the things a mom needs to get done each day. Baby is held by mom in every single exercise so mom doesnt have to find a sitter or deal with unnecessary tears or guilt so she can get in a daily workout. With Baby Strong, babys need to be close to mom is met while moms need to take care of herself doesnt have to be compromised. The Baby Strong card program is fun, effective, inexpensive, and portable so it can be carried in a diaper bag or purse for whenever mom needs a pick-me-up.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="450" alt="preorderpng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/preorder-png" height="236"></p><p><br></p><p>Features:<br></p><p><br></p><ul><br><li>Deck of workout cards held together with a teething ring link</li><br><li>Baby Safe: chew, drool and baby-friendly material used for cards</li><br><li>Text and photo instructions included for each exercise</li><br><li>Follow pre-made workouts or customize your own</li><br></ul><p><br></p><p>Benefits:</p><p><br></p><ul><br><li>Workout with ONLY mom + baby!</li><br><li>No gym, no classes, no special equipment</li><br><li>Created for moms of all shapes, sizes and fitness levels</li><br><li>Helps moms feel strong, healthy, happy, and confident</li><br><li>Fun, effective, and inexpensive workout for moms</li><br><li>Mommy Care + Baby Care</li><br><li>No Tears. No Guilt. </li><br></ul><p><br></p><p><img width="450" alt="cardspng" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/cards-png" height="220"></p><p><br></p><p>About Jennifer Johnson</p><p><br></p><p>Creator Jennifer Johnson is a perinatal exercise specialist and founder of Fit for Expecting, a unique resource for&nbsp;<a href="http://www.babystrongworkout.com/" target="_blank">safe and effective exercise programs for moms</a>. Jennifers specialty and exclusive focus is on the perinatal exercise. She is a certified personal trainer and perinatal exercise specialist. Jennifer has a passion for helping mothers and believes that by helping moms, she can positively impact the lives of their children.</p><p><br></p><p>Baby Strong currently has a goal of $9,000 and has different reward levels to thank backers. You can pre-order your first deck of Baby Strong Workout cards and with a pledge of $150 or more you receive a 30-minute Skype exercise consultation with Jennifer herself. </p><p><br></p><p>To visit the Kickstarter campaign page visit:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/babystrong/baby-strong-workout-mom-and-baby-exercise-cards" target="_blank">https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/babystrong/baby-strong-workout-mom-and-baby-exercise-cards</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>To schedule an interview with founder Jennifer Johnson, please contact Giselle Diaz at&nbsp;<a target="_blank">Giselle@socialmedia22.com</a>&nbsp;or call 914-325-9786. </p><p><br></p><p>###</p>
<i></i><div><b><i></i>Chicago, IL  August 6, 2015: </b>Lifelong entrepreneur and Director of Business Development for The Entrepreneur Café, LLC has seen a lot in his 20 years<b> </b>of helping entrepreneurs and developing startups. According to Cavanaugh, New business owners can often find themselves intimidated or overwhelmed by the business development process and can struggle to determine if their idea is viable. According to the U.S. Census Bureau, there are an estimated 27.9 million small firms in the U.S. with 21.7 million being one person shops with no employees. At some point these owners will be faced with issues that can sidetrack or derail their new venture including an ineffective management team, poor return on marketing and lack of access to capital and resources. Drawing on his expertise as a small business development specialist and a college educator in entrepreneurship and branding, Cavanaugh wrote <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Entrepreneurial-Spirit-Lives-Entrepreneurs-Business-ebook/dp/B00C2C1SR8/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1391637261&amp;sr=1-1&amp;keywords=The+Entrepreneurial+Spirit+Lives"><i>The Entrepreneurial Spirit Lives: 25 Tales To Help Entrepreneurs Start, Grow and Succeed In Small Business</i></a>. The book made Ownerds list of <a href="http://www.ownerd.com/50-books-to-inspire-you-on-your-entrepreneur-business-growth-journey/"><i>50 Books To Inspire You On Your Entrepreneur and Business Growth Journey</i></a>.</div>  <div><br></div><div>In <b>Chapter 6: Mission Statements Keep Your Business on Course</b>, Cavanaugh describes a companys mission statement as a dynamic, living breathing work in progress. According to Cavanaugh, A good mission statement provides an opportunity to define your business at its most basic level. A quality statement should in a small way tell your companys story, explain what you do, and express your organizations ideals, beliefs and values. Cavanaugh offers the following tips for developing or reexamining your mission statement.</div><div><br></div>  <div></div><ul><li>Are your companys products and services clearly defined?<br></li><li>Can the reader of your mission statement determine what markets you compete in?</li><li>Does your mission statement define who your target customers are?</li><li>Does your mission statement identify a problem, needs and wants of the customer?</li><li>Does your mission statement communicate your strengths and competitive advantage?</li></ul><div></div>  <div><br></div><div>In <i>The Entrepreneurial Spirit Lives</i>, Cavanaugh brings his passion for the discipline of entrepreneurship to this collection of small business topics.&nbsp; The book offers practical and easy to follow small business advice along with downloadable and interactive end of chapter exercises. According to Cavanaugh, Starting a business doesnt have to be complicated, you just have to be willing to take the first step. On the road to small business success, entrepreneurs will likely find themselves at different stages in their journey. <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Entrepreneurial-Spirit-Lives-Entrepreneurs-Business-ebook/dp/B00C2C1SR8/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1391637261&amp;sr=1-1&amp;keywords=The+Entrepreneurial+Spirit+Lives"><i>The Entrepreneurial Spirit Lives: 25 Tales To Help Entrepreneurs Start, Grow and Succeed In Small Business</i></a> is written for individuals looking to gain a better understanding of small business concepts, for startups looking to better navigate the entrepreneurial landscape, for smaller organizations looking to expand, and for entrepreneurs everywhere nurturing a dream. </div>  <div><br></div><div>Cavanaugh L. Gray is the Director of Business Development for <a href="http://www.ecafellc.com/">The Entrepreneur Café, LLC</a> a small business development company based in Chicago, IL (Phone/Fax) 877-511-4820. To read a chapter from <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Entrepreneurial-Spirit-Lives-Entrepreneurs-Business-ebook/dp/B00C2C1SR8/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1391637261&amp;sr=1-1&amp;keywords=The+Entrepreneurial+Spirit+Lives"><i>The Entrepreneurial Spirit Lives: 25 Tales to Help Entrepreneurs Start, Grow, and Succeed in Small Business</i></a> or for assistance with your small business log on to <a href="http://www.ecafellc.com/">www.ecafellc.com</a>. Help us share the discipline of entrepreneurship with our <i><a href="http://www.slideshare.net/clgray4/final-v5" target="_blank">Startup Questionnaire</a></i>. For daily startup advice, Connect With Us on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Entrepreneur-Cafe-LLC/160182630678613?ref=br_rs">Facebook</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/TheECafe">Twitter</a>&nbsp; or&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/cavanaugh-l-gray/7/63a/a40">LinkedIn</a><i>.</i></div>
<div><br></div><p>Imagine speaking a language that you know has a high chance of disappearing from Earth in the next generation or two. The cultural heritage, the quirks of expression, some childhood images that can only be expressed in your native language - gone.</p><p>This is exactly the where Ryan Heavy Head found himself. As a member of the Blackfoot tribe, Ryan looked for a way to find a connection to his language and culture.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p> After serving in the military, he reconnected with his heritage by studying the history and language. He went on to design courses in Blackfoot culture that relied on field observation of the cycles of life and seasonal changes in the environment, as well as cultural artefacts called bundles that represented mans contract with the natural world.</p><p>Ryan is not alone in speaking an endangered language. In North America alone there are hundreds of languages that are considered in danger, many of them heritage languages.</p><p>While there are traditional efforts made in preserving endangered languages: through UNESCO and funds dedicated to the task, internet technologies are making language preservation much easier. Online resources are maintained by organizations and enthusiasts.</p><p>Ryan is unique, however, in his approach to help preserve his language and traditions. He is pursuing an educational model that touches on the living aspects of the language: the cultural mindset and perception of the world that cannot be captured in books or recordings.</p><p>He has started his own educational initiative centered around Blackfoot language and culture. He is also teaching the language online, through a language-education platform called italki, in order to teach his beloved subject to a global audience. He has had students take his classes from places as diverse as Germany and China. This diversity of interest from the rest of the world offsets the apathy that is often found towards Native languages in reservation communities, and serves as an indicator that there is hope for recovery of endangered languages and cultures through online education. </p><p><b>Additional Resources: </b></p><p><a href="https://vimeo.com/75446810">https://vimeo.com/75446810</a></p><p><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSvn--lTQsg" title="Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSvn--lTQsg">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSvn--lTQsg</a></p><p></p><p><a href="http://www.theecologist.org/Guides/The_Ecologist_Guide_to_Skills_and_Courses/2007750/enlivened_learning_at_red_crow_community_college.html" title="Link: http://www.theecologist.org/Guides/The_Ecologist_Guide_to_Skills_and_Courses/2007750/enlivened_learning_at_red_crow_community_college.html">http://www.theecologist.org/Guides/The_Ecologist_Guide_to_Skills_and_Courses/2007750/enlivened_learning_at_red_crow_community_college.html</a></p>
<p>Going abroad to spend time making a better world can be a tough decision, but that is only the first of many sacrifices that a Peace Corps volunteer must makes. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>One of the challenges of going into isolated places in the world can pose for a Peace Corps volunteer is the language. Though the volunteers are smart, well-educated people that are looking to help, the language resources available to them before landing in-country can be quite scarce. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>So much of the work a volunteer does depends on her ability to pick up a foreign language in only 3 months of training (which happens AFTER she arrives to her assignment in-country).</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>For Kelsey, the possibility of being able to start this process early is a game-changer. She is about to embark on a tour of duty in Malawi, needing to acquire Chewa. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Much to her surprise her friend recommended to look for a native Chewa speaker online. She lucked out when she found an italki user who is a native fluent speaker of the language, Friday <a href="http://www.italki.com/user/2098564">http://www.italki.com/user/2098564</a>.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Kelsey was so excited she got in touch with italki, asking us to encourage him to apply to be a teacher of the language on the platform. We gleefully agreed and are currently in communication with Friday about the possibility. </p><p><br></p><p>Once confirmed, Friday will be joining the quickly growing group of italki teachers of #rare languages, including Blackfoot, Welsh, Basque, Yoruba, and dozens of others. &nbsp;</p>
<p>Russian culture and freedom of expression has been under pressure in recent years. This includes, oddly enough, the ancient and mystical oral art of mat, or the Russian curse language. This form of cultural expression is colorful and linguistically intriguing (entire conversations can be had in nothing but blush-inducing, hair-raising, and often hilarious use of cursing, aided by Russian grammatical flexibility and a flair for the literary so inherent in Russian culture).<br></p><p><b><br></b></p><p>It has, however, been banned in Russia since June 2014, putting many works of literature, film, and music into the category of illegal expression. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Though censorship is not new to any Russian, the cultural landscape has changed significantly with the changes in media distribution models brought on by the internet. Krovostok records and profane films propagate online through Torrents, social networks (especially VK, where a large amount of Russian music is available to play streaming for free). </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>The resources of a connected world are even making an impact in the educational sphere. Besides the ability to learn proper Russian through a multitude of services, apps like DuoLingo and Memrise, it is possible to learn the art of mat from a teacher on italki, a social network and marketplace for language-learners: <a href="http://www.italki.com/course/34641" title="Link: http://www.italki.com/course/34641">http://www.italki.com/course/34641</a></p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Anna Wiazemsky is offering a cursing course for advanced Russian students, giving anyone dedicated to learning Russian the ability to become uniquely fluent in a way no other educational program would be able to achieve. </p><p><br></p>
<p>The era of globalization is giving the world more than anxiety over ethical manufacturing practices. It is also creating the ability for individuals to truly make a difference on a personal, human scale. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Meet Derek, a man from Java who has found a way to make a difference by teaching children English and music in Colombia. </p><p><b><br></b></p><p>He is funding his teaching efforts by giving Indonesian and English lessons on italki.com, a platform for language exhange and one-on-one language classes with teachers in over 100 languages. <a href="http://www.italki.com/teacher/2605559">http://www.italki.com/teacher/2605559</a> </p><p><br></p><p>A touching element of his teaching strategy is that he uses his Indonesian lessons online to fund his ability to volunteer and continue educating children in Pereira, Colombia. Thereby, every class taken with the teacher is a contribution to a better education and hope for success to an underprivileged child. </p>

With IHB's recent acquisition of the BlockStreet iOS App they now have exclusive access to the coveted bitcoin trading demographic."</blockquote></i> Brock Pierce, Managing Partner at Blockchain Capital, Chairman of the Bitcoin Foundation and IHB Investor &amp; Advisor<br></div><div><br></div><div>The core value proposition is an emphasis on having the freedom to create inspiring digital content to drive higher engagement rates. The comprehensive system supports a mobile first strategy with output across all platforms.<br></div><div><br></div><div>IHB produces bitcoin content only after doing a very detailed SEO analysis against competitors. Check out the <a href="https://ihb.io/advertising" target="_blank">IHB Advertising</a> or send an email to Gavin Knight at ihb@ihb.io and the right person will get in touch.</b><br></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><b></b><u><b>About IHB</b></u><b></b><br><b></b></div><div>IHB is a privately held media and data services company that caters to an exceedingly tech-savvy and affluent demographic. Our strength lies in the ability to securely deliver high-quality bitcoin news and data with precision and speed.<br><b></b></div><div><br></div><div><a href="https://ihb.io/">IHB News</a> engages in developing, assembling and disseminating news and information. Our focus is on increasing awareness of topics related to Bitcoin and Blockchain technology. We reach a global audience online at ihb.io and also deliver content across other digital platforms, including mobile and e-reader applications and social networking sites.<br><b></b></div><div><br></div><div><a href="https://ihb.io/global-bitcoin-index">The Global Bitcoin Index</a> is the most authoritative index for bitcoin pricing. The index offers a real time measure of Bitcoin versus a diversified list of emerging and developed market currencies. It was constructed to provide a better measure of Bitcoin prices as compared to other indexes that have arbitrary rules, opaque data and proprietary formulas.<br></div><div><br></div><div>IHB actively conducts Research &amp; Development with the Bitcoin community through <a href="https://plus.google.com/communities/101061746158310035784">IHB Labs</a>. Our first project is the development of the Global Bitcoin Widget. Its stated goal is to create a tool so powerful it changes the way we think about the status quo. Currently in beta, we hope to produce an innovative gateway to the Internet of money.<br></div>

<p>SAN JOSE, CA  Opera San José recently completed its 31st season with the Irene Dalis Memorial Concert. Dalis, who founded Opera San José in 1984, passed away last December at the age of 89. More than 20 current and former members of Opera San Josés resident company, accompanied by the Opera San José Orchestra and Chorus, performed some of Daliss most memorable excerpts from her extraordinary career. The capacity audience from across the community, celebrating the legacy of Irene Dalis, was a testament to her contribution to the quality of life in our region. Opera San Josés 201415 season also featured an impressive range of works at the California Theatre beginning in September 2014 with a production of Verdis dramatic Rigoletto, a tale of a brutalized court jester determined to protect his daughter from a decadent court and a duke who seduces and abandons women. Heather Morris of Peninsula Reviews wrote, Baritone Matthew Hanscoms Rigoletto was superb. He took us along his emotional roller coaster ride with a wonderfully versatile voice, full of expressive personality and technical prowess. The company followed Rigoletto in November with Rossinis comedy The Italian Girl in Algiers, a tale of a clever Italian girl shipwrecked in a foreign land while searching for her lover, but finding herself the focus of a powerful sultans unwanted affections. Kevin Kirby of The Metro said, From the very first note of the overture, you know you are in good hands musically. Luke's orchestra responds like a finely tuned Italian sports car, and the acoustics of the California Theatre allow the ensemble to show off its full dynamic range while never overpowering the singers.<br></p>
<p>Beijing, June 30 2015  Baidu Nuomi, a leading O2O (Online to Offline) service, today unveiled its Membership Plus O2O ecosystem strategy. At a press conference held this morning in Beijing, Baidu chairman and CEO Robin Li also announced that Baidu would invest RMB 20 billion over the next three years to expand the life services platform.<br></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>I took a look yesterday, and right now Baidu has over fifty billion RMB in cash on its books. Were going to take 20 billion of that and do Nuomi right, said Li.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Baidu Nuomi estimates that it will occupy the number two position in its category by the end of the year, as measured in sales proceeds.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Baidu Nuomis Membership Plus strategy will help merchants establish their own marketing platforms to increase user retention rates and consumption frequency. It will integrate Nuomis membership system with merchants own CRM systems through members-only prepaid cards, a payment after service offer, and through <i>BaiNuoLian</i>, a commission-based app for promotions. It plans to provide merchants with big data-driven tools for behavioral analytics, assisting merchants in making optimal decisions. The strategy will help merchants to acquire loyal users online, allowing them to tap into Baidus huge user base and driving large amounts of traffic to their sites or to their physical places of business.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Users who have reached certain spending levels automatically become VIP members, who then enjoy double discountsfrom Nuomi itself, and from the merchants member clubs.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Baidu has been indexing the real world, and connecting people with services in the mobile era through its technology-based products and its ecosystem build-out, said Robin Li. Baidu Nuomi, as a platform that truly connects people with local life services, has been making great strides over the past year. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Going from connecting people with information to connecting people with services is a major transition, said Li. Such a transition requires determination, and it comes with costs. When weve determined to undertake something new, and it becomes the companys priority, we focus the whole companys attention into it. We dont just make promises: We deliver. And usually, we under promise, and over deliver, said Li.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Li emphasized that Baidus O2O strategy will fully leverage the companys strengths in technologyfrom voice and image recognition to Natural Language Processing to Big Data and Deep Learning.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Zeng Liang, vice president at Baidu and general manager of Baidu Nuomi, said, Nuomis membership-based system drives customers to merchants, raises the quality of user experience, and helps create a healthy market ecosystem with merchants. These advantages are what differentiate Nuomi from the traditional group-buy platformswhich usually have fewer loyal users who tend to be very price-sensitive and are locked into a vicious circle of price competition that downgrades user experience.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Nuomi now operates in over 330 Chinese cities and aims to expand to cover all Chinese cities by the end of the year. It now boasts 650,000 online stores, with nearly 2 billion RMB in monthly turnover.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Nuomi has been testing its Membership Plus strategy this year in two key categoriesrestaurants and movie ticketsby launching prepaid cards and membership cards.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>In trial operations, only four months after the launch of its prepaid card together with Nuomi, the famous Beijing Cantonese restaurant Lao Guang says that the cards brought in an additional million yuan in <a>turnover</a><a>[ys1]</a>&nbsp;. Traditional group buy can only bring us one-off customers, but Baidu Nuomis prepaid cards have helped us turn these one-time group buy customers into regulars. It is bringing us a large number of online members while helping us retain off-line customers. This is significantly improving the overall profitability of the restaurant, said Zhang Bin, general manager of Lao Guang restaurant.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>During the recent May Day holiday, Baidu Nuomi introduced joint movie ticket membership cards with Dadi Digital Cinema, Stellar Mega, and 17.5. These membership cards sold out instantly. Zhao Jian, president of Stella Mega, said, Baidu Nuomis joint membership cards have brought new experiences to our online customers. In addition to helping us attract new members, its also allowed us to provide a customized viewing experience to them, based on their personal preferences. This has not only helped our cinemas to generate more revenue, but has enhanced our user loyalty and increased value-add consumption in theaters.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Gao Shuang, an analyst at the China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC), said she believes that the Membership Plus strategy pioneered by Baidu not only connects online and offline membership, but also helps business to increase profitability, enhance customer loyalty, pull in new customers, and improve retention rates. At the same time, it also provides users with greater freedom, convenience, and quality in service experience. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>As a truly collaborative platform for merchants and Baidu Nuomi, it stands out as an innovation in the O2O area. The 20 billion RMB investment over the next three years will bolster Nuomis advantage in overall resources, and will significantly alter the landscape and current market structure in the highly competitive O2O market.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Baidu</b></p><p>Baidu, Inc. is the leading Chinese language Internet search provider. As a technology-based media company, Baidu aims to provide the best and most equitable way for people to find what theyre looking for. In addition to serving individual Internet search users, Baidu provides an effective platform for businesses to reach potential customers. Baidus ADSs trade on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol BIDU. Currently, ten ADSs represent one Class A ordinary share.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Media Inquiries</b></p><p>Kaiser Kuo</p><p>Director, International Communications</p><p><a>kaiser.kuo@baidu.com</a></p><p>(86-10) 5992-8419</p><p><br></p><div><div><div>  </div>  </div>  </div>

The Peoples' Bank of China just shifted its official exchange rate for the second day running, effectively allowing&nbsp;the yuan to tumble by&nbsp;another 1.9% against the dollar, after a 1.9% cut on Tuesday.<br><br>Tuesday's cut was the biggest single move in a day, and together they take the Chinese currency back to where it was to the dollar in October 2012.<br><br>The&nbsp;PBOC has fixed the yuan at 6.3306 to the US dollar on Wednesday morning, weaker than where the spot price closed yesterday at 6.3250.<br><br>The yuan has weakened further  as of 7:25 a.m. London time (2:25 a.m. ET) it's at 6.444 against the dollar.<br><br>On Tuesday the PBOC fixed the USD/CNY at 6.2298, nearly 2% below the level seen on Monday following an unexpected currency devaluation.<br><br>Here's how it looks:<br><br>Over the longer term it's clear to see that China's currency has strengthened considerably against the dollar over the last decade.<br><br>The PBoC is trying to reverse some of that trend  in fact, the&nbsp;China is pretty much the only major trading partner of the United States whose currency hadn't&nbsp;already tumbled against the dollar in recent years:<br><br>Though the Shanghai Composite is pretty flat, down just 0.20% as of 7:30 a.m. London time (2:30 a.m. ET), other Asian markets are getting smoked.&nbsp;Japan's Nikkei&nbsp;is down 1.58% and&nbsp;Hong Kong's Hang Seng&nbsp;is down 2.11%.<br><br>European luxury exporters and premium car firms like LVMH and BMW got hammered yesterday too, a process that could resume again shortly.<br><br>A devaluation typically benefits a country's domestic producers, boosting their ability to export. That's because their goods are suddenly cheaper on international markets. A product that was worth 100 yuan two days ago is now effectively worth more like 96 yuan, if you're buying in dollars.<br><br>The opposite side of that is that it hurts anyone trying to export into China, since products denominated in other currencies are effectively getting more expensive.<br><br>The Chinese authorities are effectively trying to stimulate&nbsp;the economy, which has seen slowing growth in recent years. It remains to be seen just how much of a devaluation they're willing to engineer to achieve that goal.
<p><a href="http://www.socialcentiv.com/">SocialCentiv</a>, whose software-based service helps companies of all sizes find new customers on Twitter, announces a new feature that makes it easier and faster for a company to share its promotions and special offers with consumers.</p><p>SocialCentivs patented software uses a subscribers keywords and geographic location to comb Twitter for relevant Tweets, and drops them on a dashboard called the Tweet Stream so the business can @ direct reply with a coupon or discount to get them in the door.</p><p>The new multiple campaigns feature provides SocialCentiv clients a way to manage numerous discounts and other offers they may be using simultaneously to attract Twitter users who have expressed a need via the social networking platform for what the business sells.</p><p>As any good marketer knows, a business must use different types of promotions in different circumstances, such as price discounts, limited-time sales or product giveaways, says Bernard Perrine, CEO and co-founder of SocialCentiv. Extending multiple offers at the same time can be a challenge. Using keywords and geo-targeting, our multiple campaigns application makes that juggling act a snap.</p><p><b>Adding new campaigns</b></p><p>After logging in to SocialCentivs online service, customers will see a new tab in the navigation bar called Campaigns. By clicking that tab, followed by hitting a button marked Create a new campaign, they will receive the option of either building a new promotion or duplicating an existing one.</p><p></p><ul><li><b>Creating a new campaign</b>: This is the best route for building new offers that use unique keywords and locations. The SocialCentiv software guides users through such tasks as creating landing pages and follow-up emails and providing external links. After that, the user can pick the geographic locations to target consumers, along with keywords for filtering Tweets to find the right prospects.</li><li><b>Duplicating an existing campaign</b>: This is a good way to modify existing promotions for other uses or target groups. The Duplicate an existing campaign button includes the keywords and locations that were part of the original effort. From there, its simple to edit the promotion to suit the marketers needs. After the changes are made, SocialCentivs software asks the user to give the campaign a name. Its best to give each promotion a unique, relevant label to easily distinguish it from other offers the company might be using.<br></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Sorting Tweets to correct campaigns</b></p><p>Businesses that offer multiple promotions concurrently often use some of the same keywords or locations in different campaigns.</p><p>If a consumers Tweet contains keywords or a location that crosses two or more campaigns a marketer is running, the SocialCentiv software will flag that Tweet and ask the sender which promotional effort he or she is replying to.</p><p>This helps ensure that the business responds optimally to every person who has expressed a need through Twitter for the companys offerings, Perrine says.</p><p>Our multiple campaigns feature is part of our on-going effort to streamline the process of helping our customers generate new business through Twitter, he explains. This social network is the first place many consumers go to express their needs and desires, from being hungry or thirsty to wanting a new car. Thanks to improvements like the multiple campaigns upgrade, SocialCentivs software makes it easier than ever to mine Twitter for that marketing gold.</p><p><b>About SocialCentiv</b></p><p>In August 2014, HipLogiq integrated its portfolio of Twitter marketing applications under a single product line, SocialCentiv. Now, businesses can visit <a href="http://www.socialcentiv.com/">www.SocialCentiv.com</a> and find a user-friendly, do-it-yourself Twitter marketing tool that makes it easy to create a campaign that tracks keywords and reaches relevant consumers with greater precision by targeting local Tweets. You can be part of the most relevant Tweets as they happen, spot opportunities first, and make a name for yourself with SocialCentiv.</p><p>Since May 2013, SocialCentiv has received $12 million in two rounds of funding. For more information, go to <a href="http://www.socialcentiv.com/">www.SocialCentiv.com</a>, like us on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/socialcentiv">Facebook</a> and follow us on<a href="https://twitter.com/SocialCentiv" title="Link: https://twitter.com/SocialCentiv"> Twitter</a>.</p><p>###</p><p></p><p>For more information, contact Karen Carrera, TrizCom, 972-207-1935, <a>karen@trizcom.com</a> or @kjcarrera.</p>
