<p>Tuesday, October 20, 2015, Memphis, TN  Today and tomorrow, law enforcement and political leaders will converge on Memphis, home of the largest known rape kit backlog, to share best practices and other useful information. &nbsp;Yet, the public and media are banned from the events.<br></p><p>Representatives from <a href="http://www.enforcerapelaws.org" target="_blank">People for the Enforcement of Rape Laws</a> (PERL), a Memphis-based anti-rape advocacy organization, were unable to attend the meeting, which had been promoted by local officials for months.</p><p>The public has little faith in law enforcement handling of rape cases, said Meaghan Ybos, Executive Director of PERL. &nbsp;The secrecy of this summit undermines the credibility of officials who claim that Memphis police have changed their ways.</p><p>In fact, Memphis stands behind MPDs handling of past cases, Ybos noted. &nbsp;The public cannot be expected to take the departments word that it has fixed institutional problems.</p><p> </p><p>Ybos isnt the only Memphian to lambast the secrecy of the rape kit summit.</p><p>Jeni Diprizio of WATN remarked: "I love it when Memphis' media relations person keeps the media out of an event and then police tell a photographer he can't even shoot video in the lobby of a public building and gets in front of the camera to block him. Nope, this time it wasn't me but I really wish I had been there! As for their "top secret" summit, don't worry I was able to call and get the agenda from a different, more transparent administration!"</p><p>Keli Rabon, a former Memphis reporter who<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CzK0mow1CVQ"> first investigated MPDs use of rape kits in 2010</a>, commented: I'm disappointed there isn't a session on how to lie to the media about your rape kit problem.</p><p>It is unclear what sources have funded this summit.<br></p>
<p>NEWS<br></p><p>For Immediate Release</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FEMA LAB LAUNCHES PERMANENT TESTING OF ADVANCED WARNING AND RESPONSE NETWORK</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Life-Saving Technology Will Leverage Next-Generation ATSC 3.0 Broadcast TV Standard</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>WASHINGTON, Oct. 20, 2015  The U.S. Federal Emergency Management Agencys Integrated Public Alert and Warning System <a href="https://www.fema.gov/testing-ipaws-lab-jitc">(IPAWS) Lab</a> is now playing host to a technology demonstration of <a>AWARN</a>  the Advanced Warning and Response Network. </p><p>Developed and supported by leading technology companies and broadcasters, AWARN will leverage next-generation broadcast technology to transmit next-generation emergency alerts to the public. AWARN capitalizes on existing emergency alerting standards and builds upon the Mobile Emergency Alert System (M-EAS) developed during a pilot project and standardized by the Advanced Television Systems Committee (ATSC).</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FEMAs testing, in the IPAWS Lab located at the Joint Interoperability Test Command in Indian Head, Md., will demonstrate the feasibility and operational deployment of AWARN within the IPAWS suite of technologies and allow public safety officials to gain confidence using IPAWS in a secure environment, according to FEMA. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>AWARNs equipment will be put through its paces at the IPAWS Lab, where closed-environment testing will be employed to assess its capabilities. Testing will begin with M-EAS using current-generation digital broadcast technology as a solid foundation for advanced emergency alerting using next-gen broadcasting technology. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>AWARN senior advisor John Lawson, president of <a>Convergence Services, Inc</a>., called broadcast Advanced Emergency Alerting a major addition to FEMAs network of networks for public safety communications. It will provide vital information to the public whether or not the cellular network is functioning or the electric grid is intact, he explained. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>The current U.S. broadcast standard, the <a>ATSC</a> &nbsp;A/53 Digital Television Standard adopted in the 1990s, is being upgraded to a new more flexible and powerful version called ATSC 3.0. This new broadcast system, currently being standardized, promises to provide a more robust transmission, a higher data throughput and improved indoor reception. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Integrated into the new ATSC 3.0 standard will be a capability for Advanced Emergency Alerts such as AWARN. Mobile digital television reception is a core component of the new standard, meaning that the same broadcast signal going to home TV sets can easily be simultaneously transmitted to ATSC 3.0-equipped smartphones and tablets. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Just as with M-EAS, AWARN is designed to integrate seamlessly with IPAWS. Alerts generated by state, regional, or local authorities currently trigger text and tone alerts under the legacy Emergency Alert System to be received by viewers and listeners.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>AWARN uses the new capabilities inherent in ATSC 3.0 to deliver rich media alerts. Video, photographs, text, evacuation routes, maps, plume models, radar images, html pages, shelter information, Amber Alerts and more can be transmitted as part of the AWARN alert. </p><p>This advanced use of rich media allows the public to search for more information on each alert issued, all via the broadcast transmission stream or, to put it another way, without using their data plan or having to access LTE or 4G at all. The use of Internet Protocol technology allows the new application to be flexible and extensible. Data delivery, non-real-time delivery, and electronic service guides are all included. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Lawson said that testing at the IPAWS Lab will address more than technical issues. It also is an opportunity for emergency managers to move beyond text messages and sirens to distribute rich media assets, including multilingual and accessible alerts, such as text-to-speech. He said initial FEMA testing with first-generation technology lays the groundwork for further testing of the very robust advanced alerting system as the ATSC 3.0 standard process proceeds over the next year.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>AWARN is supported by leading broadcasters and technology companies including; Gates Air, LG Electronics (and its U.S. R&amp;D subsidiary Zenith), Digital Alert Systems, Monroe Electronics, Triveni Digital, NAB Labs, Capital Broadcasting, PBS, Convergence Services, and others.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>AWARN Media Contacts:</p><p>Dave Arland, Arland Communications&nbsp; - Dave@ArlandCom.com&nbsp; - 317-701-0084</p><p>John Taylor, LG Electronics USA - <a href="mailto:John.Taylor@lge.com">John.Taylor@lge.com</a> -&nbsp; 202-719-3490</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>News Release from FEMA</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>October 20, 2015</p><p>HQ-15-073</p><p>Contact: FEMA News Desk</p><p>Phone: 202-646-3272</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FEMA to Assess Future Over-the-Air Broadcast Alerting Technology</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>WASHINGTON The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) National Continuity Programs Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Division has begun to assess the feasibility of a public alert and warning capability that is being developed in the private sector. &nbsp; </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>New technologies could deliver detailed emergency information to the public with pictures and videos of evacuation routes, storm tracks, and shelter information  increasing community preparedness before, during, and after a disaster. The media alerts will be able to include multilingual and multi-format information to warn non-English speaking populations and people with access and functional needs. &nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FEMA is committed to working with the private sector to examine and improve future alerts and warnings, said Roger Stone, Acting Assistant Administrator for National Continuity Programs. New systems could someday include pictures and video as part of the advanced alert and warning information provided to the general public.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>One such technology being considered is the Advanced Warning and Response Network (AWARN).  AWARN works by using advanced capabilities in the next generation of digital television broadcast system called ATSC 3.0 being standardized by the Advanced Television Systems Committee.  The emerging television broadcast standard provides for the transmission of large media rich, data messages over-the-air to mobile, portable, and fixed television and video devices without interrupting ongoing television shows. &nbsp; </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FEMAs IPAWS is a national system for local alerting. IPAWS enables authorities at all levels of government to alert and warn people in areas endangered by disasters. IPAWS is used by federal, state, and local authorities to send emergency alerts to cellular phones as Wireless Emergency Alerts (WEAs), to radio and television as Emergency Alert System (EAS) broadcasts, to NOAA Weather Radios, and to an All-Hazards Alert and Information Feed for Internet applications, services, and websites.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>For more information on IPAWS, go to <a href="http://fema.pr-optout.com/Tracking.aspx?Data=HHL%3d%3e493.CP%3f%401A39377.LP%3f%40083%3a&amp;RE=IN&amp;RI=711798&amp;Preview=False&amp;DistributionActionID=6426&amp;Action=Follow+Link">www.fema.gov/ipaws</a>. </p><p>###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FEMA's mission is to support our citizens and first responders to ensure that as a nation we work together to build, sustain and improve our capability to prepare for, protect against, respond to, recover from and mitigate all hazards.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Follow FEMA online at <a href="http://www.fema.gov/blog" title="Link: http://www.fema.gov/blog">www.fema.gov/blog</a>, <a href="http://www.twitter.com/fema" title="Link: http://www.twitter.com/fema">www.twitter.com/fema</a>, <a href="http://www.facebook.com/fema">www.facebook.com/fema</a> and <a href="http://www.youtube.com/fema">www.youtube.com/fema</a>.  Also, follow Administrator Craig Fugate's activities at <a href="http://www.twitter.com/craigatfema" title="Link: http://www.twitter.com/craigatfema">www.twitter.com/craigatfema</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>                                                                                                                                </p><p>The social media links provided are for reference only. FEMA does not endorse any non-government websites, companies or applications.</p>
<h2>Online Shopping Just Became A Lot More Addictive<br></h2><p>Todays online shoppers are not satisfied with just discount catalog shopping, they want more! While most shopping apps and online stores like Amazon, eBay or Etsy try to sell you products at a discount or sell it at an auction, this new shopping marketplace changes online shopping by taking a different approach altogether.&nbsp;</p> <p>In traditional auctions, prices start at a low reserve and buyers bid their way higher. At <a href="http://bitly.com/ibuysell90sec" target="_blank">iBuySell</a> - a social mobile marketplace, <b>prices keep falling from a preset price till the first person snaps up the product adding an element of suspense and fun</b>. The limited time frame adds to the rush and excitement. <b>There are no biddings, so the first person to hit the buy-it-now button gets to purchase the product </b>at the price it was set at. The product is then considered sold and no longer available for purchase.</p> <blockquote>Most online platforms are nothing but discount catalogs, products move slowly, it's hard to get discovered, upfront promotion costs are too high and the fees are astronomical. There are not many options available for small retail owners and individual entrepreneurs to make their life easy says Macungie, Pennsylvania based co-founder Kaus Mukherjee. So we thought why not combine shopping for incredible deals with a little fun and suspense, to make it an engaging experience? The buyer is always intrigued if they will be the first to get the item or will someone else will take it? Here there are no hassles of bidding and the entire live action lasts for less than 90 secs.</blockquote> <p>Kaus migrated from India to United States in the late 90s. He stumbled upon this idea of iBuySell as he and his wife Suchi went about exploring several options to setup an online retail business. While he has been a technologist all his life and currently employed as a manager at Citigroup, she is a realtor. The common interest of both: Shopping and Technology!</p> <p>At <a href="http://bitly.com/ibuysell90sec" target="_blank">iBuySell</a> you are not limited to sell just designer brands such as Coach, Louisvuitton, Chanel handbag, shoes and accessories but you can also sell jewelry, homewares, tech gadgets, sports items and much more. <b>Buyers can expect to purchase the items anywhere from 50-80% of their original price</b> depending on demand and nature of the item.</p><p>iBuySell is shaping up to be a great place to buy and sell items, attracting brands, retailers, boutique shop owners and individual entrepreneurs who are looking to drive sales and improve profit margins. </p> <blockquote>At <a href="http://bitly.com/ibuysell90sec" target="_blank">iBuySell</a>&nbsp;we believe everybody has something to sell or buy. Our mission is to provide a platform which benefits a seller as much as a buyer. A seller is the backbone of our marketplace and supporting them would also translate to benefits being passed on to the buyers says founder and CEO Kaus. Our sellers have a choice of paying a low monthly fee starting at $49 or pay per transaction (10-15%) which is much less compared to competitors fees of more than 20%. There are no fees for listing an item and we encourage sellers to include their e-commerce website details in their profile to drive traffic to their existing business</blockquote> <p>The team has made a lot of progress in completing the design of the app, applying for patent and trademarks and hiring specialists for developing the app, they need help to raise funding to complete development and the app is schedule to be released in beta by November of 2015. To realize this objective the team has launched a <a href="http://bitly.com/ibuysell90sec" target="_blank">crowdfunding campaign at Fundable</a>. </p><blockquote>We are excited about launching our campaign as means for not only raising funds to help create the app but also to spread the word and increase adoption says Suchi.</blockquote> <p><b>Success of iBuySell will result in not only a unique, exciting and rewarding experience for shoppers it will also allow thousands of brands, retailers and entrepreneurs a platform to grow their existing business faster, drive sales by engaging their customers and keep more in profit without paying too much in upfront costs.</b></p> <p>Teaser video of how iBuySell works - <a href="https://youtu.be/e8M0gt0en5w">https://youtu.be/e8M0gt0en5w</a></p> <p>To learn more about iBuySell or support their crowdfunding campaign click <a href="http://bitly.com/ibuysell90sec" target="_blank">here</a>.</p>
Working with text is often a messy business for programmers. While code has to be unambiguous, words tend to be anything but. Over the years, a number of companies like Alchemy and Thomson Reuters have launched services based on natural language processing (NLP) and machine-learning algorithms to help developers more easily extract meaning from documents. Now, Aylien is joining the fray with its own text-analysis API, the first in a series of developers services the company is working on.<br><br>The service was founded by Dublin, Ireland-based Parsa Ghaffari, with the backing of Chinaccelerator. Ghaffari told me that he first applied to the accelerator program with the idea for a product that used NLP to automatically pull up relevant data while you were writing about it. It turned out, though, that the underlying technology for this didnt exist. He then set out to build the technology, and the result of this  after almost three years of work  is Aylien.<br><br>The API allows developers to quickly extract basic data like headlines and the body of text from a document, but it also offers a summarization service, entity and concept extraction, and language and sentiment detection. Ive used the API for a couple of personal projects and with the exception of a few issues, it worked as advertised. It doesnt like texts in languages other than English, though, and was almost 100 percent confident that this German post about Googles latest Street View project expansion was actually&nbsp;about curling. The company is working on support for other languages.<br><br>If you want to give the service a try, just head over here and plug a URL into Ayliens API demo.<br><br>All of the data comes back as JSON and the company uses Mashape&nbsp;to sell access to its data.&nbsp;Developers who need to make fewer than 1,000 API calls per day get free access to the service, and those who need more can sign up for paid plans, starting at $199 for 6,000 calls per day. Thats a bit more affordable than what most of Ayliens competitors currently charge, though not by a wide margin.<br><br>Currently, the Aylien team consists of three engineers and none of them hold PhDs. Thats pretty unusual for an NLP startup. While Ghaffari has ties to the academic NLP world, he credits the fact that there are no academics on his team for the pragmatic approach the company takes.<br><br>The next project the company is tackling is a news API&nbsp;for filtering news stories and a number of consumer products that will sit on top of the technologies the team built for its developer services.
<p>USA, FLORIDA, LAND OLAKES - October 21st, 2015 - Artix Entertainment just launched the Undead Assault app for Apple and Android mobile devices. Just in time for Halloween. The app is an inspired remake of the hit Flash game of the same name from 2005 which was played millions of times on Newgrounds, Addicting Games, and EbilGames. The new Undead Assault features the song Battle on! by the band One-Eyed Doll and is available for free now at <a href="http://www.undeadassault.com" title="Link: http://www.undeadassault.com">www.UndeadAssault.com</a>.</p><p>Is my bosss dog really the entire financial model of this new game? realizes Joe Kraken Noble, lead coder of Undead Assault.</p><p>The in-app purchase in Undead Assault is the creators real-life dog, Daimyo, the undead slaying pomeranian. For $5 you can unlock Daimyo, who will follow you in game, grants a 3X gold boost, and also unlocks an armor set in our web MMO AdventureQuest Worlds. As far as undead-slaying puppy dogs go, Daimyo has quite a following  nearly 20,000 followers on his Facebook account. <a href="https://www.facebook.com/DaimyoAE">https://www.facebook.com/DaimyoAE</a>&nbsp;</p><p>When I asked Daimyo what he thought about this, he said, Arf! says Adam Bohn, Founder/CEO of Artix Entertainment. So you know.</p><p>Undead Assault is an infinite runner video game. Play as Artix the Paladin, a magical knight who uses his oversized battle axe, swords, and a chainsaw arm to slice through the invading skeletal forces. A continuous stream of animated monsters rushes towards the player, requiring good reaction time in order to either swipe the enemies with weapons or jump over them, avoid obstacles, and collect runes to unlock special areas, all while collecting gold and experience. Upgrade your character with 5 armor and weapon sets, each unlocking a special power. Go for high score and beat your friends to the top of the leaderboard. &nbsp;</p><p>WHAT: Undead Assault available for Apple and Android app stores<br></p><p>WHEN: Available now</p><p>WHO: Artix Entertainment</p><p>WHERE: <a href="http://www.undeadassault.com">www.UndeadAssault.com</a> </p><p><b><br></b></p><p># # #</p><p>About Artix Entertainment</p><p>Artix Entertainment is a fun and quirky independent video game studio which has been developing and publishing RPG &amp; MMORPG games to its audience of 250+ Million registered players since 2002. Visit<a href="http://www.artix.com"> www.Artix.com</a> for more information.</p><p><b><br></b></p><p>AdventureQuest Worlds (Flash MMORPG) - <a href="http://www.aq.com/">&nbsp;</a><a href="http://www.aq.com">www.AQ.com</a></p><p>AdventureQuest 3D (3D Mobile MMORPG) - &nbsp;<a href="http://www.aq3d.com">www.AQ3D.com</a> </p><p>AdventureQuest (Flash RPG) - &nbsp;<a href="http://www.battleon.com/">www.BattleOn.com</a></p><p>Battle Gems (Puzzle RPG) - <a href="http://battlegems.artix.com">http://BattleGems.Artix.com</a> </p><p>Dragons (Idle Game) - <a href="http://www.aqdragons.com">www.AQDragons.com</a> </p><p>DragonFable (Flash RPG) &nbsp;- <a href="http://www.dragonfable.com/">www.Dragonfable.com</a></p><p>EpicDuel (Flash PvP MMO) - <a href="http://www.epicduel.com/">www.EpicDuel.com</a></p><p>MechQuest (Sci-Fi Flash RPG) - <a href="http://www.mechquest.com/">www.MechQuest.com</a></p><p>HeroMart (Online shop) at <a href="http://www.heromart.com">www.HeroMart.com</a></p><p><b><br></b></p><p>You can follow, friend, or stalk Artix on</p><p>Twitter: <a href="http://twitter.com/artixkrieger/">https://twitter.com/artixkrieger</a></p><p>Facebook: <a href="http://www.facebook.com/artixkrieger">https://www.facebook.com/artixkrieger</a></p><p><b><br></b></p><p>Media Contacts</p><p>Daniel Vasile, Artix Entertainment, at Dan@BattleOn.com<br></p>
After 90 days of mentoring and molding, 10 startups graduated today from Shanghai-based Chinaccelerator. Theyre the seventh batch to emerge from the program since it started in 2009.<br><br>At a crowded demo day in an auditorium at the newly-established ShanghaiTech University, William Bao Bean (pictured below), the Chinaccelerator managing director and SOS Ventures partner, hailed the fact that the current batch is made up of 50 percent female CEOs and 43 percent female founders.<br><br>Here are all 10 multi-national teams that presented to a mix of investors, fellow entrepreneurs, and curious students.<br><br>School Match is an app for prospective students to get one-on-one mentoring sessions. CEO Christina Lau said she could have used such a service when she made the leap from Mexico to UC Berkeley, where she initially struggled to acclimatize. That kind of unease can lead to students dropping out, she explained.<br><br>School Match finds mentors at top schools around the world so that kids and their parents can grill them with questions on anything from the course workload to the best area to live off-campus. It already has 200 mentors on board.<br><br>Its aimed at Chinese students heading overseas. About five million students prep each year to go into higher education in other countries, and about 460,000 get in.<br><br>The startup takes a 15 percent cut of the paid mentoring sessions. Judging by the app screenshots, a session typically costs RMB 200 (US$32) per hour, which is about on a par with what it costs to get English private tutoring in China.<br><br>iCE Angel founder Richard Law started the pitch with a photo of his mother. He explained that she died suddenly out on the street and he wasnt by her side at the end because the emergency services didnt contact him. Thats the kind of situation the service wants to help avoid.<br><br>This is being offered directly to people via an emergency response app, which a first responder can supposedly access (though that raises issues if a phone is locked  and if a paramedic or doctor has no clue what to look for in someones phone). The startups other approach is to form partnerships with travel companies or any business that involves going far from home. That company will then give its customers iCE Angel ID bracelets or cards that will serve as the emergency contact in the event of an accident.<br><br>Another revenue stream comes from services like insurance or senior care packages.<br><br>The core service through the app is free, while iCE Angel charges for the other elements on offer.<br><br>Meet Boutique focuses on boutique hotels in China. Han Dong says that boutique hotels tend to get buried in Chinas popular travel-booking sites, such as Qunar and Ctrip, but the startups app gives them a place to shine and stand out as characterful alternatives to the usual luxury chain hotels.<br><br>Han claimed that his app can get lower prices for boutique hotels for its customers because those businesses appreciate not only the limelight but also the tasteful clientele it brings them.<br><br>GeiLi Giving wants to shake up the way Chinese people give to charities, making charitable campaigns more transparent and Kickstarter-esque while encouraging folks to donate with gamification and a boost of social media virality.<br><br>The current problem is that Chinas rate of charitable giving is one of the lowest in the world, explains co-founder and CEO Elyse Ribbons during her pitch. The startup wants to unlock the giving potential of China, she enthused.<br><br>GeiLi Giving operates as a public account in WeChat, giving it easy access to your digital cash through WeChats wallet.<br><br>The startup runs crowdfunding-style donation drives for pre-vetted charities and NGOs, giving people a clear idea of how much needs to be raised for a specific project. Micro-donations are fine, as low as RMB 10 (US$1.60) to make it as accessible as possible.<br><br>The viral element comes in, Ribbons explains, when people get points for donating and sharing a campaign with their WeChat buddies. That also helps people feel ownership over a campaign, she adds.<br><br>The startup makes money kind of like Kickstarter  by taking a cut of the total raised.<br><br>Ribbons, who hails from the US and speaks fluent Chinese, is using her celebrity contacts from her regular appearances on Beijing TV to get a variety of stars to promote some of the charitable campaigns via WeChat.<br><br>Robin8 is a data-driven platform for brands to connect with bloggers and influencers. Its aimed at the China market, where CEO Miranda Tan says the world of content marketing is hampered by a lack of trust and no clear way of rating a key opinion leader (KOL).<br><br>So the idea behind Robin8 is that it attaches data to a KOL to help brand managers get marketing material out there through the most effective bloggers and reporters. Tans pitch dubbed this a marketplace of KOLs in the manner of Airbnb.<br><br>This sounds ethically problematic if reporters are republishing content marketing-style articles straight from brands, but its not clear if thats what the end result might be. This could equally be a more effective way of pitching press releases to the most relevant bloggers and journalists.<br><br>Tan said the Robin8 platform scans tens of thousands of news articles each day in order to determine who are the influencers in particular areas.<br><br>Specifiko CEO Mark McIntyre reckons that multinational corporations lose a lot of money due to inadequate English proficiency.<br><br>The startup wants to help fix that in one very specific industry  healthcare and pharmaceuticals. Its focusing on Japan and China to give physicians and clinical scientists English courses that cover their industry and day-to-day work in detail. It uses a mix of text and videos. So far there are 2,000 videos and about 82,000 articles in English with human translations in Chinese and Japanese to help people understand the topic at hand.<br><br>The service, which companies pay for, gives management some data on a workers progress with English to help them make decisions related to promotions and pay rises.<br><br>Its set to partner up with major pharma companies like Novartis and Pfizer.<br><br>SXT Learning CEO Ryan J King was a corporate trainer for seven years. Trouble is, the whole corporate training system is broken, he said at the top of his pitch. Those training sessions give too much information in one go  and people tend to fall asleep. Zoned-out office workers have slept in his own training sessions, he admits  and hes even fallen asleep when attending such things himself. He backed that up with photographic evidence.<br><br>A Deloitte study reckons that 90 percent of whats taught at training sessions is forgotten within five minutes, wasting most of the estimated US$160 billion that companies put into those sessions each year.<br><br>SXTs solution, King explained, is to put corporate training into a good-looking app so that people can take in all that info in more manageable chunks. For workers, the training app has quizzes to keep people motivated, and for the bosses it has analytics so peoples progress can be charted.<br><br>Hopefully the app-based model wont mean that workers are expected to do training in their own time, but Kings pitch didnt touch on that issue.<br><br>30 companies are already using SXT, he said.<br><br>Theres no award for startups with fun names, but there ought to be one to reward The Squirrelz. Its a sort of Etsy for upcycled products  but with a huge, Alibaba-sized twist.<br><br>The Squirrelz operates on two levels. To ordinary shoppers, its a marketplace for funky products made out of cast-off items (pictured below); to makers, its a place to source those materials in bulk. The good news for the startup is that it makes commission on both those stages.<br><br>Bunny Yan, the CEO and co-founder, gave the example of a huge batch of medical scrubs that were rejected because they came out in the wrong color. On The Squirrelz, someone turned those into courier bags.<br><br>Major manufacturers benefit by being able to sell off stuff that would otherwise be trashed.<br><br>The startup can help transform a 1kg bundle of cast-off material that cost only US$10 into US$1,000 worth of products that people want to buy, Yan claimed.<br><br>So far, The Squirrelz has just over 40 designers whove created more than 600 products. Its going to start by focusing on China.<br><br>Lots of startups are trying to improve international money transfers so as to stop people getting fleeced by banks or by the god-awful Western Union. BitNexo is one of these, but its doing so for a very specific area  for business deals between China and Latin America.<br><br>Founder Darren Camas  who splits his time between China and Chile  explained in the pitch that the transfers are done via bitcoin, but users never need to touch bitcoin during the process. This means its not technically a bitcoin transfer, which is an important detail for the China market where banks are prohibited from allowing customers to deal in bitcoin.<br><br>The commission it takes is more transparent than the banks and is set at two percent.<br><br>Xiao Dian Bao wants to take the kind of personal communication common between ecommerce merchants and their customers and make it relevant to offline stores.<br><br>The pitch was a bit of a head-scratcher because it sounds like its only the owners of tiny shops whod communicate with customers in person over social media, but then the presentation mentioned partnering with huge chain stores.<br><br>The startup used the English name Shopal in the pitch, but that already belongs to a Japanese startup. Weve used the Chinese name to avoid confusion.<br><br>On the whole, it looks like Chinaccelerator has come out with a nicely diverse and strong batch of super-focused startups who are, thankfully, not doing the same old things that we get tired of seeing at pitch contests (customer loyalty app, anyone?).
<p>You don't have to pass a breathalyzer to shop online!</p><p><a href="http://drunkmall.com" target="_blank">drunkMall</a> presents the weirdest (but kinda cool?) items available to purchase from the Internet in one (amazing) website for your browsing pleasure.<br></p><p>From Nic Cage pillowcases to sriracha iPhone cases, Gary Busey posters to Game of Thrones coasters, 2 lbs of pink Starburst to satanic kitty shirts - <a href="http://drunkmall.com/" target="_blank">drunkMall</a> is probably the most dangerous website to be on when you come home from the bar...</p><p>With infinite scrolling and a unique system of browsing categories by hashtags, <a href="http://drunkmall.com/" target="_blank">drunkMall</a> immediately sucks you in and you have to see what's next. Before you know it, an hour has passed and your wife is pissed.<br></p><p>Only a month old, <a href="http://drunkmall.com/" target="_blank">drunkMall</a> has already received these huge shoutouts from <a href="https://twitter.com/realjknoxville/status/656830610133008384" target="_blank">Johnny Knoxville</a>, <a href="http://drunkmall.com/I%20might%20have%20to%20buy%20a%20Nicolas%20Cage%20throw%20pillow%20or%20purchase%20some%20%24.99%20%22fuck%20you%22%20phone%20calls.%20http://www.drunkmall.com" target="_blank">Ralphie May</a>, <a href="http://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2015/10/forget-skymall-now-there-is-drunkmall.html" target="_blank">Paste Magazine</a>, <a href="http://thechive.com/2015/10/21/drunk-and-in-the-mood-to-shop-try-drunkmall-21-photos/" target="_blank">The Chive</a> and <a href="http://www.elvisduran.com/articles/whats-trending-461825/whatstrending-drunk-shopping-14056388/" target="_blank">Carla Marie</a> of Elvis Duran &amp; The Morning Show!</p>

<p>USA, FLORIDA, LAND OLAKES - October 27th, 2015 - Video gamers across the web are in for a treat (and possibly a few fun tricks) this Halloween weekend. <a title="Link: http://www.cruxshadows.com/" href="http://www.cruxshadows.com/">The CrüxShadows</a> are starring as special musical guests in a brand new Halloween Adventure inside Artixs massively multiplayer browser based game, AdventureQuest Worlds at <a href="http://www.aq.com">www.AQ.com</a> . The event begins in-game, Friday, October 30th, around 8pm EST.</p><p>The team and I were speechless when the <a href="http://www.cruxshadows.com/">CrüxShadows</a> graciously agreed to appear in game for the Halloween event!, exclaimed Adam Bohn (aka Artix), creator of AdventureQuest Worlds. As fans, the team and I have been going to their concerts for years. &nbsp;We are so grateful for the opportunity to re-create and share the energy of that experience to our players all over the world.</p><p>The band members of <a href="http://www.cruxshadows.com/">The CrüxShadows</a> are being cartoonized and will appear not only as performers, but as a key story element in the game. The halloween themed adventure will have 5 acts, featuring airships, shadow monsters, a forbidden Pyramid, and an unspeakable ancient evil creature. Both the game and special adventure are free for everyone to play and enjoy.</p><p>For event details, visit <a href="http://www.aq.com/events/thecruxshadows/">http://www.aq.com/events/thecruxshadows/</a> </p><p> </p><p>The people over at Artix have been great to work with and we are excited about this and the potential to reach new fans in the future. said Rogue, lead singer of The Cruxshadows. Remember to bring your love for all things CXS, and your sense of humor, and prepare for a Halloween treat.</p><p></p><p>WHAT: <a href="http://www.cruxshadows.com/">The CrüxShadows</a> appearing in the game AdventureQuest Worlds</p><p>WHEN: Starts Friday, October 30th, around 8pm EST</p><p>WHO: Free for everyone to enjoy.</p><p>WHERE:<a href="http://www.undeadassault.com"> </a><a href="http://www.aq.com/events/thecruxshadows/">http://www.aq.com/events/thecruxshadows/</a><a href="http://www.undeadassault.com"> </a></p><p><br></p><p>ABOUT THE CRUXSHADOWS</p><p><a href="http://www.cruxshadows.com/">The CrüxShadows</a> have played shows across the world, and produced over 18 CDs, a DVD, and appeared on countless compilations. A favorite of the Sci-fi, fantasy, &amp; counter-culture crowd, The CrüxShadows have scored four Billboard top 10 singles in the US (Sophia #1, Birthday #1, Immortal #2, &amp; Quicksilver #1). Their most recent album, "As the Dark Against My Halo" reached the #1 position on the German Alternative Charts (DAC).</p><p>visit <a href="http://www.cruxshadows.com/">http://www.cruxshadows.com/</a> &nbsp;for more information.</p><p><br></p><p>ABOUT ADVENTUREQUEST WORLDS </p><p>AdventureQuest Worlds is a fantasy, massively multiplayer video game that plays on popular web browsers. Run by a small but very passionate and creative team, the game has been updated with new adventures, monsters, areas and items every single week for the past 7 years. The game is being ported to Android and Apple devices in 2016. </p><p>Visit <a href="http://www.aq.com">www.AQ.com</a> &nbsp;for more information.</p><p><br></p><p># # #</p><p><br></p><p>ABOUT ARTIX ENTERTAINMENT </p><p>Artix Entertainment is an innovative and fun independent video game studio which has been developing and publishing RPG &amp; MMORPG games to its audience of 200+ Million registered players since 2002. Popular titles include AdventureQuest, DragonFable, Epicduel, BattleGems and the newly released Undead Assault. </p><p>Visit <a href="http://www.artix.com">www.Artix.com</a> for more information.</p><p><br></p><p>Media Contacts</p><p>Daniel Vasile, Artix Entertainment, at Dan@BattleOn.com</p>
<h4>Are You in a Marriage or an Irrelationship?</h4><h5>October 29, 2015</h5><h5><br></h5><table><tbody><tr><td><br></td><td><br></td><td class="wysiwyg-tmp-selected-cell">Episode Description<br></td></tr></tbody></table><p>In this show, guests Dr. Mark Borg, Dr. Grant Brenner and Daniel Berry invite you to consider whether you are in a marriage or an arrangement to keep you emotionally safe. Drawing upon years of clinical experience, they define an Irrelationship and show us how we hide from intimacy by using routines we carry from childhood. They offer strategies for understanding and changing your marriage into a true relationship.</p><p>Read more about Dr. Phillips show and this important and informative episode here: &nbsp;<a href="http://www.voiceamerica.com/episode/88457/are-you-in-a-marriage-or-an-irrelationship" title="Link: http://www.voiceamerica.com/episode/88457/are-you-in-a-marriage-or-an-irrelationship">http://www.voiceamerica.com/episode/88457/are-you-in-a-marriage-or-an-irrelationship</a></p><p><br></p><h4>Guest Information</h4><p></p><table><tbody><tr><td>Mark B Borg Jr, PhD&nbsp;<br>[<a href="http://www.voiceamerica.com/guest/27359/mark-b-borg-jr-phd" target="_blank">View Guest Page &gt;</a>]</td><td>Grant H Brenner, MD&nbsp;<br>[<a href="http://www.voiceamerica.com/guest/27360/grant-h-brenner-md" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.voiceamerica.com/guest/27360/grant-h-brenner-md">View Guest Page &gt;</a>]</td><td>Daniel Berry, RN, MHA<br>[<a href="http://www.voiceamerica.com/guest/27361/daniel-berry-rn-mha" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.voiceamerica.com/guest/27361/daniel-berry-rn-mha">View Guest Page &gt;</a>]<br><br></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Sports Video Innovations Built-In Camera Delivers Worlds First, Live-Streaming Footage of Player POV</b></p><p>SHREVEPORT, La. October 28, 2015  <a href="http://www.sportsvideoinnovations.com/" target="_blank">Sports Video Innovations (SVI)</a> announced today that the worlds first live streaming of footage from its built-in video helmet camera debuted during pre-game coverage of the San Francisco  Seattle game, when warm-up action was seen through the eyes of tight end Vernon Davis. The game took place Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, at Levis® Stadium in Santa Clara, California.</p><p>SVIs patented, built-in video camera technology is both rugged and streamlined enough to be safely integrated within the nose bumper of SchuttVision helmets. The resulting player point-of-view is one of a kind. The technology puts fans in the middle of the action and gives coaches and players a never-before-available view of plays for practice, trainingand now, with the live streaming capabilitythe chance to closely examine strategies and tactics as they happen and from the center of the play.</p><p>The SVI camera built into the SchuttVision helmet is safe and National Operating Committee on Standards for Athletic Equipment compliant. It can be used by players at any position, including during games. Nearly 30 NCAA and NFL teams have used the helmets. The camera delivers 720p HD video at 30 frames per second, with 2.5 hours of battery life and a removable SD card for media storage.</p><p>Were excited to usher in the next stage of our development in conjunction with last weeks match-up, said Jeremey Jeansonne, SVIs co-founder and CEO. Everyone involved with football has been impressed with our technology. The ability to stream live straight from a players helmet represents another huge leap forward.</p><p>The live streaming footage of Davis warming up was aired on CBS and can be seen here: <a href="https://youtu.be/9ELpvLdBTJs" target="_blank">https://youtu.be/9ELpvLdBTJs</a>.</p><p># # #</p><p><b>About Sports Video Innovations</b></p><p>Sports Video Innovations (SVI) launched in January 2014 to revolutionize the way sporting events are viewed and experienced, starting with football and the SchuttVision helmet. For the first time, a rugged, high-definition video camera fits into the nose bumper of a football helmet to provide the one of a kind players point-of-view that coaches, fans and broadcasters have been seeking. SchuttVision is approved by the National Operating Committee on Standards for Athletic Equipment (NOCSAE).</p><p>First football, and then the sporting world! SVI plans on expanding its patented technology into other areas of sports to bring the companys innovative point-of-view camera to baseball, lacrosse and hockey. Visit SVI at <a href="http://www.sportsvideoinnovations.com/" target="_blank">http://www.sportsvideoinnovations.com</a> or on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/SportsVideoInnovations" target="_blank">Facebook</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/SchuttVision" target="_blank">Twitter</a> or <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMw8Hp2wBbFe9vFm1Zg6jJA" target="_blank">YouTube</a>.</p><p><b>MEDIA CONTACT</b></p><p>Martin Stein</p><p>TrizCom Public Relations</p><p><a href="mailto:martin@pitchpr.co" target="_blank">martin@pitchpr.co</a></p><p>1-972-215-6457</p><p>Karen Carrera</p><p>TrizCom Public Relations</p><p><a href="mailto:karen@trizcom.com" target="_blank">karen@trizcom.com</a></p><p>                                                      </p><p>1-972-207-1935</p>
<p><b>Three-Month Campaign in Three Cities Generates a Nearly 14% Click-Through Rate and Exponential ROI</b></p><p>Using the <a href="http://www.socialcentiv.com/" title="Link: http://www.socialcentiv.com/">SocialCentiv</a> Twitter marketing application, Room Escape Adventures is taking a direct and personal approach to getting more people in Los Angeles, Dallas and Columbus, Ohio, to take up the challenge of being Trapped in a Room with a Zombiea pulse-pounding adventure designed to get participants minds racing and adrenaline flowing as they try to escape the room or get eaten.<br></p><p>Room Escape Adventures set up the SocialCentiv app to look for people Tweeting about things like bachelor party, date night, birthday party, team, Halloween, zombie and Walking Dead. Relevant Tweets received a real-time, direct @reply with a deal for half-off tickets. For example, when SirMusicalD Tweeted Sometimes when Im bored, I find my way into shows and just appreciate how friggin amazing humans are, Room Escape Adventures tweeted: @SirMusicalD Next time, try us! Escape for an hour w/a zombie, Dustin! Escape for $14, with a link to the half-priced deal.<br></p><p>And because no one faces the zombie room alone, one Tweet can equal up to 12 tickets  which equates to exponential ROI for Room Escape Adventures. Over the course of three months, from July  September 2015, the campaign generated 21,401 impressions1, 928 engagements2 and a nearly 14 percent click-through rate on average in all three cities.</p><p>Almost all of our marketing efforts are focused on social, and we know our 18- to 32-year-old target audience is on Twitter. We found SocialCentiv to be the best way to engage with them at the moment they might be interested in the entertaining experience we offer, says Nicole DaCosta, director of marketing at Bucket List Productions, the company that runs <a href="http://roomescapeadventures.com/">Room Escape Adventures</a> series.<br></p><p>The Tweets that express an immediate need are a growing, yet untapped market according to recent research from Forrester Consulting, <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/think/docs/forrester-moments-that-matter-research-study.pdf"><i>Moments That Matter: Intent-Rich Moments are Critical to Winning Todays Consumer Journey</i></a>. Forresters research defines moments as instances when [customers] reflexively turn to their devices to act on a need to learn, discover, find, or buy something. The study goes on to illustrate that 98 percent of companies arent moments ready, and those that fail to respond to this expectation will rapidly fall behind firms that do respond. However, companies that take steps toward becoming moments ready reap benefits in the form of more profitable ROI in both their mobile investment and overall marketing investment.<br></p><p>In the next phase of the campaign, Room Escape Adventures is expanding its use of SocialCentiv in other cities where it produces Trapped in a Room with a Zombie, including New York City, and will also take full advantage of the October premiere of Season 5 of <i>The Walking Dead</i> as well as Halloween.<br></p><p>Were hoping to capitalize on the spirit of the season and give people a frightful and fun zombie experience, says DaCosta. SocialCentiv is a great asset to help us accomplish our goals as their staff is always checking in with us, tweaking responses, suggesting ways to Tweet, and making sure our campaign is working to help build ticket sales.<br></p><p><b>About SocialCentiv</b><br></p><p>SocialCentiv is a full-service Twitter marketing company that helps companies find new customers on Twitter with their patented software. Using a business keywords and geographic location, SocialCentiv combs Twitter in real time looking for relevant Tweets that express an intent to purchase a product or service. The business can @ reply directly back to potential customers with a customized, personal message and a discount or offer to get them in the door. For example, @JaneDoe Tweets about being really hungry for pizza. A local pizza parlor finds her Tweet using SocialCentiv, and Tweets directly back with a personal message and a coupon for free salad and soda with her pizza at lunch. SocialCentiv has a 34 percent average click through rate, and some industries  like restaurants, hotels and sports marketing  having much higher averages.</p><p>Since May 2013, SocialCentiv has received $12 million in funding. For more information, go to <a href="http://www.socialcentiv.com/">www.SocialCentiv.com</a>, like us on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/socialcentiv">Facebook</a> and follow us on<a href="https://twitter.com/SocialCentiv"> Twitter</a>.<br></p><p>&nbsp;# # #</p><p>1. Impressions = number of times a user is served a Tweet in timeline or search results; 2. Engagements = number of times a user interacted with a Tweet</p><p>For more information, contact Karen Carrera, TrizCom, 972-207-1935, <a href="mailto:karen@trizcom.com">karen@trizcom.com</a> or @kjcarrera.</p>
<p><a>Solis Mammography</a>, is getting an influx of calls from women asking if their mammograms are covered by insurance in light of the American Cancer Societys (ACS) new recommendations announced last week. Solis wants to reassure all women that insurance coverage has not immediately changed, and that its radiologists <a href="http://newsroom.solismammo.com/2015/10/20/215/" title="Link: http://newsroom.solismammo.com/2015/10/20/215/">strongly</a> recommend that women still begin getting an annual mammogram at 40 (unless high risk factors exist which might cause her to start earlier than 40.)</p><p>Solis Mammography, the nations largest independent provider of mammography services, has centers in the Dallas/Fort Worth, Houston, Phoenix, Columbus, Ohio, and Greensboro, N.C., markets.<br></p><p>We want the public to know that currently, a standard 2D screening mammogram is covered at 100 percent by almost all healthcare plans, says Connie Oliver, Solis VP of marketing and client relations. Last week, the ACS recommended that women between the ages of 40-44 not get mammograms. This has confused many patients who worry these recommendations give insurance companies the right to deny payment for mammograms to women under 45.<br></p><p>What the community needs to know about the out-of-pocket costs for mammograms, as it stands today:</p><p></p><ul><li>A standard 2D screening mammogram is covered at 100 percent by almost all insurance plans.<br></li><li>3D screening mammograms, also known as tomosynthesis, are 100 percent covered by Medicare and by select major insurance providers including Blue Cross Blue Shield of Texas. Coverage by other providers vary by plan and policy. If a 3D mammogram is not covered, out-of-pocket costs at Solis Mammography range between $50 and $100.<br></li><li>As of today, the ACS announcement has not had any impact on mammography coverage by insurance providers. However, that risk does exist in the future if the public and the healthcare community do not speak out. Solis Mammography does everything it can to ensure the insurance landscape does not create an unfavorable financial hardship for women who proactively want to take ownership of their health.<br></li></ul><p></p><p>If there are other specific coverage questions, Solis recommends that women call their health insurance provider. Or, Solis representatives are always available for questions at 866.717.2551. Lastly, you can visit the Solis website which has many frequently answered questions at <a href="http://www.SolisMammo.com">www.SolisMammo.com</a>.<br></p><p><b>About Solis Mammography</b><br></p><p><a href="http://newsroom.solismammo.com/">Solis Mammography</a> is a specialized healthcare provider focused exclusively on providing women an exceptional mammography experience. Headquartered in Addison, Texas, Solis is the nations largest independent provider of mammography services and currently operates 31 centers across four states  Texas, Arizona, Ohio, and North Carolina. The company operates both wholly owned centers and multiple successful joint ventures with hospital partners. Solis provides a complete range of highly specialized breast health services including screening and diagnostic mammography (2D and 3D), computer-aided detection, breast ultrasound, stereotactic biopsy and ultrasound-guided biopsy. For more information, visit <a href="http://www.solismammo.com/">www.SolisMammo.com</a>, like them on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/SolisMammo">Facebook</a>, follow them on <a href="https://www.pinterest.com/solismammo/">Pinterest</a>, or subscribe to their <a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/solishealth">YouTube</a> channel.</p><p># # #<br></p><p>For more information, contact Karen Carrera, TrizCom, 972-207-1935, <a href="mailto:karen@trizcom.com">karen@trizcom.com</a> or @kjcarrera.<br></p>
<p><i>October 28, 2015 (New York, New York)<b>&nbsp;</b></i>&nbsp; Just days around World Food Day and International Chefs Day,&nbsp;<a href="http://thekitchenconnection.org/">KitchenConnection.org</a>&nbsp;launches the second version of its foodie social network where both lay and professional cooks can share pictures, blog posts, and recipes, as well as participate in the platforms signature connections where users can host live video sessions to cook or share tips about food with other users anywhere in the world. Currently, there are representatives from over 100 different countries on the platform, from Fiji to North Korea.&nbsp;</p><p>Users can choose to host these connections for free or paid, and if paid, can donate some or all of the money to Kitchen Connections partner charity, Action Against Hunger, supporting the sites mission:&nbsp;<i>Im eating  youre eating and because were eating together,</i><i>&nbsp;someone else is eating too</i></p><p>Just a year ago, Kitchen Connection launched its invite-only beta version after a pre-launch event in New York City where the Kitchen Connection team showcased a live cooking experience with a French Master Chef from the prestigious chefs association, Maîtres Cuisiniers de France and foodies in Paris.</p><p>The site, which urges members to create a profile where his cooking credentials, languages spoken and interests can all be showcased, is also a place to distinguish users who are members of the prestigious World Chefs organization, which has partnered with Kitchen Connection. Past supporters of the platform include Whole Foods Market Bowery, which sponsored their launch in the past.</p><p>Founder, Earlene Cruz, thought of the venture while studying abroad on a ship through the program Semester at Sea. Right before porting in Ghana, she lost her wallet with all of her money. Her plans to CouchSurf there led her to a home-stay with a family that graciously housed her and fed her for the week that she was in Ghana. Eating the delicious red-red stew with her hands on their living room floor led her to want to virtually recreate the experience, hence the premise for Kitchen Connection.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a></a>Here is the sites promotional video:&nbsp;<a href="https://youtu.be/m4TqVE14OMc">https://youtu.be/m4TqVE14OMc</a></p><div><br></div><p>ABOUT Kitchen Connection</p><p><a href="http://www.KitchenConnection.org">www.KitchenConnection.org</a></p><p>Where Food Links the World"</p><p>The mission of Kitchen Connection is to alleviate global hunger by creating a hub for recipe exchange, education, and global connection through food. The aim is to connect global foodies through a virtually interactive platform that allows them not only to meet, interact with, and learn from fellow members but also to work together to create meals, sit down together, and ultimately contribute to their global family through the revenue generatedwithout even leaving their homes. Food  its preparation, consumption, and distribution - is the most ubiquitous human experience, which is at the core of the alleviation of global hunger.</p><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p><i>Im eating  youre eating </i></p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p><i>and because were eating together,</i></p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p><i>someone else is eating too</i></p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###</p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><p><i></i></p><p><i></i></p><p></p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Recent advances in technology have allowed pro and amateur athletes the enhanced ability to monitor and improve their performances. For golfers, accurate analysis of each swing and information on the courses are invaluable. <b></b>ti.ttle is a new golf training aid device that calculates the carry distance and various attributes of a shot by sensing and analyzing the swing. Even without hitting a single ball, golfers can perfect their swing by looking at the results of each swing displayed on the ti.ttle swing analyzer.<b></b> On the course, ti.ttle also functions as an e-caddie by pinpointing the remaining distance to the hole. The creator of ti.ttle, ULike Creative, Inc. announces the launch of its Kickstarter crowdfunding campaign on the 3rd of November 2015, offering backers an exclusive opportunity to receive the device as a show of appreciation.&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="http://bitly.com/ti-ttle" target="_blank">Visit ti.ttle's Kickstarter page</a></p> <p>ti.ttle is a small and powerful smart device that helps the golfers to perfect their swing by practicing consistent form anywhere and at anytime. This feature is ideal for golfers who want to improve their technique but are unable to access a practice facility on a frequent or regular basis. ULike liken their device to a flight simulator for optimum training availability. ti.ttle is a light and convenient device that comes with a wearable clip and cradles for mounting on each of the clubs. The OLED screen display on the device is equipped with a touch sensor for operation.</p> <p>Using a swing analysis algorithm, ti.ttle calculates the carry distance according to calibration with each club and adapts to provide <b>incredibly personalized and accurate swing data</b>. After a complete swing the carry distance is immediately displayed in real-time. ti.ttle has the ability to identify up to nine different swing types and uses a MEM (microelectromechanical) sensor to break down the swing, allowing the user to immediately adjust shot tendencies as practice continues.</p> <p>When on a course, ti.ttle pairs with the users smart phone to offer additional features. A decline call option and missed call management feature allow the player to remain focused on their game without distraction. By syncing with the smart phones GPS, ti.ttle also has access to Golf Course information for over 36,000 courses worldwide. While playing on one, the current hole number and remaining distance to the hole are displayed on the device.</p> <p>ti.ttle is the result of ULikes CEO JS Youns passion for the golfing world that has spread among staff. ULike Creative, Inc is a technologies company specializing in smart wearable devices and mobile apps. The introduction of the device to a wider audience and raising funds for the initial production are the central objective of their campaign launch.</p> <p><b>See the</b><a href="http://bitly.com/ti-ttle" target="_blank"><b> ti.ttle campaign</b></a><b> first and don't miss out on the early bird deals. They won't last long.</b></p>
<h3><i>Feel good and perform better with green tea caffeine, more electrolytes than a Gatorade, and more vitamins than a Vitamin Water.</i></h3>  <p>NEW YORK, NY -- Athletes and active individuals alike have been relying on synthetically caffeinated energy shots for energy, sugared water for electrolytes, and over-loaded pills for vitamins. Products with multi-million dollar marketing campaigns and athlete endorsements have labeled themselves the only solutions for our performance needs. TRU, Inc. didnt buy it, and their team of athletes and entrepreneurs are bringing startup innovation to nutrition and fitness.</p>  <p>--------</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>Innovative nutrition startup, TRU, Inc., will be releasing its first product line, TRUEnergy, through Kickstarter on November 17th (<a href="http://eepurl.com/bDZu3v" target="_blank">sign up for the launch notification</a>). TRUEnergy is a green tea caffeinated sports shot infused with major electrolytes, essential vitamins, and antioxidants. The shot has a citrus flavor with real sweetener. This sports shot is the most functional beverage on the market, ounce for ounce. How? In just less than 2 ounces TRUEnergy has more electrolytes than a Gatorade, more vitamins than a Vitamin Water, and an optimal amount of caffeine for sustainable energy and focus. TRU is disrupting sports nutrition and creating a new class of beverage</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><i>TRUEnergy is, ounce for ounce, the most functional beverage on the market.</i></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>I experienced major problems as an athlete with sustaining energy over the course of a game, and I needed a solution. While playing pro hockey, guys were experimenting with things like energy shots and coffee. Eventually, theyd shy from the highly caffeinated options because the energy wasnt sustainable. Theyd get the jitters, and theyd crash. TRU, Inc. founder Jack McNamara. To perform at your best, you need that optimal focus point, so we created a better solution by utilizing green tea as the perfect natural stimulant. In addition, athletes need more electrolytes than typical individuals and have deficiencies in specific vitamins, so we added those as well. Antioxidants are an added bonus aiding your body in the recovery process.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><i>Dont regret what you drink, get what you need for now and later.</i></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>As a student-athlete you need to be focused in and out of the classroom. As a rower wed wake up at 5am for early morning practice, and there were a lot of mornings where guys werent fully awake and focused until theyd gotten into their workout. Its crucial to be at your best from the start, says Robert Avakian.</p>  <p>____________</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>Starting with focus and experiencing lasting energy is optimal for competition, workouts, or practice. Additionally, TRU understands the importance of also taking care of your body. In a soccer match youre running upwards of 7 miles. In addition to energy, I needed to have my body prepared. For that type of prolonged competition Ill play better, and with more confidence, knowing my muscles have the electrolytes and vitamins to fight fatigue and cramps, says Ryan Foss-Skiftesvik.</p>  <p>____________</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>At TRUs core is innovation and transparency. In addition to the innovative formula, TRUEnergy is re-inventing the bottle. A minimalists dream, the transparent rectangular design enables versatility for display, and maximizes efficiency for distribution. TRUEnergy is unique and modern, and deserves a memorable bottle rather than the opaque and stumpy standard. Importantly, this attention-commanding bottle will be polyethylene terephthalate - a recyclable plastic.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><i>The transparent rectangular bottle is a minimalists dream.</i></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>The team behind TRUEnergy is made of former college, international, and professional athletes who understand the consumers pain  because its their pain. Now, theyre creating the sustainable solution. TRU, Inc. is going to change the game of nutrition by creating innovative products. No longer will we sacrifice healthy ingredients for desired performance benefits. Simply, youll feel good and perform better.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b>About TRU, Inc.</b></p>  <p>TRU is a NYC based nutrition startup participating in FOOD-X, an SOSV backed international accelerator. TRUEnergy Sports Shot, TRUs first product, will launch through Kickstarter on November 17th at 9am EST. <a href="http://eepurl.com/bDZu3v" target="_blank">Sign up for the launch notification</a>.</p><blockquote><h3></h3></blockquote>
<div>Despite or because of all the conveniences of modern industrial societies, what we are eating is damaging the health of our populations and of our agricultural systems. Much of modern medicine is focused on treating diet-related diseases, which have become widespread and pervasive.</div><br>Environmental issues related to industrial agricultural systems are also of serious concern, not only to us but to future generations. We are twice as large and are living twice as long as compared to traditional agrarian societies, but we are not that much happier or healthier. Food needs revolution.<br><br>FOOD-X is taking on these radical challenges by bringing together markets and education, combining entrepreneurship, peer learning, mentor coaching, and financial leverage. Trial and error, essential to entrepreneurship, will be experienced through multiple cycles in a very condensed period of time, accelerating a year of progress into 14 weeks. Our network of eight SOSV accelerators, graduating nearly 100 companies a year, have shown that 3 out of 4 companies change their names, and more than half of companies change their product radically during the course of our programs. Consequently, success rates for these companies are much higher than average  companies achieve higher revenue, companies achieve funding, and companies achieve product/market fit going through accelerators.<br><br>Watch FOOD-X Founder Shen Tong talk about The Food Movement at TEDx:<div><div><iframe width="560px" height="315px" class="embed-responsive-item" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/TvNBXbla_10" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div><br></div>
WASHINGTON &nbsp;The Obama administration has authorized the deployment&nbsp;of&nbsp;U.S. military advisers into&nbsp;Syria&nbsp;in a significant expansion of the U.S. fight against the Islamic State, the White House said Friday.<br><br>President Obama approved&nbsp;a contingent of no more than 50 special operations forces to enter northern Syria where they will work with local rebels fighting the Islamic State.<br><br>The move&nbsp;reflects&nbsp;concerns that the fight&nbsp;against the militants in Iraq and Syria has stalled and needs to be reinvigorated.<br><br>The deployment is open-ended, White House spokesman Josh&nbsp;Earnest said, and future moves will be based on a constant assessment.&nbsp;"This is not a short-term proposition," he said.<br><br>Administration officials insist that the move does not alter the basic strategy, which is to support local forces in the fight against the Islamic State and avoid the use of conventional American&nbsp;ground troops.<br><br>Obama has been mindful of "mission creep," the steady escalation of U.S. involvement that would draw America deeper into a Middle East war.<br><br>"I will not put American boots on the ground in Syria  I will not pursue an open-ended action like Iraq or Afghanistan," Obama said in 2013.<br><br>Dispatching U.S. Special Operations advisers is not the same as conventional military forces, but it heightens the risk for American troops and places them closer to combat. A U.S. soldier, Master Sgt. Joshua Wheeler, died last week while supporting a Kurdish raid that successfully freed 70 prisoners from an Islamic State prison in Iraq.<br><br>"They will not be in a combat mission," Earnest said.<br><br>The new advisers in Syria will support opposition forces battling the Islamic State there. U.S. aircraft have supported Kurdish forces in northern Syria in battles against the Islamic State.<br><br>The Pentagon recently began supporting an Arab coalition in Syria, saying they were currently engaged in operations against the Islamic State. The force of about 5,000 rebels are in&nbsp;a position to put pressure on militants in Raqqa, the defacto Islamic State capital in Syria,&nbsp;which would represent a new front in the war.<br><br>Special Operations forces can help train and coordinate rebel forces and better coordinate airstrikes from the U.S.-led coalition.<br><br>The administration has also authorized the deployment of A-10s, an aircraft that is effective in providing close support to ground troops, to Turkey where they will be used in the war against the Islamic State, which is also known as ISIL or ISIS.<br><br>The administration says it&nbsp;will discuss with Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi the establishment of a special operations force that could target Islamic State leaders.<br><br>Michael Knights, an analyst with the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, said the administration has been feeling pressure from some of its allies in the region to speed up the pace of operations against the Islamic State.<br><br>"The White House's previous attitude is this is a three- or four-year conflict," Knights said. "Everybody else is saying, 'We're in a hurry.'"
