<h3>Just launched on Patreon on the 31st of October, Codename: Rave is the premier webcomic featuring a world built from old and new rave culture, and proudly offers stories spanning a diverse spectrum of ideals, perspectives and philosophies.</h3><p><br></p><blockquote><blockquote><p><b><a href="https://www.patreon.com/codenamerave?ty=h" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Support the Codename: Rave campaign today on Patreon - Get exclusive updates on new chapters and more</a></b></p></blockquote><blockquote><p><a href="http://www.releasewire.com/press-releases/codename-rave-before-you-lies-a-unique-world-of-struggle-and-strife-638031.htm" target="_blank"><b>View Press Release</b></a></p></blockquote><blockquote><p><a href="https://www.dropbox.com/s/7exu3w8oh0631j2/CNR-Issue1.pdf?dl=0" target="_blank"><b>Download Issue 1</b></a></p></blockquote></blockquote><h4><p><br></p>  </h4><h3>Cover Page</h3>Title- Codename: Rave <li>Copyright date- September 2014</li> <li>Specs- </li> <ol> <li>Page Length- Ongoing</li> <li>Style- Fluctuates between different artists purposely to give the reader a sense of displacement and evolving reality.  Main style purposely resembles 1990s indie self publish artist books to give the reader a sense of nostalgia if they were readers at that time.  Developed over the course of the last 15 years.</li> <li>Contact Info-</li> <ol> <li>Creative Director- The Broken Flow</li> <ol> <li>Phone Number- 410-419-8818</li> <li>E-mail- <a href="mailto:codenamerave@gmail.com">codenamerave@gmail.com</a></li> <li>Website-  <a href="http://www.codenamerave.com">www.codenamerave.com</a></li> </ol> </ol> </ol>  <p><b><i><br></i></b></p><h3><b><i></i>Tagline<i></i></b></h3><p></p><blockquote>Believe in the Beats!</blockquote><p></p><p></p><blockquote>Thrown into a world of endless power, one man known only as The Operator must go without. He must survive in a city where everyone has super powers but him, and where his best hope are the call to the Groove, Sonic Goddesses that arm him against those who stand past his limits.  Someone in the city is always looking for him, and it is only a matter of time before he will appear again to fight for what is left of reality itself. </blockquote><p></p><p><b><i><br></i></b></p><h3>	<b><i></i>Synopsis<i></i></b></h3><p>The Codename: Rave Webseries is a foray into the vast cast of characters that make up the population of Replay City.  The Codename: Rave webseries begins with Exordium, a seven part prologue to the Codename: Rave universe. &nbsp; Starting with the chapter Apocolyic Night, each chapter will give readers a chance to meet the key players in the Codename: Rave Universe. &nbsp; With enough support and time to build a fanbase over the course of the year, The Codename: Rave team plans to run other stories and expand the universe.<br></p><h3><b><br></b></h3><h3><b>Chapters</b></h3><p>	<b><i>Apocolyic Night</i></b></p><p>The initial chapter of Exordium opens with a rave taking place in a Warehouse in Replay City.  We don't see The Operator spinning on this night, because each of the stories is designed to build to our first sight of him in Chapter 6 and 7 Build and Replay City.  Raves thrown in the warehouse have rooms that are constantly shifting and changing.  One of these rooms is known as the Death Diva Room, and serves as a meeting place for Tabitha Scarnage and her guests in Replay City.  Tabitha is a drug dealing witch, who is now attempting to bring her associates from the Shadow Fallacy realm to Replay City to expand her control of the city.  She plans to do so by selling powerful drugs known as Triggers, which have various affects on the powers each of the citizens in replay City already has.  Also at the table are the other members of the Suffermoore Society Katiyana, Jelan Bex, and Ala Blight.  They are discussing the differences between their world in the Shadow Fallacy and the real world, which is Replay City.  This takes place years before the other chapters, and is when Tabitha and the Suffermoore society were still on speaking terms.  Tabitha is telling them of her plan to use a powerful new source of power known as Beyond and her Trigger drugs to give them an edge of the magic they are used to using.  In the middle of their conversation, the Suffermoore society meeting is interrupted by members of The Fit, a faction of energy based weapon users in the city.  They want to cut Tabitha out of the drug operation she built in Replay City.  She makes an example out of all of them by calling to Katiyana to use her control of Nightmares to paralyze them with fear.  Tabitha uses this opportunity to show off her ability to drain emotions from some of the Fit as well and the chapter ends.</p><p><br></p><p>	<b><i>Sourcerers</i></b></p><p>The second chapter of Exordium explores the elemental users in Replay City known as the Sourcerers.  It picks up with a flashback of Alyssa Ferno carrying Raquel Vega out of Haze hospital.  As it continues, the chapter explains the Sourcerers and their search for the pieces required to build The Source, which will allow them to stabilize the Beyond in their bodies and help them survive in the city as a faction.  This chapter also discusses the issue that The Operator is hard to find and may be the key to assembling the Source. &nbsp; The chapter ends when Tabitha murders everyone in a board meeting at the pharmaceutical corporation that allows her to manufacture her legal drugs and do her research. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>	<b><i>Serengeti</i></b></p><p>The third chapter of Exordium picks up some hours after the timeframe Sourcerers takes place in and shows the same board that was killed by Tabitha in the previous chapter.  That board was faced with an issue threatening the city, a man known as Dark Pixel.  Ala, one of the Suffermoore Society from the first chapter is attempting to explain the severity of Dark Pixel's presence and how he is seeking out powerful people in cities around the world to kill.  She is in the middle of explaining how Replay City is next, when Tabitha comes in to the meeting.  When Tabitha gets there she begins to attack Ala, we discover the board meeting members are holograms that Tabitha is using to influence Dark Pixel, who did not know she had previously killed the board members earlier.  Ala makes it out of the building to dialog with Monica Sonance, the woman who creates The Operator's technology from his ideas.  We see her workshop, which shows of The Operator's technology for the first time.</p><p><br></p><p>	<b><i>Old Wounds Heal in Grime</i></b></p><p>The fourth chapter of Exordium is a flashback to Raquel Vega's time in the hospital after she was attacked by a Fit and Fury and paralyzed from the waist down.  The flashback ends when Otieno gets Raquel's attention to let her know that he sees the two men that attacked her and asks if she recognizes them in the arcade. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>	<b><i>Darkness in Them</i></b></p><p>The fifth chapter of Exordium features Otieno, on one of the Operator's closest friends.  He takes a long ride throughout Replay City and is approached by a mysterious figure.  He wants to follow him and learn of what he is doing in the city, but he has to focus.  He is on short time and must meet Raquel at A.C., the arcade where Raquel is waiting ready to shoot intruders. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>	<b><i>Build</i></b></p><p>The sixth chapter of Exordium picks up where Darkness In Them left off and provides explanation from the Operator about how he has survived by training in a Virtual Reality simulator linked to Reality known as the Build.  The chapter ends when an individual tries to enter the build with a special suitcase that contains a single CONTINUE, which allows the user to come back to life at the price of the lives of everyone in an entire city.  Raquel and Otieno are supposed to guard this case with their lives, and since it is stolen, they must travel back in to the simulator with {OP} to get it back.<b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><br></p><p><b><i>	Replay City</i></b></p><p>The seventh chapter of Exordium features The Operator out in the streets of Replay City, describing how the Build extended to the city and formed a contract caste system that relies on a glitched application to determine if someone can accept black market style requests for hits, attacks, assassinations, and other unsavory services.</p><p><br></p><h3>	<b>Character Descriptions</b></h3><p><b><i><br></i></b></p><p><b><i>T</i></b><b><i>he Operator</i></b></p><p>A man known only as The Operator is left to survive in a city full 	of individuals given amazing superpowers by way of an essence most know as 	Beyond.  In order to survive, he develops technology that allows him to fight 	against those trying to kill him and to call out to the Groove, Sonic Goddesses 	made of Beyond.  Will it be enough to keep him breathing?</p><p><b></b><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/d7673300-7666-4629-84f7-1f7c86ed0fe3/CodenameRaveOperator.jpg" title="Image httpwwwucarecdncomd7673300-7666-4629-84f7-1f7c86ed0fe3"><br></p><p><b><i><br></i></b></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Tabitha Scarnage</i></b></p><p><b><i>	</i></b>Tabitha comes to the world of Codename: Rave by way of Shadow Fallacy, a parallel world that is the inverse of existence.  After arriving in the city, she quickly ran short on thrills because her normal form of sustenence, emotions, function quite differently than back home.  To compensate for this, she began to develop Trigger, a method of experiencing intense highs.  Over time, her ability to satiate faded, and she began to consume human emotions more regularly and sell the products she'd developed during her research.  In this way she controls much of the Underground.</p><p><b></b><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/87cccf1b-676e-49a5-a3f3-f6a896faff14/tabitha.jpg" title="Image httpwwwucarecdncom87cccf1b-676e-49a5-a3f3-f6a896faff14"><br></p><p><b><i><br></i></b></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Katiyana Michaels</i></b></p><p><b><i>	</i></b>Another visitor from the Shadow Fallacy. Katiyana is the current leader of the Suffermoore Society in the Shadow Fallacy, which presides over the use of magic.  Katityana has the ability to control nightmares by altering the chemicals that access the fear receptors in the human brain.  &nbsp; Arriving in Replay City at request of Tabitha for a meeting of the Suffermoore Society, she soon, finds a pair of headphones.  Not aware of what they are or their function, she puts them on and feels the power and presence of someone that she's never met.  Who is he? </p><p><b></b><br></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Ala Blight</i></b></p><p><i>	</i>Best friend of Katiyana, Ala Blight also resides in the Shadow Fallacy.  Ala is a Dark Architect and can use her control of magic to Build to the Sky.  She works alongside many of the businesses in Replay City. </p><p><b></b><br></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Jelan Bex</i></b></p><p><b>	</b>A member of the Suffermoore Society, Jelan has the ability to replinish mana, a source of magic.  She finds herself at Tabitha's meeting in Replay City as well.</p><p><b></b><br></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>The Sourcerers</i></b></p><p><b><i>	</i></b>A group of elemental users given their powers by Beyond as well.  They are searching for themselves, and the Source, a form of technology that will help them balance the levels of Beyond constantly coursing through them.<b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>	</b></p><p><b><i><br></i></b></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Raquel Vega</i></b></p><p><b><i>	</i></b>Owner of the arcade A.C. within Replay City.  One of The Operators oldest friends, who was paralyzed from the waist down when the everyone's powers were activated in Replay City. <b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b></b><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/c61e6e30-6cea-41a0-9cfc-7ddcfba468c8/raquel_profile.jpg" title="Image httpwwwucarecdncomc61e6e30-6cea-41a0-9cfc-7ddcfba468c8"><br></p><p><b><i><br></i></b></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Manny Ortega</i></b><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>	</b>A member of the faction known as the Fury in Replay City.  The Fury have the ability to disperse intense forms of energy and choose to do so through firearm weaponry.</p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b><i>	Bobby Bakerfield </i></b></p><p><b><i>	</i></b></p><p>A member of the faction/fraternity  known as the Fit in Replay City.  The Fit are intensely strong and nearly indestructable.</p><p><br></p><p><b>	</b><b><i>Dark Pixel</i></b></p><p><b><i>	</i></b></p><p><i>	</i>A mysterious man who is intent on collecting realities and destroying any challengers that decide to face him.  He is looking for the next contender that will challenge him and defend Replay City in The Game, a tournament developed to allow fighters to gamble for a chance to own an entire reality.<b>&nbsp; </b></p><p><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/506bb921-8e89-4295-b41a-a43ed42f4e0f/darkp.jpg"><br></p><h3><b><br></b></h3><h3>	<b>Artist Statement</b></h3><p></p><blockquote>"Codename: Rave is a very special project to me because in anything I do I strive to be unique.  I've always written stories here and there, but this one kept calling out to me over the last 15 years.  I developed it because before the internet took on the power that it did, it was very difficult to make people aware of people that were different from the same.  In the 80's and 90's if you were lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, black, asian, latino, hispannic, overweight, nerdy...different...you had no place in the world according to the mainstream.  I took the name the Broken Flow both to run against that grain again within comics and tell a story where people from all walks of life fit because they were different and to celebrate it.  There was no other place that did that better than Warehouse parties.  That framework fit very well into the survival style stories I'd always wanted to see instead of typical superhero books.  The aftermath is what you see before you."</blockquote><p></p><p><br></p><h3><b>Artist Bios</b></h3><p><b>Dino Agor- Art Director, Penciler</b><br></p><p>	A Filipino artist, graduated as Bachelor of Science in Nursing, practiced his profession 	for 5 years. But his true passion in art lead him to become an illustrator. Constant 	posting of his work gained him some commissions abroad until he got his first comic 	book published under Faster Hamster comics titled Bad Unit 2.  Then a huge work 	came on for Codename: Rave issue 0-5, having him do most of the pages. He is now 	currently working on the Codename: Rave Webseries as well as some indie comic 	publishers in the united states of America. </p><p>	</p><p><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/55eb77db-cf43-462c-bdc0-4fd7041e7ff3/Dino.jpg" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/55eb77db-cf43-462c-bdc0-4fd7041e7ff3/Dino.jpg"><br></p><p><b><br></b></p><p>	<b>Evy Pinlac- Penciler</b></p><p>Evy Pinlac was born, raised and currently residing in Manila, Philippines. She started drawing as a toddler, and attended various art-related classes and workshops growing up. She graduated high school at Angelicum College and tried to pursue a course in Multimedia Arts and Animation, but due to combined circumstances was unable to continue. In 2012 she tried getting into the comics scene, starting out by doing a few commission pieces for Pross Comics. Through that, she got acquainted with Dino Agor, who referred her to Faster Hamster Comics for a title that they needed an artist for. She has also done comics for a company named Tawalt, based in Canada. Evy does pencils, inks and coloring. She is heavily influenced by Disney comics and Japanese manga, and leans more toward fantasy genres.</p><p><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/76bc2c50-59a4-4c59-b047-a2aeeca81934/EVY.jpg"><br></p><p><br></p><p>	<b>Bryan Magnaye- Inks/Colors</b></p><p><b>	</b>Bryan Arfel Magnaye.is 26yrs old from Manila Philippines and graduated in college of arts and designs. He also attended Glasshouse seminars and some animation studios. He has been working as a comic book colorist since 2012. His first comic coloring job was a cover from Godsend Comicbook 	Publishing founded by Lee Jiles. Since then he has worked for several publishers including Zenescope Entertainment,Advent Comics,Outbreak Comics and many more.</p><p><b>	</b></p><p><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/affcaa23-d26d-4eaf-aa76-a370891d6e9d/BryanMaganye.jpg"><br></p><p><br></p><p>                                                                                                                                                     </p><p>	<b>Earl Seneres- Letters</b></p><p>Earl Seneres comes to the Codename: Rave project with a variety of talents.  In addition to being a layout artist for numerous publications he is also the lead vocalist for the band Tirada and also designs t-shirts for Pen and Armor.<br></p><p><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/e9ce9980-3b15-4101-96f5-8fdd1ae0c6bf/EARL.jpg"><br></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p></p><p></p><blockquote><blockquote><p><b><a href="https://www.patreon.com/codenamerave?ty=h" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Support the Codename: Rave campaign today on Patreon - Get exclusive updates on new chapters and more</a></b></p></blockquote><blockquote><p><a href="http://www.releasewire.com/press-releases/codename-rave-before-you-lies-a-unique-world-of-struggle-and-strife-638031.htm" target="_blank"><b>View Press Release</b></a></p></blockquote><blockquote><p><a href="https://www.dropbox.com/s/7exu3w8oh0631j2/CNR-Issue1.pdf?dl=0" target="_blank"><b>Download Issue 1</b></a></p></blockquote></blockquote><p></p><p></p>

<p><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/d4b86f2c-d123-4adc-9924-800634cd39d8/ScreenShot20151102at71017PM.png" title="Image httpwwwucarecdncomd4b86f2c-d123-4adc-9924-800634cd39d8"><br></p><p><br></p><p>Last week, <a href="http://drunkMall.com" target="_blank">drunkMall.com</a> - a curated drunk shopping/entertainment website - received major global press with articles on <a href="http://mashable.com/2015/10/28/drunkmall-online-shopping/#N0Uk_1Kcvqq3" target="_blank">Mashable</a>, <a href="http://metro.co.uk/2015/10/28/theres-now-a-website-designed-just-for-drunk-shopping-5466283/" target="_blank">Metro</a> [UK], New York magazine's <a href="http://nymag.com/thecut/2015/10/drunk-mall-drunk-shopping-site.html" target="_blank">The Cut</a>, <a href="http://www.glamour.nl/lifestyle/nieuws/gallery/deze-website-is-speciaal-voor-shoppers-die-te-diep-in-het-glaasje-hebben-gekeken" target="_blank">Glamour</a> [Dutch branch] and <a href="http://drunkmall.com/press" target="_blank">much more coverage</a> in New Zealand, Mexico, Russia, etc.</p><p>Only a month old, the site has already received attention from influencers like <a href="https://twitter.com/realjknoxville/status/656830610133008384" target="_blank">Johnny Knoxville</a>, <a href="http://drunkmall.com/I%20might%20have%20to%20buy%20a%20Nicolas%20Cage%20throw%20pillow%20or%20purchase%20some%20%24.99%20%22fuck%20you%22%20phone%20calls.%20http://www.drunkmall.com" target="_blank">Ralphie May</a> &amp; Carla Marie of Z100's <a href="http://www.elvisduran.com/articles/whats-trending-461825/whatstrending-drunk-shopping-14056388/" target="_blank">Elvis Duran show</a>.</p><p>In the wake of this attention, drunkMall is launching a weekly email catalog version of the hit website: <a href="http://drunkmall.us12.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=02869bcc4bfc766c82734a472&amp;id=cd90936ff1#_=_" target="_blank">drunkMail</a>. </p><p>drunkMail will not only include the most recent 30 or so items posted to the site (roughly 4 new products a day) but subscribers will also have access to exclusive giveaways of items recently featured on the website!</p><p>The first "issue" of drunkMail will be sent out on Wednesday, November 4th. drunkMall shoppers will need to be signed up by 12pm Central Time on Nov. 11 to be eligible to win the first giveaway.</p>
<div>  <p><b>Internet-based Content Delivery Providers Are Disrupting the Cable TV &amp; Media Industry</b></p>  <p><b>DALLAS, November 3, 2015 </b>Today streaming media allows consumers to watch TV everywhere, through access to content and video from cable networks and broadcasters across multiple platforms and devices  either live or on demand. The consumption of digital television and video content streaming offers marketers opportunities to seek new and innovative solutions to reach consumers with targeted, relevant messaging across multi devices and platforms.</p>  <p>The advertising industry is going through dramatic changes to try and keep up. The American Advertising Federation (AAF) of Dallas has assembled a panel of experts to provide insight on the best way to navigate this ever-changing market place for the advertising industry. The panel will be the main focus of AAFs monthly luncheon, which is set for Nov. 10, 2015, at The DoubleTree by Hilton Campbell Centre, located at 8250 N. Central Expressway, Dallas, TX 75206. Attendees will be able to network before the panel between 11:00 a.m. and 12:00 p.m.; lunch is served 12:00  1:15 p.m. and includes the Ask the Experts Panel.</p>  <p>Using the hashtag #askAAF, users will be able to submit their questions directly via Twitter to an assembled panel of cable and media streaming experts. The panel includes:</p>  <p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Carolyn Sheflin, director of digital sales for Time Warner Cable Media</p>  <p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Christie Hoelting, director of Midwest sales for Hulu</p>  <p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  James Loughran, senior vice president of digital and business development for NCC Media</p>  <p>Tickets are available to AAF members for $40 and $55 for non-members. For more information, please visit <a href="http://aafdallas.org/events/">http://aafdallas.org/events</a> or call (972) 488-8227.</p>  <p>###</p>  <p><b>About AAF Dallas</b></p>  <p>Founded in 1908, <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">AAF Dallas</a> is nearly 1,000 members strong and is affiliated with the <a href="http://www.aaf10.org">Tenth District of the American Advertising Federation</a>, part of <a href="http://www.aaf.org">AAF</a>s national network of more than 200 ad clubs and 40,000 professionals. AAF Dallas, AAFs 2010-2011 Division 1 Club of the Year, strives to elevate the success of the advertising community through innovation, creative excellence, collaboration, professional development, education and philanthropic endeavors. To find out how to get involved in the Dallas ad community, visit <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">www.aafdallas.org</a>, Facebook <a href="https://www.facebook.com/AAFDallas">https://www.facebook.com/AAFDallas</a>, Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/AAFDallas">https://twitter.com/AAFDallas</a> and Instagram <a href="https://t.yesware.com/tl/be8fbd5a8eb6dfd92f73b61e00659d66a3bbaddd/2b3b98e189710c9afb044e53bb47cc67/540205e58b7a48dc53225f155ba7ea3b?ytl=http%3A%2F%2Finstagram.com%2Faafdallas">http://instagram.com/aafdallas</a>.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b>Media Contact:</b></p>  <p>Jo Trizila, TrizCom PR</p>  <p>PR Chair for AAF Dallas</p>  <p>(972) 247-1369</p>  <p>Jo@TrizCom.com<u></u></p>  </div><p>                   <u><br> </u></p>
<p><i>November 3, 2015 (New York, New York)<b>&nbsp;</b></i>&nbsp; Just days around World Food Day and International Chefs Day,&nbsp;<a href="http://thekitchenconnection.org/">KitchenConnection.org</a>&nbsp;launches the second version of its foodie social network where both lay and professional cooks can share pictures, blog posts, and recipes, as well as participate in the platforms signature connections where users can host live video sessions to cook or share tips about food with other users anywhere in the world. Currently, there are representatives from over 100 different countries on the platform, from Fiji to North Korea.&nbsp;</p><p>Users can choose to host these connections for free or paid, and if paid, can donate some or all of the money to Kitchen Connections partner charity, Action Against Hunger, supporting the sites mission:&nbsp;<i>Im eating  youre eating and because were eating together,</i><i>&nbsp;someone else is eating too</i></p><p>Just a year ago, Kitchen Connection launched its invite-only beta version after a pre-launch event in New York City where the Kitchen Connection team showcased a live cooking experience with a French Master Chef from the prestigious chefs association, Maîtres Cuisiniers de France and foodies in Paris.</p><p>The site, which urges members to create a profile where his cooking credentials, languages spoken and interests can all be showcased, is also a place to distinguish users who are members of the prestigious World Chefs organization, which has partnered with Kitchen Connection. Past supporters of the platform include Whole Foods Market Bowery, which sponsored their launch in the past.</p><p>Founder, Earlene Cruz, thought of the venture while studying abroad on a ship through the program Semester at Sea. Right before porting in Ghana, she lost her wallet with all of her money. Her plans to CouchSurf there led her to a home-stay with a family that graciously housed her and fed her for the week that she was in Ghana. Eating the delicious red-red stew with her hands on their living room floor led her to want to virtually recreate the experience, hence the premise for Kitchen Connection.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a></a>Here is the sites promotional video:&nbsp;<a href="https://youtu.be/m4TqVE14OMc">https://youtu.be/m4TqVE14OMc</a></p><div><br></div><p>ABOUT Kitchen Connection</p><p><a href="http://www.KitchenConnection.org">www.KitchenConnection.org</a></p><p>Where Food Links the World"</p><p>The mission of Kitchen Connection is to alleviate global hunger by creating a hub for recipe exchange, education, and global connection through food. The aim is to connect global foodies through a virtually interactive platform that allows them not only to meet, interact with, and learn from fellow members but also to work together to create meals, sit down together, and ultimately contribute to their global family through the revenue generatedwithout even leaving their homes. Food  its preparation, consumption, and distribution - is the most ubiquitous human experience, which is at the core of the alleviation of global hunger.</p><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p><i>Im eating  youre eating </i></p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p><i>and because were eating together,</i></p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p><i>someone else is eating too</i></p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><blockquote><p></p><p></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ###</p><p></p><p></p></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></blockquote><p><i></i></p><p><i></i></p><p></p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>  </p><p>In response to the two prong strategy to fight digital ad fraud by the Trustworthy Accountability Group (TAG), Jay Friedman, COO at Goodway Group states:<br><br>Goodway Group is a part of the IAB TAG and thus has an innate understanding of the value of trustworthy ecosystems. However, by our estimation, a plan that costs hundreds or thousands of parties $10,000 each isnt necessarily a sound or effective strategy in fighting digital ad fraud.</p><p><br>Most industry analysts agree that the biggest challenge in digital ad fraud currently comes from bot traffic. The $10k TAG certification doesnt solve this issue and claiming to address it by verifying payment seems functionally problematic. To illustrate my point, suppose Im the owner of a legitimate fan blog about the Green Bay Packers, boasting over 50,000 visitors a month, yet Im an expat living in Russia. How can it be determined with accuracy that my blog is legitimate? Because lots of bot traffic comes from Eastern Europe, does that eliminate my blogs legitimacy solely based on my location? Taking it a step further, what if, as the owner of the blog, I cant afford to pay the $10,000 for certification?</p><p>  </p><p>Solving the problem of bot traffic should be our No. 1 priority, however this plan either places a million small publishers at a severe disadvantageor even worseout of business altogether. Conversely, we know that lots of bots are nothing more than spoofed users. In solving this, are we going to put CAPTCHA requirements on every page of the World Wide Web just to make sure its a real user who should be viewing an ad? User certification seems to be the most important factor in play, but its next to impossible to truly verify. And this is why it remains a pressing problem throughout the industry.</p><p>  </p><p>Goodway Group is a leading managed-services programmatic partner to local, regional and Fortune 500 brand agencies. Bootstrapped and 100 percent privately owned since 1929, Goodway moved into the programmatic digital media space in 2006 to continue its rich history of tackling complex local and regional campaign executions with data science-driven targeting and support services to make achieving success easy for agency clients. Its proprietary algorithms pair with a technology-agnostic approach to enable agencies and marketers to achieve their ultimate goal  better results while remaining lean and nimble. More information can be found at <a href="http://www.goodwaygroup.com/">www.GoodwayGroup.com</a>.</p><p>  </p><p>Jay Friedman has written several posts about ad fraud (with hyperlinks):<br>Goodway Group Watch &amp; Learn Series  <a href="http://goodwaygroup.com/research-information/watch_and_learn.php">Fraud Parts I &amp; II (Volume 2-3)</a> (video)<br>Goodway Group Blog  <a href="http://goodwaygroup.com/blog/acting-like-congress-will-not-solve-viewability-and-fraud/">Acting Like Congress Will Not Solve Viewability and Fraud</a></p><p>Press Contact:<br>Jo Trizila<br><b>TrizCom PR on behalf of Goodway Group<br></b><a href="mailto:Jo@TrizCom.com">Jo@TrizCom.com</a><br>O: 972-247-1369<br>C: 214-232-0078</p><p>  </p>
<div><div>I'd like to pitch you a few art deco statement rings similar to the ones Taraji P Henson in Empire&nbsp;and Lady Gaga in American Horror Story Hotels have worn. <br></div><div><br></div><div>I've enjoyed so much reading your recent articles on celebrity-inspired fashion. I think the rings would be a great fit for your budget-conscious, fashion-forward and well-balanced tasteful readers. </div><div><br></div><div>The rings are under $100 crafted with premium cubic zirconia and sterling silver. Here is a dropbox link to some of the items. <a href="https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6gze01m9rfkrx1j/AAD1rqnxFkVW40bHgAeydKypa?dl=0" target="_blank" title="Link: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6gze01m9rfkrx1j/AAD1rqnxFkVW40bHgAeydKypa?dl=0">https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6gze01m9rfkrx1j/AAD1rqnxFkVW40bHgAeydKypa?dl=0</a><br></div><div><br></div><div>Is this something you'd be interested to cover? Please let me know if you need anything from me. </div><div><br></div></div><div><br></div><div>Best,</div><div>Hao</div>
<div><p>Those fucking refs! </p><p>Slouched in a locker room reeking of sweat in Trondheim, Norway, I sat there numb. Something that had dominated almost a quarter century of my life had abruptly ended in a split second, and it was all my fault.</p><p>It was overtime in Game 4 of the Get-Legaen playoffs and we were trailing 3-0 in the series against the Stavanger Oilers, the best and wealthiest team in the league. To say that Rosenborg IHK was an underdog would be an understatement, but that night we had a chance.</p><p>Thanks to a questionable call, I put my fate in the hands of the enemy. It couldnt have been more anti-climactic. I had to sit on the bench and watch some kid skate down the rink like Charlie Conway on a penalty shot and seal my fate. I knew my career would eventually end, but I never thought it would be like this.</p><p><img width="640" alt="" src="https://media.licdn.com/mpr/mpr/shrinknp_800_800/AAEAAQAAAAAAAARRAAAAJGJmYWU2MTkxLWY4MDEtNDVmZS1hZWEwLTYwNjRiYTg3NDIxNw.jpg" height="453"></p><p>What the hell do I do now?</p><p>It was as if my girlfriend of almost 25 years had just broken up with me, and I had to re-enter the dating pool. The only problem was I didnt know how to date and I needed a new devotion - software sales. In 2015, Forbes had VMTurbo at the #52 spot of the most promising companies. I lasted 2 weeks and 3.5 days.</p><p>Every single day I would wake up at 5 am, jump on the T, pretend I was still an athlete for 30 minutes at Boston Sports Club, and then cold call CTOs until 6pm. The competition and effort among my colleagues within the office was fierce and familiar, and I had the utmost respect for every single person in the office. Unlike hockey where I mastered my skill over decades of dedication, I had to learn this skill set in a week. This lack of preparation turned a once tough hockey player into a scared kid on his first day of school.</p><p>Take me off your list!</p><p>Hands sweating and heart pounding, every time I made a dial, I thought I was going into cardiac arrest. Angry frustrated people, who hated their jobs, would demand me to remove them from our list. I went from getting hit through the boards on the ice to getting verbally assaulted by random people on a daily basis. At least in hockey you can take a cold tub, but for this, I had yet to find a remedy for my damaged self-esteem and ego.</p><p>After getting home at around 10pm one night, my mother asked how my day went (yes, I was a 25 year old former pro athlete living at home with my parents). After giving my pitch she replied, I would hang up on you too. I had walked into that job cocky and expecting a big paycheck; however, I walked out with a reality check.</p><p>Entrepreneur or unemployed?</p><p>At that moment, I decided that I was never going to have a boss again, and that I was going to define my own path. I hated school, despised the 9-5, and was not a fan of authority. With grad school, another corporate job or having a boss out of the question, I only had one choice: channel my passion towards entrepreneurship.</p><p>Throughout my young life, I have always had two passions. One included blades and sticks while the other included imagination and innovation. For as long as I can remember, inventors have intrigued me. My heroes are guys like Richard Branson and Elon Musk. These innovators are self-made men who put everything on the line in order to bring their crazy ideas to life. Much like athletes, they are driven by a never say die attitude and a work ethic that borders obsession. I dreamed of being the next great one.</p><p><img width="600" alt="" src="https://media.licdn.com/mpr/mpr/shrinknp_800_800/AAEAAQAAAAAAAAPGAAAAJGE0OWEzOWI2LTA1MWQtNGU5NC1hZDI1LWEyMWMxMzc3NmQ1OA.png" height="471"></p><p>&nbsp;We have a problem.</p><p>Ever since high school, I had kept a list of my ideas in my dads office that I believed had some potential. One concept stood out among the rest. It was an idea that could merge my two passions of athletics and entrepreneurship.</p><p>As an athlete, I noticed teammates would drink coffee, gels, and energy shots before games to boost focus, however they would also complain about the jitters and crashes. In addition, these guys would drink watered down sports drinks and lugged around briefcases full of vitamins. I knew there had to be a better way.</p><p>Its all about the guy next to you.</p><p>As any real entrepreneur knows, an idea is just an idea. It all comes down to execution and putting thought into action. After my short stint in sales, I decided it was time to take my chance. After getting shut down by dozens of accelerators, I realized I needed a team, so I reached out to a former Belmont Hill classmate and fellow entrepreneur, Robert Avakian. He was a former division 1 rower at Boston University and had previously started a chemical adhesives company. He believed in the mission and jumped on board as the CMO.</p><p>Our first stop was Startup52. I figured an accelerator essentially meant that we were going to accelerate to becoming millionaires. I was wrong. It was a pilot accelerator in NYC that gave us a great opportunity to go at the business full-time. Without funding, we lived in Harlem and still had to rely on personal savings. I slept on the couch, and Robert slept on a mattress on the floor. With no air conditioning for July and August, the living situation was less than optimal, but with their help, we still pushed forward.</p><p>Living at the office.</p><p>With the accelerator coming to a close and the business driving my personal funds to empty, we needed investment badly. With a stroke of luck, we got a message from&nbsp;<a href="http://www.food-x.com/cohort-iii-fall-2015/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Food-X</a>, a premier international food &amp; beverage accelerator in NYC. I had actually applied to their second cohort, but was denied. Thankfully, they kept us in the system. After an awesome meeting with their founders, we were accepted into the program and secured a small investment from their VC fund,&nbsp;<a href="https://sosv.com/food-x-announces-its-third-cohort/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SOSV</a>.</p><p>After being accepted, we decided it was time to strengthen team TRU. Continuing with our mantra for athletes by athletes, we brought on Ryan Foss-Skiftesvik, a current Fordham University senior and former IMG Academy soccer player. He was previously a part of a beverage company and had startup experience. We also brought on three part-time team members: Mathias Kaufmann, Kara Kearns, and Raymond McSpirit.</p><p>Upon arrival, reality hit. As we walked through the open floor office in the financial district of NYC, we noticed we were no longer in the minor leagues. Food tech companies like&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/6637682?trk=vsrp_companies_res_name&amp;trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A2097454201446483955817%2CVSRPtargetId%3A6637682%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary" target="_blank">Cook Mood</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/4788515?trk=vsrp_companies_res_name&amp;trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A2097454201446484044480%2CVSRPtargetId%3A4788515%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary" target="_blank">Booster</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/2814572?trk=prof-exp-company-name" target="_blank">Fika</a>, and&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/10181306?trk=tyah&amp;trkInfo=clickedVertical%3Acompany%2CclickedEntityId%3A10181306%2Cidx%3A1-1-1%2CtarId%3A1446484203192%2Ctas%3Aforkyoo" target="_blank">Forkyoo</a>&nbsp;were already beginning to gain traction on a large scale, while&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/3111104?trk=prof-exp-company-name" target="_blank">Wakati</a>, was changing the world. In other words, the pressure was on.</p><p><img width="640" alt="" src="https://media.licdn.com/mpr/mpr/shrinknp_800_800/AAEAAQAAAAAAAATaAAAAJDU5OTRhNjdjLWEzYzQtNDdlMy04ZWY4LWExMzE0MTg1MTI4Zg.jpg" height="427" title="Image: https://media.licdn.com/mpr/mpr/shrinknp_800_800/AAEAAQAAAAAAAATaAAAAJDU5OTRhNjdjLWEzYzQtNDdlMy04ZWY4LWExMzE0MTg1MTI4Zg.jpg"></p><p>Sink or swim.</p><p>Eventually, there comes a time when you have to present your product to the people, and they are going to love it or hate it. It is as simple as that. It is an exciting time, but also terrifying for fear of disapproval. Despite the fact that we have received some positive reviews of our formula from athletes and working professionals, the nerves still quake. You want people to enjoy your product so much that they need it. As entrepreneurs, we all have this deep-seeded belief that we have built a better wheel, and that we have the greatest product in the world for our industry, but when will we feel truly validated?</p><p>Traction is the key to success and every company must eventually take the plunge to prove their concept. Our true test is the launch of a presale campaign for our first product on November 17th through Kickstarter. Geared towards athletes and active lifestyle individuals,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.tru.energy/sports-shot/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">TRUEnergy</a>&nbsp;is a green tea caffeinated sport shot infused with more electrolytes than a Gatorade and more vitamins than a Vitamin Water to help you feel good and perform better.</p><p>Our test is now.</p><p>For an invite to our launch,&nbsp;<a href="http://eepurl.com/bDZu3v" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">sign up here</a>.</p><p>Thank you for reading our story.</p></div>
<p></p><p></p><u><i><p></p></i></u><i><p>MINI-sponsored exhibitor aims to improve life in cities through walkability</p><p> </p></i><p> </p><p> </p><p> <b></b></p><p><b>New York, NY: </b>BMW MINI is sponsoring State of Place as one of the ten startups (from over 40 who applied) selected to receive pro-bono exhibition space at the CoInvent Pulse Technology and Business Festival being held in New York on November 9, 2015. State of Place was selected to participate in the innovative CoInvent Pulse startup ecosystem based on its potential to improve life in cities by helping to make them more walkable. </p><p> </p><p> </p><p> </p><p>"We are honored that BMW MINI recognizes State of Places potential to make a positive impact on cities through walkability, and we look forward to interfacing with other like-minded entrepreneurs, investors, and even potential new team members and engaging with the CoInvent Pulse startup community," said State of Place Founder, Dr. Mariela Alfonzo. "To raise awareness about what makes cities walkable and why this matters, we are giving away a free "Walk-and-Talk" tour in New York City for attendees who share their business cards at our booth or tweet to @stateofplace with #walkandtalkNYC." As an international walkability expert, Dr. Alfonzo will lead the walkability tour, dissecting the aspects of city design that impact our perceptions, feelings, and behaviors daily.</p><p> </p><p> </p><p> </p><p></p><p>CoInvent Pulse is a business and technology festival that will be featuring 150 exhibitors and an array of business workshops. CoInvents mission is to help founders, startups, and entrepreneurs grow and thrive in the New York tech and startup ecosystem. The CoInvent Pulse Festival will be held on November 9, 2015, 9am-6pm at the Metropolitan Pavilion at 125 West 18th Street, New York, NY 10011. Details are at <a href="http://pulse.coinvent.co/">http://pulse.coinvent.co/</a>. </p><p>  <b></b></p><p><b>About State of Place: </b>State of Place is an innovative urban data analytics startup that forecasts the value-add of walkability. We help cities, real estate developers and NGOs by quantifying what people love (and dont) about their communities and identifying the most valuable ways to maximize their walkability, so they can deliver irresistible places. <a href="http://www.stateofplace.co/">www.stateofplace.co</a>   </p><p></p><p></p><p>  </p><p> </p><p> </p><b><p></p><p>###</p><p> </p></b><p></p><p></p><p><b></b><i></i><u></u><br></p>
<b>Woman Gives Comic Bloody Nose for a Batman joke*!?</b><p>  <p><br> I am 5'3. 130 lbs. I was punched by an intoxicated redhead who was 6'4 &amp; 230 lbs. bedecked with rings. This happened at Sullivans franchise during my ex-girlfriends birthday.</p>  <p>The cameraman runs onstage so you don't see her continue to punch me. In the complete footage she insults me, I try to defend myself, she hits me twice, I dial 9-11. Police arrest her &amp; ask me if I want to press charges. I nod. I ask the woman her name. "Kiss my Irish a**," she says. Then the owner asks me if I am going to sue.</p>  <p><a href="http://thelajournal.com/blogs/reverse-racism/">120 seconds.</a> I fielded 147 comments, airing on WGN Radio + Tallahassee &amp; Wichita livestream. </p>  <p>Thank you. <p><b><i>Former Microsoft Team Leader Tapped to Lead Regional Ad Sales Efforts</i></b><b></b></p><p>JENKINTOWN, PA - (Nov. 4, 2015)  Goodway Group, a managed services programmatic media firm serving hundreds of advertising agencies across North America, has announced the hiring of Microsofts Allen Afshar to serve as their Western U.S. regional sales director. He will be based in Seattle, Wash.</p><p>While working at Microsoft, Afshar spent over a decade as a leader in multiple ad sales channels and service capacities. Just prior to joining Goodway, Afshar headed a regional district on the Bing.com ad sales team, which targeted domestic and global partnerships. His specialty centers around launching creative display, mobile and search advertising campaigns across multiple business sectors including automotive, consumer goods, retail and technology. For his efforts, he was awarded with Microsofts prestigious Circle of Excellence honortheir highest level of sales recognition.</p><p>Goodway has been family owned for 86 years, and were proud to have Allen Afshar join our tight-knit group, said David Wolk, president of the Goodway Group. Were growing fast and have been fortunate enough to attract the right type of talent to continue delivering the successful results our clients have come to expect.</p><p>Afshar joins an increasing list of employee hires in the past six months, as the company continues to add clients while expanding into new markets, both in the U.S. and abroad.</p><p>Im extremely passionate about advertising, its continued evolution and the value it brings to customers, said Afshar. Goodway has made its mark since 1929, by bringing top marketing expertise to its customers, and the results definitely speak for themselves. After an amazing experience at Microsoft, Im eager to partner with Goodways current and future customers in showing the value of programmatic ad buying.</p><p>Allen Afshar is a graduate of the University of Washington and resides in Kirkland, Wash.<br></p><p>For more information, please visit Goodway on the web at <a href="http://www.goodwaygroup.com">www.goodwaygroup.com</a>.</p><p><b>About Goodway Group<br></b>Goodway Group is a leading managed-services programmatic partner to local, regional and Fortune 500 brand agencies. Bootstrapped and 100 percent privately owned since 1929, Goodway moved into the programmatic digital media space in 2006 to continue its rich history of tackling complex local and regional campaign executions with data science-driven targeting and support services to make achieving success easy for agency clients. Its proprietary algorithms pair with a technology-agnostic approach to enable agencies and marketers to achieve their ultimate goal  better results while remaining lean and nimble.</p><p>###</p><p><b>Media Contact:<br></b>Jo Trizila<br>TrizCom PR<br>Office: 972-247-1369<br><a href="mailto:jo@trizcom.com">jo@trizcom.com</a></p>

<p>               <b>Shes Trained to Heel So He Can Heal</b>&nbsp; &nbsp; <br></p><p>CARROLLTON, TX (Nov. 5, 2015) <a href="http://www.OperationKindness.org">Operation Kindness</a>, the original and largest no-kill animal shelter in North Texas, and the North Texas Chapter of Pets for Vets are training shelter dogs to become companions for North Texas military veterans experiencing post-traumatic stress issues.<br></p><p>At no cost to the veteran, shelter dogs are vetted, matched and then professionally trained to fit into the veterans lifestyle. Both the veteran and the animal receive training for the lifetime of the dog.</p><p>After serving in Operation Enduring Freedom and Operation Iraqi Freedom, North Texas Marine Steven Osteen sometimes experiences feelings of anxiety due to post-traumatic stress disorder. To help keep calm when these feelings arise, Steve decided to apply for a companion animal through the Pets for Vets program. Steve was instantly selected and then connected with a professional trainer from Operation Kindness to discuss what type of companion dog would appropriately fit his needs, lifestyle and personality. After meeting with Steve, it was apparent he would need a dog that would be calm and comfortable in social situations.</p><p>This is where longtime volunteer and foster parent for Operation Kindness, Debra Knight, comes into play. She began fostering Hazel, a 3-year-old retriever mix. What she thought would be a short, two-week stay evolved into a very successful three-month companion training program. In order to become a companion animal, dogs are required to take tests to assess their social skills, ability to be trained, handling and reactivity, anxiety triggers and house manners. Only 2 percent of shelter animals meet these requirements. Hazel, however, scored an almost perfect score of 90 percent.</p><p>Each week Debra met with Amber Jester, a certified behavior specialist and animal trainer at Operation Kindness. Together they created the curriculum to prepare Hazel for becoming a companion. Hazel quickly learned how to sit and many other important behaviors to help her future veteran companion.</p><p>Fostering for Pets for Vets was a great experience for me. You know it is the right thing to do when everybody wins, said Debra. The veteran got a companion animal, a shelter dog got a home, my dogs got a stronger pack leader, and I got a rich experience in training with the mentoring and guidance of a professional trainer.</p><p>Today, almost three months after her initial training, Hazel accompanies Steve wherever he goes including trips to the zoo, circus, grocery store and many more adventures. In crowded situations, Steve is able to focus all of his attention on Hazel  relieving feelings of anxiety which helps keep him calm. Steve credits Hazels assistance with helping him save his life and his marriage.</p><p>As part of the program, Operation Kindness also provides the veteran with supplies and equipment such as a crate, food and water bowls, and grooming supplies to help the dog and owner start their new life together. Throughout the process, the trainer provides ongoing support to the veteran and continues to make home visits to assist with training techniques. All of this is done at no cost to the veteran.</p><p>Operation Kindness Pets for Vets program needs more volunteers willing to foster and train dogs for veterans. If you would like to volunteer, or know a veteran who could benefit from this program, please contact Tomi Tucker at <a href="mailto:ttucker@operationkindness.org">ttucker@operationkindness.org</a> or visit <a href="http://www.operationkindness.org/opk/homepage/pets-for-vets/">http://www.operationkindness.org/opk/homepage/pets-for-vets/</a> for more information.</p><p>Pets for Vets is a nonprofit organization founded by animal trainer Clarissa Black. The national organization has 22 chapters in 18 states, two of which are in Texas  in the Houston and North Texas areas. Operation Kindness, the North Texas chapter, is the first animal shelter nationwide to be granted chapter status. For more information on Pets for Vets, visit <a href="http://www.pets-for-vets.com">www.pets-for-vets.com</a>.</p><p><b>About Operation Kindness</b></p><p> Founded in 1976, Operation Kindness is the original and largest no-kill shelter in North Texas. Its mission is to care for homeless cats and dogs in a no-kill environment until each is adopted into responsible homes and to advocate humane values and behavior. Operation Kindness has saved nearly 80,000 animals since its inception. The shelter assists nearly 5,000 dogs and cats each year, caring for an average of 300 animals daily with another 100-150 animals in foster homes.</p><p>Join Operation Kindness in their mission to care for homeless animals by becoming a member of the Happy Tails Society. This group of dedicated friends provides a monthly gift to help pay for medical care, medicine, food, shelter, nurturing and behavior training the pets need to have a second chance at life. Learn more about Operation Kindness at <a href="http://www.OperationKindness.org">http://www.OperationKindness.org</a> or on Facebook (<a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Operation-Kindness/30251945822">www.facebook.com/pages/Operation-Kindness/30251945822</a>).</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Contact:</b></p><p>Katie Hill-Mudd</p><p>TrizCom Inc. </p><p><a href="mailto:jo@Trizcom.com">Katie@TrizCom.Com</a></p><p>Office: 972-247-1369</p><p>                                                                                      </p><p>Cell: 214-676-4254</p>
We are pleased to announce that we will host our first Corporate Litigation Symposium on November 17, 18 and 19.&nbsp;<div><br></div><div>We invite you to participate in this <a href="http://www.doar.com/company-news/event/corporate-litigation-symposium/?src=companynews" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.doar.com/company-news/event/corporate-litigation-symposium/?src=companynews">3-part virtual event encompassing expert sessions on witness preparation strategy, effectively presenting Mortgage-Backed Securities (MBS) cases, and Internet-based research of jurors during jury selection</a>. A registration link is provided below for each session and youll receive your confirmation and dial-in information upon <a href="http://www.doar.com/company-news/event/corporate-litigation-symposium/?src=companynews" target="_blank">registration</a>:<div><br><b>November 17&nbsp;(12:00pm ET): Center Out</b>  We will discuss the importance of witness testimony to trial outcomes and how to best prepare witnesses for deposition and trial. This webinar will be led by Dr. Roy Futterman, a Director in DOARs jury consulting practice. Dr. Futterman will provide practical insights and methods for developing trial strategies that consider the witnesses critical role during trial. &nbsp;<a href="http://www.doar.com/from-the-center-out-basing-deeper-trial-strategy-on-the-witness-juror-connection/" target="_blank">Learn More or &nbsp;Register here</a><br><br><b>November 18 (2:00pm ET): The Multi-Trillion Dollar MBS Crisis: Telling the Story, Closing the Deal</b>  We will look through the lens of the current multi-trillion dollar MBS crisis being litigated between investors and trustees. Our world-class panelists will speak to the data itself and the issue of how to find and tell the real story  the story with which jurors and triers of fact will really connect. &nbsp;<a href="http://www.doar.com/litigating-new-multi-trillion-dollar-risks-in-mortgage-backed-securities/" target="_blank">Learn More or&nbsp;Register here</a><br><br><b>November 19 (12:00pm ET): Know Thy Jurors: Researching Jurors During Jury Selection</b>  We will turn our attention to the issue of jury selection and how to properly perform Internet searches during voir dire. Specifically, our experts will address what the courts are saying about it, what types of useful information you are likely to find and how to avoid the risks inherent in the process. &nbsp;<a href="http://www.doar.com/internet-research-on-jurors-during-voir-dire/" target="_blank">Learn More or&nbsp;Register here</a></div></div>
I was poking around Amazon a while back and saw an 85-inch Samsung TV that cost $45,000. Just for fun I checked out the reviews and saw these gems:<br><br>"I was going to fund my daughters [sic.] wedding in Hawaii, but I figured this Samsung TV would last much longer." -- Jordan<br><br>"The black levels and color depth on this TV are pretty good for the price. However, the small screen size is a deal breaker. I recommend buying an IMAX theater instead." --&nbsp;David<br><br>If you haven't run across them before, there's a long tradition of users leaving funny fake reviews on odd or extravagant products on Amazon.com. Here are some of the funniest ones I've found.<br><br>Unfortunately, not all fake reviews are hilarious. Marketing firms often pay people to leave positive reviews on major seller sites to boost sales. In fact, Amazon just sued more than 1,000 people who were paid to post fake five-star reviews on products.<br><br>Even legitimate reviews might be unhelpful. Maybe the reviewer went overboard with unwarranted praise or criticism. You don't want to base your purchasing decision on faulty information. We're going to look at how you can tell the difference between a real, helpful review and a fake or unhelpful one.<br><br>Before we go into the signs, however, there's one general rule I need to mention. You should never base a buying decision off of only one online review, whether it's positive or negative.<br><br>Look around the shopping site you're on, and other shopping sites or online sources, for more reviews. Additional reviews will help you get a picture of what the product is really like. Also, don't just go by star ratings because every reviewer has different things they consider pros and cons.<br><br>Here's an example: Looking at reviews for a printer recently, some people gave it five stars and mentioned that it used ink a little fast but print quality was great. Other people gave it one star and said print quality was great but it burned through ink. It's the same information from completely different viewpoints. So, don't just skim.<br><br>OK, now for the signs of fake or unhelpful reviews.<br><br>Facts are important in a review. When you're writing your own reviews, staying factual can protect you from a lawsuit. However, factual tips are also more useful for everyone.<br><br>If you see a string of reviews that are heavy on the adjectives ("Amazing!" "Fantastic!" "Life-changing!") and light on facts, skip them. You're looking for reviews that tell you what specific features the reviewer found that make it a good, or bad, product.<br><br>In fact, it often saves time to skip 5-star reviews and look at the 4-star and 1-star reviews to see what negatives people mention. Again, however, any negatives need to be backed up with facts. "It was terrible" tells you a lot less than, "It worked fine for three weeks and then the power button fell off."<br><br>On the other end of the spectrum, you might find reviews that have too many facts with no conclusions. It might just be a list of product features with no information about how the product impacted the reviewer. That's a sign the reviewer is just copying the features list and possibly doesn't actually own the product.<br><br>Amazon does have a "verified purchase" tag on some reviews to show that the person did in fact buy the product. Be sure to look for that when you're considering reviews on Amazon.<br><br>There have been plenty of times I've been researching a product and started noticing a similarity in the reviews across several websites. In one case, nearly every review was posted on the same day. That's certainly a red flag, and the fact that none of the reviews was very factual was just the icing.<br><br>For another product, every positive review I found online was the same exact review. The author's name was even the same on every site. That's not a coincidence, that's just plain lazy on some marketer's part.<br><br>Reading through a string of reviews on Amazon, you might notice a whole collection that uses similar word groupings and writing style. That's usually a warning flag as well. It means the reviewers are either copying the manufacturer's information or the same person wrote them all.<br><br>Watch out for product reviews from new accounts or new websites. True, the person might have created the account just to buy that product, but some of the reviews should be from long-time members of the site.<br><br>Most shopping sites, such as Amazon, let you see the profile of the person leaving the review. That way, you can see what they've reviewed in the past. Find out what your Amazon profile reveals about you and how to take control of it.<br><br>You might find the person has reviewed hundreds of widely dissimilar products, which gives them a more credibility than someone who's only reviewed a few items from the same manufacturer. It helps, too, if some of those reviews had factual criticisms.<br><br>The only thing worse than tons of suspicious reviews is very few reviews. You're left with no way to make comparisons. At that point, every review becomes suspicious, especially if they only appear in out-of-the-way blogs and websites.<br><br>For example, there might be a "too-good-to-be-true" tech product for sale that doesn't have a review, or even a mention, on any reputable tech site. Or you might have to visit page 10 of Google's search results to even find a review of the product you're after.<br><br>In those cases, give it a miss. You're better off buying a competitor that has more reviews, or just not buying that type of product entirely.<br><br>On the Kim Komando Show, the nation's largest weekend radio talk show, Kim takes calls and dispenses advice on today's digital lifestyle, from smartphones and tablets to online privacy and data hacks. For her daily tips, free newsletters and more, visit her website at Komando.com. Email her at techcomments@usatoday.com.
SAN FRANCISCO&nbsp;&nbsp;Twitter's senior vice president of engineering&nbsp;Alex Roetter has&nbsp;pledged "faster progress" after an African American engineer publicly criticized the&nbsp;company's&nbsp;efforts to advance diversity.<br><br>The social media service&nbsp;gave voice to the&nbsp;Ferguson protests&nbsp;and empowered the Black Lives Matter&nbsp;movement, yet the company&nbsp;has a bleak&nbsp;record of hiring and retaining African Americans and Hispanics.<br><br>Leslie Miley, an engineering manager laid off last month when the company cut 8% of its workforce, blasted Twitter for its&nbsp;lack of diversity and inclusive work culture&nbsp;in a&nbsp;Medium post&nbsp;this week.&nbsp;Miley&nbsp;wrote&nbsp;that a "particularly low moment" came when Twitter's&nbsp;engineering chief told him:&nbsp;"Diversity&nbsp;is important, but we won't lower the bar."<br><br>He also said the engineering chief proposed classifying&nbsp;the ethnicity of potential job candidates by last name.<br><br>Miley did not name Roetter. But in his response, Roetter acknowledged that Miley was referring to him.<br><br>"I want Twitter to be a place where all employees feel comfortable raising questions about diversity," Roetter wrote. "That hasnt always been the case, which is unacceptable. The comments attributed to me arent an accurate or complete facsimile, but they conveyed a meaning that was very far from what I intended, which means I did a poor job communicating. That resulted in unnecessary pain and confusion, for which I am truly sorry. We all want the same results  stronger representation of underrepresented minorities at all levels within Twitter."<br><br>Miley, who declined to sign a non-disparagement agreement so he could speak publicly about his experiences at Twitter, did not have an immediate comment. But he responded to Roetter on Medium: "Thank you for this well thought out post. I applaud Twitter for always striving to be a better place."<br><br>Miley's criticism of Twitter's track record on diversity struck a national nerve, generating headlines and&nbsp;drawing&nbsp;renewed scrutiny of the social media service.<br><br>Blacks, Hispanics and Asian-Americans account for 41% of U.S. users, making Twitter more racially diverse than any other social network, including Facebook. As a publicly traded company, Twitter has capitalized on the diversity of its users to attract advertising from major brands that want to target those groups.<br><br>Twitter is especially popular among African-Americans. More than a quarter of black Internet users&nbsp;in the U.S. are on Twitter, a rate higher than other ethnic groups, according to a 2013 study by the&nbsp;Pew Research Center. And "Black Twitter"  the flow of conversation about issues that matter to this online community  has become a cultural force capable of influencing the national dialogue and the course of events.<br><br>Yet African Americans make up a tiny percentage of Twitter's U.S. workforce. And, according to Twitter's most recent diversity figures, the company&nbsp;no longer has any underrepresented minorities in leadership roles in the USA, a decline from 4% last year.<br><br>In August, Twitter publicly announced those goals which include increasing the percentage of its staffers who are underrepresented minorities to 11%, the number of minorities in tech roles to 9% and leadership roles to 6% in 2016.<br><br>Rev. Jesse Jackson told USA TODAY on Wednesday he has "grave concerns" that the recent layoffs at Twitter disproportionately affected African&nbsp;Americans and Hispanics, and he has asked CEO&nbsp;Jack Dorsey to publicly release "a specific accounting."<br><br>"Ive learned a lot this week," Roetter wrote. "We as a company are working to address our blind spots swiftly to build a Twitter that will make our employees and people who use our services proud."
<p>As a part of the World Entrepreneurship Forum (WEnF) 2015, the second Lions Den, an entrepreneurship challenge, was successfully held in Hangzhou on Oct 21, 2015. </p><p>Four challengers pitched their business plans in an exhilarating five-minute, demonstrating their market acumen. After a global search and strict selection, Wei Wei, founder of Global Solutions Localized and Professor Mark Greeven, in collaboration with the Four Lions, have selected four promising young ventures. These four entrepreneurs all aim to offer solutions to industrial or social problems and satisfy consumer needs, including energy saving, construction management, diet management and safety of bus transportation. The Four Lions this year include Baybars Altuntas, the deputy of EBAN (European Business Angel Network) and serial entrepreneur, Paulo Andrez, honorary president of EBAN and serial business angel, Cheng Houbo, founder of Shenzhen Oriental Fortune Capital and Forbes China best investor for consecutive years, and Manoj Sharma, CEO of Singapore Action Community for Entrepreneurship. The Lions proposed critical questions and provided pragmatic recommendations for challengers.</p><p>Ted, the first challenger and the founder of Evercomm from Singapore, stressed the complexity in energy consumption management in factories and large campuses, and provides solutions that can help managers to make decisions to save energy cost based on the real-time data. Ted also told the investors that his main purpose in Lions Den is to seek network rather than funding. This is one fantastic example for other entrepreneurs said judge Paulo Andrez, commending on Teds emphasis on networking and expanding of the market rather than just begging for money to burn..</p><p>African entrepreneur Sidy Kebe aims to provide a B2B platform, connecting constructers with global suppliers, in consideration that it has been uneasy for African constructers to purchase and import appropriate materials and equipment. He exhibited the core competitiveness of his venture in terms of existing relations and experience while the judges were looking for first achievements and some real revenues and profits.</p><p>Apart from business ideas related to heavy industry, entrepreneurs also focus on daily life and social well-being. As a local entrepreneur, Zhang Kingsun offered Tao Tie, a device made of magnets to turn the ordinary refrigerator into a smart one. With some simple clicks, the magnetic devices can track food consumption and inform users with a real-time cooking guide and nutrient analysis. As interesting as the idea is, judges challenged him with the plans feasibility and potential market size. Kingsun, nevertheless, showed prowess and is determined to make it happen, if only for solving his own daily refrigerator stocking problems.</p><p>Malaysian entrepreneur Shi Jin aims to make public transport safer. His APP Traquer tracks buses and prevents road accidents. Judges critiqued that the APP is more socially influential than profitable and such comments put every participant in the forum to ponder how a social enterprise project make a profit.</p><p>                </p><p>In the end of the Challenge, Manoj Sharma shared with challengers his seven criteria he uses when considering if a business plan is worth investing, i.e. the idea, market size, expertise, team, revenue, competitive advantage and the potential to innovate the business model. Paulo Andrez encourage more women to participate in the challenge and called for women Lion in the next Lion Den. Even though all the ventures are winners, only one can be the real winner. Both the Lions and the deciding public voted for Ted with his venture Evercomm. Now let the market decide.</p>
