<p><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/b433a434-f422-4c1a-adf3-15139cdfae53/ScreenShot20151030at20819PM.png" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/b433a434-f422-4c1a-adf3-15139cdfae53/ScreenShot20151030at20819PM.png"><br></p><p><br></p>
New York City police are searching for the gunman who shot three men Monday -- one fatally -- outside a midtown subway station.<br><br>The victims, who are each in their 40s,&nbsp; had been drinking coffee in a McDonald's when the heavy-set gunman in a black-hooded sweatshirt spoke with them, Robert Boyce, city chief of detectives told reporters, according to The Associated Press.<br><br>The gunman then followed the three victims to a nearby subway station with an entrance at 35th Street and Eighth Avenue, about two blocks from busy Penn Station, Boyce said.<br><br>The nature of the dispute is being investigated now, Boyce told reporters outside the subway station.<br><br>The wounded were rushed to Bellevue Hospital, police said.<br><br>Several streets were closed and some bus lines rerouted while police investigated at the scene, "Street closures in the area of 35 St. &amp; 8th Ave in Manhattan due to police investigation. Use alternate routes," police warned commuters in tweet.<br><br>The shooting took place at about 6:14&nbsp;a.m. a block from where three subway lines meet. "Individuals were heard having a dispute prior to shooting. 3 males were shot in subway station &amp; we are looking for 1 shooter &amp; 2 other men," police tweeted.<br><br>The Daily News,&nbsp;citing police, said a 43-year-old man died in the shooting. The victim was Angel Quinones, AP reported, based on unnamed source in the police department.<br><br>A&nbsp;45-year-old man was shot in the neck and abdomen and was&nbsp;and critically injured, and a 48-year-old man was wounded in the leg, the Daily News reported. Three men&nbsp;were seen fleeing the scene, possibly in a silver vehicle,&nbsp;the newspaper's website reported. William Lamboy was critically injured and Eddy Torres was wounded, AP reported.<br><br>Two of the victims attend a nearby methadone program at the West Midtown Medical Group, AP reported, citing friends of the victims.<br><br>This kind of thing doesnt happen over here, Michael Gessow, 39, of the Bronx, who said he has been coming to the clinic for 10 years, told AP. They were real nice guys, straight guys. I cant believe it.
<p><i>Named the 2016 Beneficiary of Americas Future Series and Opens an Internal Veterans Service Organization (VSO) Resource Center</i></p><p>DALLAS, TX (Nov. 9, 2015)  <a href="http://www.transformanceusa.org" target="_blank">Transformance, Inc.</a>, formerly Consumer Credit Counseling Service (CCCS) of Greater Dallas, has announced plans to expand and extend their financial literacy outreach programs to U.S. veterans. Transformance was named the 2016 nonprofit beneficiary of the Americas Future Series. Americas Future Series is a nonpartisan organization that hosts numerous annual events featuring prominent business, military, government and educational thought leaders. Their intent is to elevate awareness and dialogue on the issues affecting the stature of the United States global competitiveness in the key areas of health care, energy, education, the economy, the environment, national security, cybersecurity and technology/innovation.<br></p><p>Rich Lakers, CEO of Americas Future Series, said, We fully support the vision of Transformance to foster financially accountable and sustainable communities across America through its transformational learning systems. To date, AFS has raised over $2,000,000 for causes worldwide. Transformance, Inc. and Americas Future Series have entered into a multiple-year agreement for 2016 and beyond.<br></p><p>In addition, Transformance opened an internal veteran service organization (VSO) resource center by welcoming two other VSOs to their nonprofit headquarters in Dallas. Joining Americas Future Series is the Veterans Coalition of North Central Texas (VCNCT) and Grace After Fire, each of whom will have their own presence at Transformances headquarters to expand their specific veteran outreach efforts. The aim of the VCNCT is to assist veterans and their families efforts to reintegrate back into society through opportunities related to education, employment, financial literacy, housing and mental health services. Grace After Fire is dedicated to empowering female veterans self-knowledge and self-renewal by connecting them with key resources to transition back into family life, workplace and the pursuit of happiness.<br></p><p>Unfortunately for our U.S. military veterans, statistics show troubling patterns in the lack of financial literacy. According to the 2013 FINRA Investor Education Foundations National Financial Capability Study, 42 percent have no rainy day fund, 18 percent have no retirement account, 35 percent utilize nonbank borrowing and 55 percent got three or fewer answers correct on a simple financial literacy survey.<br></p><p>We are pleased to open our facilities to all three of these honorable institutions, said Ken Goodgames, president and CEO of Transformance. The co-location of these veteran-serving organizations will serve to dramatically increase our outreach to vulnerable military and veteran families in the Dallas-Ft. Worth area, many of whom often need assistance with opportunities related to financial literacy and economic empowerment.<br></p><p>To find out how your organization or nonprofit can team up with Transformance and become a part of the financial literacy solution, call (800) 249-2227 or visit <a href="http://www.transformanceusa.org">www.transformanceusa.org</a>.<br></p><p>###<br></p><p><b>About Transformance, Inc.</b><br></p><p>In 2015, the agency will have delivered more than 125,000 consumer interactions through financial counseling, outreach, and education. &nbsp;In 2016, the agency expects to serve up to 1 million low and moderate income families with transformative financial learning solutions accessible on-line and through a new mobile app.</p><p>Since its founding in 1974 as Consumer Credit Counseling Service of Greater Dallas, the agency has empowered clients to overcome adversity and attain their financial goals. &nbsp;Services include credit/budget counseling; financial education; housing counseling; individual debt management and bankruptcy counseling. Transformance will: &nbsp;<br></p><p>	Provide a national non-profit resource dedicated to confidential and professional counseling to assist financially distressed or economically vulnerable families<br></p><p>	Develop and foster community educational programs on family money management, budgeting and the wise use of money and credit</p><p>	Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with the credit community, employee assistance programs, professional counselors and community-based social service agencies</p><p>	Provide opportunities for economic empowerment of low and moderate income families and with a particular focus on at-risk communities such as seniors, military families, veterans, communities of color and single, female-headed households</p><p>	Enable good financial knowledge early in life through its focus on education of students (K -12) and their parents through agency strategic partnerships</p><p>Transformance, Inc., is a 501c (3) nonprofit founded in 1974, and is a United Way Service Provider as well as a HUD-approved multi-state housing counseling and education organization. &nbsp;The agency is formally accredited every four years by the Council on Accreditation for Children and Families (COA) to ensure compliance with top industry standards and best practices. &nbsp;The agency has its headquarters in Dallas, TX, with satellite offices in Arlington, Amarillo, Ardmore, OK, and Colorado Springs, CO.<br></p><p>To read more about Transformance, Inc., or for an annual report, visit <a href="http://www.transformanceusa.org" title="Link: http://www.transformanceusa.org">http://www.transformanceusa.org</a>.<br></p><p><b>About Americas Future Series</b></p><p>Americas Future Series (AFS) is a nonpartisan organization that hosts events featuring prominent business, military, government, educational and other thought leaders with the intent of raising awareness and encouraging dialogue on issues affecting U.S. Global Competitiveness, including health care, energy, education, the economy, the environment, national security, cyber security and technology/innovation.</p><p>All AFS events honor military, support worthy causes and focus on issues critical to improving our nations future. Military Family and Veteran Employment Roundtables and Hiring Events help put veterans to work and improve corporate America's ability to find, attract, assess, hire, onboard, mentor and retain those who have served.<br></p><p><b>About Veterans Coalition of North Central Texas</b><br></p><p>The mission of the Veterans Coalition of North Central Texas (VCNCT) is to build bridges between public, private and not-for-profit organizations at the local, county, state and federal levels for all our veterans and their families by rebuilding, educating and equipping all veterans to reintegrate back into society and to bring awareness and a call to action to all communities about the challenges faced by veterans and their families.</p><p>Key initiatives include education, employment, financial literacy, housing and mental health. Nekima Horton is the board chair of VCNCT. See <a href="http://www.vcnct.org">www.vcnct.org</a> for additional information.<br></p><p><b>About Grace After Fire</b><br></p><p>The mission of Grace After Fire is to provide the means for women veterans to gain self-knowledge and self-renewal. The agency was established to protect the female veteran, connect the resources and renew the women  essentially to help women veterans help themselves.</p><p>Grace After Fire is continuing to expand its program offerings through teaching, developing and listening to the woman veteran and her needs upon returning home. The agency assists in the often difficult transition back into family life, achievements in the workplace and the pursuit of happiness.<br></p><p>Board Chair Tandy Ervin is based in Dallas, Texas, and CEO Mea Williams is based in Houston, Texas. The agency currently serves clients in three states on a direct basis and through affiliates. See <a href="http://www.graceafterfire.org">www.graceafterfire.org</a> for additional information.<br></p><p><b>Contact:</b><br></p><p>Jeffrey Cheatham<br>TrizCom PR<br>(972) 247-1369<br>jeffc@trizcom.com</p><div><br></div>
<p><b>The Effects of BioEsse® Topical Probiotics For&nbsp;MedSpa&nbsp;</b><b>Skin Laser and Re-Surfacing Treatment Recovery</b></p><p>[November 8, 2015  Sarasota, Florida] &nbsp;Best results with skin resurfacing depend on skin recovery. &nbsp;Probiotics for the skin are a crucial element of this process.  Billions of healthy bacteria normally living on skin support skin healthy and therefore, skin recovery from resurfacing procedures.  But these microbes, called our skin microbiome, are impacted by skin resurfacing techniques, and can be neglected, or even harmed, by common skin care products.</p><p><a href="http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com" title="Link: http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com">BioEsse<b>®</b></a>.  <a href="http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com" title="Link: http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com">BioEsse<b>®</b></a>&nbsp;contains a powerful probiotic concentrate for the skin called BellaCell<b>®</b>,<b>&nbsp;</b>which supports healthy skin through balancing the skin microbiome. &nbsp;Research at Quorum Innovations -- where <a href="http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com" title="Link: http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com">BioEsse<b>®</b></a>&nbsp;was developed -- showed that a healthy skin microbiome supports optimal skin health, healing and appearance. &nbsp;With its patent-pending probiotic FilaggRenew<b>®</b>&nbsp;Technology, <a href="http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com">BioEsse<b>®</b></a>&nbsp;supports a balanced skin microbiome, healthy levels of the skin protein filaggrin, normal skin immunity, and a strong skin barrier for best defense against outside elements. &nbsp;All of these components are important for good post-resurfacing skin results.</p><p><b><a href="http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com">BioEsse®</a></b> is all about skin probiotics, say <b><a href="http://www.bioesseprobiotics.com">BioEsse®</a></b> physician co-founders, allergist-immunologist Dr. Eva Berkes, and oculofacial plastic surgeon Dr. Nick Monsul. &nbsp; &nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;<a href="http://www.BioEsseProbiotics.com" title="Link: http://www.BioEsseProbiotics.com">www.BioEsseProbiotics.com</a></p><p><a href="http://www.QuorumInnovations.com" title="Link: http://www.QuorumInnovations.com">www.QuorumInnovations.com</a></p>
<p><a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9j">SocialCentiv</a>, whose marketing software helps companies find customers on Twitter, is helping retailers spend less money to reach more holiday shoppers  right at the moment theyre looking for that perfect gift or party venue.</p><p>As we head into the 2015 gift-buying rush, retailers and restaurants are facing a paradox, says Bernard Perrine, co-founder and CEO of SocialCentiv. While this is shaping up to be a robust period for doing business, stores and eateries alike are struggling to find and retain customers.<br></p><p>SocialCentivs technology service, which helps businesses find Tweets in real time from prospective customers who are ready to buy their products or services, can dramatically lower the cost of finding clientele.<br></p><p>As we have previously <a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9l">demonstrated</a>, restaurants and dining spots pay an average of $1.83 per click when using our service, a savings of 71 percent compared to the average of $6.49 they must shell out on Google AdWords, Perrine says. Retailers see an average cost per click of $2.59 with us, a 53 percent reduction from the average of $5.54 they will spend on Google AdWords.<br></p><p>For the retail and restaurant industries, where profit margins can sometimes be challenging, SocialCentivs service provides the Holy Grail that a marketing tool should deliver. We give a measurable return on investment, he says.<br></p><p><b>SocialCentiv helps one retailer sell party dresses</b><br></p><p>One local dress designer and retailer uses SocialCentiv to sell party dresses and bridal gowns. In September alone, its campaign generated 6,585 impressions1, 1,091 engagements2 and experienced a 60 percent click through rate.</p><p>How it worked: SocialCentivs software searched designated geographic locations for keywords like dress, gown, homecoming 2015 and hoco. Relevant Tweets received a personalized @ reply with a link directly to the website.<br></p><p>SocialCentiv has helped clients target hyper local customers where their stores are, says Perrine. By looking for Tweets where potential customers specifically mentioned a dance or fancy party, we were able to put their product directly in front of them and offer so many styles it was easy to choose one!<br></p><p><b>Good times, difficult obstacles</b><br></p><p>While economic conditions may not be perfect heading into the holidays, late November and the month of December are looking like prime selling times, experts say.</p><p>The National Retail Federation is <a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9n">expecting</a> the post-Thanksgiving period to bring in a robust $630.5 billion for the industry, or about 19 percent of its 2015 revenue.<br></p><p>The trade group believes retailers revenue from this holiday period will rise 3.7 percent compared to the 2014 holiday season  well above the 10-year average of 2.5 percent.<br></p><p>Similarly, the National Restaurant Association has <a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9q">forecast</a> that eateries will bring in a record $709.2 billion in sales this year.<br></p><p><b>About SocialCentiv</b><br></p><p>SocialCentiv is a full-service Twitter marketing company that helps companies find new customers on Twitter with their patented software. Using a business keywords and geographic location, SocialCentiv combs Twitter in real time looking for relevant Tweets that express an intent to purchase a product or service. The business can @ reply directly back to potential customers with a customized, personal message and a discount or offer to get them in the door. For example, @JaneDoe Tweets about being really hungry for pizza. A local pizza parlor finds her Tweet using SocialCentiv, and Tweets directly back with a personal message and a coupon for free salad and soda with her pizza at lunch. SocialCentiv has a 34 percent average click through rate, and some industries  like restaurants, hotels and sports marketing  have much higher averages.</p><p>Since May 2013, SocialCentiv has received $12 million in funding. For more information, go to <a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9j">www.SocialCentiv.com</a>, like us on <a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9s">Facebook</a> and follow us on <a href="http://go.socialcentiv.com/l/108792/2015-11-06/gt9v">Twitter</a>.<br></p><p># # #<br></p><p>1. Impressions = number of times a user is served a Tweet in timeline or search results<br></p><p>2. Engagements = number of times a user interacted with a Tweet</p><p>For more information, contact Karen Carrera, TrizCom, 972-207-1935, <a href="mailto:karen@trizcom.com">karen@trizcom.com</a> or @kjcarrera.<br></p>
<p><i>Company adds new Vice Presidents of Sales, EMEA, and Vice President of Sales, Americas, to drive sustained growth</i><br></p><p><b>Billerica, Mass., and London, (November 11, 2015) </b> <a href="http://www.oncamgrandeye.com" title="Link: http://www.oncamgrandeye.com">Oncam</a>, the leading provider of 360-degree technology, announced today it has expanded its global market strategy in response to increased demand for the companys suite of 360-degree IP camera technologies and added key leaders to its executive team to address continued growth.</p><p>A leader in the development of 360-degree video technology, Oncam has made significant investments in strong leadership to propel both geographic market reach and product development. Oncams product portfolio is valuable in a wide range of security and business optimization applications, including those found in critical infrastructure, Safe Cities, retail, transportation, education, maritime, banking, gaming and enterprise markets.</p><p>In the last year, Oncam has experienced significant progress in expanding sales efforts and brand recognition across the globe, as evidenced by increased recognition in key vertical markets, said Adrian Marsh, Chief Operating Officer, Oncam. As the deployment of high-resolution, multi-megapixel cameras has expanded, Oncam is proud to be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge, 360-degree video technology and incorporating next-level analytics that use video as a powerful management and information tool.</p><p>Ian Compton has been named Vice President of Sales, EMEA, and will report to the companys Chief Operating Officer, leading the sales teams in delivering business-led value propositions to end-user clients via Oncams channel partners. Compton also will be responsible for driving Oncams presence in the region.</p><p>I am excited to contribute and play a leading role in elevating the companys overall sales strategy in EMEA to the next level, building key relationships with our valued partners and navigating trends in the security market, as well as the wider technology field, Compton said. Compton recently served as International Sales Director within ASSA ABLOY EMEA, where he developed and lead commercial activities of the access control business within the region.</p><p>Additionally, David Wedel has been named Vice President of Sales for Oncams Americas division, and in this role, will lead the sales team in the Americas in driving market penetration, lead development and partner engagement initiatives. Wedel brings a wealth of experience to Oncam, having worked for both industry leaders and emerging technology providers.&nbsp;</p><p>Businesses of all types can greatly benefit from incorporating 360-degree technology, driving further value while enhancing security initiatives, and Oncam continues to lead the way with the best user experience in the industry, Wedel said. Wedel has more than 25 years of experience in physical security, networking technology and integrated solutions sales and marketing.</p><p><b>About Oncam </b></p><p>Oncam is part of Oncam Technologies and was founded in 2007. Oncam is an independent, specialized IP video and technology company with a reputation for being one of the most innovative firms in todays market. Oncam designs, delivers and deploys IP video solutions  working with partners to deliver high-value business solutions for customers, that leverage Oncams award-winning 360-degree cameras and other technologies.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>                                                           </p><p>From regional hubs in the U.K., United States, Turkey, South East Asia, UAE and India, Oncam provides security and technology solutions to customers in many countries around the world and is recognized as the global industry leader in total situational awareness. For more information, visit <a href="http://www.oncamgrandeye.com">www.oncamgrandeye.com</a>. </p>
<p>               <b>Outstanding Women of Today Award Honors Achievements Helping Families with Children Battling Cancer </b><br></p><p>Altrusa International of Richardson Foundation honored Larissa Linton of Heroes for Children with the Outstanding Women Award in the nonprofit category at their annual Outstanding Women of Today... Builders of Tomorrow Luncheon held Oct. 30.</p><p>It is such an honor to be recognized by the strong women of Altrusa for this distinguished award, Larissa said. We work very hard to help families across the state of Texas who have a child battling cancer, but to know that our work is being recognized here in our backyard is gratifying.</p><p><b></b></p><p>Larissa received the award in honor of her achievements as co-founder and executive director of the Richardson-based nonprofit that provides social and financial assistance to families across the state of Texas whose children are battling cancer. Under her leadership, Heroes for Children has served more than 4,200 families with more than $5.5 million in financial assistance  helping families pay their rent, utility bills or out of pocket expenses like gas to and from the hospital, meals, child care and so much more.</p><p>To achieve the nonprofits vision that no family with a child battling cancer will fight alone  Larissa has organized a multitude of events and programs including:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Heroes and Handbags</b> luxury handbag auction and luncheon hosted each spring in Dallas and Houston</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Golf tournament</b> hosted every spring or summer in the Dallas area</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; <b>Heart of Gold 5K and Fun Run</b> hosted in the Dallas area each September in honor of National Childhood Cancer Awareness Month</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Holdem for Heroes poker tournament </b>hosted each fall in Austin, Dallas and Houston</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Movie Day</b> treats families served by Heroes for Children to a day at the movies  including fun-filled games, prizes and sweet treats.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Holiday Heroes</b> offers full holiday joy to the families it serves throughout the year. Each holiday season, social workers choose families in need from hospitals served by Heroes for Children across the state of Texas. Families selected for the program are adopted and receive gifts for the entire family.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Laptops for Love</b> donates new laptops to teenagers battling cancer. This unique program provides teens with a link to the outside world while undergoing cancer treatment and allows them to keep up with their schoolwork while away from the classroom.</p><p>The year 2015 has proven to be a successful year for Heroes for Children. Heroes celebrated 10 years of service at the signature fundraising event Heroes and Handbags, hosted in Dallas and Houston and raising more than $675,000 for Heroes for Children. To find out how to get involved with events like this and more information about Heroes for Children, please visit <a href="http://www.heroesforchildren.org">http://www.heroesforchildren.org</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Heroes for Children</b></p><p>Heroes for Children is a unique nonprofit organization that provides social and financial assistance to families with a child battling cancer. Since 2005, Heroes for Children has helped alleviate families worries, giving them comfort and a brief respite from the everyday challenges of fighting cancer and care giving. Since its inception, more than $5.5 million has been given to 4,200 families in need. To learn more about Heroes for Children, please visit <a href="http://www.heroesforchildren.org">http://www.heroesforchildren.org</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Altrusa Outstanding Women of Today Award</b></p><p>The Outstanding Women of Today Award is a distinguished honor for professional accomplishments. Women are nominated for exemplifying determination, innovation and making an outstanding contribution in their careers. They are recognized and applauded for making a difference for the future of women and providing leadership in their fields. Companies, organizations and individuals may nominate women in one of six categories: small business (fewer than 50 employees), education, government, nonprofit, corporate and Outstanding Woman of Tomorrow (a woman 35 years of age or younger, in any of the above fields). All nominees are honored at the Annual Outstanding Women of Today Luncheon and Awards Presentation. On average, more than 300 community leaders attend the luncheon. For more information, please visit <a href="http://www.altrusarichardson.com/Outstanding-Women" title="Link: http://www.altrusarichardson.com/Outstanding-Women">http://www.altrusarichardson.com/Outstanding-Women</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Contact:</b></p><p>Katie Mudd</p><p>TrizCom Public Relations</p><p>972-247-1369</p><p>214-676-4254</p><p>                                                                                  </p><p><a href="mailto:Katie@TrizCom.com">Katie@TrizCom.com</a></p>

Studies show that cellular radiation and wi-fi emissions are reducing sperm count by up to half as well as sperm motility and viability by up to a third. Additionally over half of the remaining sperm experience abnormal DNA structure and morphology. There is also increasing evidence that wireless device radiation has toxic genetic effects on nearby cells, which could potentially increase the risk of testicular cancer.</p> <p>Confronting this frightening reality, CEO and co-founder Arthur Menard is passionate and determined to bring Spartan Boxer Briefs to the public market. <p>PLANO, TEXAS (November 12, 2015) <a href="http://legacyer.com/">Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care</a>, one of the nations first hybrid health care models offering both urgent care and emergency room treatment options under one roof, has opened multiple locations including one in North Richland Hills at 8950 N. Tarrant Parkway, North Richland Hills, Texas. Legacy is headquartered in Plano with seven health care centers in Allen, Coppell, Frisco, Keller and McKinney. The North Richland Hills location is the only facility of its kind in the city.</p><p>Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care is planning a ribbon cutting ceremony with the <a href="http://www.netarrant.org/">Northeast Tarrant County Chamber of Commerce</a> on November 18th followed by a luncheon honoring the citys first responders. In addition, Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care will present <a href="https://www.nrhtx.com/index.aspx?nid=270">the North Richland Hills Police Department</a>, <a href="https://www.nrhtx.com/index.aspx?NID=157">North Richland Hills Fire Department</a> with donation checks. The event will conclude with a buffet lunch and tours of the hybrid health care facility.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>We want to give the community the opportunity to explore our hybrid heath care model. North Richland Hills residents wont have to choose between a stand-alone ER or an urgent care facility. With Legacy, theyll have the best of both worlds  top-rated, board-certified, emergency-trained physicians; state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment; and an only pay-for-the-care-you-need, in-network billing system, stated Keith Miller, president of Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care.</p><p>Urgent care hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily, and ER services are accessible 24-7, 365 days a year. The typical wait time before being seen is less than five minutes. Online check-in is available and walk-ins are welcomed.</p><p>Founded in 2008, Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care is one of the nations first health care models to offer both urgent care and emergency room treatment options under one roof. It has built an exceptional customer service program and rating by providing transparent billing, soothing environments and one-on-one service with board-certified, emergency-trained physicians. Patients have access to immediate, on-site emergency room equipment and only pay emergency care prices when it is truly an emergency. For more information, visit <a href="http://legacyer.com/">http://legacyer.com/.</a></p><p>?????????????????????###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Media Contact:</b></p><p>Dana Cobb</p><p>TrizCom Public Relations </p><p>972-955-9747</p><p>                              </p><p>dana@trizcom.com</p>

Black Friday has become synonymous in our minds with great deals. Often, the deals are impressive as businesses compete for shoppers' attention and dollars. But theres a dirty little Black Friday secret.<br><br>Just because you're buying on Black Friday doesn't mean you're getting the biggest savings. You might do better buying before or after, depending on the product. But how do you know?<br><br>Every year, software giant Adobe uses its Adobe Marketing Cloud to crunch numbers and make predictions about the upcoming season. Adobe says that it's been accurate within about 2% every year so far. This year, it examined 55 million products from 4,500 retailers stretching back to 2008 and released an incredibly detailed report. So, what does it tell us?<br><br>According to Adobe, the Monday before Thanksgiving is generally the cheapest day for buying electronics, with an average discount of 18% across 17% of items. You can find bigger single-item discounts on products Thanksgiving Day and after, but you'll also see a lot more "out-of-stock" notices if you wait.<br><br>Be aware that around 76% of shoppers buy the same 1% of product makes and models, which are mostly electronics. So if you don't buy early, you might not get that popular item you had your eye on.<br><br>This year for electronics, Adobe says Apple gadgets should lead the sales in wearables (Apple Watch), online video streaming (Apple TV) and tablets (iPad). Want to know how these Apple products stack up to their competitors? Check out my handy product comparison charts.<br><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/6e13f7d3-d323-414d-bf28-68b949a63fac/ScreenShot20151030at20430PM.png" title="Image https3amazonawscomrobin8-productionrobin8-production6e13f7d3-d323-414d-bf28-68b949a63facScreenShot20151030at20430PMpng"><br>For video game consoles, the PlayStation 4 is going to be hot and Minecraft and Halo 5 are going to compete for the top video game.<br><br>If you're looking at 4K TVs, Adobe predicts most consumers will go for Sony over LG and Samsung. So, pay attention to the non-Sony brands for bigger discounts as retailers try to shift supply.<br><br>Thanksgiving weekend is a great time to check off some items from your family's Christmas wish lists. However, you might want to consider starting the weekend before Thanksgiving. While Cyber Monday traditionally has the cheapest toy prices, you'll get three times the out-of-stock notices. If you wait until the week before Christmas, that will double.<br><br>According to Adobe, the hottest toys this year are going to be: the remote control BB-8 droid from Star Wars: The Force Awakens,&nbsp;Barbie, American Girl dolls, Lego, Hot Wheels, the remote controlled R2-D2 toy, Razor scooters, and toys based on Disney's Frozen.&nbsp;If your child has their heart set on any of these, buying early would be wise.<br><br>Thinking of getting your significant other something sparkly for Christmas? Thanksgiving Day is the best day to buy jewelry. You should see discounts up to 25% across 20% of available items. You also shouldn't encounter many out-of-stock notices for the entire Thanksgiving weekend. Note that if you wait until December, you won't find better deals, and there will be a lot more items out of stock. So don't wait.<br><br>Clothing and other apparel items are one area where Black Friday and the surrounding shopping days don't matter as much. Thanksgiving Day will have the best savings in November with discounts of up to 27%. However, prices traditionally drop even more in December, with December 23 being the lowest. &nbsp;However, the out-of-stock risk on many products does go up as time passes.<br><br>Bonus: Some other interesting shopping facts for Black Friday<br><br>According to Adobe, deals generally start the Monday before Thanksgiving, so if you want to get a jump on shopping, go right ahead. Contrary to what you might think, Thanksgiving Day has the best deals, with Black Friday coming next, and prices increasing through Cyber Monday.<br><br>Still, Adobe expects U.S. consumers to spend $3 billion on Cyber Monday, with Black Friday coming in just behind at $2.7 billion. Thanksgiving Day shopping is also growing quickly with an expected $1.6 billion in sales, which is up 18% over last year. So, despite the growing number of retailers announcing that they're closed Thanksgiving, people will still be buying where they can, and many of them will do it online.<br><br>In fact, at least 51% of the shopping on Thanksgiving weekend will be done on mobile gadgets, which is the first time mobile shopping has crossed the 50% mark. However, Adobe finds that consumers think online shopping via mobile phone is also the most stressful way to shop thanks to the smaller screen and problems adding payment information. So, you might consider taking a tablet to your family gathering if you're planning to shop.<br><br>Also, if you do shop online, know that your best chance of finding deals is still through in-store displays. If you're looking for online deals, social media is the best place to find them, followed by promotional emails from the companies you like to shop at. Even if you're not signed up for a store's emails, you can look up promo codes for over 150,000 stores at various sites online.<br><br>On the Kim Komando Show, the nation's largest weekend radio talk show, Kim takes calls and dispenses advice on today's digital lifestyle, from smartphones and tablets to online privacy and data hacks. For her daily tips, free newsletters and more, visit her website at Komando.com. Email her at techcomments@usatoday.com.

<div>SPECIAL BULLETIN: CHRONIC ORTHOPEDIC/NEUROLOGICAL CONDITIONS AND THE GOLDEN YEARS &nbsp;<br><br>Many people find it exhilarating to close up the main house and go to to a warmer climate for winter each year. After years of planning &amp; preparation, they enjoying trading these cold, bitter months with restricted activity, for sunny, warm days full of outdoor activity. But few expect a CHRONIC PAIN CONDITION to come into their lives &amp; threaten this rousing scenario.</div><div><br></div><div>These statements may have applied in the past, but for many individuals who kept searching until they found an answer, they are no longer the case. Due to ongoing new developments in medicine and technology, these types of statements are not necessarily true in today's world:<br><br></div><div>&nbsp;#1 "The doctors have done all they can do. Patients just have to learn to live with it." (Not if the cause is uncovered &amp; minimized or eliminated.)<br>#2: "Because of aging, a body no longer has the ability to heal." (Modern scientific researchers say that the human body was remarkably designed to live 110-120 years, if taken care of properly.) <br>&nbsp;#3: "Medications &amp;/or injections correct the condition." &nbsp;(At best, they only manage or cover-up the symptoms, while the condition continues to degenerate or worsen.)<br>&nbsp;#4: "Only surgery will correct the problem &amp; so the doctor says to wait until it's unbearable." (It has been well documented that the success rates for surgery are not impressive &amp; often leave patients with disability, ranging from an automatic 5%/surgery, to as much as 50%.)<br><br>&nbsp;The main problem is, until now there has been no effective approach, to help doctors understand the underlying cause(s) of a patients' symptoms &amp; then, how to effectively reduce/eliminate them in situations like:<br>- orthopedic conditions such as : chronic neck &amp; back pain, arthritis, disc bulge, disc herniation, spinal stenosis, spondylolisthesis, failed back &amp; neck syndrome, <br>- neurological conditions such as: peripheral neuropathy (with abnormal nerve sensation in the extremities), radiating nerve pain (i.e. sciatica, neck/shoulder/arm pain, intercostal pain &amp; neck/cranial pain), as well as balance disorders, dizziness, headaches &amp; muscle weakness.<br><br>&nbsp;As a result, most doctors, (who are trained to treat ACUTE DISEASE CONDITIONS, with drugs &amp; surgery) have no other option but to treat these CHRONIC CONDITIONS same. &nbsp;These types of conditions are oftentimes better categorized as FUNCTIONAL CONDITIONS - conditions in which some body function has developed a imbalance &amp; complications, which develop into symptoms. &nbsp;If the CAUSE or CORE ISSUE is uncovered &amp; properly addressed, then the NORMAL FUNCTION is restored &amp; the symptoms are reduced or eliminated.<br><br>"The Gossett Factor" is a unique FUNCTIONAL APPROACH to examination &amp; treatment, based on Dr. T.K. Gossett's extensive post-graduate study in Orthopedics/Neurology/Functional Medicine, in addition to over 35 years of clinical practice experience, successfully treating CHRONIC-SEVERE CONDITIONS, which had not responded to traditional forms of treatment. <br><br>&nbsp;Here is a list of several common medications patients often turn to when they have a chronic orthopedic or neurological condition:<br><br>&nbsp;- OTC drugs - Aspirin, Tylenol, Advil, etc., or prescription drugs like:<br>&nbsp;-Codeine: for mild to moderately severe pain. <br>&nbsp;-Hydrocodone (Vicodin, Norco): for moderate to severe pain. Hydrocodone is the narcotic part of the drug; the non-narcotic part is acetaminophen. <br>&nbsp;-Hydromorphone (Dilaudid): for moderate to serve pain. Its delivered by injection and is available in extended-release form, for around-the-clock treatment. <br>&nbsp;-Meperidine (Demerol): for moderate to severe pain. <br>&nbsp;-Morphine (MS Contin): for moderate to severe pain. It acts on the central nervous system to relieve pain. Its available as extended-release capsules or tablets if you need it for a short time. <br>&nbsp;-Oxycodone (Oxycontin, Percocet, Percodan): for moderate to severe pain. Its prescribed for people needing pain medication around the clock for a long time.<br>&nbsp;-Lyrica/Gabapentin/Pregabalin/Carbamazepine: for the pain of peripheral neuropathy.<br><br>&nbsp;NOTE: Unfortunately, these drugs merely attempt to cover up, rather than treat the cause of patients' symptoms, so they have limited success &amp; often cause the patient to have a variety of harmful side effects - worse yet, the underlying condition continues to degenerate, without the patients' knowledge!<br><br>&nbsp;BASED ON NEW RESEARCH &amp; NEW TECHNOLOGY, THERE IS A BETTER WAY!!!<br><br>&nbsp;As stated above, Dr. T.K. <p></p><p><b>Los Angeles</b><b>, USA, November 16</b><b>, 2015</b> Priolite North America and Priolite GmbH, Germany, are proud to announce a new addition to the Priolite family of HotSync capable strobes, the 300Ws Li-Ion battery powered MBX300 HS.  </p><p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>Similar to the already available Priolite MBX500 HS, the MBX1000 HS, and the M-Pack1000 HS, the new MBX300 HS is able to synchronize its light output to select Nikon, Canon, and Pentax cameras with the help of the Priolite Hot Sync System at up to 1/8000th of a second1. Utilizing the entire range of possible shutter speeds, the Priolite Hot Sync System allows photographers to shoot with wide-open apertures in sunlit environments, freezing motion of fast moving objects, and enables them to create images difficult or impossible to capture before. The ability to remotely control high-powered battery operated studio strobes anywhere between 9Ws and up to 1000Ws per light2 with the Priolite Remote Control opens up endless possibilities for creatives all around the world. </p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>High-powered strobe photography at shutter speeds of up to 1/8000th of a second, combined with the ability to operate any of the Priolite Hot Sync strobes at any power setting and without the need for an outlet, truly represents a quantum leap forward for most owners of Canon, Nikon, and Pentax cameras, says Joachim Renschke, the CEO and founder of Priolite GmbH. By using the 2.4 GHz spectrum, the Priolite Remote Control supports 4 groups, 9 different IDs in each group, 1/10th of a stop power adjustments, and remote control of modeling lights wherever your next assignment might take you. Photographers now no longer have to rely on generators while on location, searching for outlets, or running wires when setting up their lights.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>With many of my assignments on location, I am excited about Priolites continuing development of their Hot Sync System, and in particular this new MBX300 HS. Being able to add some fill-light easily and without the need for a power outlet makes these smaller and lighter units ideal for professionals on the move. Whether you shoot weddings, events, or portraits, the new MBX300 HS is a powerful, portable and very affordable companion, and just like the MBX500 HS, the MBX1000 HS, or the M-Pack1000 HS, this strobe allows you to sync flashlight to your camera at up to 1/8000th of a second. The MBX500 HS is easy to carry, so I can fit two of them in a backpack with room for other equipment, and be on my way, says Alex Munoz, professional still and motion photographer from Los Angeles, California.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b><u>General Pricing and Availability</u></b></p>  <p>MBX 300 Hot Sync, SKU 01-0300-07, <b>MSRP $899.00 US</b></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b><u>Main Features</u></b></p>  <p>Support Flash Sync speed on many HSS enabled Canon, Nikon, and Pentax cameras up to 1/8000th of a second</p>  <p>Hot Sync works over the entire power range of the strobe from 9Ws up to 300Ws </p>  <p>Wirelessly trigger and control Priolite strobes with the Priolite Remote Control (2.4 GHz)</p>  <p>Control Priolite strobes in 4 groups with 9 device IDs individually; control modeling lights</p>  <p>Provide up to 300Ws per MBX300 HS with a maximum of 180 full-power flashes per charge</p>  <p>Li-Ion powered, no memory effect</p>  <p>Made in Germany with a 2 year US warranty</p>  <p><b>&nbsp;</b></p>  <p><b><u>Content</u></b></p>  <p>Product introduction <b><a href="http://www.priolite.us/mbx300-hotsync/">http://www.priolite.us/mbx300-hotsync/</a></b></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b><u>Contact</u></b></p>  <p>PRIOLITE North America</p>  <p>877.977.6922</p>  <p>hss@priolite.us</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b><u>Sales</u></b></p>  <p><a href="http://www.priolite.us">www.priolite.us</a></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>1 Depending on the maximum shutter speed of the camera</p>  <p>2 MBX1000HS is currently the most powerful single head, Hot Sync enabled Li-Ion powered strobe on the market</p>  <p></p><br>

WASHINGTON  At least 13&nbsp;governors say they will not accept Syrian refugees&nbsp;in their states in response to Friday's attacks in Paris.<br><br>The Republican governors  in Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Louisiana, Mississippi, Massachusetts,&nbsp;North Carolina, Ohio,&nbsp;Texas and Wisconsin  are concerned that resettlement could open the doors to terrorists.<br><br>"There may be those who will try to take advantage of the generosity of our country and the ability to move freely within our borders through this federal resettlement program, and we must ensure we are doing all we can to safeguard the security of Americans," Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker said.<br><br>In Louisiana, Gov. Bobby Jindal tweeted,&nbsp;"I just signed an Executive Order instructing state agencies to take all available steps to stop the relocation of Syrian refugees to LA."<br><br>At least 132 people were killed and hundreds&nbsp;injured in a series of attacks that took place around Paris on Friday evening. Several of the attackers have been identified as French citizens. According to French prosecutors, a bomber who targeted the national stadium was found with a Syrian passport.<br><br>The passport's discovery&nbsp;raised&nbsp;concerns that Islamic State militants&nbsp;may be&nbsp;crossing into Turkey before moving to&nbsp;Western Europe alongside the hundreds of thousands of refugees and migrants who have entered Europe this year, many of them fleeing the civil war in Syria.<br><br>In Michigan, Republican Gov. Rick Snyder said he is suspending his efforts encouraging resettlement of Syrian refugees in his state. But he he did not&nbsp;make any blanket statement on Monday that refugees would not be allowed into Michigan.<br><br>"Michigan is a welcoming state and we are proud of our rich history of immigration," Snyder said in the statement. "But our first priority is protecting the safety of our residents."<br><br>Comments that Snyder had made Sunday were widely viewed as an indication he would not allow Syrian refugees into the state.<br><br>About 20 Syrian refugees&nbsp;already in the pipeline for resettlement in the U.S.&nbsp;either recently arrived in Michigan or are expected to arrive soon, and Snyder said Monday he is not asking that they be stopped or vetted  leaders and refugee advocates argued&nbsp;the Department of Homeland Security already does extensive security checks before allowing any refugees into the U.S.<br><br>"The United States should be a safe haven," said Dr. Yahya Basha, a Syrian-American advocate from West Bloomfield, Mich.,&nbsp;who has family members who&nbsp;are refugees. He was at the White House recently to discuss the Syrian refugee crisis with U.S. officials:&nbsp;"We should welcome them."<br><br>Arkansas Gov. Asa Hutchinson issued&nbsp;a statement saying the plan to resettle Syrian refugees in the United States is "is not the right strategy."<br><br>Despite such reactions, President&nbsp;Obama is continuing with plans to accept refugees from Syria. Responding to calls to admit&nbsp;Christians but not Muslims into the country, he said, "Thats shameful. Thats not American, its not who we are."<br><br>"We dont have religious tests to our compassion," he said, speaking from the G20 summit in Antalya, Turkey.<br><br>But Texas Gov. Greg Abbott said in a letter to the president that,&nbsp;"Neither you nor any federal official can guarantee that Syrian refugees will not be part of any terroristic activity.&nbsp;As such, opening our door to them irresponsibly exposes our fellow Americans to unacceptable peril."<br><br>One refugee advocacy organization said the governors are setting themselves up for a discrimination lawsuit.<br><br>You cant restrict certain nationalities coming to your state, said Jen Smyers, director of policy and advocacy with the Immigration and Refugee Program at Church World Service.<br><br>Democratic Gov. Peter Shumlin of Vermont&nbsp;said Monday that governors who turn away Syrian refugees are stomping on American values.<br><br>Shumlin said he believes seven or eight refugees from Syria are being considered for placement through the&nbsp;Refugee Resettlement Program in Vermont, and he believes the state can take more.<br><br>Its the spirit of all Vermonters to ensure that when you have folks who are drowning, who are dying in pursuit of freedom, that Vermont does its part, Shumlin said.<br><br>Indiana&nbsp;Gov. Mike Pence issued a statement saying his state "has a long tradition of opening our arms and homes to refugees from around the world but, as governor, my first responsibility is to ensure the safety and security of all Hoosiers.. Unless and until the state of Indiana receives assurances that proper security measures are in place, this policy will remain in full force and effect.<br><br>Alabama Gov. Robert Bentley&nbsp;acknowledged Sunday there are no plans to settle refugees in his state, or credible terror threats directed at Alabama. But he issued a statement saying he would "not place Alabamians at even the slightest possible risk of an attack on our people."<br><br>Please continue to join me in praying for those who have suffered loss and those who will never allow freedom to fade at the hands of the terrorists, Bentley said.<br><br>According to the U.S. Census, 3.5% of Alabamas population in 2014 was born in a foreign country. The national average was 12.9%.<br><br>Bentley in 2011 signed a sweeping bill that attempted to criminalize undocumented immigrants living in the state. Most elements of the law have been struck down by the federal courts.<br><br>Bentley's statement said neighboring states had accepted Syrian refugees; Louisiana has accepted 14; Syrian refugees also have&nbsp;settled in Atlanta, Memphis and&nbsp;Nashville.<br><br>The civil war in Syria, which has raged since 2011, has killed 250,000 people and, according to the United Nations, sent more than 4 million refugees into other countries to flee the violence in what has been called the largest humanitarian crisis since World War II.<br><br>At least one Republican governor said he doesn't have the authority to keep out&nbsp;certain refugees.<br><br>Florida Gov. Rick Scott, in a letter to congressional leaders Monday, said organizations have asked his state to support the relocation of 425 possible Syrian refugees&nbsp;and he wants Congress to deny federal funding for that process.<br><br>"More importantly ... it is our understanding that the state does not have the authority to prevent the federal government from funding the relocation of these Syrian refugees to Florida even without state support," Scott wrote.<br><br>The vast majority of the refugees have gone to Europe or neighboring countries. The United States accepted 1,854 Syrian refugees through September; more than 10 times as many have been admitted from Myanmar. The Obama administration has indicated that it plans to increase that number to 100,000 by 2017, which human rights advocates call inadequate to address the depths of the crisis. The U.S. accepted at least 130,000 South Vietnamese refugees in the months after the fall of Saigon in 1975.

<p><b><i></i></b><i>Investors Seek Refuge in Precious Metals After Stocks Hit Hard</i><b></b></p><p><b><i>&nbsp;</i></b>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ADDISON, TX (Nov. 18, 2015)  Institutional and other high net worth investors in China, the world's largest producer and consumer of gold, turned to the metal as a safe haven this year as stocks fell, according to Dallas-based international wholesaler Dillon Gage Metals. After surging in recent years, Chinese equities suffered a sharp selloff this past summer, with the Shanghai Stock Exchange tumbling almost 40 percent in 10 weeks.</p><p>Because of China's market structure, weekly metal withdrawals from the Shanghai Gold Exchange (SGE) can be used to monitor the nation's demand, Terry Hanlon, president of Dillon Gage Metals, says. The SGE is a physical market, with no paper contracts, he explains. By law, all mined and imported gold in China must sell through the SGE. Gold purchases by the nation's end users, not including its central bank, pass through the SGE.</p><p>By mid-October, drawdowns in 2015 from the SGE totaled 2,062 tons, a sizable 33 percent above a year earlier.</p><p>Meanwhile, Chinese imports have been rising to supplement its mine production. In the past, gold imports typically came in through Hong Kong, but importers now bring the metal in from the UK, Switzerland and other countries. Since Shanghai opened new vaults in recent years, this gold enters the mainland through the SGE.</p><p>In July, China's central bank started reporting changes in its gold reserves after six years of keeping them quiet, Hanlon notes. The bank has been adding to reserves, and in September said its holdings stood at 1,693 tons. That makes China the fifth largest gold-holding nation.</p><p>The central bank of China has reasons for its new reporting transparency. China wants the yuan to be part of the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Special Drawing Rights (SDR) basket, Hanlon says. Officials are building gold reserves to back the yuan, hoping it will become an international currency with reserve status.</p><p>Today's SDR basket includes the dollar, the pound, the yen and the euro, which together determine the value of an SDR  an IMF-created asset to address liquidity issues between central banks.</p><p>China's economic growth, though stronger than in other leading nations, is slowing. In a surprise devaluation in August, the central bank reduced the yuan's value, sending it to a four-year low. When they did that, authorities were reacting to a string of weak economic data last summer. The numbers suggested the yuan was overvalued and affecting exports.</p><p>As of late October, China's central bank had cut interest rates six times in under a year, eyeing second-half 2015 growth that may dip to a 25-year low of less than 7 percent. This fall, officials are working on a new five-year plan, which will impact gross domestic product growth (GDP). It will have to be approved by the Chinese legislature next year. Planners have signaled a desire to move to slower, but steady, growth led by domestic demand and less dependent on exports.</p><p>As for the impact of China's stock sell-off on its residents, households there have less invested in equities than Americans do. Their wealth is mostly tied up in real estate.</p><p>China and India are the world's largest consumers of gold, and they alternate between which one leads. China's demand is on a long-term uptrend. But the nation's thirst for bullion, gold coins and jewelry waned in 2014. And its jewelry demand slipped in this year's second quarter, hurt by a slowing GDP and the stock market's slide. Demand is expected to improve this fall and winter, however, because of jewelry giving between the nation's recent Golden Week holidays in early October and Chinese New Year's in February.</p><p>In July, the London daily gold-price fix sank to a six-year low of $1,080 an ounce, but has since recovered a bit. Chinese consumers tend to buy gold on price dips.</p><p>In the last decade, Chinese gold production from mines grew at a faster pace than in other countries, making it tops in the world, followed by Australia. Chinese output, estimated at more than 462 tons in 2014, stays within its borders to meet industrial and jewelry needs.</p><p>Zijinshan Gold and Copper Mine, started up by Zijin Mining in 1993 in Fujian province, is one of the country's big gold producers. Its extraction costs are rising, however. China's open mines extract gold ore from hard rock. Mining from deposits in river beds is another source. The industry contains few large-scale gold mines and has more moderate-sized operations, including a number of smaller, artisanal and often illegal ones. Environmentalists complain about unsafe practices, including dynamite detonation and use of pollution-creating mercury.</p><p>Recognizing China's growth as a gold hub earlier this year, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) launched a physically delivered, kilogram gold futures contract, settled in Hong Kong at CME-approved locations. The CME noted that as gold demand swells in China and the Far East, the physical bullion market is moving eastward.</p><p>For more information, please visit <a href="http://www.dillongage.com">www.dillongage.com</a> or call (800) 375-4653.</p><p># # #</p><p><b>About Dillon Gage Metals</b><br> Dillon Gage Inc. of Dallas (DillonGage.com), founded in 1976, companies include:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Dillon Gage Metals (<a href="http://www.DillonGage.com/Metals">www.DillonGage.com/Metals</a>), one of the worlds largest precious metals wholesale trading firms. The firm is an authorized purchaser for all major world mints and maintains inventory in over 20 countries around the world. 800-375-4653</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  FizTrade Online Trading (<a href="http://www.FizTrade.com">www.FizTrade.com</a>) offers real-time bid/ask trading platform for gold, silver, platinum and palladium. 800-375-4653</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Digital Metals (<a href="http://www.DigitalMetals.com">www.DigitalMetals.com</a>) delivers advanced tools and technologies that enable market participants to be more successful in their businesses. Digital Metals offers cloud-based solutions for the physical precious metals marketplace built upon the Digital Metals Platform. 866-494-3577</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Dillon Gage Refining (<a href="http://www.dillongage.com/refining/why-dg">www.dillongage.com/refining/why-dg</a>), professional assayers and refiners of precious metal scrap, from low grade to karat scrap. Stone removal services and diamond experts on staff. 888-436-3489</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  International Depository Services Group with locations in Delaware, USA (<a href="http://www.ids-delaware.com">www.ids-delaware.com</a>; 888-322-2431), and Ontario, Canada (<a href="http://www.idsofcanada.com">www.idsofcanada.com</a>; 855-362-2431), offers secure, efficient and insured precious metals and certified coin depositories that focus of custom business logistics solutions that include storage, fulfillment, inventory managements and many other value added services.</p><p><br> <b>Contact:</b></p><p>Jeffrey Cheatham</p><p>Senior Account Manager</p><p>TrizCom PR</p><p>(972) 247-1369</p><p><a href="mailto:jeffc@trizcom.com">jeffc@trizcom.com</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Jo Trizila</p><p>President</p><p>TrizCom PR</p><p>(972) 247-1369</p><p>                                                                        <a href="mailto:jo@trizcom.com">jo@trizcom.com</a><br></p>
<p>               <b>Downtown McKinney Storefront Hosts 1920s Vintage Sleigh</b>&nbsp; &nbsp; <br></p><p>DALLAS, TX (Nov. 17, 2015)<a href="http://www.grayliving.com">Gray Living</a>, the 4,000-square-foot home décor and lifestyle shop in the heart of McKinneys town square, has a window display that visitors cannot only adore from the outside, but climb in to for an elegant holiday photo complete with historic smiles.</p><p>This one-of-a-kind, one horse open sleigh will sit prominently at Gray Living, open to the public, throughout the holiday season.<img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/b85783a0-8616-470a-956f-e489726462c3/sleigh.png" title="Image: http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/b85783a0-8616-470a-956f-e489726462c3/sleigh.png"></p><p>My wife and I were on an antiquing trip in Brimfield, Massachusetts, when we spotted the sleigh, and we knew that we needed it to be part of our family holiday celebration. All it required was a reupholster, and it was set. My family and I have been using this sleigh to decorate our home during the holidays for so many seasons. This year, I thought it would be great to share it with the community, says Randal Weeks, owner of Gray Living and founder of <a href="http://www.aidangrayhome.com/home1">Aidan Gray</a>.</p><p>He continues, Rather than waiting in line at the mall, hoping for a last minute picture with Santa, guests can make this years photo experience more enjoyable. They can stroll through downtown McKinney, hot chocolate or eggnog in hand, stop in for inspiring holiday décor ideas and take their own free photos in the sleigh.</p><p>The entire Gray Living location is adorned with holiday décor and inspiration through December.
