<p>Hip dysplasia is a condition that babies are prone to for a number of different reasons. Genetics play a role, and babys position in the womb can also place pressure on the hip. Some babies have more ligament laxity and, because the hip socket is soft and pliable, it is easier for babys hip to subluxate. Hip dysplasia can lead to various problems later in life, which is why its important to be aware of what can be done to prevent the problem from getting worse. Swanling founders Joanna and Jan Marco von Yurt are trying to raise awareness by providing parents with information and a <a href="http://www.swanling.com/" target="_blank">healthy solution for baby sleep</a>.</p><p><br></p><p>While hip dysplasia cannot really be prevented, as many cases are present at birth, parents can learn what to do to keep it from getting worse. Swaddling baby is a method that is encouraged to help baby sleep better, but some parents are not aware that tightly swaddling baby can lead to hip dysplasia. Its difficult for new parents to know the correct way to swaddle baby with a traditional blanket, and not all baby swaddles are recognized as hip healthy by the International Hip Dysplasia Institute (IHDI). </p><p><br></p><p>The Swanling Slumber Sleeper and Slumber Swaddle are products invented by the von Yurts that are both recognized by the IHDI. These safe sleep products do not put any strain on babys hips, all while promoting feelings of comfort, safety, and security. </p><p><br></p><p>The Slumber Sleeper&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>The Slumber Sleeper is an all-in-1&nbsp;<a href="http://www.swanling.com/" target="_blank">safe sleep solution</a>. It is a mattress protector, fitted sheet, flat sheet and sleep sack all in one, designed to help keep your baby safe, warm and centered. </p><p><br></p><p>Features &amp; Benefits:&nbsp; </p><p><br></p><ul><br><li>Give your child sleep independence</li><br><li>Allows older children to move freely and change sleep positions</li><br><li>Easily watch baby without adjusting monitor</li><br><li>Unique design facilitates back sleeping</li><br><li>Helps keep baby centered in the crib</li><br><li>Built-in washable &amp; waterproof lining</li><br><li>Makes babies feel held and loved, producing longer, healthier sleep and happier babies</li><br><li>Meets all ATSM/CPSC standards</li><br><li>Recognized by the International Hip Dysplasia Institute as a Hip-Healthy product</li><br><li>Recommended by pediatricians</li><br></ul><p><br></p><p><img width="400" alt="swanling-JULY-6jpg" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/swanling-july-6-jpg" height="267"></p><p><br></p><p>The Slumber Swaddle&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>The Slumber Swaddle is for newborns and can be used until your baby has grown out of swaddling (usually around 3 months of age.) The Slumber Swaddle uses our original Snap-in-Place system to attach securely at the waistband of the Slumber Sleeper. The Snap-in-Place system ensures that the swaddle will stay in place and helps keep baby comfortably wrapped through the night. The wonderfully soft lightweight bamboo jersey fabric is breathable helping your infant maintain a comfortable temperature. Further, our wonderful hands to heart or fetal tuck position pockets ensure children have the comfort they so need to sleep well. The easy wrap and close design takes the guesswork and frustration out of swaddling and allows for a custom fit every time.</p><p><br></p><p><img width="229" alt="Bassinet Sleeper Croppedjpg" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/mprgenieproduction/binaries/112592/bassinet-sleeper-cropped-jpg" height="300"></p><p><br></p><p>For more information on the Swanling sleep solution products, please visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.swanling.com/" target="_blank">http://www.swanling.com</a>. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>To schedule an interview with Jan Marco and Joanna von Yurt, contact Giselle Diaz at giselle@socialmedia22.com or call Tasha Mayberry at 207.317.6099.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>### </p>
<p><a></a><br></p><p><b>November 17, 2015</b><i> - 91% of all healthcare organizations have lost their patient data in the past two years.</i></p><p>Medical identity theft, in where your medical records and financial data are accessed by non-authorized personnel, has been on the rise ever since the Affordable Care Act of 2010 mandated digitization of patient records. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 had earlier offered financial stimulus packages to healthcare providers, which did so.</p><p><b>But why bother with medical records?</b></p><p>Some unscrupulous individuals soon realized the value of medical records just lying there for the taking. Poor cyber security measures in place, which arose from multiple people like doctors, nurses (some of them private contractors hired by the hour), administrators and insurance staff needing to access the data on a priority basis, only made it easier for them. </p><p>The healthcare sector alone accounted for the highest percentage of total hackings across industries. Patient records often contain associated billing information and insurance data - these are the primary objects of interest.</p><p>For instance, someone could set up a company that purports to sell electric wheelchairs, and bill the government thousands of dollars for every wheelchair they ship on paper, using Medicaid/Medicare numbers obtained this way.</p><p>Prescription medicines (for which they need to know which patients were prescribed what) are another way in which health insurance fraud could be perpetrated.</p><p>Having access to credit card information compounds the problem further. Any charges are billed first and the money transferred immediately. They can be disputed only later.</p><p><b>What can I do?</b></p><p>You can protect yourself by checking your credit report regularly. The three major credit-reporting agencies - Transunion, Equifax and Experian - all offer a free credit report once a year. You could get a credit report every four months at no extra cost and dispute anything out of place. Not doing so only affects your credit score.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>                        </p><p>There are now companies that provide protection against medical identity theft. It is a good idea to read up on the terms and conditions first, understand exactly what is being offered, and then sign up if it makes sense financially. Some of the best identity theft protection plan companies in the country that protect against ID theft can all be found on <a href="https://velvetprotection.com/">VelvetProtection.com</a>.</p>
<p><b>Beijing, November 18 2015</b>  CITIC Group and Baidu, Chinas leading search engine, today announced a strategic cooperation agreement under which Baidu and CITIC Bank will jointly establish Baixin Bank, the first joint venture bank formed by an Internet company and a traditional bank in China. The strategic tie-up represents a new model for combining Internet and finance, and a major step forward for Baidu in addressing Chinas large and fast-growing financial services industry.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>With over 640 million users searching on Baidu every month, Baidu has long served as a primary gateway for people to find the financial products and services theyre looking for, making the Baidu search engine a powerful distribution channel for financial services. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>CITIC was one of the first commercial banks established in China after the inauguration of reform, and has operations in 126 cities with close to 1,300 business outlets. CITICs assets total over 4 trillion RMB. The bank ranked 33rd in the <i>The</i>&nbsp;<i>Banker</i> magazine<i>s</i> July 2015 ranking of the worlds 1000 top banks by Tier 1 capital, and 46th by overall capital. Baixin Bank will combine the core strengths of Baidu and CITIC, and will offer a wide range of financial solutions for enterprises and for individuals. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Baidus scope extends from connecting people with information to connecting people with services. The establishment of Baixin Bank will mark a milestone for Internet finance in China, said Robin Li, chairman and CEO of Baidu. "This is the first in-depth cooperation between an Internet company and a traditional bank, representing an entirely new model of Internet + bankinga bank that truly understands both the Internet and financial services. Together, we will pioneer and build the future of Internet finance. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Chang Zhenming, chairman of CITIC Bank, said, The joint establishment of this direct bank not only marks the further deepening of bilateral cooperation, but also represents a meaningful effort to integrate the traditional banking business with Internet companies. The new direct bank will leverage the strengths of both sides, creating a powerful force for finance + Internet. It will better meet the growing needs of ordinary people and small businesses for financial services, helping to create a more inclusive finance, and supporting the development of the real economy. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Baidu brings to the Baixin Bank its massive traffic resources, vast behavioral data and powerful data analytics capabilities. Coupling Baidus strengths with CITICs leading financial product design capabilities, Baixin Bank will be able to offer innovative products to meet the needs of individual customers. CITICs account systems and large network of offline outlets, meanwhile, will ensure that Baixin Banks customers receive high-quality service whether online or offline. Both parties will contribute to better risk management, combining CITIC Banks expertise in traditional risk assessment with Baidus capabilities, based on dynamic behavior-based Internet data. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Pending approval by the China Banking Regulatory Commission (CBRC) of a direct banking license, the Baixin Bank will operate in strict accordance with the requirements set forth by the CBRC. The banks mission will be "to manage wealth for the people and finance for the public, to develop an inclusive approach to finance, and to service the real economy." The bank will address the major financial pain points that individuals and SMEs currently encounter.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Baidu also announced that Baidu Wallet, Baidus online payment platform, has officially launched a 1% cash-back program that will have no end date: Consumers using Baidu Wallet to pay will henceforth receive an immediate 1% cash rebate on all purchases. Baidu Wallet is an important part of Baidus services ecosystem, and will help support Baixin Bank with data, users, and business development opportunities with Baidus SME customers. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>As part of its commitment to more inclusive financial services, CITIC Bank also announced that beginning December 1, customers will be able to make online transfers free of charge across China. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Baidu</b></p><p>Baidu, Inc. is the leading Chinese language Internet search provider. As a technology-based media company, Baidu aims to provide the best and most equitable way for people to find they're looking for. In addition to serving individual Internet search users, Baidu provides an effective platform for businesses to reach potential customers. Baidu's ADSs trade on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol "BIDU". Currently, ten ADSs represent one Class A ordinary share.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Media inquiries, please contact</p><p>                                                               </p><p><a href="mailto:intlcomm@baidu.com">intlcomm@baidu.com</a></p>
<p></p><p>  <p>International entrepreneurs Bill Rowell and Edward Armstrong, founders of Golden Portrait, are revolutionizing the way consumers preserve their photographs by replacing photo paper and other print materials with Pure 24k Swiss Refined GOLD </p>  <p>Bill and Edward merged their skills, knowledge, passion and experience together to create Golden Portraits, which are produced under the strict control and certification of a group of hand chosen, international, 2nd generation, gold setting artists. This Swiss Refined and Certified Gold is carefully crafted into fine layers of pure 24k gold settings. It is then prepared for the photographic interfusion process. </p>  <p>The specialized Interfusion Process begins with the personal digital, high resolution photo of that Special Moment chosen by the consumer. &nbsp; These personal digital photographs are uploaded to the photo editor section of the company website.&nbsp; Customers may choose between portrait, landscape or desktop frame styles.&nbsp; </p>  <p>Golden Portrait then proceeds with the delicate process of interfusing the digital photo into the previously prepared 24k gold settings. Upon the completion of the interfusing process, the elegance of the consumers new 24K Swiss Refined Golden portrait is encased with a dark wooden frame. The polished glass that overlay the newly created heirloom will most certainly bring the customers new Golden Portrait alive.</p>  <p>&nbsp;Our parents generation would print photographs then place them into photo albums rarely to be viewed, or place them inside boxes that collect dust for years to come.&nbsp; More recent generations take digital photographs and download them onto their computer hard drive or save them onto flash drives forgetting about them for even longer then our parents generations Bill &nbsp;said. </p>  <p>Edward continued on by stating that the problem is that these methods forever hideaway the individual moments in a persons life that deemed them worthy to be photographed in the first place.</p>  <p>Laverne Armstrong (U.S. National Director), seeing the vast need for Golden Portraits to be made available to the American market, as well as the Global market, established the U.S. Corporate Office Location in Union City, CA.&nbsp;  It is from here that she also launched the American debut of My Golden Portrait during the 2015 Annual Megafest event hosted by Bishop T.D. Jakes in Dallas TX this past August.</p>  <p>I feel our website sums it up well Laverne said. While modern technology has improved the quality of our most treasured photographs, the durability and lasting quality on paper and in digital format is still questionable. Where would you trust your most treasured memories to, paper, digital format or 24K gold?&nbsp; At Golden Portrait we have embodied this ancient principle of Eternalizing Your Memories by replacing photo paper and other print materials with Pure 24k Swiss Refined GOLD.</p>  <p>The price of a 24k Swiss Refined Golden Portrait start at approximately $327 for a desktop frame and range up to $527 for the largest frame size of about 19.05 in. (x) 21.92 in. Golden Portrait also provides Global Distribution for all orders and can shipped within 4 to 6 weeks after the initial order is accepted. </p>  <p>Golden Portraits mission is to provide customers and their future generations with a moment of time cherished as an heirloom, represented and preserved, in a high quality 24K Swiss Refined Golden Portrait.</p>  Visit <a href="http://MyGoldenPortrait.com">http://MyGoldenPortrait.com</a> for information on how to get your Golden Portrait today.</p><br>
<p><i>Former Consumer Credit Counseling Service of Greater Dallas Seeks Wider Audience for Expanded Outreach Programs</i></p><p>DALLAS, TX - (Nov. 17, 2015)  Transformance, Inc., formerly Consumer Credit Counseling Service (CCCS) of Greater Dallas, has named TrizCom Public Relations as its agency of record. Effective immediately, TrizCom PR will handle all public relations initiatives including media outreach campaigns. Transformance is a full-service credit counseling and financial literacy nonprofit, headquartered in Dallas with regional representation in several key markets including the cities of Amarillo; Austin; Ardmore, Oklahoma; and Colorado Springs, Colorado.<br></p><p>In bringing TrizCom PR on board, Transformance seeks to expand its messaging to a wider audience. Efforts will include its traditional crisis counseling and instructor-led educational offerings while also launching a portfolio of multiplatform, e-learning offerings designed to promote financial resiliency and wealth accumulation through informed decision making and long-term behavior modification. The Transformance suite of financial learning products, including e-learning, is designed to have a sustainable, measurable impact with the potential to reach 10 million consumers.<br></p><p>With over 40 years of assisting consumers in North Texas, weve rebranded as Transformance and are ready to take our expanded outreach programs to a much wider audience. With the amount of media contacts and campaign experience that TrizCom brings to the table, they seem well-suited to help us reach that goal, said Ken Goodgames, president and CEO of Transformance.<br></p><p>Founder and CEO of TrizCom PR, Jo Trizila, adds, We are ready to begin sharing the wealth of information Transformance has to the media and public. To represent a company with as rich a history as Transformance is an honor. TrizCom is well-versed in the nonprofit side of corporate communications, and we look forward to expanding awareness and consideration of their cutting-edge outreach programs to key audiences.<br></p><p>In the past 40 years, Transformance has assisted over 1.7 million North Texans. For more information, please visit Transformance on the web at: <a href="http://www.transformanceusa.org">www.transformanceusa.org</a>. For more information on TrizCom, please visit <a href="http://www.trizcom.com">www.trizcom.com</a>.<br></p><p>###<br></p><p><b>About Transformance, Inc.<br></b>In 2015, the agency will have delivered more than 125,000 consumer interactions through financial counseling, outreach, and education. &nbsp;In 2016, the agency expects to serve up to 1 million low and moderate income families with transformative financial learning solutions accessible on-line and through a new mobile app.</p><p>Since its founding in 1974 as Consumer Credit Counseling Service of Greater Dallas, the agency has empowered clients to overcome adversity and attain their financial goals. &nbsp;Services include credit/budget counseling; financial education; housing counseling; individual debt management and bankruptcy counseling. Transformance will: &nbsp;<br></p><p>	Provide a national non-profit resource dedicated to confidential and professional counseling to assist financially distressed or economically vulnerable families<br></p><p>	Develop and foster community educational programs on family money management, budgeting and the wise use of money and credit</p><p>	Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with the credit community, employee assistance programs, professional counselors and community-based social service agencies</p><p>	Provide opportunities for economic empowerment of low and moderate income families and with a particular focus on at-risk communities such as seniors, military families, veterans, communities of color and single, female-headed households</p><p>	Enable good financial knowledge early in life through its focus on education of students (K -12) and their parents through agency strategic partnerships</p><p>Transformance, Inc., is a 501c (3) nonprofit founded in 1974, and is a United Way Service Provider as well as a HUD-approved multi-state housing counseling and education organization. &nbsp;The agency is formally accredited every four years by the Council on Accreditation for Children and Families (COA) to ensure compliance with top industry standards and best practices. &nbsp;The agency has its headquarters in Dallas, TX, with satellite offices in Arlington, Amarillo, Ardmore, OK, and Colorado Springs, CO.<br></p><p>To read more about Transformance, Inc., or for an annual report, visit <a href="http://www.transformanceusa.org">http://www.transformanceusa.org</a>.<br></p><p><b>About TrizCom Public Relations<br></b>From national industry leaders and Dallas-Fort Worths largest companies to startups and growing enterprises, TrizCom PR provides public relations and social media services to a wide variety of businesses encompassing startup, healthcare, lifestyle brands, B2B, energy, tech, entertainment, food/beverage and beyond. TrizCom PR has a dynamic track record of local, regional, national and international media placements on behalf of its clients that, if monetized, would equal hundreds of millions of dollars. They recently opened PITCH PR- Powered by TrizCom PR, in partnership with the Dallas Entrepreneur Center (DEC), a firm that works within the confines of early-stage entrepreneurs to satisfy the gap of public relations in Dallas startup ecosystem to better bridge innovation and media in Dallas thriving entrepreneurial community. Or <a href="http://www.pitchpr.co">www.pitchpr.co</a>.</p><p><b>Media Contact: &nbsp;</b><br></p><p>Jeffrey Cheatham</p><p>Senior Account Manager</p><p>TrizCom PR</p><p>Office: 972-247-1369</p><p>Mobile: 972-961-6171</p><p>jeffc@trizcom.com</p><div><br></div>
French couture house Christian Dior is giving consumers creative control over how to apply its newest scent, Jadore Touche de Parfum, by comparing the application with a ritual.<br><br>Diors latest addition to the Jadore fragrance line was announced on Sept. 23 with content published to the brands online magazine, DiorMag. Content posted delves deep into the scent and marketing communications created&nbsp;to promote Jadore Touche de Parfum, allowing consumers to get a solid&nbsp;grasp on the fragrances characteristics.<br><br>Its smart because it allows Dior to control the environment and deepens the communication with its consumer, said Terry Rieser, co-founder and COO of Tag Creative. I think it strengthens its position as a fashion authority in a way that is uniquely Dior.<br><br>Ms. is not affiliated with Dior, but agreed to comment as an industry expert.<br><br>Dior was unable to comment&nbsp;directly by press deadline.<br><br>A new ritual<br><br> Using its social media accounts, Dior directed its consumers to DiorMag through posts that did not give away too much information about Jadore Touche de Parfum. Instead, Dior placed all of its content within DiorMag, a source for all brand happenings.<br><br>The first post on Sept. 23 introduced the fragrance and its brand ambassador Charlize Theron. For more than a decade the actress has been the face of the Jadore fragrance collection, making her a likely selection for the new campaign, which also ensures a sense of trust among consumers when a new scent is launched.<br><br>Charlize is the literal embodiment of the Jadore brand so I couldnt imagine any other woman being the face of that iconic bottle, Ms. Rieser said. When you create such a strong relationship with a line as she has done, its integral to maintaining brand consistency.<br><br>Ms. Theron last starred in Diors updated multichannel campaign for the original JAdore last September (see story).<br><br>Dior continued sharing details about the campaign for Jadore Touche de Parfum with a behind-the-scenes image of Ms. Theron and photographer Peter Lindbergh, who shot the campaign.<br><br>A full version of the film created for Jadore Touche de Parfum can be viewed on DiorMag as well, but as of press time, the video had not yet been shared socially beyond YouTube by Dior. In the video, Ms Theron wears a gold shimmery dress that shines as she walks down a darkened street approaching the camera.<br><br>When Ms. Theron gets closer to the camera, the angle changes to show different aspects of her body and golden gown.<br><br><br><br> Dior Jadore  The new visual  Behind the scene<br><br>Diors video content was followed by two posts that are more focused on the fragrance itself.<br><br>The first describes Jadore Touche de Parfum as a new page in [Jadores] sparkling story, as this scent is redefining how women apply fragrance, meaning that Dior is encouraging consumers to wear the perfume either on its own or with others in the collection for a layering effect.<br><br>Dior suggests layering the scent with other Jadore fragrances such as LOr, Eau de Parfum, LAbsolu and Voile de Parfum. This is achieved through blotting Jadore Touche de Parfum&nbsp;on the skin using its cap.<br><br>Diors exclusive perfumer-creator Francois Demachy created Jadore Touche de Parfum to adapt to the ritual and character of each woman to tell a story of her singularity by responding to her skin. This concept is being expressed socially through the hashtag #MakeJadoreYours.<br><br>As with much of Diors design and marketing strategy, this is linked to the brands eponymous founder, who was quoted as saying, Just like your clothing, your perfume expresses your personality. Thus you can change it, according to your mood.<br><br>On its own, Diors Jadore Touche de Parfum has notes of damask roses, sambac jasmine and Sri Lankan sandalwood. These notes are then explored further in a second film shared to DiorMag.<br><br>The video stars Ms. Theron, who also narrates, speaking&nbsp;of how only the wearer can feel a fragrance and explore [her]&nbsp;essence. Visuals show the Jadore Touche de Parfum bottle in detail as well as the elements of the fragrance such as chips of sandalwood and blossoms and petals of roses and jasmine.<br><br>Stacked scent<br><br> Recently, there has been a surge in niche fragrance brands and bespoke scents that allow consumers to match their&nbsp;moods or personalities directly to a perfume. Layering scents is also trending, but many consumers may not feel confident to do so on their own without the direction of a trusted brand.<br><br>For instance, French fashion label Givenchy is allowing consumers to create their own scent profile each time they wear Ange ou Démon Le Parfum &amp; Accord Illicite, a fragrance duo.<br><br>Consumers can either wear the fragrances together for a layered scent profile, or wear them alone. To layer, the consumer would spritz on Le Parfum before adding Accord Illicite drops to the pulse points (see story).<br><br>[At Tag Creative we] see the brands we work with and the beauty industry as a whole beginning to shift toward the trend of personalization and customization, Ms. Rieser said. These are important trends that capture the spitit of consumers today.<br><br>We are clearly seeing an array of demographics seeking brands that understand their need for a deeper level of personalization, she said. It is no longer about finding a brand that you associate with, but more identifying a brand that customizes to the consumer.<br><br>Final Take<br><br> Jen King, lead reporter on Luxury Daily, New York<br><br><br><br>Jen King is a lead reporter on Luxury Daily. Her beats are consumer electronics, consumer packaged goods, food and beverage, fragrance and personal care, jewelry, media/publishing, software and technology and telecommunications. Reach her at jen@napean.com.<br><br>You can leave a response , or trackback from your own site.
<p>At this time of year, its hard not to get into the festive spirit. We know that indulging in rich food and drink can be tempting, and the opportunity to savor seasonal treats can throw a wrench in the works for pregnant women who may be trying to stick to a clean-eating regime.</p><p><br></p><p>To beat the temptation of the holiday season, Baby2Body Founder and CEO Melinda Nicci has compiled some fantastic tips to make the most of the festivities, without compromising on a healthy lifestyle.</p><p><br></p><p>1.&nbsp;Keep a healthy diet at the forefront of your mind &nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Craving rich, sugary treats is common throughout many pregnancies, as it can indicate a womans desire to provide high-caloric, high-fat foods for her baby  and help it survive and thrive in her womb. The holiday season can make these cravings more frequent, as these treats are often on display at parties and family gatherings. When a craving strikes, its best to stick to fresh fruit and vegetables or a handful of nuts and raisins to avoid a sugar high  and an inevitable crash later on. </p><p><br></p><p>These nutritious, small snacks will satisfy your sweet tooth, and keep your blood sugar levels stable, too.</p><p><br></p><p>2.&nbsp;Eat little and often</p><p><br></p><p>Big family meals with plates piled high can be incredibly tempting, but eating little and often will make your experience this holiday season a lot more pleasant. During the later stages of pregnancy, your stomachs capacity will be reduced due to your baby taking up a lot of room, so filling up will prove incredibly uncomfortable. Try eating smaller meals, and place emphasis on foods that offer slow-releasing energy, lean meat and fish, and plenty of fresh veggies.</p><p><br></p><p>3.&nbsp;Dont miss out  have a mocktail</p><p><br></p><p>The holidays make for the perfect opportunity to imbibe, but during a pregnancy, alcohol consumption should absolutely be avoided. If you want to join in with the toasts and revelry, try a mocktail  youll get all the flavor of a fruity cocktail, without the alcohol. </p><p><br></p><p>Heres the Baby2Body recipe for a delicious, light and festive margarita: </p><p><br></p><p>Ingredients:</p><p><br></p><p>- 2 cups of lemonade<br>- 1 frozen banana<br>- 2 tbsp of cashews</p><p><br></p><p>Directions:</p><p><br></p><p>- Squeeze fresh lemon juice as desired<br>- Add some fresh strawberries<br>- Top it off with ice and blend!</p><p><br></p><p>4.&nbsp;Get creative with H2O</p><p><br></p><p>We all know drinking water is essential in our day-to-day lives, and during pregnancy, its of the utmost importance. However, it can feel boring when everyone else is sipping on eggnog and mulled wine. Liven up your eight glasses a day with a delicious blend of citrus fruits and berries, or try mint and cucumber for a refreshing kick that will keep you hydrated and satisfied!</p><p><br></p><p>5.&nbsp;Make easy, delicious swaps</p><p><br></p><p>Christmas and Thanksgiving wouldnt be the same without an abundance of pumpkin pie and Christmas cake; however, they are loaded with fat and sugar. Swapping decadent desserts for lighter options will keep you feeling trim, reduce bloating and boost your confidence too. Our favorite easy swaps include making a big batch of warming stewed apples, a zesty orange polenta cake, or a seriously easy ice cream alternative with just one ingredient: banana. Pop a banana in the freezer overnight, remove peel, blend and eat immediately  youll have a delicious whipped banana pudding that tastes just like your favorite gelato!</p><p><br></p><p>6.&nbsp;Exercise, exercise, exercise!</p><p><br></p><p>The weather shouldnt deter you from working out, although the chill of winter can be off-putting. Try and exercise for 20 minutes every day; a brisk walk will get your heart pumping, release endorphins, offer some much needed stress-release, burn calories, and enable you to sleep soundly. Head off for a stroll with a friend or your partner if you need some motivation.</p><p><br></p><p>7.&nbsp;Take time to relax and recharge&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>The holidays can be a stressful period, what with the constant meals and parties, decorations, meal prep and more. We encourage you to practice your meditation techniques, and find some practices that help you unwind and relax. Our preferred methods include closing your eyes for two minutes in a comfortable position and visualizing a beautiful and tranquil space, focusing on deep breathing, and listing the people and things you have to be thankful for. Tis the season to be grateful!</p><p><br></p><p>Additionally, theres no shame in asking for help  be it from a relative, partner, friend or neighbor, a friendly face can halve a problem with a simple chat over a cup of (caffeine-free) tea. </p><p><br></p><p>About Melinda Nicci&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Melinda Nicci is the Founder and CEO of Baby2Body, and a sport psychologist, trainer and author with 20+ years experience in pre and post-natal fitness, health and wellbeing. She has trained hundreds of women to get their bodies back post-birth, has co-authored a book with DK Publishers, been a resident columnist in Prima Baby magazine and various lifestyle publications, and is an advisor on health-tech. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>About Baby2Body&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Baby2Body is redefining the way women experience motherhood, by putting the focus back on moms, enabling them to live better - because happy moms make for healthy babies! The online platform provides expert guidance; everything you need and want, all in one place. With Baby2Body, they can sign up for free to receive daily emails for pregnant women, or weekly emails for new moms. The timely tips and articles keep them informed, motivated and inspired to live happier and healthier. </p><p><br></p><p>Visit&nbsp;<a href="http://www.baby2body.com/" target="_blank">www.baby2body.com</a>&nbsp;to find out more! </p><p><br></p><p>To schedule an interview with founder Melinda Nicci, please contact Giselle Diaz at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:giselle@socialmedia22.com" target="_blank">giselle@socialmedia22.com</a>&nbsp;or call Tasha Mayberry at 207.317.6099. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>###</p>
<p><i>Collaboration Will Launch the Center for Social Innovation</i></p><p>DALLAS (November 19, 2015) - Transformance, Inc. of Dallas, Texas, has welcomed Walter Bender, founder of the nonprofit educational software provider Sugar Labs, to the steering committee of the Center for Social Innovation. Bender is a noted computer scientist, media specialist and educational champion and will serve as the founding member of the technology advisory group at the newly established Center for Social Innovation. He will also serve as the managing editor of the Centers quarterly Social Innovation Journal. He was a founding member of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Media Lab, where he served as the executive director from 2000 to 2006. Bender's book, Learning to Change the World, on technology, learning and social entrepreneurship, was published in 2012.<br></p><p>The Center for Social Innovation leverages the 30,000-square-foot headquarters of Transformance (a nonprofit financial education and crisis counseling organization) as a community hub and a vital resource for collaboration. The Center will host a nonprofit co-working center, nonprofit and technology accelerator resources, and special community events  plus a number of economic empowerment programs focused on low-to-moderate income families, consistent with the Earn It, Keep It, Grow It initiatives outlined by leading social innovation pioneers such as the Annie E. Casey Foundation. The Center will also support the development and delivery of integrated social services offerings by Transformance and its community partners.<br></p><p>Transformance President and CEO Ken Goodgames said, In launching the Center for Social Innovation, we hope to attract the specific top thinkers, problem solvers and social entrepreneurs such as Walter Bender. His globally recognized thought leadership in both the digital media and nonprofit sectors will be paramount to shaping our growth and direction at this early stage. Walter has been extremely gracious in donating his time and talents to supporting the launch of the center, and we look forward to a long-term collaboration.<br></p><p>Sugar Labs founder Walter Bender said, Transformance and other innovative nonprofits that I have served have the common vision of using both collaboration and innovation to solve social problems. I hope to serve as a mentor and technology adviser for the emerging nonprofits based at the Center for Social Innovation. Additionally, my work at the center will allow me to launch a number of youth-oriented technology design programs in the DFW area. My personal passion is the use of technology to help youth in communicating their ideas while stimulating creativity. I am also passionate about giving students the opportunity to immerse themselves in the empowering world of programming.<br></p><p>The Center for Social Innovation is located at 8737 King George Drive in Dallas, Texas. Renovation plans are under development for the Center and a grand opening celebration will be announced in January 2016.<br></p><p>###<br></p><p><b>About Transformance, Inc.</b><br></p><p>In 2015, the agency will have delivered more than 125,000 consumer interactions through financial counseling, outreach and education. In 2016, the agency expects to serve up to 1 million low and moderate income families with transformative financial learning solutions accessible online and through a new mobile app.</p><p>Since its founding in 1974 as Consumer Credit Counseling Service of Greater Dallas, the agency has empowered clients to overcome adversity and attain their financial goals. Services include credit/budget counseling, financial education, housing counseling, individual debt management and bankruptcy counseling. Transformance will:<br></p><p>	Provide a national nonprofit resource dedicated to confidential and professional counseling to assist financially distressed or economically vulnerable families<br></p><p>	Develop and foster community educational programs on family money management, budgeting and the wise use of money and credit</p><p>	Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with the credit community, employee assistance programs, professional counselors and community-based social service agencies</p><p>	Provide opportunities for economic empowerment of low and moderate income families and with a particular focus on at-risk communities such as seniors, military families, veterans, communities of color and single, female-headed households</p><p>	Enable good financial knowledge early in life through its focus on education of students (K -12) and their parents through agency strategic partnerships</p><p>Transformance, Inc., is a 501c (3) nonprofit founded in 1974, and is a United Way Service Provider as well as a HUD-approved multistate housing counseling and education organization. The agency is formally accredited every four years by the Council on Accreditation for Children and Families (COA) to ensure compliance with top industry standards and best practices. The agency has its headquarters in Dallas, Texas, with satellite offices in Arlington; Amarillo; Ardmore, Oklahoma; and Colorado Springs, Colorado.<br></p><p>To read more about Transformance, Inc., or for an annual report, visit <a href="http://www.transformanceusa.org">http://www.transformanceusa.org</a>.<br></p><p><b>About Walter Bender, Founder  Sugar Labs</b><br></p><p>Walter Bender is the founder of Sugar Labs (a member project of the nonprofit foundation Software Freedom Conservancy, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization based in New York) that develops educational software used by almost 4 million children in more than 40 countries. In 2006, Bender co-founded the One Laptop per Child, a nonprofit association with Nicholas Negroponte and Seymour Papert.</p><p>He is a globally recognized technologist and researcher who works in the field of electronic publishing, media and technology for learning. Bender received his undergraduate degree from Harvard University in 1977 and a masters degree from MIT in 1980, where he built the Electronic Publishing research group. He was a founding member of the MIT Media Lab, where he was a Senior Scientist and holder of the Alexander W Dreyfoos Chair.<br></p><p>As executive director of the MIT Media Laboratory from 2000 to 2006, Bender oversaw a budget of approximately $40 million per year and led a team of researchers in fields as varied as tangible media to affective computing to lifelong kindergarten. In 1992, Bender founded the MIT News in the Future consortium, which launched the era of digital news. Currently, he is launching a new initiative at MIT, the Open Leaning Lab, a forum for collaborative research among universities globally.<br></p><p>Bender serves or has served on numerous boards and committees, including IBM's mobile computing advisory board and the GNOME technical advisory board. He is on the advisory board of the Squeak Foundation, the Center for Educational Technology (CET) in Israel and Libre Corps, a new program at the Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) that builds long-term, on-going relationships between university students and humanitarian organizations. He is on the editorial board of the Journal of Technology, Society and Knowledge.<br></p><p>He has held visiting faculty appointments at international universities, including the University of Tampere, and continues to serve on university research advisory boards and on occasion teaches at Hult and MIT Sloan business schools. Bender is a frequent keynote speaker, most recently at SLUSH, the largest startup conference in Northern Europe.<br></p><p>For more information regarding Sugar Labs, please visit <a href="http://www.sugarlabs.org">www.sugarlabs.org</a>.<br></p><p><b>Media Contact:</b><br></p><p>Jeffrey Cheatham</p><p>Senior Account Manager</p><p>TrizCom PR</p><p>Office: 972-247-1369</p><p>Mobile: 972-961-6171</p><p>jeffc@trizcom.com</p><div><br></div>
<p>               <b>Operation Kindness Offers Unique Gifts to Benefit Homeless Animals</b>&nbsp; &nbsp; <img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/42733016-eae5-4666-8d61-e4f0c21b3f14/KindnessKatalog.png"><br></p><p>CARROLLTON, TX (November 19, 2015)Theres nothing like the joy of giving and receiving a holiday gift that helps save lives, and thats exactly what discerning shoppers will find in <i>The Kindness Katalog</i>, <a href="http://www.OperationKindness.org">Operation Kindness</a> new gift catalog. From live-saving surgeries to warm, cozy beds for homeless animals, there are delightful gifts at all price points to show your compassion while delighting a loved one, friend, client or employee. One hundred percent of the proceeds will directly benefit the homeless animals at Operation Kindness, the original and largest no-kill animal shelter in North Texas.</p><p><i>Kindness Katalog</i> gifts include:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Happy Tails Society memberships that give the gift of life all year long by helping to cover the cost of medical care, shelter and food. Recipients will receive a Happy Tails Society decal, holiday card and a monthly e-newsletter featuring a Happy Tale of how their membership is making a difference. Starting at $19 a month, this gift is tax-deductible for the purchaser.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Prepaid adoption gift certificates for a dog or cat with accompanying food bowl and accessories. Each gift certificate costs $200 and is valid for 90 days after the initial purchase to ensure the perfect pet is available. If the perfect pet is not available or the recipient does not wish to adopt an animal, the gift certificate can be refunded.</p><p>Gifts from <i>The Kindness Katalog</i> are very impactful, with both the giver and receiver knowing theyre helping save an animals life, instead of having to make space for another item in the overcrowded lives we live today, says Operation Kindness CEO Jim Hanophy.</p><p>&nbsp;To browse <i>The Kindness Katalog</i>, visit <a href="http://www.operationkindness.org/opk/">http://www.operationkindness.org/opk/</a>. Items will be available for purchase online until Dec. 31.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Operation Kindness</b><br> Founded in 1976, Operation Kindness is the original and largest no-kill shelter in North Texas. Its mission is to care for homeless cats and dogs in a no-kill environment until each is adopted into responsible homes and to advocate humane values and behavior. Operation Kindness has saved nearly 80,000 animals since its inception. The shelter assists nearly 5,000 dogs and cats each year, caring for an average of 300 animals daily with another 100-150 animals in foster homes.</p><p>Join Operation Kindness in their mission to care for homeless animals by becoming a member of the Happy Tails Society. This group of dedicated friends provides a monthly gift to help pay for medical care, medicine, food, shelter, nurturing and behavior training the pets need to have a second chance at life. Learn more about Operation Kindness at <a href="http://www.OperationKindness.org">http://www.OperationKindness.org</a> or on Facebook (<a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Operation-Kindness/30251945822">www.facebook.com/pages/Operation-Kindness/30251945822</a>).</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Contact:</b></p><p>Katie Hill-Mudd</p><p>TrizCom PR </p><p><a href="mailto:jo@Trizcom.com">Katie@TrizCom.Com</a></p><p>Office: 972-247-1369</p><p>Cell: 214-676-4254</p><p>                                                                </p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="http://legacyer.com/">Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care</a>, one of the nations first hybrid health care models offering both urgent care and emergency room treatment options under one roof, is celebrating its two year birthday in Allen, Texas (1310 W. Exchange Pkwy.). Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care is headquartered in Plano, Texas with seven health care centers in Allen, Coppell, Frisco (2), Keller, McKinney and North Richland Hills. </p><p>Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care - Allen is a Texas state-licensed 7,632 SF Freestanding emergency &amp; urgent care facility in Allen, Texas. Its award-winning building was designed by <a href="http://www.5gstudio.com/">5G Studio</a> and was 5G Studios second facility. The design concept built upon the success of their first facility in Frisco, Texas where the distinctive architecture and interior design of the facility continue to bring as much brand recognition as the exceptional medical service. The building combines two traditionally separate programs, the emergency room and the urgent care, under one roof. The progressive architectural design integrated the elements of sustainable and evidence-based design to offer a soothing environment for patients seeking care under distressed conditions. The project held its ground breaking ceremony on March 21, 2013. </p><p>Co-Founder and Chief Medical Officer Jay Woody, MD states, "Since we started Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care in 2008 we wanted to present a completely different health care experience for our patients and that included the aesthetic of the facility. &nbsp;When we expanded to Allen we were presented an opportunity to design our perfect scenario from scratch thanks to the support from the city. &nbsp;We are so proud of our results and the thousands of patients that visit every month unanimously agree they love the clean, non-healthcare feel of the facility" &nbsp;</p><p>At Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care, patients only pay for the care they need. No more making financial decisions when a family member needs to feel better. Legacy ER &amp; Urgent care is always on whether a condition will get billed as an urgent care visit (more than 70 percent fall into this category) or an emergency.<b>&nbsp;</b></p><p>Unlike most free-standing ERs today, Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care wont bill you emergency room prices unless you actually need emergency care. If you go in during urgent care hours for a sore throat or some other non-emergency situation, youre charged urgent care prices, not emergency room prices, which can save you hundreds of dollars per visit, explains Keith Miller, president of Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care.</p><p>Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care has the ability to treat and care for almost any emergency and all urgent care needs.</p><table>  <tbody><tr>   <td>   <p>Chest pains</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Abdominal pains</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Lacerations, wounds or bleeding</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Sore throats, itchy eyes, fever</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Fractures, sprains, bruising</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Pediatrics</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Stroke symptoms or seizures</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Insect bites, stings, allergic reactions</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Allergies</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Burns, major and minor</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Pink eye</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Pneumonia</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Rash</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Back Pain</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Headaches or head injuries</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Vomiting</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Accidental Poisoning</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Appendicitis</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Asthma &amp; Breathing problems</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Blood clots</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Chemical exposure</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Dehydration</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p>Dizziness</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>Eye injuries</p>   </td>  </tr>  <tr>   <td class="wysiwyg-tmp-selected-cell">   <p>Foreign body removal</p>   </td>   <td>   <p>&nbsp;</p>   </td>  </tr> </tbody></table><p>Urgent care hours are from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and ER services are accessible 24/7, 365 days a year. The typical wait time before being seen is less than five minutes. Online check-in is available and walk-ins are welcomed.</p><p>Founded in 2008, Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care is one of the nations first health care models to offer both urgent care and emergency room treatment options under one roof. It has built an exceptional customer service program and rating by providing transparent billing, soothing environments and one-on-one service with board-certified, emergency-trained physicians. Patients have access to immediate, on-site emergency room equipment and only pay emergency care prices when it is truly an emergency. For more information, visit <a href="http://legacyer.com/" title="Link: http://legacyer.com/">http://legacyer.com/.</a></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;###</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Media Contact:</b></p><p>Dana Cobb</p><p>TrizCom Public Relations </p><p>972-955-9747</p><p><a href="mailto:dana@trizcom.com">dana@trizcom.com</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Locations:</b></p><p>1310 W. Exchange Parkway, Allen, Texas 75013: 972-678-4545</p><p>330 S. <p><b>Student run company, ChugaChaga, set to launch this January.</b></p><p><b>New York City, New York- </b>Student entrepreneurs from the University of Albany are set to launch the next generation organic health beverage at the start of 2016. These students started strong by placing in the NYS business plan competition in April. This summer they developed in a locally based accelerator, ultimately leading to their acceptance into the world-class Food-X accelerator in NYC. While in Food-X, these students rapidly developed their business and beverage with the help of titans in the food industry. </p><p>ChugaChagas revolutionary beverage Tree Tea is the worlds first wild crafted, organic, and Non-GMO certified chaga beverage. For those who are unaware, chaga is a superfood local to the northern United States renowned for its health enhancing properties and great taste. Chaga has one of the highest concentrations of antioxidants of any food ever tested and dense sugars that help to maintain healthy immune &amp; digestive systems. ChugaChaga takes care of a major pain point for consumers looking to try chaga, getting it. Chaga grows in cold mountainous terrain, with its primary harvest season in harsh winter months. So instead of going gangrene in the Adirondacks, ChugaChaga takes care for everything from Tree to Tea with their network of harvesters who sustainably handpick wild chaga. &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</p><p>Founder and CEO Luke Evans was a chef in the Catskills when he first learned about the power of chaga. While in his junior year of High School, Luke embarked on a hike with his mentor in search of the elusive chaga mushroom. From the moment he set his eyes on chaga, Luke knew that his life would never be the same again. Watching my brother battle cancer throughout my childhood profoundly impacted my life. The mantra let thy medicine be thy food and food be thy medicine was ingrained in my career as a chef and ultimately inspired me to start ChugaChaga. said Luke Evans. As he entered college and his ideas fermented, Luke recruited two of his close friends to make dreams a reality and the trio has been unstoppable ever since. </p><p>      </p><p>On December 3rd the team presented at Food-Xs demo day in front of hundreds of the food industrys top innovators; only to ship off to California for the BevNet Live New Beverage Showdowns Semifinals on December 7th &amp; 8th. Through their drive and ambition the ChugaChaga team is certain to accomplish their mission of spreading the power of chaga by adapting it to the modern lifestyle. If you want to join the Fungi Tribe, on their quest of making ChugaChaga the premier national brand of chaga beverages, be sure to check out their website and Kickstarter campaign, which is running from Jan. 19th through Feb. 18th &nbsp;Tree tea will be available in multiple locations throughout NYC and online!</p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>Contact:</b></p><p>Marc Iskandar, Chief Marketing Officer</p><p>813 Washington Ave, Albany, NY, 12206</p><p>(516) 647-6802</p><p>                    </p><p>marciskandar@chugachaga.com  &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p>
<p><i>Purchase $150 in gift cards and receive a free one-hour massage or facial session&nbsp;</i></p><p><b>Who: </b><a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/regions/TX/Dallas.aspx"><b>Dallas-Fort Worth Massage Envy</b></a> (35 locations), the pioneer and national leader of professional, convenient and affordable massage and spa services.</p><p><b>What:</b> Massage Envy holiday gift card offer</p><p><b>When: </b>Now through Saturday, Dec. 27, 2015</p><p><b>Where: </b>35<b> </b>Dallas-Fort Worth locations of Massage Envy</p><p><b>Details:</b> This holiday season, purchase $150 in gift cards from one of the 35 Dallas-Fort Worth Massage Envy locations and receive a free one-hour service  either massage or facial. Memberships are available for $59.99 per month and include a one-hour massage session. Members can enjoy unlimited additional one-hour massage sessions at the $39.99 member rate or a one-hour Healthy Skin facial session for $49.99.</p><p>Log on to <a href="http://www.massageenvy.com/regions/TX/Dallas">www.massageenvy.com/regions/TX/Dallas</a> to find the nearest Dallas-Fort Worth Massage Envy. All Massage Envy locations are open seven days a week. For more information, visit MassageEnvy.com. The national franchise is dedicated to providing professional and affordable therapeutic massage and skincare services to members and guests with busy lifestyles at convenient times and locations. Founded in 2002, Massage Envy has more than 1,000 franchise locations in 49 states and 1.5 million members.  In addition, the average unit volume for a franchise location is $1.35 million. Through its national partnership with the Arthritis Foundation, Massage Envy has raised more than $3 million in four, one-day Healing Hands for Arthritis events. O 7º Congresso RTI Data Centers vai apresentar e discutir as tendências do setor de data centers e as novidades em produtos e serviços de fornecedores nacionais e internacionais<br><br>O crescimento do acesso à Internet no Brasil tem ganhado contornos grandiosos. A disseminação de tecnologias móveis, expansão das redes sociais, a virtualização de aplicações e, consecutivamente, o aumento no volume de tráfego de dados revelam a necessidade das empresas se atualizarem para manter sua competitividade elevada em um ambiente cada vez mais digital. O processo engloba o armazenamento de informações, gerenciamento de servidores, além de transmissão de dados com velocidade e segurança. Esse cenário contribui para o crescimento do mercado de data centers no país, tema de discussão do 7º Congresso RTI Data Centers, que será realizado em 28 de maio, em São Paulo.<br><br>Dia 28/05  das 08h às 18h<br><br> As inscrições para o congresso podem ser feitas antecipadamente por meio <br><br>do site:  <br><br> Ou diretamente no local do evento.
<p>HORSHAM, PA., November 23, 2015 &nbsp; --&nbsp;  Traffic safety experts consider the Thanksgiving holiday weekend to be among the most dangerous driving times of the year.&nbsp; Nearly 1,200 people were killed in traffic crashes throughout the nation over a recent Thanksgiving weekend, according to National Highway Traffic Safety Administration statistics.</p><p>What makes it such a risky time on the road?&nbsp; Thanksgiving is one of the busiest travel times with people driving to family gatherings and students returning home from college.&nbsp; Wine is often consumed with the big meal, and beer often is the beverage of choice as we watch football games on TV.&nbsp; Add to that the fact that a big turkey dinner can cause drivers to feel drowsy.</p><p>"A convergence of factors at Thanksgiving time make impaired and drowsy driving real dangers," said Randy Wright, President of Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care, a nationwide transmission and auto repair brand that services almost any make or model vehicle, foreign or domestic.&nbsp; "All of us at Cottman work hard to keep you and your car safe and reliable, so we urge you do your part by taking precautions on this festive holiday.&nbsp; We want both you and your car to travel safely."</p><p>Safety experts say we tend to get sleepy after a big meal, especially one that includes roasted turkey, which has enzymes that may cause drowsiness.&nbsp; Studies also show that even one or two alcoholic drinks with a meal can seriously impair driving ability.</p><p>Cottman offers some simple tips to help keep Thanksgiving safe and joyous for people who must travel by car, whether locally or over big distances.</p><p><ul><li>Be sure the driver and all passengers are      wearing seat belts.</li><li>If you plan to drive, don't drink or take      drugs.&nbsp; If you do plan to drink,      designate a sober driver before the holiday celebration begins.</li><li>Avoid driving long distances after a big      holiday meal.&nbsp; If possible, have      someone who can share driving tasks, and allow extra time for frequent      rest stops.</li><li>If you feel yourself nodding off, find a safe      place to pull over, have coffee or a caffeinated product and close your      eyes for a 20-minute nap.&nbsp;</li></ul></p><p><b>About Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care:</b></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p>                                </p><p>With locations across the U.S., Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care is a transmission and auto repair brand that services almost any make or model vehicle, foreign or domestic.  Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care centers specialize in complete transmission service, brakes, suspension, air conditioning service and much more.  Cottmans headquarters is based in Horsham, Pennsylvania.  For more information, please visit <a href="http://www.cottman.com/">www.Cottman.com</a> and <a href="http://www.thecottmanmanblog.com/">www.TheCottmanManBlog.com</a>. </p>

<p>TEST Greg - </p><h1>HART Reports Significant Confirmatory Results for its 2nd&nbsp;</h1><h1>Generation Bioengineered Esophagus, Trachea and Bronchus&nbsp;</h1><h1>Implants</h1>
<p>Harvard Apparatus Regenerative Technology, Inc. (HART) (Nasdaq: <a href="http://studio-5.financialcontent.com/prnews?Page=Quote&amp;Ticker=HART" target="_blank" rel="nofollow" title="Link: http://studio-5.financialcontent.com/prnews?Page=Quote&amp;Ticker=HART">HART</a>), a biotechnology company developing bioengineered implants for life-threatening conditions, today announced significant results  including clear evidence of complete esophageal tissue regeneration  from recently conducted animal research on HART's 2ndGeneration (Gen2) bioengineered implant platform. HART will hold a conference call at&nbsp;5:00 p.m. ET&nbsp;today to discuss these results.</p><p>Jim McGorry, HART CEO, commented: "We pursued these animal studies to test the design and technology enhancements we have made to our second generation technology and to prepare us for our upcoming studies with the Mayo Clinic. We are very encouraged by the results of these studies and by the significant advancements we have made across all three indications. In particular, results for the Gen2 implant in the esophagus far exceeded our expectations, particularly given the study's brief duration. Over a two-week period, all layers of the esophagus, most notably the epithelial and muscle layers, were fully regenerated, and components of esophageal nerves were present. Such nerves are fundamental to the proper contraction of the muscles that move food along the esophagus."</p><p>Mr. McGorry continued, "Based on the strong performance of our Gen2 implants in all three indications, we are well-positioned as we move forward with confirmatory longer-term large-animal studies with Mayo Clinic in December."</p><p>Research and Development Highlights:</p><ul><li>HART's Gen2 technology reflects design enhancements to improve the body's response to the implant and to better guide the repair of tissue in the healing process.</li><li>HART's recent animal studies tested all three of its Gen2 implants  esophagus, trachea, and bronchus  demonstrating resolution of the negative inflammatory response observed with the prior generation of the technology.</li><li>Clinically significant evidence of tissue and nerve regeneration was observed in the esophageal implant, positioning the esophageal implant as the current lead development priority.</li><li>HART is initiating confirmatory and longer-term large-animal studies with Mayo Clinic in December.</li><li>HART remains on track to conduct human compassionate use surgeries and to file an initial IND application with U.S. FDA in 2016.</li></ul><p><b>Research Findings<br></b>Saverio La Francesca, M.D., HART's CMO, added, "We have demonstrated a very significant improvement in the body's response to the implant in the tracheal position, and we have observed initial engraftment of the implant into the surrounding tissues. Similar positive findings were noted in the main bronchus position."</p><p>He continued, "We are very encouraged by the anatomical and histological data from our esophageal implant study. Based on these data, we believe that our second generation implant possesses all the necessary cues to elicit full regeneration of the esophagus. Importantly, our esophageal implant addresses a very significant need as a potentially life-saving treatment for patients with esophageal cancer. Each year in the U.S. approximately 17,000 new cases of esophageal cancer are diagnosed, and more than 4,000 are addressed by surgery. Our results underscore the value and potential of our platform technology to treat these patients and pave the way for further studies and our regulatory pathway for human clinical trials."</p><p><br></p>
<div><p>Harvard Apparatus Regenerative Technology, Inc. (HART) (Nasdaq: <a href="http://studio-5.financialcontent.com/prnews?Page=Quote&amp;Ticker=HART" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">HART</a>), a biotechnology company developing bioengineered implants for life-threatening conditions, today announced significant results  including clear evidence of complete esophageal tissue regeneration  from recently conducted animal research on HART's 2nd Generation (Gen2) bioengineered implant platform.&nbsp;</p><p>Jim McGorry, HART CEO, commented: "We pursued these animal studies to test the design and technology enhancements we have made to our second generation technology and to prepare us for our upcoming studies with the Mayo Clinic. We are very encouraged by the results of these studies and by the significant advancements we have made across all three indications. In particular, results for the Gen2 implant in the esophagus far exceeded our expectations, particularly given the study's brief duration. Over a two-week period, all layers of the esophagus, most notably the epithelial and muscle layers, were fully regenerated, and components of esophageal nerves were present. Such nerves are fundamental to the proper contraction of the muscles that move food along the esophagus."</p><p>Mr. McGorry continued, "Based on the strong performance of our Gen2 implants in all three indications, we are well-positioned as we move forward with confirmatory longer-term large-animal studies with Mayo Clinic in December."</p><p>Research and Development Highlights:</p><ul><li>HART's Gen2 technology reflects design enhancements to improve the body's response to the implant and to better guide the repair of tissue in the healing process.</li><li>HART's recent animal studies tested all three of its Gen2 implants  esophagus, trachea, and bronchus  demonstrating resolution of the negative inflammatory response observed with the prior generation of the technology.</li><li>Clinically significant evidence of tissue and nerve regeneration was observed in the esophageal implant, positioning the esophageal implant as the current lead development priority.</li><li>HART is initiating confirmatory and longer-term large-animal studies with Mayo Clinic in December.</li><li>HART remains on track to conduct human compassionate use surgeries and to file an initial IND application with U.S. FDA in 2016.</li></ul><p><b>Research Findings<br></b>Saverio La Francesca, M.D., HART's CMO, added, "We have demonstrated a very significant improvement in the body's response to the implant in the tracheal position, and we have observed initial engraftment of the implant into the surrounding tissues. Similar positive findings were noted in the main bronchus position."</p><p>He continued, "We are very encouraged by the anatomical and histological data from our esophageal implant study. Based on these data, we believe that our second generation implant possesses all the necessary cues to elicit full regeneration of the esophagus. Importantly, our esophageal implant addresses a very significant need as a potentially life-saving treatment for patients with esophageal cancer. Each year in the U.S. approximately 17,000 new cases of esophageal cancer are diagnosed, and more than 4,000 are addressed by surgery. Our results underscore the value and potential of our platform technology to treat these patients and pave the way for further studies and our regulatory pathway for human clinical trials."</p><p><a href="http://www.harvardapparatusregen.com" title="Link: http://www.harvardapparatusregen.com">www.harvardapparatusregen.com</a></p><p><br></p><p><br></p></div>
<p>  </p><p><b>Cleared to Market Medical Devices in 33 European Countries</b></p><p>  </p><p>DALLAS, TEXAS (November 23, 2015) Dallas-based medical device designer and manufacturer AccelSPINE® received its CE Marking and European ISO 13485 certification last week. The CE Marking will enable AccelSPINE to expand its customer base to the 28 countries that make up the European Union and five additional countries that adhere to European Union regulations.</p><p>  </p><p>&nbsp;Obtaining a CE Marking and an EN ISO 13485 at the same time is rare in our industry, said Danny Chon, president and CEO of AccelSPINE. Certification processes take a lot of time and require that you meet certain standards that not every company is ready for. In addition, an EN ISO 13485 certification isnt required for a company like ours, but obtaining both was important to us. Its a symbol of our commitment to excellence. </p><p>  </p><p>The designations, effective Nov. 18, were awarded to AccelSPINE by TUV Rheinland LGA Products GmbH after extensive quality assurance audits. AccelSPINEs ISO designations are EN ISO 13485:2012 and EN ISO 13485:2012/AC: 2012, acknowledging that AccelSPINE has established and applies a quality management system for medical devices for the following scope: Design and Development, Manufacture, Distribution of Non-sterile Spinal Implants and Instruments.</p><p>  </p><p>AccelSPINEs CE Marking or EC Certificate signifies a full quality assurance system for its medical devices pursuant to Directive 93/42/EEC Annex II (excluding section 4). To obtain a CE Marking, products must adhere to the requirements of relevant European legislations and standards. Products that obtain a CE Marking can be sold to the European Union member countries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, The Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and the United Kingdom. In addition, the CE Marking grants AccelSPINE access to other countries who abide by European Union regulation, such as Turkey, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Switzerland and Norway.</p><p>  </p><p>AccelSPINE® is a nationally recognized medical device company headquartered in Dallas, Texas. The company designs, develops, manufactures and distributes spinal implants and instruments that are tailored to fit the unique needs of surgeons and patients. For more information, call 800-713-9489 or visit <a title="Link: http://www.accelspine.com/" href="http://www.accelspine.com/">www.accelspine.com</a>.</p><p>  </p>

One McKinney storefront, <a href="http://www.aidangrayhome.com/">Gray Living</a>, the 4,000-square-foot home décor and lifestyle shop, will be keeping its festive doors open on Nov. 28, 2015 and its 1920s sleigh on display as a free photo opportunity for families looking for a memorable holiday photo with family and friends while they shop local. </p>  <p>Small Business Saturday is a different way to shop, says Gray Living owner and <a href="http://www.aidangrayhome.com/">Aidan Gray</a> founder Randal Weeks. Its one of the best days to shop when you want a stress-free experience. We love getting the chance to talk with our customers and help them find exactly the gifts theyre looking for.</p>  <p>Small Business Saturday falls on a weekend that will be filled with family festivities as part of Downtown McKinneys Home for the Holidays celebration.</p>  <p>It means a lot to be able to take part in everything going on during the weekends celebrations. Not only do we get to show people the small business difference, but we also get to support the community that supports us, says Weeks.</p>  <p>In honor of the holiday and in support of Small Business Saturday, Gray Living is offering a discount of 30% on all items in store (candles excluded) through November 29th.</p>  <p><b>About Gray Living</b><br></p>  <p>Gray Living is a home furnishing store known for its Casual European Elegance. They offer the finest furniture, bedding, lighting, gifts and more.
