<p>The South African <a href="http://www.moreflavour.co.za/coffee-making-products/aeropresscoffeemaker/">AeroPress</a> champion 2016 is Winston Thomas from Origin Coffee Roasting&nbsp;Cape Town.</p><p>It doesnt come as much surprise when Origin scoops awards. This infamous speciality coffee roastery has been doing it for more than 8 years now with a bank volt full of SA Barista titles, Cup taster and Latte Art titles and now South African AeroPress title. But what is new are the faces, with youngsters like Winston, and Arno Els (SA Barista Champ finalist) it looks like the new generation at Origin are following in the footsteps of the old guard before.</p><p>Winston has been tipped as a future coffee star, after his 2nd place qualifier at the Cape Town regionals a few months back came after only 1 year in the coffee industry. Its fair to say that he probably makes more aeropress than anyone else in South Africa working behind the brew bar at Origin. His thirst for knowledge, passion for <a href="http://www.moreflavour.co.za">coffee makers</a> and coach-ability will take him far and we have great expectations for him on the world stage in Dublin.</p><p>The biggest surprise came from new comer Kurt Nilsen. A late independent entry on the evening surprised the entire coffee elite as he made his way to the finals with his very unconventional approaches, that seemed to bring unusual yet standout flavours from the coffee over his heat competitors. Needless to say Kurt became a coffee legend overnight.</p><p>Third place was Melanie Winter, from The Coffee Mag. The Coffee Mag is SAs leading speciality coffee publication, and had a strong presence with Mag producer Iain Evans making the Semis. The guys from The Coffee Mag were great hosts for the event along with the resident roastery FireBird.</p><p>The Coffee used was roasted by one of SAs best roasters Gerald Charles from Rock and Roller Coffee.</p><p>Charles: Guatemala SHG EP Huehuetnango Finca El Coyegual. Guatemala is one of the worlds top coffee origins and the eighth largest producer. This relatively small country boasts the most climatically diverse regions in the world. The soil, rainfall, humidity, altitude, and temperature are varied enough to produce seven distinct types of Guatemala Arabica coffee. Huehuetenango and Antigua coffees are well-known and highly rated.</p><p>Huehuetenango from the north highlands are exceptional coffees with distinct acidity and fruited flavours. Of the three non-volcanic regions, Huehuetenango is the highest and driest under cultivation. Due to the dry, hot winds that blow into the mountains from Mexicos Tehuantepec plain, the region is protected from frost. Cultivation  between 5000 and 5500 feet above sea level. A light medium to medium roast is suggested. This coffee has a sweet aroma, with a fruity start reminiscent of plums and a milk chocolate finish. Generally it is a great all round coffee. Flavour profile: Chocolate, Plum and Berries.</p><p>David Coleman, Wed expect to choose an African Coffee for the champs, and we cupped a few great Tanzanians and Kenyans along with this Gautamalan, but this one for me provided a great challenge for the brewers. Its had distinct acidity, sweetness and bitterness. This versatility would challenge them to choose a route, and go for a distinct flavour. Its was a real challenge for the brewers, and the results were radically varying coffees and lots of surprises in the cup. In the end Winstons mastery of the AeroPress and momentum gained through the rounds culminated in his eventual victory. Good Luck in Dublin Winston!</p><p>The final recipes were as follows:</p><p>Winstons 1st place:</p><p>1.&nbsp; &nbsp;  19 g coffee, medium to fine grind</p><p>2.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Inverted method add 40g of 15C water.</p><p>3.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Gentle Stir 30 seconds</p><p>4.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Add 180g 87C water</p><p>5.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Pressure plunge for 1min40sec using Aerobie paper filter</p><p>Kurts 2nd place:</p><p>1.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Inverted method, 30% course grind from Bodum hand grinder, 70% finer grind from Baratza</p><p>2.&nbsp; &nbsp;  1 measure of coffee on the Aeropress</p><p>3.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Top up with 79C water.</p><p>4.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Stir and plunge for 1min</p><p>Mels 3rd place:</p><p>1.&nbsp; &nbsp;  23g course plunger grind coffee</p><p>2.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Inverted add enough water for a 10 sec bloom.</p><p>3.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Fill to the top with 92C water.</p><p>4.&nbsp; &nbsp;  Stir, cap it, swirl and plunge.</p><p>5.&nbsp; &nbsp;  BOOM!</p><p>The <a href="http://www.moreflavour.co.za/coffee-making-products/aeropresscoffeemaker/">South African AeroPress champs</a> was a fitting after party for the SA Barista champs, which had just crowned Wayne Oberholzer as the new Champ.</p><p>It brought together fans and competitors to celebrate the culmination of the SA 2015 coffee circuit. South Africa chooses its barista champs from 2015 to compete in 2016, and the AeroPress followed suit.</p><p>The evening as in true AeroPress form, a jol (translation blast or crackin Ireland) for all fans and coffee industry folk alike in an evening of coffee, craft beer and boere rolls. (South African hot dog of sorts). South Africans are growing as passionate about their coffee as they are about their rugby and braais. And this crew here are the heart of a fast growing culture of fun and flavour.</p><p>                                                                               </p><p>Look out Dublin, the AmaCoffees are coming!  @MoreFlavourSA</p>

<p><br>7 amazing things you can't miss when in Kerala<br><br>Across the globe people have known Kerala as Gods own country. If you are wondering why this name, then you have to plan a trip to find out. The long coastline, warm and amicable people, rich culture and abundance of natures bliss and bounty make Kerala nothing short of paradise. <br>Here are 7 amazing things you cant miss when in Kerala. Some real mesmerizing things that you can take back home as memories.<br>Visit the backwaters <br>Think Kerala, think backwaters. In fact backwaters have somehow become synonymous with Kerala. You have to visit these pristine bylanes to know natures magic. Take a houseboat cruise and spend the day passing through the narrow backwaters. You could also get a smaller boat and venture deeper. It is an amazing experience to row through the backwaters, and should not be missed at all. <br>Enjoy Kathakali performance <br>Music and dance is an integral part of our culture. You can enjoy an elaborate Kathakali performance by local artists to get a glimpse into the rich heritage of the region. <br>Dig into local delicacies <br>How can a vacation be complete if you dont relish local delicacies? Kerala cuisine has become popular all across the country, but the fun of that original taste remains unmatched. Enjoy fluffly appams, idli, spicy seafood, delicious sweets and of course the star of the show  coconut water. <br>Watch the sunset at the beach <br>Kerala is home to various beaches. While many are commercial, some are still untouched and hidden gems. Take back memories for a lifetime when you watch a sunset at the beach. <br>Visit the Chinese Fishing Nets <br>Chinese Fishing Nets are one of the most popular attractions of Kerala. It would be a delight for you to watch these nets and how easily they get the days catch. Talk to the local fishermen and know more about the technique. <br>Shop for amazing silk sarees <br>Shopping for traditional silk sarees in Kerala should be a must on your itinerary. The intricately made beautiful sarees would be perfect for your wardrobe and a great gift to take back home. You could also shop for cotton sarees, and traditional gold jewelry. <br>Indulge in Kerala spa session<br>What can be better than some pampering at the spa on a vacation? Relax and rejuvenate while you enjoy a traditional Kerala spa and massage. <br></p><br>

<p>The holiday season is a time of joy and family togetherness.  However, one mistake can turn a celebration into a time of tragedy, warns Randy Wright, President of Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care, a national brand that services virtually any make and model vehicle.  &nbsp;Drinking and driving is one of the major causes of traffic fatalities, and statistics show it spikes during the holiday season.</p><p>The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) reports that 10,076 people were killed in crashes involving a drunk driver in 2013, the latest year for which statistics are available.  In December alone, 733 people died on our roads and highways  23 died on Christmas Day.</p><p>NHTSA is launching its annual Drive Sober of Get Pulled Over campaign, which runs from Dec. 16 through Jan. 1.  As part of the national enforcement campaign, police will increase the number of patrols, set up roadblocks and checkpoints, and use local media to get the message out to all drivers. Drivers caught drinking and driving could face jail time, fines, loss of drivers license, towing fees, and other DUI expenses that total $10,000 on average.</p><p>Its time for all drivers to get the message, said Wright. Drunk driving is a choice you make, and when you make that choice, people get hurt or die.  He said the safest way to get home is to drive sober or catch a ride with a sober designated driver. If you plan to drink at a holiday party or at a restaurant, hand the keys over to someone else  a sober friend  or use a taxi or public transportation.</p><p>NHTSA has a SaferRide mobile app, which allows users to call a taxi or a friend by identifying their location so they can be picked up. The app is available at <a href="http://ow.ly/RWs3S" title="Link: http://ow.ly/RWs3S">http://ow.ly/RWs3S</a> for Android and <a href="http://ow.ly/RWs8h" title="Link: http://ow.ly/RWs8h">http://ow.ly/RWs8h</a> for iPhone users.</p><p>In addition to reminding all drivers to drive sober, NHTSA asks everyone to be alert. If you see a drunk driver on the road, call the police right away. If someone you know is about to drive after drinking, take their keys and help them get home safely.</p><p>NHTSA reminds drivers that even one drink can impair your judgment and increase the risk of getting arrested for driving drunkor worse, the risk of having a crash.</p><p>                            </p><p>All of us at Cottman, including your local Cottman Man, work hard all year long to be sure your car is operating safely and smoothly, Wright said.  We urge our customers, as well as all drivers, to do their part by planning ahead and avoid putting themselves and others in a dangerous or life-threatening position by drinking and driving.  Its a simple choice, driven by common sense.</p><p><img alt="" src="http://www.ucarecdn.com/0cc43d23-4732-43c2-97fa-7a2592f2b38a/" title="Image: http://www.ucarecdn.com/0cc43d23-4732-43c2-97fa-7a2592f2b38a/"><br></p><p><b>About Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care:</b></p><p>With locations across the U.S., Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care is a transmission and auto repair brand that services almost any make or model vehicle, foreign or domestic.  Cottman Transmission and Total Auto Care centers specialize in complete transmission service, brakes, suspension, air conditioning service and much more.  Cottmans headquarters is based in Horsham, Pennsylvania.  For more information, please visit <a href="http://www.cottman.com/" title="Link: http://www.cottman.com/">www.Cottman.com</a> and <a href="http://www.thecottmanmanblog.com/" title="Link: http://www.thecottmanmanblog.com/">www.TheCottmanManBlog.com</a>.</p><p>            </p><p>*&nbsp; *&nbsp; *</p>
<p>Chicago, IL, December 11 - On Dec. 13, nationally renowned family law attorney, and celebrated author, Jeffery M. Leving will appear on WGCI (107.5 FM) at 7 a.m. helping divorced fathers cope during the holidays. He will also discuss the free upcoming <a href="http://www.responsiblefatherhood.com/">Illinois Council on Responsible Fatherhood</a><u>s</u> (ICRF) annual symposium on Dec. 19, which will take place from 11:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. at the Oak Park Library, 834 Lake Street, Oak Park, IL. Leving is the governor appointed ICRF Chairman and a moderator of the upcoming event.</p><p>Leving has compiled years of research that show the devastating effects of father absence on children. The presence of a father is even more vital around cornerstone events like Christmas, Hanukkah and Kwanzaa. The holidays provide opportunities to create memories and traditions to be shared, which is an essential part to maintaining stability and comfort in tumultuous lives that can grow and flourish from a divorced home.</p><p>Home is where the heart is and fathers are a crucial part to building the foundation, said Leving. The ICRF is here to provide a solution to father absence by promoting positive father involvement with their children and contributing resources to support all dads in all communities. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>The free ICRF symposium will focus on critical issues facing single and divorced fathers today. The symposiums speakers include social justice leaders as leading matrimonial attorney Maureen A. Gorman and Illinois private detective Wayne Halick, who will both speak on a wide range of fatherhood-related topics focused on keeping children safe during the holidays. Chairman Leving and ICRF council members want to ensure that fathers are provided the essential support and parenting tools to assume the important role they play in their childrens lives.</p><p>Attorney Leving is a leader in the fathers rights movement, attorney and author of the book <a href="http://www.amazon.com/How-Good-Divorced-Dad-Break-Up/dp/1118114108"><i>How to Be a Good Divorced Dad</i></a>, which has received praise from President Barack Obama, and was endorsed by Cardinal Francis George of the Archdiocese of Chicago. He has spent his life making significant strides supporting paternal involvement.&nbsp;</p><p>                          </p><p>Leving will also appear Saturday, Dec. 12 at 7 a.m. on WGRB (1390 AM) and Sunday, Dec. 13 at 7:30 a.m. on WVAZ V-103 with Darryl Dennard, continuing the discussion of these important topics. </p>
<p>  </p><p>Ski property specialist Skiingproperty.com has announced its top five resorts for purchasing a ski home in 2016, in a bid to help investors in the French Alps at a time when market conditions are highly favourable to international buyers.<br> <br> Incredibly low interest rates on euro mortgages combined with a weak euro look likely to continue into 2016, said Julian Walker, director at Skiingproperty.com. This is, of course, good news for UK buyers. Meanwhile, infrastructure upgrades in many resorts along with a French Government that is taking measures to stimulate its stagnant property market also indicate that 2016 will be a good time to invest in the French Alps. To help anyone beginning their search for a ski home, here are five resorts we have high hopes for next year.<br> <br> <u>Châtel<br></u><b>Why:</b> Two new ski lifts linking the massifs of Super-Châtel and Linga, providing skiers with easy access to the Portes du Soleil ski area and its 650 kilometres of slopes on a total of 285 pistes, open this season. The upgrade includes a new blue run completing a convenient circular route of the Portes du Soleil.<br> <b>Property:</b> Good choice of new-build, with prices from 150,000 for a studio.<br> <br> <u>Les Menuires<br></u><b>Why: </b>Crowned best family resort at the 2015 World Snow Awards, this is our favourite for anyone buying with family winter holidays in mind. Part of the huge Three Valleys ski area, the resorts children friendliness gets even better this season with the opening of the new Boquetin blue run and two new chair lifts. <br> <b>Property:</b> Ski-in ski-out leaseback apartment from 175,000.</p><p>  </p><p> <u>Les Deux Alpes<br></u><b>Why: </b>Ticking just about every box, from night life to off-piste activities, this resort has just won the best European resort award at the 2015 World Snow Awards. Much excitement this year focuses around the opening of a new blue run, a 10-million investment that completes a 10-kilometre long stretch of entirely blue pistes, starting at 3,600 metres and ending in the resort at 1,600 metres. Re-desiged fun zones also add to its appeal.</p><p>  </p><p><u>La Clusaz<br> </u><b>Why:</b> Chocolate box pretty, not many resorts combine Savoyard tradition with excellent skiing like La Clusaz does. From its weekly street market to the local production of the famous Reblochon cheese, it oozes the type of alpine authenticity suited to couples and families. And being an hours drive from Geneva Airport and just 20 minutes from the rail station at Annecy makes it a realistic weekend destination.<br> <b>Property:</b> 4-star leaseback apartments 142,590.</p><p>  </p><p><u>Val dIsère<br> </u><b>Why:</b> Famous for its lively après-ski and night life, now the skiing at Val dIsère, which is already world-class thanks to it being within the Espace Killy ski area, is set to get even better. August saw the launch of a 16-million, two-year redevelopment of the Solaise area directly above the resort, which will see a brand new mid-mountain station at 2,500 metres. To top off a good year, the resort won two awards at 2015 World Snow Awards - for the best mountain restaurant and best après-ski bar. Exciting times ahead for property-owners there!<br> <b>Property:</b> Luxury apartments near the centre from 900,000.</p><p>  <b>ENDS</b></p><p>  For further information or to enquire about:<br>Julian Walker<br> SkiingProperty.com<br> Tel: +44 20 8150 9502<br> Email: info@skiingproperty.com <br> Website: <a href="http://www.skiingproperty.com/" target="_blank">www.skiingproperty.com</a><b><i>&nbsp;</i></b></p><p>  </p><p><b><i>About Skiingproperty.com<br> </i></b><i>Skiingproperty.com, which is owned and operated by international property specialist Spot Blue International Property, works with developers in the French and Swiss Alps to promote new and off-plan developments to the UK and wider international market. Since its foundation in 2003, Spot Blue International Property has established itself as a leading international property specialist and is a member of the AIPP and NAEA. The companys high profile in the UK and worldwide means it is regularly quoted in the national press and invited to appear on panels at leading seminars and exhibitions. </i></p><p>  </p>

<p><b>What is the Outdoor LED Christmas lights?</b></p><p>Different from indoor lights, the outdoor LED lights use the better waterproof materials for outdoor use environment, be exposed to the weather. <a href="http://www.colordecorations.com/led-xmas-lights.html" title="Link: http://www.colordecorations.com/led-xmas-lights.html">Outdoor LED Christmas lights</a>&nbsp;mainly use the rubber cable + lamp cover injected with glue + shrink tube. The rubber cable have the better characteristics than PVC cable that used on indoor LED lights.</p><p>Besides, there are more copper wire inside outdoor power cable, which have the better security.</p><p>Talk about the waterproof rating, the outdoor Christmas lights can be up to IP65 waterproof rating according to Chinese waterproof standard. Note: IP65 waterproof rating standard is equal to the IP44 in Europe. In general, the most important characteristics of outdoor lights is the cold-resistant, waterproof, safety.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Application of Outdoor LED Christmas lights</b></p><p>Because outdoor Christmas lights use the waterproof &amp; cold-resistant materials, they can be used at all kinds of places, such as trees, building, billboard, square ornament and so on, of course they can be used indoor place such as house, store, mall, etc. During the Christmas holidays, many countries will wholesale the LED Christmas lights from China, there are many kinds of Xmas lights for selection, you can check Colordecorations to find some LED lights here.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>As the manufacturer, we produce some kinds of Christmas lights, such as&nbsp;<a href="http://www.colordecorations.com/led-xmas-lights/led-string-lights-3.html">LED string lights</a>, LED copper lights, LED net lights, LED strip lights, LED rope lights, LED curtain lights and so on. Each LED Xmas lights have two kinds, the indoor and outdoor version, absolutely depends on the customer's use place. <p>Traditional food drives are limited to donations of non-perishable food - often highly processed cans and boxes of food containing high amounts of sodium, sugar and fats. &nbsp;Unfortunately, people struggling with hunger also struggle with poor health and experience high rates of obesity, diabetes, hypertension and other diet related conditions. &nbsp; The primary reason for this is lack of &nbsp;access to healthy food. &nbsp;</p><p><a href="http://www.realfooddrive.org" target="_blank">Amp Your Good</a> has developed a new food kind of food drive called crowd-feeding that enables people to donate fresh fruits and vegetables instead of canned goods. &nbsp;Crowd-feeding helps to get people facing hunger the food they really need.</p><p>Here's a<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d4QDaDBbl7A" target="_blank"> brief video</a> about Crowdfeeding.&nbsp;</p>

<p>VAIRDO or WEIRDO by VAirDo Inc.</p><p><br></p><p>"We pride ourselves in making the worlds most cutting edge, smart and compact sensor, electronics and control systems being used in applications involving computer vision, wireless telemetry and smart computing/sensing"</p><p><br></p><p>BIONX: The Self-Cooling Bio-Inspired Drone</p><p><br></p><p>VAIRDO has developed a technique and automated cooling technology for Multi-Rotors using basic physics principles and construction using first principles.</p><p><br></p><p>VAIRDOs BIONX, powered by its BrainBox Technology &nbsp;is the worlds first self-cooled micro Drone.</p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Reason for the innovation </p><p>Current closed electronic and mechatronic systems often suffer from overheating of electric and mechatronic components, leading to need for additional cooling elements like heat-sinks, cooling fans, liquid cooling and more components causing weight increase and/or drag to objects moving through air.</p><p>Description of the invention </p><p>1.	The Venturi effect creates a net flow through a pipe with an opening across which a fluid is moving, the application is very useful in cooling flying vehicles or products which encounter airflow around them in normal operation (such as fans, cars, etc.) with closed bodies which house motors, electronics and heat generating parts. If constructed correctly, a network of holes on the skin of a flying vehicle or part/product interfacing with airflow could induce airflow through the body of the vehicle, or part/product, creating a cooling effect within the closed system or part, allowing for closer-constructed electronics without requiring bulky, heavy cooling apparatus or add-ons which either increase weight or add drag to the overall system in air, not to mention increased Bill of Materials (BOM) and cost. </p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>High / Low pressure zones for the BIONX Quad-copter with tailored Body, Winglets and housings to maximize air-flow and circulation</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Central Cooling and Air circulation through the patented and unique body design of the BIONX is the key in creating the most organic and natural, bio-inspired cooling solutions for light weight body designs especially seen on Air Vehicles and Micro Drones.</p><p><br></p><p>Air Inlet at low overall temperature and low pressure zone on the BIONX.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Airflow for the Propellers and surrounding air, channeled, directed and skimmed around the surfaces for maximum, active-passive cooling without additional weight, leading to tighter packaging and more compact applications.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>
<p><i>Poor care and lack of oversight put seniors in jeopardy daily</i></p><p>----------------</p><p>SUMMARY:&nbsp; Senior care expert Nathan J. Mazur is going on record to state that the quality of care provided in Independent Living facilities that offer Assisted Living services is inadequate and potentially dangerous to seniors. A focus needs to be placed on oversight of these typically unlicensed facilities to protect the elderly.</p><div><p><i></i></p>  </div><p>----------------&nbsp;</p><p><i>White Lake, Michigan</i>  I visit at least 20 different care oriented facilities on a monthly basis says Caring Completely Founder and CEO Nathan J. Mazur. More often than not, I see things that are disturbing. Whether it be an odor of urine, medication issues, staff yelling at a resident, or a resident who is struggling to eat but is being ignored, its common for me to see things that would be completely unacceptable to most people in this country. <i></i></p><p>&nbsp;Mazur states that electing a senior care provider is undoubtedly one of the toughest decisions people face today.&nbsp; But knowing who puts the needs of the senior first is a tough thing to figure out when companies all advertise the same high quality of services? Every person that families meet from every care oriented company says the same things. We are compassionate, We are loving, We treat them like they are our own family!, etc. How can that be true for every single company in the marketplace? The answer is, its not true! says Mazur. Unfortunately revenue and sales are typically the main focus of most senior care companies. When Im working with a family and helping them make decisions, I always tell them to focus on the people and places that made them feel comfortable. Everything starts with a relationship, and senior care is no different. But at the end of the day, this is a business, and these are business people doing what they have to do in order to hit numbers. The single biggest perpetrator of putting money over seniors is the Independent Living industry.</p><p>The Independent Living industry is a large aspect of the senior care business. Independent Living technically means that the seniors who reside in those facilities can do most things on their own. Many simply did not want to manage a home on their own any longer. As things in care have evolved, Independent Living facility operators figured out that the trick to long-term, high profits for their buildings was to keep people in their buildings as their health declines. Their belief is that if they can prevent someone from moving out, that is good for the bottom line. Mazur however wonders what is more important; the bottom line, or the seniors themselves? </p><p>Mazur continues, As I said, everyone will tell you that the needs of the seniors come first. Unfortunately, I have personally witnessed over and over that this is not the case in Independent Living. I have worked with families who have been told that their loved one can definitely stay in the Independent Living facility. When I meet with the family and evaluate their loved one, its very obvious within minutes that this person requires 24 hour care, and that its actually dangerous for them to remain there. They may be a fall risk, have dementia, or require assistance with all of their activities of daily living. In Independent Living facilities, the assisted living services are typically provided by a third party in-home care agency. These home care agencies and their staff are simply not qualified to handle a true assisted living resident. Checking on someone every two hours is a terrifying plan for someone who isnt safe by themselves. What if they fall right after a check? They may lay there for two hours until someone discovers that. So what I see all the time is that a family is told that they should purchase one-on-one care, at an hourly rate in order to keep their loved one safe. The cost of this type of service is usually $10,000 or more per month! To have a family do that, when they can move their loved one to a much more qualified facility for half (or less) of the cost is irresponsible, and greedy. In addition, its dangerous! Independent Living facilities are making these decisions based on the financial health of their facility instead of the true health of the senior! Thats just wrong! Its unethical and wrong!</p><p>In an effort to help educate consumers, Mazur has started a new education, advocacy, and placement assistance company called Caring Completely. Caring Completely is a movement of Long-Term Care Professionals working together to change the industry through a network of like-minded providers. Above all else, Mazur and his team believe that people deserve high quality care, and families deserve the ability to be educated about all of the potential options prior to making any decisions about which provider will likely be the best fit for their loved ones needs. If we can help families make decisions that help them sleep more soundly at night, I consider that a win every single time! said Mazur. &nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Its my goal and my intention to go out of my way to educate families, especially those who have loved ones utilizing assisted living services in Independent Living facilities, about the great, the good, the bad, and the ugly of the senior care industry. These people deserve to know the facts! Mazur continued.</p><p>The danger has only grown as more of these types of Independent Living facilities have opened up, and continue to open up. They are fantastic at providing a great environment for someone who is truly independent, or maybe needs some help being reminded to take their medications. But their ability to do anything above and beyond that in a safe and dignified way is very questionable.</p><p>                                                               </p><p>Nathan J. Mazur is an entrepreneur focused on the senior care industry. He has been featured in CNN Money, AOL/DailyFinance.com, Crains Detroit, and in the Detroit Free Press and The Observer &amp; Eccentric Newspapers. Mazur and his company own and operate multiple assisted living facilities throughout Southeastern Michigan, while also providing private duty in-home care services as well. Through his new company, Caring Completely, he frequently consults directly with families to help them make the best decision for a loved one who is no longer able to care for themselves. Follow Mazur on Facebook at: <a href="http://www.facebook.com/NathanJMazur" title="Link: http://www.facebook.com/NathanJMazur">www.facebook.com/NathanJMazur</a> and on Twitter at: <a href="http://www.twitter.com/nathanmazur">www.twitter.com/nathanmazur</a>. Caring Completely can be reached by calling Toll Free at (877) 616-6344, or by visiting their website directly at: <a href="http://www.CaringCompletely.com">www.CaringCompletely.com</a>. </p>
<p><b>An American Non-Profit Training Female Leaders To Build Social Enterprises</b><br></p><p>Cocoa, FL  I TALK TO STRANGERS® (ITTS) is a social movement bringing the world&nbsp;together through conversation founded by Robbie Stokes, Jr. in 2012. Stokes had an idea to&nbsp;start conversations with people he did not know, so he quit his job on Capitol Hill to travel the&nbsp;globe and document what would happen if he simply talked to strangers.</p><p>Teaming up with international community-based organizations, the ITTS YouTube channel will&nbsp;follow the movement and the development of social programs: Plenumigo, led by Natalia&nbsp;Bialobrzewska from Poland, and Project I SMILE, led by Malaysian native, Lakshanika&nbsp;Lammeera Shenkeri on an incredible journey filled with positive stories of what can happen&nbsp;when you dare to share with a stranger.</p><p>My mother taught me a genuine value for women. Supporting women-led programs embrace&nbsp;a true meaning of leadership beyond genders and a dedication to getting the job done&nbsp;effectively, shares Stokes.</p><p>Only 5.2% of Fortune 500 companies CEOs are women. I work with ITTS because their&nbsp;leadership selection process is based on qualities and skills rather than gender or race, adds&nbsp;ITTS researcher Lammeera.</p><p>Beginning Dec 1, 2015, ITTS has coordinated a global donation campaign called A Gift That&nbsp;Keeps On Giving to support the ITTS 2016 global activity agenda of projects, programs, and&nbsp;events that will educate youth and promote positive conversations among diverse groups of&nbsp;people.</p><p>ITTS ends their latest video with a global call-to-action to send a small gift that can create a&nbsp;global change with their kickoff social media campaign titled #letshelpNika, a project that is&nbsp;inspired by Grammy-Award winning artist Alicia Keys.&nbsp;</p><p>New videos on the I TALK TO STRANGERS® YouTube channel will premiere every Tuesday&nbsp;beginning January 5, 2016.</p>
<div><p>JERUSALEM, ISRAEL--(Marketwired - Dec 14, 2015) - Intec Pharma Ltd. (NASDAQ:&nbsp;NTEC) (TASE:&nbsp;INTP), a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing drugs based on its proprietary Accordion Pill platform technology, today announced that it has received a US centralized institutional review board (IRB) approval to initiate its Phase III clinical trial for its lead product, the Accordion Pill Carbidopa/Levodopa, or AP-CDLD, for the treatment of Parkinson's disease symptoms in advanced Parkinson's disease patients. </p><p>Approximately 460 patients will be enrolled in this single pivotal Phase III study in advanced Parkinson's disease patients. The total treatment period for each patient will be 25 weeks. The primary efficacy endpoint will be a change from baseline to termination of treatment in the percent of daily off time during waking hours.&nbsp;</p><p>Zeev Weiss, CEO of Intec Pharma, said: "Levodopa is the most effective and widely used treatment for Parkinson's disease symptoms. However, reports indicate that up to 50% of patients show onset of motor fluctuations within two years of starting conventional Levodopa therapy. Various approaches are attempting to address this issue. We are very excited to receive IRB approval and to be entering into our Phase III clinical trial for our lead product candidate, AP-CDLD."&nbsp;</p><p>About Intec Pharma Ltd.</p><p>Intec Pharma Ltd. is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing drugs based on its proprietary Accordion Pill platform technology. The Company's Accordion Pill is an oral drug delivery system that is designed to improve the efficacy and safety of existing drugs and drugs in development by utilizing an efficient gastric retention and specific release mechanism. The Company's product pipeline currently includes three product candidates in clinical trial stages: Accordion Pill Carbidopa/Levodopa, or AP-CDLD, is being developed for the indication of treatment of Parkinson's disease symptoms in advanced Parkinson's disease patients Accordion Pill Zaleplon, or AP-ZP, for the indication of the treatment of insomnia, including sleep induction and the improvement of sleep maintenance, is our second pipeline product. We are also developing a third Accordion Pill for the treatment of gastoduodenal and small bowel Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug induced ulcers.</p><p>Forward Looking Statements</p><p>This press release contains forward-looking statements about the Company's expectations, beliefs and intentions. <p><b>54th Annual AAF Dallas American Advertising Awards to be Presented Feb. 18<br> <br> </b><b></b></p><p>Dallas, Texas<b> </b>(Dec. 14, 2015) <b>? </b>The American Advertising Federation Dallas Chapter (<a href="http://aafdallas.org/">AAF Dallas</a>) is now accepting entries for its 54th Annual AAF Dallas American Advertising Awards, more commonly referred to as The ADDYs. The organization has also announced its theme for this years event as Fantasy Advertising. The ADDYs Gala will be held Feb.18, 2016 at Gas Monkey Live. </p><p>Taking a cue from the increasingly popular Fantasy Football movement, each entry will automatically be entered into the AAF Dallas draft Jan. 21. Each agency participating in the awards will have the opportunity to create a team and scout players creative directors, art directors, copy writers and flex players  on the draft board. Results will stream live at the award show in February.</p><p>The American Advertising Awards represent the true spirit of creative excellence by recognizing all forms of advertising from media of all types, creative by all sizes and entrants of all levels from anywhere in the world. Selection of the most creative entry in each category is conducted through a scoring process in which a panel of judges evaluates all creative dimensions of every entry.</p><p>To enter, please visit <a href="http://fantasyaddys.com/index.html">http://fantasyaddys.com/index.html</a>. Entrants will be directed to the competition site, to complete the entrant information form. For each entry, registrants must review the list of categories to select the appropriate category for their work. </p><p>Online entries are due January 5, 2016 by 4p.m.&nbsp; There will be an extended deadline of Monday, January 11 by 4pm, with a $50 per entry late fee for all entries submitted after 4p.m. on January 5, with no exceptions. Any entries received after this time will not be judged.&nbsp; </p><p>Physical entries are required.&nbsp; All work must be delivered to Clampit Creative Center located at 9207 Ambassador Row, Dallas, TX 75247 no later than January 11th by 4 p.m.&nbsp; For more information about the official rules and how to enter, please visit <a href="http://fantasyaddys.com/index.html">http://fantasyaddys.com/index.html</a>.</p><p><b>About AAF Dallas</b></p><p>Founded in 1908, <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">AAF Dallas</a> is nearly 1,000 members strong and is affiliated with the <a href="http://www.aaf10.org">10th District of the American Advertising Federation</a>, part of <a href="http://www.aaf.org">AAF</a>s national network of more than 200 ad clubs and 40,000 professionals. AAF Dallas, AAFs 2010-2011 Division 1 Club of the Year, strives to elevate the success of the advertising community through innovation, creative excellence, collaboration, professional development, education and philanthropic endeavors. To find out how to get involved in the Dallas ad community, visit <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">www.aafdallas.org</a>, Facebook <a href="https://www.facebook.com/AAFDallas">https://www.facebook.com/AAFDallas</a>, Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/AAFDallas">https://twitter.com/AAFDallas</a> and Instagram <a href="https://t.yesware.com/tl/be8fbd5a8eb6dfd92f73b61e00659d66a3bbaddd/2b3b98e189710c9afb044e53bb47cc67/540205e58b7a48dc53225f155ba7ea3b?ytl=http%3A%2F%2Finstagram.com%2Faafdallas">http://instagram.com/aafdallas</a>.</p><p>###</p><p><b>Contact:</b></p><p>Jo Trizila</p><p>TrizCom PR.</p><p>Public Relations Chair  AAF Dallas</p><p>                                                        </p><p>(972) 247-1369 or <a href="mailto:jo@trizcom.com">jo@trizcom.com</a></p>
<div>Each year, more than 75 Million people make at least one food donation to one of the millions of a food drives organized in the US.  Unfortunately, the traditional food drive model limits donations to non-perishable food items, typically highly processed canned goods lacking in nutritional quality. &nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>As such, there is a disconnect between what food drives produce and what's actually needed.  I know I'm preaching to the choir, but the rates of diet related health conditions (obesity, diabetes, hypertension, etc.) among the food insecure population are staggering.  The idea of donating a canned good laden with sodium and sugar to people with these health issues is obviously nonsensical.</div><div><br></div><div><span style="line-height: 18.1818px;">It's great that so many people want to help.  It's unfortunate that they are donating the wrong stuff, which is why we developed our Crowd-feeding platform - an online food drive system that enables people to donate fresh fruits, vegetables and other healthy foods instead of the usual stuff.  Our system ensures that the good intentions actual have when they donate food have a positive impact.  We've reinvented the food drive model to turn the billions of canned goods donated each year into healthy, impactful food. &nbsp;</span><br></div>

<p><b>Mumbai, India  December 15, 2015  </b>Freedom Mortgage Corporation, a privately held, full-service residential mortgage lender licensed in all 50 states, was named winner of the prestigious 2015 Global Award for Excellence in BPM &amp; Workflow for its business process management technology.&nbsp; Jointly sponsored by the Workflow Management Coalition (WfMC) and BPM.Com, the 2015 Global Excellence Awards recognize user organizations that have demonstrably excelled in implementing innovative business process solutions to meet strategic business objectives.&nbsp; Freedom Mortgage was previously recognized for its achievements in the WfMC 2014 awards.<b></b></p><p>Freedom Mortgage acknowledged the vital contributions of Nividous Software Solutions in winning the award.&nbsp; We are delighted to win this prestigious award for a second time in a row, said Freedom Mortgage Chief Information Officer Robert DUrbano. Our team, working with Nividous, has done an exemplary job addressing the challenges triggered by our tremendous business growth over the last several years and is richly deserving of this recognition, he said.&nbsp;</p><p>Freedom Mortgage is renowned for using the most advanced technologies and providing best in class services to its clients, borrowers and partners.&nbsp; It has built more than 25 process solutions across its retail, wholesale and correspondent business lines, creating one of the industrys most efficient organizations.<i> </i>Freedom Mortgage has partnered with Nividous since early 2014 to expedite its BPM Program, and awards were won in both years. The WfMC award has highlighted that our deep experience in BPM implementation, combined with technology strength, ensures customer success, said Kaushal Mashruwala, Nividous Software Solutions co-founder. We look forward to working closely with Freedom Mortgage for continued achievement in the BPM program lifecycle.&nbsp;</p><p>Having superior technology is more important for lenders and borrowers now than ever before, said Freedom Mortgage President Stanley Middleman.&nbsp; We are committed to constantly improving our business processes to create great lending experiences for our customers and partners across all of our business channels.&nbsp; I am most proud of Freedom Mortgages technology team and all they have accomplished, he said.&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Freedom Mortgage</b></p><p>Freedom Mortgage is a national, full-service mortgage banker that provides origination and servicing through retail, wholesale, correspondent and commercial divisions. The company is licensed in all 50 states, Washington DC and Puerto Rico. Freedom Mortgage maintains an<i>&nbsp;</i>A+ rating with the Better Business Bureau and is known for using the most advanced technologies and providing world-class service to its clients, borrowers and partners. The company was founded in 1990 and is headquartered in Mount Laurel, New Jersey. The club operates several professional mens programs as well as a ladies team (Griffins Ladies) and a developmental academy and youth program.</p><p>The support weve received from our fans, businesses and the community over the years has been phenomenal, and Legacys sponsorship is another proof of this, said Phill Camm, owner and managing director of Griffins Rugby Club. Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care is a leader in their industry, and we look forward to seeing their presence on the pitch.</p><p>Legacy ER &amp; Urgent Care is headquartered in Plano and operates health care centers in Allen, Coppell, Frisco, Keller, McKinney and North Richland Hills, Texas. It has built an exceptional customer service program and rating by providing transparent billing, soothing environments and one-on-one service with board-certified, emergency-trained physicians. Patients have access to immediate, on-site emergency room equipment and only pay emergency care prices when it is truly an emergency. <p><b>Who:</b> 	Transformance, Inc. Greater Dallas Business Ethics Awards; Event Co-Chairs: Michael A. Deadline for entries is March 1, 2016. Private or public companies of any size may enter the award process. Nonprofit companies and financial service companies are not eligible to participate. Prospective nominees should be companies that have demonstrated a commitment to high ethical standards and corporate responsibility by the way they deal with their customers, their employees, their suppliers and the public at large. The program benefits Transformance, Inc., and is presented by Akin Gump, D CEO and Better Business Bureau serving Dallas and Northeast Texas.</p><p>Companies entering the Award competition will be judged in one of three categories based on the number of employees:</p><p>	Large  company with more than 2,500 employees</p><p>	Midsized  company with 250 to 2,500 employees</p><p>	Small (or Micro) Companies with fewer than 250 employees</p><p>A company may be nominated for consideration by a customer, client, employee, consultant, vendor, or may self-nominate. To nominate a company for an award, choose one of two options:</p><p>1)	Online: Fill out and submit electronically here: <a href="http://gdbea.org/online-nomination">http://gdbea.org/online-nomination</a></p><p>2)	Print out a nomination form and mail to: Greater Dallas Business Ethics Awards, P.O. <p><b><i>Gold and Silver Collectable Coins Can Make a Meaningful Holiday Gift This Year</i></b></p><p>ADDISON, TEXAS (Dec. 16, 2015)Holiday shoppers looking for memorable gift ideas should consider gifting coins for family and friends, suggests Dallas-based <a href="http://www.dillongage.com/">Dillon Gage Metals</a>. With both the U.S. and Royal Canadian Mints issuing specifically themed holiday catalogs, the selections and offerings make cherished Christmas presents or stocking stuffers. </p><p>Holiday coin options from various countries are on the market and are minted with the collector in mind. A cursory review shows gold and silver coin themes reflecting historical figures and events, nature and conservatory issues, and even military appreciation coins available for purchase.</p><p>Following the spirit of the holiday season and noting that they are not a coin retailer, international precious metals wholesaler Dillon Gage Metals provides useful tips and trends for those wishing to gift coins for Christmas in 2015:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Unusually low prices throughout 2015 for both gold and silver have made buying coins and collection sets a much more reasonably priced gift option this year.<br> </p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Keep your audience in mind as you shop for coins. With such a wide selection of coins, it shouldnt be too difficult to find a specific theme that has a particular and special meaning for your gift recipient.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Purchasing a collector coin set for beginners is an excellent way to spark and inspire a lifelong passion for collecting and investing in precious metals for the younger generation.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Buying from well-known sovereign mints such as the <a href="http://catalog.usmint.gov/">U.S. Mint</a> or <a href="http://www.mint.ca/store/template/home.jsp">Royal Canadian Mint</a> is advisable. Regardless of where you shop, be certain that you purchase coins or collector sets from a reputable precious metals dealer.<br> </p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Shopping online for gold and silver coins offers flexibility in both the price and what you receive. Spend a little time browsing selections to compare ounces to dollars before adding to your online cart.</p><p>Consider the gift of gold or silver coins and collector sets this holiday season. A memorable gift of precious metals provides the thoughtfulness and intrinsic value missing in so many other options.</p><p>###</p><p><b>About Dillon Gage Metals</b><br> Dillon Gage Inc. of Dallas (DillonGage.com), founded in 1976, companies include:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Dillon Gage Metals (<a href="http://www.DillonGage.com/Metals">www.DillonGage.com/Metals</a>), one of the worlds largest precious metals wholesale trading firms. The firm is an authorized purchaser for all major world mints and maintains inventory in over 20 countries around the world. 800-375-4653</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  FizTrade Online Trading (<a href="http://www.FizTrade.com">www.FizTrade.com</a>) offers real-time bid/ask trading platform for gold, silver, platinum and palladium. 800-375-4653</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Digital Metals (<a href="http://www.DigitalMetals.com">www.DigitalMetals.com</a>) delivers advanced tools and technologies that enable market participants to be more successful in their businesses. Digital Metals offers cloud-based solutions for the physical precious metals marketplace built upon the Digital Metals Platform. 866-494-3577 </p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Dillon Gage Refining (<a href="http://www.dillongage.com/refining/why-dg">www.dillongage.com/refining/why-dg</a>), professional assayers and refiners of precious metal scrap, from low grade to karat scrap. <p>             <b><i></i></b><i>Value-Added Feature Part of Total Website Revamp&nbsp;</i><b><i> &nbsp; </i></b><br></p><p>JENKINTOWN, PA  (Dec. 16, 2015)  Programmatic ad tech firm, <a href="http://www.goodwaygroup.com">Goodway Group</a>, has unveiled an online target rating points (TRP) calculator as part of a recent revamp to their website. Now, existing and potential clients have the ability to access a free portal to assess online impressions for digital ad campaigns. Goodway is the only programmatic firm offering this value-added service on their website.&nbsp;</p><p>Users can now convert their own TRP goals into online impressions or vice versa. As agencies evolve from buying TV to Video, media planners need to understand how moving dollars into digital will impact their communication plans. Driven by Nielsens population data, this featured tool will help digital advertisers answer key questions, such as:</p><p>1)   How many TRPs does xx impressions equate to in my market?</p><p>2)   How many impressions do I need to get to xx TRPs in my market?&nbsp;</p><p>Existing clients and even potential new ones will now have the ability to answer key questions about their digital campaigns <i>before</i> they run, states Jay Friedman, chief operating officer of Goodway Group. Its a value-added service that we hope will keep our clients as informed as possible about the strategy of their existing and future campaigns.</p><p>The total website revamp effort, created by 28Media, highlights Goodways shift to modern-day managed programmatic services while still honoring the history and values of the 86-year-old, third-generation family-owned company.</p><p>The updated Goodway website features also features new content and conversion points such as:</p><p>·  &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Seventh Edition of the <i>30 Days to Paid Digital Media Expertise</i> Book</b>: Written by Jay Friedman, chief operating officer of the Goodway Group, the reference book assists newcomers in easily understanding digital media targeting, real-time bidding, native advertising and attribution. Users are welcome to download a .PDF copy.</p><p>·  &nbsp; &nbsp;  <b>Updated Case Studies</b>: The new case studies format displays Goodways success in achieving elevated lift over control and buy through rates for clients in multiple industries, including consumer packaged goods, automotive and health care.</p><p>Change is both good and exhilarating. It keeps us nimble, keeps us pushing forward, states Jay Friedman. Our ability to transform over the years is how we built our success and how we stay at the forefront of the digital industry, offering only the best digital support, tools and integrated Web resources to our clients.</p><p>In addition to these new value-added client resources, the site also boasts easier navigation, streamlined content and rich imagery, creating a better user experience for both current clientele and future customers. To utilize these value-added features and explore the updated site, please visit <a href="http://www.goodwaygroup.com">www.goodwaygroup.com</a>.</p><p><b>About Goodway Group</b></p><p>Goodway Group is a leading managed-services programmatic partner to local, regional and Fortune 500 brand agencies. Bootstrapped and 100 percent privately owned since 1929, Goodway moved into the programmatic digital media space in 2006 to continue its rich history of tackling complex local and regional campaign executions with data science-driven targeting and support services to make achieving success easy for agency clients. Its proprietary algorithms pair with a technology-agnostic approach to enable agencies and marketers to achieve their ultimate goal  better results while remaining lean and nimble.</p><p>###</p><p><b>Media Contact:</b></p><p>Nikki Darling<br>TrizCom PR<br>Office: 972-247-1369<br>Nikki@TrizCom.com</p><p>Jo Trizila<br>TrizCom PR<br>Office: 972-247-1369<br>Jo@TrizCom.com&nbsp;</p>

<p></p><p>  </p><p><i>The Beta version of CreateOnlineAcademy is now available online and it is open for both teachers and students as education platform. The teachers or educators can create their academy for free and promote their courses online. On the other hand the students can find the academy, browse for courses of their choice and enroll in the courses they need to take. </i>  </p>  <p>The E-Learning and E-Teaching Industry has taken a new turn in the past decade and rapidly evolving into one of the most preferred classroom environment in the globe, especially for working people, extra-learning students, hobbyists and others. </p>However, conducting a live lecture online attached with a complete module of learning management system with complete environment of an online entity is often challenged by numerous disintegrated web-based platforms. Apart from that creating a custom made online academy is not only time consuming and needs computer programming with Network management skills but is also equally astronomically expensive.<br><p> For that reason, CreateOnlineAcademy have developed an integrated learning management platform offered as Software as a Service, where anyone can get their own online academy website; with just a click.</p>    <p>The dreamer behind this concept - Anand Vardhan Tiwary is a First Class Marine Engineer, Maritime Blogger and a part time trainer of Marine Engineering.&nbsp; Prashanr R. Shah Architect of the Create Online Academy, is a computer engineer with 11+ years of experience in developing various cutting edge internet technologies. He also heads his own software company VeerIT and strongly believes in the virtues of patience, innovation &amp; recognizes the benefits they provide.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p><b>CreateOnlineAcademy Provides Ten Reasons To Start Now </b>  <p>1.&nbsp; &nbsp; No knowledge of Computer Programming is Required and yet the teacher gets a separate online Academy with your Own URL and Design. </p>  <p>2.&nbsp; &nbsp; They&nbsp; get a ready-made e-teaching website backed with Learning Management System and Webinar functions with which they can conduct live classes online. </p>  <p>3.&nbsp; &nbsp; They can take fool-proof tests and interviews without the need of an invigilator or additional support to ensure a true online test.</p>  <p>4.&nbsp; &nbsp; The&nbsp; e-teaching website will be available for online teaching from mobile and pads.(Responsive template)</p>  <p>5.&nbsp; &nbsp; The Course will be consisting of Sections, Lectures and Quizzes where contents of any format can be very easily inserted by the teacher.</p>  <p>6.&nbsp; &nbsp; They&nbsp; can set mandatory reading time for your contents and also earn profit (CreateOnlineAcademy wont charge commission for that) by selling those downloadable contents online in their own e-teaching platform, created by us. </p>  <p>7.&nbsp; &nbsp; After creating the website CreateOnlineAcademy also guarantee full support (under judicial oath) to help you design the website, in case the teacher needs and that too without any extra cost.</p>  <p>8.&nbsp; <p><b>FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: 11/18/2015</b></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Cory Nelson</b></p><p><b>Field Agent®</b></p><p><b>(479) 755-4499</b></p><p><a href="mailto:cory.nelson@fieldagent.net"><b>cory.nelson@fieldagent.net</b></a></p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>Field Agents Live Black Friday Scoreboard Tracks Which Retailers Are </b><b>Winning The Biggest Shopping Day Of The Year</b></p><p><i>&nbsp;</i></p><p><i>Real-Time Photos and Survey Results Offer the First Look at the Black Friday Action</i></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (November 18, 2015) Field Agent, the pioneer provider of mobile audits and research, is offering a real-time photo feed of what shoppers are seeing in stores this Black Friday. Using the Field Agent mobile app, users will provide crowdsourced photos and survey data for near-instantaneous display on <a href="http://hubs.ly/H01qv0t0" title="Link: http://hubs.ly/H01qv0t0">BlackFridayScoreboard.com</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>With more traditional and online retailers extending Black Friday deals throughout the month, there are many questions about the role of Black Friday in the overall holiday retail scene. Through Field Agents scoreboard, interested parties will be able to view real-time data on how many people are participating in the annual shopping event. A full report will be released following the event, detailing how consumers are shopping online, both prior to Black Friday and on Cyber Monday. <a href="http://hubs.ly/H01qtYl0">You can sign up to receive the full report here.</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Getting a pulse on the kick-off of the Christmas Shopping season has never been easier than with our Black Friday Panel, says CEO and Co-founder Rick West. Viewers will get up-to-date information on the top retailers shopped by consumers, including photos from stores. Our live feed provides a perspective that both suppliers and retailers alike are looking for, and the best part is we provide it in real time.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>This will be the second straight year Field Agent provides an inside look at the critical start of the holiday shopping season. Last year, the companys scoreboard featured photos and data from 400 shoppers across the country, and several thousand tuned in to watch the real-time stream.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>The countdown is currently live at <a href="http://hubs.ly/H01qv0t0">BlackFridayScoreboard.com</a>, where you can <a href="http://hubs.ly/H01qwKw0">sign up to be notified</a> once the action begins.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About Field Agent: </b>Headquartered in Fayetteville, Arkansas, Field Agent leverages its network of 800,000 Agents to connect businesses with quality information around the world. For more information on mobile research and audits visit our <a href="http://hubs.ly/H01qv2Z0">blog</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Follow Field Agent® on <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/941924?trk=vsrp_companies_res_name&amp;trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A2574751671442938595699%2CVSRPtargetId%3A941924%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary">LinkedIn</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/FieldAgentInc">Twitter</a> to stay up-to-date with current projects and research materials. </p><p>                                                                   </p><p>&nbsp;</p>
A womans role in business has evolved considerably over the past century. As the era of the housewife dissolved and women entered the business world by storm, many have since experienced a struggle to break through the corporate glass ceiling. Discrimination, pre-existing attitudes and the constant competition made the glass ceiling a controversial topic that was often swept under the rug.<div><p>Skip forward to present day, where women are truly shining in the business world. With more Owners, Founders and C level women business leaders than ever, the cannabis industry has not been neglected from the integration. As the industry forms at an alarming rate, so have the opportunities for driven and intelligent women to make a positive impact while rising to the top.</p><p>Within the legal cannabis industry, there is a diverse, broad cross-section of business opportunities that include not only internal segments such as dispensaries, cultivators, and labs, but also numerous ancillary businesses, including outsourced human resources, legal services, marketing and public relations, to name just a few.</p><p>Many of the voices supporting the cannabis industry are long-time advocates who have been driven by their passion for their civil rights and the overhanging health issues in our global community. Women have been a strong force at the forefront of this movement and are propelling the legal cannabis business at such a rapid pace, that there is no doubt that the cannabis industry could very well become the first female dominated multi-billion dollar global industry.</p><p>Recently, I had the opportunity to speak with several female thought leaders in the industry to gain their valuable insights and perspectives on how women truly are emerging as a dominant force and how other entrepreneurs can capitalize on this industry.</p><h4>Theres No Glass Ceiling in Legal Cannabis</h4><p>Case in point,&nbsp;<a href="https://angel.co/giadhaadc" target="_blank">Giadha DeCarcer</a>, an Ivy League-educated serial entrepreneur who obtained her undergraduate degree from the University of Pennsylvania and a masters degree from Georgetown University, has 20 years experience in management, business execution, strategic business development, and has long focused on emerging markets. DeCarcer, a legal cannabis entrepreneurial powerhouse in her own right, identified a void in the legal cannabis industrythe lack of reliable and actionable dataand built&nbsp;<a href="http://www.frontierfinancials.com/" target="_blank">New Frontier Financial</a>&nbsp;into one of the leading big data research and technology companies in the industry.</p><p>Given that women have been in many male-dominated industries struggling to be heard or to make as much of an impact as we may have desired, we have had much more of an incentive to enter a high-risk space such as the cannabis industry early on, opines Giadha DeCarcer, the founder and Chief Executive Officer of New Frontier Financial.</p><blockquote><p>I believe that this greater appetite to take a chance stems from our own risk-reward equation  we have less to lose and much more to win. As such, we have entered the industry guns blazing, educated, hungry and excited to finally have a clear path forward, with no glass ceiling, no ceiling period.</p></blockquote><p>According to&nbsp;<a href="http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2014/03/06/womens-college-enrollment-gains-leave-men-behind/" target="_blank">Pew Research</a>, statistics show that women are graduating from college and receiving masters degrees in greater numbers than men. Likewise, the&nbsp;<a href="https://www.sba.gov/" target="_blank" title="Link: https://www.sba.gov/">Small Business Administration</a>&nbsp;reports that in part, because ten to twenty years ago, many women left their careers to raise a family are also now re-entering the workforce, the growth of new businesses created by women is increasing faster than that of men.</p><h4>Advice for Aspiring Female Entrepreneurs</h4><p><a href="http://jazminhupp.com/" target="_blank">Jazmin Hupp</a>, co-founder and executive director of&nbsp;<a href="http://womengrow.com/" target="_blank">Women Grow</a>, an organization founded to connect, educate, and empower women in the cannabis industry, offers advice to women considering a career or launching a business in the legal cannabis industry:</p><blockquote><p>We have a lot of amazing women in this industry. If youre thinking about yourself personally, the first step is just to examine your own skill set. See what youre really fabulous at. If you come from a marketing background, then looking at doing marketing in the cannabis industry is going to be a great first step.</p></blockquote><p>Hupp continues, If you dont have professional expertise that lends itself to serving other businesses or serving the cannabis industry, then the first stop, honestly, is probably going to be getting a job with an existing cannabis company. Thats why a lot of folks come to our monthly events, to meet people in the cannabis community and get an understanding of which types of companies they might want to work for.</p><p><a href="http://www.bizjournals.com/bizwomen/news/profiles-strategies/2014/06/what-a-21-year-old-venture-capitalist-can-teach.html" target="_blank">Yoela Palkin</a>, another female entrepreneur and co-founder of&nbsp;<a href="http://www.wherefour.com/">Wherefour, Inc.</a>, an innovative Silicon Valley-based cash-management and analytics startup catering to dispensaries observes, As a female whos grown up in the tech industry, Im used to seeking out sectors with challenges that can be solved through new product development. Theres a huge opportunity [for women] to dive in and be one of the first innovators, but it also takes a strong work ethic and a deep understanding of your customers real issues.</p><h4>Final Words of Advice</h4><p>While the legal cannabis industry has matured significantly over the years, medical and adult use is still illegal under federal law. Likewise, because laws and regulatory frameworks differ significantly from state to state, there still is somewhat of a wild west element to the industry. Consequently, authorities in the industry believe it imperative that aspiring entrepreneurs take their respective roles seriously and deliberately. According to <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/reneeharrison" target="_blank" title="Link: https://www.linkedin.com/in/reneeharrison">Renee Harrison</a>, Founder and CEO of&nbsp;<a href="http://mogulymedia.com/" target="_blank">Moguly Media</a>:</p><blockquote><p>For women who are new to the industry or established, I suggest they commit to learning as much as they can about the industry and keep up with the landscape as it continually involves. You cant know everything, so define your niche and dont ever stop learning.</p></blockquote><p>Harrison further advises, Take continuing education classes, attend conferences, and network through organizations such as Women Grow. Then contribute to the industry and your peers; share your knowledge with the world by mentoring others, contributing to publications, volunteering to be a guest on podcasts, and even consider writing a book. Not only will you be making a positive contribution to the legitimacy of the industry, but you will build your personal brand and business in the process.</p></div>

<p>Tis the season to give. And this year <a>Solis Mammography</a>, the nations largest independent provider of mammography services, will give a $10 donation for every mammogram scheduled by Dec. 31. Here is the fine print:</p><p></p><ul><li>Depending on the patients preference, the donation will go to either <a href="https://www.nokidhungry.org/">No Kid Hungry</a>, <a href="http://www.stjudechild.org/">St. Jude Childrens Research Hospital</a> or <a href="http://ihaveadreamfoundation.org/">I Have a Dream Foundation</a>.<br></li><li>The appointment must be performed at one of Soliss 30 centers by Jan. 15.<br></li><li><a href="http://newsroom.solismammo.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/All-Solis-Locations.pdf">Solis centers</a> are in Dallas and Houston, Texas; Phoenix, Ariz.; Columbus, Ohio; and Greensboro, N.C.<br></li><li>The mammography must be scheduled between now and Dec. 31.<br></li><li>To redeem this offer, call 866.717.2551, and use code 1231SM.<br></li></ul><p></p><p>Giving back to deserving charities as a way to encourage women to get their annual mammogram just makes sense  especially this time of year, says James Polfreman, Solis president and CEO. Only about half of US women get their mammogram, including those with insurance. We want to increase that number in 2016. We wish our patients, employees and communities health and wellness in the new year!<br></p><p><b>About Solis Mammography</b></p><p>Solis Mammography is a specialized healthcare provider focused exclusively on providing women an exceptional mammography experience. Headquartered in Addison, Texas, Solis currently operates 31 centers across four states  Texas, Arizona, Ohio and North Carolina. The company operates both wholly owned centers and multiple successful joint ventures with hospital partners. Solis provides a complete range of highly specialized breast health services including screening and diagnostic mammography (2D and 3D), computer-aided detection, breast ultrasound, stereotactic biopsy and ultrasound-guided biopsy. They prefer white wines such as Riesling, Pinot Grigio, Sauvignon Blanc and unoaked Chardonnay. They often gather with their friends to play Wine Games.
