<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">We welcome you to the&nbsp;<strong>International Conference on Spine and Spinal Disorders</strong>&nbsp;to be held during&nbsp;<strong>June 30-July 02, 2016</strong>&nbsp;at&nbsp;<strong>Valencia, Spain</strong>.&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spine 2016</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt; color:black">&nbsp;will be organized around the theme <strong><i>Tearing down the veil to a better Spine health</i></strong>. </span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spine</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;is a vital part of your body which supports majority of your body weight and enables you to gain control over your sensation and movements.&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spinal disorders</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;are extremely common- it ranges from infants to the elderly; so also spinal trauma .Spinal health has gigantic impact on life.</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spina bifida</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">occurs in seven of out every 10,000 live births in the United States. The average total lifetime cost to society for each infant born with<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">spina bifida</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">is approximately $532,000 per child. This estimate is only an average and for many children the total cost may be well above $1 million. Estimated annual medical care and surgical costs for persons with<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">spina bifida</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">in the United States exceed $200 million.<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Sciatica</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">is a relatively common problem. About 90% of the time<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">sciatica</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">is due to a spinal disc herniation pressing on one of the lumbar or sacral nerve roots.<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spondylolisthesis</span></a><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;color:black">,<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">spinal stenosis</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt; color:black">, piriformis syndrome, pelvic tumors, and compression by a baby's head during pregnancy may also contribute to sciatica.<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Scoliosis</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">is a multifactorial disorder, which requires multidisciplinary research and treatment; affecting 2-3% of the population and there is no cure.<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Scoliosis</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">impacts infants, adolescents, and adults worldwide, the primary age of onset being 10-15 years old.<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Kyphosis</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">is often related to<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">osteoporosis</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">but in children it can be due to injury, a tumor on the<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">spine</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt; color:black">, or a genetic disorder, such as<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">spina bifida</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt; color:black">.</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Osteoporosis</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">is the most common cause of fractures. Worldwide,<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">osteoporosis</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">causes more than 8.9 million fractures annually, resulting in an osteoporotic fracture every 3 seconds. The risk of a fracture increases with age and is greatest in women. Spain, the 6<sup>th &nbsp;</sup>largest country in Europe with a population of 46.77 million,stands third in the list of highest incidence of spine injury cases in Europe with 23.5 injuries per million per year. Most recent estimates from Europe indicate motor vehicle crashes to be the leading cause of SCIs in regions of Spain followed by falls (24.6%).Most motor vehicle crashes leads to<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">whiplash</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">injury which later results in<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">cervicalgia</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt; color:black">. More than 1,500<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">whiplash</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">claims are made in the UK every day. More than 50% of<span class="apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">whiplash</span></a><span class="apple-converted-space"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">cases resolve after a few weeks of treatment. However, approximately 30% of cases become chronic and persist for months or years.Globally every year between 250,000 and 500,000 people suffer spinal cord injury. In Europe around 333,000 are currently affected.Spain has around 100 universities and 200 hospitals working in the field&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spine</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;and&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spinal disorders</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">. There are around 20 associations and many rehabilitation agencies operating for Spinal care.The market for spinal surgery devices is being driven forward, as patients are offered safer, more&nbsp;reliable surgery.The global spinal surgery devices market is expected to grow at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 4% from $6.5 billion in 2011 to $8.7 billion in 2018. Spinal fusions increased 77 % from 2002 to 2011, and the demand will continue to grow as the indications for fusion expand.The European minimally invasive surgery spinal implant market is expected to exceed 92 million by 2018.&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/#section1"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">For more</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black"></span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spine 2016</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt; color:black">&nbsp;promises to elucidate the hotspot areas of&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spine</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">&nbsp;and&nbsp;</span><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Spinal disorders</span></a><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:black">; and emanate the solutions to various challenges in upholding a better Spine health.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p></p><p>  </p><p><b></b><i><b>Credible ENZ certified foreign education consultants Study Smart Launches It Personalized Coaching Services For Students Appearing For The IELTS and PTE Examinations This 2016</b></i><b>.</b></p><p><b><br></b> </p>  <p>Esteemed and ENZ certified foreign education consultants Study Smart has launched its exclusive personalized IELTS and PTE Coaching Services for students appearing for these examinations this 2016. The coaching services will be available at three national and one global center of the Institute. The trained and skilled study abroad experts here state that the number of Indian students going abroad for foreign studies have significantly improved in the last few decades. This is indeed encouraging as students are exposed to an international career early in life. However, many potential students lack the necessary speaking, writing, reading and listening skills in English- a mandate in most foreign abroad study locations. This is the reason why Study Smart and its team of experienced IELTS and PTE trainers have come forth to help students pass these examinations without tensions.</p>  <p>Students can enroll for these personalized sessions with immediate effect. The skilled trainers will work with them one to one to improve their speaking, listening, reading and writing skills. Both the IELTS and PTE Examinations are difficult to pass without instructed guidance. The trainers at Study Smart also give the students tips on how to score high in their examinations. The rules and the regulations of the test will also be taught to students so that they do not make mistakes out of ignorance. </p>  <p>The classroom batch is small so that trainers are able to devote more time and attention to their students. Both the IELTS and <b><a target="_blank" href="http://www.studysmart.co.in/PTEtest/">PTE training in Delhi</a></b> modules have been uniquely designed by the experts themselves to enable students become confident before appearing for the examinations. Both the IELTS and PTE Examinations are tests of English proficiency that is mandatory to pass for studying or working in nations like UK, New Zealand, Canada and Australia. Students at Study Smart will be exposed to sample tests and mock interviews as well. The onus is to focus on the overall personality development of the student. </p>  <p>The exclusive coaching program formulated by Study Smart is targeted to understand the testing patterns of both these Examinations. Practice makes the students perfect. The coaching classes also include a series of mock tests for students to get used to the examination patterns before they sit for the final tests. </p>  <p>The trainers at Study Smart will also engage the students with audio-visual inputs, personal interactions, initial evaluation and continued assessment so that they can pass the tests with flying colors. </p>  <p>Current students of Study Smart are very happy with the care and guidance given to them by the trained experts here. Most of them say that Study Smart is the best <b><a target="_blank" href="http://www.studysmart.co.in/ielts/">IELTS Institute in Delhi. </a></b>The trainers are friendly and they address student doubts with patience. The Institute has good reviews in Delhi and with the feedback of its current students has decided to go ahead with these personalized coaching batches for both IELTS and PTE Tests. </p>  <p>Admissions are now on for students who are looking for personalized IELTS and PTE training in the Capital. However, limited seats are available. Unlike other PTE and IELTS Institutes in Delhi, Study Smart does not wish to fill up its classrooms with too many students. Phone lines are open for counseling and information on the admission procedures scheduled to open this month. The experts request students to get in touch with them soon for the academic session to begin.</p>  <p>For more details, please contact the office of Study Smart at (9650680072) or visit <a href="http://www.studysmart.co.in">www.studysmart.co.in</a>.</p>  <p>D-62, 3rd Floor, Near Dena Bank, South Extension 1,</p><p>110049 Delhi, India</p>  <p></p><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>

<p><b>FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE</b></p><p>STARTUP ENTREPRENEURS: FREE INCUBATION FOR STARTUPS</p><p><i>&nbsp;Providing every possible support to startup entrepreneurs</i></p><p><b>NOIDA, UP, INDIA  10 January 2016 </b><i></i></p><p>Startup Entrepreneurs, a club for Indian entrepreneurs, first time in India, to strengthen startup culture in India and provide every possible support to startup entrepreneurs for FREE.</p><p>Indian startup culture is booming and considering new government; it has gone to a sharp high to even stronger and bigger than before. However statistics show that over 90% of startups fail within first five years of their journey. Regardless of so many incubators, accelerators and network forums, they have NOT supported, as entrepreneurs individual requirements to succeed.</p><p>We, being a group of IIT and IIM graduates and serial entrepreneurs, have gone through startup challenges and felt the pain of so called startup failure and success. After spending 20 years in Industry and seeing so many ups and down as entrepreneurs, we decided to support startup entrepreneurs through this club to increase the success rate of startups.</p><p>Any startup entrepreneurs in India can join for free to this club. We will support them with every possible means, which are required to enhance their chance of success. Unlike many accelerators and incubators, we offer more an inside support than outside support. We offer mentorship, network, self-finance and workspace for free to our members. Our club doesnt take any fee or equity in your business.</p><p>We have a pool of highly experience professional from industry, research and administration, who support our member entrepreneurs as mentor. They are keen to support entrepreneurs without any fee and be part of entrepreneurial revolutions. We facilitate entrepreneurs to connect with co-founders, investors, board members and advisors. We offer supports related with company registration, tax filling, government grants, investor pitch, marketing and brand building. We have created a unique concept of self-finance, where interested entrepreneurs can work as a group on consultancy projects to generate (and then share) revenues to improve their financial situations.&nbsp; We offer short and long term co-workspace in an excellent working environment in a IT building, which is currently located in Noida but plan to expand and create co-workspace for member entrepreneurs in almost all cities in India.</p><p>For additional information about this unique club for startup entrepreneurs, please visit <a href="http://www.startupentrepreneurs.org">www.startupentrepreneurs.org</a> or contact Startup Entrepreneurs by e-mail: <a href="mailto:post@startupentrepreneurs.org">post@startupentrepreneurs.org</a> or telephone: +47 94432969/+91 880.<i>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </i></p><p>                                                      </p><p>###<i></i></p>
<p><b></b></p><h3><b>The first wooden I-beam chair in the world. Extremely light, strong, beautiful, and comfortable.</b></h3><p></p><p>Berlin furniture company EAJY has launched its first product<gs id="1c24dcf9-6e7b-417c-859b-acb69b11ea6c" ginger_software_uiphraseguid="541b3ef0-c3ec-497d-a95f-3b2fa9767454" class="GINGER_SOFTWARE_mark">,</gs>Beams Chair on crowdfunding website Indiegogo  a wooden chair with legs inspired by structural steel beams, which offers a simple way to bring modern industrial style into daily life.</p><p>Inspired by the steel I-beams of the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, the Beams Chair is made from <gs id="a75bcc23-b873-43c3-9921-c550fb2e2bdd" ginger_software_uiphraseguid="d20376d6-791c-4362-8920-b631716e99c8" class="GINGER_SOFTWARE_mark">wooden</gs> I beams, which reduce the weight of the structure to just 4.5 kilograms while enhancing the strength of the chair.<br></p><p>The first prototype was made in 2013 by Sebastian Bächer of Tischlerei Bächer and selected by [D3] Design Contest in <gs id="f245a8b1-4b6f-4d6f-9e30-e3e92b0b9d55" ginger_software_uiphraseguid="5d2fb3dc-20e4-473e-93bb-ea6779e256ea" class="GINGER_SOFTWARE_mark">imm</gs> Cologne.<br></p><p>EAJY has taken three years to refine the design of Beams Chair with feedback from <gs id="963e24b9-765c-4016-b112-1608eef5de74" ginger_software_uiphraseguid="5a90218e-c2c1-4185-badb-7c6d0ac95e4a" class="GINGER_SOFTWARE_mark">imm</gs> Cologne. Now, the Beams Chair is more comfortable and ergonomic than ever. This simple and elegant chair is mostly constructed with solid wood.<br></p><p>"It is really interesting to see the interplay of two contrasting features, the natural wood and the industrial I-beams," said EAJY. "Our goal is to create industrial style furniture with natural vibes, simple structure, and warm feeling. Customers can style and balance their space at the same time."<br></p><p>"We are very meticulous in our product design. With its simplicity and uniqueness, the Beams Chair can easily fit into any indoor space, such as restaurants, cafes, dining rooms, and more."<br></p><p>EAJY is taking pre-orders via crowdfunding in Indiegogo. Beams Chair will start worldwide shipping from March 2016, and backers will receive up to 35 <gs id="7092a9b5-2c64-4256-928d-933b29049c58" ginger_software_uiphraseguid="39ab591e-26b5-4d50-a337-e562e0f500e8" class="GINGER_SOFTWARE_mark">per cent</gs> off retail price.<br></p><p>Visit us at <a href="http://igg.me/at/beams-chair">http://igg.me/at/beams-chair</a><br></p><p>Beams Chair Gallery<br></p><p>                   </p><p><a href="http://www.slideshare.net/EAJYDESIGN/beams-chair-gallery">http://www.slideshare.net/EAJYDESIGN/beams-chair-gallery</a></p>

In an effort to help others interested in looking to learn more about the industry, she has written and released a new book. Work from Home Confessions is the authors first and is now available on Amazon.<br></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>There is a reason why 95% of people fail when it comes to working from home working in the network marketing industryI simply want to expose the truth on the matter, explains Demosthene. Whether you are currently working from home or thinking about it, this book is a must read.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  The 226-page book published by CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform provides readers details about the work-from-home industry and network marketing. Additionally, Demosthene shares her own personal story that includes tips and resources to help others become successful in the industry with her very own confessions. Readers will get an inside look at the scams, bullying, sponsors, and exposing leader and guru tricks that forces stay-at-home workers to spend more money and the real truth about being a work from home parent.  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>Matthew Bennington, an affiliate and student at Print My ATM, comments on his success following Demosthenes support stating, Casthra has made a big difference in my life last year, using the knowledge that she has, I was able to finally makes six figures working from home. </p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>The book is now available for free download on Amazon on Kindle Unlimited or readers can also purchase the book in paperback for only $8.99. She graduated from Valencia College in 2015 where she studied business management and pastry management. Following a series of fast food jobs, she quit to begin working from home in 2011 and has been a stay-at-home mom and full-time business woman ever since. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>For media inquiries regarding Work from Home Confessions, individuals are encouraged to contact Publicist, Nancy Jean Louis at 321-307-4564 or via email at </p><p><a href="mailto:askcasthra@gmail.com">askcasthra@gmail.com</a>. Needless to say for the extensive experience, we are based in NCR/New Delhi, India where we act both as a Counsel and Counselor. <div><b>BOSTON</b>&nbsp;- <b>Jan. 11, 2016</b>&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>Carla - Car Rental app will launch on AppStore in January, 2016.<br><br>Carla will recommend personalized car rentals for users for their specific travel needs. Users can swipe cards like Tinder app to choose the best rental car that fits them. Completing the car rental booking takes just seconds.<br><br>How is this not just another travel app and why it's worth downloading?<br></div><div>&nbsp;</div><div><ul><li>We don't present 20 exact same cars from 20 different suppliers with $3 price difference. We recommend personalized car rentals for users for their specific travel needs.</li></ul><ul><li>We don't have that tabular format of cars listed one after another that you see in every single (well almost) app. Travel should be fun and so is our app. We have Tinder cards where users can focus on one car at a time and swipe to book. </li></ul><ul><li>And at a time where "old economy" car rental companies are losing market share to sharing economy, we bring in the best deals available in 20K locations across the globe.</li></ul><br></div><div>Carla is available in 20,000 locations, 150 countries worldwide. Comparing rental cars from 850 companies including all major car rental companies like Avis, Budget, Enterprise, National, Sixt, Hertz, Alamo, Thrifty, Europcar is just a single tap.<br><br>Users can rent a car from all cities and airports such as Los Angeles, New York, Las Vegas, Orlando, Miami, Sydney, London, Manchester, Rome, Berlin and Tokyo. All car models and makes are available from SUV to cabriolet.<br><br>Users can:<br><br>- Save time and money with best price/performance options.<br><br>- Hassle-free reservation. No more never ending list of cars.<br><br>- No need for coupons. Discounts are already applied.<br><br>- View your upcoming and past trips.<br><br>Carla will be available on AppStore in January, 2016. For beta testing, please join through the link.<br><br><a href="http://www.rentcarla.com/">www.rentcarla.com</a><br></div>
<p>This third annual global title in the <a href="http://bobcm.net/best-of-branded-content-marketing-ebooks/">BOBCM international series of free ebooks</a>  the second book this year, following the launch of BOBCMs <a href="http://bobcm.editiondigital.com/best-of-branded-content-marketing-2015#!bobcm">first ever regional title in Germany</a> in September  was previewed at events hosted by <a href="http://www.motherlondon.com/" title="Link: http://www.motherlondon.com/">Mother</a> in the UK on 25 November, and by <a href="http://www.tenthwave.com/">Tenthwave</a> and <a href="http://www.talkwalker.com/">Talkwalker</a> in New York on 3 December.<br></p><p>Combining the input of more than 100 branded content marketing experts around the world  and featuring a guest section from <a href="http://www.dandad.org/">D&amp;AD, the global association for creative advertising and design</a>  the collaborative, 320-page book is the flagship in BOBCMs stakeholder engagement mission to curate, debate and share the key considerations that brands, academics and practitioners should bear in mind when planning, creating, producing, distributing, or measuring branded content. It contains 20 feature articles that reveal insight from leading exponents, and 25 case studies detailing how outstanding projects of all shapes and budgets were conceived, and the results they achieved.</p><p>Tim Lindsay, CEO of D&amp;AD, said: Were particularly pleased to partner with BOBCM in the increasingly important world of branded content.</p><p>The book is published exclusively on the Edition Digital platform that unifies the process of creating, managing, distributing, monetising and analysing digital publications in one comprehensive solution.</p><p><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/juzzie">Justin Kirby</a>, Founder &amp; Curator of <a href="http://bobcm.net/">BOBCM</a> and VP, Strategic Content Marketing at <a href="http://www.tenthwave.com/">Tenthwave</a> said: BOBCMs partnership with Edition Digital this year marks a giant leap forward in our content publishing process. The Edition Digital system is easy for designers and producers to use, enabling every element including animations to be custom created and edited in real time without using code. Through its browser-based access optimised for computers, smartphones and tablets, our readers get an enhanced media experience of our content on a completely new level, far beyond that offered by the iBooks and SlideShare platforms we used previously.</p><p>Rok Pulevic, CEO of <a href="http://www.editiondigital.com/">Edition Digital</a>, said: Edition Digital has empowered BOBCMs 2015 publications with an interactive mix of images, audio and video, and enabled this amazingly rich content to be instantly accessible to readers across multiple channels.</p><p>BOBCM is supported by not only D&amp;AD and Edition Digital, but also <a href="http://www.a-p-a.net/">APA</a>, <a href="http://www.iabuk.net/">IAB</a>, <a href="http://www.ipa.co.uk/">IPA</a>, <a href="http://www.isba.org.uk/">ISBA</a>, <a href="http://www.osservatoriobe.com/">OBE</a>, <a href="http://www.prca.org.uk/" title="Link: http://www.prca.org.uk/">PRCA</a>, <a href="http://www.radiocentre.org/">Radiocentre</a> (formerly RAB), and <a href="https://www.marketingsociety.com/">The Marketing Society</a>  comprising some 350,000+ members around the world.</p><p>Andrew Canter, Managing Partner of BOBCM, Global CEO of the international <a href="http://www.thebcma.info/">Branded Content Marketing Association (BCMA)</a>, and Chief Content Officer of <a href="http://www.globallivingbrands.com/">Global Living Brands</a>, said: Were grateful for the support and contributions to this book made by leaders in the field, who are helping to evolve the branded content marketing approach all over the world. Whether you work for a brand, in academia, or as a marketing practitioner, this book will inspire you to improve your own output, customer relationships and business results.</p><p>The new <a href="http://bobcm.editiondigital.com/best-of-branded-content-marketing-2015-global-edition#!cover"><i>Best of Branded Content Marketing 2015: Global Edition</i></a> is available free with the other BOBCM 2015 titles only at <a href="http://bobcm.editiondigital.com/">http://bobcm.editiondigital.com</a>, and it will be followed shortly by the publication of an international Market &amp; Expert Insight Reports supplement.</p><p><b>Press images available at:</b><br></p><p><a href="https://www.dropbox.com/l/sh/D0hGYPqNIfnhUxzSmbCwkp">https://www.dropbox.com/l/sh/D0hGYPqNIfnhUxzSmbCwkp</a> </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b><u>For further information contact: </u></b></p><p>Barbara Matijasic, Marketing Manager Edition Digital</p><p>E:&nbsp;<a href="mailto: barbara.matijasic@editiondigital.com" target="_blank" title="Link: mailto: barbara.matijasic@editiondigital.com">barbara.matijasic@editiondigital.com</a></p><p>Phone: 0038640 908 479</p><p><br></p><p><b>About Edition Digital</b></p><p>Since 2008, Edition Digital has empowered creative individuals, small production teams and big publishers with a complete set of solutions for digital publishing. It enables real-time editing and publishing, simple creation of interactive content and full customization of the browser appearance. Publishers can monetize their digital editions through subscription system and advertisements. Advanced analytics tools allow users to monitor the progress and effectiveness of publications and campaigns. Integrated workflow makes collaboration of the entire digital team easy and efficient. Edition Digital is fully automated and easy to use because of our deep understanding of the importance of a creative approach to delivering digital content.</p><p>Edition Digital is already used by many global companies such as Mazda (UK, USA, Canada, Australia), Land Rover, Boots, Marks &amp; Spencer, British Telecom, Esprit, Fiat, BNP Paribas, Barclays, Sainsburys, Argos, Yamaha and British Airways.</p><p><b>About BOBCM</b></p><p>Best of Branded Content Marketing (BOBCM) is a joint initiative set up in 2013 and managed by the <a href="http://www.thebcma.info/">international Branded Content Marketing Association (BCMA)</a>&nbsp;and <a href="http://bobcm.editiondigital.com/created-by-studiobobcm">StudioBOBCM</a>.</p><p>BOBCM curates, co-creates, speaks about and publishes the latest thinking and outstanding content from brands, broadcasters, filmmakers, production companies, studios, advertising and marketing agencies, media planners, publishers, games developers and other practitioners and academics who use, create, distribute, or measure branded content. Official supporters of BOBCM include APA, D&amp;AD, Edition Digital, IAB, IPA, ISBA, OBE, PRCA, Radiocentre and The Marketing Society.</p><p><b><u>For further information contact:</u></b></p><p>Justin Kirby, Founder &amp; Curator</p><p>T: +44 789 992 5595</p><p>E: <a href="mailto:justin@bobcm.net">justin@bobcm.net</a></p><p>W: <a href="http://www.bobcm.net/">www.bobcm.net</a></p>
Publishers are leaving billions of dollars on the table by focusing on advertising as their primary revenue source.&nbsp; In reality advertising revenue should be the last channel of revenue they rely on.<br><br>With words like view ability, fill rate and Ad blockers (the really bad word) the advertising eco system has become a mine field with many obstacles to overcome.<br><br>In a July 2014 study by Google the search engine giant determined that the average websites ad view ability is 50.2%.&nbsp; That means half of the average publishers ads are not seen and do not earn any income for the publisher.<br><br>With the steep growth of Programmatic ad buying site specific purchases are becoming rarer for traditional ad units.&nbsp; Advertisers are purchasing audiences using behavioral data and are matching that to the cheapest inventory they can find to cherry pick the best audience for their product.<br><br>So CNN gets a low ball ad buy and the advertiser only buys&nbsp;the ads viewed by the optimal prospects for their products.&nbsp; If a Publisher can attract a premium audience perhaps they can maximize their ad revenue.&nbsp; But even the most premium Publishers (ie: Wall Street Journal, Time Inc., Vogue etc) cannot consistently attract an audience of buyers.<br><br>As the system gets better at maximizing ROI for online advertisers the specific websites will become less and less important to their media planning.&nbsp; At the end of the day the advertisers only care about making sales and, except for illegal or adult sites, dont really care where the buyers come from.<br><br>Where Ecommerce is 300% of Advertising Revenue<br><br>For&nbsp;Thrillist, remnant advertising is non-existent and ads arent sold programmatically. Instead, the digital publisher embraced ecommerce early on and that business is now three times the size of its ad business.<br><br>If todays digital publishers are truly looking to build their business they should begin implementing the most lucrative revenue sources.<br><br>In the first quarter of 2015 Amazon took in $17 billion from merchandise Amazon itself sold to consumers. Of the $17 Billion in sales Amazon kept 33.93% after deducting their cost of goods (the gross margin) so well consider the number of $5.76 Billion. The sales were attained when 569 million unique visitors went to their website.<br><br>During the Q2 2015 the Time Inc network of websites, usually one of the 20 most visited sites in the world, had about 312 million unique visitors and generated about $77 million in advertising revenue.<br><br>Time Inc. generated about $.25 for every unique visitor in the 3 month period while Amazon generated $10.11 for every visitor to their website during their quarter.<br><br>Had Time Inc. been selling products at the same rate as Amazon it would have generated over $3 billion dollars during its quarter. That is 40 times more!<br><br>As for products that publishers can sell looking to their existing operations for opportunities would be the best place to start.&nbsp; For some publishers books could be a good choice.&nbsp; The New York Times is marketing vacations based on editorial/educational themes.&nbsp;&nbsp; Joint ventures with existing ecommerce organizations could also be lucrative.<br><br>Advertising revenue is county specific.&nbsp; Publishers need to solicit different advertisers in each country.&nbsp; Global ad campaigns are rare.&nbsp; Couple that with major market determined International print distribution and the International ad revenue becomes tougher to come by.<br><br>However the same digital subscription can be sold worldwide. Its a much more versatile product. It is sold direct to consumer.<br><br>The Wall Street Journal was one of the earliest traditional newspapers to add online subscriptions and now has about 700,000 digital subscribers, the New York Times recently announced they had exceeded the 1 million digital subscriber level, the Financial Times has over 500,000 and the list goes on.<br><br>Digital subscriptions have the potential to generate much greater profits than print subscriptions once Publishers learn how to optimize their marketing thereby minimizing their subscription acquisition costs.<br><br>The Wall Street Journal is generating $41 million dollars a year based on their $59 annual subscription price.&nbsp; Not the kind of revenue necessary to replace the advertising but it is a good start. Especially considering digital subscriptions can be sold worldwide while print distribution is limited to set geographic areas.<br><br>Probably the most valuable email business, or at least the first most valuable, was Daily Candy.&nbsp; This started out as a deals newsletter for fashionable finds and built into a business that was sold for $125 million dollars to Comcast years later.&nbsp; The entire business was a daily email.<br><br>Email is the digital form of direct marketing and many great fortunes have been made in direct marketing. With millions of visitors daily Publishers are missing out in building out another lucrative revenue source.&nbsp; Publishers could offer paid email subscriptions for super premium content, such as secret hideaway travel newsletter or an investment newsletter, or they could use the free email lists to sell products and services.&nbsp; At a minimum an email list serves as a source of traffic back to the website.<br><br>Lauren Touby built the site MediaBistro.com as a news and information site for the media business.&nbsp; However what most likely started out as a great idea turned into almost 80% of the revenue, a jobs board.&nbsp; Many Publishers see job boards as an add on and do not dedicate any significant resources to the initiative.&nbsp; The job board at MediaBistro earned Lauren $23 million when it was sold in 2007.<br><br>Other revenue sources include resource directories, smartphone applications and software downloads to name a few.<br><br>In the future the most successful publishers will be diversifying away from advertising and some may eliminate advertising entirely.&nbsp; Those same successful publishers will also have recognized that to be successful in ecommerce they need to hire ecommerce experts and to not try to do it themselves.<br><br>Who knows perhaps in 5 years some of the largest ecommerce businesses will be named CNN.com, People.com and the New York Times.
<p>                   </p><p><i>Leandre Johns, General Manager of Uber DFW, to Speak Jan. 28</i></p><p>The <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">American Advertising Federation Dallas (AAF Dallas)</a> is featuring Leandre Johns, General Manager at Uber as a part of their digital breakfast series, which focuses on emerging technologies and business models. The first event of the year will be held Jan. 28, 2016.</p><p>Leandre Johns, General Manager of Uber Dallas/Fort Worth, will lead a discussion on the Uberfication of Everything, addressing the impact it will have on DFWs consumers, marketers, businesses, industries and brands. Audience members are encouraged to ask Johns questions during the Q&amp;A portion of the event.</p><p>Uber Technology, the app that connects riders and drivers, has led the digital revolution for convenience tech, shaking up the traditional taxi scene by offering a service that provides convenience value through technology. Digital innovators are beginning to take a page out of Ubers book and are seeking ways to uberfy the world by providing services that offer convenient on-demand mobile services to match demand with supply.</p><p>We are honored to kick off the new year with Leandre Johns as the first featured guest of our digital breakfast series, says Jason Dove, president of AAF Dallas. His experience at Uber will provide our members with a unique insight of the many ways emerging technologies are impacting our industry.</p><p>AAF Dallas will host The Uberfication of Everything Digital Breakfast Jan. 28 from 7:30  9:30 a.m. at the Dallas Entrepreneur Center, 311 N. Market St. #200, Dallas, Texas 75202. Tickets will be available for purchase online  $22 until Jan. 23, $27 after. For more information, tickets and sponsorship opportunities, please visit <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">www.aafdallas.org</a>.</p><p>Upcoming events hosted by AAF include happy hour and ADDYs Draught Party at Dodies Reef, 2821 Greenville Ave. Dallas, Texas 75206, Jan. 21, 5:30  8 p.m. Explore the opportunity to network in the DFW advertising world, while enjoying great drink specials with the company of like-minded professionals sponsored by The Boss Group and SocialCentiv.</p>
On a fall evening at Fordham University, a class of 30 MBA students was asked, Do you want to eventually work in digital media?<br><br>Thats a huge change from just about four semesters ago, where that number was closer to zero. Most people taking that class called Media Executive Playbook were just doing it as an elective.<br><br>One driver behind the increase: digital media and advertising technology veterans are popping up in classrooms&nbsp; sometimes, even at their own alma maters  to teach them not just the basics of DSPs, DMPs and&nbsp;SSPs but also to stoke an interest in how exciting the world of ad tech and digital media can be.<br><br>One of those is Eric Franchi, founder of Undertone, the guest lecturer that evening at Fordham. Franchi was a guest in&nbsp;Ed Careys class that evening. Carey himself is&nbsp;global vp at Dun &amp; Bradstreet and a former magazine ad sales executive who also worked at ad tech companies including the Rubicon Project and Undertone.<br><br>Franchi chose to focus his lesson&nbsp;on ad networks and ad agencies, and how the lines between tech vendors and agencies are&nbsp;blurring. The class especially responded to his explanation of platform wranglers  employees inside agencies, brands and publishers who&nbsp;liase with new platforms. You folks are in a good position, he told the millennial class. There is a need for this inherent understanding of new platforms that you already have.<br><br>Carey, a Fordham alum, said the interest in careers is on the rise. Other&nbsp;than Franchi, guest speakers in&nbsp;his class have included&nbsp;Jay Sears, svp at The Rubicon Project, and Brian Lesser, global CEO at Xaxis. Theres good academia dedicated to new media adoption out there, but there arent a lot of tenured professors who can actually teach it as a subject matter expert, said Carey.<br><br>Nick Johnson, who left his role as svp national sales at NBC Universal just last month, has for the last few years been working with his alma mater, Gettysburg College, and its office of career development to push digital media as a career. Every fall, he would go into the college to talk about NBC Universal (most kids only at that point knew it as a brand or a TV channel), then check in throughout the year and, in the summer, offer internships inside the company.<br><br>Especially in a liberal arts school, they dont know exactly what NBC does or where they really would fit in, he said. Interns go into ad operations, for example, and have in many cases become full-time employees at the company. Weve built a pipeline.<br><br>The issue for many in the industry is&nbsp;that schools dont necessarily prepare students for real-life jobs. The problem I am trying to solve for is how to matchmake academic institutions and people in our industry hiring at the entry level, said Johnson.<br><br>For one, few people understand how&nbsp;digital media or ad tech works. Secondly, the process can be off-cycle  people graduate in the spring and digital organizations work in a calendar year and rarely have well-established internship programs.<br><br>Greg Coleman, BuzzFeed president and former president of ad tech firm Criteo, has been teaching a class at NYUs Stern School of Business called digital media innovation. Every week, Coleman invites his friends, including Rent the Runway founder Jennifer Hyman or BuzzFeed founder Jonah Peretti to guest lecture, and 75 percent of students grades are decided based on a final media project judged by VCs.<br><br>Coleman was first moved to teach&nbsp;when his daughter began college at Georgetown&nbsp;and he found the digital curriculum extremely light. Things are different now, but he said his focus is to give students a better, real-life view of the digital media world.<br><br>Colemans impetus is common: Schools dont really do it on their own, so those in the industry have to. B-schools and universities in general can do more to prep students for a path in modern digital media and ad tech, said Franchi. The pace of change in the space means that course materials that are as little as a few years old are probably obsolete. Thats also why I like guest lecturing, since it gives me an opportunity to help students understand that the ad tech side of the business is a lot more exciting than they may think.
Most people say you should delay taking Social Security to get a bigger benefit. But rather than waiting for a larger monthly check in the future, I think I'd be much better off collecting Social Security as soon as I can and investing the payments. Do you agree? -- Michael P., Chicago  In a word, no.    I understand the appeal of what you propose. Many people want to get their hands on their benefits as soon as possible, fearing (incorrectly) that Social Security will go broke. Others enjoy the sense of control they get from investing those funds instead of passively waiting for a higher payment down the road.   Still, I think coming out ahead with the strategy you're contemplating will be a lot harder, and riskier, than you think. And there are some downsides that may disadvantage you in ways you haven't considered.   Here's an example.   Let's assume you're 62, the earliest age at which you can claim your worker's benefit, and you have the choice of taking $9,000 a year now or $12,000 a year if you wait until age 66, the age at which you will qualify for a full Social Security benefit.   Related: Your 3 biggest Social Security questions answered   In short, you'll take the standard 25% haircut for claiming your benefit at 62 versus your full retirement age of 66. Social Security will increase those benefits for inflation. So, if inflation runs at, say, 2% a year, the $9,000 payment you started receiving at age 62 will have grown to $9,742 by age 66. Had you waited until age 66 to claim benefits, however, you would start with a benefit of $12,989, or $12,000 plus four years of inflation increases.   If you go ahead with your plan to take benefits early, your Social Security payment would be $9,742 at age 66. That's $3,247 less than the $12,989 you would be entitled to had you waited until age 66 to collect. But you'll also have those four years' worth of Social Security payments you invested. Assuming you invested all of those benefits in a broadly diversified 50% stocks-50% bonds portfolio that returned 5% a year, those early payments would be worth $41,918.   So the question is: Are you better off with the lower Social Security payment plus the $41,918, or waiting for the higher payment for life?   One way to answer that question is to see how long that $41,918, plus future investment earnings on it, would last if you withdrew just enough each year so that the withdrawal plus your lower Social Security payment would match the higher full-age benefit.   Ultimate Retirement Guide: Social Security   And if you go through that process -- withdrawing $3,247 the first year at age 66, $3,312 the second, $3,378 the third, etc. -- you would find that your stash of invested early Social Security payments would run out at age 81. You can think of that as the "break-even" age for your strategy.   At that point, you would have nothing left of the payments you invested, and your Social Security payment at 81, $13,111 ($9,000 plus inflation adjustments), would be $4,371 lower than the $17,482 payment ($12,000, plus inflation) you would be getting had you waited until age 66 to collect. And each year, that dollar gap would widen since your inflation increases are applied to a smaller payment.   You can come up with different break-even ages based on different inflation rates and investment returns. The lower inflation is and the higher your investment return, the longer it would take for your invested Social Security payments to run out. If you figure you'll earn a higher return by investing more aggressively, your scheme looks much better.   Problem is, the more investing risk you take, the greater the chance that your Social Security fund may suffer a big setback. And the combination of an investment loss plus the withdrawals from the fund could potentially deplete your Social Security stash faster than a more conservatively invested portfolio.   Related: The smart way to double your nest egg in 10 years   Suffice it to say that unless you're willing to roll the dice, you're probably looking at a break-even age in the early to mid-80s. And even that's not certain. It's possible that even without a market setback, a conservatively invested portfolio might return less than 5% a year.   Of course, if you die before you reach your early- to mid-80s, you could end up collecting more with your strategy than by waiting for the higher full-age benefit. But how likely is that?   Life expectancy for a 65-year-old man is approximately 86 or 87 and a woman is 88 or 89. And roughly half of people live beyond those estimates, many well beyond. Besides, if you're married and you're the higher wage earner, your spouse may be stuck with that lower benefit if she (or he) outlives you. That's another reason many people hold off for a higher benefit.   There are plenty of other ways to crunch these numbers and many other factors you can take into account, such as taxes, which I've left out to simplify things. (I should also note that there's an "escape clause." If you decide to change your mind within 12 months, you can repay benefits and reapply for higher payments later.) But unless you're an incredibly talented or lucky investor or you expect to die early (and your spouse's benefit isn't an issue), you're probably better off just waiting until full-retirement age to collect.   Related: When can I start getting Social Security payouts?   Indeed, you may be able to collect even more over your lifetime by postponing payments to as late as age 70. And if you're married, you may be able to maximize the amount you and your spouse receive by coordinating when you claim benefits.   Given the amount of money involved, I think almost everyone should consult a Social Security calculator before filing for benefits or, if you're not comfortable doing the analysis on your own, consult a service, such as Maximize My Social Security or Social Security Solutions that will lay out your options for a fee.   I'm all for astute investing in retirement, including reasonable ways to take Social Security into account when building a portfolio. But the strategy you're proposing combines little upside potential with lots of downside risk. That's a lousy combo. So I recommend you abandon it.   More from RealDealRetirement.com   Your 3 biggest Social Security questions answered   25 ways to get smarter about money right now   Should you factor Social Security into your retirement portfolio?      CNNMoney (New York)  First published February 24, 2015: 5:19 PM ET
<p><b>Burlingame, Ca. - January 12, 2016.</b> AlerSense Incorporated has created the worlds first <i>smart</i> airborne allergy and asthma early warning system alerting consumers as particles and toxins build. AlerSense is an in-home unit when, combined with the mobile app, delivers accurate environmental readings, giving asthma and allergy sufferers precious time to remove themselves from, or alter the environment to possibly mitigate or avoid an allergy or asthma attack. AlerSense delivers precise in-home measurements of airborne contamination and toxins such as pollen, mold, dust, dust mite waste, VOCs and animal dander helping consumers monitor the levels of airborne contamination in the environment that can cause allergy and asthma attacks. AlerSense also tracks humidity and temperature thus creating a holistic air quality assessment.</p><p>AlerSense was founded by a team of passionate people who were determined to change the way we look allergies and asthma caused by airborne contaminants. For the longest time we have accepted the fact that allergies and asthma attacks just happen. We wanted to work on a project that would help people throughout the world understand when contaminants are building in the home so that they can make the appropriate adjustments to possibly avoid an allergy or asthma attack, said Skip Sanzeri founder and CEO of AlerSense. Weve combined some of the worlds most advanced sensors, with a smart mobile app and extensive software algorithms that will allow users to record allergy and asthma symptoms at the time when they first noticed the symptoms. Our goal is to give consumers enough time to avoid or mitigate an allergy or asthma attack. And the system gets smarter as it learns each family members sensitivities based on user input. Airborne contaminants are usually invisible to the naked eye and therefore attack unannounced. Well, were here to make the announcement.</p><p>AlerSense units will be available in the spring of 2016. Interested customers may preorder AlerSense via the AlerSense website at <a href="http://www.alersense.com/">www.AlerSense.com</a>. </p><p><b>Global Problems</b></p><p>The global allergy diagnostic and treatment market is projected to increase to nearly $35.3 billion by 2015 from $31.5 billion in 2014. According to the U. S. Center for Disease Control (CDC), it is estimated that 1 in 12 Americans has asthma. Additionally the CDC estimates that 17.6 million Americans were diagnosed with hay fever in the past 12 months. </p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>About AlerSense</b></p><p>AlerSense stands for Aler (Alert, Allergy), and Sense (detect and report). AlerSense is committed to providing high quality consumer airborne contaminant sensing solutions. Based in Silicon Valley and Dublin, Ireland, AlerSense will help change the world by reducing allergy and asthma attacks. </p><p>For further information please visit <a href="http://www.alersense.com/">www.AlerSense.com</a> or send an email to <a href="mailto:info@AlerSense.com">info@AlerSense.com</a>.</p><p><b>Company Contact:</b></p><p>AlerSense, Inc.</p><p>Skip Sanzeri</p><p>Founder, CEO</p><p>Tel 1 650 504 0465</p><p>                                  </p><p>skip@alersense.com</p>
<p>Liebe Bleach Spieler,<br><br>eine schöne Begrüßung! Der Winter kommt, warum spielt Ihr nicht gemütlich am Computer unser <a href="http://bleach.risengame.com/" target="_blank">bleach online deutsch</a> neues Spiel <a href="http://bleach.risengame.com/" target="_blank">Bleach Saga</a>?<br><br></p><p>Und  heute wartet ein neuer Server auf Euch. Am Freitag, den 12.1.2016 ist  Server 13 um 10:00 Uhr (MEZ) in eine neue Runde gestartet. <br></p><p><br></p><div><p><img width="500" alt="bleach saga" src="https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-XDYVUYm-_kU/VnysUWVzSSI/AAAAAAAAASs/Z7AX_h7O0Fc/w2200-h800/%25E6%25AD%25BB%25E7%25A5%259E-%25E5%25BE%25B7%25E8%25AF%25AD-2.jpg" title="bleach saga"></p><p><br></p></div><p>Damit  wir Euch herzlich begrüßen können, haben wir vielseitige  Veranstaltungen für Euch vorbereitet, massive kostenlose wertvolle  Belohnungen winken Euch!<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<br>Seid dabei und meldet Euch an, um eine mysteriöse Reise in Bleach Welt zu genießen!<br><br>Detail bitte zum: <a href="http://bleach.risengame.com/" title="Link: http://bleach.risengame.com/">http://bleach.risengame.com/</a><br><br>Bleach Saga DE<br></p><p><br></p><p><br></p>
<p></p><p>Mit <b>Supreme Pirates</b> war es zunächst möglich alles an Land zu kontrollieren. Durch Supreme Pirates konnte auch alles in der Luft und über den Wolken kontrolliert werden. Durch das neue Browser - Action - Game Supreme Pirates kann nun auch alles auf dem Wasser und den sieben Weltmeeren kontrolliert werden. Dabei steht dem Spieler eine Vielzahl von Schiffen zur Auswahl. Nach der Wahl eines Schiffs je nach eigenen persönlichen Vorlieben kann dieses natürlich umfangreich mit Waffen und anderer Ausrüstung ausgestattet werden.</p><p>Damit Supreme Pirates so glücklich wie möglich sind, muss man sie auch bei Laune halten. Das gelingt nur mit genügend Waren, Rohstoffen und Nahrung. Deine fleißigen Arbeitskräfte sollen beim Ausbau deiner Stadt ja nicht entkräftet sein und schlimmstenfalls verhungern. Handwerker und Facharbeiter reichen allerdings nicht aus, um dein Städtchen zu expandieren. Die Umgebung in der du dich befindest, muss erforscht werden und erst dann lassen sich eventuell geeignete Gebiete belagern. Doch aufgepasst, neben nützlichen neuen Rohstoffen, kannst du auch auf feindliche Räuberlager stoßen. Was dann in so einer Situation passiert und wie du dich entscheidest, liegt in deiner Hand. Bevorzugst du den friedlichen Rückzug oder wagst du doch lieber einen mutigen Angriff? Egal welchen Weg du gehen wirst, es warten viele fesselnde Abenteuer auf dich.</p><p>Hat man sich ein wenig durch die Welt von <b>Supreme Pirates</b> gekämpft, geht es ans Eingemachte. <p><i>One of Only Nine Exchange Approved Precious Metals Depositories in the United States</i></p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; NEW CASTLE, DELAWARE (Jan. 12, 2016)  The Commodity Exchange, Inc. (NYMEX or Exchange) and CME Group approved <a href="http://www.idsofdelaware.com" target="_blank">International Depository Services (IDS) of Delaware</a>, a subsidiary of <a href="http://www.dillongage.com" target="_blank">Dillon Gage Metals</a>, to become an Approved Depository for gold, silver, platinum and palladium. The Exchange has approved IDS after a vigorous review process determined that the IDS facility met or exceeded the most stringent security and operational requirements expected by the Exchange. IDS becomes just the ninth precious metals depository in the United States&nbsp;to achieve COMEX approval.</p><p>Obtaining the approval of the Exchange is a tremendous achievement for our precious metals depository, said Alisa Moen, president of IDS Group. Weve been working very hard through the application process and are thrilled to deliver broader services and further benefits to our institutional and banking clients.<br></p><p>Throughout the application process, IDS met all the requisite benchmarks for buildings construction (meeting and exceeding terms as a Class III UL-Rated storage facility), storage capacity, internal and external vault security, and detailed insurance coverage policy/certification.<br></p><p>Achieving COMEX approval at IDS of Delaware brings an even higher level of trust and security to our precious metals storage operations, said Terry Hanlon, president of Dillon Gage Metals. Very few depositories in the world qualify for this level of scrutiny and status, and were proud to be counted among them.<br></p><p>IDS of Delaware is an approved depository of the Intercontinental Exchange Futures U.S. (NYSE:ICE) and is an associate member of the London Bullion Market Association (LBMA). IDS of Delaware is located at 406 West Basin Road, New Castle, Delaware. For more information, please call toll-free (888) 322-6150 or visit <a href="http://www.ids-delaware.com">www.ids-delaware.com</a>.<br></p><p>###<br></p><p><b>About Dillon Gage Metals<br></b>Dillon Gage Inc. of Dallas (DillonGage.com), founded in 1976, companies include:</p><p>	Dillon Gage Metals (<a href="http://www.DillonGage.com/Metals">www.DillonGage.com/Metals</a>), one of the worlds largest precious metals wholesale trading firms. The firm is an authorized purchaser for all major world mints and maintains inventory in over 20 countries around the world. 800-375-4653</p><p>	FizTrade Online Trading (<a href="http://www.FizTrade.com">www.FizTrade.com</a>) offers real-time bid/ask trading platform for gold, silver, platinum and palladium. 800-375-4653</p><p>	Digital Metals (<a href="http://www.DigitalMetals.com">www.DigitalMetals.com</a>) delivers advanced tools and technologies that enable market participants to be more successful in their businesses. Digital Metals offers cloud-based solutions for the physical precious metals marketplace built upon the Digital Metals Platform. 866-494-3577 </p><p>	Dillon Gage Refining (<a href="http://www.dillongage.com/refining/why-dg">www.dillongage.com/refining/why-dg</a>), professional assayers and refiners of precious metal scrap, from low grade to karat scrap. Stone removal services and diamond experts on staff. 888-436-3489</p><p>	International Depository Services Group with locations in Delaware, USA (<a href="http://www.ids-delaware.com">www.ids-delaware.com</a>; 888-322-2431), and Ontario, Canada (<a href="http://www.idsofcanada.com">www.idsofcanada.com</a>; 855-362-2431), offers secure, efficient and insured precious metals and certified coin depositories that focus of custom business logistics solutions which include storage, fulfillment, inventory managements and many other value added services.</p><p><b>About International Depository Services Group</b><br>International Depository Services Group with locations in Delaware, USA (<a href="http://www.ids-delaware.com">www.ids-delaware.com</a>; 888-322-2431), and Ontario, Canada (<a href="http://www.idsofcanada.com">www.idsofcanada.com</a>; 855-362-2431) offers secure, efficient and insured precious metals and certified coin depositories that focus on custom business logistics solutions including storage, fulfillment, inventory management and many other value-added services.</p><p><b>Contact:<br></b>Jeffrey Cheatham<br>Senior Account Manager<br>TrizCom PR<br>(972) 247-1369<br>jeffc@trizcom.com</p><p>Jo Trizila<br>President<br>TrizCom PR<br>(972) 247-1369<br>jo@trizcom.com</p><div><br></div>

Its the only product that uses a proprietary AI engine and big data to make every message precise, accurate and efficient.</p><p><b>How Robin8 Works for Content Marketers</b></p><p>Robin8 uses data-driven predictions to match content with the key opinion leaders (journalists, bloggers, social media leaders) who are most likely to be interested in it. Globally, there is an information overload from social media and content marketing. Consumers and key opinion leaders are overwhelmed, and brands are getting lost.</p><p>Tan says that Robin8 is changing the face of the industry with technology thats been years in the making. Now you can predict the success of every pitch you make to a reporter or influencer by knowing with confidence that they are likely to share your content, she says.</p><p><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/acac836f-fd80-424e-bf3b-27bbce4dbbde/twitterheadimg.png" title="Image httpwwwucarecdncomacac836f-fd80-424e-bf3b-27bbce4dbbde"><br></p><p>It starts with a database of more than a million influencers who have been profiled by the algorithm-driven AI engine that powers Robin8. Tuesday night at Target Center, playing the team whose path to the upper echelon of the Western Conference they are hoping to retrace, the Timberwolves got another difficult reminder of just how long that path is.<br><br>On the front end of a back-to-back that will take them to Houston on Wednesday, finishing up an 0-for-4 homestand, the Wolves late really came up short in a 101-96 loss to Oklahoma City.<br><br>The familiar one-two-punch of Russell Westbrook and Kevin Durant led the way as the Thunder beat the Wolves for the eighth straight time. Durant scored 30 points with seven rebounds and three assists. Westbrook, who nearly had a double-double by halftime, finished with 22 points, 11 assists and seven rebounds.<br><br>It is the Thunder, perhaps more than any other team, that the Wolves are trying to emulate. Flip Saunders often voiced his admiration of the way the Thunder  which drafted Durant in 2007 and Westbrook and Serge Ibaka in 2008  was built. The hope was that Andrew Wiggins, Karl-Anthony Towns and Zach LaVine would become the same kind of cornerstones.<br><br>Tuesday morning after the Thunders shootaround, Durant spoke highly of the way the Wolves were trying to build their team, saying they were doing it the right way. But, he said, its a tough process to go through; the Thunder won 20 games in Durants rookie season, 23 a year later with Westbrook and Ibaka before breaking through with 50 a year later.<br><br>The Wolves (12-27) continue to learn that. They lost for the seventh straight time and for the 11th time in 12 games.<br><br>But not without a fight. The Wolves were down 14 entering the fourth quarter when LaVine and Shabazz Muhammad led a charge that brought the Wolves within three points on Wiggins put-back dunk with 3:14 left.<br><br>Durant hit a 20-footer, but Wiggins followed with a layup. Durant hit again, then Wiggins made one of two free throws. But Durant scored again, with 1:15 left, to put the Thunder up six.<br><br>Continuing to bring energy off the bench, Muhammad scored 20 points. LaVine, who has battled a shooting slump, scored 21 points with nine rebounds; it was those two players who led the Wolves back in the fourth quarter. Wiggins scored 22 and Towns had 12.<br><br>The Wolves were down 13 before the game was 5 minutes old. They were down 11 after a quarter, 12 at the half and 14 entering the third before the Wolves rallied to make it a game.<br><br>Some late-arriving fans hadnt even reached their seats by the time the Thunder opened the game on a 15-2 run. The Wolves settled for  and missed  jumpers early while the Thunder moved the ball for easier shots. Thats why four of five Thunder starters scored in that 15-2 start.<br><br>But the Wolves found some energy when LaVine and Muhammad entered the game, pulling within eight late in the quarter before Oklahoma City  with Durant getting a three-point play and a three-pointer  closed the quarter strong to take an 11-point lead into the second quarter.<br><br>The Wolves bench  particularly LaVine and Muhammad  continued to click in the second. Muhammad, who scored 10 second-quarter points, hit two free throws to pull the Wolves within seven points. But two Durant jumpers sandwiched an Ibaka three-pointer and the Thunder was back up 14. Up nine late, Westbrooks three-pointer at the halftime buzzer gave Oklahoma City a 60-48 halftime lead.<br><br>Despite cutting down on the turnovers and getting nine points from Wiggins in the third quarter, the Wolves were unable to make up any ground in the third quarter. With Westbrook scoring nine points and Durant seven, the Thunder pushed the lead to 14 entering the fourth quarter.

<a href="http://emillosanto.com/" target="_blank">http://emillosanto.com/</a> <p><a></a>&nbsp;13th January, 2016-Turkey, Emillo Santo, a traditional, hand-sewn shoe maker, has decided to offer their wide product range to the world customers through their website.   </p><p>When it comes to patented leather shoes, Italian shoe making techniques are unparalleled. For many centuries now Italians have ruled the world of shoe making and still most of the high end brands of shoes have Italian parentage. Emillo Santo is one of those finest shoe makers that can boast about a heritage in shoe making spanning over three decades.  </p><p>In the world of fashion, handmade, patented leather shoes hold a special place. It is considered elite and top notch even amidst world class brands. Emillo Santo is one such name that has earned itself reputation in offering a hoard of handmade shoes and leather goods for fashion conscious men and women. Even today, their customers swear by the promises made by Emillo Santo regarding quality, craftsmanship, comfort and durability.  </p><p>The art of handmade shoemaking is a dying art. The market is loaded with manufacturers producing in mass. Emillo Santo is few of the remaining shoemakers who take their trade very seriously and till date has followed the traditional ways of shoemaking. Some of the traditional methods employed involved show drying, hand dyeing, cutting, and hand stitching each pair.  </p><p>Since they set out to rule the world of bespoke shoe making in 1984 they have continually driven by strong business ethics and determination to create unique pairs of shoes that the owners would be proud of. They are one of the largest manufacturers and retailers of handmade shoes and often produce customer designed shoes as well.</p><p>Each pair of shoes from Emillo Santo is cut out from top quality Italian full-grain calfskin leathers. Hand-sewn welt construction, full cowhide inner lining, steel shank-reinforced mid-sole for more stability are a few trademarks of Emillo Santo that set them aside from competition. It takes them over a month and around 200 highly skilled operations to produce a finished pair of shoes.</p><p> It wouldnt be wrong to state that they also offer the widest variety of men and women shoes and leather accessories. And, quite contrary to the popular belief that bespoke leather shoes are expensive their products are vary wisely priced to appeal to a larger customer base.</p><p>They have recently launched their website where they would be offering their products online. Customers now would be able to directly order from the manufacturer and get their products delivered to them. We have followed traditional ways of business for many years and we believe that the direct customer-manufacturer relationship that we have enjoyed with our esteemed customers has been a key factor in forging a long term relationship with them. But the world around us is changing fast and it would be wrong not to recognize the changes.  said the spokesperson from the brand.  </p><p>        </p><p>Whatever their reason has been to take their business to online platform it is welcome by the customers worldwide who have always longed to own a fine pair of Emillo Santo shoe or leather accessory. &nbsp;</p>

However, there are plenty of options and you don't always need to purchase an expensive one to get the most out of it, but instead there are plenty that are inexpensive options as well. Simply determine which features of the machine you want or need and look at the machines with those options and find the best one for your budget. You should also make sure that you are looking at every element and not just the budget, but look at how you plan to use it as well.</p><p><i><b>Choosing the Right One Based on Requirements</b></i><br></p><p>If you are looking for a machine that isn't extremely expensive, then  make sure to look at the <b><a href="http://treadmill-ratings-reviews.com/treadmill-reviews/budget-treadmills/horizon-fitness-t101-4/" target="_blank">Horizon Treadmill T101</a></b>. However, there are a few things that you should look into, including what features you can do without and which ones you need. There are plenty that you can look for, including heart rate monitor, calories burned and other ones that are standard, however, there are some additional ones that you can find. These ones, which aren't necessarily required, include the book stand, television and other non-crucial items.<br></p><p><i><b>Usage of Treadmill</b></i><br></p><p>Another thing that you need to think about before you check out the <b>nordictrack x9i incline trainer reviews</b> is how often you will be using the machine and for what. However, if you are planning to run full out on the machine, then you should look at the top end ones that would ensure that you have the best of everything.<br></p><p>All of these are crucial when it comes to purchasing the proper machine for your workouts, so don't forget to look at all aspects. You need to determine your budget and how much you can afford to spend on the machine and what you will be using it for since each one is used for specific needs.
