WASHINGTON, Feb. 10, 2016 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Kramerbooks  Afterwords, one of Washington, D.C.'s noted independent book stores, is hosting an author event for Love Her, Love Her Not: The Hillary Paradox (She Writes Press), a recently-released researched anthology edited by Washington, D.C.-based political journalist and commentator Joanne Bamberger.&nbsp; <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Love Her, Love Her Not: The Hillary Paradox delves into the nuances of our complicated feelings about one of the most powerful women ever in American politics. In this timely collection, Bamberger provides the narrative framework through which to view the history that's led us to this moment in time -- the moment when voters must decide whether they can forgive Hillary Clinton for not being the perfect candidate or the perfect woman and finally elect our first woman president -- then hands the stage to a unique and diverse group of writers of all ages, walks of life, and political affiliations.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Bamberger, publisher of the digital magazine The Broad Side and a regular contributor at USA Today and the San Francisco Chronicle, will be joined by contributors Mary C. Curtis, Politics Editor at Roll Call and a contributor at The Root, and Emily Zanotti, a columnist with The American Spectator.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Bamberger, Curtis and Zanotti will discuss the question explored in the book, and one that is being discussed every day now that the 2016 campaign season is in full swing  why do voters have such complicated and conflicting feelings about Hillary Clinton and how will those perspectives impact her second run for the White House?<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Love Her, Love Her Not: The Hillary Paradox is an Amazon.com #1 bestseller, was designated an Amazon Hot New Release before publication, and was recently featured on CSPAN Book TV.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Contact: Joanne Bamberger, 301-718-6269 or joanne@the-broad-side.com or Laura Rossi Public Relations, 401-487-2453 or  					  					 			   		  	 		  			     <a href="http://joannebamberger.com">http://joannebamberger.com</a><br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			      					  					 			   		  	 		  			      					  					 			   		  	 		  			     &nbsp;<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			    			   		  	 		  			   										<br>										 										SOURCE  Joanne Bamberger 			   		  	 	 RELATED LINKS<br>	 		  		  		  <a href="http://joannebamberger.com">http://joannebamberger.com</a>
WASHINGTON, Feb. 10, 2016 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Kramerbooks  Afterwords, one of Washington, D.C.'s noted independent book stores, is hosting an author event for Love Her, Love Her Not: The Hillary Paradox (She Writes Press), a recently-released researched anthology edited by Washington, D.C.-based political journalist and commentator Joanne Bamberger.&nbsp; <br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Love Her, Love Her Not: The Hillary Paradox delves into the nuances of our complicated feelings about one of the most powerful women ever in American politics. In this timely collection, Bamberger provides the narrative framework through which to view the history that's led us to this moment in time -- the moment when voters must decide whether they can forgive Hillary Clinton for not being the perfect candidate or the perfect woman and finally elect our first woman president -- then hands the stage to a unique and diverse group of writers of all ages, walks of life, and political affiliations.<br><br> 					  					 			   		  	 		  			     Bamberger, publisher of the digital magazine The Broad Side and a regular contributor at USA Today and the San Francisco Chronicle, will be joined by contributors Mary C. <p>November 6, 2013: Renowned New York City hairdresser, Sam Brocato, is literally smoothing the world of hair styling with the Brocato VibrastraitTM Oscillating Flat Iron. The extraordinary technology involved in this advanced piece of hair design equipment combines the drying properties of heat with over 7,500 oscillations per minute to smooth and shape all hair textures, while reducing styling and drying time by up to 30%. </p><p>As a busy upscale hairstylist, Brocato said that he and his team are constantly trying to improve and speed up the process of straightening hair without damaging the hair itself. Finding nothing that met his exacting specifications, he worked with a team to develop a safe, new approach. The addition of the unique vibrating sensation allows the VibrastraitTM to easily and quickly glide through the hair, instead of tugging or pulling at it. The vibrating effect can be turned on and off for different styling outcomes. </p><p>While the heat and oscillating properties dry hair and remove kinks and creases, the tourmaline ceramic plates seal in moisture, keeping hair silky smooth for days. The Nano- Silver coated plates do not groove even after repetitive uses, which means the Vibrastrait plates will maintain their slip for years. </p><p>A digital display indicates the exact temperature of the VibrastraitTM. Variable temperature settings allow for more precise control because they can be adjusted for fragile to thick coarse hair. An Integrated Super Sensor Technology enables rapid heat-up and cool-down capabilities, with heat evenly distributed throughout the plates, allowing for even penetration. Additional features include the industrys fastest recovery time, an automatic safety shut-off, an ergonomic design for easy handling, and a three year warranty. </p><p>This revolutionary flat iron has been extensively tested by the thirty members of my Brocato Design Team with transformational results for our clients, said Brocato. Heat penetration is important to the effectiveness of hair products used; conditioner responds especially well to heat. The vibrating quality makes stacked hair become smooth and even, so the flat iron can glide through it more easily. I recommend starting at the scalp and working your way down twice for sleek, luxurious, shiny hair. </p><p>Brocato has been honored as "World Top Fashion Hairstylist" by the World Hairdressing Congress in London and as "Editorial Stylist of the Year at the North American Hairstyling Awards. As the author of Beautiful Business, he shares his thoughts and visions on retailing in the salon industry. </p><p>Available for purchase on <a href="http://www.supersilk.us">www.supersilk.us</a>, <a href="http://www.ulta.com">www.ulta.com</a>, <a href="http://www.folica.com">www.folica.com</a>.&nbsp;</p><p>                               </p><p><img alt="" src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/robin8-production/robin8-production/077be8bf-c596-4ccd-a9ed-5df0f01a32d7/VIBRAstraitIron1PURPLEUpD1.png" title="Image https3amazonawscomrobin8-productionrobin8-production077be8bf-c596-4ccd-a9ed-5df0f01a32d7VIBRAstraitIron1PURPLEUpD1png"><br></p>

<p>&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<img src="http://www.ucarecdn.com/10b73daf-44d9-4c02-ac60-a05049a8cb2a/" title="Image: http://www.ucarecdn.com/10b73daf-44d9-4c02-ac60-a05049a8cb2a/"></p><p>Corporat aer going a huge transformation. Changing market dynamics, increasing digitization and changing consumer preferences have all necessitated a different approach from businesses in India. Senior executives and managers have also recognized the change unfolding around them. In order to make sure that they are on top of their game, more and more professionals are opting for executive education programs in the country.</p><p>Now, executive education in India has witnessed a resurgence of late. While management development programs and part-time business courses have always kept the working folks interested, it is only in the last few years that professionals are willingly quitting their high paying jobs and investing their time in the market. Not only does an executive education program freshen their knowledge and enhance their skills, it also give them a chance to try out something new and reorient their career towards a differentpath.</p><p>There are a slew of executive education programs in the market. Top Indian b-schools, international schools and even some corporate firms have developed programs aimed at the working executive. Typically, executive education in India is offered in the following formats:</p><p>Full-time executive masters program  If money and time is not an issue, this is the most immersive of all executive education programs. Typically lasting between 12-15 months, managers usually take a sabbatical and pursue this program. You can reap rich dividends since you are fully invested in the course. You can choose from government institutions like IIM Ahmedabad, private options like SP Jain Institute of Management and Research, Mumbai or global options like MISB Bocconi, Mumbai.&nbsp; </p><p>Part-time executive MBA program  These executive programs are ideally suited for those who cannot quit their current jobs but are interested in upping their skills. Classes are typically held on the weekends. Indian School of Business (ISB), Hyderabad offers an interesting program called PGPMAX in this category.</p><p>Online programs  A computer or mobile device coupled with a decent internet connection is all it takes for access to online executive management programs. Many leading business schools like IIFT and XLRI offer such programs in India. </p><p>            </p><p>Short programs  Lasting from 4 days to a few weeks, these programs offer deeper insights into one specific management area. These offer a great way to stay engaged with the latest trends in your work area. Most of the IIMs and other business schools offer a lot of quality short executive courses. <a href="http://www.misbbocconi.com" target="_blank">Business Schools in India</a></p>

Rolling out a self-service password reset solution requires hard work. Not only do you need to worry about the nuts and bolts of the implementation, but also create an effective communication plan to get everyone on board. And this is where the challenge comes in  getting end-users to adopt a new solution.<br><br>If you build it, they will come?<br><br>This mentality is why many IT initiatives have failed  only 37% of the financial potential of a new initiative is realized due to defects and breakdowns in the implementation phase, according to this study by project management consulting company. You may be convinced of the benefits of the solution, but your end-users may not share the same vision. Dont expect them to eagerly start using the solution. The change will not happen overnight, or at all if you dont communicate the initiative to them first.<br><br>A communication plan should be put in place to ensure that stakeholders are aware of the changes and end-users know what they should expect.<br><br>In the marketing world, the rule of seven says that the prospective buyer should hear or see the marketing message at least seven times before they buy it from you. Think of your end-users as prospective buyers. You need to repeat the same message at least seven times before they start using the tool. Explain the benefits for your end-users and repeat the message in multiple media such as emails, intranet, text messages and from the helpdesk.<br><br>Adoption rates have been proven to be higher in organizations that provide &nbsp;regular communication prior and post-rollout. Check out this 10 step communication plan for communication templates and various materials to help get users on board.<br><br>With buy-in from the right stakeholders and a communication plan in place, you are now on your way to reaping the benefits of your self-service password reset solution  reduced helpdesk calls, cost savings, increased availability and end-user productivity.
Stockholm  February 3, 2016. Specops Software announced today a new release of&nbsp;Specops uReset with support for forced enrollment and enhanced reporting functionality to allow IT administrators to easily increase enrollment levels.<br><br>Self-service password reset solutions provide measurable benefits by reducing password reset calls to the helpdesk, says Thorbjörn Sjövold, CTO of Specops Software.&nbsp; However IT departments still struggle to meet ROI goals due to poor end-user adoption rates. If end-users are not enrolled in the system they will continue to call the helpdesk.<br><br>Specops uReset provides several key features to deal with this challenge including pre-enrollment, admin enrollment and now forced enrollment options. Pre-enrollment can be achieved by selecting any of the identity services that utilize common Active Directory (AD) user profile information such as: manager details or mobile number. Admin enrollment can be used when the user profile data does not exist in AD using basic PowerShell scripting and out-of-the-box cmdlets to fill this data.<br><br>If pre-enrollment or admin enrollment are not feasible, now IT departments can set forced enrollment options to ensure that end-users enroll. These options include: opening up a browser at login or flexible intervals or opening up a full screen un-closable browser to force enrollment. These options along with the ability to drill down to see which users havent enrolled allow IT departments to tackle this issue effectively.<br><br>Specops uReset pre-enrollment and admin enrollment options are being used with great success allowing our customers to reach 100% adoption rates from day one, continues Sjövold. Now with the introduction of new forced enrollment and user based reporting functions, Specops uReset now allows IT administrators to pin point users that havent enrolled and literally force them to take action.<br><br>For more information on Specops uReset and how it can guarantee 100% end-user adoption, start you free evaluation trial today.<br><br>Specops uReset&nbsp;is the next generation password reset solution by Specops Software. The solution revolutionizes self-service password reset by providing authentication choice through its support of flexible multi-factor authentication, multiple pre-enrollment options and a highly intuitive Web interface that can be accessed anytime, anywhere from any Internet connected device to guarantee end-user adoption, higher productivity and lower IT support costs.<br><br>Specops Software is an award-winning software company that develops solutions for desktop and password management which extend the functionality of Windows infrastructure. With offices in the US, Canada, the UK and headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, Specops Software helps companies, organizations and educational institutions in more than 50 countries. Specops Software has grown steadily since it was founded in 2001 and reports strong turnover and solid profit.
In the final Democratic debate before the Nevada caucuses, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders faced off at a pivotal moment in the race for the Democratic nomination.<br><br>After a sweeping loss in the New Hampshire primary earlier this week, the former Secretary of State aimed to stop the bleeding. Meanwhile, Sanders needed to generate more momentum and support from non-white voters as he heads to more moderate, diverse states.<br><br>The Democratic presidential candidates turn to Nevada next Saturday, where each candidate needs to take a stand.<br><br>Here are five moments that mattered from the Democratic debate:<br><br>1. Whose Line Is It Anyway?<br><br>Over and over Bernie Sanders hammers home his one message: The economy is rigged and money corrupts politics. And tonight, Clinton stole it from him.<br><br>"There aren't enough good paying jobs, especially for young people. And yes, the economy is rigged in favor of those at the top, she said during her opening remarks, echoing the Vermont Senator almost word-for-word from his stump speech.<br><br>Clinton also dropped the R word during her concession speech in New Hampshire on Tuesday.<br><br>While imitation is the biggest form of flattery, it might also be the biggest sign that the once-presumed Democratic frontrunner is scrambling to find a new message.<br><br>2. History on the Stage<br><br>Hillary Clinton was asked tonight about the 55 percent of female voters supporting Bernie Sanders over the former Secretary of State in New Hampshire and what women are "missing" about her. She answered that she has "spent my entire adult life working toward making sure that women are empowered to make their own choices, even if that choice is not to vote for me."<br><br>She then took the opportunity to note some history on the stage:<br><br>"I would note just for an historic aside, somebody told me earlier today we've had like 200 presidential primary debates. And this is the first time there have been a majority of women on the stage," she said referring to herself and moderators PBS's Gwen Ifill and Judy Woodruff. "So you know, we'll take our progress wherever we can find it."<br><br>Woodruff quipped: "Senator Sanders, you're in the minority but we still want to hear from you."<br><br>The Vermont Senator -- who would be the first Jewish president -- noted, "I think a Sanders victory would be of some historical accomplishment as well."<br><br>3. Sanders Takes On Race Relations<br><br>Bernie Sanders made two unequivocal statements on race tonight. First, this -- We are looking at institutional racism, the Vermont Senator declared, citing incarceration rates, youth unemployment, and systemic poverty along racial lines.<br><br>Sanders, who desperately needs to close the gap and improve his name recognition with African American and other minority voters as he race for the partys nomination moves beyond Iowa and New Hampshire, then went further.<br><br>Asked point blank if race relations would be better under a Sanders administration, he did not hesitate, Yes.<br><br>What we will do is say instead of giving tax breaks to billionaires, we are going to create millions of jobs for low income kids so they're not hanging out on street corners. We're going to make sure that those kids stay in school or are able to get a college education, he continued.<br><br>4. Bernies Fight Over Fundraising<br><br>Its no surprise that Sanders brought up a corrupt campaign finance system where extraordinarily wealthy people make very large contributions to super PACs.<br><br><br><br>After he implied Clintons super PAC does not allow her to remain independent from corporations who donate large sums of money to her campaign, Clinton said, We are mixing apples and oranges. My 750,000 donors have contributed more than a million and a half donations. I'm very proud.<br><br>Clinton then reminisced about how President Obama was able to stand up to Wall Street even though he was the recipient of the largest number of Wall Street donations of anybody running on the democratic side ever. That did not settle well with Sanders.<br><br>Let's not insult the intelligence of the American people, Sanders said. People aren't dumb. Why in god's name does Wall Street make huge campaign contributions? I guess just for the fun of it.<br><br>5. Kissing Off Kissinger<br><br>After criticizing Clintons Iraq War vote, Sanders turned to attacking Clintons relationship with Henry Kissinger, whom Sanders called one of the most destructive secretaries of state.<br><br>In her book and in this last debate, she talked about getting the approval or the support or the mentoring of Henry Kissinger, Sanders said. ...I'm proud to say that Henry Kissinger is not my friend. I will not take advice from Henry Kissinger.<br><br>Well, I know journalists have asked who you do listen to on foreign policy and we have yet to know who that is, Clinton pointed out.<br><br>Well, it ain't Henry Kissinger, that's for sure, Sanders fired back.
Employer-based health insurance isn't about to disappear. But its erosion will continue and could eventually reach a tipping point.There are between 150 million and 160 million Americans who depend on employer-based coverage. That's less than half the U.S. population, a share that will gradually shrink over the next decade for several reasons.First, small-business employers with skimpy plans for their lower-wage workers will eventually begin encouraging their employees to seek coverage on the exchanges . They will do so because their existing plans must meet the Affordable Care Act's essential benefit package in 2017.Second, group health insurance among larger employers is rapidly moving toward the more skin in the game model. Nearly a quarter of beneficiaries are in high-deductible plans. A decade ago, it was only 4%. When the next recession hits, that number could take another spike upward.Employers, we're constantly told, offer health insurance to stay competitive in the race to recruit and retain workers. But putting people in a high-deductible plan alters that equation, since few employers fully fund the health savings accounts attached to such plans. If it's going to be my skin, I want it to be my plan.That loyalty (some call it job lock) will be further eroded by the Cadillac tax , which Congress and the White House last year postponed until 2020. Current government estimates say about 7% of people enrolled in employer-sponsored coverage will get hit by the tax, a number that will gradually rise.The whole point of the tax is to get employers to redesign plans to make beneficiaries more cost conscious. Therefore, its impact on loyalty will be the same as the rise of high-deductible plansit will make people more aware that health insurance is their responsibility, not their employers'.The rise of private exchanges is helping pave the way for the working population to accept a changed paradigm. While only 2% of covered workers in firms with over 50 employees use private exchanges, 17% are considering it, including 22% of employers with over 5,000 employees. Sen. Ted Cruz , now a front-runner in the race for the Republican nomination for president, has all but called for an end to employer-based health insurance. He couples that with ending essential benefits, ending government-run exchanges, and promoting a race to the bottom on state-based insurance regulationa disastrous set of policies for anyone concerned about overall health outcomes.But he's on to something when he calls for portability and individual responsibility. What he forgets is that Americans also yearn for security.The exchangesas long as they sell well-regulated policies that are affordablecan provide that security. The secret is including everyone in the pool. A careful read of this week's By the Numbers shows just as many countries achieve universal coverage through regulated insurance markets as through a single-payer system. Neither is better at controlling costs.We can pave the way for the gradual erosion of employer-based insurance by adopting policies that encourage individuals' use of exchanges. First, we need to shore them up by forcing Congress to fully fund the risk-adjustment program. The government needs to persuade younger, healthier people to purchase coverage.We shouldn't simply adjust the Cadillac tax, as President Barack Obama will recommend in his 2017 budget. We need to revamp the entire health insurance tax exclusion in a way that ties subsidies to income, and addresses all the reasons some plans are more expensive than others. That can be caused by the makeup of the risk pool and regional variations in the cost of care, as well as the generosity of plans.If Donald Trump's candidacy has taught us anything, it's that we're in a political period when traditional loyalties are breaking down. The same is true for the relationship between healthcare consumers and employer-based coverage.To loosely borrow from a song used in a previous political campaign: Let's start thinking about tomorrow.
<p><br> Mind Power Education College offer B.Ed. course program. Bachelor of Education is an undergraduate academic degree awarded for a course or a program in the field of education. It is popularly known as B.Ed.&nbsp; Which is an abbreviated from of the education degree. The Bachelor of Education qualifies a students to become a teacher in a school. The B.Ed. degree is mandatory for teaching in higher primary schools and high school.</p><p>Mind Power Education college (MPEC) college is the B.Ed. College in Agra. Affiliated to DR. Bhim Rao Ambedkar University Agra, it is also known as Agra University. Presently, B.Ed. is a two year full time course, enclosed by Nation Council for Teacher Education (NCTE). MPEC College offers exceptional opportunities and facilities for teacher development and for bringing out perfect amalgamation of academic learning and practical teaching skills.</p><p><b>Eligibility Criteria</b>:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Graduation leaving certificate.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Provisional board certificate.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  10th or 12th passed certificate.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Caste certificate in case of O.B.C., S.C. and S.T. candidates.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Four passport size recent photographs.&nbsp; </p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>Bachelor of Education Specializations: </b></p><p><b>T</b>eachers play a vital role in a students life and they should be a role model to the students. B.Ed. degree is compulsory to qualify as a teacher. This undergraduate program includes various teaching methods &amp; training.<b> </b></p><p>Bachelor of Education specialization is based ones choice of stream in Graduation. Depending on that one can specialize in that particular subject.</p><p><b>Vocation Opportunities after Bachelor of Education Degree:</b></p><p>As said earlier, to become a fruitful professional in teaching field one should have a minimum qualification in Bachelor of Education. The job opportunities for these professionals are various. They can discover work in different government and government helped organizations, for this recruitment the government organizes SET. After qualifying this examination one can join as teacher in any government school in the State. The B.Ed. graduates can teach in high primary and high school level.<b> </b></p><p>Teachers can never run out of employment. <p>Mind Power Education College offer B.Ed. course program. Bachelor of Education is an undergraduate academic degree awarded for a course or a program in the field of education. It is popularly known as B.Ed.&nbsp; Which is an abbreviated from of the education degree. The Bachelor of Education qualifies a students to become a teacher in a school. The B.Ed. degree is mandatory for teaching in higher primary schools and high school.</p><p>Mind Power Education college (MPEC) college is the B.Ed. College in Agra. Affiliated to DR. Bhim Rao Ambedkar University Agra, it is also known as Agra University. Presently, B.Ed. is a two year full time course, enclosed by Nation Council for Teacher Education (NCTE). MPEC College offers exceptional opportunities and facilities for teacher development and for bringing out perfect amalgamation of academic learning and practical teaching skills.</p><p><b>Eligibility Criteria</b>:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Graduation leaving certificate.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Provisional board certificate.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  10th or 12th passed certificate.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Caste certificate in case of O.B.C., S.C. and S.T. candidates.</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Four passport size recent photographs.&nbsp; </p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>Bachelor of Education Specializations: </b></p><p><b>T</b>eachers play a vital role in a students life and they should be a role model to the students. B.Ed. degree is compulsory to qualify as a teacher. This undergraduate program includes various teaching methods &amp; training.<b> </b></p><p>Bachelor of Education specialization is based ones choice of stream in Graduation. After qualifying this examination one can join as teacher in any government school in the State. The Growth of the global fertilizer industry is mainly driving the nitric acid market. As Nitric acid is used in the production of calcium ammonium nitrate and ammonium nitrate, which are used in fertilizers. Ammonium nitrate can further be used to produce urea ammonium nitrate (UAN), which is used in explosives and fertilizer solutions.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p><b>Full report available Global Nitric Acid market forecast 2015-2022 report at <a href="http://www.briskinsights.com/report/nitric-acid-market">http://www.briskinsights.com/report/nitric-acid-market</a> </b></p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>Nitric acid is used in the manufacturing of various chemicals including adipic acid, ammonium nitrate, toluene di-isocynate and nitrobenzene. <p></p><p>  <p><br></p>  <p>Museums are the best showcase of a peoples culture. In most instances whenever tourists are visiting a new place, one of the best way of understanding that region's culture is by visiting local museums. Netherlands has a rich culture, which dates over five hundred years ago. Most of the museums in the area have artifacts, which can be used to highlight particular culture or making it easier for tourist to understand an individual Netherlands culture. For a tourist to get in-depth information, it is essential they visit top rated museums. The following include some of these</p>  <p><b>Amsterdam Museum&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </b></p>  <p>Amsterdam is a metropolis made up of the city of Johan Cruijff, de United East India Company, Rembrandt, Ajax, the red light district, and marijuana. The best way to understand the city is by visiting the Amsterdam museum so that you can see, hear, read and also taste how the city came into being and why it is still the way it is.</p>  <p><b>Allard Pierson Museum</b></p>  <p>This is the archeological museum of the University of Amsterdam. This museum contains a variety of artifacts, and world art, which originated from ancient Egypt, ancient Greek world, the near east, the Roman Empire and Etruria. This museum shows the importance of these ancient civilizations to the current European culture. This Museum offers visitors a spectacular tour of diversity and vastness of civilization</p>  <p><b>Museum Our Lord In The Attic</b></p>  <p>This museum has a rich history of the Catholic Church. About 350 years back, Catholic and other religious dissenters were not able to worship in public. This lead to the creation of something magical in the heart of Amsterdam. This is the Our Lord in the Attic; it is a 17th-century canal house which has a completely hidden church. The museum usually provides an audio tour in multiple languages.</p>  <p><b>Museum of the Canals</b></p>  <p>Amsterdam is well known for its canals. When you explore these canals, you get to know how Amsterdam has evolved from centuries up to now. Canals are where trade began; the feast was celebrated and the center of the city. This museum gives tourists the chance to appreciate why canals are very popular in Amsterdam.</p>  <p><b>The Rembrandt House Museum</b></p>  <p>Rembrandt was a talented artist and a passionate collector. He had a gorgeous collection of painting, artifacts, and prints among other collection. During 1656, he went bankrupt, and everything in his house was auctioned. This house has now been restored to former glory and furnished with works and items of art from the masters time. All these has been stored in the Rembrandt House Museum</p>  <p>The above include some of the must visit museum.todoholland.com is a site which gives tourist an easy opportunity of booking these and other museums by just placing the order, receiving the ticket via email and priming it and visiting the area.<br></p></p><br>

<table> 	 	<tbody> 		<tr> 			<td class="wysiwyg-tmp-selected-cell">Wide range of ON SEMICONDUCTOR, USA EMCCD image sensor. The KAE-02150 Image Sensor is a 1080p (1920 × 1080) CCD in a 2/3? optical format that provides exceptional imaging performance in extreme low light applications. Each of the sensors four outputs incorporate both a conventional horizontal CCD register and a high gain EMCCD register. An intra-scene switchable gain feature samples each charge packet on a pixel-by-pixel basis. This enables the camera system to determine whether the charge will be routed through the normal gain output or the EMCCD output based on a user selectable threshold. This feature enables imaging in extreme low light, even when bright objects are within a dark scene, allowing a single camera to capture quality images from sunlight to starlight.<br><table> 	 	<tbody> 		<tr> 			<td>For product details go to our webpage <a href="http://www.image-sensor.in/emccd-image-sensor.php">http://www.image-sensor.in/emccd-image-sensor.php</a>  or</td> 		</tr> 		<tr> 			<td>For more details go to our corporate website <a href="http://www.image-sensor.in">http://www.image-sensor.in</a></td> 		</tr> 		<tr> 			<td>or drop an email  to us at   sales.overseas@balaji-microtechnologies.com  or sales.india@balaji-microtechnologies.com</td> 		</tr> 		<tr> 			<td>Call Us  , +91-129-4006203 , +91-129-6561300, +91-9643047670</td> 		</tr> 	</tbody> </table></td> 		</tr> 	</tbody> </table>

<p>COSTA MESA, CA&nbsp;and&nbsp;ALBANY, NY&nbsp;-- (Marketwired) --&nbsp;02/08/16&nbsp;--&nbsp;<a href="http://ctt.marketwire.com/?release=1241872&amp;id=8358610&amp;type=1&amp;url=http%3a%2f%2fwww.nemusbioscience.com%2fhome.html" rel="nofollow">NEMUS Bioscience, Inc.</a>&nbsp;(OTCQB: NMUS), a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery, development, and commercialization of cannabinoid-based therapeutics for significant unmet medical needs, today announced an agreement with&nbsp;<a href="http://ctt.marketwire.com/?release=1242729&amp;id=8389840&amp;type=1&amp;url=http%3a%2f%2fwww.amriglobal.com%2f" rel="nofollow">Albany Molecular Research Inc</a>. (NASDAQ: AMRI) for the development and manufacture of NEMUS' proprietary cannabinoid-based active pharmaceutical ingredients. The agreement will capitalize on AMRI's process chemistry expertise in the synthesis and formulation of NEMUS' proprietary prodrug of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). This molecule forms the basis of NB1111, NEMUS' compound in development for the treatment of glaucoma, and NB1222, for the management of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV).</p><p>"Advancing our lead therapeutic candidates into the manufacturing stage is a major milestone for our company," commented&nbsp;Brian Murphy, M.D., CEO-CMO of NEMUS. "This permits us to move from testing prototypic formulations to having the ability to accumulate API-based data in pre-clinical and clinical studies, which is pivotal for submission to regulatory agencies."</p><p>"AMRI looks forward to working with NEMUS to bring this new class of cannabinoid-based therapies through the developmental process," said&nbsp;Christopher Conway, Senior Vice President of Discovery and Development Services at AMRI. "AMRI will focus on manufacturing synthetic versions of NEMUS' proprietary prodrug of THC at our&nbsp;U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration&nbsp;(DEA) approved facilities."</p><p>Dr. Murphy concluded: "Eye disease and the oncologic-related palliative care markets are in need of new classes of compounds to benefit patients. There is a significant need for better treatments for patients suffering from a variety of diseases including adverse events related to their cancer care. We are excited to collaborate with a highly-experienced manufacturer like AMRI, to bring new medications such as cannabinoid-based therapeutics, to these areas of significant unmet medical need."&nbsp;</p><p>ABOUT&nbsp;NEMUS BIOSCIENCE, INC.&nbsp;<br>The Company is a biopharmaceutical company, headquartered in&nbsp;Costa Mesa, California, focused on the discovery, development, and commercialization of cannabinoid-based therapeutics for significant unmet medical needs in global markets. Utilizing certain proprietary technology licensed from the&nbsp;University of Mississippi, NEMUS is working to develop novel ways to deliver cannabinoid-based drugs for specific indications, with the aim of optimizing the clinical effects of such drugs, while limiting the potential adverse events. NEMUS' strategy will explore the use of natural and synthetic compounds, alone or in combination. The Company is led by a highly qualified team of executives with decades of biopharmaceutical experience and significant background in early-stage drug development.&nbsp;</p><p>For more information, visit&nbsp;<a href="http://ctt.marketwire.com/?release=1242729&amp;id=8389843&amp;type=1&amp;url=http%3a%2f%2fwww.nemusbioscience.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.nemusbioscience.com</a>.</p><p>ABOUT&nbsp;ALBANY MOLECULAR RESEARCH INC.&nbsp;(AMRI)&nbsp;<br>Albany Molecular Research Inc.&nbsp;(AMRI) is a global contract research and manufacturing organization that has been working with the Life Sciences industry to improve patient outcomes and the quality of life for more than two decades. With locations in&nbsp;North America,&nbsp;Europe&nbsp;and&nbsp;Asia, our key business segments include Discovery and Development Services (DDS), Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API), and Drug Product Manufacturing (DPM). Our DDS segment provides comprehensive services from hit identification to IND, including expertise with diverse chemistry, library design and synthesis, in vitro biology and pharmacology, drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics, as well as natural products. API supports the chemical development and cGMP manufacture of complex API, including potent, controlled substances, steroids, hormones, cytotoxic compounds and sterile API. DPM supports development through commercial scale production of complex liquid-filled and lyophilized parenterals, sterile suspensions and ophthalmic formulations. For more information, visit&nbsp;<a href="http://ctt.marketwire.com/?release=1242729&amp;id=8389846&amp;type=1&amp;url=http%3a%2f%2fwww.amriglobal.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.amriglobal.com</a>.</p><p>NEMUS FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS&nbsp;<br>Statements in this press release that are not descriptions of historical facts are forward-looking statements that are based on management's current expectations and assumptions and are subject to risks and uncertainties, including statements about the potential benefits of cannabinoid-based medicine and the timing of our near term, intermediate term and long term goals. Jocelyn Briddell remembers feeling paralyzed several years ago during a dinner conversation with co-workers at a colleagues home that took on an unexpected racial overtone.<br><br>Over an elaborate homemade Italian spread, her colleagues husband launched into a lengthy monologue in which he denigrated Jews, Latinos, African-Americans, Mexicans and lesbians  despite having guests that included two Jewish women, a lesbian and Briddell, who is African-American.<br><br>We were all just sitting there looking at one another, frozen, Briddell says. Finally after an hour and a half Briddell went to the bathroom and looked in the mirror, thinking what are you doing? She and her co-workers left, drove a block away and got out of their cars to talk about what happened.<br><br>We were stunned at ourselves for not saying anything, says Briddell, now executive director at the Scarritt Bennett Center in Nashville, which promotes racial justice through trainings and conferences.<br><br>Everyone goes through this when theyre sitting at the dinner table with family and friends and you think you'll just let that comment go, because its a social gathering, says Briddell.<br><br>For me it was a defining moment. I will never again not speak up. I could have told him it was offensive. I could have asked questions about why he was making those comments. But I didnt.<br><br>In recent years, there have been calls for a national dialogue about race and racism, prompted by everything from police-involved shootings of African Americans to the lack of diversity in Oscar nominations to Beyonces Super Bowl half-time show and her song, Formation.<br><br>But often, those conversations in day-to-day life can be awkward and uncomfortable.<br><br>Rinku Sen, president and executive director of Race Forward: The Center for Racial Justice Innovation and publisher of news site Colorlines, says that sometimes the best way to begin a conversation about race is by asking lots of questions.<br><br>A few years ago, Sen was waiting in line at the Sundance Film Festival to buy tickets. Sen, who is Indian-American, began chatting with a white woman behind her. The woman told her she had adopted two African-American sons. Sen told her she did racial justice work.<br><br>The woman told Sen that she had attended a two- or three-day race workshop and felt like she was hated by all the people of color there.<br><br>If I hear white privilege one more time, Im going to hurt someone, the woman told Sen. For Sen, whose career is devoted to openly talking about white privilege  the notion that white people have inherent advantages in American society  the response was offensive.<br><br>There were many, many times I wanted to roll my eyes during that conversation, Sen says. But the interesting thing I noted as we wound our way closer to the frontis that shed say something not so great and, then, if I asked her a question, shed talk her way in my direction, philosophically speaking. At one point, she said she felt that white people see themselves as individuals, and blacks and Latinos see themselves in groups. I said, you know why that is, dont you? And she said because we get to live as individuals, whereas they are always lumped in with their group.<br><br>For people of color who may be offended or angered by anothers remarks, Sens advice is to lower the litmus test. Expect people to be less than perfect. People are going to say the wrong things. Theyre going to be imperfect. Theyre not going to know a piece of history thats critical to your family.<br><br>Even if someone ultimately says the wrong thing, the fact they are willing to engage in conversation is important, she said.<br><br>Derald Wing Sue, a professor of education and psychology at Columbia Universitys Teachers College and author of the book Race Talk and the Conspiracy of Silence: Understanding and Facilitating Difficult Dialogues on Race,&nbsp;says even when conversations take a turn for the worse, he tries to keep dialogue open.<br><br>Sue, who is Asian American, recalled an interaction with a white female student in his class who interrupted him while he was talking about race.<br><br>The woman challenged Sue, pointing out that women are oppressed, too. She was uncomfortable and resistant, almost as if she felt like Sue was accusing white students of racism, he said.<br><br>When these interactions happen, I will generally agree, Sue said. Women are also a marginalized group in our society. But then I made a process observation. I told her, youre right about that, but you seem so upset and angry. Where is that coming from?<br><br>Eventually we got to the point that she understood what racism was about because as a woman, she had experienced the same things as well, Sue says. When we get to the point we can talk about what buttons we are pushing, then we can really hear one another.<br><br>Rev. William Barber, president of the North Carolina state chapter of the NAACP and author of The Third Reconstruction,&nbsp;says sometimes the most productive conversations about race dont focus on skin color, but the broader class divisions and societal problems  issues such as police brutality, access to healthcare and childcare, voting rights and economic inequality.<br><br>Barbers work promoting interracial dialogue within North Carolina communities has led to the creation of seven local chapters of National Association for the Advancement of Colored People that are predominantly white  and a recognition by some in those communities that Barber is representing interests that cross racial lines.<br><br>When you deal with race from systemic perspectives and examine disparities, you can show how policies that disparately hurt black people end up hurting us all, he says.<br><br>For Briddell, one of the biggest bridge-builders is to tell personal stories so people can see how their upbringings and lives are shaped differently by race.<br><br>Briddell had a conversation recently with a white co-worker who talked about his experience going to Ocean City in New Jersey as a child.<br><br>Briddell, whose family lives in the area, told him about her dad, an African-American who could not visit Ocean City. The only African-Americans who went to Ocean City in the 1940s and 1950s were gardeners, housekeepers or kitchen workers.<br><br>My coworker told me how much he appreciated my personal experience, because it made him think about how our lives were shaped differently because of racism, she says. He said there are places I have been going to all my life and never thought about this.<br><br>So how do you have a conversation about race?<br><br>&nbsp;Ask questions rather than make assertions, so you can understand why someone holds certain beliefs or opinions.<br><br>&nbsp;Tell personal stories about your life experiences and listen to how they differ from others.<br><br>&nbsp;Temper your reaction if someone says something that offends you, but try to acknowledge the impact of their words as quickly as possible. Take a break from the conversation if necessary and walk around the block. You cant calmly respond if you are too filled with emotion to articulate why.<br><br>&nbsp;Take a deep breath and don't freeze when conversations turn awkward or uncomfortable.<br><br>&nbsp;Talk about policies and larger system-wide issues that may disproportionately affect people of color but have a wider impact on the entire community.<br><br>&nbsp;Take a chance even if it makes you uncomfortable. If you make a mistake, youll get the chance to have another conversation. Just a willingness to begin the discussion is an important step.<br><br>&nbsp;For people of color, lower the litmus test. People are going to make mistakes and they are going to say the wrong thing. Expect people to be less than perfect, but remain engaged in the conversation.<br><br>&nbsp;Focus on the impact of peoples words and not the intentions behind them. People say racist things with intention and without intention.<br><br>&nbsp;Educate yourself. There are thoughtful analyses and stories available for everyone to read.<br><br>&nbsp;Any opportunity is a good opportunity to talk about race, not just tragedies. Big national stories often spark conversation but there is a version of that big national story probably going on near you.
<p>As James Collins once said:</p><p><br></p><p>"Greatness is not a function of circumstance. Greatness, it turns out, is largely a matter of conscious choice, and discipline." &nbsp;? James C. Collins, Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't</p><p><br></p><p>What does it take for a company to go from successful to super-rich?</p><p><br></p><p>Nick Fortune, CEO of FortuneDNA and founder of the HUSH Secrets of the Ultra-Wealthy Forum may hold the answer.</p><p><br></p><p>After years of touring with some of the largest real-estate, investment gurus and wealth building organizations in the world such as the Trump Organization, the Robert Allen Institute, Robert Kiyosaki (Author of "Rich Dad, Poor Dad"), and many other "gurus," Nick and his speakers have built relationships with the "movers and shakers" behind the world's richest elite.</p><p><br></p><p>And it turned his stomach.</p><p><br></p><p>According to Nick, "Most of those who are out front teaching people in a room at $5,000 a person, were never successful themselves in running a successful business, before they realized they could fill a room up and sell information."</p><p><br></p><p>FortuneDNA is a 28 year national conglomerate encompassed of Legal, Tax, Financial, and Business Consulting Professionals with hundreds of years of combined experience.</p><p><br></p><p>He believes the difference between the average consumer and the ultra-wealthy is education and action. &nbsp;FortuneDNA and its associates have spoken for some of the largest real estate gurus and wealth building organizations in the world and continue to be advisors to the same.</p><p><br></p><p>Each year, Nick and his crack-team of professional speakers, authors, coaches and trainers help thousands of clients, teaching them the secrets of the Ultra Wealthy.</p><p>When working with Fortune DNA, you learn how to reduce your tax liability by 15-50%, obtain up to $50,000 in business credit regardless of FICO score, properly structure a business to protect patents, how to buy stocks, bonds, mutual funds and even real-estate 100% tax-free, legally, and attract investors &amp; <p><b>Strong sales growth, new employees:</b></p><p><b>flexword from Mannheim achieves positive results for the 2015 financial year</b></p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p>(Mannheim, January 2016) flexword Translators &amp; Consultants, one of the leading professional language service providers that works strictly according to the native speaker principle, achieved extremely positive results for the 2015 financial year.&nbsp; Headquartered in Mannheim, Germany, flexword was able to boost its sales by 62%, increase the number of permanent employees to 33 and expanded its pool of translators around the world to approx. 8,000 trained translators and proofreaders. Thus, the expansion of the company, which was founded in 1992 and has completed projects for more than 1,000 clients from a wide variety of sectors from the automotive industry to pharmaceuticals, is showing no signs of stopping. Goranka Mi-?ak, Founder and Managing Director of flexword: "Our commitment to uncompromising quality and our successful business development have paid off. We are especially pleased that we were able to expand our core team in 2015 to include more key employees."</p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p>As a result, flexword, which was one of the first translation service providers to be certified according to DIN 15038, also grew in 2015, against the market trend. Goranka Mi-?ak: "We are convinced that we can only win over clients in this competitive market by offering them top quality and added value. This is why we do everything to provide first-class translations around the clock, and are consistently expanding our service portfolio in order to do so." </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>The network of translators has been strategically extended across all time zones. The global translator team allows flexword to offer translations exclusively by specialist native speakers who are professional translators and have many years of experience. Because they work in different time zones, orders can also be carried out outside core business hours or overnight. Improved customer satisfaction ratings show that the company's investment in further project management and quality assurance staff has paid off.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>flexword has also set itself many goals for 2016, for example, a new overseas office is planned and the team in Mannheim is to be increased to 40 employees.</p><p><u>&nbsp;</u></p><p>For more information please contact <b>Elise Grosdidier</b>&nbsp;either by:</p><p>                        </p><p>phone<b>&nbsp;+49 (0) 621 39 74 78-290</b>&nbsp;or email <a href="mailto:elise.grosdidier@flexword.de"><b>elise.grosdidier@flexword.de</b></a><b>.</b></p>
<p><b>Recommended</b>&nbsp;<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Infectious Diseases Conferences</a>&nbsp;| <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/" title="Link: http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Microbiology Conferences</a>&nbsp;| <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Infection Conferences</a>&nbsp;</p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe" title="Link: http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe">OMICS International </a>Conferences invites all the participants from all over the world to attend Infectious Diseases Europe 2016 which includes prompt Keynote Presentations, Special Sessions, Workshops, Symposiums, Oral talks, Poster Presentations and Exhibitions. </p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Viral Infectious Disease</a>&nbsp;occurs when an organism's body is invaded by pathogenic viruses, and infectious virus particles (virions) attach to and enter susceptible cells. There are many types of viruses that cause a wide variety of viral diseases. The most common type of <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">viral disease</a>&nbsp;is the common cold, which is caused by a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract (nose and throat). <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Viral diseases</a>&nbsp;are contagious and spread from person to person when a virus enters the body and begins to multiply. Viral diseases result in a wide variety of symptoms that vary in character and severity depending on the type of viral infection and other factors, including the persons age and overall health.</p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Bacteria</a>&nbsp;are living things that have only one cell. Under a microscope, they look like balls, rods, or spirals. They are so small that a line of 1,000 could fit across a pencil eraser. Most bacteria won't hurt you - less than 1 percent of the different types make people sick. Many are helpful. Some bacteria help to digest food, destroy disease-causing cells, and give the body needed vitamins. Bacteria are also used in <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">making healthy</a>&nbsp;foods like yogurt and cheese. But <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">infectious bacteria</a>&nbsp;can make you ill. They reproduce quickly in your body. Many give off chemicals called toxins, which can damage tissue and make you sick. Examples of bacteria that cause infections include Streptococcus, Staphylococcus, and E. coli. Antibiotics are the usual treatment. When you take antibiotics, follow the directions carefully. Each time you take antibiotics, you increase the chances that bacteria in your body will learn to resist them causing antibiotic resistance. Later, you could get or spread an <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">infection</a> that those antibiotics cannot cure.</p><p>        </p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungi</a>&nbsp;are everywhere. There are approximately 1.5 million different species of fungi on Earth, but only about 300 of those are known to make people sick. Fungal diseases are often caused by fungi that are common in the environment. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">Fungi</a>&nbsp;live outdoors in soil and on plants and trees as well as on many indoor surfaces and on human skin. Most fungi are not dangerous, but some types can be harmful to health. Fungal diseases can affect anyone. Learning about them can help you and your doctor recognize the symptoms of a fungal disease early and may help prevent serious complications. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungal diseases</a>&nbsp;are often caused by fungi that are common in the environment. Most fungi are not dangerous, but some types can be harmful to health. Mild fungal skin diseases can look like a rash and are very common. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungal diseases</a>&nbsp;in the lungs are often similar to other illnesses such as the flu or tuberculosis. Some fungal diseases like <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">fungal meningitis</a>&nbsp;and bloodstream infections are less common than skin and lung infections but can be deadly.</p>
<p>Curated Content is adding to its existing office network of Melbourne, Sydney and Hong Kong with news of the companys expansion into the US, opening its doors in Los Angeles this week.</p><p><br></p><p>Sydney, Australia., February 15th, 2016 - Leading Australian content and inbound marketing agency, Curated Content has officially opened the doors to its Los Angeles office. The news comes only weeks after announcing the launch of its Hong Kong office, following the acquisition of foundation client, Marriott International, via Curated Contents visual analytics brand, Datalabs.</p><p><br></p><p>Curated Content, headquartered in Melbourne Australia, and with offices in Sydney, and Hong Kong, views the extension of its network as a key pillar shoring up its ability to focus its content, inbound marketing and visual analytics capabilities squarely on the Asia-Pacific region.</p><p><br></p><p>As a key partner of global inbound marketing platform, HubSpot, Curated Content offers seamless and scalable marketing automation solutions for clients all over the world, particularly in the Asia-Pacific region. Curated Contents expertise in content strategy, visual and written content and distribution services, is complimented by Datalabs suite of data visualisation and analytics products. Together, playing in the content and data space, Curated Content and Datalabs offer one of Australias most robust and comprehensive end-to-end service models.</p><p><br></p><p>We really do see inbound marketing becoming the cornerstone of content marketing efforts, especially in the B2B sector. Without a really strong marketing automation platform capability, its going to be increasingly difficult for businesses to reach those qualified leads with any scale. Weve invested heavily in the skill sets required to provide our clients with a comprehensive all-in-one solution, and with boots on the ground in new markets, were right were our clients need us. Its an exciting time for us, and the combined strengths of both our Curated Content and Datalabs brands is where creativity and data science collide.</p><p><br></p><p>Heading up Curated Contents Los Angeles office will be Adam Wiggins in the role of Head of Strategy. Adam will work closely with Curated Contents Digital Marketing Manger, Julia Gumbleton, a former Digital Strategist at Australian Radio Network, who will work out of the Melbourne office.</p><p><br></p><p>Adams specialist inbound marketing skills and experience first impressed us when he was our client. When the opportunity came to bring him on board, we absolutely jumped on it. Adam is thrilled to be back home in the states doing what he loves in a market he knows very well. With Julias experience and digital marketing skills added to the mix, they make for an impressive duo. Curated Content co-founder and Managing Director, Cath Pope said.</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;Our companys focus on the Asia-Pacific region represents exciting opportunities and has always been our goal since the get-go. Our data-driven approach to content and inbound marketing, and the capability to analyse and report on those efforts using Datalabs range of beautiful visual reporting products is great news for clients looking for absolute transparency and detailed insights into their marketing efforts.</p><p><br></p><p>About Curated Content</p><p><br></p><p>Curated Content was founded in 2010 specialising in content strategy, written and visual content creation, content distribution and inbound marketing. Curated Contents sister brand Datalabs, specialises in data visualisation and communication, data analysis and visual marketing analytics. </p><p><br></p><p>The company has offices in Melbourne, Sydney, Hong Kong and Los Angeles. </p><p><br></p><p>Clients include the Australian Government, Transurban, SEEK, ANZ Bank, Gumtree, JLL, the Australian Bureau of Statistics and Nickelodeon.</p><p><br></p><p>For more information, visit <a href="http://www.curatedcontent.com.au">www.curatedcontent.com.au</a>.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/">OMICS International</a>&nbsp;cordially invites all participants across the globe to attend the 3rd&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="http://biomedical.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://biomedical.conferenceseries.com/">Biomedical Engineering</a>Conference and Expo (Biomedical 2016) which is going to be held during August 22-23 in Vienna, Austria to share the&nbsp;<a href="http://biomedical.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php" title="Link: http://biomedical.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">advancements in the field of Biomedical Engineering</a>&nbsp;and technology.<br></p>
<p><a><b>Omics International</b></a> welcome you to participate in the upcoming <a href="http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/"><b>8th World Medical Nanotechnology Congress &amp; Expo</b></a> at Dallas, USA during June 08 - 09, 2016.</p><p>&nbsp;Medical Nanotechnology 2016 brings together leading scientists, engineers, directors of companies in the field of Nanotechnology, Biomedical Engineering, Medicine and Pharmaceuticals to exchange information on their latest research progress. The main theme of the conference is Nano and molecular technologies in medical theranostics" which covers a wide range of critically important sessions.</p><p>&nbsp;<b>Medical Nanotechnology 2016</b> Emphasizes on:</p><p>Ø&nbsp; <a href="http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/events-list/nanotechnology-for-treatment-of-stroke-and-spinal-cord-injury" title="Link: http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/events-list/nanotechnology-for-treatment-of-stroke-and-spinal-cord-injury">Nanotechnology for Treatment of Stroke and Spinal Cord Injury</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><table>  <tbody><tr>   <td class="wysiwyg-tmp-selected-cell">   <p><b>Last Date for abstract Submission</b><b></b></p>   </td>      <td>   <p><b>Mar 15, 2016</b><b></b></p>   </td>      <td>   <p><a href="http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php"><b>http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php</b></a><b></b></p>   </td>     </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p><b>Early bird Registration</b><b></b></p>   </td>      <td>   <p><b>Feb 27, 2016</b><b></b></p>   </td>      <td>   <p><a href="http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/registration.php"><b>http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/registration.php</b></a><b></b></p>   </td>     </tr>  <tr>   <td>   <p><b>Conference dates </b><b></b></p>   </td>      <td>   <p><b>June 08-09, 2016</b><b></b></p>   </td>      <td>   <p><b><a href="http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/">http://medicalnanotechnology.conferenceseries.com/</a></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>                                            </p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><b>Recommended</b>&nbsp;<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/" title="Link: http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Infectious Diseases Conferences</a>&nbsp;| <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Microbiology Conferences</a>&nbsp;| <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Infection Conferences</a>&nbsp;</p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe" title="Link: http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe">OMICS International </a>Conferences invites all the participants from all over the world to attend Infectious Diseases Europe 2016 which includes prompt Keynote Presentations, Special Sessions, Workshops, Symposiums, Oral talks, Poster Presentations and Exhibitions. </p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Viral Infectious Disease</a>&nbsp;occurs when an organism's body is invaded by pathogenic viruses, and infectious virus particles (virions) attach to and enter susceptible cells. There are many types of viruses that cause a wide variety of viral diseases. The most common type of <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">viral disease</a>&nbsp;is the common cold, which is caused by a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract (nose and throat). <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Viral diseases</a>&nbsp;are contagious and spread from person to person when a virus enters the body and begins to multiply. Viral diseases result in a wide variety of symptoms that vary in character and severity depending on the type of viral infection and other factors, including the persons age and overall health.</p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Bacteria</a>&nbsp;are living things that have only one cell. Under a microscope, they look like balls, rods, or spirals. They are so small that a line of 1,000 could fit across a pencil eraser. Most bacteria won't hurt you - less than 1 percent of the different types make people sick. Many are helpful. Some bacteria help to digest food, destroy disease-causing cells, and give the body needed vitamins. Bacteria are also used in <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">making healthy</a>&nbsp;foods like yogurt and cheese. But <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">infectious bacteria</a>&nbsp;can make you ill. They reproduce quickly in your body. Many give off chemicals called toxins, which can damage tissue and make you sick. Examples of bacteria that cause infections include Streptococcus, Staphylococcus, and E. coli. Antibiotics are the usual treatment. When you take antibiotics, follow the directions carefully. Each time you take antibiotics, you increase the chances that bacteria in your body will learn to resist them causing antibiotic resistance. Later, you could get or spread an <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">infection</a> that those antibiotics cannot cure.</p><p>        </p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungi</a>&nbsp;are everywhere. There are approximately 1.5 million different species of fungi on Earth, but only about 300 of those are known to make people sick. Fungal diseases are often caused by fungi that are common in the environment. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">Fungi</a>&nbsp;live outdoors in soil and on plants and trees as well as on many indoor surfaces and on human skin. Most fungi are not dangerous, but some types can be harmful to health. Fungal diseases can affect anyone. Learning about them can help you and your doctor recognize the symptoms of a fungal disease early and may help prevent serious complications. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungal diseases</a>&nbsp;are often caused by fungi that are common in the environment. Most fungi are not dangerous, but some types can be harmful to health. Mild fungal skin diseases can look like a rash and are very common. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungal diseases</a>&nbsp;in the lungs are often similar to other illnesses such as the flu or tuberculosis. Some fungal diseases like <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">fungal meningitis</a>&nbsp;and bloodstream infections are less common than skin and lung infections but can be deadly.</p>

There are approximately 1.5 million different species of fungi on Earth, but only about 300 of those are known to make people sick. Fungal diseases are often caused by fungi that are common in the environment. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">Fungi</a>&nbsp;live outdoors in soil and on plants and trees as well as on many indoor surfaces and on human skin. Most fungi are not dangerous, but some types can be harmful to health. Fungal diseases can affect anyone. Learning about them can help you and your doctor recognize the symptoms of a fungal disease early and may help prevent serious complications. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungal diseases</a>&nbsp;are often caused by fungi that are common in the environment. Most fungi are not dangerous, but some types can be harmful to health. Mild fungal skin diseases can look like a rash and are very common. <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Fungal diseases</a>&nbsp;in the lungs are often similar to other illnesses such as the flu or tuberculosis. Some fungal diseases like <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">fungal meningitis</a>&nbsp;and bloodstream infections are less common than skin and lung infections but can be deadly.</p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Bacterial resistance</a>&nbsp;is a growing threat and yet few new antibiotics active against multi-resistant bacteria are being explored. A combination of falling profits, <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">regulatory mechanisms</a>&nbsp;and irrational and injudicious use of<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">antibiotics</a>&nbsp;has led to an alarming situation where some infections have no cure. In this article, we summarize the new developments that have been suggested to incentivize the pharmaceutical industries toward the field of<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">infections</a>. We also briefly mention the new compounds on the horizon and some newly approved compounds that might help us tide over this crisis.</p><p>            </p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Global Market Reports</a>&nbsp;of infectious diseases is a complete study of current trends in the <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">infectious diseases</a>therapeutic and diagnostic market, industry growth drivers, advanced therapies and restraints. It provides market projections for the coming years. It includes analysis of recent developments in technology for <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">infection diagnosis</a>&nbsp;and treatment. Market reports also includes a review of micro and macro factors essential for the existing market players and new entrants along with detailed value chain analysis.</p>

A combination of falling profits, <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">regulatory mechanisms</a>&nbsp;and irrational and injudicious use of<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">antibiotics</a>&nbsp;has led to an alarming situation where some infections have no cure. In this article, we summarize the new developments that have been suggested to incentivize the pharmaceutical industries toward the field of<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php" title="Link: http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">infections</a>. We also briefly mention the new compounds on the horizon and some newly approved compounds that might help us tide over this crisis.</p><p><a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">Global Market Reports</a>&nbsp;of infectious diseases is a complete study of current trends in the <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">infectious diseases</a>therapeutic and diagnostic market, industry growth drivers, advanced therapies and restraints. It provides market projections for the coming years. It includes analysis of recent developments in technology for <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">infection diagnosis</a>&nbsp;and treatment. Market reports also includes a review of micro and macro factors essential for the existing market players and new entrants along with detailed value chain analysis.</p><p>              </p><p>A <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">parasitic disease</a>&nbsp;is an infectious disease caused or transmitted by a parasite. Many parasites do not cause<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">diseases</a>. Parasitic diseases can affect practically all living organisms, including plants and mammals. The study of parasitic diseases is called parasitology. Some parasites like Toxoplasma gondii and Plasmodium spp. can cause disease directly, but other organisms can cause disease by the toxins that they produce. Although organisms such as bacteria function as parasites, the usage of the term "<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">parasitic disease</a>" is usually more restricted. The three main types of organisms causing these conditions are <a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/">protozoa</a>&nbsp;(causing protozoan infection), helminths (helminthiasis), and ectoparasites. Protozoa and helminths are usually endoparasites (usually living inside the body of the host), while ectoparasites usually live on the surface of the host. Occasionally the definition of "<a href="http://infection.omicsgroup.com/europe/call-for-abstracts.php">parasitic disease</a>" is restricted to diseases due to endoparasites. </p>

<p><b>The world is changing</b>. The way people are perceiving and analysing things is changing. Everyday more and more people are getting online, changing the dynamics of marketing incredibly. Marketing is not about Billboards and Television Ads anymore, it is about being visible to your customer in their research phase. In pursuit of achieving these objectives, Organisations around the world have realised that Online Marketing (also referred to as Digital Marketing) is the most powerful and effective way of Marketing. <a href="http://www.infinityreach.com" target="_blank" title="Link: http://www.infinityreach.com">Digital Marketing</a> has found its Rightful place in the Western and the European markets but in India it is still at a very nascent stage and is a much undervalued form of Marketing.</p><p>WHY is it that every small firm in the West has a presence online but the biggest organisations in India still dont have a Facebook page? A laymans response would be "Perception and the Attitude of the Organisations in the subcontinent should change", if we analyse extensively, this is absolutely true. It is a well-known fact that big Organisations have shut down as they were not able to reach the right customers due to ineffective and unplanned Marketing Campaigns. But slowly and surely the shift from conventional marketing to Online Marketing is happening as the firms are understanding the value of Digital Marketing. In Hindsight, companies are going to spend more on Online Marketing Vis a Vis Conventional Marketing as they are realising the true potential and reach of Online Marketing.</p><p>A few Metros in India like Mumbai, Bengaluru and Delhi have been among the early adopters to this paradigm shift and have contributed hugely to where Digital Marketing is placed currently in India. The early bird Digital Marketing Agencies from these cities have made inroads into MNCs and have to an extent transformed the way Organisations have looked upon Marketing for Decades. These inroads have opened a huge potential market for Digital Marketing Agencies and have resulted in a huge splurge of these agencies in other Metros like Hyderabad and Tier1 cities like Pune.</p><p>Although Organisations and Marketing Heads have come to realise the importance of Digital Marketing for their survival in this competitive world, in Hyderabad most of the firms still undervalue this platform of Marketing and in Reality they treat it like a minute part of Conventional Marketing. The reason being they are still not completely aware of the widespread reach and the effectiveness of Digital Marketing. Lets look at this case study about a Big Organisation and how initially they were very skeptical about Digital Marketing but in due course of time they realised its potential and currently spend 10 fold more than what they initially started off with:</p><p><a href="http://smrholdings.in/" target="_blank">SMR Holdings</a> Case Study: A 25 year old Infrastructure firm known for building some of the biggest projects in Hyderabad and Bengaluru. Every year they spend heavily on conventional Marketing like Billboards and Paper Ads. They signed up with Infinity Reach a couple of months back and initially gave us a meagre spending budget, and we completely revamped their website, created new landing pages, new Facebook page, started smart SEO and spent wisely on Google AdWords, which in just a few months time started showing quantifying results. The Firm started recognising the impact of Digital Marketing on their business and completely transformed their Marketing strategy. They have seen a considerable increase in the number of sales and as they say the rest is history.</p><p>Organisations, CEOs and the Marketing Heads located in the Pearl City are yet to recognise the true potential of Digital Marketing. So will they do that in the near future? Well only TIME can tell. But one fact is very certain that current Organisations should learn from the past debacles of big Organisations and realise the potential of Digital Marketing and give its due credit.</p><p> </p><p><br></p>
