<p>It is our great pleasure to invite you to our <a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">4th International Conference on Vascular Dementia</a> during June 30 to July 02, 2016 at Valencia, Spain.</p><p>Conference Theme: <i>Integrating Recent Discoveries and Interpreting Vascular Dementia Research for Better Health</i></p><p><a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Vascular Dementia 2016</a> is a specially designed conference to bring the expertise in the field of <a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Neurology</a>, Psychiatry, and Gerontology across the world for mutual sharing of their invaluable knowledge and Nobel work. Our <a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Vascular Dementia conference</a> welcomes Researchers, Doctors, Students and Exhibitors from all over the world to Valencia, Spain.</p><p>Conduct demonstrations, meet with eminent personalities, distribute information on <a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Vascular Dementia Research</a>, its Therapeutic advances and many more topics related to various <a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Neurological disorders</a> and associated <a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Brain disorders</a> and make a splash with novel therapeutic approaches at this outstanding event.</p><p><a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Vascular dementia</a> is the second-most-common type of dementia in the United States and Europe in the elderly; however it is the most common form in some parts of Asia. The incidence of the illness is 1.5% in Western countries and just about 2.2% in Japan. It accounts for 50% of all dementias in Japan, 20% to 40% in Europe and 15% in Latin America. The prevalence of dementia is 9 times higher in patients who have had a stroke than in controls. 25% of stroke patients develop new-onset dementia within 1 year of their stroke. The relative risk of incident dementia is 5.5% within 4 years of suffering a stroke.</p><p><a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Vascular Dementia Congress</a> anticipates more than 250 participants around the globe with inspirational Keynote lectures, Oral and Poster presentations. &nbsp;<a href="http://vasculardementia.conferenceseries.com/">Vascular Dementia Meeting</a> Organizing Committee welcomes you to join us, where you will be sure to have a great experience with scholars from around the world.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>                          </p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Plastic Surgery is a special type of surgery that can involve both a persons appearance and ability to function. Plastic Surgeons strive to improve patients appearance and self-image through both reconstructive and cosmetic procedures. Plastic surgery restores and improves function, as well as appearance. It can involve surgery on any part of the human body, except the central nervous system.</p><p>  </p><p>International Conference and Exhibition on Plastic and Aesthetic Surgery will be organized during Aug 08-10, 2016 at Toronto, Canada. The conference highlights the theme Innovations, outcomes and new technologies in Plastic and Aesthetic Surgery. Plastic-aesthetic Surgery-2016 will bring together leading surgeons, physicians, research scholars, students along with industrial and pharma professionals to exchange their views on critical aspects of Plastic and aesthetic  surgery. The event is designed in a way to provide an exclusive platform for new researchers, scholars and educators to present and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, and concerns, practical challenges encountered and the solutions adopted.<br> Plastic-aesthetic Surgery-2016 will comprise leading keynote speakers, session speakers, poster presenters who will be presenting their advanced research on the topics such as Facial Rejuvenation, Hand &amp; Upper Extremities Track, Craniomaxillofacial/ Head, Neck and Cosmetic Dentistry and Non-Surgical Aesthetic Procedures. A variety of companies will display products and services that provide solutions for managing surgery and reconstructing or repairing parts of the body disorders.</p>
<p><b>1. &nbsp; AN INTERACTIVE SESSION ON ESOP ISSUES</b></p><p><b>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Amity Innovation Incubator</b></p><p><img alt="" src="http://www.ucarecdn.com/6f659571-4ca5-4507-96d0-a32fb6d6fbcb/"><br></p><p>The performance of the company is the outcome of its employees efforts. Simultaneously, the concept of ESOP has also been mushrooming amongst corporate players who want a mechanism that could retain talents in their company and thereby, enhance the performance of their employees. Mr. Rajesh Sharma addressed an interactive session on ESOP which was organized by Amity Innovation Incubator on November 18th, 2015. He discussed the concept of ESOP with various entrepreneurs comprehensively. Mr. Rajesh Sharma gave his views upon ESOP as a non-cash retention solution, its importance, implementation of ESOP, procedure and criteria to issue ESOP and tax implication of ESOP. He also discussed how and why ESOP is a smart option for startups by analyzing Productivity of Huawei and ZTE, respectively.</p><p><br></p><p><b>2. &nbsp; BW ACCELERATE</b></p><p><b>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; BW:BusinessWorld</b></p><p><img alt="" src="http://www.ucarecdn.com/9a958830-64b4-4cf7-ac5e-764c291800af/" title="Image httpwwwucarecdncom9a958830-64b4-4cf7-ac5e-764c291800af"><br></p><p>The Life moves forward like a Business Cycle, wherein phases such as Peak and Trough are ubiquitous. <p>Surgery Conferences | Surgery Meetings | Plastic Surgery Conferences:</p><p>  </p><p><a href="http://surgery.conferenceseries.com/abstract-submission.php">General surgery</a>&nbsp;is the specialty which deals surgery of the organs of the body. Surgery is a technology consisting of a physical intervention on tissues, and muscle. This procedure is considered surgical when it involves cutting of a patient's tissues or closure of a previously sustained wound. Other procedures such as angioplasty or endoscopy, may be considered surgery if they involve "common" surgical procedure or settings, such as use of a sterile environment, anesthesia, antiseptic conditions, typical surgical instruments, and suturing or stapling. All forms of surgery are considered invasive procedures; so-called "noninvasive surgery" usually refers to an excision that does not penetrate the structure being excision.</p>

Surgery is a technology consisting of a physical intervention on tissues, and muscle. This procedure is considered surgical when it involves cutting of a patient's tissues or closure of a previously sustained wound. Other procedures such as angioplasty or endoscopy, may be considered surgery if they involve "common" surgical procedures or settings, such as use of a sterile environment, anesthesia, antiseptic conditions, typical surgical instruments, and suturing or stapling. All forms of surgery are considered invasive procedures; so-called "noninvasive surgery" usually refers to an excision that does not penetrate the structure being excision.</p>

Each includes:</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Private bath</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Kitchenette</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Built-in storage</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Housekeeping</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Three delicious meals a day</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  On-site maintenance</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  Transportation</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  On-site beauty and barbershop</p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  24 hour emergency call-light assistance</p><p><b>&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>Contact Summerfield:</b></p><p>Telephone: (801) 434-7581</p><p>Email: administrator@summerfieldinfo.com</p><p>Address: 911 North 800 West, Orem, Utah 84057</p><p>                                                                      </p><p>Website: <a href="http://summerfieldinfo.com/home.html" target="_blank">www.summerfieldinfo.com</a></p>
<p>Nanotek Conference and Expo pave a platform to globalize the research by installing a dialogue between industries and academic organizations and knowledge transfer from research to industry. <br>Nanotek 2016 aims in proclaim knowledge and share new ideas amongst the professionals, industrialists and students from research areas of Nanotechnology and Materials Science to share their research experiences and indulge in interactive discussions and special sessions at the event.</p>
<p><a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/">Mucosal Immunology - 2016 </a>is to &nbsp;gathering people in academia and society interested in immunology to share the latest trends and important issues relevant to our field/subject area World Mucosal Immunology Summit-2016 brings together the Global leaders in Immunology and relevant fields to present their research at this exclussive scientific program. The Immunology Conference hosting presentations from editors of prominent refereed journals, renowned and active investigators and deciscion makers in the field of Immunology. World Mucosal Immunology -2016 Organizing Committee also invites &nbsp;Young investigators at every career stage to submit abstracts reporting their latest scientific findings in oral and poster sessions. <br></p><p><a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Mucosal Vaccination</a>- Most infectious agents enter the body at mucosal surfaces and therefore <a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">mucosal immune responses </a>function as a first line of defence. Protective mucosal immune responses are most effectively induced by mucosal immunization through oral, nasal, rectal or vaginal routes, but the vast majority of <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/vaccines-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">vaccines </a>in use today are administered by injection. Immunisation involves the delivery of antigens to the <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/vaccines-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">mucosal immune system </a>(dispersed or organised into units such as Peyers patches in the intestine or the nasal-associated lymphoid tissue in the oropharangeal cavity). The antigen delivery systems may comprise a simple buffer solution with/without <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/vaccine-adjuvants-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">adjuvants</a>&nbsp;or an advanced particulate formulation, such as liposomes or <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/nanoparticles-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">nanoparticles.</a>&nbsp;The most commonly evaluated route for mucosal antigen delivery is oral, but other routes have also been explored.<br></p><p>&nbsp;<a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Mucosal Vaccines Adjuvants</a>- Most infectious agents enter the body at mucosal surfaces and therefore <a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">mucosal immune responses </a>function as a first line of defence. Protective mucosal immune responses are most effectively induced by mucosal immunization through oral, nasal, rectal or vaginal routes, but the vast majority of <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/vaccines-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">vaccines </a>in use today are administered by injection. Immunisation involves the delivery of antigens to the <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/vaccines-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">mucosal immune system </a>(dispersed or organised into units such as Peyers patches in the intestine or the nasal-associated lymphoid tissue in the oropharangeal cavity). The antigen delivery systems may comprise a simple buffer solution with/without <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/vaccine-adjuvants-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">adjuvants</a>&nbsp;or an advanced particulate formulation, such as liposomes or <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/nanoparticles-journals-articles-ppts-list.php">nanoparticles.</a>&nbsp;The most commonly evaluated route for mucosal antigen delivery is oral, but other routes have also been explored.<br></p><p><a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php" title="Link: http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Mucosal Immunology of HIV Infection</a>-&nbsp;Recent advances in the <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/clinical-cellular-immunology.php">immunology</a>, pathogenesis, and prevention of <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/aids-clinical-research.php">human immunodeficiency virus</a>&nbsp;(HIV) infection continue to reveal clues to the mechanisms involved in the progressive immunodeficiency attributed to infection. &nbsp;HIV selectively infects, eliminates, and/or dysregulates several key cells of the human immune system, thwarting multiple arms of the host immune response, and inflicting severe damage to <a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">mucosal barriers</a>, resulting in tissue infiltration of 'symbiotic' intestinal bacteria and viruses that essentially become opportunistic infections promoting systemic immune activation. <a href="http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/imr.12072/full">Mucosal tissues</a>&nbsp;are the major targets exposed to the HIV during transmission. In the majority of subjects the initial acquisition of HIV involves passage of virus across a mucosal surface. The sexual route is the most important route of transmission- (1) homosexuals where<a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/blood-lymph.php">lymphoid</a>&nbsp;cells are likely to be the prime target and (2) heterosexuals where the <a href="http://mucosalimmunology.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">genital tract</a>&nbsp;provides the virus access to lymphoid cells.<br></p>
<p>Recommended <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/">Nursing Conferences</a>&nbsp;|&nbsp;<a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/">Cancer Nursing Meetings</a>&nbsp;|&nbsp;<a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/">Oncology Nursing Events</a><br></p><p><a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OMICS International </a>welcomes you to attend the International Conference on <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Oncology Nursing</a> and <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Cancer Care</a> which is going to be held on September 19-21, 2016 at Las Vegas, USA which includes prompt keynote presentations, Oral talks, Poster presentations and Exhibitions.</p><p><a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Oncology Nursing</a>  2016 is a global platform to discuss and learn about Cancer Prognosis,  General Issues in Cancer Care, Cancer-Basic and Applied Research,  Clinical Oncology &amp; Tumor Specific Cancers, Advances in Cancer  Therapy, Companion Diagnostics in oncology, Cancer Immunotherapy &amp;  Stem Cell Therapy, Cancer Treatment &amp; Advancements in Cancer  Therapies, Drug Discovery &amp; Anti-Cancer Vaccines/drugs, Novel  Approaches to Cancer Therapeutics and metabolomics, Breast Cancer &amp;  Treatment, Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM), Pediatric  Oncology, Cancer Pain Management, Supportive Care Services &amp;  Lifestyle Connection, Gynecologic Oncology &amp; Endocrine Oncology,  Radiation Oncology.Oncology has become one of the major focus areas for  pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies because of the high unmet  need for improved treatments for multiple types of cancer.For an  oncologist or an oncology nurse, finding the appropriate words to  comfort a family who is facing the loss of a loved one can be difficult.  This section addresses how different groupsoncologists, patients, and  Nursesthink about end-of-life care issues. This section discusses an  oncologists responsibility and perspective when it comes to difficult  subjects such as advanced cancer, hospice, do not resuscitate orders, <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/scholarly/cytotoxic-drugs-journals-articles-ppts-list.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">cytotoxic</a>  therapy, supportive care, maintaining a patients dignity, and imminent  death. Articles in this series also discuss the role of spirituality  and religion at the time of death, and the importance of good  communication between the oncologist and family members throughout the  dying process.Oncology nurses practice in a variety of settings  including acute care hospitals, ambulatory care clinics, private  oncologists offices, radiation therapy facilities, home healthcare  agencies, and community agencies. The roles of the oncology nurses vary  from the intensive care focus of bone marrow transplantation to the  community focus of cancer screening, detection, and prevention. <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/call-for-abstracts.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Health promotion</a>  includes motivating people to embrace behaviors that both improve their  emotional and physical quality of life and reduce their risk for  premature morbidity and mortality. Although the majority of adults  treated for cancer in the United States live free of disease for many  years, many survivors experience lasting side effects and complications  of treatment. Others encounter recurrences or new cancers that require  additional treatment. <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/call-for-abstracts.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Late effects</a>  vary from one cancer survivor to the next. They can range from very  mild to serious. Medical experts cant always predict if or when they  will occur. Some effects might improve or go away with time such as  anemia. Patients with advanced cancer are willing to pay more for all  aspects of a good <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/call-for-abstracts.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">end-of-life</a>  experience compared with healthy older adults. Both groups are willing  to pay more to be pain free and to die at home. This Session Includes  Cancer Genetics: Genetic Counseling, Ethical Issues, and the Nurses  Role, Health Promotion, Late Effects of Cancer Treatment and Long-Term  Survivorship Issues,End-of-Life Issues, Psychological and Family Issues,  Nursing-Sensitive Patient Outcomes, Translation Science, Cancer  Epidemiology, Palliative Care</p><p>Website: <a href="http://oncology.nursingconference.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://oncology.nursingconference.com/</a></p><p>Kevin Patrick</p><p>Program Manager</p><p>Phone:+ 1-702-508-5200 Ext:8044</p><p>      </p><p>Email: <a href="mailto:oncologynursing@conferenceseries.net" target="_blank">oncologynursing@conferenceseries.net</a></p>
<p>Software enables up to 10x faster downloads and uploads on both cellular and WiFi networks </p><p>February 19th, 2016, Porto, Portugal&nbsp;  Streambolico announced today the release of C4S, software that enables super fast file transfers between mobile devices and the cloud.&nbsp; Based on Steambolicos proprietary network coding technology, C4S will help anyone who wants to improve mobile users download and upload experience with the cloud, by providing up to 10 times faster file transfers. Designed as a pure software solution, C4S can be easily deployed and integrated with existing cloud services and/or private content servers. Streambolico has conducted extensive lab and field trials in 18 countries, which have shown the tremendous potential of C4S to speed up mobile file transfers, and is now looking for partners with interest in the technology to participate in the validation of the potential of C4S via pilot deployments.</p><p>TCP, the commonly used protocol for file transfers, does not serve mobile devices well.&nbsp; Packet loss and jitter are common in wireless networks, due to shadowing, fading and interference, slowing file transfers. Streambolicos C4S file transfer solution overcomes these issues. <i>Using a unique network coding protocol coupled with an advanced rate control mechanism, C4S achieves reliable and up to 10x faster file transfer to and from mobile devices</i>, according to Rui Costa, CEO of Streambolico.</p><p>      </p><p>The new C4S file transfer solution employs a client-server architecture, suitable for fast integration with both cloud and private servers, and includes a software developers kit (SDK) for Android and iOS, allowing enterprises and businesses to integrate C4S within their existing applications.</p><p>Read more in&nbsp;<a href="http://www.streambolico.com" target="_blank">http://www.streambolico.com/</a> </p>
<p><i>More than 184 Professionals and 15 Students Honored </i><i>at 54th annual AAF Dallas American Advertising Awards</i></p><p><b>DALLAS  Feb. 19, 2016 </b><b>?</b> The <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org/">American Advertising Federation  Dallas</a> (AAF Dallas) honored the best advertising professionals in the business at the 54th annual AAF Dallas American Advertising Awards, held at Gas Monkey Live on Feb. 18, 2016. More commonly known as the ADDY® Awards competition, the American Advertising Awards receives more than 40,000 entries across the country, competing at three different levels  local, district and national. Gold winners from the AAF Dallas American Advertising Awards will advance to competition at the district level.</p><p>Over 950 entries were submitted this year from more than 70 Dallas advertising agencies and universities. Stephen Cargile, principal creative designer, <a href="https://thewaltdisneycompany.com">Walt Disney</a>; Eunie Kwon, interactive design director, <a href="https://www.mirumagency.com/san-diego">Mirum</a>; and Marcelo Padoca, creative director at <a href="http://lacomunidad.com">The Community</a>, served as judges.</p><p>With a theme mirroring the increasingly popular Fantasy Football movement, AAF Dallas created Fantasy Advertising to engage both entrants and attendees with the creative thinking that emerges in advertising.&nbsp; Moroch developed this theme to enhance the experience of all in attendance.</p><p>Following the awards ceremony, attendees celebrated their accomplishments at the events after-party featuring live music by The Live 5 Band. </p><p>The American Advertising Awards 2016 sponsors included Blanks, Breed Music, Clampitt Paper, The Company of Others, Creative Circle, Dave &amp; SOUND:</b> Merry Texas Christmas, Entrant: The Richards Group - Advertiser: H-E-B </p><p><b>JUDGES CHOICE  INTEGRATED CAMPAIGN:</b> Diaz Law Firm, Entrant: WALO - Advertiser: Diaz Law Firm</p><p><b>BEST OF PRINT: </b>Texas Tourism: Heated Bus Shelters, Entrant: Slingshot - Advertiser: Texas Tourism</p><p><b>BEST OF DIGITAL:</b> Lights Magazine, Entrant: Tamarack Agency - Advertiser: Tamarack Agency</p><p><b>BEST OF ONLINE/INTERACTIVE:</b> Adoptable Trends, Entrant: Dieste - Advertiser: Dieste</p><p><b>BEST OF BROADCAST:</b> Love Letter, Entrant: Moroch - Advertiser: McDonalds</p><p><b>BEST OF SHOW STUDENT:</b> Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy, Entrant: Texas A&amp;M University  Commerce</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About AAF Dallas<br> </b>Founded in 1908, <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">AAF Dallas</a> is nearly 1,000 members strong and is affiliated with the <a href="http://www.aaf10.org" title="Link: http://www.aaf10.org">Tenth District of the American Advertising Federation</a>, part of <a href="http://www.aaf.org">AAF</a>s national network of more than 200 ad clubs and 40,000 professionals. AAF Dallas, AAFs 2010-2011 Division 1 Club of the Year, strives to elevate the success of the advertising community through innovation, creative excellence, collaboration, professional development, education and philanthropic endeavors. To find out how to get involved in the Dallas ad community, visit <a href="http://www.aafdallas.org">www.aafdallas.org</a>. </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>About the American Advertising Federation<br> </b>The American Advertising Federation (AAF), the nations oldest national advertising trade association, and the only association representing all facets of the advertising industry, is headquartered in Washington, D.C., and acts as the Unifying Voice for Advertising. The AAF also has 15 district operations, each located in and representing a different region of the nation. The AAFs membership is comprised of nearly 100 blue chip corporate members comprising the nations leading advertisers, advertising agencies, and media companies; a national network of nearly 200 local federations, representing 40,000 advertising professionals, located in ad communities across the country; and more than 200 AAF college chapters, with over 6,500 student members.</p><p>###</p><p><b>Media contact:<br> </b>Jo Trizila</p><p>TrizCom, PR.</p><p>Public Relations Chair  AAF Dallas</p><p>(972) 247-1369 or <a href="mailto:jo@trizcom.com">jo@trizcom.com</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Katie Mudd</p><p>TrizCom, PR.</p><p>&nbsp;(972) 247-1369 or <a href="mailto:Katie@TrizCom.com">Katie@TrizCom.com</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    </p><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>These are both 6-man dungeons with 4-man heroic versions. Be advised that the heroic versions do not give you warnings on boss mechanics. Do not do the 4-man versions of these dungeons until you are very comfortable in the 6-man dungeon AND you have a decent Soul Shield set. These dungeons require that your weapon is upgraded to at least Awakened Profane. I recommend having at least 25k health from soul shields before attempting these dungeons. 2-3 <a href="http://www.bladesoulgold.net/" target="_blank">BNS Gold</a>, Soul Shield Chests, Boss Loot (Outfits, Soul Shields, Crafting Materials)</p><p>It's okay to admit if it's your first time in one of these dungeons. Most players are more than happy to help someone new. It's better for the party to know that you're inexperienced than for them to assume you know what you're doing and then fail at it.</p><p>Do NOT, I repeat, DO NOT USE SKILLS THAT KNOCK A TARGET AIRBORNE. These skills are great for PvP but will waste everyone's time in a dungeon, since if you knocked a target airborne, you are the only person who can DPS that target until they land.</p><p>Grappling skills, such as the one that KFMs have, are great. These do not restrict party DPS.</p><p>4 bosses in each dungeon. Bloodshade Harbor is more difficult than Blackram Supply Chain.</p><p>There are separate dailies for 6-man dungeons and 4-man dungeons. If you complete the 6-man quest for a dungeon, you cannot also complete the 4-man quest for the dungeon. The 4-man quest gives greater rewards, but do not attempt them until you are very comfortable with the dungeon.</p><p>You must do the quest "Invitation from Poharan" before you can queue for Blackram Supply Chain. You must also have at least an Awakened Profane weapon.</p><p>Bloodshade Harbor's cross-server daily will not appear until you have completed "Reunion at Bloodshade Harbor", a regular blue quest in the Fishing Lodge, which is a windstride point in the Moonwater Plains-Hogshead Pasture, just south of Hogshead Hamlet. In turn, "Reunion at Bloodshade Harbor" will not appear until you have completed the 6-man Blackram Supply daily at least once. Thanks /u/shiror, /u/TESS3RA, /u/deice3, and /u/Ecorin</p><p>Make sure to accept the dailies from the Cross Server NPC before entering.</p><p>Nothing special, just defeat all the bosses within each dungeon for rewards.</p><p>If you are unsure on boss mechanics, they are almost the exact same bosses as in the 24-man world raids.</p><p>Takes about 30 minutes for each dungeon assuming no wipes and experienced party members.</p><p>For more information, please go to <a href="http://www.bladesoulgold.net" title="Link: http://www.bladesoulgold.net">http://www.bladesoulgold.net</a></p>

How they identify and solve problems will dramatically effect the business. Human error is a major problem. <p><b>San Jose, CA, February 22nd, 2016 </b><a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/" title="Link: http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/">Rhino Labs</a>, a leading provider of high-performance data security, networking, and data infrastructure solutions<b> </b>is announcing its <a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/pcie-rlcn6645-qge-wbp/">1Gbps</a> and <a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/pcie-rlcn6645-2x10gebp/">10Gigabit</a> Ethernet Smart Network Adapter with bypass technology. The <b>Smart NICs</b> fully offload secure network services, packet classification and network protocols processing from the host CPU and handle high speed network traffic up to 20 Gbps line rate per port. The <b>Smart Network Adapters</b> come in a PCI-e form factor and are targeted at Networking/ Security Appliances, Servers and Monitoring Systems. The Smart NIC family incorporates the Rhino Health Monitoring (RHM) tool, which provides continuous monitoring of CPU cores, board peripherals, and host processors via heartbeats, voltage, and temperature checkpoints. The family consists of three members </p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/pcie-rlcn6635-qge-wbp/">NIC6635</a>  Quad port 1GBASE-T, 2 network segments, 6 MIPS CPU cores </p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/pcie-rlcn6645-qge-wbp/">NIC6645</a>- Quad port 1GBASE-T, 2 network segments, 10 MIPS CPU cores </p><p>·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;  <a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/pcie-rlcn6645-2x10gebp/">NIC6645-10</a>  Dual port 10G Fiber, one network segment, 10 MIPS CPU cores</p><p>The NIC6600 family is based on <a href="http://www.cavium.com/OCTEON-II_CN66XX.html">Caviums Octeon II</a> multi-core processors family of CPUs, which integrates 6 or 10 cores, and provides high performance integration for Deep Packet inspection and next generation 3G/4G/LTE wireless base station platforms. It also provides up to 15GHz of application performance with a large 2MB L2 cache and a DDR3 memory controller. Included is security acceleration for SNOW 3G and KASUMI, TCP/IP packet processing acceleration, and QoS. Caviums PowerOptimizer technology limits maximum power from 9 to 20 watts from low-end to high-end.</p><p>Rhino Labs is pleased to announce the Cavium based NIC6600 Smart NIC family of products. A complete line of products will be announced during 2016, said Guy Marom, Rhino Labs CEO. The Smart NICs are installed in servers as well as security and networking appliances and offload processing from the host CPU by performing packet classification at wire speed. With the RHM technology we guarantee that the Smart NICs will perform reliably in any environment.</p><p>Rhino Labs includes extensive support for software development and provides full SDK, Linux OS, and drivers to control the failover mechanize and EJTAG for debugging purposes.</p><p>The Smart NIC family is currently available in production very well priced for volume production. For pricing and additional information go to <a href="http://www.rhinolabsinc.com/">www.rhinolabsinc.com</a> </p><p>About Rhino Labs<b></b></p><p>                  </p><p>Rhino Labs Inc. is a leading provider of high-performance data security, networking, and data infrastructure solutions. Rhino Labs products are used by a growing base of OEM customers, from large enterprises to small and mid-size businesses, in applications focused on Cyber Security, Network Monitoring, SDN, NFV and Traffic Management. The companys standard and customized products include Intelligent Bypass NICs, Smart NICs, and a variety of network, security, and storage appliances. Rhino Labs line of integrated solutions is driven by a team of experts in system integration, logic design, software programming, and hardware design that specialize in architecting solutions that meet complex and demanding embedded system design requirements. Rhino Labs is a privately held company headquartered in Santa Clara, CA with local engineering and manufacturing facilities, and high volume manufacturing facilities in Malaysia.</p>
<p>We cordially welcome you to the International conference on Bipolar Disorder on August 22- 23, 2016 at Sao Paulo, Brazil. OMICS International organizes conference every year all around the world. We make the platform for global networking as it brings together renowned speakers and scientists across the world to a most exciting and memorable scientific events, filled with much enlightening interactive sessions, world class exhibitions and poster presentations.</p><p>In Brazil, some organizations like the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, The Centres for Disease Control and Prevention, FAPESP, Sao Paulo research foundation and National Science foundation are spending $21,600, $96974, £2.5 million, $45,987 each year for the research and medical education on Psychiatric related disorders like Bipolar Disorders.</p><p>Track 1:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>The manic depressive illness which is also known as Bipolar Disorders are mental disorders that Specify by unusual elevated event of <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/psychology-psychotherapy.php">moods</a>, active level and energy.  It is also characterize by ability to carry out the personal works and daily task. Bipolar Disorders symptoms are often acute.  The acute symptoms are termed as <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/bipolar-disorder">mania</a>&nbsp;or <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/bipolar-disorder">hypomania</a>, based on their different from the normal downs and up that everyone goes through from time to time in their life time. The symptoms could cause a poor concentration, poor jobs and poor academic results, break up and divorce, and suicide is most common symptoms seen. Bipolar disorders patients could live full and healthy life; they could be treated well with help or proper medications and proper counselling with mental exercise.  There are four features commonly seen on <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/bipolar-disorder">bipolar</a>&nbsp;patients, those are also known as rapid cycling or as episodes of mania.<br> <br> The Bipolar disorder has been categorised into two different types i.e. bipolar disorders I which is characterize by single manic episode, other is bipolar disorder II which is again characterized by both hypomanic episode major depressive episodes.</p><p>Track 2:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/"><b>Understanding Bipolar Disorders</b></a></p><p>Bipolar Disorders are very mysterious type of <a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/brain-disorders-therapy.php">mental disorders</a>. Till today the main of bipolar disorders have not been fully understood by researchers, scientist and clinician. It has been reported in some journals that, <a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/open-access/journal-of-psychiatry.php">bipolar disorders</a>&nbsp;are seems to be a <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/understanding-bipolar-disorders">genetic</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/understanding-bipolar-disorders">hereditary</a>. The similar proband and disorders symptoms have been seen in the siblings of bipolar disorders patients.  Most of the time bipolar disorders are misunderstood and misdiagnosed due to its confusing and subtitling nature. Bipolar Disorders patients often suffer with lots of medications side effects and sever mistreatment. </p><p>Track 3:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Progression in treatment of Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>Innovative advancement in treatment modules and research are being carried out by <a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/open-access/journal-of-psychiatry.php">psychotherapist</a>, psychiatrist, <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/neurology-neurophysiology.php">neurologis</a>t and researchers. Gratefully, numbers of associations and research organisations are supporting and funding the researchers for their noble and innovative researches on bipolar disorders. One organization which is also known as the National Institute of Mental Health or NIMH is the world's leading neurology and psychiatrist research organization. They do focus, conducts and supports research on the treatment, cause, and proper diagnosis of metal disorders. There are different types of new and advance technique like <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/progression-in-treatment-of-bipolar-disorders">Behavioural approach system</a>, Behavioural, inhibition system, System sensitivity, Impulsivity traits, Cognitive style, Screening procedures, <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/progression-in-treatment-of-bipolar-disorders">Demographic and risk factors</a>&nbsp;and New advances in drugs as well as medications which is being use for the treatment of bipolar disorders and other related mental disorders.</p><p>Track 4:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Prevention of Bipolar Disorder</a></p><p>There are numbers of diseases and mental disorders which could be prevented with ease. Unlike any other preventable disorders, bipolar disorders are not preventable and it is somewhat related to hereditary. Proper diagnosis and knowing the earliest sign could help lot more in treating bipolar disorders.  Proper <a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/family-medicine-medical-science-research.php">counselling</a>&nbsp;and diagnosis and intervening between episodes can help to prevent bipolar disorders from worsening further.  Many disorders like attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (<a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/searchresult.php?keyword=ADHD&amp;search=search">ADHD</a>), <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/prevention-of-bipolar-disorder">substance abuse</a>&nbsp;and <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/prevention-of-bipolar-disorder">schizophrenia</a>&nbsp;has reported to be disorders like bipolar disorder and with other mental disorders. Guidance for <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/prevention-of-bipolar-disorder">multifactorial risk model</a>&nbsp;and education about bipolar disorders would help the people to do proper dealing with bipolar disorders patients.</p><p>Track 5:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Diagnosis and Neuroimaging of Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>Diagnosis and <a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/brain-disorders-therapy.php">neuroimaging</a>&nbsp;of bipolar disorders became the most important factor in treating bipolar disorders patients. These systematic methods are used to identify the conditions of patients, manic episodes and acuteness of the bipolar disorders as well as the other sign and symptoms.</p><p><a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/prevention-of-bipolar-disorder">Diagnosis</a>&nbsp;and neuroimaging often describes and denotes to the techniques that produce the internal images without surgery and without incision of the skin. It helps in getting internal image from any part of the body and organs without being direct contact with it. In other ways we can say that these technologies enable us to have a <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/prevention-of-bipolar-disorder">non-invasive visualization</a>&nbsp;of the <a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/brain-disorders-therapy.php">brain</a>s structure and functions. These techniques which are also known as neuroimaging became most useful device for both researchers and clinicians. <br> <br> Track 6:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Comorbidity of Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>The epidemiological surveys and studies of the other mental disorders  for the comorbidity with  bipolar disorders pointed out that the bipolar disorder are often diagnosed  coexist with other mental disorders like <a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/open-access/school-cognitive-psychology.php">substance abuse</a>, eating, <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/yoga-physical-therapy.php">addictions</a>&nbsp;and personality disorders and <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/comorbidity-of-bipolar-disorders">anxiety</a>&nbsp;disorder. Numbers of journals has been reported about the evidence of genetic overlapping and influences on <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/comorbidity-of-bipolar-disorders">schizophrenia</a>&nbsp;with bipolar disorders. It has been reported that, twins shows a genetic correlation between the disorders with high ratios. Adopted do not shows disorder correlations like twins. Thus, studies concluded; twins shared with same short of mental disorders and other manic episodes like schizophrenic because of its shared and influenced genes.<br> <br> Track 7:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Assessing and Treating for Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>Assessing of bipolar disorders patients are the important part of treatment with the medication treatment.  It is considered as best treatment method for bipolar disorders as because; it is the combination of both assessing and medications. It is unfortunate that many of doctors are void of available and specific treatment for <a href="http://www.esciencecentral.org/journals/sociology-and-criminology.php">mental disorders</a>. Thus, they commonly treat the metal disorders with one type of medications which causes numbers of side effects. Fortunately researchers have found other ways for the proper treatment of bipolar disorders i.e.  Adjunctive therapy and <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/assessing-and-treating-for-bipolar-disorders">electroconvulsive</a>&nbsp;therapy, <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/assessing-and-treating-for-bipolar-disorders">Lithium therapy</a>&nbsp;and <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/psychology-psychotherapy.php">antidepressant</a>&nbsp;Chrono therapy and social rhythm therapy including non-convulsive and sub convulsive <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/assessing-and-treating-for-bipolar-disorders">therapeutic methods</a>.</p><p>Track 8:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Anti-psychosis and Mood Stabilisers for Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p><br> Drugs for the treatment of bipolar disorders are being manufacture but with the lack of specifications. Commonly, <a href="http://www.esciencecentral.org/journals/pharmacovigilance.php">antipsychotic</a>&nbsp;are being used to treat and stabilize psychotic events other psychosis moods. Psychotic moods are commonly the symptoms for many types of mental disorders. Latest <a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/open-access/biology-and-medicine.php">drugs</a>&nbsp;called <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/assessing-and-treating-for-bipolar-disorders">atypical antipsychotic</a>&nbsp;caused least side effects and these are currently being commonly prescribed for bipolar disorders. These drugs stabilize the <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/assessing-and-treating-for-bipolar-disorders">mood swing</a>&nbsp;effectively with least side as compare to the older antipsychotics but, it still caused side effects.</p><p>Track 9:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Genetic and cellular markers in Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>Bipolar Disorders have been divided into two different categories i.e. <a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/brain-disorders-therapy.php">Bipolar I</a>&nbsp;and <a href="http://www.omicsgroup.org/journals/brain-disorders-therapy.php">Bipolar II</a>&nbsp;base on its mood events and mania phase. However, effective and exact studies are not yet been properly done on Bipolar Disorders. Genetic studies have been done in various methods to find out the easy therapeutic solutions and cause. The various genetic studies have reported that there are chromosomal similarities and linkage to bipolar disorders in <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/genetic-and-cellular-markers-in-bipolar-disorders">twins</a>. But, there is a lack of study base on meta-analysis of microsatellite markers linkage. Due to mix finding reports by various researchers on <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/genetic-and-cellular-markers-in-bipolar-disorders">genetic</a>&nbsp;association studies of individual persons, there is a lack of proper reports about the cause of bipolar disorders.</p><p>Track 10:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/"><b>Advancement in Research on Bipolar Disorders</b></a> </p><p>New advancement in <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/genetic-and-cellular-markers-in-bipolar-disorders">research</a>&nbsp;is being taking over the older methods of research on bipolar disorders. Researchers are trying to provide evidence based best qualitative methods and quantitative procedures to treat bipolar patients, after that there would be no needing of further treating and diagnosing. Around the globe, researchers are trying to figure out and explore the new techniques and methods to understand <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/genetic-and-cellular-markers-in-bipolar-disorders">emotions</a>&nbsp;and <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/patient-care.php">stress</a>&nbsp;of bipolar disorders patients.</p><p>Scientist has come across a very longs ways to provide accurate diagnosing methods for bipolar disorders. But, there is still lack of accuracy and precision which often yields side effects and <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/pulmonary-respiratory-medicine.php">misdiagnosed</a>&nbsp;of bipolar disorders.</p><p>Track 11:&nbsp;<a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php/">Case Reports on Bipolar Disorders</a></p><p>                                              The case reports are always been a key which helps to became <a href="http://www.omicsonline.com/open-access/review-public-adminstration-management.php" title="Link: http://www.omicsonline.com/open-access/review-public-adminstration-management.php">awareness</a>&nbsp;about things that are happening or happened. Many case reports concluded that bipolar disorders are most affected to the North America. India is with least affected by bipolar disorders. Numbers of journals reported the co-existence of bipolar disorders with other mental disorders and many drugs have been reported to cause severe <a href="http://www.omicsonline.org/aids-clinical-research.php">side effects</a>. Numbers of misdiagnosis and mistreating the bipolar disorders patients, suicides, murders and divorce has been reported because of bipolar disorders. <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/genetic-and-cellular-markers-in-bipolar-disorders">Antidepressan</a>t like <a href="http://bipolar-disorders.conferenceseries.com/events-list/genetic-and-cellular-markers-in-bipolar-disorders">Prozac</a>&nbsp;has been reported to be discontinued as medicine for bipolar disorders because of its severe side effects and worsening the bipolar disorders patients.<br></p>

<p>We proudly welcome you to the <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/"><b>International Conference on Spine and Spinal Disorders</b></a> to be held during <b>June 30-July 02, 2016</b> at <b>Valencia, Spain</b>. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spine 2016</a> will be organized around the theme Tearing down the veil to a better Spine health. The resolution of <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spine 2016</a> is to elucidate the hotspot areas of <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/" title="Link: http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spine and Spinal disorders</a> and emanate the solutions to various challenges in upholding a better Spine health. To transform this resolution into a reality we bring together a conglomerate of experts in the arena of <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">spine</a> form all over the globe on a single platform. The event will focus on novel advancements in the diagnosis, treatment and management of <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">spinal disorders</a>. Around 200 papers will be presented on a myriad of arenas covering all the significant aspects of <br></p><p><a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spine</a>&nbsp;is a vital part of your body which supports majority of your body weight and enables you to gain control over your sensation and movements. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spinal disorders</a>&nbsp;are extremely common- it ranges from infants to the elderly; so also spinal trauma .Spinal health has gigantic impact on life. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Spina bifida</a>&nbsp;occurs in seven of out every 10,000 live births in the United States. The average total lifetime cost to society for each infant born with <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">spina bifida</a>&nbsp;is approximately $532,000 per child. This estimate is only an average and for many children the total cost may be well above $1 million. Estimated annual medical care and surgical costs for persons with <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">spina bifida</a>&nbsp;in the United States exceed $200 million. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Sciatica</a>&nbsp;is a relatively common problem. About 90% of the time <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">sciatica</a>&nbsp;is due to a spinal disc herniation pressing on one of the lumbar or sacral nerve roots. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Spondylolisthesis</a>, <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">spinal stenosis</a>, piriformis syndrome, pelvic tumors, and compression by a baby's head during pregnancy may also contribute to sciatica. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Scoliosis</a>&nbsp;is a multifactorial disorder, which requires multidisciplinary research and treatment; affecting 2-3% of the population and there is no cure. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Scoliosis</a>&nbsp;impacts infants, adolescents, and adults worldwide, the primary age of onset being 10-15 years old. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Kyphosis</a>&nbsp;is often related to <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">osteoporosis</a>&nbsp;but in children it can be due to injury, a tumor on the <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">spine</a>, or a genetic disorder, such as <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">spina bifida</a>. <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">Osteoporosis</a>&nbsp;is the most common cause of fractures. Worldwide, <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">osteoporosis</a>&nbsp;causes more than 8.9 million fractures annually, resulting in an osteoporotic fracture every 3 seconds. The risk of a fracture increases with age and is greatest in women. Spain, the 6th &nbsp;largest country in Europe with a population of 46.77 million, stands third in the list of highest incidence of spine injury cases in Europe with 23.5 injuries per million per year. Most recent estimates from Europe indicate motor vehicle crashes to be the leading cause of SCIs in regions of Spain followed by falls (24.6%).Most motor vehicle crashes leads to <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">whiplash</a>&nbsp;injury which later results in <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">cervicalgia</a>. More than 1,500 <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">whiplash</a>&nbsp;claims are made in the UK every day. More than 50% of <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/call-for-abstracts.php">whiplash</a>&nbsp;cases resolve after a few weeks of treatment. However, approximately 30% of cases become chronic and persist for months or years. Globally every year between 250,000 and 500,000 people suffer spinal cord injury. In Europe around 333,000 are currently affected. Spain has around 100 universities and 200 hospitals working in the field <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spine</a>&nbsp;and <a href="http://spine.conferenceseries.com/">Spinal disorders</a>. </p><p>There are around 20 associations and many rehabilitation agencies operating for Spinal care. The market for spinal surgery devices is being driven forward, as patients are offered safer, more reliable surgery. The global spinal surgery devices market is expected to grow at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 4% from $6.5 billion in 2011 to $8.7 billion in 2018. Spinal fusions increased 77 % from 2002 to 2011, and the demand will continue to grow as the indications for fusion expand. The European minimally invasive surgery spinal implant market is expected to exceed 92 million by 2018.<br></p>
<p>Indie coffee shops have long struggled to compete with the Starbucks of the world when it comes to maintaining customer loyalty. <a href="http://www.getcrema.com/">Crema</a> is the company looking to change that by providing coalitions of local&nbsp;coffee shops with the technology and platform to compete with the big coffee shop chains. The Crema app&nbsp;will direct users to the best indie coffee house in their vicinity and and enable&nbsp;patrons to earn loyalty points towards future purchases. CEO &amp; Founder Elyes Ben Mrad recently shared his inspiration for the Crema App, the technology behind it and the journey to bring Crema from Canada to the United States. Hear more about how Crema is empowering a coffee revolution on the Food Innovators by Food-X podcast series: <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/food-innovators-by-food-x/id1079695327">https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/food-innovators-by-food-x/id1079695327</a>. </p><p><a href="http://www.food-x.com/">Food-X</a> is constantly looking to increase engagement, excitement and thinking about food and the food industry. Each podcast episode will feature an interview with food innovators, entrepreneurs and thought leaders looking to shape the future of food.<br></p><p><a href="http://www.food-x.com/">Food-X</a> finds some of the coolest, craziest, and most innovative food business startups and pairs them with a killer roster of passionate, accomplished experts to grow and launch exciting new food products, business models and opportunities in a 14 week program. Food-X changes the landscape of food business, merging together the food movement, established food juggernauts, and new fresh-thinking partners to propel forward the food industry.<b><br></b></p><p>You can apply to Food-X at <a href="http://www.food-x.com">www.food-x.com</a>. </p><p><br></p><div><br></div>
<p>i want to publish the content.,</p>
<h2>An Open Question</h2><p>Every field has one. A problem that has been written off as too difficult, too time consuming. Merely mentioning an attempt to solve it raises eyebrows. Long after the community at large has moved on, it is taken up by those on the fringe. Attempts by novices are undertaken for no other reason than the difficulty of the problem and the imagined accolades that would accompany a solution. The open question in Computer Science of whether P = NP is such a problem. An answer to the affirmative has the possibility to literally change the world, provided a "reasonable" polynomial time algorithm is presented. Python's hardest problem is less difficult than crafting a proof of P = NP, to be sure. Nevertheless, it has not received a satisfactory solution to date, and the practical implications of a solution would be similarly transformative. Thus, it's easy to see why so many in the Python community are interested in an answer to the question: "What can be done about the Global Interpreter Lock?"</p><h2>A Low Level Look at Python</h2><p>To understand the GIL and its implications, we must start at Python's foundations. Languages like C++ are compiled languages, so named because a program is fed in to a compiler where it is parsed according to the language's grammar, transformed into a language agnostic intermediate representation, and linked into an executable comprised of highly optimized machine code. The compiler is able to optimize the code so aggressively because it is seeing the whole program (or large, self-contained chunks) at once. This allows it to reason about interactions between different language constructs and make informed decisions about optimization.&nbsp;</p><p>In contrast, Python is an interpreted language. The program is fed into an&nbsp;interpreter&nbsp;in order to be run. The interpreter has no knowledge of the program before it is run; rather, it knows the rules of Python and is capable of dynamically applying those rules. It too has optimizations, but optimizations of a rather different class. Since the interpreter cannot reason about the program proper, most of Python's optimizations are optimizations of the interpreter itself. A faster interpreter means faster program execution "for free". That is, when the interpreter is optimized, Python programs need not change to realize the benefit.&nbsp;</p><p>This is an important point, so it bears repeating. The execution speed of a Python program, all other things being equal, is directly tied to the "speed" of the interpreter. No matter how much optimization you do within your program itself, your program's execution speed is still tied to how efficiently the interpreter can execute your code. It is clear, then, why much work has been devoted to optimizing the Python interpreter. It is the closest thing to a free lunch Python programmers can get.</p><h2>The Free Lunch Is Over</h2><p>Or is it? A generation of programmers have learned to write code while Moore's Law was delivering hardware based speedups with predictable timing. If one wrote code that was slow, simply waiting a bit for faster processors was oftentimes the easiest solution. Indeed, Moore's law still holds true and likely will for quite a bit longer, but the&nbsp;way&nbsp;in which it holds has fundamentally changed. No longer are clock rates steadily increasing to dizzying speeds. Instead,&nbsp;multiple cores&nbsp;are used to take advantage of transistor density increases. Programs wishing to capitalize on new processors must be rewritten to exploit&nbsp;parallelism.</p><p>When most developers hear "parallelism" the immediately think of multi-threaded programs. Utilizing multiple threads of execution is by far the most common way to take advantage of multi-core systems. While multi-threaded programming is a good deal tougher than "sequential" programming, the careful programmer may nevertheless exploit parallelizable portions of his or her code to great effect. The implementation language should be an afterthought, since almost all heavily used modern languages support multi-threaded programming.&nbsp;</p><h2>A Surprising Fact</h2><p>Now we come to the crux of the issue. To take advantage of multi-core systems, Python must support multiple threads of execution. Being an interpreted language, Python's&nbsp;interpreter&nbsp;must be written in such a way so that doing so is both safe and performant. We all know the issues that multi-threaded programming can present. The interpreter must be mindful not to operate on internally shared data from different threads. It must also manage user's threads in such a way that the maximum amount of computation is being performed at all times.</p><p>What, then, is the mechanism by which data is protected from simultaneous access by different threads? The&nbsp;Global Interpreter Lock. The name is instructive. Quite literally, it is a global (in the sense of the interpreter) lock (in the sense of a mutex or similar construct) on the interpreter. This approach is certainly safe, but it has (for the new Python programmer), a startling implication: in any Python program, no matter how many threads and how many processors are present,&nbsp;only one thread is being executed at any time.</p><p>Many discover this fact by accident. Newsgroups and message boards are littered with messages from Python novices and experts alike asking "why does my newly multi-threaded Python program run slower than when it had only one thread?" Many feel silly even asking the question, since of course a program with two threads where before there was just one will be faster (assuming that the work is indeed parallelizable). In fact, the question is asked so frequently that Python experts have crafted a standard answer: "Do not use multiple threads. Use multiple processes." But this answer is even more confusing than its question. I shouldn't use multiple threads in Python? How can multi-threading in a language as popular as Python be so broken as to have experts recommending against its use? Surely I'm missing something?</p><p>Sadly, nothing has been missed. Due to the design of the Python interpreter, using multiple threads to increase performance is at best a difficult task. At worst, it will&nbsp;decrease&nbsp;(sometimes significantly) the speed of your program. A freshman CS undergrad could tell you what to expect when threads are all competing for a single shared resource. The results are often not pretty. That said, there are many times that multi-threading works well, and it is perhaps a testament to both the interpreter implementation and the core developers that there are not more complaints about Python's multi-threading performance.</p><h2>What Now? Panic?</h2><p>So what, then, can be done? Are we as Python developers meant to give up the idea of using multiple threads to exploit parallelism? Why does the GIL need to guarantee only one thread is running at a time anyway? Couldn't finer-grained locks be added to protect individual objects from simultaneous access? And why has no one attempted something like this before?</p><p>These are useful questions with interesting answers. The GIL protects access to things like the current thread state and heap allocated object for garbage collection. There is nothing special about the Python language, however, that&nbsp;requires&nbsp;the use of a GIL. It is an artifact of the implementation. There are alternative Python interpreters (and compilers) that do not make use of a GIL. For CPython, though, it's been there pretty much since the beginning.</p><p>So why not get rid of it? Many are not aware, but this was attempted back in 1999 for Python 1.5 in the oft-cited but poorly understood "free threading" patches from Greg Stein. In the patches, the GIL was completely removed and replaced with finer grained locking. Its removal, however, came at the expense of execution speed for single-threaded programs. It was perhaps 40% slower when running with a single thread. Two threads showed an increase in speed, but beyond that the benefits did not scale linearly with the number of cores. Because of the degradation in execution speed, the patches were rejected and largely forgotten.</p><h2>The GIL is Hard. Let's Go Shopping!</h2><p>The "free threading" patches are instructive, though, in that they demonstrate a fundamental point about the Python interpreter: removing the GIL is&nbsp;hard. Since the time of the patches, the interpreter has come to rely on&nbsp;more&nbsp;global state, making the removal of today's GIL that much more difficult. It should be noted that it is precisely for this reason that many become interested in attempting to remove the GIL in the first place; hard problems are fun.</p><p>But perhaps this is all a bit misguided. Let's consider what would happen if we had a magical patch that removed the GIL with no performance penalty to single threaded Python code. We would have what we said we wanted all along: a threading API that properly makes use of all processors simultaneously. Now that we've got what we want, is it actually a good thing?</p><p>Thread based programming is hard. There are no two ways about it. Every time one thinks he or she understands everything there is to know about how threading works, a new wrinkle is uncovered. A number of high-profile language designers and researchers have come out against the threading model because it is simply too difficult to get right with any reasonable degree of consistency. As anyone who has written a multi-threaded application can tell you, both developing and debugging are exponentially more difficult compared to a single threaded program. The programmer's mental model, while well suited for sequential programs, just doesn't match the parallel execution model. The GIL, then, unintentionally serves to help protect a programmer from his or her self. While synchronization primitives are still required when using threads, the GIL actually helps preserve consistency of data between threads.</p><p>It seems, then, that Python's most difficult question may be asking the wrong thing. There's a good reason that Python experts recommend using multiple processes instead of multiple threads, and it's not to hide the inadequacies of the Python threading implementation. Rather, it is to encourage developers to use a safer and more straightforward concurrency model and reserve multi-threaded programming for when it is absolutely necessary. To many, it is not clear what, if any, is the "best" model for parallel programming. What is clear to most, however, is multiple threads is not it.</p><p>As for the GIL, don't think it just sits there static and unanalyzed. Python 3.2 saw a new GIL implementation by Antoine Pitrou with encouraging results. It was the first major change to the GIL since 1992. The change is too large to explain here, but at a high level, the old GIL counted Python instructions to determine when it was time to give up the GIL. As it turns out, a single Python instruction can comprise a large amount of work, as they don't translate 1:1 to machine instructions. In the new GIL, a hard timeout is used to instruct the current thread to give up the lock. When a second thread requests the lock, the thread currently holding it is compelled to release it after 5ms (that is, it checks if it needs to release it every 5ms). This leads to more predictable switching between threads when work is available.&nbsp;</p><p>It is not a perfect change, however. Perhaps the most active researcher into the effect of the GIL on various types of work is David Beazley. In addition to what is likely the most in-depth look at the pre-3.2 GIL, he has researched the new GIL implementation and discovered a number of interesting program profiles for which even the new GIL performs quite poorly. He continues to drive the discussion surrounding the GIL forward with practical research and published results.</p><p>Regardless of one's personal feelings about Python's Global Interpreter Lock, it remains the language's most difficult technical challenge. To understand its implications requires a thorough understanding of operating system design, multi-threaded programming, C, interpreter design, and the CPython interpreter implementation. Those prerequisites alone preclude many developers from investigating it more thoroughly. Nevertheless, the GIL shows no signs of going away any time soon. For the time being, it will continue to both confuse and surprise those new to the language while simultaneously intriguing those interested in trying to solve very difficult technical problems.</p><p>The preceding is based on my research to date into the Python interpreter. While there are many other parts of the interpreter I hope to write about, none is more well known than the Global Interpreter Lock. The technical details were researched thoroughly against the CPython repository tip, though I imagine there are some inaccuracies. If you spot one, please let me know so that I may correct it as quickly as possible.</p><p>Posted on&nbsp;Mar 31, 2012&nbsp;by&nbsp;Jeff Knupp<br></p>
